review_body: Ilikai Room 339 - Very clean, great views of marina , nightly calling of sailors on conch shell Great wifi Slept 4 adults ( put pull out mattress on floor for better sleep Condo is great location for all things.

Older, well maintained building. There are privately owner units which are less expensive but may or may not be up to hotel standards. We stayed in a hotel run unit overlooking the boat harbour. Our unit 2539 was an immaculately clean studio with a full kitchen and full size fridge with freezer. No dishwasher. It had reasonable square footage for two, there was a sofa bed and a good size balcony for two. All in all it was perfect and if you open the drapes wide had a wonderful view. I’d stay there again if I wanted to go to Honolulu again. Honolulu is crowded and noisy. Bed was awesome.

Fantastic Apartment with stunning views! Very well kitted out to make it feel like home away from home. If I could make one suggestion it would be to put in a bigger bed, with a more ornate bed cover and pillows.

While one of the older places in Honolulu the Ilikai is a great place to stay. The beach is a short walk from the patio and the rooms are fine. We had a higher room and it had a great view of the water.

City view was nice. Kitchen was clean and stocked with coffee. Overall ambience of room was great. Cinnamon restaurant was excellent choice for both breakfast and dinner. Hawaiian musicians, Kaawa Entertainment was excellent while we had our dinner. They sang our party a special song and made us feel very special. Valet service workers were accommodating and very welcoming. Reception desk was very helpful and had lots of aloha. Lobby area was always clean and clear for patrons to come and go comfortably. Loved the little shops around the hotel. We definitely will have another staycation in the future.

Centrally located in Honolulu, this hotel was more "grown up" which was PERFECT . It is the first "High rise" building in Honolulu. There are 2 really nice quiet pools and shops, a restaurant an ice cream parlor, and a SPA! I had the BEST massage I have EVER had here. I cannot wait to go back! The room was a really nice studio with a balcony that overlooked the Harbor, which was used for the opening shot for the TV show Gilligans Isalnd! . I would definately stay here again! The price was right and it is near Waikiki if you want to go there. There are really nice beaches just outside the hotel that were great and "grown up" . Shopping and restaurants are within walking distance. there is also bus or Uber service right outside the door! If you have a car, you have to pay for parking everyday it is Valet, that was the ONLY drawback to our stay and if you are into high end fashion the mall is just a few blocks away again I walked there, the shops in the mall were outstanding! Every high end designer has a store here. The food court is not like any mall food court anywhere, it has really amazing restaurants or just quick FRESH Sushi places . So many choices so little time!! there are laundry facilities on each floor. So to sum up Yes, I would definately stay here again!!

This was the first time staying at the Illikai Marina Hotel. Check in was a breeze, the room clean and located to all the areas of Waikiki. We recommend this to anyone interested in staying. Walking distance to the Hilton Hawaiian lagoon and other Waikiki points of interest.

The property had great access to the beach restaurants , activity’s and shopping. The staff was wonderful and the rooms were spotless and recently up dated. We will definitely return next year. We may even look into buying a time share at this resort . Can’t wait to go back

We found this hotel to be a very good choice. Ample room, nice kitchen, and very good view out of the balcony. The staff were friendly throughout our stay and arranged an early check-out too. Room cleaning was generally good but we did find some occasions in which the room hadn't been properly cleaned. Otherwise an excellent stay. Cheaper parking is available around the building in the marina but they also offer their own valet and self-park parkings.

I had a lot of anxiety about this based ono the reviews. But it was the least expensive of all the hotels we checked. Downside? Well, there’s a $28 daily resort fee no matter whether you use the amenities. Oh well...Valet parking is also $28 a day. But the valet service is fantastic. Never seen one as friendly and efficient. These folks hustle. Tip well. Tip often. Now, the hotel - historically, this was one of the first on the Waikiki beach, and was initially a bit of a white elephant. Ultimately they creatively carved it into 4 options, condos you could buy and live in, condos you could own but rent to “hotel” guests, straightforward hotel rooms, and hotel rooms you could own and ‘rent” to guests via the hotel. Now, reading some of the negative comments made it clear that some of the wanting experiences were in the condos, which apparently the hotel has little control over. So heating/AC issues, hot water, cleanliness, etc were less predictable. Somehow, we got a basic regular old hotel room, second floor, water view, balcony. The room was huge, clean, pretty modern, hot water and AC worked perfectly, quiet, good sleep. Absolutely no complaints, completely exceeded our expectations. Good shopping in the lobby - ice cream, souvenirs, wood art, coffee place, several hotel eateries.

So we went through a rental company with this place. Facilities were good and location being smack bang in the middle between the mall and Waikiki was a bonus. The room was spacious and beds comfortable that was pretty much about it. For the wee bit of tv we wanted to watch it was difficult to figure out. Kitchen wasn’t very well equipped. Could have had a few more towels, beach towels, laundry basket and a simple broom to clean up during our long stay. The room and balcony could have been a bit cleaner too. Would I stay again? Definitely but in the hopes of a cleaner well equipped room for next time would be nice?

Nicely located property at Ala Moana end of Waikiki. Convenient bus stop just out lobby. Recommend diamond head wing facing the ocean, 6th floor or higher. Tons of shops and restaurants to walk to. Walking distance to two sandy beaches. The building is dated but has ac and is a terrific value. Recommend you book thru vrbo or other service whereby you can select the exact unit you want before you arrive

Nice hotel which is a combination of hotel and privately rented condos. Has everything we need including restaraunt and convenience store located in the lobby. Bus and trolley stop on the doorstep, walk to the worlds biggest outdoor shopping centre. Close to the beach and friday night fireworks

Stayed in the apartment section of the hotel. The rooms are a bit dated but some of the hotel is under renovations. The pool area is ok. Great location. There is an abc shop across the road so you can pick up your food essentials close by. The downstairs foyer has a great coffee shop and sell great coffee that Australian travellers will appreciate. The ice cream shop has $2.00 ice cream on Tuesday. Would stay here again. Close to the big shopping centre. Can walk to it. Same road.

We were staying here because my daughter is being treated at the hospital. We live on an outer island. Anytime I approach any place to stay or write any review I always try to be open minded and not base my review on 1 or 3 problems as things are going to happen, inevitably, but there was a lot of issues encountered while staying here. Let me begin. The staff is rude. Likely because they deal with entitled tourists with bossy attitudes all day so as a local we always tip big and always apply a very gracious attitude to any staff. Our first incident was the night we checked in. My daughter, a cancer patient who is in a wheelchair loves to put the key in the door and open our hotel room. Well the guy bringing the bags intercepted the card as I am handing it to my daughter and says “ let me do it, I only have 2 mins left of my shift” stunned by his attitude I didnt say much and we even gave him a gracious tip as thought oh hell I’ll extend grace as the guy has probably had a long day. Further issues include housekeeping not showing up 6 out of the 12-13 days we were here. I would just call the first few times and ask for towels and our trash taken but by the 4th time I asked for a manager. No apology just asked if they could send someone right away. Great I said! That was 3:00pm and about 6:00 pm I guy comes with towels and gathers the trash. 3 hrs means right away. This happened a few more times. Valet, 3 times brought up the wrong car. Which was an added bummer as we were late to the hospital a few times. They are so adamant that we show our tag yet they bring you the wrong car. My favorite thing was the maintenace repair drilling into the wall with a power drill at 8:00am in the morning about 10 ft from our door. I was shocked that no one notified us to loud maintenance at 8:00am. I went out and asked the guy how long he would be until done with the sound. I did the online chat with guest services only to find out that this is normal repair times and that we should have been notified in advance if maintenance. Ummm no no notification and turns out we were not the only ones upset as several couples in the hallway asked if we heard the noise. I am just suprised by the customer service. I would not recommend this place. I wanted to like it but just can’t recommend it. pros: kamaiana rate, kitchen in room, several elevators, good location. Probably cheapest parking valet aroundcons: in addition to the above only one out of 5 dvd’s worked. We even had maintenance come check the dvd/playstation 3 which needed an update. He told us to let the front desk know the dvd didn’t work. As my husband turned it in and as he went to the bathroom I saw the front desk guy that he talked to go return a dvd to the machine rental. Same one who knows! We returned 4 movies for not working.Sleeper sofa has a lot of stains and the mattress is SUPER thin and uncomfortable. Also found crayons and a food covered paper towel the first night we went to use the sleeper sofa

We stayer on floor 23 which does have a nice ocean view. The kitchenette was also nice as we do not like to eat out every meal, especially breakfast. Bed was great too. The downside was the shabby furniture which was tattered and torn with ground in dirt. It was in need of replacement as was the carpet. It also was old, worn and the ground in dirt made it look like it was original carpet. The air conditioner was a mitsubishi late addition with the compressor located on the walk out deck. The thermostat was easy to use but didn’t seem to be very sensitive as we continually had to turn it off and on manually. No matter how we tried to set it, it just ran continuously. In summary, for the prices charged, the things I mentioned were something you would not expect from this hotel.

We stayed here for our 20th wedding anniversary. Booked an ocean view suite and we were not let down, 25th floor and overlooking the lagoon and beach and views to Diamond Head. Room was spacious, and kitchen was fully equipped (not that we needed to use it). Location, easy walking distance to Ala Moana shopping or a 10 minute walk into Waikiki. Trolleys also stop right out the front. This property is a mix of private and hotel accommodation, we stayed with the hotel side and had no complaints. We look forward to coming back again.

I always remember the iconic shot of handsome Jack Lord-as "Steve McGarett" from the original Hawaii Five-0 tv series- where he's standing on a lanai and turns around for his close up. I didn't stay in the penthouse where I read it was filmed, but still was excited to stay at the wonderful Ilikai Hotel. We actually stayed in a studio condo there that had a full kitchen and a fun bonus-we could hear (and partially see) the Hilton Hawaiian Village rooftop luau most nights! The Ilikai is a wonderful hotel in a perfect location-close to the Hilton lagoon (could see the Friday night 5 minute fireworks show from out lanai as well), only a 15 minute walk to the Ala Moana Mall, close to the beaches, but not right in the noisy busy line of Waikiki hotels. It's on a main street so easy to walk places yet still find your way back and also good The Bus access and very convenient ABC stores (love them!) to either side..The front desk staff and concierge were helpful & friendly, there was some free entertainment certain nights in the lobby area (or outside if no rain), and the Ku'Ai lobby shop staff were always very nice too. Staying here was one of the biggest reasons we had an amazing Oahu visit! The elevators were usually slow and no stairs were in sight, but that's just a small negative among an otherwise perfectly pleasant stay at this beautiful & comfortable, perfectly located hotel! I 100% recommend staying at the Ilikai! Love it!

The floor mounted in the window air conditioning rattler is very noisy. Even more so when the compressor kicks in. The closed and locked aluminium sliding glass doors on the balcony have leaks and gaps allowing wind and traffic noise to enter the room. Go elsewhere if you want a quiet room.

We booked a studio condo at the Ilikai through Waikiki Beach Rentals. Great location right next the the Hilton Hawaiian Village. 10 min walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. 15 min walk into the heart of Waikiki. Main bus stop out the front. The Lagoon View rooms can see the Friday night fireworks and the Hilton Luau. Hertz rent a car desk in the lobby (book online via the Hertz australia website for cheaper rates and to ensure insurance included). Laundry facilities on every second floor. Mini mart with reef safe sunscreen, cheap goggles, milk, sandwiches, sushi, fruit, snacks etc... in the lobby. 2 heated pools.

Over all it was a great stay. While our room looked nothing like the one pictured on trip advisor is was the same floor plan and somewhat similar view. We booked our vacay through Shell Vacations as we are owners in SF. Our options were a room on the 4th floor with view of the pools, ocean/beach (partial), and harbor or a higher floor (12th I think) with a city/street view. For us the choice was a no brainer and we really did like being on the 4th floor and partial ocean view.Staff was always helpful and friendly. Definitely gave us the Aloha Spirit during our entire stay. The advice and suggestions made on Trip Advisor were extremely helpful. If you haven't read through them....please do!To review the hotel room itself may seem more negative than it really was...but I am being brutally honest so as to not disillusion anyone about the room itself.We arrived on a Thursday afternoon and had already read about the bell hop/luggage attendent providing services at a fee. $2.00 a bag to us was an automatic given (in our opinion) and our bags were whisked away and magically arrived at our room in a timely manner. Our room wasn't quite ready (we arrived at 2pm) so we were directed to the hotel adjacent to the Illikai (The Modern) for a late lunch. The restaurants on site at the Illikai were not open at that time. The lunch at The Modern was adequate (very expensive for lunch) and we did not repeat our visit.We checked into our room shortly after 3pm. It most definitely is a studio room with a kitchen. There was no dishwasher and no garbage disposal. The garbage can was quite petite and had to be emptied (by us) daily. Our visit was for 12 nights and we were told we would have our room serviced 2x. During that service we were given a very "bare bones" clean up. We were given fresh towels at the visits. Garbage was removed. We did have to hang our towels and use a minimum of 2x to stretch through the time we stayed.The kitchen itself was serviceable. We were able to have breakfast several mornings in our room. The lighting in the kitchen was sub-standard as there was no lighting above the stove top and was made even darker by the microwave shelving with a noticeable down sloping angle. (LOL, we made sure to be gentle with the microwave for fear of it sliding off). The stove top and refridgerator were at least 15-20 years old. But they worked very well for us.The bathroom has no shelving or cabinet space for your toiletries except for a tiny space behind and above the toilet. If you have a hanging travel bag for your personal grooming stuff this is the time to bring or buy one =-) The bathroom is shower only there is no tub. This wasn't an issue for us as we prefer showers. There were broken tiles and missing baseboards on the bathroom floor.The main room with our bed was very comfortable. The most notable thing that my husband felt needed immediate upgrading was the size of the TV. Watching TV in bed was difficult as the TV was 32". Sorry if that seems overly critical, but as sports fantatics ( there were 2 playoff games in the NFL while we were there) we weren't able to enjoy the games in our room and sought out local sports bar to watch the games.The view from our room was very nice. The view of fireworks was partially visible from our room on Friday night. They are quite loud. But beautiful. The following Friday we went down to the lagoon and watched the fireworks. Much better viewing.We enjoyed some of our meals at Cinnamon's. Service was usually friendly and quick. It depends on whether you eat at a busy time. My husband loved the banana pancakes. We also enjoyed the extremely brief walk to The Chart House for appetizers (pou pou plates) at sunset.We loved getting daily newspapers in the lobby and found that everyone we encountered at the Illikai was friendly and helpful.The distance from the Ilikai to Waikiki is walking distance. We were able to walk to the International Market Place and everything inbetween. The location of the Illikai made it quieter than the hotels on Waikiki Beach and we thought this a plus.We would definitely stay again.

We stayed here for one night due to its convenient location. We had a suite on level 22 facing the main road. The suite was spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable. The only complaint I had was that the rooms are not sound proof and you could hear car horns and sirens from the road. There is laundry on this floor but it's a $2.50 fee for each wash and dry. There are 2 pools, one is a tanning pool. The other is a larger pool with warm water. My son was told he wasn't allowed to jump in the pool but it is 8 foot on one end so that means the only way in is to use the ladder which people tend to hover around. I found the staff and reception to be efficient but not very informative. We had no idea where the pools were and had to ask other guests as there is no signs in the lift.The luggage desk was never attended. There is a phone that you call to ask for luggage to be stored but we had to call twice before anyone came. When we wanted to pick up our luggage they were so slow that we decided to wheel our own luggage to our room. On Friday night there is free entertainment at the hotel courtyard area. The reception staff didn't inform us about this but there was a flyer in the lift. We had ice cream at Dave's Ice cream and the lady who works there was so friendly! Lovely lady and delicious ice cream. The convenience store is also very big and has a lot of variety. The best thing about this hotel is the location and our room was also impressive and well equipped. Maybe next time I would request a room facing the marina, might be quieter.

This "old lady" was the first high rise in Waikiki and the hotel featured in the original Hawaii 5-0. Situated on the boat Harbour next door to Hilton Hawaiian Village, its location works well for airport drop off, proximity to Ala Moana Mall and Lagoon in front of the Hilton. Though dated, rooms well equipped with full kitchen, small bathroom, beds firm, lack sound proofing with rowdy neighbours. Also we've been advised that we cannot use our NAB Traveller card to settle bill, which is preloaded with USD, which we always use when travelling as it avoids multiple exchange fees back to AUD. Other hotels we have stayed in, in Hawaii do accept this card. Will most likely go back to Hilton Village next time. This is our 5th trip to Hawaii.

Not impressed - stayed October 2019 and while the view was great and had everything we needed, the floor (including balcony) was filthy, the air con drip tray kept overflowing on to the balcony below and we got a violation, even when we thought it had been taken care of, got another one with a not so nice message. The air con itself was mouldy (I don't know if that is the correct word, but definitely unhealthy), the shower head had a calcium build up, the shower had cracks in the side tiles, the light switches were dirty, as were the curtains and sliding doors. Bugs did appear but there was bug spray available.My recommendation would be to stay elsewhere unless renovations had been done, or it had a really good clean.

Very happy with accommodations. We had a room with a king bed and pull out sofa and small kitchen area. Laundry facilities on the same floor. City view room. Didn’t mind the constant home of traffic below, don’t even notice it after awhile.We have had drinks and dinner in Cinnamons, the outdoor patio if comfortable and a nice evening gathering space. Live entertainment is offered some nights. We have taken a couple of Roberts Hawaii tours that pick up right out front the hotel. We also used the Waikiki trolley lines for sightseeing. No need for a car at this location. Easy walking distance to many things. I would stay here again.

Sadly there is not one pleasant thing I can say about this Studio Condo. This was my experience.1. On walking in the condo and there was a very stale smell, as if the room had not been cleaned. 2. On retiring, the bed was disgusting. A very strong male odour which permeated in the pillows including in the sheets and duvet, as if they had not been washed. Day 3 I found the time to wash the lot as I could not tolerate the unclean bedding ,3. The Air conditioner was unable to be left on at night whilst sleeping due to the loud noise, a square box inserted in the fixed glass on the floor to the outside on the balcony.4. Unfortunately the balcony door was not able to be left open during sleep time due to the street noise of cars and people, and the studio was on Floor 14. 5. Day 4, the toilet overflowed, with use of the toilet appropriately and only using the toilet paper provided. Fortunately, I had many of my family also in the hotel and had respite when required. I was very disappointed with this studio condo and paying $2400.00AUD for the week, I do expect clean and up to date bedding and a toilet that functions. All in all, in my view, the owner needs to pay attention to detail and check on cleaning quality. Also, please toss the fake plastic flowers!

We rented 829, 813, and 817. The rooms were ok but most of the stuff was well used. The toasters didn’t work and the beds are just ok. The view in 829 was great if the marina but you couldn’t see the Hilton lagoon for fireworks. The internet wifi in room 813 was basically useless. The valet parking is 28$ per day and they get your car very quickly. Great deal that is for sure. I would definitely stay here again but would not stay in 813.

I stayed in room 1738 with 2 others. It is a studio apartment with 2 double beds and a sofa bed. Unfortunately I had the sofa bed which clearly was old and well used. Apart from being slightly smelly, there was a huge dip in the middle and I could feel all the springs in the mattress. I had to put 2 cushions underneath it to balance the dip and I had to put the blanket and doona underneath the sheets, which only slightly helped - I could still feel the springs. Also the leg of one of the other beds kept falling off every time someone sat on it. I was incredulous that we paid a fortune for the room and I had 6 very uncomfortable nights with not great sleep. I would not recommend this room. Other than that, the view was nice but there needs to be some maintenance done on the sofa (get a new one) and the bed.

I can’t lose a chance to leave a review because the stay was just nice for our family vacation. We stayed in room 2222 with ocean view and kitchen. Our vacation concept this time was to escape from colder weather for a warmer area for a week, thus, a kitchen was a must. The IH stove with 4 burners (2 larger in front and 2 smaller in rear) was good enough to cook any type of meals, as well as full sized microwave, refrigerator, toaster, kettle, etc...everything was there, which met our needs completely. As we are a party of four, we decided to request an additional rollaway to get 4 beds in total for $45 per day, which was also a nice choice for us. We enjoyed the ocean view everyday and a fireworks on Friday night from the balcony. Parking was only valet parking for $30 per day; they were very kind and good. Definitely Ilikai will be one of our choices for future visit to Honolulu.

My family and I stayed at the Ilikai Hotel and Suites for 10 nights and loved it. We are a family of a 2 adults and 2 boys aged 9 and 8.The rooms were very clean and lovely and were serviced beautifully. We had a lovely view of the Sunset, Marina and beach. The balcony is a great size.It is a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and about 10 minutes to the main strip of restaurants and shops. Lovely walk both ways.The beach and lagoon are not even a 5 minute walk.Staff were helpful, in particular Chester. He was always helpful and suggested things to do and places to visit. Always had a smile. Thank you so much Chester, you made our visit that little bit more special. The pool area is nice, however the only thing we didn't like was that no pool toys are allowed to be used whilst in the pool. We have traveled the world, but have never been at a resort or hotel where pool toys are prohibited. This is a little obsurd, especially when it is a family hotel.Would definetely stay there again!

Great Hotel and especially the location. It was right off the beach and had a very nice view facing the ocean. Rooms were very spacious and hotel staff was very nice. Me and my friends really enjoyed our stay and would visit again.

Get used to hearing, “a resident complained.” They have two pools, one is a relaxation pool. Might as well label both as relaxation pools. In the large pool, you cannot jump in. I’m not talking diving, or cannon balls, but literally, no jumping. As I heard another guest say, “what’s a pool for if you can’t jump in?!” No floaties, no noodles, no small tubes. No playing catch and don’t even think of throwing a diving ring, because it involves throwing. Btw, the water smells like gym socks. However, the water was probably warmer here than at any of the other pools we tried out. It felt like hotel guests were treated second class. If you don’t want children or hotel guests, don’t rent out rooms. The hotel rooms are on floors 4 or lower and 24-29 I believe. The rooms are okay. The carpet is thread bare in a few places, but they are kept clean. If you get a room facing the street, it is LOUD. A lot of sirens, horn honking, etc. The hotel itself is quiet though. Only one restaurant was open while we stayed there, Cinnamons. It was good, but closed a couple times for private parties. The cleaning crew is very nice, but they don’t do dishes. Very convenient location to the Hilton Lagoon. Great for watching fireworks too. All of the tours we went on had no problem finding the place.

Very much enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai. Located at the western end of Waikiki. It’s walking distance to the rest of Waikiki and Ala Moana shopping centre. All the tour buses and local buses pick you up right in front of the hotel. The staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful. The hotel looks to be one of the older ones but inside is very nice. Our room had a nice balcony and view of the sea and the marina. The room was very well appointed with a comfy bed, sofa and TV, a kitchen with everything you need to cook a meal if you don’t feel like eating out. The room was made up every day with nice fresh towels etc. I would stay there again and recommend it to others.

We stayed here a few nights before going on the cruise in Hawaii and it was a great place to stay. We went through a vacation company and we had self check in and check out which was simple and easy. We called with a hairdryer problem and they delivered a new one the next am. It was very clean and well stocked with towels, etc. The Ala Moana center is nearby and a great shopping area. Just wished we'd had more time.

The hotel really should be paying me to stay here not the other way around! Given this is not a hotel that gives you points for staying here or discounts or anything (and no, they're not paying me, just in case you were wondering!), but yet another great stay. I pick this place because I like the location, away from the hurly burly of the centre of town, walking distance to the Ala Moana Centre, on a bus route, close to restaurants, older building so its sound proof and a great price in an expensive city for a water view room. You can book via the hotel or via private rental, either way, its a great choice.

Booked a private rental. 712, room was excellent, fantastic views, especially for fireworks. Staff were all very nice.Only problem is owners at the pool should mind their own business,was told I should be wearing swimming attire! Excuse me I was wearing a swimming costume top and board shorts and told the busy body to mind her own business, at least I didn't have all my bits hanging out like some.

I stayed at the Ilikai for around ten or eleven days. The moment we got there, my brother and I were confused on where to go. We got assistance on the location of the front desk and were immediately helped with our stay. I believe his name was Jon or something like that, but he was the one who helped us get through our contract and guided us on where to go and what to do. We stayed in a room on the twenty-fourth floor and had an amazing view. As this was my first time in Hawaii, I was astonished at the beauty and cleanliness of our balcony and room. We got a local newspaper each morning. The room we stayed in was basically like a small house with every necessary appliance. Microwave, silverware, bowls, cups, mugs, refrigerator, hygiene products (soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion), and everything in between. Housekeeping came every day while we were exploring. We were able to wash our own clothes on our floor as well. It was a very nice experience. If you want to go to Hawaii, I would definitely recommend the Ilikai. Go the extra mile to make your experience worth it. You won’t regret it.

Arrived via Jetstar and had to wait 4 hours to get into my full seaview room at 10am. They tried a partial seaview room on me first, (a peep from part of your balcony), then a sunset room,(same same) but as people that had booked before me apparently took all seaview rooms they still accepted my booking and my money so they tell me.. I couldn't stop crying & got asked by the HIDEOUS reception females if I needed a doctor!!!!! After 2 days of not being able to open my curtains with every other hotel looking in and despite the room they took my money for, I cut my losses and moved to the Hilton Hawaiian. 29th floor, a mansion of an apartment and views to die for. No refund of the 5 extra nights from these fakes at the Ilikea. Dont book here! When I get back to Australia, I will fight this to the end. Thank God for Law School!

We stayed for 12 days in Waikiki Marina Resort at Ilikai and loved it.Our Studio room was very spacious, clean and well furnished including full kitchen facilities. The location is excellent and nice restaurants and shops are close by.The staff at this resort is exceptional. Would like to especially thank Shawn and Kristol at the customer service counter.

We stayed here for 7 nights in a condo. Located next to Hilton and with in walking distance on Ala Moana. Great pool for children and seperate area for adults. Hop on bus stop right outside at $2:00 for trip into main shopping areas. Beach at rear of complex.

Recently stayed at the Ilikai, everything was great, beautiful room, clean, friendly staff.Restaurant staff were friendly, food not real flash. However upon returning to Aus noticed we were charged twice for our stay.will chase up today.

this was our second stay at illikai. (room 1906) and were very happy with the hotel, its location and the room. the view from our patio was outstanding as were the sunsets. couldn't have asked for more. unit was clean and comfortable, although the beds were a bit on the small side.  with that being said, I almost stayed on the diamond head side where we have stayed MANY times in the past and I was so glad we didn't. I don't understand how the city can let so many low lifes squat on what was once of the planets most beautiful beaches. the homeless population has exploded over the years with makeshift tents along the shrubbery all along the beach. I lost count of how many drugged out scarey looking individuals were walking the streets side by side with the families and other tourists, most of them in a daze and others screaming at the wind and punching trees. im originally from NY and this is more disturbing that what I saw back there in the old days. I understand that some people have problems and are put on the streets, but Waikiki, especially at night has become an inner city hole along side a beautiful beach. not the same place it was years ago. the traffic was always bad and has got even worse. public transportation is beginning to make more sense now that ever. im afraid its time to explore some of the other islands if Hawaii is in your plans.

The view was fantastic as we were on a high floor and overlooked the harbour and sea. The room was very spacious however it was tired and the bed was hard. The cleaning was substandard. After the cleaner had been the shower smelled of a dirty cloth. They did not wash the dishes. Our family were staying somewhere else so we used their pool as we did not like the pool at the llikai. There was no complimentary water. The receptionist who checked us in and out, same person, was very efficient and pleasant. Great location and great views but would not stay there again.
user_name:
Maree P
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: The front desk guy "Ron" trying to trick me with the city view room. I clearly said I paid for a partial ocean view room. What's more, he told me since you only stay here for one night and I guess you don't have time to go to the beach, so I don't need to give you a beach towel card. YOU DON'T TELL YOUR GUEST WHAT THEY SHOULD DO. You just offer whatever the guest paid for which all the service included in the resort fee. The furniture and carpet have been worn out and everything is so outdated. Avoid this place by all your means

We had a week to fill in between the Rugby World Cup / visit to family in Japan and a tour of Cuba. Hawaii looked like a good place to do this. Recommended to us by a friend the Ilikai has been that perfect stop-off. Starting with early checkin (for a price) after getting off a long (crossing the dateline) flight...we stayed in a Luxury Sunset Junior Suite with Ocean View and Kitchen. The room is super spacious (luxury after Japan) with all mod cons. Very comfortable bed and beautiful view with verandah overlooking the marina and wonderful sunsets. The kitchen well appointed with very large fridge and good cooking facilities.The small shop on the ground floor has all the essentials and friendly, helpful staff, with super markets in walking distance for anything more substantial. The daily amenities fee covers a free DVD hire. We had trouble with the DVD player which also works as a playstation...but a friendly engineer (actually 3 engineers! one after the other) finally taught us how to use... A day tour of the the island starting with a visit to Pearl Harbour is a MUST. The tour bus picked us up at 7am from outside our hotel and delivered us back at 5.30. We booked the tour through Tripadvisor...Aircon in the room worked really well and is a must if you don't want to experience 30 degrees and high humidity. We didn't use the swimming pool which looked small and a bit murky!

I stayed at the Ilikai Hotel & Luxury Suites for one night in May. While I'm not a huge fan of Honolulu I found the location to be good and the hotel to be clean and well staffed. We had a suite on a high floor. Great view, spacious lanai. The hotel lobby and grounds feel a bit dated but the rooms are nice. We had a kitchenette and there are plenty of stores close by as is the Ala Moana Beach Park. If an urban beach vacation is on your list then the Ilikai Hotel is worth checking out.

Honestly what can I say to this wonderful hotel and it’s hospitality besides thank you! Thank you a million times. A little backstory we booked our entire 6 day trip in Oahu at a different hotel and two hours after getting there we ran for hills, it was a total dump. With bed bugs, dirty weird stained carpets and all. That hotel had decent reviews so I was in complete shock when we checked in and saw it’s dismal state. I was panicking about what we’re going to do because I knew we couldn’t stay at that place. My husband and I were on the brink of changing our flights to just go back home.I remembered the Ilikai because I stayed there for a week back in 2016 and had all pleasant memories. We decided to drive to the hotel and ask about pricing instead of going through Expedia and just talk to someone in person to try to salvage our honeymoon. I figured I had stayed here before and it was great so something familiar was very comforting. Mark at the front desk was that guy and boy did he deliver. He first heard our story as I inquired about a room there and he was very genuinely upset for us as well with our whole fiasco. He let us know about a last minute deal on an oceanfront room and we jumped at the chance. He was phenomenal, we got a beautiful room on the 23rd floor and he even had a bottle of champagne sent up to us to celebrate our honeymoon. Mark saved my night and my trip, no more frustrated tears just mimosas! That is literally the reason that from now on every time I’m in Oahu I will only stay at the Ilikai.P.s Also the coffee house downstairs and ice cream shop are delicious!

Stayed at the hotel suites. Nicely updated hotel room with small kitchen. Great view of lagoon and ocean from 25 floor. Easy walk to Ala Moana mall. Little restaurant on site ‘Cinnamon’s’. Popular for breakfast. Friendly service, reasonable prices. Cafe for take out breakfast and good Americano coffee. Busy place in the morning!My only complaint is how cheap and chintzy they are with towels. Asked for two towels at the 2nd floor pool and got a song about not having enough. The small towel does not cover the lounge chair so you get to put your legs onto the hot part or your back onto the hot uncovered part. The hotel room they leave exactly two face cloths every day. Not sure why they can’t provide one or two extra towels here. It’s annoying to have to ask every single day for a couple extra facecloths and towels.

My wife and I stayed there for our last leg of our Pacific rim tour. Fireworks Friday night was one of the best shows I’ve seen. The water was beautiful. The beach is all coral though, so I would recommend some water shoes or sandals. Food was great and there are little shops are all down stairs to buy all the gifts you may need. Go see Chris at the paddle board shop for a great paddle tour!

We stayed at the Illikai in September for 10 days. We are a family of four (2 teenage kids) and booked a unit with 2 beds in one room. It was a good size for us all and having the kitchen facilities was excellent using the coffee machine each morning and evening. The booking and checkin process was easy. The Illikai is close to a couple of ABC stores and bus stops to go either into Waikiki or Honolulu. The close proximity to Ala Moana mall is great, we walked there each day for food and cold drinks. My only gripe would be that our unit (2016) was a bit tired with decor and was showing signs of being in need of some upgrading. The toilet/plumbing was a bit smelly and we ended up buying some toilet cleaner to see if we could get rid of the mild smell that was in the bathroom/toilet. But this may be with all of Waikiki as we could smell the same smell as we walked the streets - perhaps Waikikis infrastructure hasn't grown to match the amount of tourists? Anyway, overall is was an excellent base to stay at on our first trip to Hawaii. I would definitely stay again (maybe in a slightly more modernised unit).

We booked this hotel not expecting much, but we were pleasantly surprised by the service and the room. The view we had was AMAZING! We had the 22nd floor. The only drawbacks were no circulation in the elevator or hallways. Other than that, it was OUTSTANDING!

The water view rooms with kitchenettes are great. There are a lot of useful facilities and shops within the hotel with a lot more within easy walking distance (either to Ala Moana or Waikiki). The staff are very friendly and it seems most shuttle services stop outside the hotel. Great location for everything we wanted to do while we were in town.I'd stay again.

We booked an apartment at the Ilikai and it was so spacious and clean! The balcony overlooked the pools and the ocean, just such beautiful and relaxing views. It was close to restaurants, cafes and beach front bars. A perfect location to stay in Waikiki.

This hotel has been renovated since our last stay. Maintenance could be an issue as carpets are already grubby and the wooden furniture is chipped. Rooms are spacious and all have a large balcony. Be sure to take a room with an ocean view, above the 7th floor. Rooms have a kitchen with full fridge, microwave, large oven and hot plates and a lounge area. The hotel is very popular with family groups. Breakfast isn’t included, however there is a restaurant, cafe and small store with gifts and basic grocery items site. The Hilton Hotel next door offers other options. The hotel charges an additional resort fee of $25/day. It doesn’t include anything that you wouldn’t expect from a hotel other than free hire of dvds. There is a coin operated laundry on each floor. A bus stop outside the hotel appears to service a number of local tourist operators.

Beautiful hotel, great location, amazing "studio-apartment" type rooms, and a friendly staff...no place better than the Ilikai for an Oahu trip. Near the Hawaiian Village therefore has agreat view of the Fireworks on Friday. Cinnamon's has the best pancakes too! Try and eat a 4 stack, I dare you!

12 nights booked here.... not by any means first time to Waikiki, first to Ilikai. We fortunately able to book early checkin, apt 1336 .. which was great considering 0600 arrival at HNL. First impression... a bit dated! Kitchen was well equipped and bathroom was adequate. Locale great.Our view was over lagoon, so we had a great view of fireworks. I will admit I found the bright lights from the Hilton a night, a bit much.. closing blinds minimal effect. I think I would prefer marina view next time.Our bedroom (twin) and lounge area a different matter. I found the covering sheet on my bed had been stained/marked, which wasn’t immediately noticed as covered by decorative cloth. Our fake timber flooring had been repaired however it was very obvious and our lounge (was sofa lounge) was rather disgusting. It was badly marked and stained, it truly needed a good clean. We simply didn’t like to sit on it. Probably worse was the aircon. There were instructions not to go below 72f. Sorry, but that is a bit too warm to sleep thru! It was one of those noisy old style, at floor level. Totally ineffective and most definitely needs replacing.We noticed during the period other apartments better appointed, so this experience wouldn’t put us off staying here again. We just need to find out when renovated, hopefully we will pick better next time. I couldn’t recommend 1336 in its present state.

The staff our helpful, the suites clean and tastefully decorated. I had a kitchenette it was very niat and decked out with all dishes and utensils.Te view was spectacular and the walk to the lagoon for a swim was only 400 metres. I was very happy with my stay as it was 10 years ago that I first stayed at the illikai hotel.

Located in the back corner of the twelfth floor (1243), this two bedroom two bath unit offered great value for money--especially if you don't need to park. I came in a large group so we split up and left the car with the other half of our tribe. The unit was well appointed with granite counters and floors throughout. Coffee maker, toaster, microwave, and all the other amenities that you could want. Go downstairs and get some beer for the fridge or some ground coffee for breakfast. This place is truly your home away from home. Two walls offered panoramic views of the Honolulu shoreline and the lagoon at the HHV. On Fridays I bet the fireworks show would be fabulous!

We stayed in apartment 816 which had a king bed, small sitting area, kitchenette and bathroom. We travelled with a baby so arranged a hire cot through the cleaners, cost was $79USD for 8 nights. We booked the accommodation through Waikiki Beach Rentals which were great to deal with. This hotel is located approx 10-15minute walk out of Waikiki, next door to Hilton Village, 5min walk to Ala Moana Shopping Cente and within a 2min walk to 2 ABC stores. This is the second time we have stayed here. We love the location and style of accommodation, would high.y recommend to anyone travelling to Wakiki. Rates are really reasonable compared to other hotels in the area.

Chester was the man. Took exceptional care of my wife and I on our honeymoon! I’m on no sleep just flew back from Cali in bed writing this review because this hotel was the bomb. Fireworks right outside, suite like rooms completely renovated. Private balcony... off the super touristy strip in Waikiki but centrally located to skip out the city or go downtown. The customer service though was dope and Chester went above and beyond to help my wife and I with all our endeavors and checking in and out! He deserves a raise. Genuinely caring for all his guests it truly does make the difference.Only negative was the hotel doesn’t have AC in lobby area because it’s outside which is fine, sorry I’m used to casinos with full blown AC but the elevators didn’t have it either and cramming 10 people in an elevator after everybody just went to the beach was rather gross... take note management. I’m still giving you 5 star because my man Chester at the front desk was phenomenal! Cheers!

Our room was spacious, with a full kitchen and large fridge which comes in handy in Hawaii. We had a King size bed and a pull out couch bed. There is an ABC store just around the corner (walking distance), and the beach is just a few minute walk away as well. I didn't rent a car until we wanted to go to the North side, and there is a car rental place at the resort and two across the street. If you rent from across the street you can return it later in the evening. We just rented one for a day (parking overnight is expensive!), and it seemed to work out great. We used Uber a couple of times to go to the crater hike and a few other close locations that aren't close enough to walk. The resort itself is nice, but the pool is tiny so we didn't spend any time at the pool. There is a kiddie one on another level, but it looked small and not worthwhile as well. The beach is amazing, and we rented paddle boards and had a great time! Overall, the hotel is clean, spacious and convenient. I would go back.

First class hotel difficult to find anything wrong with it, staff amazing so helpful rooms spotless cinamons great food would recommend to any one, if first time in waiikiki make it the illikai hotel to stay Ronnie

Stay at the ilikai at condo 817 for 2 weeks loved our condo had everything you could possibly need bed was very comfortable bed didn’t get much noise it was really comfortable had starter kit to start us off like soap shampoo toiletries

BEAUTIFUL VIEW!! The room was perfect!! The location was AWSOME AND THE PEOPLE AT THIS HOTEL WERE INCREDIBLE!! What more can I say!! Thank You for making our Vacation of a Lifetime sooo spectacular!! ❤️

Excellent. Love the garden entertainment at night, music & hula dancers and some free fresh leis and I am one of the lucky ladies that got one. Room is very excellent. What we had is a condo room and has all we need including kitchen electrical stuffs for preparing our food & coffee. Love the Veranda where I can meditate over looking the blue waters of Hawaii. Love ❤️

We stayed at apt #2023. The block has maybe 1000+ units (huge!) and as fifty years old this year, I am assuming not every apartment is the same level of refurbishment nor appoitment. The reference to building amenities will be common.Recommended for long or short stay. Very comfortable, excellent base.Nicely appointed apartment in huge apartment block. Pretty well everything you need is at this apartment which has been refurbished since the block itself is 50 years old. Despite this there is no signs of its antiquity! Plenty of coffee and cleaning materials etc. Beers in fridge. Decent wi-fi. Aircon works well. Lots of elevators. Shops within complex open late. Self check in works very well but you must follow email instruction as the resort itself will cannot help if you are not prepared (if arranged via the owner rather than resort). Attractive pool(s) ith towels provided. Friendly pool staff. Easy to get to the apartment from airport - we used ride hailing app.Very little not to like. The apartment, unlike some in the block, looks out to the street not to the ocean but I don't think it was stated otherwise in the blurb via agency we used

What can I say about the Ilakai... we loved it! the staff was wonderful, we enjoyed Cinnamon's for breakfast every morning. The room was lovely, the bed... it was not comfortable, but honestly most hotel beds are not for me (bad back). We would definitely come back. The beaches are within walking distance. We especially loved the Ala Moana beach/park it was not crowded. The buses and shuttles are super close by.

Thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Ilikai in Apt 1923. A beautiful condo with a city view and all of the things we needed. Good standard accomodation if you’re just needing a place to lay your head at night.

Beware of staying at this property. I experienced bed bugs here. I captured a live bed bug in a solo cup and took it to the front desk. There was no manager on site so they brought down the housekeeping manager to speak with me. She confirmed it was a bed bug but did nothing about it. She questioned why I was bringing it to her attention on my check out date. I explained that was the first time I saw one. She basically accused me of “planting” the bed bug. As if I have the resources or desire to do something like that. I was treated with total disrespect. I had to catch my flight home so I didn’t have time to inspect my luggage or belongings before packing. It was a total inconvenience for me upon returning home to have to leave my luggage and content in my backyard until I had time to thoroughly inspect every item for bed bugs. Bringing these critters home could be disaster. They can live up to a year without feeding and it takes 122 degrees to kill them. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. The property is 50 years old, dirty, and in need of a total face lift. The only positive was the valet staff were all very friendly, fast and efficient with my car every day.

We booked through a travel consultant that recommended Ilakai due to no resort fees. We had a 1 bedroom ocean facing condo which was clean had a full kitchen but the oven door would not open due to the double door fridge......There are 2 double beds which we struggled even being 5'6 & 5'7 both very firm mattresses and were told the unit was only for 2 people so thought yes a queen size or even a king configuration would have been acceptable. Now this is a private owned room 1616 as I said spectacular veiws to the ocean pool and lagoon, in saying that though there is the right hand side of the Ilikai also looks onto your balcony also on the left another hotel peers in. You get a free show nightly like groundhog day is great first day or two but becames a pain after that. Proximity to Ala Moana shops is great also the number 8,20,19 & 42 will take you past War Museum also to the International shopping complex also the opposite direction to Ala Moana. As I write this August 2019 day pass on the bus for 2 was $11 to hop on and off for the day is the most economical way to see yourself around to walk to free War museum is 2424 steps and a nice walk either along beachfront or roadway paths .But on finishing There is free wifi, a kitchen to cook,tv if you watch tv, you get a few pool passes and 2 rolls of toilet paper. There are ABC convenience stores nearby save you dockets bring what you can from home as food is expensive. ALOHA enjoy and Mahalo

We ended up changing our minds and staying here instead of at another hotel closer to the mall. The reasons we ended up staying here was for the view of the water/harbor, they offered rooms that had a full fridge and kitchen area, and it was not quite in the heart of the mall/shopping area.We have a great experience overall. The staff was very friendly and very helpful from the front desk to the little ice cream shop to the mini market to the spa/massage area. The staff that handles the valet/parking situation is great as well if you rent a car. They get you in and out fast with no limit on how many times you can leave and come back.My only gripe is that the beds were really firm.

We stayed at the Ilikai for 10 nights and booked direct. We arrived early and dropped our bags off while we walked down to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. We got back around 1.00 pm and had access to our apartment. The apartment was spacious and had views of the marina. It was a great location and we used the complimentary shuttle a couple of times. Staff could have been friendlier. We went to Cinnamons for dinner and didn’t rate it. It was easy getting the shuttle to the outlets from the guy out the front of the hotel under the umbrella. Definitely would stay here again

We rented this Unit through Waikiki Beach Rental. Booking process was easy.Ilikai 1942 - Great location, really central, comfortable, clean and just like the pictures, the check-in was easy. Loved the view, beach access and the amenities of the Ilikai building. For 4 people the bathroom was a bit small, there were not enough towels and towel holder for drying. We had a perfect stay in this appartment. We would definitely stay here again!

This is our third stay at the Illikai. We love everything about it. the location and its proximity to restaurants and Ala Moana Shopping Mall and the beach and the public lagoon, and the views from the balconies..The list could go on. It is a bit dated and an old establishment but many of the rooms are uodated and its clean.We will always choose this hotel/condominium establishment.

Our accommodation was cancelled last minute due to the new private home letting rules. We wanted a full kitchen and viewThis was a great find on the 25 floor nice big rooms bigger than most with a small kitchen and good views. It was quiet and cleanYes this on old hotel struggling but we no problem with any of the staff and the service was greatIt was also great to be away from the downtown Waikiki

We had a family of 7 and trying to find hotels without hiring 2 rooms was impossible until I came across this gem. The hotel rooms are dated but sufficient and room 1543 was a double apartment with ocean views and so spacious, we couldnt have asked for more. It was clean, modernised and while the nothing special of the facilities, the pool was adequate, even though one of the pool attendants took her job too seriously, it was good. Close to everything except the hustle and bustle of waikiki tourist strip.We loved it being at the start of the tourist strip and felt very comfortable.Staff were mostly good and courteous. Room was great as we were self sufficient.Really no bad points other than it being a dated hotel but that did not worry us at all.

Friendly and efficient staff. Room was well appointed and clean and comfortable. Pool areas are busy and restricted for sun access due to high rise nature of the area. Cafes and restaurants were good with quick service. Hotel is well placed with bus stops, mimi market and McDonalds(!) close by. Downtown Waikiki is an easy enough walk away (15 mins?). Recommended.

Definitely a three-star hotel, maybe better for business travelers because of the larger square footage and kitchen. Front desk staff was not friendly upon check-in or check-out. The rooms were clean, the bedroom furniture was good but living area furniture was lacking. Would have preferred air conditioned elevators and hallways. Gave up location for room size, but I won't do that next time.

The llikai was a great hotel to stay at.The ocean views from my room were spectacular in the morning and the sunsets were great in the evening.Room was very comfortable and spacious. Staff were friendly and helpful.One issue:Furniture in rooms and In lobby require updating and or cleaned.Cushions had old water stains and were found to be faded.

Pros1. Very stunning view of the Marina and sunset. (22 floor)2, Cinammons restaurant has one of the very best breakfast I have ever had.(Pancakes and omelets are off da chain)3. I loved the full size kitchen. We stored our beverages and could warm up our food. This is great if you have kids and want to save a little money.4. The staff was courteous and receptive to our requests for extra towels.5. The pool was fun6. Lots of restaurants and bus lines in front of the hotel. This hotel seems to be a major stop for all the tours. 7. Don't forget to get beach chairs and towels at the front desk.8. Don't miss the 4 minute firework show on Friday evening.... quick but good....9 Bring your washing powder because there are washing machines and dryers on each floor. I like washing my swim clothes at night......Cons- 1. It was 3 of us in the room and 2 queen size beds would have been better instead of 1 queen and a sofa bed. The comfort level would have been better with 2 queens. The sofa bed was a bit squeaky....2. The rooms seem to be a little hot at night. Its like they turn the air down.3. I agree with a previous review about the hall carpets are filthy and it is hot in the hallways.Well this place is okay..... I will come back again!!!! The Pros outweigh the Cons..... And I will need another Farmers omelete real soon with some red velvet pancakes.....

Lovely location, nice rooms and views. Didn't interact with the staff much but they seemed nice. Nice restaurant downstairs, good cocktails, good view of the fireworks. Nice pool. Would stay here again - Thansk! :)

I saved for years for this holiday and the Ac was terrible. Turned up one day to find a technician in the room fixing it.Apparently they have the right at any time to send people into yr room (as advised by very abrupt real estate agent Scott). Wasnt any better so we spent our whole trip boiling to death. Great place if everything works; if not yr on yr own. From now on I stay at hotels who care about customer service and keeping their good name.

I was looking for a one night stay for my family and I because of our flight being cancelled. The customer service is okay but the hotel overall needs a remodel/upgrade. The hallways are very old and dirty, the carpets are dirty and have stains. I asked for a two queen beds and I got a king and a pull out sofa. I was willing to stay and tough it out because it was just one night. Although as I was pulling the pull out sofa into a bed I accidentally pulled a sheet and I saw a BED BUG crawling in between the sheets! I immediately grabbed my kids and our stuff and ran out. When I told the front desk they just said sorry and gave me my money back. Although in the end I was stuck scrambling to find a hotel room last minute. PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT BED BUGS!

Clean room and very convenient location for traveling around the Island.Lots of resturants within walking distance choose from. Nice pool and fitness room.This was my third stay at this hotel. I will stay here again.

Rented a suite, very nice place the only thing was dirty pots and pans in the kitchenett. that was kinda gross. They play the theme from Hawii 5-0 on all the hotel tv screens, kind of amusing, as it was used in the opening credits of the TV show.

Have tried numerous hotels in Waikiki as we pass through, and keep coming back to the Ilikai, we stayed in an ocean view room on the 23rd floor, it was large, well appointed with a good kitchen, and sitting area,bathroom and balcony with stunning views, easy walking to the Ala Moana.centre, they do offer complimentary shuttle which we used and the driver was a font of information, giving details of where shops and supermarkets were located on his route. Staff are friendly, they offer complimentary beach chairs and towels, There is a convenience store in the lobby that has all the essentials including hot coffee and danishes for breakfast, and wifi was good.No complaints here we will be back

In December 2018, I booked a two-bedroom suite at the Illikai for a friend and I. I ended up changing the dates of my stay. I tried to make the date change online but had difficulty with the site. I used the hotel website's "chat" function to get instruction on how to revise my dates and rebooked.After staying at the hotel during the revised dates, the Ilikai charged me more than $400 for the room they said I did not cancel. I explained about changing the date online. I had a 45 minute phone call with a manager from the hotel about the charge. He did not care that I had a history with the hotel nor that he risked losing a customer nor that I had stayed there later that week. He showed me no "aloha" spirit. It is unlikely I will stay there again especially given the abundance of other wonderful hotels in Waikiki.

We rented a private 1 bedroom condo at the Ilikai hotel and it was surprisingly beautiful and modern. We booked it from Expedia for $750 for a week. There is no daily maid service but you can get maid service for a fee. The view was excellent from the balcony on the 9th floor. It’s an older hotel and it’s very busy, but very quiet at night.

One reason it did not get 5 stars. No air conditioning in elevators or hallways. Other than this it was a fabulous place to stay. We had the 2 bedroom suite that fit our budget and family needs. Can’t express how wonderful it made our first time in Hawaii feel like we lived here. Each room had its own air conditioner, and bathroom. The living spaces were nice to enjoy breakfast or late night snacks to reminisce over the days events. If you are more than a couple, I would highly recommend this hotel.

The location was great, hotel staff lovely.However we booked with Waikiki Beach Rentals and stayed in room 1412, no problem with booking or checking in, was really easy. On first walking into the room it was lovely, but on closer inspection the room was not very clean and was very disappointing. We also had problems with the hotel lifts, my mother was on a mobility scooter and more then once the lift doors closed on her when entering on the scooter, causing not only damage to the scooter but also leaving her with a bruised knee. We did complain about this but it appeared nothing to was done. This was watch by the security guard on duty at the time of the incidents, which was at least 4 times and they did nothing to help, thankfully the general public was of help in holding the doors open when she entered as I was not always with her. The fireworks on Friday night were fantastic and we really enjoyed them. We did enjoy our stay over all , and would consider staying here again, as the cleanness of the room might have been a one off, would like to hear from other people that have stayed using Waikiki Beach Rentals.

We stayed in one of their "Luxury, King Bed, Sunset Ocean- View with Full Kitchen" rooms on the 24th floor. It was a beautifully presented, immaculate and comfortable room with a magnificent view over the marina and beyond to the sunset. The accommodation was perfect for us to relax and catch our breath after travelling around the USA for 3 weeks.The staff are considerate and helpful and attend quickly to any requests.The Ilikai is just North of Waikiki, away from the hustle and bustle, but there is excellent public transport outside the front entrance to take you wherever you wish to go.The Ala Moana shopping complex of around 350 shops/restaurant etc is an easy 10 minute stroll to the North.The Ilikai is not your typical hotel. It is primarily a tower of apartments and offers more laid back accommodation than you get in the city centre, perfect for holiday living. The aircon was great and appreciated.There are plenty of restaurant choices within easy walking distance. We would be happy to stay again.

Second time we have stayed at the Ilikai but we made the mistake of booking condo 1231. Advertised as remodeled with new furniture which is so far from the truth. The futon couch so old. The beds old and uncomfortable. Worst of all the sheets were filthy and the mattress stained. The management did not seem to care. Even the lobby was dirty. The only thing that was good about this apartment was the view over the marina.

Fabulous stay for 5 days here in this apartment. Well appointed kitchen. Stunning views over the Marina and out to sea with so much going on on the water. The Pantry just a short walk for groceries. Ka’ili was excellent to work with.

Wonderful location and really great space for two couples. 2 bedrooms both with en-suites but only one had air conditioning which made things a little warm with just fans in that room. Very convenient to the Lagoon and the fabulous Alo Moana Mall and a short walk to the busy Waikiki shopping and restaurant areas. The hotel facilities were adequate with a nice pool but the restaurant food was very ordinary and expensive so would recommend going elsewhere for meals- just down the road about 100metres is Goofy’s which was reasonable and had lovely food.

We spent out Honeymoon in Hawaii and at the Ilikai Apartments for 2 weeks. The room was set with a fully equipped kitchen that we used to cook some meals such as breakfast and even had a few dinners there also. There was an ABC store across the way from the apartments that allowed us to purchase food for this. Our room was situated on the pool level with our verandah looking straight out onto the pool deck. There was plenty of entertainment around the lobby area of the hotel with performances and fireworks on the Friday night, courtesy of the Hilton (next door). The lagoon is a mere 5 min walk from the hotel and provides a safe area for children to swim and play. We didn't mind walking around to much so didn't feel as if this property was to far from the main strip but others may think otherwise. The Moana shopping centre is a decent walk in but there are free shuttles that can drop you back along the way if you time it correctly. All in all a very reasonable hotel that provided us with a base to complete many activities and see many things throughout our time in Oahu. Thank you. Ilikai Hotel

I had the misfortune of staying in apartment 1742. This apartment was rented through the Waikiki Beach Rentals group. That was my first and biggest mistake. Never ever rent a condo through them. There is no comeback if the condo is not up to standard. On the apartment itself1. The curtains. There may as well not be any curtains on the windows. They DO NOT block out any light and therefore for my holiday I get to be woken up from 6:30am2. Power amp age. Inadequate power amp age in the unit has meant that despite bringing international charger and adaptors, most of the appliances can not be used properly3. The lack of draw space inside the cupboard. There aren’t any draws. And the smell that emanates from the bedside tables has meant that I cannot unpack draw items and they are therefor in my suitcase 4. The general state of cleanliness was just a 50%. The floors were dirty, the shower looks like it needs bleaching and place could do with a good cleanAll in all your accommodation is sitting below satisfactory The Ilikai is a fabulous establishment in a perfect location. This review is not directed st the Ilikai themselves

Moved from the modern next door to this gem.This hotel has the views, ammenities , the atmosphere you would expect.Reasonably close to main shops of waikiki and short walk to ala moana shopping centre.Car hire hertz in lobby , convenience store , ice cream parlour.It has a couple of pools , two minute walk to the lagoon or ocean and its pretty quiet.Cable tv , great kitchen set up , large fridge and very clean upon arrivalRented from waikiki beach rentalsHighly recommended

Staying in Ilikai unit #1143. The view is absolutely top notch. The owner is easily accessible by phone and email to set up the booking reservation. The Hilton Hawaiian Village is adjacent to Ilikai, offering extensive shopping and restaurants. The balcony views include ocean views, Waikiki beach, Hilton lagoon, Ala Wai harbor (setting for Gilligan’s Island TV series and Elvis movie Girls, Girls, Girls), Friday evening fireworks, downtown Honolulu, etc. The sea breeze coming into the unit is refreshing ... except for the occasional cigarette smoke that wafts in from nearby units. We simply shut the balcony doors until the smokers stop; a frustrating experience. We would stay here in the future.

Hubby and I stayed an extra night after we took a cruise from Vancouver to Ohau. We weren't able to check in before our luau so it was 10:00 before we got back to the hotel so we couldn't see anything until the next morning, we had an ocean view room which was wonderful. I thought the room was fine and the full kitchen was great, the vanity in the bathroom showed some wear, a tough up paint job would have done the trick. The king bed was comfortable and the room spacious, we couldn't get the play station to work as there are DVD's that you could watch. Not sure I would stay here again.

Our family stayed at the Ilikai for 10 nights and it was fantastic. We arrived at night pretty late so we couldn’t see anything out the windows. I got up to make coffee pretty early and was greeted with the most spectacular view of the ocean you’ve ever seen! We ate all our meals outside on the lanai and it was just a short walk to the beach. The staff were all great and were quick at delivering any towels etc that we needed at any time. Our cable didn’t work we discovered about halfway through our stay, but they sent a nice man up right away to fix the problem. The only negatives that I would say is that the carpet was pretty old and missing in spots. It would be great to see this replaced. One of the sliding balcony doors to the back bedroom was also not locking. We meant to mention it when we checked out but forgot. It was on the 22nd floor so we weren’t overly worried about it, but it would have made us feel better if it had locked with having kids in there. We just set the ironing board in the sliding part so it couldn’t be opened! These were the only things we can think of that we would change, as our stay was fantastic. We would definitely stay here again if we’re ever lucky enough to visit this beautiful island again!

I found this hotel a bit dated at first. But the location was great. We was on the 24th floor over looking the harbour. Walking distance to the beach. Shops and restaurants on the ground floor. They charge you $25 a night for resort fees. Things like, ice, newspaper, PlayStation games rentals and movie rentals. I didn’t agree to this but it as to be paid. So just remember that. And also they require around $200 for damage security. Which is a nightmare because when you check out it takes about 10 days to be put back into your account.

We booked the Ilikai through WaikikiBeachRentals.com in July 2018 for our trip in April 2019. All transactions took place online and after booking, a reservation summary was emailed to us with all of the information needed for our stay, including a link to make our room payments. We were able to split the payment and have the couple that we traveled with make their share of the payment through the link. I had one communication through the comment section on their website promptly responded to before we booked. Thought it was interesting that we also received, at the time of the booking, a key code for the room and the time it would be active.When we arrived at the hotel, there was no check-in process or need to go to the registration desk as we simply went to our room and used the key code. There are several elevators servicing the hotel with very short wait times.We had a 2 bedroom unit, 510, which would have slept 6 due to a sleeper couch. Our unit had a small kitchen (room for 2 to move around) that was well stocked with cooking utensils and dishes/glasses. There was a refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, stove, small sink/garbage disposal, and coffee maker. A bar that had one stool separated the kitchen from the living space. On one end of the room was a dining table with 6 chairs. In the middle was a leather couch, coffee table, small end table, tv cabinet, and a wall mounted flat screen tv. In the other end of the room was another small round table with 4 chairs. The 2 bedrooms were on opposite ends of the room. The master room was a little larger than the other bedroom with a dresser, nightstand, tv, king-size bed, closet space, bathroom, and the small balcony access. The other bedroom had 2 nightstands/lamps, closet space, queen-size bed, tv, access to the unit bathroom, and access to the main balcony (which had a better outside view.) There wasn't much room between the bed and wall mounted tv in this room, so we placed the 1 barstool under the tv so we wouldn't bump into it. The large balcony had a small table/4 chairs that faces the marina/ocean. The smaller balcony faces another hotel/town and had a smaller table with 2 chairs. Both bathrooms had plenty of towels and only soap was provided.The large windows in this unit give you a nice view. You are asked to turn the AC off when you are not in the room, but it works well and cools the room off pretty fast.Cinnamon's is the restaurant/bar on the lower floor and we enjoyed several meals, including the buffet, there. There is an ice cream shop, gift store, and a few other specialty shops/services located on the floor also. Although we didn't have to deal with the reception desk and concierge, I had questions for both, and they were very helpful.The swimming pool was clean. Towels are provided at the pool and there are several lounge chairs, but they do fill up fast during the day. We were still able to get chairs when we went. The Ilikai is in a nice location and a 15 minute or less walk can get you to several places to shop or eat. The lagoon and beach are only a few minutes walk away with Diamond Head Crater viewable from the beach. In our unit was a beach chair and mat which we made use of. Tour buses and trolleys stop in front of the hotel. There are also some businesses in the marina that provide excursions.I would suggest and recommend Waikiki Trolley (hop on/hop off) as a cheap way to get around if you don't already have plans. They have several different lines that take you different places for sightseeing.Would definitely stay at the Ilikai again, probably trying a different unit though.

The Ilikai it's self never fails to impress from the time you walk into the foyer it is like being at home, Cinnamon's is a great place to eat and our second visit to condo 1232 at the Ilikai condos was even better than our first. The condo was exactly as I remembered it, although some of the furniture had been upgraded, like the mattress and the 60 inch TV. The lanai was still remarkable and the whole condo comfortable and well appointed and maintained. We will be back.

Ilikai 1126 - This was our first time staying at ilikai, and we loved it. Our condo 1126 was a fantastic 2 bedroom apartment, with views of the lagoon/ocean and city/mountains. We love having the 2 balconies and used them both. Having the city views was lovely and that balcony provided the wind breeze which helped cool down the condo. The a/c unit was effective but really noisy. The unit had everything that we needed and we made use of the kitchen cooking half of our meals for the 2 week period. Ala Moana Shopping centre was fantastic and a quick 10 min walk got you there. There was a Foodlands food market where we got our food. You don't see the Hilton Friday night fireworks, from this unit, so If your wanting to see them, best to walk down to the lagoon. We had 6 people for our stay and 1 person was using the sofa couch to sleep. It is not the large corner sofa couch shown in the photos, which looks lovely and comfortable. Its a very hard uncomfortable sofa couch, which has bars and springs digging into you each night. So we were very dissatisfied with this. Having said that, it was the only disappointment in our condo. We booked it through Waikiki Beach Rentals and they were great to deal with, making it very easy. The first two numbers (11) is floor level and 26 room number. The location was fantastic, easy access walk way down to lagoon and beach, which we used daily. And an easy walk, either towards Ala Moana Shopping centre or the other way towards Waikiki Beech for shopping and dinning. Staff at reception and bag counter were all friendly and helpful. Lots of cool little shops around the Foyer, with locally sourced products for sale. I would definitely stay here again.

I booked a condo through aloha vacations paid deposit checked reviews all mixed there were going to be myself husband two younger daughters 20 and 21 who were bridesmaids then my other daughter announced coming leaving children with husband as no money for everyone so we asked about larger room that would take 5 they changed us no problem I have submitted review for them separately. We chose 2108 which faced the harbour we arrived early the concierge said to.go up as believed the previous ones had gone which was great we were on the 21st floor. Codes to get in no need for keys or cards which is great as 5 of us all doing different things. First impression was the reception entrance valet parking waterfalls lovely shops inside hairdressers massage coffee shop supermarket ice cream parlour and a couple of others we went up to our room found was a beautiful studio kitchenette with large fridge freezer microwave coffee perculator oven all the utensils you could want bathroom shower over bath and sink and mirror two double beds and a sofa that turned into double bim when 5 of you a lille cramped but who spends time in room. The lanai well it was amazing the views were beautiful and the sunset amazing the pictures we took were the most amazing I have seen.
