There was a pool which provided towels for you kids and adults clean but relatively small considering sized complex however with the beautiful beach a stone's throw away does it matter there was another pool 2nd floor which was a dip pool not deep but chairs in the water to lay on smaller kids here but not many and the sun more up there. I cannot say how relaxing this holiday complex was everything in walking distance.There are alot of homeless people camping out further up on the beach parades but they tend to keep themselves to themselves and I did not feel unsafe hope this review helps

My friend and i stayed in the hotel part and it was very nice. The full kitchen was awesome and not something you find often and the lounge pool was where we spent most of our time. It really had everything we needed only thing is the carpets and couch were a bit dirty and could use a clean.

We stayed here for 4 nights during Spring Break. Easy walk to lagoon and beach. The resort fee includes use of beach towels and chair which is great. The pool on 2nd floor is only 1 ft 18 inches but the area is calm and has many umbrellas. The pool on 1st floor goes to 8 ft deep but is much busier with no umbrellas at lounge chairs. There is a shuttle for all Aqua resorts that gets you easily to Ala Moana Shopping center as well as the Waikiki area of shopping and restaurants. Rooms are nice and clean. Kitchen has a variety of appliances making it easy to cook.

We spent several nights at the Ilikai hotel and it’s a good average hotel. The location is good as it’s approximately a 10-15 minute walk from the Main Street where all shops and restaurants are. The Hilton lagoon that is right behind the hotel is amazing. The hotel seems a little old and the restaurant is average. The pool is very small for the size of the hotel and they literally don’t allow any splashing. So if you have a family I wouldn’t recommend this hotel at all. Not very family friendly.

Hi, Firstly I am trying to keep this review neutral.Our Ilikai private Condo was 1444. It has two bedrooms, each with a queen bed, a kitchen, living area. It is a corner Condo with good views. The deco is pleasant and comfortable. The Ilikai caters for families and you notice the numbers that churn out of the lifts. The condo was quiet though. The Ilikai is close to a beach and lagoon. It is a ten minute walk from the beginning of the main strip.Negatives are: curtains are beginning to tear due to sun damage. Chipped tiles on the floor, though they are not sharp. We arrived to find a blocked toilet that was in the process of being fixed. It didn't help our initial impression to find a bad smell and a toilet removed from the wall. When i expressed my disappointment to Bert the maintenance manager, he was borderline rude in response. This didn't help. Where we understand that these things happen, we should have at least been called and advised that our room wouldn't be available for at least an hour or so while they fixed the toilet. Maybe a voucher for a drink and we would have been happy to sit waiting. Instead, we arrived to the smell and a toilet disconnected from a wall. The clean afterwards (which i had to ask for) was adequate, but they did not wash the floors as I would have expected.I went back through the website (Waikiki beach rentals) and they advised to contact the owner. I did and have heard nothing back from him. I tried to contact someone directly at Waikiki beach rentals and have not heard back from them also.It seems that if you have a problem then you are left all on your own!Did this ruin the holiday? No, but it would have been good to have at least had come sort of acknowledgment that this was not the best way to arrive at our Condo! Either that or book through the Ilikai Hotel and get the benefit of having someone deal with problems as they occur.Rating: 7.5/10 (it would have been 9/10 if the arrival was more pleasant).

We enjoyed this hotel because it had a kitchen area and it made our stay feel like home. We cooked breakfast and lunch there. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel has two pools. One for lounging and the other for swimming. Everything is a short walk from here, including the beach.

This was a first family trip to Hawaii and we wanted to stay near the Hilton lagoon bu stay in a comfortable room to cater for a family of 5 so we picked Ilikai! Very impressed with the modern rooms which had a king bed, sofa bed, kitchen and outdoor area overlooking the pool. The location was ideal being in between Ala Moana Centre and Waikiki which was a 15-20 min walk or a $2 ride on the trolley which are at the front. The pool was nothing special but we used the Hilton Pool most times which was open to the public and was a close walk. We were lucky to have 2 Fridays there and seen the fireworks. We hired a car for 2 days and was helped by the lady in car rentals in the hotel. We got to see the whole island over 2 days. Would recommend going to Dole Plantation, Kualoa Ranch to see where some movies were made, Pearl Harbour & Waikele Premium Outlets for shopping. Food is quite expensive in Hawaii but we found the Cheesecake Factory to be well priced and the food was delicious...did go back 3 times :) Had a great family holiday and would do it again!

First time we have stayed at the Marina end of Waikiki, we stayed in the one bedroom with kitchen. Room was big, clean and comfortable. It had a modern design and great location. It was close to lagoon, beach and shopping center. 5-10 minutes walk at the most. Only criticism was the pools were small and busy. We didn't stay at the hotel pool, went to lagoon and beach instead. Loved staying here- would come back.

Very pleased with the size of our suite and the amenities provided. Even had a slow cooker in the kitchen! View of the marina and sunsets from our balcony was spectacular, but we would have been just as happy with any of the views from other wings of this hotel. Our only concern was that the size of the pool was quite small for so many guests and expect it could get overcrowded during peak school holiday season.

This is a 3+ location. The rooms are all studios, but what they lack in size they make up with cleanliness, efficiencies and comfort. The Ilikai is a Honolulu icon located on the north end of Waikiki and over looks the marina where the crew of the SS Minnow departed for their 3 hour tour, (Kids ... ask your parents about Gilligan's Island). We like the Ilikai because it is so conveniently located but at the same time we're not Waikiki overwhelmed. Its the most uncrowded resort on the crowded Waikiki beach. Parking is valet only and expensive, but since they don't have their own parking lot, that's just way it is. In general, we bus and walk everywhere from here. The sunsets can be spectacular and with the Hilton literally next door, there's always something exciting going on. FYI: Cinnamon's, their lobby restaurant, is unbelievably packed on the weekends, (local favorite), but on weekdays you'll be immediately seated. The breakfasts are fantastic.

I have been staying at the Ilikai, renting a condo, for many years. It is a beautiful building and very well situated. Within an eight minute walk you can be at the huge Ala Moana shopping centre which has a very excellent grocery store at the far end. Be sure to get a room overlooking the ocean at the back of the building. The street side can be very noisy. It is a very easy walk to get into the heart of Waikiki. Every Friday night the Ilikai sponsors a free Hawaiian concert in the Plaza @the Ilikai, followed by a magnificent display of fireworks. On Sunday the Ilikai has a live band with dance music in the plaza. In my opinion it’s the very best in Waikiki.

We have a very pleasant stay at the hotel ocean view suite. The hotel is Y shape, and there are two different types of ocean view suite, one is facing the Hilton lagoon and the ocean(pic 1), and another one is Sunset suite(pic 2). There is firework (5 minutes) each Friday night at Hilton lagoon. If you choose that said, you can see it(pic 4). The only issue I have is the view is somehow obstructive by Hilton. If choose sunset ocean view, you won’t be disappointed by the beautiful sunset(pic 5 is taken from second floor). The room is very spacious (pic 3 is from internet but is exactly what we have, at least 500+plus square feet). Enough room for my kids to play here and there, which is much nicer than staying at the regular 300 square feet hotel room. The sofa can be turned into a queen-size sofa bed( a bit soft though). I read some review about the elevator issue. For the time we stayed there, we never need to wait for elevator for more than 2-minutes, but the ride can be very noisy. The staff is friendly and helpful. The kitchen equipped with essentials. The toiletries is not too-notch brand and it’s fine. There is a convenient store onsite and the price is reasonable. Of course ABC store is nearby where you can find anything, even cheap snorkeling gear. (12.99 per set) if you rent a car, behind the hotel, there are plenty of up to 10 hours parking space ($1/hour) so you can park overnight. During day time, near Hilton lagoon, there are a few free and up to 6 hours parking if needed (I guess it’s mainly for people visit the beach). Hotel valet parking is $28/day. For shopping, I found a few interesting stores in the nearby Hilton village. I think the building is a mix a hotel and time share, everything above 22 floor call luxury suites, and they also offer partial ocean view at the lower floor (2-6 floor I guess). Better to verify with them when you book your trip. Lastly, the ocean facing side of the hotel at 20 plus floor is not noisy, this might not be true for the city facing site.

We stayed in Unit 1602 for a week and had a great time. 2 double beds for two single ladies and a futon as well. Plenty of room. Great view of the marina and having a kitchenette was a great add on. Huuuge TV, air con, huuuge fridge plus full oven and microwave. Nothing else was needed apart from a hairdryer which we bought from Walmart for $10 and left there as it can't be used in Australia. Walked to the Hilton Lagoon (took 5 mins) to watch the fireworks and it was about 10-15 min easy walk to Ala Moana.

My family and I had an amazing 2 bedroom 2 bath very spacious condo suite on the 25th floor of The Ilikai. Two balconies with ocean views, mountain and city views. Completely remodeled. Excellent service, comfortable beds, full kitchen, comfortable furnishings. Would stay here again.

We booked a condo 5 months in advance in Booking.com. A month before the trip, they took the deposit as planned. I asked for the room number and I got it (823). I found bad reviews of that room and I asked for a change. They said there was nothing else. I said I wanted to cancel and they said that you have to pay a penalty of more than $1,000 for cancelation within 1 month. I called again and they told me that there was nothing else, because I was in an “economy” room. I asked for an “upgrade” and they finally assigned me a better room that I could see by looking at the pictures. They charged me an extra $200. Hotel is old (built in 1964) but well maintained. During our stay, one of the 5 elevators stopped working and lasted for at least a week and was out of order when we left. The apartment that we got (1617) is in very good condition, but it is a studio. The upgrade may be that appliances are newer than the original one, that had appliances from the 60’s or 70’s from what I could see in the pictures. The only issues were: (1) no beach towels, (2) no blender in the kitchen, (3) some missing vertical blinds for the balcony, (4) the “vizio” TV did not accept the apple adapter, and the remote has some failures, and (5) it is not insulated for noise, there is not double window to the street, so you can hear everything. Bed was firm. Bathroom was excellent. Kitchen was functional. All was clean. Laundry room worked with quarters, and you can get coins in the 7th floor. There are 2 small / medium size swimming pools. There is a convenience store in the lobby floor, as well as a restaurant, a coffee shop, a rental car place and other small businesses. It is in located at walking distance from Ala Moana beach, and also a little further is Waikiki beach.

We stayed 5 nights in a 2 bedroom ocean view condo on the 12th floor. It was a great location, parking was included, and shopping and restaurants were within walking distance and also on site. Once I bought earplugs most nights were very restful. I'm a light sleeper and woke up at the sound of sirens (police/fire nearby) and garbage trucks (all garbage trucks sound the same) but the majority of evenings were fine. The pool area is huge. Free fireworks over Waikiki Beach on Friday nights you can enjoy from this location. Also a huge plus is there are many bus stops nearby and most of the tours stop at this hotel for pick ups. You can also catch the Waikiki Trolley Cars here with on/off privileges. This is a perfect place to stay. If you're new to Hawaii, like we were, there are Red Lobster and Outback restaurants less than a block away. ABC is a popular souvenir store in the area and there are two close to this location. One to the right towards the Hilton Hawaiian Village complex and one to the left towards the restaurants. We also saw a McDonalds to the left of this property and on the corner about 1/2 block away. Beautiful weather! This location pops! You won't be disappointed.

They give you a lot of space for what you pay. But the cable TV completely suck; we had problem even with changing channel. Swimming pools aren't pretty. But it's close to mostly everything. Views are nice for some rooms as well.

It’s now tired. While the location is great the rooms are a bit tired. My condo 1120 wasn’t too bad but the other condo we had was more tired. The corridors and public spaces could be better maintained

This hotel was very comfortable and spacious for one room. We had a king-sized bed, full kitchen, sofa, small desk and of course a nice TV. Right on Waikiki Beach, ask about when the fireworks are scheduled -- I think it's Friday evening. Short program and enjoyable. Musicians and dancers performed in the lobby that night as well. Another night, the guitarist singer invited a well known hula dancer to perform. Her entire table of women got up and we watched 5 women gracefully tell their story. I thought they were elegant. There is also an ice cream store in the building -- don't miss the Tuesday special.

Great place to stay with many facilities and great staffPool for refresh and Short distance from the beach, you can walk easily downtown or the main boulevard to do your shopping or go for drinks or food

The Ilikai is located in the heart of Waikiki and is close to everything. There is a great beach next door at the Hilton Hawaiian Village which has lots of good shops and restaurants. The Ilikai also has Cinnamon's which is a good place to eat as well. They were renovating four of the floors with new carpet and wallpaper when we were there, although the carpet hardly needed it. Nice safe place to stay.

My family of 5 recently had a week stay at the Ilikai Hotel. We were on the 23rd floor in a 2 bedroom suite. The suite was spacious and comfortable with 2 large bedrooms and 2 decent sized washrooms. There were also 2 great balconies and we had a nice city and ocean view. My eldest daughter took the pull out sofa bed which was very creaky,and worn. She complained that she felt the bars and springs through the thin mattress. I did call down to ask if they could provide any sort of extra padding or bedding but they were unable to assist.The kitchen was well equipped and we bought groceries from the nearby ABC store for breakfast and snacks.The service was okay...housekeeping will not clean the dishes and there is no dishwasher in the suites. We even called down to say we would pay extra to have this service but they would not accommodate. The table was left frequently unwashed or cleaned and they did not provide cleaning tools for us to do so on our own. Not that we would really want to do that on holiday anyhow.The beach is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel and there is no beach service. The front desk does provide beach chairs and towels but you must carry them down on your own. Also, the chairs are not loungers and are pretty uncomfortable. We schlepped them down to the beach the first day and then rented loungers and umbrellas from a beach vendor after that. The pool is small, definitely not glamorous in any way. It was the type of pool you would find in the basement of an old condo building. I would have expected something much nicer. We barely spent any time there. The little grocery shop in the hotel is outrageously priced...I think I saw a box of cereal for over $10.00!! We only had one meal in the hotel restaurant and it was mediocre. However, with all of that being said...the price of this hotel is right. As long as you know what you are getting. If I was returning with my kids or planning a long stay, I would consider returning to the Ilikai.

Condo 817Easy check in procedure, very very clean, has pool towels in the unit so you don’t have to worry about white towels, bed is very comfortable, room has everything you need, full kitchen, big shower, WiFi, work desk, TV and A/C, highly recommended, good price and brilliant views

Nice large suites with full kitchen and large balcony. Loved the location, off the beaten path but right next to the ocean - a beautiful beach, not as hectic as Waikiki beach, but still able to walk to Waikiki along a boardwalk. Stayed one night right in Waikiki and was elated to return to Ilikai! The only issue we had is the bed was too hard for us, but they do offer a topper. Would like to see the bedding updated in general, but overall highly recommend this property. We will definitely be back. And great little ice cream shop in lobby:)

Not sure about pricing since my husband's employer paid for the room. The floor we were on was being updated so very busy. Final product will be nice. We had a studio with king bed (needs to be replaced), kitchenette with full size refrigerator and stove but not much storage. Storage overall is limited but if you're not staying long, that shouldn't be an issue. We had a street view and given the choice, ask for the ocean view. The parking garage is half a block from the hotel. It does have A/C though a bit loud..On the plus side the A/C drowned out the street noise.

To preface this is about a condo NOT the hotel which is located on the top floors .It is regarding the condos booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals This is my experience which I feel necessary to let people know about  -In January this year my sister and I holidayed in Waikiki at The Ilikai in Unit 1738 booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals . We have stayed at The Ilikai previously and we understand the units are showing signs of wear and tear and that the fittings are old and worn but we like the location .On the 4th day of our 12 day vacation at 4.30pm the glass shower screen shattered explosively as I was exiting the shower stall. The door was a 2 section sliding panel arrangement . I sustained deep cuts to my hands and cuts and abrasions to my arms legs and body.I was in shock and thankfully my sister was there to assist.She immediately rang Scott from Waikiki Beach Rentals who said we needed to ring security ( he did not enquire as to my welfare at any time during or after) . Upon securities arrival they indicated it was beyond their scope and called the paramedics . They arrived within 5 minutes ( a great service) and proceeded to dress my woulds ,bandaged my heavily bleeding hands , administer pain killers ,advise I would need to visit a hospital and to have a tetanus shot . I was not to put my hands in water. I also required a course of antibiotics .My holiday was ruined . I had very limited use of my hands which made hygiene a challenge . My sister became my carer.I was constantly in pain. I was embarrassed by my heavily bandaged hands and nervous and anxious around people in case they should bump my hands .When I contacted Scott from WBR and the owner of Unit 1738 in Japan by email 2 days later their response by email was that I was 'lucky' I wasn't being charged for the shower screen and that ' we wanted to charge you but realise it was an accident'. Also that I should have reported the problem to maintenance . There was no problem until I was standing in the shower cubicle covered in blood and shards of glass.I am not a shower maintenance expert and so can't predict when and old and worn shower screen might fail.It was also suggested I ' did' something to the screen or was too rough. I am 61 ,my sister 57 ,we way 52 kilo and 53 kilo and are of slight build . How much damage could we do???No offer of a refund , accommodation in lieu , change of room or medical expense reimbursement was made . I found the attitude of Scott from Waikiki Beach Rentals and the japanese owner of Unit 1738 to be appalling at best. They insist we were responsible for everything in the unit regardless of age were and tear etc . When an accident does suddenly occur they point to maintenance and the lack of reporting . One needs a crystal ball! My welfare seemed of no concern and they would take zero responsibility.I am still very nervous around glass doors and still have intermittent pain in my hands .Personally I will never book this unit or in fact any unit under the care of Waikiki Beach Rentals .I just would not feel safe or protected .

We arrived at the Ilikai after initially staying in an air BNB at the Royal Aloha for our first two nights which was a disaster so we got a refund and walked to the Ilikai and Patrice could not be more helpful and she got us the most spectacular room (2525).The views were amazing and the two bedroom suite was stunning with two bathrooms and huge balconies.The lounge dining area was huge and had a great kitchen to.Blockout blinds in the bedrooms were great to and housekeeping was excellent to.The pullout sofa bed in the lounge was very comfortable to.Dave's ice cream parlour in the lobby was a winner with the family to.There were five of us and there was plenty of room in the suite.Thanks to the Ilikai for saving our holiday that started as a disaster and thanks to Patrice who looked after us and also gave us a 20% winter discount.The free beach chairs and beach towels were very handy to. We will definitely be back!

The suite has lots of space and amenities. Go downstairs by the pool to see the fireworks on Friday night. Cinnamon's Restaurant had good food and service. The saltwater pool is lovely. I was very impressed with HVP management. Our suite should have had a fully equipped kitchen for 5 people. It was short of wine glasses (only 2 - one glass - one plastic) and cutlery (lots of forks 2 spoons) . When contacted HVP management brought up what we needed - a new set of wine glasses and cutlery set. Unfortunately they could not provide a good set of pots, a modern kettle or comfortable beds. These need upgrading right now then the suite will be great. I changed suites the following week because this suite was booked. In suite 1110 the kitchen is nicely fitted with up to date pots and pans, and comfortable beds. So it will not take much to make Ilikai 526 a great suite.

We extended our vacation another week and tried the ilikai theu Waikiki beach rentals. The person on charge, Scott is terrible with customer relations. I called to tell him we were checking out early due to filth in the unit. Not a call back, not an offer for a different room, just sent one of his guys by to check the room for damages. When I ask the guy for a refund, he told me I need to talk to the owner, by the way, i believe the owner is in Japan. It's been over a week and still no call, no sorry, nothing. We spoke to some locals that were cleaning their unit that rents on vrbo, their comment was, "Good luck with that guy. He knows you're gone and will not be back. He lives in Kauai. " BUYER BEWARE. Pay extra and stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village across the street. Last picture is a list of rules to follow while renting. The best one is, shut off window air units when not in the unit and never turn below 72 degrees. What a joke.

Nothing to really fault about this hotel. Perfect locationPerfect views Large spacious room Reception was superb Great variety of shopsClean hotel and lobby Booked and paid at reception $380 AUD The staff couldn’t do enough and everyone seemed to love their job

Unit 408 rented through Airbnb is filthy, unkempt and smelly. Looks like it has not been cleaned in months! Dirty old stained carpet, pullout bed totally unusable with broken springs and worn out. One closest for clothing is full of old cleaning chemicals and dirty cloths. Kitchen drawers are broken, cupboards and drawers are filthy. No basic kitchen items, 1 wine glass and 1 juice glass, no dish towels or wash cloths. We had to buy glasses, wash cloths and toilet paper etc The deck is full of old rotting bar stools.This place needs a lot of work to be rentable! Owner was rude and would not assist with any issues. Don't waste your holiday budget, stay ANYWHERE else!

Was a great location to visit wakiki beach...and HONNALULU....HAS A FULL kITCHEN AND COMFORTABLE SURROUNDINGS,,,VIEW WAS AMAZING we were able to do road trips from here and felt like I WAS COMING HOME EACH NIGHT...WE could cook and make lunches..great place

We went to Waikiki as my wife was giving a speech at a marketing conference. The Ilikai was convenient to the Hilton Hawaiian Village where she was giving her talk. I went to the beach, surfed Ala Moana (small waves) and enjoyed the sunshine between bouts of light rain. The Illikai was quiet and had shops on premises (expensive compared to the nearby ABC Stores). The restaurant was passable but not spectacular. Breakfasts were good--though we spent most of our breakfasts in the kitchen in our condo. Staff was pleasant and helpful.

We booked a week-long stay in a lovely suite on the 22nd. floor that was comfortable, convenient and recently renovated. It had a great kitchen that helped reduce the number of restaurant visits which have become very expensive since our last visit to this hotel. The room was sunny and bright and had a commanding view of the beach and Hawaiian Village lagoon. The view from the room's lanai of the Friday night fireworks display was breathtaking. It is important to know that many of the apartments are privately owned and may not be as comfortable as this suite was.There is a large patio off the ground level with lush plants and water features where one can sit and enjoy a coffee or ice cream from one of the hotel shops and read or check your email (the wifi throughout the hotel is good).There is entertainment featured down on the patio on certain nights. One night the quality of the performance was particularly good and was comprised of a single musician with a complex array of gear providing recorded tracks to which he sang and played his stratocaster guitar with impressive skill honed over 40 years as a local musician. There are also two performance stages in the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door with live music most evenings but the quality of the musicians had diminished since our previous visits there.The staff throughout the hotel and in the various shops located on the main floor were pleasant and helpful. Our suite and the main floor public areas were kept very clean and tidy. There are two pools and a gym attached to the hotel and the beach is a stone's throw away. Shopping areas are just a 10 min. walk. The Ilikai is the ideal Waikiki location. Recommended.
user_name:
Solfrog
Victoria Capital Regional District, Canada

review_body: Most apartments are privately owned so really really check the photo's before you book, mind you ours did not look to bad from photo's - apartment 729 but was one of the most depressing places I have stayed. The Lobby and Hotel looks lovely, pool area OK at the best, location - found it a bit of a bother to get anyway - you had to get bus or walk about 45 mins to main part of Waikaki. Beach out the front looked nice but needed thongs to get in the water as 2 inches deep and all stones in the water - thought I was in Nice in South of Frances. Everything in the apartment broke everytime we touched anything, bathroom was so old, kitchen appliances included cutlery was ancient and all looked rusty and grotty. Sofa bed constantly creaked all night long, double beds - dont think they were double more like 3/4. I just did not enjoy this hotel and would never go back, mind you would never go back to Hawaii, expensive, over-rated, over priced and far to busy - would stopped on our way back from Whistler so maybe I was spoilt by Canada as this was just a big disappointment. Take my advice and go to Sri Lanka soooo much nicer.

We booked our stay through a 3rd party that rents out the suites that are owned by an owner, not the hotel itself. What a great place to stay!! First of all, the views!! The lanai was perfect to relax, or have your morning coffee, or a glass of wine to end the perfect day, or to watch the Hilton fireworks. The room had everything that a person could need should they decide to do some cooking instead of going out for their meals. Everything that you need is nearby. Lewer and Kalakaua are a 10 to 15 minute walk. The Ala Moana mall and park are a short 5 to 10 minute walk. Foodland is approximately a 15 minute walk. There are two ABC stores two minutes away. We had to contact WBR for something and the next thing you know, someone was at our door. We have already made plans for next year and will be booking through this website without any question. This place makes for the perfect holiday!!!

We stayed in this light bright studio on the 8th floor overlooking the harbour. It is just as the pictures with amazing views. The location is great for everything that Honolulu has to offer. Just wish we could have stayed longer.
user_name:
CAP19572014
Bury St. Edmunds, United Kingdom

review_body: Practically everything about this hotel is excellent. The location is spectacular. The surrounding area is beautiful to walk around. The Ala Moana Mall is 5 minutes walking distance. The ocean is close by if you want to swim in it. The view from the ocean view suite (overlooking the lagoon) is out of this world. Had a front row seat for the Friday night fireworks display which was terrific. The room was large and very nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable. Having access to a full kitchen simplified many of our meals and helped save a lot of $$. There are places nearby to shop for food. The car valet services although a bit pricey was very convenient. Never had to wait more than 2 minutes for the car. All hotel staff whether at the front desk, at the pool or house maintenance were very courteous and efficient. Checking in and out was a breeze. We were never kept waiting for anything more than 2 minutes. The only negative comment I have is that there is not enough chairs at the larger of the 2 pools (we always eventually found a spot within a few minutes). I have been to Waikiki numerous times before with my wife but this past visit to the Ilikai Hotel was the best ever. Even though the cost is somewhat more than other locations, it was well worth it. Can't wait to return.

The Good: The fact that this was a condo meant that there was more room to spread out & some more options for us than a hotel stay would have meant.We were close, but not right in the main shopping/restaurant part of Waikiki.The Bad: What can I say - the room we stayed (823) in could be described as 'jaded' at best. Of the 3 lights for the bedroom & lounge area, one didn't have a bulb, one was so broken I felt unsafe using it & so unplugged it. The mechanism to operate the plug for the bathroom sink was broken. The kitchen sink could only be stopped dripping by standing on one leg & holding your tongue a certain way. The kitchen & bathroom areas need major renovation - e.g. really old cabinetry & fixtures, some old water damage visible with substandard repairs obvious. One electrical plug in the kitchen was so loose it wouldn't hold a plug. The kitchen sink plug barely held water long enough to do very few dishes.Of the other amenities - there were several bathroom towels, but only one beach towel. There were 2 body boards, one of which was broken.A suggestion - the owner/operator could provide a laminated sheet with details about the venue - e.g. where the coin machines are located for the washer/dryer, where to put the garbage out & the fact that the hotel recycles some materials.The condo could also do with a minimum of light blocking curtains. Sound dampening would also help - as it is right above Ala Moana Blvd, which is lit all night & is very busy most of the time.

We stayed for 2 weeks in a private condo on the 16th floor and have no regrets paying the price (given the time of year - December) for everything this hotel had to offer. It was clean, well stocked with crockery and utensils and a well equipped kitchen to be able to prepare some meals. A good size fridge and freezer as well that we could stock so we did not need to keep going to the grocery store. Our view was amazing, in prime position for the Friday evening fireworks and New Year, overlooking the lagoon, beach and our pools. Market Place downstairs was open early and late to purchase groceries, restaurant, which we didn't try and the coffee shop which made the best coffee with the most fun staff you have ever met. It also helped that all tour buses and companies stop here to collect and drop off. We could walk everywhere to Ala Moana Shopping centre, Hilton Hawaiian Village, all restaurants, the main shopping strip and Waikiki beach. I would suggest this over and over again, particularly if you would like to be amongst it all without the hustle and bustle that the city can bring.

We stayed 5 nights at the Ilikai hotel. It was very clean, a good location, but average pool. Our room was great. We had a small kitchenette, sofa, chair, balcony overlooking the Hilton lagoon, luau venue and the ocean. Our room looked to have been remolded in the last few years. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

So close to Ala Moana centre like 5 minutes. 2 minutes away from lagoon great for paddle boarding and laying in the sand. We had 1742 and had great view with seeing the cultural performance was great cause you could see it and hear pretty well. Safe enviroment and ABC store downstairs for any last minute groceries.

Stayed here for 8nights. It’s close enough to Waikiki Beach, main strip and all the restaurants etc. without being right in the middle. Great access to the Hilton Lagoon, a stop on the trolley line and close enough to walk 5minutes to the Ala Moana Centre. The full service kitchen is amazing, you get an oven, stove top and full fridge. The private lanai is perfect for evening sunsets. The only gripe I had, was the bed was quite hard. I would also suggest maybe making the bathing pool on level 2 Adults Only, with later evening hours. Other than that, it was a great stay.

We stayed in a condo (512) and it was great for the four of us (2 kids) it has a king bed and a fold out couch I believe is a queen. nice view of the ocean and fireworks at the Hilton on Friday evening. full kitchen , TV, balcony and a ductless a/c that I really like. the management was great (thanks Paul) he met us there, showed us where to park the car and went to the room with us. (thanks Paul) every thing just perfect.

The view is lovely, the very nice but the smell of marijuana ruins it. For the third morning running someone is smoking dope on a balcony near me, when it is meant to be a non smoking hotel. When I called security this morning all they said is they can't do anything unless they see the person, but basically we can't do anything approach. I can't believe there can't be a more proactive approach than this. Well why not go out on the lobby area and look up? Why not walk the corridors and see if you can smell it through the doors? Still no call back about it. It is ruining my holiday!

This hotel is situated in between Waikiki and the Ala Moana centre in walking distance as well as a 2 minute access to the man made lagoon for swimming. The hotel is ageing a bit but still within standard and the shops at the lobby are great with reasonable pricing and variety. The rooms are spectacular especially if you manage to get high floors. Tip 1: spend 3 hours to find out the amenities, the free blue rays and systems, gym, lagoon, etc. There are so many things to find out that you will lose out if you do not check them out. Tip 2: use bathers elevator if you are soaking wet, everything else just enjoy Waikiki. Mahalo

Was just right for our family. Loved looking out over the Marina each morning.Nobu was easy to deal with,had an early check in which was good as we crashed for a few hours!Couple of things need to be looked at in the room but overall good spot and handy to most things we wanted to do

We stayed here from 27/12/2018 to 06/01/2019. There are some privately owned condos but we stayed in the hotel owned section. Our room was 2338 on the 23rd floor. We had a view of the lagoon and the ocean. We had a great view of the Friday night fireworks from our balcony. The room was clean and tidy and serviced every day. The blackout curtains kept the room dark and allowed us to sleep in if we wanted. we couldn't hear any traffic noise or noise from neighbouring rooms. We had a kitchen with a stove, fridge and microwave which is helpful if you want to cook some of your own meals. Beach towels and chairs are provided free of charge. The hotel is in a great location. you can walk to the lagoon or beach or the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Alternatively if you don't want to walk, the Trolley and the bus stop are out the front. The only downside is the elevators. They are small and very slow. Although there are 5 elevators we always had to wait. I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here over Christmas in an apartment. We picked the Ilikai purely because of its location next to Hilton Hawaiian Village, as we had previously stayed there, so knew the area well.First of, the parking, $30 a day for valet parking, fabulous, heaps cheaper than the Hilton. Only once did we have to wait a while but seemed like everyone was waiting for a car that morning, usually took 5 minutes if that. Was a excellent service. The apartment was smaller than we expected, and with 4 of us in and luggage too it was a tight squeeze. Furniture was scratched, and well used but apartment was clean.Towels were old and thin.Bed comfortable, but needed more pillows.Hallways were recently decorated and had new carpet and this was obvious in comparison to apartment.However location was great, and as there was no where to get a drink at Ilikai after 9.30 we would walk through to Hilton and use their bars.

With a breathtaking ocean view, overlooking the Ala Wie Yacht Harbor, $200 per night for a one bedroom condo.ABC store across the street for convenience and a choice of parking garages (we prefer the Horbron location for price and ease of access).Room numbers running 27 to 37 (1227 to 1247) on each floor offered the best view for us.Great fireworks every Friday at 7:45 PM in our marina area.Aloha.

The place is dilapidated. Pictures and amenities are all deceiving. Reservation was for a 1BD but the room was a studio. The kitchen and drawers smelled really bad. It was dusty, rusty, dirty everywhere. Dishwasher and washing machine were listed when I clicked the room description but there were not in the room so we had to use a public laundry facility. There was 1 working washing machine/dryer for the entire flr $5 each load/dry. The pictures showed there were tiles in the room but there was carpet that were wet/ moist. Towels provided were old. Location is far from Waikiki area. Parking is additional $23 a day. Definitely not worth the $195/night. I would definitely don't recommend this place!

We are a family of 4 and we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite on the 'diamond head view' side of the hotel. Our suite was perfect for a 2 week stay with our 2 kids as it gave us the space and privacy we needed. The 2 bedrooms are huge with lots of storage. We also had 2 bathrooms, both with baths. The kitchen a s dining were great, we even cooked dinner for 6 extra family members one night. Also provided us with a cot for our 2 year old, no extra charge.The facilities at the Ilikai are good, the pool on level 2 is great for young kids as it's very shallow. There is an ABC store, ice cream parlour and coffee shop in the lobby which we went to regularly. Ilikai is a 10 min walk to Ala Mona mall and less than 5 min walk to the Hilton lagoon and Waikiki beach.Staff were very friendly and helpful, even arranging a measuring tape so we could check our son met height restrictions for the Atlantis submarine ride. Lovely cleaning staff too.Really recommend this place and a 2 bed suite for a family holiday.

I have noticed that a lot of buildings in Honolulu are dated, like a throwback to the 70s. So it isn’t unusual that the Ilikai is, too. I stayed in a room here via VRBO. I realize that the room and how it is represented is dependent on the owner of that room. So in all fairness, I am going to review the property as a whole. The Ilikai isn’t hard to miss. It’s pretty monumental. The drive to the front is right off a busy street. They have valet parking at $28 a day. That being said, it offers in/out privileges. We took advantage of this because parking is a headache. The valet service was very quick, and we got to see the same faces quite often. At times the drive was congested, but not at the fault of the Ilikai or their valet parking service. The entrance is very pretty and well taken care of. The lower floors, where the shops are is clean and tastefully decorated. One of our favorite places to try was Cinnamon’s during happy hour. The main hallways where the actual hotel/condo rooms were are clean, somewhat dimly lit, but well taken care of. The walkway toward the marina, Duke’s Lagoon, and other areas is nice to have. Very well taken care of and managed. We didn’t use the fitness facility or pool, but noticed many took advantage of them. The walk to Duke’s Lagoon, the Marina, and Hilton is super short! Really loved the proximity to so many things. We walked to the lagoon to watch a sunset, eat Gilligan’s (shrimp truck), and watch the Hilton fireworks show on a Friday night. Are there other places that appear updated in comparison? Sure. But you’ll also pay for that. Would I stay at the Ilikai again? Absolutely.

We were in Honolulu, Hawaii over the Christmas holiday to visit our son who is stationed at Pearl Harbor. We stayed at the Ilikai in the "Luxury Sunset-Ocean View" room. I'll start with the positives:The lobby and the various Ilikai shops were clean, modern and were decorated distinctively Hawaiian Christmasy. Rob, checked us in and he was pleasant and professional. Upon entering our 22nd floor room we noticed the kitchen and bathroom were newly updated. The bed was very firm. And probably the best thing about the room was the view. Although we expected an unobstructed view of the ocean, our balcony actually had a partial view of the ocean and a full view of the harbor. It turned out to be better than we expected. This hotel is on a main drag for shopping and is a few blocks away from the beach and right in front of the harbor.Now the negatives:This is not by any stretch a luxury suites hotel. This hotel is terribly old and it needs a thorough (and I mean THOROUGH) cleaning! The walls and carpet in the elevator lobby on our floor were filthy. It was hard seeing so many people walking around barefoot (as is custom here) on this nasty carpet. This room is not a suite. The bed, living area and kitchen are all in one room. It's more like a studio condo. When we walked in, the first thing we saw was the newly updated kitchen. But as we went in further, we saw a worn and absolutely filthy carpet with holes. The curtains and headboard were stained and filthy. The sofa and chair were stained and filthy. The sofa tables were scratched. The night tables were dusty and the lamps had cobwebs. It was like after they updated the kitchen and bathroom, they didn't notice there was another part to the room. It was really very disappointing for the money we paid. One other thing, they made an announcement to evacuate the bldg because a fire was reported. We were heading to the stairwell when another guest came out and said they were on the phone with the front desk who said it was a false alarm. My husband called down and was told the same thing so we stayed put. They NEVER made an announcement that it was a false alarm or gave the "all clear"! In fact they never made ANY announcement after that. There were people still coming out of the stairwell 20 minutes later. Misc. Issues:The door to the room does not pressure close all the way. We didn't hear it click when we entered and when we looked back, the door was just slightly cracked. You'll need to push/pull it close to make sure. When we left the room we noticed several other rooms' doors weren't completely closed either. They have Spectrum cable. Unfortunately you can't access most of the regular channels. They are "available for purchase". There are a lot of local programming channels. The rooms have Sony Playstations that they use for DVDs as well. At check-in they give you a DVD rental card but we never used it so I have no idea how it works.The Cafe they have onsite is old and needs a good soap & water scrubbing too, BUT, the food and service was good. It's more like a diner. The concierge is not really a traditional "concierge" for the hotel. They are really sales people for Shell Vacation (Wyndham) timeshare. They will offer you discounts on certain excursions by getting you to go to a 2-hr timeshare presentation. I would suggest you go directly to your chosen excursion's website and try to book it on your own. You will find that the prices are almost identical. Unless you want to attend a timeshare pitch, skip the concierge.We prefer having a full kitchen when we travel so we don't usually mind paying a little extra, but this wasn't worth it to me. If they give it a REALLY, REALLY good cleaning...I might reconsider.

We loved our stay in the Hawaii 5-0 Penthouse suite! There was 6 adults and 3 kids and we never felt tight on space. Things that were ok but could use improvement:The finishes in the condo are nice but showing some wear and tear already and the condo was just renovated in 2017 I believe. I notice everything and the housekeeping company used could do a better job. I noticed certain areas that had been overlooked when it comes to cleaning. The kitchen was stocked ok for items you needed to cook yourself. The one thing it was missing was good pans. It had a few tiny pans only. We had to buy a pan set so we could cook. We left it so hopefully it’s still there for the next person. The other thing, there was a cleaning closet in the condo that was locked. I’m sure that is where there would be a broom and vaccine and cleaning products. We were there 10 nights and had to buy a cheap broom at Walmart and basic cleaning supplies. I’m sure the reason that stuff is not available is so you call and pay for the cleaning company to do a housekeeping while you are there. We did not do that. The lanai is huge but most days it was too hot to enjoy it. Some sort of shade would be nice. It was full sun all day and too hot. The floor burnt your feet. An awning or something would be perfect. But we thought the condo was probably not allowed to have anything like that up there. If you want a tan this lanai is the place to be!The Good!!!!The absolute best location in Waikiki!!!!! Stunning views of the ocean and diamond head. It’s very spacious and well payed out and nicely furnished. You are paying for the view and it is worth it! Lots of space for a large family. This condo had laundry right in the suite! This was amazing. The couch was super comfortable and room for everyone. The outdoor furniture was great. When it wasn’t too hot on the lanai it was the best place to sit and enjoy the views! This condo has the best views of the Friday night fireworks.

We always stay here on our visits to Hawaii!! The luxury sunset view offers great accommodations overlooking the marina. Handy in suite kitchen is a bonus along with great amenities onsite. Make sure you visit Cinnamons restaurant for the best pancakes and guava mai tais. A Hui Hou or till we meet again. Mahalo!

Fantastic 2bedroom apartment great amenities fantastic view we could see performer on top of Hilton Hawaiian village and Lagoon view !very good little shops in lobby for everything you need plus yummy ice cream shop!would definatley stay again!

We're happy with earlier check in. Noone offered to help with our luggages. The reception area has a nice feel with open space, restaurant, convenience store and other boutique shops. The hotel is well located in a quiet area with easy access to Ala Moana beach and Lagoon located next to Sheraton. We were disappointed with our room. We paid for an ocean view room and our room look straight into sheraton and it only has partial view of the ocean on the right corner. It didn't have a bath tub as advertised. We complained with reception staffs, but they didn't really help because we didn't book directly with the hotel. We were offered a 2BR upgrade, but the price difference was too high. The bus shuttle didn't come around often enough. It's a fair walk to the shopping mall and Waikiki beach. Hertz car rental on the lobby is good. Swimming pools were small, but good for family. The hotel is a bit run down. There's no air cond in the lift or the corridor.

Great location. Close to Ala Moana beach, one of the best. Friday fireworks infront of hotel. Safe lagoon for kids.Trolley stops outside for Waikiki. Travel desk very helpful. Car hire across the street with good daily rates.

We chose a room with a view over marina and ocean so we could view the beautiful sunsets from our balcony. It was fabulous. Unobstructed views! We could look down to the restaurant and bar downstairs. The bar had a great cocktail list but the food was so-so. I recommend the hotel next door for the best Maitai ever! Drinks by the pool were lovely there. I would recommend venturing out to try other restaurants. Great kitchen and bathroom facilities in our unit, and comfy bed and lounge area. The pool was lovely and welcoming after all that shopping. Very reasonably priced compared to elsewhere.Nice and close to everything, next to Hilton Hotel for fireworks viewing on Friday nights and choice of restaurants.Catch the bus from across the road to Ala Moana Centre, and the Waikele Premium outlet shops, recommend Black Friday shopping here.We were picked up from the lobby for our trip to Pearl Harbour. No problem.I recommend this accommodation and will definitely choose again for our next holiday to Hawaii.

Recently we spent 10.nights in 2020, great condo with 1 king size bed, and amazing balcony were we spent time relaxing and enjoying the view. The condo had so much supplied, wine and champagne glasses, esky, umbrella. Fantastic. 2 negatives we had a fire alarm go off and after climbing 20 floors, there was no direction from staff. Eventually we were told it was safe to go back in but for the next few hours, we would get pa messages telling us to evacuate and then another one saying it is safe to stay. This did not instill confidence. As we booked thru Waikiki rentals the apartment was not cleaned mid stay, just felt at least sheets and towels and a quick clean would have been great. Would definitely look at staying again

The Ilikai is the perfect place to really enjoy Oahu, perfect location and a superior place to stay. You could anywhere and feel safe. Plenty of great restaurants close by and you could shop till you drop. What ever you want there is something for everyone. This is our second time here and we will be back for a third time.

I flew over for medical reasons , decided to stay overnite and chose Ilikai Lite . I did not expect my room to look as it did and was so overwhelmed with emotions after visiting my doctor, that I sat on the balcony crying and soaking in the beauty of Oahu, which I missed so much ! The room was clean with full kitchen on the 6th floor and loved the balcony! I experienced from other stays in the past, the front desk can be unfriendly if your a local residence, but this stay, Customer Service was awesome! I hope to stay at Ilikai again on my next visit. Thank you for making my stay so memorable!

Enjoyed our stay despite some issues.The bedroom was well appointed, beautifully cleaned and with responsive maintenance. On arrival, and later on, the bell staff were excellent. But some of the Front Desk staff were so morose and sullen, with hostile tendencies, that we checked in with real foreboding. Happily, the other front desk staff were better and even the worst ones improved. The most noticeable issue was the way that several staff in key positions were loathe to take responsibility and initiate actions or make decisions even when much needed such as an incident involving room and corridor smoke. Senior management were either absent or unengaged to the extent that this was like a ship in a storm with no captain, no rudder and a complete loss of direction. These deficiencies need attention to be rectified as does the need for some Front Desk staff to recognize their role in creating positive guest welcoming.

Stayed for ten days at the end of a delightful cruise to Tahiti. Hotel is everything and more than you could ever ask. We stayed on the 25th floor and had an amazing view of sunsets every night. All hotel personnel friendly and absolutely delightful. Celebrating our 30th anniversary and a special birthday, and the hotel sent up a lovely bottle of Prosecco which was very much appreciated! Cleanliness of room each day was excellent and a special thanks to Eden who made sure our stay was wonderful. Love that this hotel is away from the busyness of the beach but easily walkable to everything you need. Restaurants, beach access and transit so easy.

Well my Beloved and i left this one in the hands of our travel agent. WHAT A GYP. This place is so oldish and sad. The pool has been eclipsed by another hotel , leaving patrons in the shade whilst swimming in "sunny Hawaii'. The rooms were adequate. Coffee machine was rusted. You can not get a good cup of tea anywhere. Happy hour was soured by the Barperson 's attitude. She could not be told anything adverse to what she thought was correct. What a Gyp.. Never again. Ps Look hard for the luggage elevator.

We stayed five night at the Illikai and enjoyed our stay there. The location is great as you can walk to lots of restaurants and the beach and the Hilton lagoon is just a short walk away. We rented a room through waikki beach rentals and the process was very easy and the rate was reasonable for Hawaii. Our unit 1133 was clean and overlooked the Marina and had great views of the sunsets each night. The room has a didvider from the living room for some privacy and two full beds which was a plus as there were four adults in our room. There is no maid service each day as I knew this when I booked and that meant washing my towels a couple of times through the week which was fine as I don't like anyone in my room each day if I am not there. My only recommendation to make the room better would be add a few more bath towels and wash cloths and also a room safe. The room also included wifi. The room has been updated from original as this hotel is fifty plus years like many other hotels in the area. We rented a car and used the valet to park with in and out services. I think like $20.00 a day a little pricey to some but in large cities it is not. I liked not searching for a spot and not having to walk to off sight parking garages as it rains off and on in Hawaii. All in all I enjoyed my stay here and if I ever visit again I would stay here.

We stayed on the eighth floor and had a view of the harbor where Giligan's Island was filmed and the ocean. The hotel/condo complex was built in the 60's and has that Brat Pack vibe about it. Even though its older it was ahead of it's time and fits right in with the neighbors. I was surprised by all the amenities: sundries store, hair salon, massage, restaurants, bar, coffee shop and gifts, all in the lobby.

Spent 10 days here in a 2 bedroom bath suite for a family wedding. Our suite was essentially a 2 bedroom condo, with daily housekeeping. Lots of restaurants, a small beach and a free shuttle to get you around. Only on-site parking is valet at $28.00 a day! Free music and dancing in the courtyard on weekends.

Condo 1614 booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals recently renovated a high standard. Two double beds, good aircon, good size balcony with furniture plenty of hangers in wardrobes, close to the laundry for doing washing on the coin operated machines and dryers costs 2.50 a wash takes 30min and 1hr for dryer. Full kitchen with coffee machine, toaster and jug. Huge fridge! Dishwasher also. Has a wall seperator for the bedroom if needed. Plenty of space for us with two large suicases and a couple of small you could fot a family of 4 in here easily. Amazing view to the lagoon and beach and fire works on friday evenings at 7.45pm by the lahoon. The number 23 public bus stops at bus stop just back from ilikai to take you to diamond head 5.50pp one way for 11pp for a full day pass. Trolley a bus with open sides goes from right outside the ilikai and does a loop round all the main tourist spots all day for $2 a ride, there are lots of them so you will only ever wait 10 or 15 minutes for one. Google pink trolley for a time table. For the outlet stores at waikele watch out for the waikele sign and desk outside the front of the ilikai its $5 to get to the bus stop in waikiki which is outside the galleria on royal hawaiian ave then you get the bus to waikele for another $5 each way. You can also catch the trolley in to waikiki if you like for $2 then head to Waikele on the bus. They go various times round every hour in the morning and return 2.30pm, 5pm and 7pm. No aircon on the bus! Check out Harbour Pub bottom of the Ilikai Marina hotel for 6 dollar cocktails and cheap food, $25 will get you two drinks and a pizza. Tropical Tribe just under mac donalds across the road from the ilikai is amazing for acai bowls for brekkie round $12 we ate here most mornings. Check out Foodlands supermarket at Ala Moana mall for make your own salads and much cheaper snacks and alcohol - Catch the trolley down. House without a key is great for cocktails, Dukes is great for lunch and Hula Grill for lovely views above Dukes and a bit quieter. California Pizza is delish at Ala Moana mall level 3. Ilikai is down a quieter side of town away from the hustle bustle of waikiki but still plenty round to do and close to the lagoon for swimming 5 minute walk and great for kids as its shallow swimming. Would return for sure!

What a great modern condo. We stayed here for 2 weeks in October 2018. This is a clean, spacious apartment in a sensational area. The hotel is close to restaurants/bars/tourist attractions & Ala Moana Shopping Center. We were on the beach with a 5 minute walk and buses and trolleys leave from the front of the hotel. The kitchen is well set up, the A/C worked well and the bed is large and comfortable. Access is through a passcode and clear instructions were emailed to us. Absolutely NO complaints and highly recommended.

Hiking up Diamond Head, watching the surfers on the North Shore ride monster waves, picking pineapples in a field, experiencing emotions at Pearl Harbor and a luau. After you return to your room, you relax on your lanai, retelling your adventure for the day and plan for tomorrow. Easy walk to great food and Mai Tai's.

The Ilikai is one of the oldest places in Honolulu. Built in the 60's, today it mostly comprises individually owned condos, half of which have ocean views. Because of its age, and because the condos are often vacant--especially in the fall and late spring,-- It is by far the most affordable oceanfront "hotel" in Honolulu. But to really get a good price, do not book through the website. Look on Craig for the advertisements of individual owners who are advertising their places, either by themselves or through agents. During fall and late spring, you should be able to get an ocean view condo for $100/night, all taxes included. Even less if you can accept a city/mountain view.Now these places will vary in terms of how well they are furnished, so ask for photos and make sure the owner commits to a specific room for which you have photos. And always pay by credit card. The hotel has excellent amenities: a nice, clean deep pool, a very good reasonably priced restaurant, etc. Location is superb. Parking may seem difficult but you can park in an indoor lot on the 3rd floor of the Discovery Bay Center which is across the street. Price is $15 for 24 hours, and you enter the lot from the street BEHIND the Center i.e. the first block east of, and parallel to, Ala Moana.When I was picked up from the airport, the Uber driver told me that he liked the Ilikai a lot, because it was the one waterfront hotel that Hawaiians can afford. After spending two weeks there, I agree with his assessment, and would certainly return there. On the other hand, if you're one of those who has no problem paying $300-400 per night, then the Ilikai is not for you. And at the other beachfront hotels, pay you will.One more point: I walked all the way down the beach, and swam in many segments. The beach nearest the lagoon--NOT Waikiki Beach--is, by my reckoning , both the best and least crowded of them all. Take a good snorkel and paddle out to the close by reef. Turtles can be occasionally seen, and if you look carefully at the north most part of the reef, right where the reef meets the rocky bottom, you'll see a moray eel in its cave.

Recently stayed at the Ilikai with family renting 3 other rooms. Rooms were well equipped, great location with access to the pool, lagoon and the beach. Great facilities near by such as shopping centre, cafes and restaurants.
user_name:
Pmh1971
New York City, New York

review_body: Though I've known about Ilikai for a long time, this is the first time we have stayed here. We booked another resort but changed it to Ilikai and wow are we happy we did! Yes, many resorts in Waikiki are aged but this hotel is very well maintained. Our family stayed in various suite types but all are well appointed with modern conveniences. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Housekeeping is impeccable. The valet attendants and bellmen are friendly and professional. And Mark at the front desk was just amazing! And you MUST have the guava pancakes at Cinnamon's restaurant!!

The hotel was nice but partially remodeled. $28 a day to park your vehicle, not including valet tip. I didn't have a car and they still tried to charge me. Another $386 if your an Interval International member for taxes at 12% since it's not included. The hotel side is remodeled, The Shell Vacation side not as nice. It would have been better beach side and not skyscraper side. NO Hawaiian flower lei upon arrival :(

Pros: We got a condo that fit 5 of us comfortably. It was clean and decent. They have a fully equipped full size kitchen. Lots of kitchen essentials. Lots of towels. Close to the beaches, restaurants, and 15 minutes walk to Waikiki strip. We didn’t realize their was many malls nearby. One was about a 15 min walk and another mall was about 15 min walk from that mall. Their so MANY shopping centers along Waikiki. So pack light bring your walking shoes! Gas prices wasn’t as expensive as I thought. $3.89 per gallon but Costco had it for $3.15! Cons: Street noise and toiletries is limited. They did have two extra small rolls of toilet papers but one got saturated by a water leakage. We had to buy lotion, shampoo and conditioner from a nearby Walmart (.7 miles). ABC, gift shops is tripled the prices. Conclusion: We will definitely stay again!

We had a great week stay with our family. The location is excellent- quick walk to the lagoon or to Ala Moana shopping center. Beautiful views from the lanai of the beach, fireworks and Hilton luau. The new 2nd floor pool is a fabulous addition and made for our favourite place to spend the day with a baby. The pool attendants were friendly and attentive. The 16th floor was undergoing renovation- new wallpaper but it wasn’t a concern and the workers were very courteous. The two negatives would be the long wait for the elevators at all times of the day. Very busy! The on-site restaurant- cinnamons was disappointing as it is very overpriced. Grab an açai bowl from the adjacent cafe or walk down the street to Cheeseburger Waikiki for a $5.99 breakfast. Much better deal! All in all, great stay at the Ilikai.

The hotel itself was nice besides a few roaches in the bathroom. Shame on this hotel being misleading in their billing and services offered. I booked directly through the hotel thinking that my fees & taxes were included since it said it was on my confirmation receipt that I paid $52.36 as a fee (not taxes that was additional). Upon arrival, I was charged an additional $25. per day ($50 more) for activity fees. Also, I had called to check to make sure they had a shuttle before I booked & was told “yes, it run every 15 minutes”. We went downstairs to catch the shuttle and to our surprise was greeted with “you would be better off to pay to use the trolley, cab, or Uber” because the shuttle only went to their sister hotels and only run every hour or so. It did not start my day off in the greatest mood. So, no, I wouldn’t book at this hotel again. There are mannnnny top notch luxury hotels that would have been the same price and hopefully been upfront about what they were charging and offered at their hotel. I’ll also add that I think an area closer towards diamond head would have a better beach area. The beach was a good hike from Ilikai; and ,the beach itself was beautiful but the sand was like gravel and had really sharp rocks.

We enjoyed our luxury suite. The ocean front view has the perfect view of the sunset. It was beautiful. All the staff we encountered during our stay were great! Very friendly and eager to help. The attached restaurant “Cinnamons” was pretty good. We enjoyed lunch and cocktails and numerous occasions. Our house keeper was absolutely fabulous!! The only downside to our room was the bed. The bed was hard and the pillows were way too soft. We didn’t sleep the best, but that could have something to do with the 6 hour time difference we had.

We booked this hotel room through Expedia as it was a great deal. Different to the condo apartments for holiday rental. One night accommodation at the actual hotel part of the Ilikai. Such wonderful service upon checking in. We were able to get in to our room well ahead of the usual checkin time. The reception staff were lovely. Room big enough for 3 adults. Very comfortable and clean. Will definitely book a hotel room over a beach rental now. Better value and more updated room. Thanks Ilikai for making our last night in Waikiki so great.

You can access everything at Waikiki or Ala Moana from here. Great kitchen in room, but struggled to find food to cook nearby! Eventually found Target at Ala Moana centre, highly recommend this as we could cook breakfast and the odd dinner in our room. Very quiet at night, great sleeps for the week we stayed, would happily recommend this to others.

Just checked out of the Ilikai after a 4 night stay. We had a great room with ocean and Marina views. Large rooms with full kitchen so was great to have breakfast in our room to save some money. The staff were friendly and a special thanks to our Housekeeper Francis and Wayne (I think) at concierge for booking our transfers and helping with directions etc. Loved the location as it is a bit further away from the hustle and bustle but still close enough to walk. Also close to the Ala Moana shopping centre. Only thing I would recommend would be having a few more umbrellas at the pool. Got very hot with no shade.

Hawaiian hospitality lives here at Ilikai. I spent a week beachside at the hotel which is simple sweet and beautiful but what really makes this property special is the employees. The staff the front desk the Bellman the waiters the waitresses and especially the housekeepers so welcoming and so concerned with making you comfortable that it's better than being at home thank you so much for welcoming me to your lovely hotel .

After reading so many positive reviews on Facebook about Illikai we booked 12 wonderful nights in condo 1629 it was exactly how it appeared on the website upon opening the front door it was pure bliss seeing the ocean everything was newly renovated and clean the beds were so comfortable had everything you need in the condo huge fridge microwave and stove TV all brand new sitting everyday having a cup to tea watching the surfers and parasailing was so enjoyable it was hard having to leave this condo and would definitely stay here again without hesitation

After three weeks in Hawaii and our second visit to Honolulu I can’t recommend this hotel highly enough. We stayed in a hotel on the Waikiki side when we first arrived and hated the hustle and noise of that side of town. At Ilikai you are only a 10 mins walk to the heart of Waikiki but secluded enough that you are sheltered from the noise. We had a beach view on the 25th floor which we loved. The room has a kitchen which in Honolulu is a huge bonus. This means you are not spending $50 on breakfast before you begin your day and you have the option of either lunch or dinner in your room or in our case on the balcony. We had a stove with four hot plates, saucepans, full size fridge, microwave as well as a coffee machine. Interestingly enough, no kettle but we made do by boiling our water for tea in a saucepan.The bed was very comfortable, bathroom clean and functional and wifi excellent. Would highly recommend as an excellent place to base yourself in Honolulu.

Our privately owned condo was excellent. The Cinnamon restaurant on site was good value and good food.Friday evenings hula dancing and hawaiian singing in the garden was a real highlight.Daves ice-cream made in Honolulu was the best , favourite flavours Green Tea and blueberry cheesecake .

The Iliad is located in a great spot. If you want some privacy, it’s at the end of “hotel row,” and the views are amazing! Staff are very pleasant and helpful. A very quick walk to everything and our 2bdrm suite was spacious. I’m

I was lucky to stay in a Studio Apartment via Shell Vacation Club. It was a nice large room with a king bed, pull out sleep sofa, full kitchen and large balcony that over looked the City at night. The location at the end of Ala Moana and beginning of Kalakaua made it super easy to get between town and Waikiki. There were a few local places to eat and near Ala Moana and their new Foodland Market made it easy to grab groceries and cook in the Apartment. The valet staff and Shell Vacation Staff were super nice and made it easy to check in and out. I would gladly stay here again. it's also one of the older hotels in Waikiki and so the room was nice and quite! The room was updated and the whole building seems to be recently remodeled yet still retains a lot of the Old Hawaiian charm.

Our week long stay at Waikiki Ilikai Hotel was next to the beach, a protected and well maintained lagoon, and close to restaurants and shopping. It's a short walk to Ala Moana shopping mall. Our room was very comfortable, king bed and full kitchen. Our non smoking room was fresh and clean. The AC unit was a little loud so we had to turn up the TV volume a bit. They had fireworks over the ocean on the Friday night we were there. Beautiful against the dark background sky.

Stayed here for five nights in May and everything was perfect. The accommodation was nicely decorated and clean, staff were friendly and helpful and the amenities were excellent. I spent more time at the beach than the pool as it was an easy walk which take a couple of minutes. Location was excellent close to public transport, close to the mall and many restaurants and cafes.

Very nice hotel. Rooms were good. Nice to have your own kitchen with appliances. Hotel is a 15 min walk from waikiki beach and if you go 15 min the other way you get to Ala moana center, a fantastic mall with a huge food court! Nice pools but we prefer the beach. Didn't try the gym unfortunately. Very nice service in the lobby and nice to have a small mart in the hotel. Definately recommend this hotel!

This is our first trip to Honolulu but it won't be our last. We booked into the Ilikai not really knowing what we were going to get. It has been a lovely surprise! We had two apartments due to availability. Room no 306 was our first room with marina and beach views just lovely. Room 521 has city views a bit noisy from the street but certainly doable. We have thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. 7 minute walk to Ala Moana amazing shopping centre. 10 minute walk to Waikiki main shopping streets. Buses available at our door step. All tour buses also picked up at our driveway. All in all a great location, loved it all. Great having apartment facilities to prepare some meals ourselves. Admittedly the apartments are a little dated but certainly doable and very comfortable.highly recommend.

Biggest let down. I know it's on the cheaper side but common...they could get better furniture from the salvation army store! The hotel is from the 60s and so is this room. Couldnt even sit on the couch with out falling backwards...dont get me started on the kitchen. Omg. It stinks...the oven looks older than my granny who has passed away years ago....furniture...well look at the photos...nothing like on the website. The only thing it has going for it is the view. Spectacular of the marina...and ocean. We have stayed now on both sides (lagoon) and both as good as each other. Marina has more shade on balcony and gorgeous sun set (if your home for it) but do yourself a favour and either pay more or stay away from room 1206.

Ilikai is nice but it's not worth the money! Common spaces are not as sparking kleen as they should be. The restaurants are expensive, pools are not the best, but the location is perfect! It is Hawaii which is insanely expensive. There are so many other places in the big world where one can get more bang for his buck! I visited Hawaii several times; it is nice, weather is beautiful, the ocean is blue, sand is golden and yes it is being built, but wherever you turn around the boogyman is there to get you. You can still have fun in Waikiki, but you must know that it will cost you!

The building exterior is quite antiquated; however, the open spaciousness of the lobby is really nice. One studio room 500 sq ft is quite roomy for 4 adults. Through Shell Vacation Club, the studio comes with fully equipped kitchen, stove, fridge and microwave. For beach access you will need to walk to other nearby hotel. Valet parking is $28/day; however, you may also park at the marina parking lot nearby. Overall, it is decently priced!

2 weeks in this establishment and loved every moment of it!!! Everyone is friendly, rooms are quiet, the fireworks show from the lanai on Friday’s is amazing, everything is nearby, cinnamons is amazing... I can’t say enough about this place. We will be back many many more times! Mahalo Ilikai!!!

Great location. Extremely comfortable beds. Easy access to beach and walking distance to shopping and attractions. Limited food within complex in terms of eating options. Friendly staffing. Great room size and bathrooms and mini kitchen area well worth using as very pricey to eat/drink out.

Absolutely the best place to stay in hawaii. Would love to buy our unit but don’t have a million bucks spare. Close to everything, clean fabulous view and pools. Bus stops right out front. ABCGrocery stores all around

Aside from waiting a long time to valet park the car, check in went pretty quickly. They offer beach or pool towels, beach chairs, and a card for free DVD rentals. Our room was on the second floor, and it was spacious and comfortable. There were no ice machines on that floor so we had to go to the front desk to get ice. There are a variety of shops and restaurants downstairs, which are very convenient. The main pool was crowded so we went to the second floor pool, which was beautiful. In the afternoon the shade of the surrounding buildings blocks the sun from this pool, which I enjoyed, but if you want sun, then go in the morning or mid day.In all, we were happy with the hotel.

We stayed one night in one of the hotel suites on the 25th floor and seven nights in an AirBNB rental on the 6th floor. The hotel units were all renovated and lovely. The staff were nice. However, once we switched over to the rental unit the front desk staff were not as helpful even though a hurricane warning was issued. They made it clear that rental units guests would basically have to fend for themselves should a hurricane hit. Aside from that, the hotel was well situated and the ice cream shop on main floor and other little shops were a nice touch. The pool was a basic but well maintained although it was always busy. The fountains in the main courtyard and the musicians that played on occasion created a lovely atmosphere. The hotel was mainly an older crowd (60+) or young families. It was right beside the Hilton Village so there was lots of dining and retail options.

Hard to find something bad about this place. Of course quality comes w/ a price. Just to be picky valet service was always very busy, we haven’t waited to long anyway. The view from the 23th floor was amazing, even on the mountain side of the building

Great ground floor restaurant The building structurally for a building 55 years old is fantastic no cracks in structure and the way it has been built in a Y shape would certainly make it very safe in an earthquake Location to main shpping centres and ease of travel by foot is great

This apartment is ideally situated. It is very recently renovated completely. Kitchen has excellent appliances large and efficient stove,microwave and fridge with freezer. The decor is excellent and standard throughout. New tiled floor extending out to the lanai. Beds are firm and comfortable. Bathroom is quite large considering this is a bedroom apartment though it will sleep 5 persons. Large wardrobes (2) heaps of hangers and 5 drawer unit too. The view is magnificent faces west so sunsets are spectacular.The Ilikai itself is very convenient to the Ala Moana shopping centre and slightly beyond that to Target or Walmart. Easily walk-able but buses stop right outside anyway. 2 pools to suit sun or shade! Good eating at Cinnamans on the ground floor. Great entertainment Friday and Sunday in the courtyard. Beach in sight and easily accessed. I have no negatives at all.

My wife and I had planned to spend 10 nights here, but only lasted 1 night before giving up and going elsewhere.
