The bed was unforgiving and hard, the AC rattled all night no matter what speed or temperature we set it at, the TV didn’t work and our “ocean view” consisted mostly of the hotel next door with the view well off to the right. The staff tried to be helpful and initially moved us to another room but the view wasn’t much better and the beds are all the same. They really can’t justify what they’re charging and should NOT be calling those rooms full ocean view when they’re partial at best.

The 2 bedroom suite was definitely a home away from home. It's spacious, clean, great kitchenette and service is excellent. We would be staying here again & would recommend it to you friends and family. The location is great as well because its only a 10 - 15 mins to Al Moana Shopping Mall!

Every time we go to Waikiki, we automatically choose the Ilikai! We have been there several times and have never had a bad experience there! All the units we've had were very clean and the views whether city or ocean were great. They have added an ice cream parlor in the lobby which on our last trip we visited frequently. The lanai is nice to have on the ocean side with the view of water. The harbor can be a little unsightly if you are in a lower room, but we've always had rooms closer to the top. We also discovered a small library in the lobby where you can take and exchange reading materials. The location is great as it's right next to cheap parking and you can easily walk to the Ala Moana shopping mall, or just walk down to the beach off their ramp way-you don't even have to cross they street. It's an ideal location for a romantic getaway as well as with family. They have two pools, but we find we'd rather be at the ocean. They appear clean and seem to always be in use. We will most certainly return to the Ilikai on our next trip!

Pretty much the same as last time, I keep thinking I should find a new place to stay but dollar for dollar, this place really is great value for money. It was built at a time when walls really were thicker so it is very soundproof. I slept well because it was so quiet, I loved my marina view room, always something to see and felt that this place really is good value for money. There's a supermarket in the foyer, lots of places to eat both within the hotel and in the near area, the Ala Moana Centre is an easy 10 minute stroll away, The Bus is literally on the doorstep, I'll be back again.

We recently spent 4 nights at Ilikai in Honolulu. While the facility has been updated with modern deco and new appliances service by the front desk staff has been disappointing.I left my cherished Kindle reading device with unread books in the room and contacted the hotel within 24 hours of checking out. They transferred me to the house keeping but I was told to contact them next morning. When I contacted them next day and gave them my room number they seemed to have a Kindle device that matched the description. I was told to pay the UPS charge but I was happy to get it back and gave them my credit card number etc. When I got the package back I was extremely disappointed by them sending me a wrong Kindle device. This to me reflects the Ilikai’s disrespect for the customers and lack of attention to detail that makes a hotel great.This hotel is mediocre in my opinion. I can think of a better place to stay in Honolulu for the price I payed. Will not go back there.
user_name:
Yinkmom
New York City, New York

review_body: We love the Ilikai and have stayed in 4 different private Condo's over the past 4 years while holidaying from Oz.It is a bit old and the elevators a bit warm and there is no safe ??? "WTF" but if you are a Princess or Pansy then you can go next door to the Hilton.Never had any TV or internet problems,and wouldn't stay anywhere else.You do get the occasional grubby smoker on some balconies but they are hard to control.

The hotel is neat and nice. Our room was clean and the front desk was very accommodating. The laundry though was coin operated and cost $5 a wash whether it was a small load or not. The hotel was close to shops and beach

My husband and I arrived July 22 at 2 am Hawaii time. Our flight from Vancouver was delayed by almost 5 hours due to dust storms in Las Vegas. We got in to our room which was all ready and waiting ( Room 1530). This was booked through VRBO. The rental process was easy. It was dark but the sound of the ocean was relaxing. We stayed for 2 weeks. The lanai was large and had chairs and a table where we often sat watching the Hilton Luau or ate our meals there. Because of its position in the building it receives only some sun in the morning. This kept it nice for sitting on. Only recommendation I would have for the lanai is a chaise lounge chair. There were lots of good beach equipment including chairs, boogie boards, sand toys and towels. It was easy to access the ocean. The lagoon is great for kids but we preferred the ocean. The bed is very firm and comfortable and we slept well. There was lots of storage for our things. The tv was an adequate size and the cable channel selection was very good. The kitchen was well stocked with gadgets. The coffee maker broke but was quickly replaced however the 10 cup was replaced with a 5 cup maker which was ok for us but might be too small for a bigger group. The shower was a good size and nicely tiled. Would have liked to have seen a rain shower. For the age and size of the building there was always adequate hot water. We have stayed at many Ilikai rooms before and this one we always were happy to return from our day. Air conditioner placement made it a little warm in sleeping area and chilly in the seating area. I would recommend this unit and would definitely returnAloha and Mahalo to the owners and manager.

Ilikai hotel is one of the original high-rise buildings in Oahu, Waikiki.The Ilikai is also well known, outside of Honolulu travelers and residents, for appearing prominently in the opening credits of the long running TV series Hawaii Five-O.Many of the rooms has been acquired by private investors and can be found on Airbnb.The good part is that they are remodeled and kept in a good shape, like the one I have rented on the 20th floor.The property has excellent views and next to the Hawaiian Village.I would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys a good stay on the island.

I have stayed here twice now and wouldnt go anywhere else purely because of its price point and location.We stay in the apartments which you book through Waikiki beach rentals .Each unit has its own kitchen and large balcony with sea lagoon or marina or city views.The hotel is celebrating its 50th Anniversary and to be honest it is looking a little dated and furnishings in lobby area are very old and couches a bit dirty even..This is something management should address promptly.It still is in a great location at the quieter end if Waikiki and near the Hilton lagoon but not too near the Hilton Hawaii Village thank goodness as that complex with all the shops ,people and towers in my opinion is hideously busy and large.The Illikai has a calmer ambience and the Hotel now has 2 pools both of which are clean and lovely with surrounding vegetation perfectly manicured.It is within walking distance to central Waikiki and 7 minutes walk away from Ala Moana shopping centre.It really is still a lovely place to stay if in busy beautiful Waikiki.

Rooms were like a mini suite, clean, good size, nice veranda for ocean view and fantastic firework show on Friday nights! Great trolley access for all locations including huge mall. They were actually filming a segment of Hawaii Five-O on the beach in front of the hotel.

This hotel was so close to everything, and yet so peaceful. Loved the open lobby and common areas. Everything was exactly as advertised and would definitely stay there again if we get to return to Honolulu.

Close enough to the action and just far enough away not to be noisy. Ilikai is part hotel and part privately owned suites. We stayed in a suite on the 19th floor which had a great view of the marina. Fully appointed kitchen in the suite, although you will need to pick up the basics like salt and pepper, butter, olive oil etc early in your trip. There is a store at the hotel that sells goods at a premium and an ABC convenience store nearby as well. The hotel offers shared washing facilities on the floor for $2.50 per load (The machines take only Qtrs) which was very handy, given we had packed light. If you rent a car you can valet it at the hotel and get unlimited access to you car for around $28USD per day and there is ample parking at the Marina right behind the hotel for $1USD per hourThere is a bus stop right at the front of the hotel which we used when we didn't have the rental car to get into Waikiki and back. It is very simple and several buses go past including 8, 19 and 20. Buses are air conditioned which was great. You can buy single trip tickets or day passes both from the driver. Must have exact change though. $2.75USD adult single or $5.50USD day pass. Kids half price.We were in Suite 1908 and were very happy with the quality of the beds. The curtains were block out and we had a nice breeze in the evenings. The apartment is air conditioned, has an ironing board, kettle, blender and toaster. The bathroom is large and clean.

We stayed in ilikai condo 807 which has been covered in previous reviews, thin non-block out curtains so no sleep ins. What really annoyed me was you pay a large cleaning fee yet the unit was dirty; sand in shower, spilled food on floor, dirty glasses and cutlery, shower curtain was disgusting. There are holes in the wall around power outlets so I wouldn’t recommend staying in 807 with children. The unit is over furnished which leaves little room for baggagePlease note this is not the Motel wing or lobby areas. The condo was booked through Waikiki beach rentals.

The Hotel rooms only occupy some of the apartments in the building, others are privately managed. We booked directly with an owner via Homeaway (VRBO). We stayed in apartment 1016. I also considered 824 which was very similar so will comment on them both. Firstly, the property generally is quite nice. The pool is fantastic - the main pool is very deep which is very unusual in Waikiki. There is also a separate wading pool good for toddlers or adults who just want to laze rather than swim. The grounds are nice, good shops coffee shop, ok restaurant etc. The location is ok in terms of beach and lagoon access. Pretty similar to most of the Hilton Village ( other than the Rainbow Tower which is right on the beach). Our apartment at 1016 is one of the view with a solid wall between the bedroom and the living area. The views from this apartment are really amazing. At first I thought that level 10 would be too low but in fact it was perfect - I felt comfortable on the deck ( not to high) and it was great to get out of the lift early rather than having to stop at lots of stops on the way up and down. My only issue with our apartment was that it had old style air conditioning which was very loud in the living area - our kids were sleeping in the living area and it was too loud to leave on at night - therefore we woke hot most nights and had to open the doors ( which was loud also!). Our property manager was great and gave us a large fan. We considered apartment 824 which is very similar in that its renovated with a solid wall - however this apartment has a heat pump rather than old aircon - I now wish I had chosen that apartment because of the aircon. I was worried that the 8th floor might have been too low but I dont think so now. We have teenage boys that dont like sharing a sofa bed so we bought an amazing self inflating king single full height blow up bed for one of them from Walmart on the first day (US$64). This was amazing - both boys thought it was very comfortable and we didn't need to add extra air during the whole 10 days. This was excellent because it kept our accommodation costs very low - meaning the 4 of us could fit comfortably in the one bedroom apartment rather than paying almost double for a two bedroom ( we paid US$320 per night for 1016 and 824 was US$260 per night). It was great having a full kitchen with fridge freezer. This building is a very cost effective option if you want an apartment. I think we had the best value ocean view in Waikiki - but the downside is that its a bit of a walk ( or a $2 bus ride, $10 uber) into the hub of Waikiki ( restaurants and shops ), although its an easy walk to Ala Moana mall.

As other reviewers have noted, this hotel is great for a family or travelers who want to do their own cooking. Suites come equipped with a full kitchen, which was newly renovated and spacious. Bed was very comfortable and property was clean. If you are staying for Friday night, try to get a room that faces the fireworks by the Hilton. If you are unsure, just call concierge before booking. This hotel is not the newest, so it does not have a beautiful modern lobby like some others in the area. Also, there can be a few minute wait on occassion for the elevators. But if that is not a hang up for you, this hotel is a good value, and is mere steps from the lagoon and the beach.The convenience market in the hotel was a lifesaver, and though the prices are high because you in Hawaii, they are not higher than other ABC or other convenience stores in the area.
user_name:
BenjaminMB
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were a family of 5 (three kids) and a 2-bedroom suite. The suite was nicely renovated, had a view to the beach and generally worked well.The hotel is close to a family friendly beach, lots of restaurants and close to the primary shopping street.All-in-all a good choice....it would havs been nice with a better equipped fitness room.

Stayed in unit 1927 for 4 nights, including July 4. Booked through hawaiivacationpropertiesllc.com. Unit was as advertised. Two beds and sofabed, all double sized, were plenty for family of 4 (parents and two teen kids). Sofabed is firm foam, not a soft springy mess. Kitchen was small but solidly equipped for a short vacation stay. The lanai has a nice view of the setting Sun over the marina and a great view of 4th of July fireworks. The unit was a little tight for us, and the Ilikai is like a big hotel, so it was not a “home away from home” experience, but a fine home base while spending the days out and about. The Ilikai is a good resort with the usual amenities, in the heart of Waikiki. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

We paid extra for the Mountain View and our “view” was extremely obstructed by tall buildings. Then they offered an ocean view. We turned it down because we didn’t think it was worth 30 bucks extra per night to have an obstructed ocean view too. We could have saved that extra money on the Mountain View as well. The hotel was clean but their was a huge hole in the carpet which I feel should’ve been replaced before renting that room to us for what we paid. The manager was nice enough to send a bottle of wine for our anniversary, but that’s all they offered and we aren’t big wine drinkers. The food at cinnamon’s was subpar. However, being next to the Hilton allowed us to have better food over there at their restaurant. The beach access was a little bit of a walk and we were unaware that we had access to a shaded outdoor pool on the second floor. We thought the fully exposed to the sun pool on the first floor was the only one. The refrigerator was not on when we arrived which meant we had to wait hours for our waters and soda to cool. The air also had not been turned on. Despite the flaws, overall we had a good stay here and would consider them again because the location was almost perfectly centered around all we wanted to do while there.

Wonderful hotel, great location, extremely helpful staff. Richelle went out of her way to bring me my blouse that I left behind when I moved to another part of the island! Loved the room and the balcony to enjoy the sea view!

Very good location and excellent location. Hotel extremely clean. Staff very helpful. Restaurant only fair. However, overall, I really enjoyed the stay and would stay at the hotel again when I return to Oahu.

We spent 7 nights at this nice hotel and suites close to Waikiki beach, Honolulu Oahu. We got a studio at the 24 th floor with ocean view! Double bed and sofa as extra bed. Balcony for romantic evenings. Great kitchen fully equipped! Beach towels. Good connections with shuttle bus outside the hotel. Calm and quiet during the night. Concierge in the lobby. Washing machine in the hallway. Entertainment in the evening. Small pool as the only negative experience. Highly recommended for family’s and couples.

My husband and I booked a condo through Waikiki Rentals. This is a privately owned apartment in a large hotel apartment complex. There are also apartments available directly through the Ilikai Hotel website.We stayed in a room facing the lagoon on the 17th floor.1733.The view is beautiful and if you are staying in Waikiki you really do need to have a view of the sea.The apartment was not very well cleaned. The shower and bathroom were pretty gungy. There was broccoli and rice in the dish washer and some of the glassware, crockery and cutlery were dirty. I think this is a shame as I am sure the owners would not appreciate the fact that the cleaners are not doing their job efficiently.There were plenty of kitchen utensils, crockery, cutlery, glassware but I do feel that there should be a quantity of dishwasher powder and laundry detergent as having to buy these for a short stay is most frustrating and a waste of money.The bed was very comfortable and the room was relatively quiet.The bus stop is outside the door although we did struggle to work out which buses were available for the general public to ride as many of them are private tours only.We did not use the pool as it was always very crowded. For the size of the complex we considered the pool to be much too small.We went to the free hula show and even though it rained and the show had to be cut short I consider it to be the best hula show we saw in Hawaii. Don't miss it if you are there on the night it is on.

I'm a huge fan of this property. They really make you feel the ALOHA when you stay here. Wes, the Manager, is the BEST! Love the spacious studio room (and the kitchen!), the modern decor, the grounds (with convenient shops, coffee, and eateries), the restaurant downstairs has an awesome menu, and the Friday night fireworks at your balcony are the cherry on top! It's also a skip away to the Modern hotel, as their pool and outdoor area is around the corner. Loved my last two stays there and will definitely be back! I also always highly recommend it to my friends and family. Thank you Ilikai!

Highly recommended the Ilikai. Great location only a few steps from famous Waikiki Beach. Clean and comfortable condo’s with full kitchen. Amazing views of the beach and marina from the Lani. Beautiful meals at Cinnamons Restaurant at the Ilikai especially their pancakes

Spent 8 days at the Ilikai in June with a group of Adults celebrating several significant birthdays. There was 26 of us spread out over the Hotel in various rooms and floors. Each couple had their own room. Our room was on the 16th floor overlooking the Marina. Such a beautiful view. Cannot complain at all about the room. Spacious and clean and very quiet - never heard anyone else on either side of us or in the hallways. Big bonus having a full kitchen if you want to eat in your room. We just brought our cereal from the shop downstairs.Just a short stroll to the beach or you can swim in the pool which is out the back of the hotel - lovely pool too.10 minute walk one way to Alamoana Shopping Mall or 10 minutes the other way to the main strip with all the shops, restaurants and nightlife. Maccas across the road and ABC convenience stores everywhere. Would definitely stay here again.Also love the swimmers lift. This is around the corner from the main lobby of elevators and is especially for when you get out of the pool or come back from the beach. No one uses it much and you never have to wait for it - loved it.Coming back again and bringing the kids next time.

This is a beautiful hotel. The back side of the hotel looks out over the marina. The hotel is not on the beach. If you want to be on the beach then this is not the right place for you. If you visit here it is worth having breakfast at the Cinnamon’s restaurant. It is excellent.

Highly recommend! Our room was awesome. Bed is comfy. Service was great! Self parking is in walking distance but they also valet. We didn’t get a chance to eat at the restaurant downstairs but the hotel is in walking distance of other places to eat. Would definitely stay here again! :)

The Ilikai Marina Hotel in Waikiki is a beautiful Hotel. Modern and clean. The views of the harbour and beaches are outstanding. Walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and central to all bus lines that stop outside the hotel. Beautiful lagoon and beaches right outside and great views of the sunsets and Friday Night fireworks. The Cinamon Bar and Restaurant downstairs overlooking the harbour has great food and the drink prices are so cheap. The Rib Eye with Oyster Sauce was amazing. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again

There is not much that i can say about this Hotel that is negative.Great Location next to the Rainbow Hilton with the best beach in Waikiki. We were a party of six and our three bedroom unit was everthing we expected. It is close to Ali Moana shopping centre which made it easy to buy in suppliers for our week long stay. Staff at Cinnomon's restaurant were very friendly. View was great. Would I stay again? A very definite YES!

Our third visit to this place & we love it!. Booked a sunset view suite again for 5 nights & scored the 25th floor. Great views & amenities as always. Handy to have kitchen facilities in your room & laundry also available to use on each floor. This place is close to everything & for the shoppers Ala moana is in easy walking distance. The onsite restaurant Cinnamons is hands down the best place for breakfast...you have to try the guava chiffon pancakes. Looking forward to our next stay hopefully not too far away..

Amazing stay at these beautiful suites.Everything us girls needed and the view of the beach was such a highlight.Fully equipped and clean.Customer Service and communication for the entire stay was set at such a high bar.THANKYOU I highly recommend.

We had 3 rooms booked over 7 nights, a last minute switch from another hotel in the area. The rooms are very spacious, a nice perk after spending a day at the beach or doing other activities. The location is really good - Waikiki beach is within walking distance (although you really should take a ride up to the north side of the island to experience a true world class type beach) as well as shopping including the mall. For picky kid eaters, McDs and IHOP are right across the street. Some really good Asian restaurants provide a great alternative also. Overall this place was well worth it.

One room suite right near Marina and around the corner from Waikiki beach. Avoid the street-front rooms if you don't want traffic noise. Good restaurant and shops right there. Valet parking took good care of us too.

I chose this Hotel to be close to the Honolulu Triathlon event location, and this was perfect. Had a great view over the Marina to the park area where my race was to start/finish. Hotel looks as tho it needs a bit of a birthday as was a bit dowdy, but I will still go back there again.Great location. Great staff.

We stayed 8 nights on the 25th floor. The convenience is about the only reason I’m giving this a 3/5 rating. Pros:The 2 bedroom suite works well for 5. The walk to the beach isn’t badThe housekeeping staff was friendly Cons:It was difficult to maintain an even temperature throughout the whole suite. There are wall air conditioning units in each of the bedrooms and one in the main living area. Our teenage son slept on the pullout but the temperature never seemed very cool while the bedrooms were chilly. We had a 12”circle where the carpet was somehow worn through even though it seemed the suite wasn’t that outdated. The TV in the master suite wouldn’t work the last 2 days. The kitchen was small for 5. Our sheets and pillowcases sometimes didn’t looked properly washed. Being on the corner of Ala Moana there would be a lot of traffic noise (they can’t really help that) If we come back to Waikīkī we will be finding other accommodations I’m afraid.

We loved our stay at the Ilikai. There are so many great things to say about this place. Retro laid back vibes at quieter end of beachAmazing views across Hilton Waikiki lagoon to beach2 pools, both amazing 10 min easy walk to Ala Moana for multiple shopping trips!15 min walk to Wholefoods market (amazing!)Bus stop right out front to take you to central Waikiki for as low as $2 (0r you can walk 15 min)Alamo car hire just across the roadGreat coffee shop downstairs serving Quality flat whitesThe only negatives I would say is that there is a hum of noise from cars, luau nights etc but this is everywhere. You aren’t right in the middle of the action but after a few days we preferred it more laid back. The beach is a bit rockier our front, suggest walking further down to avoid this. Would definately stay again as it’s such good value for money with this location & view.

I had a convention at the Hilton next door but had my kids with me so we wanted a condo. I had stayed at the Ilikai hotel before years ago. I went on the website and found they had remodeled. We booked a deluxe remodeled ocean Front two bed room suite. Wow, it was great. Very large, kitchen and appliances, two bed, two full bath, two HUGE ocean front balconies. They even placed plastic netting so the two year old could not get crazy on the balcony!!! the staff were really friendly and accomodating. Great location and there is a Alamo car rental across the street that is way cheaper than the Hertz in the hotel! Also, if you have a car, you can park across the street in the parking structure for $15/night!!

We stayed in a bedsitter apartment. Separate to the hotel rooms, this was privately owned, so each room slightly different in quality and furniture. Ours was clean and tidy and had everything we needed except laundry. There is a laundry on the floor but costs a bit. We faced the marina, so no traffic noise. Entertainment most nights downstairs in the restaurant area, finishing by nine o'clock, fireworks just next door at the lagoon. Ala Moana shopping centre is a ten minute walk away, but grocery shopping was better at Don Quixote. Walmart is through the back of Ala Moana and one block away. Beach and swimming just out the back of the apartments past the lagoon. Buses out the front will take you everywhere. Don't worry about the spruiker ones, the public bus will take you much cheaper to the aquarium, Diamond Head, Pearl Harbour. Look up "TheBus" for details. Would come back again.

If the Ilikai Hotel, first opened in 1964, were a woman you’d say she had had Botox, but was still showing signs of age and sag. Once the premium venue in west Waikiki, this is still a nice place to stay but it has it drawbacks. The internet connection is a sad joke. Every day I spent time (often a lot of time reconnecting when the techie I had up to the room to get started in the first place assured me repeatedly that I was now set for the week. Some joke). While the rooms have a full kitchen, there is no electric jug, and the coffee supplied is weak. There is no salt and pepper and none can be supplied. The adult pool is small – adequate but not exciting. There is a bar/ restaurant, but it operates separately and the shop (a copy of an ABC store without the same charm) has a limited range of goods; no fresh meat or fish and no vegetables which makes self-catering a bit of a challenge. All that said, the rooms are spacious, and the staff are gracious, and if you get off on history, then this is the place to be. But like so much of Waikiki, the product is tired; it is catering for mass consumption, and it is certainly not cheap.

The location for the Ilikai is ideal. It is within walking distance of shopping and the beach.The rooms are like condos with a full refrigerator. The Kitchen was stocked witheating utensils, pots, pans and dishes. The courtyard provided entertainment like Hawaiian singers, and hula dancers on Friday and Saturday night. At 10:00 on Friday night, there was a fireworks display over the beach. They also have an outdoor pool or you can go to the beach which is close by. I would recommend this place.
user_name:
Sabine S
Indian Trail, North Carolina

review_body: Situated in a perfect area of honolulu next to the royal hawaiian village and inbetween the ala moana shopping centre and downtown waikiki. Pleasant rooms with great views from all apartments. Convenience store, and other shops including restaurant are all in the foyer and are easily accessible.

Location. Location. Location. From our room at the Ilikai we could sit on our deck and watch the Friday night lagoon fireworks with a pizza and drink in our hands. Also could see the Hilton's rooftop luau without attending in person. Two pools, one was wheelchair accessible. Room was clean and lobby beautiful. Staff very kind and valet parking on site was expensive ($28/day) but offered in/out privileges. Easy to walk to Waikiki or over to Ala Moana Park or Shopping. Right on the marina and many dining options within one block. Highly recommend.

We have visited Honolulu 4 times and have stayed elsewhere one one of those visits, however, the charm and central location of the Ilikai beats the others hands down for this family. Fully furnished condos have everything a family needs, with a pool and situated right next to the lagoon and Hilton fireworks on Friday nights makes this an ideal place to stay. You can also watch the beautiful hula dancers and Hawaiian singers every Friday night in the courtyard. We always book through ocean front rentals to get the best deals.

all I can say is DO NOT STAY IN THIS CONDO. I liked the location of the Ilikai and would possibly stay again but not on the city side and I'd do a more detailed research into the condo I rented before booking.I did NOT book thru the Ilikai directly, we booked our Condo thru Waikiki Beach Rentals over half of the Ilikai has PRIVATE Condos that are booked thru rental agencies.Firstly it was so noisy we had to pretty much yell at each other when we spoke as all you can hear is city/traffic noise, it was so bad 24hrs a day and night. there is no relief from it. No one slept for 8 nights. Also there was no block out curtain, just a flimsy sheer curtain so all the city lights came in and when the sun rose in the morning it was blinding! The whole place was lit up like a Christmas Tree. The condo has a full size fridge, microwave and oven but this one had no cooking utensils! No tongs, no spatula and no baking tray. How were we supposed to cook anything?? Also it was all digital and no instructions on how to use the oven.The TV worked but over 1/2 of the channels weren't available so looking at the guide became frustrating because everything you wanted to watch would say "not available please contact to add channel" There were 3 of us staying in the condo (2 double beds) but only 2 beach towels were provided even though the place sleeps 4. The beds were so old and hard they were uncomforable and falling apart the mattress protector had holes and rips in it. UGH, we just hated the place and can't say anything nice about that condo at all.The Air Conditioner was so noisy it rattled all the time, between that and the city noise my poor ears are still ringing and i've been home for 4 days!The owner of this condo is getting good money for it and should be forced to do some upgrades before renting it again. It's pretty basic to have a blockout curtain in a room these days, no one needs to be woken at 5am by blaring sunlight (the sun comes up right in front of this condo) while on vacation.

This is a great old hotel with a modern luxurious feel. It was comfortable spacious and convenient. there are a number of shops and boutiques in its foyer. There is also has a café in its outdoor foyer area that serves real European (Melbourne) style coffee. Not that muck that is usually served. This hotel is historic because it was the first high rise one built on Waikiki strip and it also appears in the original Hawaii 5-O TV series with Jack Lord standing up on top of it. I loved staying in this place.

We booked this through waikikibeachrentals. Our third visit to the Ilikai and we have loved rooms 1706, 822. However we stayed in room 1838 this trip and the room badly needs updating, it has a musky smell and the furniture is very grubby and smelly, definitely would not stay in that room again. We really love the location, bus stop right outside, easy walk to Waikiki along the beach front.The courtyard is lovely with free entertainment a couple of nights a week. We love the keypad entry to the rooms no worries about losing key/keycards. Ilikai also has no resort fees which is why we first stayed there after years of staying at the Waikiki Circle. It also has larger rooms then the Circle, with a full kitchen.

We have stayed at the Ilikai - 5 times - 2 times at the hotel and 3 times private condos. The location is perfect for us it is a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana and 20 minutes to Waikiki. It is a pick up spot for tours - Waikele outlets.  On arrival at reception we arrived just before 3pm to be told that check in was more towards 4pm!!! must admit not very friendly receptionist staff - didnt seem to care. Checked our bags had lunch and then was able to check in. We had room 2425 mountain view which i think we stayed in before it was renovated.The city view is nice and at night the lights are pretty and the side balcony has a small view to the ocean. Some traffic noise bur does not effect sleep . We like the hotel as being older it is solid and you never hear the neighbours above or below. Nice and quiet. The unit itself was nicely decorated the carpet showing some wear. However it was NO BLOCKOUT curtains in one room that really ruined our stay. The main room had a blind not block out you could see the lights at night. The sun was so bright that even with an eye mask you where awake at 5am-6am - it is nice to sleep in on holidays.. The room was hot as well even with air con on. So we had to take it in turns to get a good night sleep .The accommodation is expensive $600 aud a night so this was disappointing. Overall we found Hawaii really expensive and have decided to have a break from our favourite place .No doubt we will return in a few yearsMahalo

Do NOT stay in room 1717 at condo rental. This condo is very dated, dirty and dangerous. We checked in and the "clean" sheets for pullout bed were dirty and had stains on them. The dishes in the cupboard were also dirty so we didn’t even dare use them. One of the lights on nightstand by lanai has a electrical short in it also. The bathroom smells like urine and the dishes in the kitchen were clearly not washed and the coffee pot had mold in it. The carpet was so old and musty that it flared up my allergies and I am still struggling with a lingering cough. Also the air conditioner barely works. We went down to let rental place know of all the issues and thought they would maybe give us an upgraded room but no they said they would take care of everything but they didn't.

This was our second visit to the IIikai this time with family we stayed in condo 2039 others in 2033 and 1318 all the units were great with fantastic views 1318 is a 2 bed unit ideal if you have kids its really 2 units made into one its got lots of room and a spa bath we love the IIikai its at the quiet end of town but plenty transport options into town or a 10 minute walk along the beach front The Hilton lagoon is close as is the beach there are eateries every where and a store in the foyer for all your food and drinks For us it represents value for money and we will book again for sure

Stayed 6 nights at Illikai Hotel and Luxury Suites on the 22nd floor with a ocean view. We were very well pleased with the quality of the room and were grateful for the kitchenette which was put to good use for breakfast daily. Hotel is close to the beach (5 minute walk) and they give beach towels and beach chairs. Hotel is also close to restaurants, shops, and the marina thus we were able to make a quick walk to the outdoor store if needed. We also rented a car for the week and utilized the parking over at Red Lobster for $23 a day. Parking at the hotel is $28 daily. Friday night there are fireworks at the Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon which can easily be seen through your balcony if you have the ocean view suite thus it was a fantastic way to end our vacation. We had a wonderful stay at the Illikai and look forward to returning

We stayed in suite 2008 as part of an AirBNB and could not have been more pleased. Even though this is a privately owned condo, we used the parking valets at the hotel and they were so accommodating. $28 / per 24 hours. Yes, there is a less expensive place to park on the other side of the property near the marina, but it was so nice to have someone park our car, grab our bags without the hassle. The suite itself was awesome! So clean, nicely decorated and so comfortable. The deck - actually more like a lanai, looked over the harbor. We had about a 180 degree view of the most gorgeous sunsets I've ever witnessed. The resort has a good restaurant where we had breakfast every morning before setting out for the day. They also had quite a few stores, small grocery store, ice cream shop and some live music. It was a perfect location for our stay Waikiki and I would definitely stay again. Loved it!
user_name:
Kim H
Mint Hill, North Carolina

review_body: We are award winning Hoteliers from Rotorua Nz. We arrived early around 1000 in the morning, Chester on reception was just fabulous. He was not only able to check us in early but gave us an upgrade to an 'Ocean View Room'. We had a wonderful 7 night stay, our room was clean, comfortable and well equipped. The bed was very comfortable and the lifts fast, walking distance from Alamoana, also great Cafes and a neat little mini-mart onsite. The other special thing about the Ilikai is it's age and history, which made it all the more special.If we are lucky enough to make it back to Hawaii one day, it will definately return to the Ilikai.
user_name:
Mike and Annema... G
Rotorua, New Zealand

review_body: I visited Maui for a week with 3 of my children and then went to Honolulu. I was on my own as my husband was unable to make it. I have five nights at the Ilikai and my second visit was as good as my first. I was upgraded to an ocean view room, which was super. During our first visit in January, I was ill the entire time and unable to do much, and as a result didn't pay too much attention to the inclusions in the resort fee. While almost every hotel now charges a resort fee, the Ilikai fee of $25/day is good value. It includes admission to Bishop Museum (which is $24.95/adult), access to a shuttle service, towels and more. I also neglected to mention in my first review that our lovely housekeeper took it upon herself to wash the glasses I had left in the sink as I was ill. I did call Guest Services back and let them know about her extraordinary service. This visit I was unable to get the wifi to work (my fault) or the TV. Both were resolved in very short order. Now I need an excuse to go back!

Great apartments and if you select the right rooms overlooking the ocean will catch the fireworks on every Friday night at the Hawaiian Hilton Village resort. Rooms are spacious and clean with great annuities. Washing machines on each floor and the lift system us fantastic. 3 mins max wait for us so far. Very well located close to shopping centres and access to trolley/ bus services. Also has car hire/ tour and snorkeling options plus more. Price was very good compared to resorts. Coffee / ice cream and local shops all at base if hotel. Restaurants within walking distance or 2 dollar ride on the pink trolley if you prefer.

Property location - excellent, Staff - warm, friendly, helpful and fun, View - absolutely amazing ocean, Room - clean, comfortable, spacious with windows, windows and windows large usable lanai for relaxing and enjoying the awesome view, nice pool area and easy access with short walk to sandy Waikiki beach. Great for couples, families, business or pleasure will return for sure. Restaurant, coffee shop and lots of little interesting shops.

Traveled with father, flew in from San Francisco, rental car, and spent most of the time outside of Waikiki for business.Location - At the west tip of Waikiki, barely at the edge. If you want to be in central Waikiki this isn't it. ABC Superette was across the street which made buying basics easy. Also a McDonalds if you need one. We wanted a place away from the noise, so naturally facing the Marina should shelter us from the tourist buses, garbage trucks etc. For the most part, we were right, except for two things - 1. There is a lot of gathering of people on the street, chatting, and also partying on docked boats Friday night. 2. It wouldn't be so much of a problem except the window and balcony doors don't seal well, or at all. Noise comes in as if the windows were open. That noise also includes garbage trucks at 4am, and the occasional tour bus taking a shortcut. The Duck boat tour also launches nearby where they have to use full throttle to get back onto land. Very loud. Parking - Parking is really easy, within the same building. Cost is $23 a day, and you can prepay the entire stay the first time you exit the parking garage. Note that there are steps going to the elevator, at least in our experience. We didn't see a 100% ADA access to the residence part of the building. Elevators are fast, so there isn't much waiting time.Amenities - This condo has almost everything you could ever need. In the kitchen, everything plus some basics like cooking oil, salt, pepper, sugar. In the closets, baby crib, stroller, sunblock, bug repellent spray, extra towels, iron/board, you name it. Kitchen feels completely new. WIFI gets about 6mbps down and 2mbps up, like DSL speeds. Quality - If you're reading down this far, you'll be interested to know that a lot of the floor tiles are loose in the unit. I think the owner must've been scammed with a bad tile contractor, or there is an issue with the subflooring of the building. The flooring in the bathroom is really bad, with all most all of the grout missing, and the tiles clicking as you walk over them. There is a downslope towards the shower which is either bc the tile contractor didn't level out the floor first, or something is still sinking in that corner. Didn't really affect the stay, but was unsettling at times. My dad complained everyday about it. Also again, the windows and balcony door does not seal completely. Shower pressure/flow was pretty low. Meanwhile the bathroom sink didn't have any water saver devices.Furnishings - lots of furniture, very useful and placed effectively. Bed was decently comfortable, but the head board is loose and not mounted securely to anything. Long chair in living room was comfortable and where I spend most of my time. There is one small chair for the tiny balcony, which in the end we didn't use much. Conclusion - Would we stay here again to resolve our noise sensitivity - No. Do we think its a good value - definitely. I'd definitely recommend this unit for a family of 4 with a tight budget.

Located on the 22nd floor with sunset and marina views. Comfortable and spacious. Worked really well for us with a kitchen where we could have breakfast and some dinners out on our spacious lanai.all staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Situated close to Ala Moana Centre with a bus stop outside to take you there or walk it. Easy but longer walk to Waikiki centre but again bus right outside to take you there.Uber and Lift also great way to get around.Only down side to this property is the pool and outside area. Needs to be modernised and made softer. However the beautiful lagoon outside the Hilton is a stones throw away and a fabulous place to swim and work on your tan. From here you can walk down the beach to Waikiki.We would stay here again.

We stayed at the Ilikai for a week with our two middle school daughters. We stayed in one of the suites with a partial ocean view and had a great balcony to sit on in the mornings and evenings, in fact we ate many of our meals on the balcony. Room was great and the hotel amenities were very nice. Would stay here again and recommend for any one looking for a place to stay during their visit. Very central location to many shops and restaurants as well as the beach.

Second time staying here. Love it. Choose a refurbish unit for sure, they're are plenty with lots of pictures . Small but quiet, secure and close to everything you need. Restaurant, store, grocery, bus stop, etc

Stayed at the hotel for six nights and our suite was upgraded to one on the 22nd floor. Excellent position and quiet. The best thing about the hotel is its location. It is right on seashore and you can walk to Waikiki beach in 5 minutes. Major shopping outlets and restaurant within walking distance. The hotel provides towels and chairs to take to the beach.It is a large complex with several shops, a bar and dining.Now, We have travelled extensively and stayed in hotels all over the world but this is the first hotel we’ve ever stayed in where you cannot move your chair by the pool to face the sun. If you moved it just slightly let alone turn it round or move it to a different location, the officious pool attendant was there telling you to put it back exactly as it was. She claimed it was a safety rule. We claim this is rubbish. It was actually dangerous being in the sun with it beating down on the top of you head.
user_name:
John B
Balsall Common, United Kingdom

review_body: We had wanted to book a room at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for the week but it was filled for the first few days. Our agent booked us at the Ilikai in a great suite with a beautiful view. When we did move to the Hilton a couple days later we wished we had stayed in the Ilikai! The Hilton did not provide the room we expected and were very disappointed. Would go back to the Ilikai the next time.

This hotel is a great hotel to stay at for having a suit to prepare meals in to keep the costs down!! The rooms are very clean and the hotel staff are friendly. The one huge downfall to this hotel is the pool hours. The swimming pool is only open till 7:30pm, which is not helpful after being out all day and having kids want to swim and cool down! The lagoon is closed early as well and for people with small children the ocean is not the best to go into swim at night. I would highly recommend this hotel I just wish the pool hours were longer.

Our room was spacious, clean & comfortable. So close to beach and lagoons. Cinnamon's had the best Poke' bowl around. Staff was friendly. Hope to be back soon! We enjoyed Hilton's Friday night fireworks from our balcony.

Stayed for a week in dec with friends who rented an apartment there. First time up that end and didn't mind it. You can walk to ala Moana shops. Walk to beach near Hilton , staff ok there. Cinnamons is great , it's a long walk to dukes statue area though. So if u plan going downtown every night , I'd jump on a bus.

We always stay here when we have a stop over in Honolulu...Uber from the airport is approx $22. The hotel is decent, however can get very busy. Try to ask for an ocean view and a higher floor. The lagoon is close to the hotel and pretty neat for kids to swim in. Every friday night there’s an amazing fireworks display ...which is great for kids.The rooms are a decent size and relatively modern.

Stayed in condo 1528 for two weeks in February. Beautiful recently renovated condo. Great kitchen with nice new appliances, tile floors, comfortable beds and nice patio furniture exactly as pictured on the booking site. This condo did not have any shortage of storage space, big closet and so much counter space in the bathroom. Of all the units we saw this bathroom was the nicest! Was super easy to secure a late checkout.The Ilikai is in a great location, easy to walk everywhere! The hotel is showing it’s age though and the pool is pretty plain. We were there with a party of 13 and they wouldn’t allow us to move chairs so we could sit together.Booked this unit through Waikiki Beach Rentals - make sure you do your research, it appears they filter reviews on their website (mine and two others in our group were not posted).

We wanted to stay in the Wakiki area but wanted a kitchen unit - didn't want to eat out for every meal. Nice kitchen units are hard to find in this area so we were delighted to find this hotel. We were not disappointed. We rented a 2 bedroom and stayed here for a week, on the 25th floor (wall to wall windows). The room was very clean and modern with a great view of the city especially at night (there were two balconies so two different views). The kitchen was well equipped with all the appliances you'll need (except a kettle!). Cleaning staff were very friendly. Small grocery store available in the lobby as well as across the street. Be aware though that if you have a car, there is valet parking only at I believe $28/day.This hotel is at the western end of Wakiki Beach so if you're big on the evening night life and like crowds you might want to be closer to the centre. The location was good for us (very near the Alo Moana Mall) and the lagoon is just a few minutes walk. This lagoon is a great place for kids - it's like a large swimming pool! Of course the beach is next door as well. The one complaint we had was with the hotel's shuttle service. This is a free minibus that does a circle route around Wakiki. Only used this once but was not impressed. Had to wait about 45 min for pickup, seems like no set schedule, no one at the hotel could tell us much about it, driver would not win any congeniality awards. This service could use some improvement. Other that our stay at the Ilikai was wonderful. Would stay here again.

Waikiki can be crowded anytime of the year, but we like to get a bit of a city fix for restaurants and shopping, as well as walking and pool time. That is why the Ilikai Hotel is a excellent location. The Rodeo Drive of Waikiki is close by as well as the largest shopping center, the Ala Moana.The hotel rooms are a good fit for 2 persons. Nicely decorated, full kitchen (no dishwasher), large lanai. Two pools for sunbathing and a decent restaurant on the ground floor. When making a reservation, do it directly with the hotel so you have a better chance to get an ocean view. Try for an upper floor between 10 & 25. The views are very memorable.

This was a terrific hotel. Fantastic location within easy walking distance to alomoana shopping, waikiki itself,shops, eating etc. Was quiet enough with fantastic views from the room. Short walk down to the lagoon to see the fireworks every friday. Staff were lovely and helpful and nothing was a bother. The rooms were really spacious and comfortable, more than adequate for our family of four.

Beautiful views! However, the room was not clean! One of the beds had sand and hair on the sheets. The kitchen was not clean and neither was the bathroom. I had to buy my own cleaning supplies to clean the room. There was a vacuum in the room but the filter was dirty! The sliding door also needs repair as the lock is falling off and the door doesn’t close easily. The cocking is coming off in the shower. Initial discussion with the manager (Scott Merlo) was not very pleasant to say the least. This is our 9th visit here and unfortunately the last two visits have not been up to par.

This is the second time we have stayed here and can’t recommend in more. Close enough to Waikiki, right next door to the Hilton lagoon. We stay on the side that over looks the pool and the lagoon but have had friends that stay on the Marina side. We Book direct with owners and in the self contained units so no need to go out to breakfast when you can cook it yourself and eat on the balcony. The restaurant downstairs is reasonably priced but plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. On Friday nights there is fireworks which you can see from your room if you are facing the lagoon. There are too pools with one that has a 8 foot end.

Awesome Place, conveniently located, close to everything. Just a 10-15 minute or so walk from all the shopping and night life. Super close to the big shopping centre. Awesome view for the Friday night fireworks. Highly recommend!

As a regular visitor to Hawaii now, I like to stay here. It’s a little distance away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. But not too far. It’s an older style building but has all the amenities one needs. Pools, gym, laundry, restaurants near by and a short walk to Ala Moana shopping centre. Not as pricey as your luxury hotels but I just need comfort and a bit more room than just a hotel room when I stay in Waikiki. A self contained unit and it does the job.

Everything about this accommodation was brilliant. I travelled with my elderly mother and Aunty (both in their 70s), with the 3 of staying in room 1820 (Hawaiian Vacation Properties). It was perfect - it did help that the 3 of us are very tidy. We had 2 x doubles and one fold out sofa bed, with enough space to move around comfortably. The balcony and view really made our mornings and late afternoons special. We could wake to a beautiful view and enjoy afternoon/evening drinks and nibbles with a beautiful view. And from our balcony, we could even enjoy the Luau Show that was happening at the Hilton on two occasions.The service from the team at Hawaiian Vacation Properties was prompt and very friendly always. We received an early check-in and very helpful service with our air conditioning.There's also a small supermarket downstairs for necessary items, including grog. We did our grocery shopping at Target at Ala Moana shopping centre - cheaper and bigger range of items.Super easy walk to all things (shops, restaurants, beach etc). And for the Aussies that love their coffee, there's a great cafe downstairs (Cafe Aroma) that knows how to make a good cappuccino (although they use cocoa powder on the top and not proper chocolate).Thank you. We'll definitely stay their again when we return.Kate

We stayed here for a week through Ilikai condo rental units! It was an absolutely beautiful place to stay. We had an ocean view condo on the 20th floor with a view of the Lagoon. The condo has a full beautifully appointed kitchen with everything you need for eating inThe resort itself has everything you need. A nice pool (2 pools) to lounge around. But going down and sitting around the Lagoon is wonderful, the water is beautiful and not to deep at all. The restaurants here are also very good for all meals. There are boutiques and shops in the hotel as well. It is across the street from an ABC store..that offers food and groceries for your stay! Walking distance for nearby restaurants, bus stops and for a walk along Waikiki Beach (about a 15 minute walk to get to the end). The best part was the price for renting a unit. It was 1/2 the price per night from other Hotels along Waikiki Beach. Highly recommend a stay here...we will most definitely stay at the same place again!

The rooms are the best thing about this place. Ours was large with a king bed, a pullout sofa and a kitchen. The bathroom was large enough but nothing special. The pullout was not that comfortable but the bed was fine. The pool is okay and there's a short walk to the lagoon which was very nice. There are plenty of restaurants and resorts and stores all around the hotel and you can walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center and the beach. All in all, Ilikai may not be the greatest hotel we've ever stayed at, but it was just fine and it was really nice having the kitchen.
user_name:
Rick C
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: We stayed in condo 2124, on the 21st floor. Fantastic views, good sized condo, nice and clean and 2 double beds. The location is great, staff are friendly. We were really disappointed the restaurant on the top had closed though, that’s a real shame!We didn’t use any of the bars or eatery’s. The little shop is great though and has pretty much everything you could need.

Overall, this is a great hotel and in an excellent location for Waikiki beach and shopping. First of all, it is a 50 year old hotel. The first high-rise hotel on the beach from what I understand. It's still very clean and nice but you do expect to see Jerry Lewis or Frank Sinatra to walk around the corner. The style, floor plan and color scheme is definiely from that era. If you don't require modern styling, then you're OK. I thought it gave the place some charm.Our room was very good, spacious with good amenities. The wi-fi is EXCELLENT and TV was OK. Each room has it's own wi-fi modem! I would like a bigger screen and there are a lot of channels on the menu that you don't get (that bugs me). AC is from a window unit but it kept the place very cool with minimal noise. It did wake me up one time at night with a loud buzz but that was only once in a week's time. The beds were very comfortable with great pillows. The bathroom was small compared to other resorts but has a good shower. The kitchen was a good size but didn't have a dishwasher. That's unusual from other resorts. The location is perfect. It's close to a lot of shopping. It's a main transportation center so you can catch everything from a cab, trolley to city bus right outside. It shares a public lagoon with the Hilton and right after that is the Waikiki beach. Every Friday night there are fireworks from the Lagoon. They're actually done by the Hilton but you can easily see it from the patio of the hotel.There are two pools. One pool for swimming with plenty of chairs. The other is a shallow 4" to 1 1/2". They provide towels and there is an attendant at each but no lifeguard.Here's the only thing that bugged me about it. There are several areas that just need to be repainted and updated. The entryway is nice but has two large bronze dolphins in the fountain. They're pretty aged and don't spray water. The passage to the pool, and eventually the beach, is just dreary. There is no decor, it needs paint and just updating. It's just a long blank hall. It's clean and everything, it's just a dreary place compared to most places and you pass through it a lot. There are lots of door jams that are dented and need to be repainted, at least on the 3rd floor. Our balcony had rusted rails and had stains. Our door had a cut-off block of wood to attach the door lock. Compared to the hotels around it, it just needs some sprucing up and a color and amenities update overall.

My husband and I stayed for a week and had an amazing time! The property itself is beautiful, especially the open air reception area. The front desk staff were very friendly and the room cleaners were just as friendly, everyday. Our room was the Sunset Ocean View Jr Suite and it had a full kitchen and a wall of sliding glass that opened up to an amazing view of the marina and the ocean. Beautiful sunsets on our balcony every evening. Cinnamon’s restaurant had terrific food and the servers were delightful every time. The lagoon is just a quick walk and then we walked Waikiki beach all the way to the other end. Very entertaining and super fun! We were so pleased with the Ilikai that we are recommending it to everyone. Thank you for such a wonderful stay!!

We stayed in room 1502. This room was just like the photos. It had everything we needed for our week stay. Very clean & tidy. Only 10min walk to Waikiki Bay & 10min walk Aka Moana Shopping Centre. All the buses & tour stop outside the Ilikai so it's a great location. Having a marina & beach view was great bonus.

We were in a penthouse - and had a great time. Clean, perfectly appointed. Oddly enough, the penthouse balconies are limited - big enough to stand on, but not eat or really socialize ... but everything else was wonderful. One unexpected advantage is every tour or transportation has a stop at the Ilikai. Great way to start or end the day. Nice bar in the lobby (not particularly recommended for dinner, but great as a bar). The Ilikai is a great choice for a few days in Waikiki.

My family and I stayed 4 nights February 2018. We stayed on the 22 floor. In the suites I expected so much more I read that the upper floors were renovated ,well there clean . All the furniture is old . Carpets full of dirty spots and dingy that’s all I can say. Even in the Spa the carpet was old . There’s nothing modern about this hotel . When I read a article outside the elevator that stated it was 50 years old now I understand . Their trying to keep it together.

We loved the Ilikai Hotel and Luxury Suites. Well appointed suites with everything that could possible need to have a wonderful vacation. The cleaning staff does and excellent job in keeping everything nice ands clean. In a great neighbourhood much quieter then Waikiki beach/ downtown Honolulu which we like. The hotel staff very knowledgeable. Beautiful walkway to enjoy sunrise to sunset along the beach. Best of all no humidity or bugs!!!

We just got back from a group holiday. All of us stayed here and loved it. Location was great and also the iconic status of the building! (Hawaii 5.0)Clean and had everything we needed and views from each room. Laundry on each floor.Staff were very friendly and hotel maids were very efficient!

We had a great holiday in Honolulu and enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai, in condo 1627 with absolqutely fantastic views. We were facing the sea and had the sun in the afternoon. I believe this is the best side as morning sun would be too hot.This particular condo is looking very tired, the kitchen is not well equipped: very blunt knifes, bad saucepans and frying pans, etc. Making a cup of tea and warming food in the microwave was the extent of the possibilities.The bathroom was just about OK and not overly clean. The king size bed was very confortable, but as we were 3, one person slept on the sofa bed, which badly need replacing; the springs of the mattress were sticking out everywhere. We had to wash the bedding of the sofa bed as it hadn’t been done from the previous occupants and did not smell too fresh.The noise from the lanai was quite strong, but the view made it not so important. The position of the hotel cannot be bettered, it is within walking distance of shops, restaurants, beach, etc. As for the service, the hawaïen people are mostly extremely friendly and ready to help whatever you ask. I would have given service 5 star if it hadn’t been for one unhelpful receptionist when I needed to print our boarding passes.Despite the problems of the condo, we will probably return, but choose another condo.

25 mins walking or bus to waikiki beach but still close to Hilton resort and Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon. They have a free show on Friday and can see firework on Friday from Hilton. Valet parking is expensive but you can park on street behind of hotel ($1/hour) or Marina Parking Garage ($7 / 10 hours or $20 / 24 hours).

I was booked at the Ilikai Hotel for a work trip on the Mountain view side. I decided to upgrade to the Ocean view side. I'm glad I did. It was beautiful! The views from the 23rd floor are amazing, especially when there is a lightening storm. The hotel is very nice with a restaurant, shopping and great staff. The staff was very friendly and helpful when needed. Parking is by valet which was $28 a night. Convenient but pricey when you add the tip everyday. Being that the hotel sits on the beach, there is a nice boardwalk that takes you along the back of all the hotels. Walking along the street was safe and easy as well and was within walking distance to Duke's. There is many restaurants and shopping within walking distance, as well as lots of sightseeing tours.My stay was for 4 nights. The housekeeping staff did an okay job. It was clean but not detailed. Having a kitchenette was very nice to be able to eat in the room before going to work in the morning. I would stay here again.

We loved out time here with friends, great spot for families also. Right on the lagoon & the fireworks can be viewed from the balcony. walking distance to shops, surf & all restaurants. Quiet location even though its so close to everything.

My wife and I have stayed at the Ilikai multiple times over the past few years. Each time we have stayed in a hotel-run suite rather than a rental by owner or by an agency. If you arrive at Honolulu Airport, as long as you don’t have enormously large bags, you can catch a city bus that will stop almost directly in front of the hotel. The staff in the lobby are helpful and friendly. During this visit, we had a room on one of the very upper floors (the 25th floor I believe) with a view of the ocean, the Hilton Hawaiian Village property, and Waikiki in the distance. You have convenient access to Waikiki should you want it, without being in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. You also have convenient access to the Ala Moana Center, which now has a full-service supermarket, and a fun Japanese food court with dozens of food options. There is a pleasant oceanfront park that offers a nice walk with lovely views of multiple varieties. You can walk through the marina area, or you can walk down to Waikiki along a pleasant walkway with ocean views. We booked a suite that had a sleeping area, a living room area, and a full kitchen. The bathroom had a walk-in shower with adequate water pressure. There was plenty of space in the unit for two people. This included floor space. For those who might do yoga or who do stretches to deal with back issues, this is a real plus. (There is also a fitness center on the ground floor that has lots of open floor space should you prefer this as a venue for stretching and exercising.) There is a lanai that adds to the space, and on the high floors in particular you have a sense of privacy even out on the lanai. We enjoyed sitting out there with our morning coffee and our evening wine. The room was clean and well maintained. It would not surprise me if it had been renovated within the past few years. Reading some of the reviews of rentals involving owners, some of them at least sound horrible. There were many five-star aspects to the Ilikai. Convenience, location, space, etc.. There were also several things, some of which are beyond the control of the hotel, that were annoying. I would stay there again; a full kitchen is a major factor. The Ilikai may well be where you choose to stay, but let me mention a few things so that you can make an informed decision. Some of these things may not matter to you, but they could also be showstoppers for some. My wife and I like to exercise. We made use of the fitness room. Getting the fitness room door to open reliably was your first form of exercise. Some of the equipment, most notably the rowing machine, was not well maintained. The resort could do a better job. Getting someone to service the rowing machine involved a runaround, another bit of unwanted exercise. We ended up going out, buying a suitable chain oil, and oiling the chain of this machine; we own two of them and so we know a bit about Concept2 rowing machines. This helped, but the machine needed more attention than I could provide. On the theme of infrastructure failures, and things being a bit worn around the edges, the floor we were on had a sign for an ice machine, but the ice machine had been removed. The refrigerator had no icemaker, and that is fine, but then more than one ice cube tray might have been a good idea. The room had an alarm clock that was set to the wrong time, and the time on it couldn’t be adjusted. We eventually unplugged it. The rice cooker did not shut off when the rice was done, and so you had to pay more attention than you normally do when using a rice cooker. The blender would have had a hard time blending runny mashed potatoes into milk; it was anemic, and the controls had been taped into a specific position. The suite we were in did not have a dishwasher, and I suspect this is the norm. I don’t mind washing dishes, and there were plenty of pots, pans, glasses, plates, and silverware, but if you are on vacation, you might prefer to be able to put things into a dishwasher and be done with it. The hotel is smoke-free, which I appreciate because I am allergic to smoke. At night, unless smoke somehow drifted up 25 floors from the street level to the lanai, someone closer by was smoking, most likely on a nearby lanai. We couldn’t identify the source. If you closed the door and turned on the air conditioning, you would occasionally get the distinct smell of cigarette smoke, or cannabis in one instance, coming into the room, particularly late at night. Perhaps owners of units are free to smoke, and the ventilation system of the hotel provides a conduit for their smoke to enter hotel-owned rooms. We also had this issue during a prior stay. It was not a nightly thing, but during our 9-night stay we had one night of outdoor smoke, one night of indoor smoke, and one night of something with the distinct aroma of cannabis. Finally, the key reader on our door was unreliable. We would get two keys, and usually only one would work. We repeatedly had to go down and get new keys, and even if both worked on the first try, within a day one of them would fail, and on one occasion both stopped working, and we had to head back down to the lobby yet again. A maintenance person came by and “tested” the door mechanism, and said it worked just fine, except when it repeatedly didn’t. None of these things, taken individually, are a really big deal, but the collection of these “minor” things got a little old over time. If you are looking for a property/hotel that provides convenient access to Waikiki and is well served by the city bus system, but don’t want to be in the middle of the madness that Waikiki can be, the Ilikai is a very good choice, and I will most likely stay there again in the future. Our stay would have been even better had there been fewer “minor issues”. I will leave it to you to decide whether the Ilikai is a good fit for you.

My wife and I stayed here from February 3rd to 13 th. We had a mountain view 24th floor, 2 little complaints, street noise, and hot water pressure from the bathroom tap, the shower was fine. Our maid was the nicest lady and did a fantastic job. The room was always clean, the hotel was clean. We will return here in the near future as we did not get to see everything that we wanted.

This is an unrenovated suite with the wall separator that pulls out. It was adequate, and fit two adults and two children. The bathroom was a little gross since you can see dust on the vents that looks like they've never been cleaned and have hardened somehow. The kitchen is small but fully stocked with appliances. We bought groceries and ate a lot of meals from home when we were too tired to go out. We cooked breakfast everyday, had nice steak and shrimp dinners while watching the fireworks in the balcony. We had a nice view of the luau next door every night.The building itself is nice. It has a small pool where the lady on duty likes to shush children playing in it. It's a lovely walk down to the Hilton lagoon and Waikiki beach. It's a great location. We parked our car underground at the Red Lobster building. It's quite a busy area since it's Waikiki. Next time I would rent out a renovated suite.We travelled January 2017, but this form only lets me choose up to March 2017.

We rented a condo directly from an owner at this resort. The condo was spacious but poorly-maintained and horribly furnished/decorated. It was like staying in an elderly and eccentric great aunt's apartment. We no doubt would have had a better experience had we rented from a different owner or from the hotel itself as we noticed two rooms nearby with the same layout that looked quite modern and nice. For this reason, I bumped up what would have been a 2-star rating to a 3. The hotel itself (famous for the opening scene on the original Hawaii Five-O) is reasonably well-located - not on the main Waikiki beach but not too far of a walk away for someone in good health. In fact, it is not on a beach at all, but rather overlooks the harbor (which despite the nice sunsets is not the most picturesque since it is interrupted by parking lots). So if the beach is your goal, there are much better (albeit more expensive) places to stay. Unfortunately the pool here is small and unattractive too, so really this is mainly a place to sleep and hunker down between excursions elsewhere. The restaurant onsite is casual and nothing special, although the food was better than expected. Altogether, I cannot recommend this place although it is an OK spot for those on a budget who don't mind walking a little. I suspect there are better options nearby, including the Hilton next door and the Modern on the other side. We were here only a couple of days while on business after a more extended holiday visit to another island so it worked all right for our purposes.

We had a 10 day stay in Hawaii late last year. Decided this time to stay a little out of the main hustle of Waikiki. It was only a short bus ride ( 3 stops) or a 10 minute walk. These Suites are right on the beach beside the Hawaiian Hotel where the fireworks display is held. We were on the 7th floor overlooking the water. What a view when we were sitting on our lanai at breakfast or watching the marvellous sunsets. There is everything you would need supplied. There is also shops downstairs and Ala Moana is so close (1 bus stop) or 5 min walk. There are also numerous places to eat nearby....special mention to Goofys which is perfect for meals, all organic and local produce. The pools are lovely but we loved the beach. The local bus pulls right into the hotel and they provide a great service for those wanting shuttles or taxis. They arranged a trip to Waikele for us which was perfect. I am so glad we decided to give this part of Waikiki a try. Shall return to Ilikai again.

We stayed at the Ilikai a few years in a row. We like the junior suites. They are great size with great balconies. I really like the beds and the extra pillows. They are one of the most comfiest ones ever. However this year I was turned off by the staff. The bell service was so aggressive asking for tips. We wanted them to hold our luggage for about 4 hours. We had to ring the front dest, for front desk to call out the bell service to their own desk that they were not attending, which was about a 5 minute wait. We actually wheeled the luggage right next to the room where they store it, and the guy literarily wrote a ticket in 30 seconds and almost didn't even have to touch the luggage, and then proceeded to indirectly ask for tips for a good 3-4 minutes. "Are you sure you can't do anything for me, since you wont see me again as my shift ends before you'll pick your luggage", "So your luggage will be here when you come back, is there anything else to do here, this is the last time you will see me before you pick up the luggage" and 15 more sentences like this, was completely unnecessary. If the staff is so hungry for tips, the management should address this issue, and perhaps put a tip jar on the bell service desk.Second time was going from Ilikai to the modern, we went through Cinnamon's where we ate several times and spent decent dollar there with( 20% tips). Anyway, so I made it through Cinnamons just fine, but the manager/host started yelling at us mid walk and my partner stopped to see what he wants. He held my partner up for like 4 minutes telling him this is not a public walkway and he cannot cross through the restaurant. Anyway, after 4 minutes of listening to his aggressive speech my partner just continued to walk and finally made it to the other side. I think this is completely unnecessary for the staff to do this. We are the hotel guests, walking through the hotel restaurant, there should have been no yelling and shouting in my opinion.

Through a series of strange occurrences, while on the job, I was unintentionally stranded in Hawaii. I know, I know, how sad, right? The worst part is it was only one, short night. The best part is they put me up in the Ilikai Hotel. I was not in one of their most expensive rooms, but it was one of the best places I've ever been! Excellent staff. Friendly and helpful. Comfortable. Luxurious. Fantastically beautiful! I could go on and on but, as I said, I was only there for basically the one night, late arrival and early leave - I did wander around the place, I was in awe. I must say five stars and recommend. If I am EVER back in the Hawaiian Islands, I will definitely be working to get a room there!
user_name:
Aimee J
Winston Salem, North Carolina

review_body: I enjoyed the restaurant bar and entertainment by my church friends, Ben and Maila.Absolutely relaxing with business associates overlooking the harbor. It has always been one of my favorite locations, ever since a distant relative, Chinn Ho developed it.We have some suggestions for entertainment and business, but not sure who manages and controls the building since it has been under new ownership.If anyone is interested, I would appreciate a call to chat.Best regards,Ed Sun(808) 303-7996

One of the nice hotels in Waikiki Beach just on the corner of marina. The view of our room was exellant indeed looking to harbor and airport. Most popular and enjoyable sandy beaches of Waikiki are established in front of the hotel.

Stayed 27th Dec 2017-3rd Jan 2018 Privately owned apt 1509. 15th Floor corner unit overlooking the city not the ocean but could see part ocean from the master bedroom. Could still see the Friday night fireworks..greatBooked through Waikiki Beach Rentals who were very easy to deal with. From initial contact to checkout they were excellent.Clear to follow entry instructions with a keypad entry (wish more rentals had this concept)Large apartment with lounge dining & kitchen. 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms which we appreciated.Also air conditioned which is a big big plus in the older type buildings. Not that at all times we needed them on as as the breezes from the open balcony doors were sufficient.Note this apt has NO OVEN only a cook top but we were not there to cook but some guests may wish to.Plenty of spare bath towels & spare pillows. But only 1 blanket not that we were looking to use them but just noticed there was only the 1 but 3 beds Laundry on same floor was very handy but wish some owners would have air dryers. As not a lot of clothes can go through drying machines so we had wet clothes from washing & no where to hang them but we improvised. But a foldup air dryer would have been most welcome.Very clean & maintained ok but had some issues. A pull chain on fan in 2nd bedroom had come off but housekeeping prior to our stay failed to notice so fan was on all the time until we realised it was the chain. Only 1 rubbish bag should be more.
