There was something under the main bed that has not been cleaned away & a table lamp needed to be thrown away out as it was dangerous as very wobbly We did not use the buildings valet only car park but parked at the Red Lobster just around the corner for $20per day in & out privileges In house restaurant with great ocean views. But the day we were going to dine which was New Years day they were closed huh!!! But cocktails on other days were excellentAlso do not struggle up the steps with suitcases (not allowed on the escalator) but go around the right hand side if standing in front of the Ilikai & there is a lift to take you up to reception etc.ABC shops just virtually outside, with McDonalds & other eateries aroundWaikiki Trolley stops right outside ($2 return if you do not hop on hop off otherwise $2 each time)Beautifully decorated for xmas & watching the sun set over the ocean..magical!!Would not hesitate to recommend this apartment or Waikiki Beach Rentals

Better then a hotel. This is the third time I have stayed here. I highly recoomend an ocean view on the lagoon side. The one bedroom studio has a kitchen which cuts down on expenses for cooking and is cheaper then most hotels. I have given it a 5 star in the past; the reason I am giving it 4 stars this time as it was hard to get access to one of the pools. There is now a 50 person limit on their big pool and they lock the gate. Quite often I felt that there was definitely not 50 people in there and they still locked it. There is no one to speak to or get their attention. It was like this pretty much every day I was here for 8 days.

My husband and I stayed here for 10 days. We lived in the sunset ocean view room on floor 24. The room had a fully equipped kitchen which was awesome to cook breakfast, lunch and have coffee in the morning. Cleaning service was everyday with fresh towels. The view was out of this world. Spend the extra cash and book it. Every evening we got a beautiful sunset to accompany our beers on the patio. The hotel was a great location. 10 min walk to the Ala Moana centre, 10 min to the lagoon, 15 min to the beach. However parking is waaayy to expensive. Park at the Red Lobster for $20/day which was less than a block away. Also, we looked around for car rental prices and we found the cheapest was the Alamo in the discovery bay centre across the street. Cinnamons in the hotel was great, especially Wednesdays and Fridays when drinks and appies are 50% off 3pm-6pm. Hotel doesn't tell you, you have to ask, but they have beach chairs at the front desk that you can borrow. They are light enough to carry to the beach. The pool was ok, 50 person limit, and more often than not it was booked. There is a small wading pool with lounge chairs on the second floor that's perfect for sunbathing. It's rarely busy. There are fireworks on Fridays that the Hilton puts on at 7:45pm. If you walk down to the lagoon and sit on the beach or grass you get a perfect view.Last tip, the elevators are ALWAYS busy. There is a separate elevator for "bathers" so that water and sand doesn't get everywhere. That elevator is almost never used. You can ride by yourself. I would stay here again!

We stayed at the Marriot pre cruise and that was far from quiet so we opted to stay post cruise at the Ilikai. We stayed here previously 4 years ago and it was not quiet. There was a restaurant below us that had live bands so you heard music all hours of the night. I did like that the Ilikai however is in an area that is not as busy and is closer to the Alo Moana shopping center. It’s just a 10 min easy walk away. This time we opted for the Hilton lagoon side thinking it would be quieter. And I’ll admit it is much quieter than our pre cruise hotel but still rather loud. It’s currently Sunday 11pm and the hotels around have live music which you can hear as clear as day inside the room.We have kids so the noise is a disturbance. We can hear it through earplugs. We have booked room 1942 so I thought we’d be high enough for some peace and quiet. I think I’m starting to realize that no hotel in Waikiki will give you peace and quiet. Therefore any future holidays in Hawaii will be on other islands. On the positive the location of the Ilikai is great. There’s and abc store on the corner. The pool is a good size, never feels crowded and it’s a short walk to the lagoon and beach. The room we are in is well furnished and clean enough. It has a wonderful view out to the beach and the lagoon. You also get a great view of the Friday fireworks.

We stayed in a rental in this beautiful hotel. This three sided hotel has views from every angle. The main room had glass windows over looking the water. Sunsets were fantastic Beds were comfortable and bathrooms modern enough. Kitchen was clean. This hotel has paid valet parking for the length of your vacation. The lobby is beautiful. The lobby of the hotel has shops and restaurants. Off to the side is a pool area, and a walkway to the beach. Every dusk a authentic ceremony is performed near the bar. The hotel is featured in the opening scenes of the old and current Hawaii 5-o.

I am a retired travel agent and spend way too much time researching my accommodation. We decided some what spur of the moment to go to Honolulu and in the end I settled on Ilikai. It is my understanding that floors 2 and 22 and higher have been renovated. Our room was great. Full kitchen with S/S appliances (as it was a studio unit and I can't stand the smell of food in my sleeping area, we mostly used it for a sandwich or salad for lunch, but still very helpful). The location in my opinion was super - at the end of Waikiki with not any where near the hustle and bustle in the centre. Lots of great ethnic restaurants nearby. We took the public bus in from the airport and back. Very easy to do for $2.75/each! Every night we would go down to the main lobby area to watch the sunset. Perhaps there would be 10-12 others, instead of the mobs you get at other properties. I would stay here again without hesitation!

We stayed at the Ilikai on a last minute trip and was very pleasantly surprised. The room was large and was a full studio suite with a full kitchen and sitting area with a pull out couch. We were on the second floor and the lanai was enormous. Only wish we had more furniture on the lanai. The bed was comfortable but the sofa bed is not comfortable for adults. It's about 3/4 mile from the major shopping/restaurant area but is a nice walk. It is across the street from the lagoon at the end of Waikiki beach. The pool is nice but no bar or drink service there. Also, I think this building is actually a condo or time share.

We stayed on the 25th floor with a wonderful view of the ocean and also facing Hilton Hawaiian Village. This is the same hotel that Jack Lord comes out on the roof top at the beginning of Hawaii Five-O. Very nice suite with a full kitchen. Appliances appeared to be all brand new. Good choices on cable although if you are in Hawaii most of your time will probably spent outdoors. Very friendly, excellent staff. Very prompt valet parking. We would definitely stay here again. Great restaurant with view of the ocean and harbor. I would recommend you get a room with an ocean view as the street side rooms could be quite noisy. The hotel has been there for 53 years but you would never know that as the décor has been updated.

As travellers from the UK we were very far away from home but beautiful Hawaii and it’s people made us feel at home, we have a ocean facing room which had the most wonderful beach view. The room was big with a full kitchen, walk in shower bathroom and there was a sofa with a big TV and PlayStation unit. (Which we couldn’t get to work to play the free DVDs on offer in the lobby) We found all the staff at the hotel really friendly and nice, I have to say the hotel lobby doesn’t seem to have very much there, the shop sells food and drinks and general items but the prices are crazy $10 for butter and $10 for a box of cornflakes we found a Walmart 5 min away by taxi so we did a big shop there. Pool is a little on the small side but was fine as we wanted to go to the beach anyways, the Hilton and it’s famous lagoon pool was also a big plus staying at this hotel. We had been traveling for a week before so we were very happy to see that we could do some clothes washing. One little complaint and this might be the hotels age is that there is no air conditioning in the lifts or hall ways so you can be all cool in your room and then in heat the moment you step out. Flying from San Francisco we flew with Hawaiian airlines and flew back with Virgin America both were amazing but I think Virgin had just the edge over Hawaiian airlines.

We picked this hotel because of the "kitchen" in the room and the location. We enjoyed it very much. The kitchen was just what we needed, a full size refrigerator, oven, microwave and coffee maker. The bathroom shown in the photos was not what we had - it was a small bathroom with very little counter space. But it was well laid out. We had an "ocean view" - but I saw no advantage to being on the 22nd floor (although going "down" there is the advantage that the elevator is not full. There are 5 elevators but they are small - so at certain times of the day it is a challenge to get on one). The hotel is an easy and direct walk to the beach. On the "ocean view" side you can see the lagoon, swimming pools, the ocean and the hotels next door. We also had a partial view of Diamond Head. The lagoon is perfect for families with small children (there is shade from trees, grassy areas, rental items and the water is shallow, clean and warm). We were able to walk from the hotel along the beach as far as we wanted. The "store" in the hotel itself is very handy and the prices were amazingly reasonable. There was also a coffee house, a restaurant/bar and gift shop on site. There is also car rental on site - much more reasonable than at the airport. Between the buses, taxis, and app based car services who needs a car - unless going to other side of island. Washer/dryer on each floor (didn't use, so don't know what charge is). The hallways are warm - same with elevator - but the room a/c works efficiently. In January it isn't an issue. Housekeeping, lobby and restaurant/bar staff were all very helpful and efficient. This hotel also has "private" condo's that are rented - be sure to stay in the hotel part for the best service. We had a wonderful time - very relaxing.

We could not have picked a better location for our Hawaiian family holiday! The Ilikai is centrally located to the Ala Moana shopping centre, the beach and downtown Waikiki. Not to mention the almost direct access to Duke Kahanamoku lagoon, the same access that guests at the Hilton Hawaiian have for a much higher price.Our room was on the 22nd floor of the hotel with views of the lagoon, the ocean and Diamond Head. We paid extra for this obviously but it was worth it, I enjoy sitting on the lanai each morning sipping on my coffee and taking in the ocean air while the kids are still sleeping, it is the perfect way to start the day! Speaking of kids, the suite we stayed in was a perfect size for our family of four with a king size bed for us and a queen size sofa for the kids. The suite comes with a full kitchen although we didn't really utilise it, we did eat breakfast in the room each morning, lunch a couple of days and we ate dinner once in the room, but that was take away. The full size fridge was very handy though especially for a family of four.There is a resort fee of $20 USD per day which covers things like beach towels, beach chairs, daily newspaper, playstation game hire, in room wifi (each room has their own modem so the speed is very good), shuttle bus etc. I found it to be good value for money.We only had one issue with housekeeping whereby they kept on short changing us on towels, there were four people staying in our room and out of our 11 night stay we received 3 towels on 8 of those nights. There was also one day where our room did not get made up at all, to the hotels credit when I called down they sent housekeeping up do our room with dry towels. Hotel management also very kindly reduced our resort fee payment by 5 days to compensate for the inconvenience.We hired a car and used the valet parking at the hotel, you cannot self park, it is $30 per 24 hour period.All in all we had a wonderful time at the Ilikai, we stayed for 11 nights so the bigger space in the room was perfect and I would highly recommend this property to anyone who is staying longer than 5 nights.

The Ilikai was built more than 50 years ago and is definitely showing its age...from a dated design to a retro feel. That said, it is super well situated near the Waikiki beach and Lagoon and the Hilton mega complex of towers. We rented four individual suites on different floors for a party of ten travelling on a family vacation. The suites all had great full functional kitchens with microwaves, stoves, fridges, toasters, blenders etc. The suites are divided into two separate rooms - allowing 3-4 people to sleep in each. Yes the furnishings are dated, the hallways and elevators are as well - so is the lobby. But for a fairly good price (approx $300US/night) you are able to get a functioning suite (and likely a pretty great balcony view) in a prime piece of property. Sunsets are also amazing. Some highlights: very well situated along Ala Moana - 5 minute walk to huge upscale and beautiful Ala Moana Mall as well as tons of conveniences from the perennial ABC stores seemingly on every block...to McDonald’s, car rentals, restaurants etc. At the Ilikai itself, there is a great coffee store in the lobby, Aroma, with good coffee, Açai bowls, paninis and they sell coffee. The minimart store in the lobby is also very well stocked with alcohol, fruit, souvenirs, newspapers from the mainland like the NYTimes! as well as ice cream, junk food, towels, bags, bread and tons of other stuff. Hawaii serves alcohol in stores until about 11:45am. This store closes at 11pm. Lowlights: main pool is way too small and bathrooms were broken which limited capacity to 50 so it was never available unless you got there prior to 9am. Beach is close by. Kiddie pool is fully open and if you don’t mind kids, it can work just as well. The concierge desk wasn’t always manned - including during prime hours. Or manned by one concierge = lengthy lineups. The hotel is very busy so there can be lengthy wait times for the elevators as endless tourists arrive and leave! Be warned!

I would love to recognize the following Ilikai Staff for their Superb Customer service and Superior professional performance:- Mr. Kawakami (GM)- Chester (Front Desk)- Marie (Front Desk)- Sandra (Front Desk)- Patrice (Front Desk)Additionally, please recognize the entire Housekeeping, Valet, and Bellman Staff.Sincere Mahalo,Efrem Williams

I recently stayed at the llikai Hotel with my family (December 28 - January 1). We were supposed to stay until January 4th but we checked out early. I was very disappointed with the hotel amenities. First, when we arrived it was just like we had been there the entire time, no fanfare. It was my first visit to Hawaii and I was expecting to be greeted with a drink and a Lei. But no problem, I guess I shouldn't have assumed that would happen. To be honest the room was not bad, it had a kitchen and we could make out own breakfast and coffee. That was one of the best parts, along with the location. The Hilton had a fireworks show and from my room I could see everything. The problem was with the gym and the pool for me. The pool had an early closing time and a 50 people limit. There was only one pool and it was extremely small. On one particular day we took our daughter to the pool after she kept asking to go. It closed at 7 or 7:30 which seemed early considering I saw folks in other pools well after 8. So we go down at about 5:45 or so. The doors are locked but people are inside. So we peek in and there aren't 50 people so what is going on? Billie, the pool attendant decided that she was going to close the pool early and start cleaning up. She refused to open the door and let us in. We spoke to the front desk only to find out that they don’t manage the pool. It was over the holiday and the manager of the pool or the hotel wasn’t there. My daughter was upset for the entire night. We were so disappointed with how the hotel handled it we began looking for another hotel that night. If this is a part of your facility you need to manage it or set a policy on how it will be managed. Bottom line: The pool area sucks. The gym was another disappointment. The room is huge however there is only one treadmill (the other one broke on day 2), one elliptical, one bike and one rowing machine. All the equipment in there is old, like atleast something that was popular in the 80’s maybe even late 70’s. The machines weren’t paired properly at all and no free weights. You couldn’t successfully work any muscle group because there was only one machine for any given group. They did have a few floor mats so multiple people could get an ab workout. The room was so big several more machines could fit but, I guess the hotel didn’t manage that either. For the price the amenities should have been far better.

The Ilikai was an excellent place to stay. Great location and all the staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was really nice. We didn’t have a view but that was ok. We had no issues at all and would go back in a heartbeat. We also spent lots of time cooking in our room. The kitchen and appliances were all very nice.The one pool was closed for renovations but we used the smaller pool everyday for the kids and it was decent.We would definitely go back again!

Our family of four (incl. two kids aged 4 and 1) stayed in what is advertised as an ‘Ocean-view suite’ located on level 23 (Room 2334) for 8 nights in early December 2017. I believe the Ilikai Hotel & Luxury Suites manage the levels 23 and up, and the lower levels are separately managed with a mixture of self-managed rentals, residents and the older-styled rooms. The room we stayed in was spacious enough to accommodate us comfortably during our stay. It has an open configuration with contemporary furnishing and a balcony that faces the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the lagoon. The kitchen is modern and spec'ed out with a ceramic cooktop, oven, microwave oven, toaster and a full-sized fridge. It is also well stocked with cookware and utensils as well as dinnerware. Our room had a king-size bed and a sofa bed that we did not use. Our kids were not interested in PS3 console games, but I would imagine this would be an excellent feature to have for some families. You can rent free PS3 games and DVDs at the self-serve kiosk near the lobby. The hotel is located roughly 10-minutes’ easy-paced walk to Ala Moana shopping centre and about 20-minutes to the centre of Waikiki beach. There are two ABC stores (convenience store) within a couple of minutes’ walk that you can stock up on your basic supplies like water, milk, bread etc. There aren’t a wide selection of restaurants/take-outs to choose from nearby as this is the quieter end of Waikiki. We found ourselves opting for Uber Eats delivery most of the time for convenience. We managed to save a few bucks by heating up the leftovers on a few occasions too. The main pool in the hotel was being renovated, but this was no big deal as the Hilton Lagoon (a.k.a. Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon) which is open to the public is only minutes’ walk away. There is a ramp from the hotel that links up with the pathway to the lagoon. We had a great view of the fireworks This is my fourth holiday in Hawaii and my first staying at the Ilikai. I have always stayed in the heart of Waikiki, but I am glad we chose here this time around – much quieter and less busy + a kitchen! Planning on coming back next year. Note to the management:We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai - a quick feedback on some minor things: Couple of requests to the front desk were unactioned and had to be requested again.Our room had a block-out curtain, but no light-filtering curtain – we noticed other rooms did. The floor carpet in room needed a steam cleanProviding small quantity of basic pantry staples like cooking oil, salt and pepper for guests staying over X number of days – just an idea :)

We stayed in s renovated room on the 25th floor on the ocean side with a balcony. We could overlook the bay and marina. We stayed here because the room had a full kitchen. We were able to eat breakfast each day in the room as well as have cold drinks and snacks on hand. There was no dishwasher in the kitchen and limited plates, glasses, pans, and cooking utensils. There was a coffee machine and coffee provided. The hotel is centrally located so we were able to walk to get food supplies, go to restaurants, and shopping. Parking is premium with valet about $30 at the hotel per night. We parked at nearby public parking which was less at $20 a night for hotel guests. Beach towels and chairs are available each day but it’s a good walk to get to the beach. The pool was closed during our stay although no one told us that when we booked our reservation. The concierge desk was more interested in selling us timeshares than providing info about the are.

The only place to stay in Waikiki in my opinion. Rooms are huge and well outfitted for short or long stays. This property has private condos for rent or hotel rooms - depending on your needs. I have stayed here many times and would stay no where else. Walk everywhere - restaurants, groceries(Food Pantry on Hobron St has best prices and is very close), Ala Moana Mall, Walmart etc. Comfort, convenience and location - who could ask for more.?!?!

The hotel did not have our reservation when we arrived, the pool was closed the entrie week we were there and we had to request tissues and coffee filters then purchase elsewhere as they were never brought to the room.

I looked long and hard for a hotel in a good location with a kitchen, modern and with laundry facilities. These were hard to find however Ilikai was able to provide.Our room was modern and a big plus was a quiet A/C. It had a large fridge and on each floor was a laundry. $2.50 for the washing machine and another $2.50 for dryer. Hotel has a small store on ground floor for basics. Valet parking was excellent. $28 a day. The parking lot at Marina next door is $1 an hour however not secure. Reading other posts there is a parking building further down the road for $20 a day. For the small extra cost the valet was the way to go for us.We didn't eat at the hotel but there was Ihop and Red Lobster nearby. Ala Moana mall was 10 min walk away. The mall had Foodland supermarket and food court. Hotel is slightly north of main Wakiki beach area however a manmade lagoon swimming area was located in front of hotel and made a good location for a dip and appeared for good for kids.Fireworks Friday 7.45pm were a bonus. I would stay here again. Didn't get 5 stars as pool out of action however beach lagoon so close didn't really matter

Our apartments had everything we needed. They were comfortable and clean and had spectacular views. There are places to eat and shop in close vacinity and the buses stop right out the front. Would stay here again for sure!

A wonderful location for accessing the start of Waikiki beach, Duke's lagoon at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, proximity to Ala Moana Center and The Bus system. This place is approx. 60 years old and the lobby, outdoor courtyard area are beautifully maintained. The hallways and elevators are not air conditioned but that was not an issue with our December stay. The units vary greatly. Some are controlled by Ilikai Hotel with daily maid service and mandatory daily resort fees. Most are privately owned and made available either through VRBO, homeaway or property management companies like Waikiki Beach Rentals, aloha condos.com. or timeshare sharks Shell Vacations Club. Big variation in prices. Ilikai Hotel units are generally standard but most owner units depend on the owners decorating tastes and how long ago any renovations were effected. The condo association requires a certain amount of upgrading and the units with the blue sofas have minimal updates where the owner chose not to be involved. BE AWARE - property management companies like Waikiki Beach Rentals will ONLY POST POSITIVE REVIEWS on their website with very few indicators of dates when these reviews were posted and always lead you to believe that the unit has been RECENTLY renovated even though it may have been 10 years ago. All their photos reflect what the unit looked like after the LAST reno.If you are careful who you reserve with and are selective of your unit, you will love staying at the Ilikai. P.S. Hawaii Five O films regularly at the lagoon near Ilikai. They pay Gilligan's Shrimp Truck to move his truck for the morning or day to make room for Kamekona's shrimp truck (which is just a prop) or the film crew vehicles to occupy that parking area. We were fortunate to witness filming in early December.

I was working nearby for a couple of weeks in December and my company booked me here, along with some of my co-workers. This is a luxury condominium/timeshare complex with a mix of guests and semi permanent occupants. The front side, where my room was, offers a city view which I enjoyed a sunset every evening on a patio with glass doors that run the length of the unit. The backside faces a marina, lagoon, and the beginning of Waikiki beach. Units are equipped with full kitchen, and most every utensil/pots/pans and everything needed to cook and serve. At prices coming in under $200, it may be pricey depending on what you are used to, but very large compared to big mainland cities like New York and Chicago. The size of my room was equivalent to a large king suite at any mid level hotel on the mainland. Valet parking available and unlimited in/out professional service is available for $25 per day per vehicle. This being a resort property DOES NOT provide any housekeeping services during the stay. Trash room and pay self laundry available. Lobby hosts some upscale shops and a few restaurants and a spacious outdoor area to enjoy food and drinks. Small outdoor pool under the 4th floor area. Traffic is bad in the most congested part of an island of horrible drivers, so allow extra time.

Room, ok. Nice kitchen, not like home, but good. Bathroom, nice. Bedroom/living room, acceptable, average . Issues with internet, had to replace modem. Staff, polite, but, not friendly. Walking distance to several shopping and dining locations, beach, etc. Big negative, pools. “Big/deep” pool, busy, lack of chaise lounges and chairs, small. “Leisure/reading pool”, facility adequate, lounge chairs in pool, ideal for toddlers, quiet, etc. Pool attendant completely unreasonable. Counted towels, length of time at pool, resistance to umbrellas being open during extreme sun , made my visit uncomfortable and unpleasant....should I mention paying $350/night during our 25th wedding anniversary trip ? Seriously, there are 2” of water in the shallow end, 18” in the deep end. It is geared to quiet time and small children. The children are adorable and a source of entertainment. But the pool “ruler” was unreasonable about moving a pool lounge an inch to accommodate groups and families or couples...needs closer review and supervision. No complaints about the guests, just the pool attendant, and you know who you are, towel counter, 2. On a better note, great access to lagoon and Waikiki beach, exactly as seen on Hawaii 5-0. Great view of luau and fireworks at Hilton.

The rooms are huge with a kitchenette if you get a suite. Great view of the ocean if you get the ocean view rooms. Ask for high floor so you can see the fireworks at your balcony. The location is excellent.

Staff are very rude,especially bell boys. After checking out, we asked them to keep our luggages for a while,because we wanted to go shopping before moving to the next place. We came back in the afternoon to retrieve our luggages. Nobody was at the bellboy desk. There was a sign and a phone to tell to call staff if nobody was there, so I did. Ten minutes later, finally a staff came, without any saying, and of course without any smile. Where is your service? Where is your hospitality? At night, my husband and I visited the front desk, because we had a question. That front desk man had no smile as well. What happened to this hotel? The only kind man is the one at the convenience store there. He is the only one seems to be working there really. The room cleaning lady was terrible too. She knocked on our door, and said "When are you leaving?" Excuse me? That was a far before the checkout time and was that for asking us to leave the room soon? What a rude hotel. Good location? Well, not so good. There are heaps of much better hotels. I should advise all of you to avoid this hotel.

Great hotel! The room exceeded our expectations. We had fantastic views, the rooms are very spacious, they're clean and modern, we were provided with a news paper every morning, refilled on Hawaiian Tropic shampoos, conditioners and moisturiser. There's great transport links from the front of the hotel to take you to any where in Hawaii that you may need to be. It's a 5 minute walk to the beach. There's a great restaurant (Cinnamon) within the hotel - the breakfast is fantastic!! We loved our stay here and would love to return.
user_name:
Georgi18
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: My wife & I spent 9 days at the Ilikai to celebrate my birthday. The condo had all the facilities you'd need plus the beauty of a daily room service, changing towels, making the bed etc. The kitchenette was fitted out superbly & looked excellent with it's Italian marble tops. The whole apartment, which was ample in size, looked as though it had had a recent make-over. Staff at the hotel were friendly & helpful & the view from the good-sized balcony was excellent. The only negative was the fact that the swimming pool was closed for refurbishment-and this was not mentioned when I made the booking! There was a small kiddies pool with sun-loungers/umbrellas etc. but it wasn't the same so, we were forced to spend sunbathing time on Waikiki beach & in the sea. The location wasn't quite as good for shopping & restaurants, as further down towards Diamond Head, but it depends what you want out of your holiday in Waikiki. Friday night fireworks courtesy of the Hilton Hotel were spectacular, especially from the 24th floor! All-in-all this is a special place for special holidays.

Located right on Waikiki beach and near the Alo Moana Mall. Directly next door to the Hilton-so many restaurants & bars nearby. Lovely heated pool and the lagoon is in front of this property and great for kids. view of the marina is lovely. the rooms are great. Patio doors fully open and you can enjoy the ocean and the Friday night fireworks. Perfect for families, suites are beautiful and quiet, we never heard any other vacationers.

The location and rooms at this older establishment are what make this place so good. The suites have small kitchens, perfect for those of us who prefer keeping some juice in the fridge and being able to prepare our breakfasts and lunches. There is nothing nicer than taking your food or coffee out onto the balcony and watching the sun come up.The bathrooms are relatively spacious. Beds are ok (not nearly as good as the Hampton inns).There was a sofa in our bedsit suite and was good for stretching out.The location is great. There are several convenience stores and restaurants within a block or two. The Ala Moana mall is about 8 minutes walk away.The downsides are the limited amenities and proximity to the beach. There are two small pools but one was closed while we were here. The beach is a fair walk (especially if you have small kids in tow) - you have to leave the property and walk through the public lot to get to the beach. Chairs and towels are provided by the front desk. There is a surcharge for stuff like watching movies (even if you don't use it you have to pay). We last stayed here 16 years ago. The place is kept well; Only the outside looks its age.

I'd stayed at the Ilikai when it was a Marriott hotel years ago. I came back because I like the size of the rooms and that there's a kitchenette in each with oven, stove, microwave, full refrigerator. This gives flexibility so you don't always have to be eating out at a restaurant. Each room has a balcony. The hotel is well positioned within walking distance of major attractions, restaurants, shopping, and the beach. You pick up a towel and chair from the front desk and it's about a 5-10 min walk to the beach.

Husband, myself and two kids stayed at Kate and david’s condo no 1334 in the ilikai hotel for 11 nights and it was our first visit to Hawaii. We were really looking forward to it and had numerous dealings with owners prior to arriving about check in information etc. a week before we arrived we got all information needed to check in which was excellent. We arrived on wed 25 October and were able to leave bags with doorman till we got access at 4 pm. We just bought a few supplies that day with intention of going shopping following day to Walmart or foodland. Next day went shopping and got milk cheese ice cream etc and beer and wine. We all went out for the day and on coming back to apartment realised nothing in fridge was cold and ice cream had melted. Also the freezer made ice and this had also melted. We turned fridge up and went and bought bag of ice to put in freezer to keep goods cold. Next day still nothing cold. Not even the milk so I sent message to owner who said that if fridge too full it wouldn’t dork well. Next day his manager came round and said it wasn’t cooling because we had it too full and had placed bag of ice in freezer. He rearranged freezer and fridge and said that it should be ok. Next day still nothing cold. I complained again to owner who advised me that his manager told him we had it too full. I said so fridge only works when it’s empty. After a week he sent round technician who pulled huge piece of ice from behind cover in freezer and advised us fan was broken. He got fan working temporarily before returning following day with new fan. Next day fridge started working and everything cold and freezer started making ice again after a week. I told owner that having had a week with no fridge and temps in high 20s we had lost cheese milk ice cream and meat and wanted compensation as I would expect a fridge in condo to work when you arrive. He did not agree and said it was our fault fridge did not work. I advised I would write this up as a bad review on TripAdvisor as I feel people should be aware of this lack of service

Right next door to the arguably more iconic Hilton Hawaiian Village, the Ilikai has an inviting interior and friendly staff, as well as some cool pool options, including an adult pool and a big wading pool. Just a 5 minute walk down the boardwalk puts you at the big lagoon where you can rent canoes and water-trikes or just swim around. Another 5 minutes down and you're at pretty much the same beach that visitors of the Hilton enjoy. Our hotel room door had mechanical issues that would not let us lock it, but that was solved within an hour of us reporting the problem. The crib that was provided for our son was comfy and safe and he had no trouble sleeping while we were there. If you drive a rental car to stay there, beware of the *very* steep daily valet charge which you have no choice but to pay unless you want to try your luck finding street parking in the heart of waikiki.. The location and base price may be great, but prepared to be gouged by some of the most numerous additional fees I've ever seen in my life. I kid you folks not - there was a "hotel services" fee that was like $18 bucks a night or something like that. I politely tried to ask the front desk while we were checking in - isn't the $140 dollars we are paying you ever day for the very thing one would call "hotel services?" Like, if we didn't pay, what would we not be able to make sue of in the hotel. I was met with a kurt non answer after the staff member behind the desk pondered this for a moment: "Sir, this is a fee for the services of the hotel." Having acquired the knowledge that I wasn't exactly dealing with the head of client satisfaction, I just left it at that. There might as well have been a "fee processing fee" - I don't remember all the exact additional charges, but that was basically what it felt like. In the end, a 5-day stay there resulted in us having to shell out about an extra $300 just to enjoy the hotel I thought I had already paid to stay at. If they would just up their nightly rate a bit and do away with the surprise "now that you're here you're kinda screwed, what are you gonna do turn around and fly home?" fees, I would have more respect for how this is run. But it feels a bit like bait and switch to have such a low nightly rate advertised only to end up paying an end total sum of money that would have allowed you to stay in a classier joint like the Hilton next door.
user_name:
Josh G
Sunnyvale, California, United States

review_body: We managed to check in a little early which was rare in most US hotels. Our room was the “Luxury junior suit ocean view” The room was quite large with lounge, kitchen with full size fridge and microwave. Room has large windows and balcony but “ocean view” was more optimistic than realistic. WiFi was good, would certainly stay here again.

Let me start by saying that my fiance and I booked a last minute trip to the ilikai via Costco travel. The package was quite affordable and the suite we got was so beautiful! The room was basically a room with a small living room, a full kitchen (including pots and pans) a fridge and stove. Great for people who are looking to save and want to stay in a few nights and cook together. The hotel manager sent us a bottle of champagne which was such a kind and surprising touch. The cleaning staff was on point and our room always looked very clean the full week we were there. The only thing that threw me off was the lack of room service (we tend to like to dine in and we're too lazy to cook one night, but we're surprised to find out that there was no room service) The other thing that was a problem was the staff at the concierge desk. We wanted to book various activities and the lady that attended us made us feel like fools for wanting to do certain things like visiting the Polynesian welcome center. She was quite unprofessional in her interaction with us and tried to con us into booking a timeshare presentation, by masking it as a complimentary breakfast. she said she already booked it for us and kept talking about the activities we wanted to do. When I asked her to clarify she said it was a breakfast that would get us discounted prices to the activities we wanted to do. I then asked her to tell us what the point of this was and she then disclosed it was a timeshare presentation (because she wanted to be honest). Needless to say, we ended up only booking one activity with her as a result of her attitude and ended up paying full price for the activity. This was the only bump during our stay but it was very troubling for us.

I spent three amazing weeks at this hotel in suite 1841. I don't think I would ever now stay anywhere else. The apartment was perfect, incredibly well equipped, Well furnished and comfortable with views to die for. The spacious Lanai looked out over the Ala Wai Boat Harbour across Ala Moana Park as far as and beyond the airport to the Mountains. The Hotel itself is well appointed with good facilities, The new pool on the second floor is a delight for adults who want some peace and quiet the main pool is good if small but if you need shade then it's not ideal. The lobby shops are the normal mix you find in any Waikiki Hotel and the little general store is perfect and carries all the essentials, the staff were lovely and could not do enough to assist, it also has a very useful ATM machine. There is a great coffee shop just off the lobby and also a restaurant with entertainment. There are a good selection of restaurants within minutes and the bus stop right outside gives you access to wherever you wish to go. The heart of Waikiki is a short walk one way and Ala Moana Shopping Centre is 5 minutes in the other. Although not directly on the beach it's literally a 3 minute walk away and he you want a really family friendly safe beach then Ala Moana Beach Park is again a ten minute stroll. I booked direct with Marina Hawaii Vacations who have an office on site, all done through email and as simple as can be and I would certainly book with them again. As a solo female traveller in her sixties I had no security concerns and often saw the guards patrolling the floors at night so would certainly recommend this as a safe spot to visit.

We had a junior suite that overlooked the harbor and the ocean — a wonderful view. The location was prefect, minutes to the beach, close to restaurants, but not in the middle of the loud and congested hotel district.Staff was average and not very knowledgeable. The concierge was not helpful at all. When asked about a restaurant in the next door hotel, she said that she’d never been there. If you don’t mind an updated older hotel and are fine with using Open Table to find places to eat, this is a good place to stay.

We were looking for a reasonably priced place with a kitchen and that's what it was but I would have preferred to be a bit closer to the main strip. Pros- good views we had a view over the pool and over the beach we were able to watch the fireworks- bus stop right at the front took us to the main strip, pearl harbour ect- restaurant in lobby- pools- big self contained units - great local restaurant around the corner with amazing steak: goofys cafe (seriously go there it's amazing)Cons- 10 min walk to main strip- beach in front of the man made pond/lake weren't nice the sand was shallow the pond were freezing the beach is much better in the middle of the beach near Moana Surfrider hotel - felt to far from the actionSo really my only complaint was location so if that's not an issue for you I would stay here. If you are thinking it might be an issue look for something a little closer, next time I would look something near the Aston or Marriott down the other end.

We had the sunset king room, and yes, the view of sunset was spectacular. The size of the room was huge, and the fully stocked kitchen was very handy for cooking. The Cinnamons restaurant on the ground floor was very nice and location was excellent, allowing us to walk both Waikiki and to the Ala Moana shopping centre with ease. You are also right next door to where the Friday fireworks are held which is very convenient.Unfortunately, there were some major problems with the hotel, which detracted form the positives. The main pool was closed for renovations, which only left a tiny wading pool for the entire 25 floors worth of rooms which was very disappointing. The primary restaurant, which was one of the reasons we had booked this hotel months ago, had closed, and there was no alternative in the hotel, so we had to go elsewhere for a nice dinner. This was extremely disappointing to us. The bed was rock hard (some people might like the firmness), so it threw my back out for the first night and I was in a lot of pain the next 2 days. We did ask for assistance in that regards, and the staff brought us 2 mattress toppers which fixed the problem for the rest of the nights which was very good of them.

This hotel offers great value for money. We are a family of 5 and fit comfortably in this condo. And because it’s not a resort there are no resort fees added on. There was a double bed and a foldout lounge for the kids to share plus another fold out bed in the wardrobe. We were on the 16th floor.The full kitchen was great as it meant we could eat breakfast at home every day and sometimes dinner if we didn’t feel like going out. There was also a vacuum cleaner in the cupboard which was great for cleaning up the sand each night.A full bathroom with shower and toilet.When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly lady who got us all checked in and straight up into our room. There was parking next door for $20 per day or valet for $28 which is what we used.The room itself was clean and updated, it wasn’t spectacular but hey all we planned to do was sleep in there each night! The only negatives I have with the room were the blinds were broken so as soon as the sun was up it was blinding you and we couldn’t really ever have a sleep in and we booked for 5 people but we’re only given 4 towels and had to pay if we wanted more (strange)There are 2 pools which we never used and a little shop down stairs that sold all the necessities at a decent price. Each floor also has a laundry room and the prices were ok.There was also a restaurant downstairs and 3 nights of the weeks they have something on, nothing big but nice enough to just chill downstairs and listen to live music.The view was spectacular, overlooking the lagoon and the tail end of Waikiki beach.We were within walking distance to the lagoon (literally at the bottom of the hotel) and Waikiki beach and the marina. You aren’t right in the heart of Waikiki which was good and bad for us. Negative: sometimes you want the hustle and bustle and a few more dining and shopping options. Positive: you were away from the hustle and bustle! In saying that though there were plenty of places to eat (Red Lobster next door and Wild Wings across the road) and a few shops to browse in. And could still walk to heart of town, about a 20 min walk or you can catch the trolley for about $2.Ala Moana is approx. 15 min walk away too.If we were to return to Hawaii we would definitely stay here again!!!

Background ... have been traveling to Oahu since 1972 ... even met my husband there. Have been there 30+ times. 90% of the time we stayed at the Sheraton Waikiki, a couple of times at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and always enjoyed our stay. Lots of changes at the Sheraton, many good ones, yet, it has lost the "old" Hawaii spirit/feel which makes Hawaii one of the most wonderful places on earth. It has a 'rushed' feeling to it. This post is not to dig on other properties, it is simply my observation and knowledge from seeing these hotels for years. I do enjoy walking around the shops in the 'village' like atmosphere at Hilton Hawaiian Village (HHV), but as far as staying there it is like "Disney World." It has just expanded too much to want to stay there and the pool lounging area is anything but relaxing.Sheraton is very pretty and we like the pool but it is very crowded and the lobby area is a busy pass through lobby versus one that captures the relaxation of enjoying the ambience.This past trip, my husband, 2 adult children and 6 year old grandson went for 10 days. My initial concern with the Ilikai was not having the children's pool like they do have at the Sheraton and HHV. But we decided to give it a try. And it worked out much better than I thought and there was absolutely no disappointment for the 6 year old. He would play in the pool at times but what he loved was the large lagoon in front of the hotel which I believe is associated with the HHV (maybe), yet we had complete access to. We got him a few floats and balls at the ABC store and we would set up under the tree around the lagoon and he had a blast the entire time. It was so much more relaxing and fun for all. For my husband and I to get away and really relax, we went to the 2nd floor new adult pool at the Illikai... amazing and absolutely wonderful.And at night or late in the afternoon, we loved sitting in the lobby or in the outside area that looks over the marina. Just so peaceful and "Hawaiian." The entertainment at night (unsure if every night) was excellent and you can also have a front seat view of the fireworks show they do on Friday nights at the HHV.We stayed in one of the upper floors (new rooms) and they were lovely with a full kitchen, nice bathroom, and well decorated. I cannot comment on the decor of the other floors as I "think" some are individually owned.The main pool worked well but needed updating. I have heard they are currently in the process of renovating that pool which on our next trip I look forward to seeing. We enjoyed the convenience of walking next door to the HHV if I just wanted to walk around the shops. Also, it was a very easy walk to the Ala Moana Mall which is a fabulous mall.What I would like to see added is drink/food service to the pool. That would be nice. Other than that it is a hidden gem!
user_name:
Annie8991
Anderson, South Carolina, United States

review_body: We have just returned from a 10 night stay in the Ilikai and whilst the stay was adequate I think that there would be better options in the immediate area. The property is situated at one end of Waikiki beach beside the Hilton village. It appears to be a mixture of timeshare owners and hotel residents. The property is quite old and in need of a refurbishment although our studio room with kitchen was fine and served its purpose. However the main hotel pool was closed leaving only a children's pool as an option which was disappointing to say the least. When my wife mentioned this to a member of the reception desk staff he suggested that she could 'always swim in the sea ' !! Not a helpful comment although in fairness they did reduce our resort fee. The main Italian themed restaurant was also closed leaving Cinnamons bar/bistro as the only option which quite frankly was poor at best. It was not part of the hotel but operated by another company who clearly should invest more in staff training as the bar service left a lot to be desired. All in all a pleasant trip which unfortunately was marred by a set of circumstances.

We rented a condo through Waikiki Beach Rentals. The location was great, away from Waikiki Beach and close to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre.We had a full kitchen which we really only used for breakfasts and drinks and nibbles on the balcony.It's an easy stroll on the boardwalk to Waikiki. The beach is not as busy as Waikiki itself.The only drawback was that the main pool was closed for repair so we could only get wet to our ankles in the wading pool.

We would just like to say, we have been to Hawaii 3 times in a year and half and just love it, and we feelstaying at the Ilikai just makes the holiday perfect.It's very rare to go to a hotel and feel ìts like home and makes you feel like you never want to leave.Best position,wonderful atmosphere you can walk everywhere from there.I wouldn't change a thing about the Ilikai.See you next year.

Really enjoyed my stay here. Close to all big hotels and pools with the advantage of having a good bedroom with own kitchen and integrated lounge area. Large verandah to sit and watch sunset. Very close to beach and good ten min walk to main shopping avenues. Restaurants just okay, service great, quality of food average. Reception spacious and efficient. Porters and valet all very friendly and helpful. Only grind would be the fact that the stafff went on strike and lay siege to the hotel with loud speakers and singing all day. I completely understand their grievances over pay, no one strikes lightly but it did make for an unusual stay. In fact we had to stay away all day as the chanting was so loud and went on till 7pm. No housekeeping as a consequence.  It only lasted 24 hrs and normal service resumed. If you have the money go higher up, the views must be stunning and it will be quieter. We were on the second floor. Also gym very old and dated. Needs an upgrade. Shops in foyer and mini supermarket excellent. Restaurant server Krystal, top notch, great asset to restaurant, not only remembers your face but how you like your eggs done.

The hotel is nice and is walking distance to shops and restaurants (just right across the street). It has a full kitchen, living room, and big balcony. What I do love about this hotel is the beautiful view of Waikiki Beach!

Just got back from Hawaii and room 1120 at the Ilikai was fantastic. Large room, comfy bed, a view to die for overlooking Waikiki beach and the lagoon. The shower was great (actually room enough to shave your legs, ladies). I could not have made a better choice. All that research paid off in a great vacation. Aloha

I stayed in 2524 (top two floors are hotel owned and rented). There are some great things about this hotel! Generally very clean. Kitchen is appointed with some basics so you can get groceries and cook. The view from the ocean front rooms are absolutely amazing. The hotel is centrally located...the bed is comfortable. A lot of the staff are quite friendly and do a lovely job, particularly the housekeepers and valet.Room for improvement: generally aspects of the hotel are a little shabby and could use a refresh, including rugs and some furniture. - The room rugs are meant to be cream and are instead grey with stains- Couch in room seemed kinda dirty- the cushions and rugs downstairs were worn and kinda grossBut all in all, a good choice for your stay.

Second time we have visited Hawaii we decided to try Illikai. Upon approach I thought to myself wow where are we staying. The outside definitely needs a makeover. The room was nice though not impressed with the lack of safety lock for the balcony definitely not great for kids my 4 year old unlocked it herself . Pool was closed the whole week we were there which was rather anoying. Staff front desk couldn't care less about you. Make a complaint it goes no where Ive yet to still have anyone contact me over the resort fee issue in fact I called expedia myself when I got home and got a refund for false advertising the resort fee was included and I was still told to pay it when I was there. Also home now with these bites and itching on my legs mostly bed bugs . Never again

We stayed in 2233 and had a wonderful experience. Property seemed recently updated. Room was well designed, bed was comfortable and our lanai had an intoxicating view of the marina. Nice kitchen area. Elevators are convenient and quick. Staff was very friendly and wanted to be helpful. You are a short walk from the beach and a nice swim. Ala Moana Park is just across the causeway. We could not imagine a better choice.

We stayed 3 nights the Ilikai in a individually owned condo. We were traveling with several other families who also stayed here. The nicest were the hotel units. Our unit was nice, but hasn't been fully renovated. They were working in the halls on renovations when we were there. It's a good location on the outer edges of downtown Waikiki. You can walk into the city, but it is a bit of a walk. You can also catch the trolley into downtown. We had a rental car and paid to valet, it was convenient and quick. The hotel has a lot of history including being featured in the original Hawaii 5-0 show, they has some interesting story boards in the hotel. The pool is OK, we preferred the lagoon and the ocean. Quite a walk to the lagoons and ocean with older people and kids in tow. The lobby was nice, the staff was friendly and helpful.

The Ilikai hotel is over 50 years old and featured in a fair number of the old Hawaii 5-0 show featuring Jack Lord. The hotel is divided into two parts, the condos which can be rented through sites like Air BnB and the hotel portion. The hotel portion has been updated and upgraded over the years but with the condos, renovations and refurbishing depends upon the individual owner.There is a large children's pool which is very shallow and a general use pool. The location is a terrific asset as you can walk to the beach or marina very easily. There is a concierge on duty with extended hours who is very helpful with booking excursions or even general information and maps. We had hoped to go up to the top in the famous glass elevator but a sign directs the elevator was only for the use of the restaurant patrons. We might have considered having dinner there but frankly the attitude put us off.The local bus which goes just about everywhere on Oahu departs from the front of hotel. There's a McDonalds across the street and a Subway as well as a small supermarket which stocks more souvenirs than food so is not that useful. The Ala Moana shopping centre is nearby. There is entertainment on the weekends.We enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai. It isn't as glitzy as the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door, full of shops and restaurants which you can visit, but it suited us.

The Ilikai is an ideal choice for accommodations in Waikiki. The rooms come with a complete kitchen so you can save a bundle on food and the property is well maintained. Just a 5 minute walk to the beach and 15 minute walk to the tourist areas of Waikiki so you are situated in a prime location without too much of the noise and crowds of the central area of Waikiki. I would definitely stay there again.

We stayed here for 5 nights and the room was clean and the location was within walking distance to restaurants and the Ala Moana shopping mall and most tours and trolleys stop out the front. There is a nice cafe downstairs and a general store and the restaurant has the best fish tacos.

Amazing! Hotel was fantastic and immaculate. We had an ocean view room and it was just perfect. The room was very big and the mini kitchen had everything you needed and more, better than my house!!! The bathroom was very big too and the shower was fabby. We bought a lot of items from the mini mart in the hotel, although it's a bit more expensive for some items the amazing customer service made it worth it. DVD rental is included in the resort fee which is great for when you want to have a chilled night in. The hotel seems to be central pick up for all the tour companies which is perfect that after a long day on a trip you get dropped off right at your door. We really can't recommend this hitel highly enough it really was a perfect stay with all the facilities you need. zlovely restaurant's and shops close by. We will be recommending this hotel to others and will definitely booming again on out next visit to the island.

The views from this place area amazing! There are restaurants, shops, a general store and the grounds are beautiful. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hallways and elevators aren't air conditioned but the room was very comfortable.Being able to see the rooftop luau and fireworks was a Real Treat! Without a doubt, we will stay here again!

The Ilikai is a pleasant enough hotel in a good location on Waikiki beach. The rooms are a fair size, nicely decorated with good kitchens and bathrooms (no bath). It could do with more mirrors in the room as there is only one in the bathroom. Choose ocean side rooms on higher floors for great views. Expect to walk 15-20 mins to the main part of Waikiki for shopping and dining.Issues with the hotel worth noting are the location of the designated smoking area right at the top of the only walkway to the lagoon and beach. Everyone has to walk through the constant plumes of smoke going in and out of the beach side of the hotel which is really frustrating.The 24/7 Fitness Centre consists of some fairly ancient and poorly maintained equipment (no free weights). For a hotel of its size, this really needs maintenance and upgrading. We ultimately had to pay a small fortune to use a local gym.The downstairs pool is really deep and not very kid friendly. It's also quite small and dated in design.Daily room servicing consists of bed making and towel and toiletries replacement. No other cleaning appears to take place. This is especially annoying with regard to dishes which do not get cleaned and there is no dishwasher. A clothing item of ours went missing during a room service. We have emailed to find out if it got caught up in sheets or towels with no response - very disappointing given the cost of the top and negligence in the process.In room wifi is great but there is no wifi anywhere else! Unlike many other cities in the US we visited, it was a real struggle to get wifi access pretty much anywhere other than our hotel room.Much like most of Hawaii, the Ilikai is a bit dated and the staff are not overly friendly. Be ready for everything in Hawaii to be like this... and super expensive!

We stayed here in 2014, nice rooms, great view of the sea and the lagoon. rooms were nice, with everything you need. close to everything, beach, shops, restaurants, market......I would stay here again

This was our second stay. Our partial ocean view studio was well appointed. The kitchen is convenient for breakfast or lunch but don't plan to do any real cooking. There is no dishwasher but there is laundry on each floor.There are two pools- one for swimming while the other is designed for sun bathing. There is no beach but the Hilton beach and lagoon are next door.The downstairs restaurant has a full and bar menu which offers many choices from pancakes to poke Portions reasonably priced and generous.This hotel is priced well.

My stay at the llikai Hotel on 9-23 - 9-24 was Amazing! The accommodations, Staff, and the entire property was Superb.The check-in process, the Valet parking, the Bell luggage service was flawless!The Hotel Personnel Noteworthy of mention of the highest regard are:Rod, Chester, Marie, Patrice, Richelle, Roxy, and Jasmine. I will surely visit this magnificent property on my next vacation.Mahalo A Hui Ho !!!Efrem Williams

The Ilikai Hotel is rated 3.5 stars and probably quite accurate but a very pleasant stay was the result. We selected the hotel for a few days rest after a fairly hectic world tour and to break journey from NY to Australia. It is well located in Waikiki and a large lagoon opposite the beach is only a short stroll away. It had its own 20 metre pool and but not incorporated well into the layout, maybe an after thought but good for laps in the morning and very comfortable temperature. Check in was very efficient and friendly and all luggage delivery to room shortly after our arrival. We had a lovely spacious room with full kitchen and good sized bathroom and a large balcony overlooking the sea and marina. The kitchen was well stocked with utensils etc but we had to request an electric jug which was most odd. Clearly Americans don't start the day with two cups of English Breakfast tea. Watch out for the ratty pigeons that quite happily trot into you room and say hello if you leave the balcony door open. Best not to encourage them. The room is well air-conditioned and if you leave balcony door open at night with no aircon you will not be bothered by any Mosquitos etc. They resort is well located with restaurants and shops nearby but it also has its own mini-supermarket which is fully stocked with everything you need including in-expensive alcohol. Plus if looking for a light meal it has fresh salads, fruit trays etc if you need a break from restaurants. It also has a nice outdoor Cininmon Cafe for breakfast and casual meals plus bar and dinner menu. There is also a little cafe near the restaurant which provided the best coffee we'd had in a long time. There is also an up-market restaurant on the 30th floor which was very nice and had terrific views over the water. The hotel also had a Hertz office in the foyer which was handy. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

This hotel/apartment hybrid is over 50 years old but very well kept for its age and obviously has had upgrades to its facilities over the years.We stayed in a lagoon facing room on the 24th floor which is almost near the top. Highly recommend choosing lagoon facing rooms and ideally towards the right wing if facing the sea. The view is great and you can also catch the fireworks from the room's balcony.The room is quite spacious and comes with a well equipped kitchen. No kettle though. The room was very clean and modern with good wifi. I think each room has its own router which helps.The hallways weren't quite as nice and a bit dated but I'm sure that's not much of a concern for most people.We saw three swimming pools but ended up using the shallow pool on level two everyday as it's most suitable for young kids. Best to use the pool mid to late afternoon when the building's shadow will shelter you from the sun.There is a fancy restaurant on the very top floor which we enjoyed. A bit pricey but food and service was goood. Also had live music which was a real plus. Lobby area is reasonably large with some shops including a convenience store. Quite handy for purchasing water and some food in the mornings. Location wise it's not bad but requires some walking. Took us about 15min on foot to Ala Moana and likewise to the centre of Waikiki. Alternatively, the trolley bus does stop outside or you can take a complimentary shuttle but the timetable is not very frequent.Overall, a family friendly hotel like most in Hawaii. A safe choice.

The Ilikai Hotel is iconic. The original Hawaii 5-0 show with Jack Lord was filmed here. In the opening theme shows him standing on the top lanai (balcony) before showing other iconic scenes around the island. The new series also films here and were here the day after we arrived. So when I started planning this trip a year ago, I knew this would be the perfect hotel to stay as I celebrated my Hawaii 5-0 birthday! What I didn't know before coming is that the marina here at the hotel is also where the beginning of Gillian's Island was filmed. You know when they board the S.S. Minnow. Plus the rooms have full kitchens which saved us on eating out. Our room, 2232 was great and it was an ocean view room, which I knew I wanted from the beginning. And the fact that you could rent DVD's to watch in your room, free of charge. The staff was very pleasant, especially Rod (who checked us in), and Sherry (security guard we saw everyday we were there; 7 days). The General Manager, Wes Kawakami sent a card with a hand written note welcoming us and wishing me a happy birthday, along a box of cookies from Honolulu Cookie Company and a bottle of Champagne. Everyone we interacted with from housekeeping, restaurant, shops, etc. were very nice which made our stay even more enjoyable.You might want to consider this hotel on your next Hawaiian journey. But be sure you get the ocean view room. We're planning to return next year and Yes, we will be staying at the Ilikai.

We keep chossing the Ilikai because of the 2 bedroom luxury oceanfront condos. HArd to get in waikiki.ONe of the older hotels it has amazing wrap around balconies with views over the ocean and the harbour.. cant get much better than that!Lovely staff and very helpful. grocery stores, coffee shop and small restaurant all on site. Pool is lovely, but bit too many children at times. As they do have a second puddle pool, an adult only version would be great. The only down side was the beds. I dont think I have ever slept on a worse mattress in many years. Both bedrooms had the same stiff hard mattress. We woke up every morning with a sore back.due to this we might not choose the hotel version but just go with a vacation rental inside the same building next time.

We were originally a bit worried after we seen some of the reviews about the Ilikai but should not have worried. We arrived on the 28th Aug & were able to get straight into our room which was fantastic after a ling flight with our 8mth old daughter, were arrived there at the hotel at 7.45am. We were greeted at reception by Richelle who was very friendly & helpful. Our room was 2439 a sunset ocean view room & the view was amazing! We previously had stayed the Hilton Hawaiian Village but this was so much better. The rooms are very spacious & the kitchens are great basically it's a full kitchen with plenty of room ( I wish my kitchen was as nice at home). The bathrooms are nice & big & there is plenty of bench space. There was always plenty of hot water not like previous reviews I had read. The baloney was nice & big & it was nice to sit out there at sunset & after dark looking at the views. The staff were always very helpful, we had order a cot & it was delivered to our room fast. There was a older maid I met on the 1st day can't remember her name but I know her daughter is having a baby in November but she was absolutely lovely. She was not our usual maid but this lady was always really nice & talked with our 8 mths old daughter. The lifts were never too busy & we never had to wait too long. I'm not sure what the pools are like cause we always went to the beach out the back of the Hilton near the lagoon. The laundry room was a great bonus, it cost around $5 aud to do a load of washing & to dry it.We will definitely be staying here again when we come back to Hawaii.

Booked this hotel through Costco Travel (first and last time I will use them) for a stay July 1 - 8, 2017. The hotel was chosen because it was close to cousins we were visiting. There are definitely others hotels to stay in that provide better customer service during and after your stay. We booked a partial ocean view. When we arrived, the only room available was on the 2nd floor and its only view was a marina and boats, no "ocean". I opted to spend $40 per night for a full "ocean" view (room 2524) and as you'll see from the photo I attached, this was no "full" view. Unfortunately, I was told it was the only other room available in the hotel. (I phoned two times to see if anything else was available and was told no). Housekeeping - Not once during our stay was the room vacuumed, nor was the patio ever cleaned or dishes/cutler put away. This is in spite of me leaving a $4/$5 tip daily. Ice - on the Fourth of July we had guests over and were unable to find ice anywhere in the hotel; not even in their store. When I phoned the front desk to ask why no ice was available, I was told to walk to a store and get some. Ants - When we checked into the room, there was slip of paper informing us that pest control services would occur during our stay. That was a good thing. I wish it had occurred earlier during the stay because we ended up with an ant problem in our bathroom, on the patio, and in our luggage. There was also a problem with our sink backing up and after it was treated, the problem stopped, so I think that may have been due to the pest problem. Positives - the suite itself was beautiful, the onsite restaurant, Cinnamon's, is delicious, the hotel sundry store has an excellent selection and wonderful staff, and the bands that played were very good. After I returned home, I wrote directly to the hotel manager, Sandra Hashimoto, and never received the courtesy of a response. It has been two months. I also wrote to Costco Travel and never received the courtesy of a response. Neither will get my business in the future. As I said there are many other hotels to choose from and I would suggest staying elsewhere and using other travel services.

While I have been to Waikiki 8 or so times, I had never stayed here. One thing I can say about almost all of the Waikiki hotels is that they are not that great inside unless they are brand new or have been completely gutted and remodeled. So to pay a premium just for a "brand name" hotel is not worth it for me as I spend most of my time outside. Also, I wanted a kitchen and most hotels do not have kitchens unless you stay at an outdated one.Note: this review is for the hotel room not a condo or time share. I knew that I didn't want a mountain view room as those rooms face the noisy Ala Moana Blvd. So I paid a little more for a pool view room since the pools face the ocean, but there was no view of the pool, LOL! The staff was nice and we arrived early and our room was ready. The room had been remodeled recently so it was nice inside. These rooms come with only 1 bed and a pull out couch, but the bed was very comfortable. Kitchen was nice and they provided dish soap and paper towels, but everything else you have to buy. Who really wants to buy salt, pepper,spices when you're only there a week? I did use the activities desk to book 1 adventure and a rental car. FYI, it's so much cheaper to rent a car thru this hotel than from the actual rental place. I had looked at costs online the day before our trip and when the hotel gave me their price for the exact car I was shocked. The car rental place is just across the street so it's very convenient. If you have to park a car at this hotel you will be charged a $28/day valet fee. I like that beach towels and chairs are provided (included in daily fee you pay). While the rooms have AC, the hallways and elevator do not and the elevators are really slow and small.We ate dinner one night at Cinnamon's restaurant, not very good. But I hear their breakfast is better. I prefer to go eat near the Waikiki beachwalk as there are a lot of good restaurant options there.My only complaint about our stay was the beach and the lagoon at the Hilton Hawaii Village. The lagoon being man made had very hard "sand" and is not comfortable to sit on. The beach in front of the Hilton had too much coral and rocks both on the sand and in the water. We ended up walking about 8-10 minutes down the shore for better sand/water. Overall, for the price I would stay here again if I needed a kitchen. It's very convenient to the airport and is very close to the beach. There are 2 pools but we never used them as we were always at the beach. And there are 2 ABC stores on either side of the hotel.

My wife and I stayed at the Ilikai for 7 nights in an ocean view suite. The 24th floor view was breathtaking, and the room itself was lovely. The location is also good, though a bit removed from the main part of Waikiki. The building itself is definitely older (and not in a fun historic way). The hallways were hot, and the elevators are slow and very stuffy. The staff was a bit hit or miss, with some nice/helpful people, while others were not helpful and almost hostile. One (admittedly petty) quibble is that our room had a kitchen but no dishwasher, and the maids did not clean dishes (even glasses). This is absolutely a first-world problem, but nothing says tropical vacation like washing dishes by hand...

We stayed in an ocean view room for ten nights. The room was clean and spacious with a magnificent view of the lagoon and ocean. There was a full sized fridge and basic cooking utensils which meant that we could prepare some meals in our room. The bed was comfortable but very firm. The centre of Waikiki and the Ala Moana shopping centre were both an easy 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. We payed the resort fee which included access to the hotel shuttle, beach towels and beach chairs. While the towels and chairs were useful, the shuttle was slow and difficult to access. The beach near the Ilikai is amazing. We spent hours just swimming and relaxing there and did not use the hotel pool which looked a bit dated. I would definitely stay here again.

We had an ocean view room on the 5th floor that was just perfect! A 5 minute walk to the beach. 10 minutes to the Ala Moana shopping center, 15 minutes to the tourist area of Waikiki. This is also a pickup/dropoff point for many tour operators, so was incredibly convenient. I really couldn't fault this place and would happily stay here again.

I'm one of those people who research EVERYTHING about my holiday before I book anything. Because I was travelling with my twin 16 year old girls, my twin 13 year old boys and my husband I had some very specific requirements: 1) Plenty of space so we weren't tripping over each other 2) A full kitchen so the kids could eat whenever they wanted 3) A great view with ocean front balcony 4) A safe place for the kids to come and go from 5) A spot where I could watch the kids on the beach if I need to ;) The Illikai OCEAN FRONT room we booked was amazing and ticked every box. Our friends were staying right across the lagoon at the Hilton and when they saw our room they couldn't believe what we'd paid for our apartment. Every experience at the Illikai from the front desk to the pool, to Cinnamons restaurant, to the awesome cocktails was fantastic. For a family of six, I couldn't imagine a better apartment in Honolulu that the Illikai OCEAN FRONT apartments.

Rod is reception is THE BEST person on the front desk...they all re great but we found Rod the best..this was 2nd time.staying at Ilikai and we intend to make thia our resident hotel..we have recommended this hotelmto family and friends and everyone has had good things to say..great location....good transport just on the road...great hotel.amenities..washing machine n dryer on every floor..ABC store on ground level sells anythingbyou need from wine to doughnuts to bread and milk..great friday/sunday entertainment..good pool and beach is a minute walk..amazing views from the hotel..rooms are very clean. Price is fair and I intend to stay here again quiet soon..

Excellent hotel despite age. Most units privately owned I think and remodelled so a great selection. Perfect location to walk to everything and if lucky enough to have beach/lagoon view sitting out on the Lanai (verandah) is heaven. If high enough you can watch show on Hilton hotel each night and Friday night fireworks, Well run and clean, with 2 pools and restaurant.

We stayed here for 10 nights in May 2017. The apartment is clean and modern, with all the conveniences you will need to make your stay comfortable.Quiet split system air conditioning, full block out curtains and built in wardrobes help to make this a comfortable place to stay for a family break.There are coin operated washers and dryers available on each floor. Guests have full access to both Ilikai pools as well. The location is convenient to use as a base for your stay in Waikiki or if you are touring Oahu.

We, myself and my wife, and the families of our three grown children, together 11 persons, stayed in Ilikai Hotel for a week in July, 2017. We found the stay was pretty good. The staff was friendly, and accommodating; all tried to meet our needs.The hotel was part of a much larger complex. It occupies the top 5 floors of a big building. Below at the lower floors include normal residents in s number of floors, a time-share units in some floors, and maybe something else. It seems the building was originally constructed for condominiums, and subsequently partitioned into these setups.The hotel part consists of all suites, from Jr suite to 2 bedroom suites. (Not sure if there are any larger suites.) Its furnishings is good but not luxurious, with some pieces too old to be used for a 4 star hotel. Also, some suites lack certain necessary pieces. (For example, some suites do not have writing desks and chairs. No hotel rooms should be like this.) We learned later that it happens this way because the suites owners are individuals who would place whatever furnishing to their liking. The hotel management only manages the rental and caring of the property, like a hotel. We think the management should have a requirement of certain kind of furnishing uniformity before they could join the hotel.However, the hotel management tried to find ways to satisfy the customers' needs. This makes it work for those units that are deficient in their furnishings, as guests can request the hotel to bring to the suites what they need.The suites are quite spacious.
