All have a fully functional kitchen and adequate utensils and dishes. The TV's were good size. It includes internet in its fees. The location is good, at the end of Waikiki Beach. Its swimming pool is marginal, not quite fitting for a 4 star hotel. However, the hotel is next to Hilton Hawaiian Village which has a big lagoon and ocean beach. Hotel guests only have to walk a short distance to get to them,Overall, the hotel has good value for what it provides. But not quite luxurious as the name implies, unless some significant improvements are made. The best part of our experience is its friendly staff.

I had originally booked the HHV next door. But after I kept reading not so great reviews, I booked the Ilikai. And I'm so happy I did. We stayed here for 5 nights the first week of August 2017. We had room 2342. Amazing views!! We could see the ocean, the lagoon, pools below us, the fireworks, and the nightly HHV luau show. The room was well laid out and cozy. We even had a rollaway bed brought up and still had enough room to walk around comfortably. And there's a full kitchen. The walk to the beach and lagoon is about 5 minutes via a boardwalk. Nice and easy access to Waikiki beach and Duke's lagoon from the hotel. I liked the open and airy lobby. We used the valet and never waited too long or had any issues. We were also able to walk a lot of Waikiki beach and then into the city area.It was nice to return to the quiet hotel. The Ilikai front desk was never busy and they were always helpful with fresh towels and beach chairs. We also used their DVD and game rental kiosk every night. The room was clean and looked renovated. Housekeeping was awesome. We tried to leave tip money and a thank you note a few times but they never took it. I wonder if it's hotel policy to not accept it. We only had one noise complaint from the room above us. I swear it sounded like they were stomping and pounding wood. After the second night of this happening around 11pm, I called the front desk. They took care of it because we never heard a sound again. It was quiet and peaceful. Beds are hard. I requested a pillow top and it helped a bit. I think I just got used to it and jet lag set in because I slept well every night. They also sent up a bottle of wine and glasses because they heard we were celebrating a birthday and anniversary when we checked in. Love those special touches. After visiting the main drag of Waikiki hotels I was grateful for choosing to stay at the other end of the beach where it was less congested and quieter. We didn't use the pools, we were too busy visiting the island and beaches. Elevators were sometimes crowded but that was the only time we really interacted with other guests. And there's no ac in there so it wasn't a treat when they piled in sometimes. That's really my only complaint. We also tried Cinnamons for breakfast and it was tasty. There's a little market and gift shop in the lobby area if you need anything. We were sad to leave and would definitely stay here again.

Nice quiet room on the 25th floor. Positives - close to the Hilton next door which has good restaurants and better shops, the kitchen in the room is well equipped. Great view. 10 minute walk to Ala Moana.Negatives - bed was rock hard, lack of air con in corridors and elevators. Our housekeeping kept servicing the room later and later in the day, 4pm on our last full day there and it wasn't from a lack of a daily tip.

I rented a condo in the Ilikai, it was called a one bedroom which is actually a 500 square foot room in studio format with kitchen and large balcony. I did see photos of some rooms having sliding doors to separate the living and sleeping areas, my room did not have those sliding doors. The Aston hotel offers condos as hotel rooms with daily maid service, but I chose instead to rent through Waikiki Beach Rentals so I could select the specific condo room number with the exact view and on the floor I wanted. Renting a condo didn't give me daily maid service however, and the furnishings were older but comfortable. The property is kept up nicely, and the huge outdoor patio offers plenty of seating areas and live music with hula dancers Friday nights. Plus some seating indoors in the lobby if it's raining. It is a short walk to the Hilton Beach and just a little longer walk to the Ala Moana Beach Park and Ala Moana Shopping Center. You can catch a shuttle bus out front as well as the public bus, and taxis are available too. At least 10 restaurants within short walking distance. Great restaurant, Cinnamon's (coffee shop style with indoor A/C or outdoor patio seating) in lobby. My only suggestion for improvement would be for the management to keep the swimming pools open longer hours because they're not very big and it would be nice to swim or lounge during less busy times. Be specific in your selection of which room you prefer, as the views vary from Yacht Harbor, to Lagoon, to City depending on the wing of the building your room is located. I personally believe the Yacht Harbor view is stunning.

We recently visited Waikiki and stayed for a second time at the Ilikai - the hotel continues to impress us in many ways: the rooms are a great size, have full kitchen facilities ( full size refrigerator etc) and you're getting this at a very reasonable price. The staff are alway friendly and helpful - we arrived around 9am in the morning and our room was available for us which was fantastic after 9 hours in a plane. The hotel is in a quiet location but only a short distance away from the main hustle and bustle of Waikiki and Ala Moana Center. Finally, a big thank you to Patrice at the Ilikai for organising our booking and needless to say, we will definitely be coming back again.

This was a very economical option as we chose a 2 bedroom suite with kitchenette and two bathrooms. We could easily cook for ourselves and saved a fortune on breakfasts and dinners out. There was a shared washing machine/ laundry room on our floor and pool downstairs. The location is down towards the Ala Mona shopping centre and Walmart and Ross Dress a 10 min walk away.

We stayed 8 nights at the ilikai Hotel on Waikiki in apartment on the 19th floor.This location and the Hotel is fantastic. View over the lagoon, great pool and always desk chairs and towels. A close walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre. Restaurants close by. We would stay here again and recommend. Some apartments are privately owned so the condition can vary. This Hotel is older but clean and has good facilities.

While the hotel may not look as modern from the outside, it is a beautifully renovated hotel. Our suite accommodation was tremendous. Staff are great, particularly Rhonda (concierge) - she is outstanding.

This was our first time as a family to Waikiki and I would absolutely recommend staying at the Ilikai, for family, for couples, for solo travelers. Love that the rooms are big, have a mostly full kitchen (no dishwasher), and a good-size balcony. We ate breakfast and snacks out on the balcony every day and it was ... superb. We also loved that the Ilikai is a *very* easy walk to the Foodland Farms grocery store, the Ala Moana shopping center, and the rest of Waikiki. It was not too bad a walk to Walmart, either. We never needed transportation in Waikiki, other than our feet. But if we wanted to ride, lots of trolleys / buses have stops literally in front of the Ilikai, so super easy.We rented #1916 through vrbo.com / homeaway.com, and we had a great time. It appears rooms ending in even numbers -12 through -44 have a view of the (quiet) Ilikai pools, the less quiet Hilton kid pools (but it was not bad, not at all -- actually sweet to see all those little kids having the time of their lives), the gorgeous Duke Lagoon, the Hilton's Friday night fireworks (a serious boondoggle!), the Hilton's rooftop luau (watching the firedancers was fun), and a peekabo view of Diamond Head.The Ilikai driveway entrance is always busy but never felt congested or aggressive, with stairs, an escalator, and a small elevator around the corner for wheelchairs (my kiddo), luggage, and strollers.The entrance lobby is beautiful, open-air with monkey pod trees. I didn't really ever come up with the time to go and sit in that tranquil lobby but I admired the folks who did, very quiet and peaceful with a nice breeze. We did not interact with the front desk staff so I can't say anything about them. Four times we did go to the concierge; the first time the lovely young brunette with thin tortoiseshell frames was friendly and helpful, but the other tree times the women working there were more (less?) than apathetic, bored, absolutely disinterested in offering us (or the other visitors we saw) help. So we just looked things up ourselves and went from there. Very easy!The security staff, the maintenance workers, and the staff manning the pools were **fabulous**. I mean seriously -- we liked them. The lovely lady at the family swimming pool was so sweet offering to help me get my disabled child in the wheelchair lift (LOVE that the Ilikai has one!). The other pool has a built-in ramp and a suntanning deck (not sure what to call it -- very shallow water) which was terrific for us as well. The bathrooms at the family pool were also good and totally disabled-friendly. Thank you!!!The lagoon is very easy to access from the Ilikai with a long, smooth ramp just past the family pool -- loved that ramp. Because of it we were able to swim / do watersports there easily, as well as walk along the terrific beach boardwalk.At certain times of day the elevators can be very, very crowded and necessitate quite a wait: be prepared. We appreciated the bathers' elevator and routinely availed ourselves of it. I also appreciated the washers / dryers on the room floors -- it was USD$2.50 per wash, USD$2.50 per dry. Expensive but so, so convenient.If I were to return to Waikiki I wouldn't think twice about staying here again, and have already freely and repeatedly recommended to others staying at the Ilikai when in Waikiki. We loved having a kitchen (for breakfast and snacks), we loved the incredible walkability / location.

After staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for 4 nights this was an excellent alternative. As our flight was cancelled we needed to vacate the Hilton and chose the Ilikai as it was next door. It was a great choice and unlike the Hilton it was lovely and quiet with excellent service. We checked in at 9 am and were able to go straight to our room. The check in was smooth and straight forward. I would highly recommend this for either a couple of family. The rooms are very roomy with kitchen facilities.

Before reading this review if you are a very forgiving person and time and money is no object to you than you can skip my review and go on to the next . This is my second visit to the Ilikai, my wife and I fell in love with this place the first time we came here, nice comfortable room with kitchen and best of all ocean front view and Hilton's firework on a Friday night from the balcony. This time we were not as fortunate ,when we checked in to the ilikai on Aug 4 . We were first given a room on the 25th floor and the first thing we noticed once we opened the door was it was nowhere facing the water, partial ocean at best ( room 2538 ) if I am correct . We went down to the front desk and spoke with their supervisor on shift and she explained to us that the room is the same rate but she offered us a room simpler to the one we stayed on our last visit. (Room 2424)We thought that was the end of it till we came back from our dinner and I started noticing there was a few ants crawling on the kitchen table then my wife noticed there were ants on the kitchen wall , as we looked closer we noticed they were all over the room . We again call the front desk and had to be temporarily switch to a down graded room . The next morning, 7:30 am I was waken up by the sound of someone trying to open our room door , someone at the front desk has given another family our room thinking that it was empty and again I had to call the front desk .This is my vacation , I traveled close to 13 hours from New York and paid $ 5,000 plus dollars just to get here and every second of my time off is of great value to both my wife and I . With all this said , I leave it to the the reader of this review to decide if these unfortunate things are acceptable to you or not during your vacation. I do believe the Ilikai can do much much better than what had done so far .

Our family of 4 stayed in the 2 bedroom suite on the 25th floor for 4 nights, which is just one floor down from the penthouse. We had a rental with GPS, so the location was very easy to find. Once we arrived it was super busy at the entrance and parking was only via valet (which personally I don't prefer and rather have the option), but check in was fast and efficient. In fact the reception counter was never busy, even during check out, which is very surprising with all the rooms and guests the hotel has to accommodate. Our room was very spacious with a nice view of the Hilton and the lagoon. Decor was not new but clean which is the most important thing. Amenities were satisfactory. The aircon in one bedroom was making a loud noise, the water from the showers were too soft for our liking, plus there was no proper curtain in one bedroom to keep out the sunlight, but otherwise it was fine. With a proper kitchen, we cooked breakfast so never had to try the restaurant. Location-wise it is super convenient with a 5-minute walk to the beach, 10-minutes to Ala Moana mall, and an ABC store and McDonald's just across the road. Nothing wrong with the Ilikai, but I would probably want to try something new the next time I visit.

We stayed in apartment 1527 this time and it was as good as the one we had last year.The facilities are all you require for your holiday and with a full kitchen makes for a relaxing holiday.The apartments are always spotless and provided with plenty of linen for your stay.We booked through Waikikii beach rentals who we found very good to deal with.The location mid way between Ala Moana and Waikiki is perfect.The sunset from the bar downstairs is perfect

This is a nice hotel with good facilities. We enjoyed our time in the room and of course the views of the lagoon and the beach . To be honest this is more condo focussed property but none the less we enjoyed the experience.Staff were friendly and helpful overall.If we visit Hawaii again we would certainly consider this place .

We chose this property as it had 3 separate beds as my teenage boys weren't keen to share a bed. We booked through Waikiki Vacation Rentals and chose room 2014. It was fantastic and the balcony overlooked the lagoon, Luau at the Hilton and the Friday night fireworks. The room was in great condition and included beach towels as well. The facilities at the property were great with 2 swimming pools, right on the lagoon and beach, restaurants onsite and nearby too. It's a 10 min walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and the $2 shuttle stops right at the front door if you can't be bothered walking the 20 mins in to Waikiki. Highly recommend this unit.

Visited with family, had booked two bedroom condo with amazing views , hotel itself excellent but could be better in that coffee shop doesn't open until fairly late and hundreds of people,up,at 5 to,catch buses for different tours, McDonald's on corner opens at 6 and you have people running not a great way to start day. Cinnamons restaurant very good but don't understand why they didn't have a children's menu, great entertainment at night in hotel courtyard and a wonderful pub right across the road that has live music and dare I say allows you to smoke at the outdoor tables.

We use Shell Vacations Time Share... no we ABUSE Shell Vacations at the Ilikai. Well built. Sprinkler system for fire suppression. We couldn't hear our neighbors at all. Suites are large. Beds are to absolutely die for. Pillows are perfect. Old Hawaii 5.0. Hotel. We've stayed here 7 times over the years and will be coming back !! We brought our daughter and son inlaw here for their wedding gift and they loved it as well. Beautiful front entrance. Relaxing lobby. Overlooks the marina. You can take advantage of Aloha Friday Fireworks from next door. On the bus line. Everyone knows where the Ilikai is located. Uber picks up here. This place is perfect !!!

Rented a condo here in June which was very nice. This review is specifically for the hotel.Pro's: Location of Waikiki without the cost of The Hilton next door. Friendly valet staff if you choose to park at the hotel, but also close proximity to public parking garage that is about 25% cheaper. Nice walkway to the lagoon or the beach without the hassle of dealing with the traffic. Bus stop right outside.Con's: Older hotel where many are privately owned. We rented a private condo which was very nice and very recently renovated. Be sure you now what you are renting. Fitness center is for time share mostly, check when you rent to see if you have access if this is important to you. Overall we enjoyed our stay due to nice condo, however, we won't stay in Waikiki again due to traffic and noise at all ours of the night. Next time we will stay on the North Shore if we go back to Oahu.

We booked two rooms for an extended family group through Waikiki Beach Rentals, private condos. Overall the location, views & amenities were fantastic. Would stay again, but not at this condo.Watch out for the condo owners cancelling reservations. We booked several months ago (different condo on 21st floor) and about a month later the owner advised they were withdrawing the condo for the Summer. Full refund of our deposit but a bit of a hassle with currency exchanges and also trying to get two rooms nearby. Also our original room had a King bed, room divider & pull out couch. We were unable to find that again on this floor.2132 has two double beds. Not the most comfy - a bit stiff and not the nicest linens. Would have preferred Queens. Bathroom has a "Japanese soakingtub". If you have any flexibility issues DO NOT book a room with this. Huge barrier to climb in/out of shower. Luckily we got the other room with a normal walk in shower for my elderly in-laws.Overall the room was adequate but felt dated and a bit grubby. Was tidy and had a quick wipe down, but needs a good scrub and a do-over. Stove had dodged elements, no dishwasher so silverware and dishes were a bit crusty, lanai was filthy. I literally got out the mop and scrubbed it myself because my feet got sticky and black from walking around out there. My in-laws apartment was much newer, cleaner & had better furniture on the lanai.Two pools available with towels down there. Lovely warm water. No spa. Very strict rules about children jumping, diving, hanging on floating divider or being too loud. Was a bit much. A few grumpy old ladies floating in the deep end glared at us repeatedly. Shop in lobby pretty good , and ABC store either direction one block out the front door with more variety & a bit cheaper. Cinnamons restaurant really good and friendly staff, great for breakfast & pretty good for quick, casual family dinner. Short walk to lagoon, which was fun. 10-15 min walk to Ala Moana mall. Huge but you have to search out the non-elite stores. Gucci, Balenziaga, etc right in prime spot. If you want Old Navy you need to get a map & go searching.Definitely a the 'quiet' end of Waikiki. We walked down to Duke's for a drink one night (not so easy now as the beachfront boardwalk mostly gone) and couldn't believe the crowds & chaos.Plenty of rental car companies across the street at the Discovery Bay Ctr (small mall). Alamo, National, etc. we rented a very nice Jeep and did a drive around the island & went to the Outlet Mall (30 min drive West of Honolulu).Coffee shop on L floor quite good too for lattes, etc.We didn't have much to do with Ilikai staff as you get a code and just let yourself in. But they did help us order a taxi for the airport and were very helpful.Would happily stay again but would search for other condo which was newly refurbished and try to get queen /king or possibly stay at one of Ilikai hotel rooms as these seemed newer, with housekeeping & better quality furnishings.

We had an amazing time in waikiki and Ilikai #1944 was perfect. The multiple balconies overlooking the ocean and the lagoon were perfect. It was fantastic to relax outside in the morning to eat breakfast and start the day. Great views of the sunsetting over the mountain in the evenings as well. The beach chairs and boogey boards that were in the room were perfect to take to the beach, which we did every day. The location was walking distance to many convenient places for food or shopping. The room was clean and perfect size for the four of us. I would definitely recommend and would stay here again if we're lucky enough to go back!

Friendly and accommodating staff, and nice-appearing suites with kitchen/utensils, but dated plant plus apparently a "breakdown maintenance" philosophy makes this hotel an undesirable choice. A/C did not dehumidify, and after a second call, maintenance replaced filters which corrected problem - completely unavoidable if 3-month replacement schedule were in place. Drape pulls failed twice, and were left unrepaired. Super dirty rug on one side of bed.Saw two elevators (of 5) fail in 1 day, and not taken out of service for elevator mechanic to inspect/repair. Elevators have old style sensitive edges (rather than light beams) to detect late-entering passengers, resulting in several guests being pressured by closing doors before reopening. Pool hours unrealistic, closing at 7:30 PM, and no hot tub. Completely unacceptable at any per-night price, but a travesty at $370 per night. Until this hotel does a complete renovation AND changes its policy to preventive maintenance, avoid for convenience and safety.

A nice place in a great location and very good service. Lots of amenities in very nice hotel. Lounge had great views and a pianist. We had a great time here. It has a real nice modern feel to it overall.

This review is mainly for unit 325 which was rented through WaikikiBeachRentals.com. We were hesitant to book this property because of the age of the establishment. However, he pictures on the WaikikiBeachRental site looked great and the representative we spoke to made the property sound amazing. The Ilikai is certainly not a bad property, but didn't live up to our expectations. The grounds were well kept for the most part. The pools and lobby were nice. The property is in a okay location, but we felt there are much better choices to be more centrally located in Waikiki. For example, hotels around the beachwalk area would be nicer to access more by foot. Everything of interest to us seemed like a long walk from Ilikai. Luckily, we had a car and drove accessed most of Oahu that way. Again though, Ilikai is not a bad location. More important to note is unit 325. There was certainly lots of room in this unit, but did not live up to our expectations. The unit was advertised as being newly renovated. There were some newer appliances, maybe some furniture and some paint. However, it didn't feel updated at all. The pictures advertising the place looked MUCH nicer than it actually was. I guess it came down to the details. The beds were extremely uncomfortable. There were only two old run down A/C wall units for the entire unit. Both A/C couldn't keep the place cool and were in need a major cleaning. Just looking at the A/C units made you feel dirty. Our closet doors were falling off. Vents were full of dust. Little areas around the unit appear to have not been cleaned for a very long time (i.e. light switches, vents, etc.) . The balcony furniture was old and rusted. The balcony itself felt and looked dirty and clearly is not painted well. Be careful of what the pictures or agents advertise at the Ilikai. With all of that said, the place is certainly doable. We got by for our days here in Oahu and still had an amazing time. We just wouldn't rent again here. There are much better choices available that offer more value and updated rooms. Lastly, we should note, that we usually stay at a Marriott or Hilton and expect that kind of cleanliness when we arrive. The cleanliness of a condo/room means the most to us when traveling. This simply didn't hit the mark for us.

This property has been upgraded over the years. Our room has a partial ocean view, and it is spectacular. Close to beach and lagoon. Easy walk to shops and Waikiki beach. Rooms are clean. On site restaurant. We have stayed here before. It is our go to hotel.

My husband and I went to the Ilikai Hotel for our honeymoon. The staff was very friendly. Our rooms were always well kept, and the view of the city from our room was amazing. The location of the hotel is great. You can enjoy to beach or set-sail; either option is recommended. I can say I will not forget my stay and will return.

We stayed in a condo here with VRBO so our unit could be the owner's problem. However, the hotel amenities were terrible. The pool is run down, the pool bathroom was rusted and disgusting. The staff is great and is all the service in Hawaii, but the hotel is run down. It's really too bad because it was obviously great in its day. The location is super but it's a rip off.

Over priced and false advertisement. DONT GO. Needs improvement,amenities,TUBS, and overall the view was awesome but that's as far as it goes.My best advice is search diligently.The pictures will fool you

We stayed at Ilikai Apartment 1438 for 2 weeks from 13th May 2017. The apartment was light, airy and spacious. The kitchen was very well equipped with all the utensils required including a full sized fridge. The bathroom was very good with lots of space for all our things, they even included additional beach towels and extra bath towels. The Lanai was spacious with excellent views to the lagoon and the ocean, we had breakfast out here each day and drinks out here before we went to dinner each night. The king size bed was comfortable, pillows not so good if you like something firm. The apartment requires block out curtains as the sun rises every morning and comes into the apartment and wakes you up. There is a problem with the air con because there is only an over head fan in the living room and not in the bedroom. Also there is no reading light in the living room or on the lanai. There is an air conditioner in the bedroom but it is not split system so the person sleeping next to it got the full blast of the air and the air also pushed up the lamp on the bed side table and you had to be careful with the water glass on the bed side table. Apart from that the air con is very noisy, you can't sleep with the balcony doors open because at 4am every morning the delivery guys arrive at either Ilikai or the Hilton Hawaiin Village across the way. The car park exhaust fan is also very noisy constantly. When we tried to do our washing at the laundry facilities on our floor the machines were taken up by either hotel staff or contractors every day and even when we tried other floors everything was busy. The location is very good and the pool is great.

We stayed at the Ilikai in June 2017 in Room 2416. After days of researching and critiquing hotels, we chose the Ilikai and were very pleased with our decision. I booked this hotel on the internet through one of the Ilikai's "chat" reps. They beat any price I found on the discount sites! So please check with the hotel before booking on a discount site. Except for one small bump when we checked in (I booked for three people and they had me down for one and wanted to charge $90 more perDay) I showed the desk clerk a transcript of my convo with THEIR rep and she gave me the price the online rep. quoted. This desk clerk was the ONLY and I mean ONLY "somewhat unpleasant" staff we encountered here. Everyone else:maids waitresses, pool staff, valet, etc. were so welcoming and pleasant. So FYI if you book with their online Rep, have them send you a transcript of your conversation. Now on to the good part, the open-lobby is lovely, it has a fresh breeze flowing throughout and the water features added additional ambiance to the entry area. The veranda is a great place to rest, read or visit with others travelers. They have free DVD rental (with new releases much like Redbox rental machines). On Friday evening there is a fabulous fireworks show from the lagoon which was an additional perk, and our room had the perfect view!!!THE ROOM:Our room was very clean and the decorations were modern. We had a King Bed with a sofa bed. The bed and pillows were wonderful, and The sofa bed was very comfortable too. There were 3 adults in my party and the size of the room was adequate, but would get a little crowded with many more people. The views were breathtaking from our room #2416. The floor to ceiling windows/doors were great and allowed us to welcome the beautiful Hawaiian weather inside. While we didn't cook anything in the kitchenette, it was great to have a refrigerator for water/snacks and fresh coffee each morning. I will post pictures of the room.P.S. Our cleaning lady, Lei, was a jewel! She took very good care of us!THE BEACH: The beach is just a few steps away. While the Ilikai didn't have it own beach, Waikiki Beach is only about a 1/2 block away and visible from our room. The Hilton Lagoon is just out the back door and offers a lot of water activities. THE POOLS:Both pools were well maintained and not very crowded. We were able to get chairs each day without rushing to throw a towel down to reserve one. The small pool has a tanning ledge and water chairs. We loved it! There were very few children at the hotel during our stay, so very little splashing and sweet giggles.THE SHOPPING: There are a few shops in the hotel lobby, but the Ilikai is the perfect location for shopping. There are restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Many fun novelty shops as well as high end shops like Louis Vuitton and Kate Spade. Ala Moana drive is in the center of everything. Cinnamons:We are breakfast each day at Cinnamons. The breakfast food was very good with a delicious special each day! The hostess and waitresses were fantastic. I wish I would have written down their names.While this isn't a luxury resort, it is beautiful and full of Hawaiian culture!I will definitely stay at the Ilikai again, this hotel made our trip to Hawaii one to remember. I would have given 5-stars but there was no room service and the main elevators got a little crowded and had no A/C.

We stayed for 9 nights in June 2017 in apartment 602.Our impressions: all staff we encountered were helpful, friendly & efficient; our unit was exceptionally clean, with a good supply of towels etc.King size bed which was too firm for our liking; two night tables & good bedside lights to read by in bed.Safe box in wardrobe appreciated. A generous sized balcony (courtesy of the 1962-64 build date) with outdoor table & chairs perfect for breakfast & evening meal with marvellous view overlooking the boat harbour & ocean (in distance)Aircon. effective & efficient, but grille & filter very dusty on arrival-maintenance fixed it same afternoon, which we appreciated.Our unit was spacious, good oven & micro, huge fridge, attractive newish stone bench tops & tiled floor. Deficiencies in kitchen which could easily be remedied: no bowl or cover to cook in microwave, no wine glasses (housekeeping supplied them when we asked), a rubbish bin without a lid, no vegetable peeler or oven mitt (safety issue), only 1 white pvc chopping board (hygiene issue), no ice cube tray although there was an ice bucket in room. We used a dinner plate as a fruit bowl.Curtains did not meet when closed; curtains also look old & dirty in parts. Funny little daggy squares of old carpet in wardrobe.

We stayed on the 8th floor and our rental was through Waikiki Beach Rentals. The condo had two comfortable beds, as well as a nice leather pull out couch. The kitchen and bath were modern and nicely stocked. The balcony overlooked the lagoon and beach-- stunning! We did not visit the restaurant, but it was busy daily,so my guess is that it is good! We did visit the coffee shop on the first floor, which made great lattes. There is a convenience store on site, as well, for snacks, drinks and even souvenirs. The penthouse restaurant was a great place for happy hour and apps. The view from up there was absolutely beautiful, as we visited during sunset. I would recommend this hotel/resort to couples or small families. I can't wait to go back!

Loved this hotel. The location is amazing and the retro feel is fun. Just a 15 minute walk to the Ala Moana shopping mall and it is located on the trolley line stop out front as well as the bus. Steps away from the beach and the Hawaiian Hilton lagoon. Loved this hotel and our stay here was great!

We stayed at Ilikai Hotel Condo (1006) 10th floor & booked via Hawaiian Vacation rentals for 1 week. The condo was quite small ( due to having 2 double beds in the room) & a little dated, but suited us perfectly. The magnificent views overlooked the Harbour & Ocean. Each morning we woke up to this awesome view. The hotel is a 7min walk to Ala Moana shopping centre. It has the trolley bus stop at the door & the local bus stop. ABC convenience store, Restaurants & sports bar across the road. A very central location & not in the thick of the busyness of Waikiki. You can walk along the beach track from the hotel to Waikiki beach, about 30min easy walk. The hotel is next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village where a fireworks show is held on the lagoon every Friday night. The hotel has Cinnamon restaurant that serves all day food. There is a restaurant on the top floor which serves cocktails from 3.30 at Happy Hour prices. Pool area is great & the gardens and courtyard very clean & well maintained. The booking staff are helpful & pleasant. Security is present around the hotel, which is great. They had hula classes, hula entertainment & music in the courtyard several nights. I would highly recommend this hotel. I would also highly recommend this room. Our Jetstar flight was delayed by 11hrs back to Oz. We contacted the rental place & was given the room to use for FREE for the extra day, until we left at 8pm..other travellers we spoke to either had to pay for an extra day or move out as scheduled. We were really impressed with this service & very grateful. I will definitely be back to Ilikai & room 1006. Also has keyless entry.

Loved staying here for our family holiday! Such amazing views where we could watch the fireworks, surfers and people swimming in the lagoon. The hotel accommodated for our 1 year old with a high chair and cot. We loved the kitchen facilities and extra floor space. Easy walk along the beach to the main street of shops. Only thing that would've made it better would be to have a table and chairs to sit around on the balcony and eat meals on, as the low table isn't quite suitable.

Loved the apartment. Big queen size bed and the fold out sofa bed was comfy and a great size also. It was clean and had all we needed in the apartment. There was myself, my partner and our daughter staying in the room. Suitable for 4 adults. I was able to whip up some quick meals in the kitchen. And the laundry room wasn't too far away from our room so we were able to wash, which is handy because we didn't pack much so we could fit more shopping in. A couple of bars near by which are nice and the location is about a 15 min walk into Waikiki itself, beautiful at night with the coastal breeze. Would definitely recommend .

The Ilikai building is a couple of blocks from the swimming lagoon and beach behind the Hawaiian Hilton in Waikiki and similarly, about 3 blocks from the Ala Moana Shopping Center. It is away from the busy hustle-bustle streets of Kalakau Street where 90% of the tourist congregate, so you are not fighting the world for space. The condo conditions are a little aged but adequate. We saw many families with small children staying here due to the proximity of the lagoon pool near Hilton which is safer for children to use than the beach. There is also a regular swimming pool in the complex if salt water fun is not for you. The building has most of the conveniences one would need ranging from a ABC-like store to the Cinnamon restaurant in the building to the McDonald's across the street. One con to this place is like the con to most other places in Waikiki and that is parking for cars. You can valet park at $28 per day in this building or park in the lots behind the building at $1 per hour. Tip: If you need to park you car for no more than 10 hours (which would be returning from dinner or an evening drink at a bar) with NO in-and-out privileges, go to the building next to the Ilikai Marina Condos on Hobron Lane. They have a parking special which cost $7 for 10 hours so you could leave your car there overnight and retrieve it the next morning. It is also safer as it is indoor parking garage versus parking out in the street. However, be warned that you need to retrieve the car before the 10 hours are up or else you would be charged $8 for each overtime hour the car stayed parked there.

We booked a condo with Hawaiian Vacation Properties and were very happy with their customer service as well as the condo. It had everything we needed, right down to great beach chairs. I miss the beautiful view already (#1118) and sitting out on the large lanai every day. Full kitchen, great wifi, long distance back to Canada, it was perfect. We loved the keyless entry. Close to Waikkii, shops, restaurants. Loved the history of the hotel, felt very retro.Kat from Hawaiian Vacations was understanding, patient, and very helpful. Would book with them again. Book here, you wont be disappointed!

I love classic older hotels and those that have modernized their facilities get a big tick from me right from the start.My husband and I traveled to Hawaii to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and we stayed in a Junior Suite for 6 nights at the Ilikai.It is a very rare occurrence to stay at a hotel and have absolutely NO need to contact reception for the whole period of your stay, but that is exactly what happened... this meant that our every need was catered for without having to ask.. big big tickWell done to all the staff !!!We stayed in a Junior suite with a full kitchen.. the things I loved Recently upgradedRoom was cleaned each day to a high standard and there were no broken fixturesRoom and balcony are large that gave u plenty of room to moveA large fridge for everything u could need + adequate crockery, cutlery and pansIndividual wi-fi modems in room, so super fast internetYou don't need your room key to operate the air-conditioner so u can go out and leave the air-conditioner on and come back to perfect room temperature.The in-hotel convenience store is a little bit more expensive then the ABC down the road but it has everything u may need or forgot to packThings I didn't like Parking- Parking is extra on top of your room and resort fee and the valets are slow. I didn't like that I couldn't call ahead so that our car was waiting as soon as we arrived downstairs. There were some days we were waiting more then 10mins for our car to be be available. There were also times we when we arrived back at the hotel behind a bank of cars that were waiting to be parked.We arrived early (1pm) off an international flight and our room wasn't ready. I knew check in wasn't till 3pm but we were really tired and we're hoping to check in early and sleep. So we a done pre-check-in and were sent away for a couple of hours until our room was ready. When we arrived back at 3.15pm our room still wasn't ready and they tried to change our room but we had booked a specific room so we could watch the fireworks from our room, so I told them we would wait for the room we booked. We then had to wait another 20mins for our chosen room and were eventually settled in our room just after 4pm.It might be worth noting that just as ppl are willing to pay extra for a late check out there are many ppl that would be willing to pay extra for an early check-in especially when coming off international flights. Give ppl a choice early check in or late check out, not everyone is coming in on late flights from the US mainland, a lot of ppl do visit Hawaii from Australia and they arrive early and check out early.We done a lot of research before we left home on things we wanted to do, so we had no need to use the concierge service but other guests told me they were excellent.We did not have the opportunity to eat at the restaurant so I am unable to review that. There are plenty of places to eat around the hotel, we loved the sports bar across the road. This hotel is also close to the Ala Moana center which is a great place to shopWould I stay here again and recommend it to my friends - Absolutely

We stayed in a Shell, Timeshare room:studio. The unit is well equipped with kitchen and supplies. The unit is nice. The property, pool and hallways could use a face lift. The condo is in a nice location over looking the marina, next to the beach and within walking distance to shopping and activities on Waikiki. Laundry is located on all the floors: $2.50 for a washer & dryer use: bring your own laundry supplies. Free Wi-Fi. There are 2 pools on the property:1 on the 2nd floor, wading pool and 1 on the main floor. There are 2 restaurants on site: went to the one on the main level for breakfast, was not impressed. Next time I will venture out on the street to find a better breakfast. Parking is only Valet for $28 a day. Across the street by Red Lobster for $20 a day. The beds are comfortable and the shower is ok, could use new shower heads updated. The Air conditioning in unit is good but a little noisy. The staff are friendly.

This place is really nice, close to store's, restaurant's. A shuttle picks you up right outside the lobby door and brings to the mall and picks you up later when your done. I HOP is across the street and Outback is less then a block away same side. The room we had has a full size fridge and stove it was a very big unit. The pool area was great and they supply towel's.

The service we received was great, the grounds are well-maintained, and the location to the beach was good (very short walk to lagoon and beach). I appreciated the ability to checkout chairs and beach towels. The kitchen in the room was really convenient for making breakfast or a quick sandwich if we did not feel like getting "cleaned up" again before/after beach. I'd love to give this hotel a higher rating, but the bed was hard as a rock. Seriously. Slept on the sofa our third and last night there because I ached from the firm bed. We both did. If you can tolerate an extra, extra firm mattress, then you might be ok, but this made it hard for either of us to sleep.

We had a great time here. The location/view is great. It was very clean and fully equipped with everything we needed. Our contact Paul was very nice and let us know about activities going on. Love that it has a parking space. Has wifi.

Ilikai is a well placed apartments close to all shopping and restaurants, there are three views of either the view over the boat harbour looking towards the airport, or overlooking the man made lagoon or looking up the coast toward diamond head. The view i selected was over looking the harbour / marina.The room is self equiped with all cooking facilities and crockery, washing machines and dryers are located on every floor along with dryers and cost $2.50 each per load.All tours and information can be obtained from the concierge desk located in the foyer.The accommodation is highly regarded and recommended for both families, couples and singles as the people here are very friendly.

this is one of the older hotels in Waikiki. However, well maintained, great views and good location. It is really close to the beach and some shops, however there is quite a hike to get to the heart of waikiki beach from the hotel.

The room was great, large and comfy. Excellent bed and bathroom and a great view, even if we could not see Diamond Head, we could see the ocean and the harbour. Nice bar and restaurant. Friendly and helpful staff (even deliver ice when you need it) and overall a quiet, clean and well priced hotel to stay. Very popular and even a decent and convenient smoking area down the back past the bar...

2 weeks at Ilikai, and no major problems.Good location at the start of the Waikiki strip with mall close by and bus stop in front.Building showing its age, with several days of sections of lobby being roped off due to leaks from the ceiling, and over crowded super slow elevators, as some are not working.Rooms are basic, but functional, no sound from above or below, no bath tub, only a shower. Very high parking rates for vallet only parking kept us from renting cars most days.Our room looks nothing like the pictures the resort posted, more like what you would expect from say... 20 years ago.This is by no means a posh luxury resort, but the rooms are clean and serviceable, and the location is nice Staff is friendly and accommodating.We would come back, but only if the price is right, nothing particularly memorable about this place one way or the other.

We came across our Studio Condo through VRBO (Vacation Rental by owner) it was on the 17th floor with views of the harbour and ocean, fully self contained and perfect for what we wanted. King size bed, full kitchen, lounge area and television with free wifi. Through contact via email with the owner we organised everything as well as payment and had no problems. Having been to Hawaii before and stayed in a hotel last time we wanted to have the option of dining out or being able to sit on our Lanai having dinner and enjoying the view. Would throughly recommend.

We had just come from Disney Aulani before our stay at the Ilikai so there were very big shoes to fill. The Ilikai is ok not really good not really bad! We booked through a separate booking agent so I am aware that in this case we stayed in a privately owned condo. Although renovated rooms still a very old hotel. Old and slow lift and worn and dirty carpets through the hallways. Good points though however- very handy to have a washer and dryer on each level, easy access to lagoon in front of HHW, handy walk to Ala Moana shopping. It was a very long walk into main part of Waikiki but we did it a few times with kids but we also took the taxi a few times as well $12. Approx one way.Some handy shops in the lobby- good coffee shop and mini mart.Pool not really desirable to us as we had small kids with us. No safe in room either which made us feel a little less safer about leaving passports and valuables in the room but it was all fine during our stay. I wouldn't personally stay again but may recommend to friends/family looking for somewhere budget friendly in Waikiki!

My family and I only stayed one night I wish we were there longer. It wasnt a problem when I upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite the day before. Our room was set in a corner so we enjoyed both the ocean and view of the city it was perfect. The front desk was very efficient and friendly the only issue I experienced was on our departure day I was short of cash but didnt want to leave him emptyhanded so I gave him what I had and was going to find an Atm in the lobby believe me I work in customer service so I knew I needed to fix that but was a little shocked when he made a comment that I didn't tip him enough. Other then that our stay was great my family and I will be back!! Beautiful property clean rooms you wont be disappointed.

Great location for those we don't want to be in the hustle of the Waikiki strip but only a 10 min walk away either along the beach front or the shopping strip or 5 min walk to the Ala Moana Centre which is great after a meal Rooms had a great size balcony for water and sunset views and a coffee Aroma coffee downstairs serving g8 espresso Aussie coffee flat whites the staff so helpful and very clean I would stay again .

Thank you to Wes & his team for making us feel special during our (silver wedding anniversary) short stay here. (Mahalo !) & Many thanks for recognising our special anniversary ;-) a nice touch.We stayed in the hotel part on the 22nd floor with ocean view & what a view - looked out over the lagoon and ocean. Room was very clean and well equipped with kitchen & lounge areas.  The location was ideal - walking distance to everything you need & a big shout out to U-GoMobility who delivered a mobility scooter for us as my wife has MS and this is an essential piece of kit to allow us both to go out and about and explore. A very friendly and personal service (don't hesitate to call them) thanks a million to Hugh and his very professional team. This is a perfect location for Honolulu & a wonderful hotel with very welcoming staff.Our only regret was that we didn't stay longer - but what a great excuse to go back !! When we return to Hawaii - this is the place - no question where we will be staying.

We stayed for 6 nights in May in room 241 which was a Luxury Junior Suite. Everything about the room was perfect from the king bed to the furnishings and fully equipped kitchen. We also had a huge balcony overlooking the Marina. We loved the cocktails at Cinnamon's which has beautiful views but never had a meal there.There is a few restaurants near by and you can get the trolley bus at the front of the hotel straight into Waikiki for $2.There is a concierge desk in the foyer which we used to book 3 tours, 1 being to Pearl Harbour and the other to the shopping outlets and both went as planned. Unfortunately we were left extremely disappointed after booking a Sunset Cocktail Cruise for our last night which also happened to be our 43rd Wedding Anniversary and the reason for going to Hawaii in the first place. We paid $170 and were given a confirmation with the wrong pick up time. The correct time was 30 mins before the time we were given so after standing for 30 mins thinking they were running late we went back to the Concierge desk at Ilikai and even thought they admitted theyhad given us the wrong time we were made feel like it was our fault. It took over half and hour for them to agree to give us a refund but no other compensation to make up for their error which spoiled our night and we were left all dressed up with no other plans. I have since emailed the Ikilai but all I got back was sorry for the conventions. No one seems to get this was to be the highlight of out holiday which was a trip of a life time for us. My advise is be very wary of making booking at the Concierge desk at Ilikai as I would hate anyone else to be left as disappointed as we were. It would of been nice if the Ilikai had even offered us a voucher for dinner or even a couple of drinks at the bar but nothing, I was left to walk away in tears on what was to be a special night.

After much research we came across this hotel through an email with a very good deal on it. Although being an "older" hotel (it was used in the intro for the original Hawaii 5 O), it has been very nicely up dated and the interior is very comfortable without being ostentatious. Our room was a 500sqft studio and was very well appointed and had a full kitchen with large appliances. The room had been totally refurbed and was a pleasure to stay in. The hotel location is excellent, being next to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, with some good restaurants, a 10 minute walk to the Ala Moana centre and the beach or lagoon very close. The Pink shuttle line stops at the front door, so its only a 10 minute ride to downtown Waikiki. It was a very pleasant 15-20 minute walk back from there. Being at the end of Waikiki beach , the hotel is not surrounded by hordes of tourists and feels more beach-like than if it was in the middle of Waikiki.

Stayed here for 4 nights over Easter break, watched fireworks from our balcony on the Friday, great condo with everything you need, prepared our own breakfast each morning, paid extra for an early check inn, but owners let us have a late check out of 7.00pm for free which was so helpful as our flight was at 10.30pm. We really enjoyed the restaurant on the rooftop level Sarento's. Walking distance to lagoon beach, eateries etc would definitely stay here again, thanks again.

We rented unit 2016 and it was great! Lagoon side, great view from balcony. Condo had everything we needed. It was expensive to park but at the end of a long day valet service was worth every cent. Very convenient location....early morning walks down to Waikiki beach were amazing.We rented unit through Waikiki Beach Rentals and had no issues at all.

We've been here a couple of days and are just loving Ilikai is a great place to stay. The rooms are very clean and the staff is very nice. We have a ocean/lagoon view and we love it. A lot of room with a great full kitchen, large fridge, updated appliances, full stove. Marble bar with nice couch and king size bed. Bathroom very clean with marble tops and a great shower. One thing that's a bit different about this hotel is it's at the very end of Wakiki beach or just past it some but has a lagoon which then attaches to a beach. We love having both, next to that is nice little harbor with all kinds of small to medium vessels. It's not too crowded because it's off the beaten path a bit, within walking distance. All kinds of shops and Restaurants close by. There are two restaurants attached one is called Cinnamon's GREAT place with affordable prices and food is great. The other is on the top of Hotel and we have NOT tried it yet but plan to. Lastly this hotel is the hotel we found the best price compared to all the other "Beach Hotels" They have a $18 fee which includes wifi, free tram through Wikiki, free beach towels and chairs. Well worth the fee.

I usually stay 5 star but decided to try a condo and after much research we used WaikikiBeachRentals.com to book Room 2124 in the Ilikai Hotel.From the booking to the arriving this was a wonderful experience. So simple and stressfree. Simply type in the code and you're in your condo. No losing a key but still feeling very secure.Suite 2124 is fabulous with modern furnishings, spacious living area, modern and clean with a view to die for.. A nice bathroom with lovely little bath which is important to me as I love a bath everyday.The view was just fantastic and better than a lot of 5 star hotels I've stayed in.The room had 2 comfy double beds, large TV, quiet ac, a large fridge/freezer, kettle & toaster.... in fact everything we needed to enjoy our stay. We got 5 towels, handtowels, 1 bathmat ( 2 would have been nice) and 2 pool towels. There is a good laundry on the floor (save your quarters) and a large trash room to empty your hundreds of shopping bags into!!I loved my first experience with a condo and will now always stay here when in Waikiki. The company was excellent to deal with and the standard of room and ease of booking a delight.My 2 daughters and I stayed here for a fraction of the cost of a similar standard hotel, the only thing missing was the daily cleaning service and this can be bought if desired ( not cheap though).There are 2 restaurants and a great market shop in this hotel We ate at both restaurants and highly recommend them both. (Cinnamons & Sorrentos).We loved Waikiki Beach rentals and the Ilikai Condos. I already have several friends booking here now. Thank you for a fab holiday in a fantastic Condo. We will most definitely be back to Suite 2124.

Stayed in this building for a second time, chose the city view this time. Condo/hotel is great, very clean, well taken care of and a 5 minute walk to Ala Moana mall. With a new grocery store that opened up near by, it makes it so much easier to do your own groceries and save a boat load of money on horrible restaurant food. Highly recommend it.

been here two hours and nothing but frustration and annoyance. first, a trainee at check in was confused, but the supervisor stepped in and only made things worse and somehow shut down the credit card terminal. took 10 minutes. got to room. not bad, but there concept of "full ocean view" didn't come with mention that it was framed by buildings. tried to sign on internet, but system was so confusing of trying to match numbers on a router to a slew of possible numbers on my phone i had to call an engineer. then i had him try and fix the tv where half the channels were fuzzy. that was 30 minutes ago - he left to get a part and hasn't come back. so i figured i order some room service. searched the room, no menu. called front desk. they sent a guy up with the menu but turns out they don't really have room service - just a guide to order from neighborhood restaurants - with a $7 delivery charge and who knows how far. and this is a hotel with a couple of restaurants but not set up to deliver to rooms? also, the TV is small, particularly given i'm in a suite so the bed is now far away - and they don't offer in-room movies. well, went to plug in my computer, ipad and phone to charge - guess what, no outlets near the bed and no USB ports, either. now the guy, 20 minutes later is back trying to fix the tv and about to shut off the internet, so i have to send this off and who knows when that will come back and i get some work done - but i guess i have to go out to find some food anyway. it's an old hotel and there has to be better in a strip of grand old hotels.

Good morning breakfast on our balcony. Can't get enough of this view. This Airbnb is amazing the apartment has the best king bed and pillows. Kitchenette, island bench comfy couch in front of a good sized flat screen. Clean bathroom shower.Ilikai 17th floor with views over the pools to Hawaiian Hilton across to diamond head and the lagoon and marina. The pools are pretty average but the lagoon is just across the walk bridge. We can watch the hiltons rooftop luau for here each night. The trolley picks us up and takes us back from out the front to any where we want to go even places we have never thought of. We are just jumping on and off when ever we hear happy hour. The best thing is there is a happy hour here nearly every hour of the day... this is living. $250 aud a night recommend

Travelled here as two couples after cruising to Hawaii. Booked the condo on the 17th floor through Ali'i Beach Rentals and all seemed good until we arrived and tried to access the condo and the wifi inside. Eventually got access only to find the place dirty. Manager attended next day and refunded a portion of our rent which was fine. So apart from an initial hiccup which was compensated for, we really enjoyed the space and views offered. Furniture was comfortable and overall this was a great stay.

We stayed in a studio apartment on the 14th floor for 10 days. It had everything we needed such as an oven , full size fridge even a blender and toaster.When there was an issue with the internet connection we spoke to the lady in the management office. She was very nice and the same day it was fixed.The location is great right next door to the lagoon. The staff are all friendly the lifts are fast. The convenient store in the lobby is handy and not too badly priced.

My family stayed at room 2002. The room was clean, kitchen had all the necessities we need and had a beautiful view of the marina. The main lobby of the hotel has a coffee shop, souvenir stores, and two restaurants ( Cinnamon's and Sorento ). Cinnamon offers the best guava pancakes! The hotel location is close to bus stops and shopping areas. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki.
user_name:
Cruiser22747843440
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed in room 1232 for 11 fabulous nights. The room was perfectly clean, well appointed, very comfortable with a great view. The closest thing to a complaint we had during our stay was that part way through our stay people moved in upstairs who at 7:00am each day sounded like they were rehearsing for a revival of Stomp. This luckily only lasted for a few days.I am a little worried that if I tell everyone how good it really was the apartment might not be available for us next time and there will be a next time for sure. I loved watching the sunset over the beach each night with a few cocktails on the lanai and the suite was perfect to watch the fireworks. All in all it was amazing

Whilst the room had nice furnishings, was clean and well maintained and had a lovely view of the sunset over the marina, the bathroom was rather outdated and the kitchen did not have a dishwasher. However, these are minor points that did not really bother me as we did not spend much time in the room and were enjoying the beach and nice weather. The issue that really irritated me and one which I would caution others to be aware of when checking in is the hold that is taken on your credit card. I was told when checking in that one nights accommodation would be put on my credit card as a hold. Imagine my surprise when my credit card was declined whilst shopping a few days later and after checking my bank statement I found our entire 8 night stay had been charged to the card. After speaking to reception about this and explaining that it was only supposed to be a one night security and that I did not want to use that card for accommodation as it was an Australian card and would result in added fees, they explained that it was only a hold and that they could take the hold off if I provided them with a different card. I settled our account at this time using an American card and was assured that the hold should be off my card within a couple of hours. Same issue when I went to use my card again a couple of days later. After spending 10 minutes on a international call to my bank in Australia, I was informed that unless the business contacts the bank directly to remove the hold it will sit in pending for up to 10-14 days and that rather than going to the effort of contacting the bank, most businesses just wait for this period to lapse for the pending amount to be returned to the account. And if the bank is contacted directly it can still take up to 72 hours. That may be fine if it was one nights accommodation as I was informed at checking in, but the entire 8 night stay! Is this actually legal for the hotel to take a hold of the entire stay? I have never heard of this happening before, one nights accommodation yes, or a record of the card details in case the account isn't settled, but putting a hold on an entire stays worth of accommodation when you first arrive?! I will definitely be pursuing this matter further with relevant authorities. So, end result was I was unable to use my credit card for the entire trip which limited the shopping and activities I planned on doing, it was just lucky that I was not solely relying on this card for the trip or it would have been an absolute disaster. Please be very careful when checking in and do not use a card that you plan on using for your holiday or you will be in for a rude shock. Oh, I am now back in Australia and guess what, the amount is still pending on my card!In addition to this, reception staff were not very proactive regarding provision of information, it did not even feel like checking into a hotel as we were provided with no information regarding facilities or activities upon arrival. It was not until our 3rd day when we stopped into the timeshare office (separate to the hotel) whilst walking past to the beach to ask about volcano tours (as they looked like a tour booking office on first glance) that the lovely chatty man in the office told us there was a sundeck with pools on level 2 and an Italian rooftop restaurant, if it had not been for him we would not have even known there were pools in the hotel. I realise that you need to ask to receive information but usually at "luxury" hotels, reception staff go out of their way to inform you of all the facilities etc. available. My advice would be to give this hotel a miss and book into another nearby hotel with a good reputation such as the Hilton. The rates are comparable, the service is not.

for anyone looking for someplace to stay in the heart of the action in Honolulu seriously needs to consider staying at the Ilikai Hotel. Located between Waikiki Beach and Ala Moana Beach Park - you are in very easy walking distance to all the major attractions in the Waikiki. The property itself is a gem - rooms large, quite and clean...most have kitchenettes. The staff friendly and professional. I've stayed at this property more than a dozen times and its never disappointed. If shopping is your thing, you are 10-minute walks to both Ala Moana Mall and Kalakaua Ave. Out the back of the property you are right at the west end of Waikiki Beach. Rental cars are available close by if you need one. This is my Honolulu Go To!

The Illikai would have to be one of the best places to stay at. It is very central to everything, buses, Ala Moana Shopping Centre, The Hilton Lagoon (which is awesome for families to swim at), the main beach which stretches along Waikiki and of course the main strip for Waikiki shopping. When I return to Hawaii this is definitely where I will be staying again, the coffee downstairs is really good, and they have amazing acai bowls for the health freaks. It was also conveniently located across the road from a big ABC store as well as McDonalds for those days when you're hungover. You have Addiction nightclub literally around the corner from you which plays really good RnB music. The list is endless!!! Highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in Waikiki

The Ilikai is a very special location...you just cannot get a better location than the Ilikai, but there are at least five companies who rent/manage the 1000 room in this iconic building. Reading some of the reviews some people have not had a good experience..but for some reason they did not write down the number of the room they were staying in..or the company they used. Others write glowing reviews..and DO give the number of the room they are staying in and the company they used.We use Aloha Condos each time and the information is accurate..and we have never been disappointed.

I stayed for one night at this hotel and it was gorgeous! I booked a room with a view and it was amazing. It has some cute shops on the ground floor. You need to try the breakfast bagel from the coffee shop down stairs! There is also a small grocery store if you need any essentials. Rooms usually come with a kitchen so you can cook too. It is a bit pricey but worth it. It is 15 minutes walk to Ala Moana and 20ish minutes walk to Waikiki beach. Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed for five wonderful nights at the Ilikai. Our room was well appointed, clean and spacious with great views. The bed was comfortable, had great linen ensuring a good nights sleep. The pool is small but sheltered so on the odd day you don’t want to go to the nearby logon or beach it’s a great option. We had a wonderful time here and have recommend the hotel to our friends.

Nice open, breezy foyer and reception area with friendly staff willing to help. The rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable with nice lanai's. We had rooms overlooking the boulevard which was great to sit outside at night, have a beer and watch the sights. One of our party had a pool view room which provided additional space.

This was a quick 96 hour business trip to Hawaii. My office made the hotel reservations. I was a little apprehensive with the property being split hotel and condominiums. My stay couldn't have been any better. Check in was easy and the room was almost perfect. The only thing that could have been better would have been a water view, but the city view was great. The location was ideal for me, during some down time I walked around the area and would definitely stay here again given the opportunity.The restaurant was so-so, the gift/convenience store had everything you could want.

We were staying next door but when they could not guarantee a room overlooking the water (tho on site said it was) we looked at this place. Rented the condo through the owner, had no issues & she was more then willing to assist us when we had some family issues back home and was going to change our booking. But we ended up there as planned & had an absolute ball! The view is to die for. They had cancelled Friday night fireworks and happened to have them on Saturday night (we arrived Saturday morning) so we sat on our balcony watching them. Location was great - we walked pretty much everywhere but when on tours the bus picks you up from the Ilikai anyway so our friends had to walk down to us.Seems to be older place but maybe renos done but we had no qualms with the place - expected it to be older, obviously with that comes some work that needs updating like grout etc in bathrooms but we weren't there to nitpick and enjoyed our stay. Everything we could need was in the kitchen and free wifi to keep up with family we left back home!

This was our fourth time at the Ilikai and third Condo we have rented through Kat at Hawaiian Vacation Properties and as usual, the Condo was immaculate. The Condo is one of the better ones we have stayed in - nice and bright with an upgraded kitchen. The bathroom is very clean and a good size vanity. Great supply of towels (both bath and good beach towels) and some nice little extras like bottled water, starter pack of soaps, dishwasher tablets, loo paper, etc. There was also an Esky/Cooler/Chilli Bin and a whole bin of goodies out on the balcony for the beach. You won't find a better spot in Waikiki for the Friday night fireworks.We have always found Kat to be professional but warm and will be returning in September. Thanks again Kat.

Our Studio was more like a one bedroom condo with a full kitchen minus a dishwasher.The view couldn't be beat. It is situated on the beach and next to the yacht harbor. The beach walk extends all the way to Waikiki.They will see us again!

Stayed here with my family for a little over two weeks, next time if we stay here we would try to stay in a condo closer to the beach. they do a quick clean before you arrive, and it's nice to have a kitchen, BBQ, washer/dryer, but definitely was surprised by the cleanliness. We found old makeup, pizza dips, among other things making me doubt that a full and proper clean had been done in a while.

We stayed here for 6 nights. The room was fantastic - nice and roomy. Loved the fact that there was a full kitchen with a decent size fridge. We had a stunning sunset view room on the 25th floor which was amazing. Nice and close to Ala Moana Center, trolley buses stop right outside hotel. Staff were great :)Only downside was some inconsiderate people staying in the room directly below us, smoking weed on their lanai, which drifted straight up to our room. We advised security, who came up about 10 minutes after the fact and advised us they would have to catch them in the act. So we gave up on reporting them again!
user_name:
Trudy B
New Plymouth, New Zealand

review_body: It was the first time that my big group of family and friends (18 people included adults and children) came to Hawaii and stayed 9 nights in Ilikai hotel.We were so disappointed of how a 5 star hotel and resort treated us so badly. Why do I say this? There are some major reasons below:1. Poor services at the front desk. The staff worked so slow on the check in time. There was 3 staff at the front desk but it took us 2 hours to do the check in after a very long flight from Melbourne, Australia (11 hour flight).2. As a big group, we had 40 pieces of checked in and carried on luggages but there was no one to help us to carry these luggages to the 22nd floor. We did it ourself! It took us another one hour to bring these super heavy luggages to the 22nd floor by hand! Remember, we had elder people who are 83 and 75 years old, and 4 children who are 7,10,13 years old.3. Stupid surcharge "resort fee"!On the last day when we checked out, the front desk staff required us to pay USA $280 per room for the "resort fee" for 9 nights. We were in shock as we booked this hotel online and all the payment had been done 1 month before we came. So where was this stupid surcharge fee from? We hadn't been told about this when we checked in, which made us so upset. We felt like this hotel is a scam who robbed our money in a silent way! We asked why we paid this and what the resort fee was. The staff just said: "This is the hotel policy. All customers have to pay." They kept our credit card information when we checked in, so what could we do? They charged us after we left the hotel to the airport back in Melbourne. We were so so upset because we had not been told about this fee. If we had been told at the beginning, we wouldn't book this hotel or change another hotel right away! No respect for the customers at all!What is resort fee? As the staff said It is the coffee in my room that I used because I thought they were here for free as normal; wifi inside my room which we didn't use much as we left the hotel at 9am and came back 12 pm, every single day!; the towels that we used for going to the beach which only 1 towel for per customer per day! That's all!!!4. There was no tea, milk, coffee for free in the kitchen at all!5. The restaurant near the lobby was too expensive and the food was horrible. The service was too bad as we had to wait so long.6. The shower and bathtub are too old.7. Flowers at the lobby was too old and smelt like dead rats around the lobby.

My daughter and I spent 9 nights at the Ilikai Hotel. We stayed in a room with a kitchen so we didn't have to eat out for all meals. The room was light and bright, clean and spacious. The hotel has its own shuttle bus service into Waikiki and any hotels in the circuit. We used it a couple of times, but the walk to Waikiki is only 20 minutes flat and easy walking so we walked most times. There are washing machines for guests on most floors, this was very handy. We were on the second floor, so although we had a balcony to sit on it was too noisy due to the traffic noise, but still good to be able to open the door and not feel trapped. The windows were very well insulated and no noise penetrated when they were closed. We slept very well in a very comfy king sized bed. The customer service staff were all very helpful and friendly and our booking in and out was very efficient. There was entertainment in the courtyard on a couple of night, and we enjoyed that.

Stayed here with my family. Nice room with full kitchen and beautiful view from balcony to Lagoon. Great location. Great pool and short walk to lagoon. Kids loved snorkelling in the warm water with the fish! Trolley bus or local bus transport right outside hotel. Booked our room through Airbnb with no problems. Great selection of basic and high end restaurants nearby. Alo Moana Mall is shopping heaven & is a short driving distance away. 4 car hire companies over the road. Book your surf lesson with Eddie at Hawaiian Beach Boy Services based at Discovery centre across road from hotel.

We have stayed in the Ilikai on 2 occasions. We booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals and the process was seamless. Good value, excellent position, great quality room.When you book through the rental agency check the room first make sure it fits your need. As well, the hotel is separate from the apartments. The concierge will take bags to the room for you and arrange taxis and give advice on car rental, parking and tours etc. Make sure you tip as the service is usually for hotel guests but they help apartment guests and deserve a reward. Good convenience store in lobby. Food supplies and alcohol available. Laundry on each floor.

We rented room 2006 and really enjoyed our stay. Being on the 20th floor would not usually be at the top of my list as I am afraid of heights but it really was not a problem. The buses and Waikiki trolleys all stop outside so no excuses about getting around. I loved the shops on the lower level and we ate and drank at the bars and restaurants in the complex and tried out the pool too. Overall great place to stay and would recommend it

this hotel has everything central to shopping the beach restaurants and has good value for money (and did you know Hawaii 5 O was filmed there) getting all that it is still a number one location also 20 min form airport

Rooms are great, new, clean, comfortable & very friendly staff. We had 2 couples in 2 separate rooms on the 22nd floor. One overlooking the marina and the other overlooking the lagoon, both ocean views. The lagoon side room has views of the fireworks and activity below but straight ahead off the balcony you are looking directly into the hotel next door. The ocean view is off to the side. It's not terrible but the hotel does somewhat block the ocean view. The marina side view had the city to the right and the ocean and the park across the way to the left. We were high enough that no building was directly in our view path. Both are very good choices and I agree with the other comments about having a room on the upper floors. We couldn't seem to coordinate to catch the free trolley. We were given an app to track them but it sometimes didn't work. The front desk staff was pleasant but didn't seem completely knowledgeable about schedules and activities. I asked how long the hula performers were going to be on the patio so I could let my parents know if they would have time to get there and the response was "are they (the performers) still out there?" she didn't know the schedule. I also asked on a separate occasion whether the fireworks would be going on even if it rained and was told yes they always have them. We did have some light rain (heavier rain was expected) and we sat by the lagoon waiting along with many others but the fireworks had been cancelled. The hotel next door coordinates the fireworks not the ilikai but maybe a better response would have been, it may be cancelled and to check the facebook page of that hotel for an updated status. Other than those small incidents a very nice hotel.

We rented two Ocean Sunset view rooms, we were on the 25th floor - certainly stunning views. We stayed for 11 nights.The room itself is a good size, we found the bed comfortable and it was handy having the kitchen - we cooked at the apartment a few times. I did think it was odd that there's no rangehood above the oven especially when cooking on the stovetop.The bathroom is a good size, plenty of counter space - there's no bath just a shower but that's fine. There is very little storage in the room though for suitcases etc which was a pain, especially for a longer stay.We visited the store downstairs and the ABC across the road but did find the Safeway which was a huge supermarket so did a couple of big shops there - much more economic than the smaller shops.Location wise it's only a 10 min walk to Ala Moana shopping Centre, we really liked the food court there as did our kids. We used the hotel shuttle, it's not overly reliable and we had some pretty long waits so ended up catching a cab on multiple occasions.Each morning we would get our coffee from Aroma downstairs - reasonable coffee.
