We avoided Cinnamons after a very disappointing breakfast on our first morning at the Ilikai - my breakfast of bacon and eggs was appalling.There is a show every Friday night followed by fireworks at the lagoon - they are at 7.30pm and worth watching.We used both pools, there's very little shade with the bigger pool and the bathroom is really in need of a facelift. This being said, our family really enjoyed swimming in the big pool as it's really deep.The hotel is pretty pricey so we will shop around a bit more to ensure we are getting the best value for money when we return. We did enjoy staying at the Ilikai and would recommend it to those looking for somewhere a little bit out of Waikiki beach.

Upon landing at HNL obviously we were excited to began our vacation! Checked into the ilikai with no problem. Used a Credit Card for the hold and paid the resort fee up front with my debit. Went to our room where everything was nice and tidy. The room came with pots/pans etc for our long stay which was really nice to have, because we did end up making dinner a few times during our stay. The TV was a bit outdated, but that's fine we're not there for TV. The AC blew fine which was considerably nice due to the fact we paid for a "Ocean Sunset View" and boy does it boil in those rooms! Second night and continued throughout our stay our AC unit kept turning off or not turning on at all! Called maintenance and they fixed it the first time. Second time it took them 2 days to do something about it, but yet it still kept turning off and we had a 3 Year old with us which made matters worse in a hot room..this goes for day and night.Overall our stay was average minus the AC issue. Cinnamons was decent. The Cafe down stairs was a plus. Issues arose upon check out. Everything seemed fine. Checked out at the front desk and was given a receipt. Asked if we owed anything else and was told no I was good to go!Apparently I wasn't, because 2 hours later sitting in the airport waiting for my plane I get a call from some staff member at the Ilikai who states I owe for Parking, Upgrade fee, Resort fee etc.1. I paid for the upgrade fee a week before I even flew into Hawaii.2. Resort fee was paid upon checking. 3. Parking I provided him a card over the phone since he was so persistant in getting something from me? Even though I am pretty sure I paid since I was told everything was good upon checkout. Today's 5/11 I checked out 5/9 and I get charged a resort fee!? Which I've already paid. Called Ilikai and for some reason I get the same guy again. He tells me they never charged me it was a Hold on my card. Uh no I gave you a Credit Card for a hold and paid with a debit card for the fees! Even have my Receipts. Well sure as heck he continues to argue with me. Worse case if Ilikai doesn't reach out to me and correct the issues at hand I'll be doing a charge back for said fee's since i was charged without consent. On top of that not even being in the same state.Nice Hotel / Not worth the headaches though.

My great aunt owned a condo at the Ilikai Condominiums clear back in the late '60s and made Waikiki Beach her 2nd home. Then, back in the early '80s, my sister worked for a time here. Both had nothing but good things to say about the Ilikai, so when I went to make a reservation here, I didn't pause wondering if I would enjoy my stay. Short answer, I did.Although the external look of the building is a bit dated, the ownership and management have done an excellent job of ensuring this property has quality amenities and excellent customer service. With the property right on the "beach side" of the swanky Ala Moana Boulevard, it sits adjacent to endless dining, shopping and tourist activities. I wholeheartedly recommend the Ilikai and hope you enjoy your stay as much as I did.

We booked a couple of nights in a Luxury Junior Suite over looking the marina.The room was very modern and clean with a small kitchenette. There was no dishwasher, and only a small quantity of kitchen supplies/utensils.There was a modem allocated to the room and the wifi worked with no problems.Both the bed and sofa bed were very hard.Modern bathroom and great shower, just not enough hooks and rails to hang towels and clothes.The reception staff at check in and check out were polite and organised. Unfortunately our interaction with staff at other times during our stay (eg. beach towel collection, concierge, pool attendant) was disappointing - it was as if we were interrupting their day.The resort fee includes a shuttle service around the city. We had trouble finding a staff member to assist us in getting a voucher for the shuttle and then finding out where we had to stand for collection. The shuttle is very handy, but there is minimal communication by the driver.Overall it was a pleasant looking room and hotel but it just lacked those extra bits and customer service.

centrally located . shops and transport very handy. was a luxury to be able to sit out on the balcony with ocean views . only complaint was WiFi. there was 3 friends in the room but only one could log onto the site . other two used the WiFi at the lobby.spoke to admin as stay for a week but got no assistance. but was a minor inconvenience. overall loved the place and our stay was very comfortable

This is a great location in close proximity to the beaches and the Ala Moana shopping centre. Highly recommend getting a room with an ocean view as the views are amazing. The pool was great and only a short walk to the lagoon and ocean. The king size bed and sofa bed were very comfortable. The kitchen was equipped with a stove top and oven, microwave, utensils and pots, fridge which was great as we have to cook for a child with food allergies. Definitely staying here again!

Great place in center of Waikiki. All individual owned so furnishings are quite different. Has a living area and kitchen area. I really enjoyed this place. THere is a small grocery store in building and restrauants. View was amazing

This hotel is in a great location - next door to the Hilton and a short walk to Alamoana Shopping Centre and beach. It has amazing views over the lagoon, beach and harbour. We stayed in a private condo within the Hotel. It was an older style but had everything you wanted, including a full kitchen, and we loved the fact that it had a balcony with a fantastic view. There is a laundry on each floor of the hotel for guests to use.There is a coffee shop and restaurant on site which we found to be very good. There is also a convenience store and a couple of other shops within the hotel.The only complaint we had was that the pool was closed the entire time we stayed (5 days). They did have a paddling pool open but that didn't really cut it.Would stay there again.

Our room was great. View spectacular. Small kitchen and living room with king bed rather than a queen. The bed was great. Quiet and a sunbathing pool was perfect. The staff was helpful and friendly. Definitely would stay there again.

I used to stay at the Ilikai regularly in the past. However, I noticed that the hotel began to deteriorate (i.e. the rooms weren't as clean, things just seemed to be run down. Hence, I stopped staying at the Ilikai. I began staying at another hotel close by.Recently, I decided to give the Ilikai a second chance. There has been some renovations completed which made me feel like the ownership had made a turn for the good.Last week I spent a night at the Ilikai and when I entered the room, it smelled like mildew and frankly stunk. I went to the front desk and advised the desk person (Ron) and he advised me that, "You only made reservations for a standard room." s soon as he finished that comment he said, let me see what I can do. He moved me to another room which ended up being fine. I was only spending one night. Another issue with the hotel is that there is only two bellmen on during the day hours. this can create a delay in getting your bags to your room. There are only two valet persons to get your car. In spite of that, they actually were able to bring your car in decent fashion.Overall, this hotel could suffice if you are not looking for a lot of glit and glamour.

Obtained the details of the Ilikai from a mutual friend, we booked through Waikiki beach rentals, there web site is easy to read and full details explained, we choose condo 1742 on the 17th floor, excellent views of the lagoon, ocean and the fireworks on a friday night. The condo was clean and tidy with a full kitchen with everything you needed, large king bed with spare linen and towels, the rest of the furniture was comfortable, large hanging area for clothes. Pool was nice with plenty of shade, easy access to the beach and within 15 mins walking distance to walkiki and 6 mins to ala moana shopping centre, local buses stopped either side of the road which made it quite easy to catch. Great place to stay.

We stayed in the mountain view 1 bedroom suite. This suite was prepared with everything you needed for an extended stay. It included a full kitchen with all the necessary items to prepare, cook and eat your meals! In case you were wondering it was set up with a four piece place setting so washing dishes is required especially if eating more than one meal in per day. There were toiletry items in the bathroom for your use as well and these were replenished as needed throughout your stay. The room was clean and modern and very large in comparison to other hotels. Our family of four had space to spread out but there was no privacy in the unit between the living, bedroom and kitchen area, it was one big room. The resort itself was beautiful. We ate at the restaurant Cinnamon's on our last night. My husband and one son enjoyed their meal but our other son and I were not overly impressed with our choices but that is just personal preference not due to servers. The front desk staff were very helpful. You can borrow beach towels as well as beach chairs there for the duration of your stay. We used the valet car park service for our rental car during our stay and they were all great during drop off and pick up. The location of the resort is great! It is at the one end of Wakiki Beach. It was quiet but close to everything... restaurants, stores, buses, parks and the Ala Moana Mall for shops. I loved how close the beach and lagoon were to this resort. If we ever returned to Oahu, I am sure we would return to this hotel!

We stayed in Iliaki 1944. Corner condo on 19th floor. Excellent views of ocean, lagoon and marina. Balcony had nice furniture and felt very private. From windows and side balcony were treated to the Luau shows happening at the Hilton Hotel next door. Condo beds were too hard/firm but rest of furniture was comfortable. Small kitchen area with limited supplies. It would have been nice to have some aluminum foil or plastic wrap and similar items. Nice tvs in bedrooms and livingroom. Nice penthouse restaurant with wonderful views. Pool was nice, but crowded. Easy access to beach and lagoon. Great location near stores and restaurants. Clean and comfortable. Great stay...would definitely stay here again.

We have stayed here many times over the past 30 years ..and seen many changes along the way .When staying in an apartment type accomodation there is an expectation that we will eat in some nights ...A few small things would make our stay more pleasurable .It's time to upgrade the outdoor seating on the lanai ...even if the cushion hasn't blown away with or without cushions these chairs are very uncomfortable .The view night and Day is lovely and would be more enjoyable if the seating was comfortable.A non stick frypan and a few microwave dishes would be great .Also a kettle or jug to boil water for the morning cuppa tea.These units don't have dishwashers so the addition of a brush along with a scrubbing pad would make dishwashing easier .The pool areas lack shade , so maybe a few more umbrellas couid enhance the area.As we said only small things that would make a lovely stay even more enjoyable .

The Ilikai was amazing. So close to everything. It's a popular stop for all buses and tours so they pick you right up here. Everything you need is right here. Food, grocerys, activities, easy access to the beach and lagoon and two pools!

This condo is superb. It has a fabulous view from every room. It soothes your soul. It is beautiful. Have you ever wanted to view fireworks from the top down...this is the place! Very well appointed...you have no wants. It is very clean. The parking is included which is outstanding.

We stayed on the recommendation of a friend. Overall we found the Ilikai a good place to stay. It is an older property - 50+ years,but has been renovated and is well kept. It is very well located and close to all the things you might want. The staff were excellent. Our room was recently renovated with nice furniture and on the second floor. Still, it had a nice view through to the water and a large balcony. We thought the beds were great and to our liking. Some other reviewers thought them hard. Our only "gripe" would be about the resort fee that purports to be for a whole range of things that other hotels build in. Still, it seems a common practice but could be tough if you felt you did not get much use from the facilities. YMMV

The condo was perfect, in a perfect location, with perfect views. We could not have asked for any better of a stay. Illikai 1944 was in excellent condition from the beds, to the bathrooms, and the kitchen. We loved every minute of our stay and all the conveniences of our room and the complex. We didn't even need to go to the grocery store because the market in the lobby of Illikai had everything we needed.

The hotel has a variety of eateries. Walking distance of stores and rentals. Jaw-dropping scenery. The variety of room layout along with amenities such as laundry rooms is an amazing touch. I will surely revisit and recommend.

Our first impression when pulling up to the building was that it was older and might be outdated. When we got to the room, we couldn't be more wrong. The unit was well appointed and in great condition. We had excellent views from the balconies. We were right in front of the weekly fireworks as well. It was close to restaurants and shopping and within easy driving to the zoo, aquarium, airport and not that far from Pearl Harbor.

I haven't been to Oahu since I was kid, and my wife and I decided to go here for a much needed vacation. Through out preferred airline, we took a package at the Ilikai. It was a great hotel - right in the middle of the action beside the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Plenty of things to explore - either by walking or as we did, using a rental car to launch our daily activities. The car valet staff, front desk staff, concierge, housekeeping and others were welcoming and gave us a great Aloha! experience. We stayed on one of the renovated floors - with a great view of the lagoon and the ocean (well worth the extra price) to enjoy a morning coffee on the balcony or just listen to the sound of the ocean. The only thing that wasn't amazing was the bed - a bit hard for my liking, but still slept pretty well, despite the time zone change from home. Appreciated having the kitchenette so we could store snacks or some breakfast foods. Can't comment on the quality of the pools - the main pool was under repair during our stay so it was not available to use.

This is a hotel/ condo/ time share. We stayed in the hotel part. Floors 20 and higher have been recently renovated, so try to get one of those rooms. We mentioned when booking that it was our honeymoon and the GM upgraded our room and sent up a bottle of champagne! The room was lovely and had a great view of the harbor. On Friday's they do a fireworks display and have live hula music and dancing. The resort fee includes daily towels, beach chairs, free movie rentals and video game rentals. The staff was very nice.The beds are incredibly firm. I had shoulder pain after the first night, so they sent up a mattress pad. It helped, but they were still very firm! I literally bounced a quarter off of it! It's not directly on the beach. You can see it and have to walk down a ramp. It's a 5 min walk to the lagoon and a 10 min walk to the beach. By the way walk further along the beach another 10 mins to avoid all the rocks or bring water shoes!

We stayed at the Ilikai for 11 nights in a studio suite. We had full kitchen facilities so were able to cook most of our meals. Grocery shopping was easy and close at Foodland...About a 10 min. walk. Next time would probably go to Walmart for the first big grocery trip as prices are better and way more choice than Foodland. The studio was comfortable though the A/C was very loud. Also wish the lighting was better in the kitchen. Would definitely stay here again...Maybe higher up as this time we were on the 3rd floor.

We enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai hotel and luxury suites. We had a 8 night stay and thought the value was pretty good. We booked through booking.com and didn't realise there was tax added on top so it wasn't quite as cheap as we had thought. Unfortunately the main pool was also out of action while we stayed here. The hotel has everything you need onsite including a lovely cafe, restaurant and convenience store to name a few. The location was good, based between the main road into Waikiki and the beach. Our view looked out onto the city but was up high enough that the sound of traffic wasn't too bad. I don't have anything to complain about (besides the room being relatively small that there wasn't really anywhere to put luggage), and I don't really have anything to rave about. The hotel is everything you need, maybe a little outdated in some rooms, but would be fine for those wanting a home away from home and handy to the beach. Would I stay again? Probably not

Large rooms with stunning views. Close to the lagoon and marina. Lovely décor.The only draw-back was there is no room service. There is excellent home delivery from many casual and more up-market restaurants. The service was efficient and the delivery fee is $6.95.Full kitchen but no dishwasher. Washing machine and dryer on each floor $2.50 per load for each plus $1.25 washing powder. There was a sign for ice but no machine. We made our own in our freezer.The restaurant at the top of the building, Sarento's, is worth the visit. A step back in time. We could imagine the rich and famous dining there in past years.Good general store in the foyer. Beach chairs and towels provided in the resort fee, as was wi-fi. Unfortunately, the pool was not available as it was undergoing maintenance but the lagoon was very close a lovely to swim in, as was the ocean.We walked along the beach to get into the heart of Waikiki. Easy 10 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping centre.Would definitely recommend stay at the Ilikai.

We stayed in an apartment through Captain Cook Resorts and it was amazing! We had great communication with the agent and the apartment itself was so clean and well catered for. It had all the mod-cons you could want for a great stay. There were five of us basically all adult and there was plenty of space for everyone. It was a great location 10 mins from the beach and lagoon and Ala Moana Shopping Centre. It has a restaurant and coffee shop as well as a convenience store in the plaza area with the local ABC shop just 5 mins walk away. Because this was an apartment there was no room service or servicing but there was a laundry facility on the floor. Too perfect. We loved it.

The location is fantastic with great viewsRooms are large and spaciousUnfortunately they are all individually owned. so you are at the mercy of individual owners as to how well furnished and maintained your room is.We were unlucky, the beds were cheap, the Wi-Fi didn't work, many simple things you would expect were missing - i.e. no wine glasses and when we asked the owner, they told us to buy our own.Recommend you do some in-depth research before booking a room

We have always stayed at the Ilikai Hotel and Condos. It's cheaper, central and roomy for a family of 6. Right next door to the Hilton we got to enjoy the fireworks every Friday night from our condo. If in need of supplies there's a ABC store across the road and only a short 15 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping centre. Also, across the road is Car Hire, Bufffalo wings, Bottle shop and McDonalds. It also a short 15 minute walk to Magic Island park if you want to escape the over-crowded Waikiki beaches.

We decided to go to Hawaii in the last minute during the Summer holiday and my friend who goes often to Hawaii recommended this place, so we booked for 5 days. The hotel was like a time share condo, but it was really ok. The restaurant downstairs was good and the room was renovated and clean. But I think the swimming pool was a bit too small for this size of the hotel. Most of the time we went to the beach in the Hilton next door, so it was ok, too.

I have just spent 10 nights at the Ilikai which was comfortable but disappointing that the pool was closed for maintenance. We were still charged a resort fee of US$18 per day & was refused a discount despite asking twice as we were unable to use the pool.Housekeeping staff were awesome & Cinnamon cafe & coffee shop downstairs was adequate.

We stayed in sunset ocean view junior suite on 24 th floor of the Ilikai and the furnishings were new and appealing and our 2 teenagers slept in the sofa pull out bed which gave them front row horizontal viewing of the large screen TV to their delight . We had a king size bed . There are a few rooms I believe with 2 double beds too which we could have had if we had waited until 2 pm but as the suite with king and sofa bed was available at 10:30 am and the hotel was happy to let us have it early, we took that and were happy with it.There are 25 floors and then the penthouse level and 1 benefit of being on the higher floor is that the lifts often fill up as you descend and people on lower floors often have to wait for the next lift.You can't see the hilton fireworks from the sunset wing but we walked out to Magic Island at Ala Moana and had a great view from there.My husband and kids enjoyed watching airplanes leaving and arriving afar off in the distance at Honolulu airport from the lanai . Fun to watch if you are an airplane fan and you will get a nice view of this from the sunset wingThere is a kitchen and it was handy to have the microwave and fridge and nice to perch on the bar stools and eat / read on the bar.We liked the location as it is a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and a 20 minute stroll to Waikiki.The hospitality fee of $18/d covered good wifi, beach towels ( which we took on excursions ) and beach chairs ( can carry down to Fort De Russy beach to enjoy) and DVD/ playstation 3 game rental as well as use of the shuttle. There is a free shuttle which does loops from the hotel to Waikiki and to Ala Moana shopping centre and stops at several Aqua hotels which serve as good pick up/drop off points for different parts of Waikiki. You can track the shuttles in real time on the internet site as to where they are in real time and expected arrival times at each stop. Last shuttle about 9 pm . We used the shuttle a few times in the heat of the day but its quite pleasant to walk in the cooler morning and evening .There was a large commercial standard laundry washing machine and dryer on our floor which cost $2.50 in coins per load for a wash or dry cycle and the machine could take a massive amount of clothes . Very efficient . Half an hour wash and 1 hour dry. Cash can be exchanged for coins at reception. We had brought our own laundry powder but you can buy from dispensing machine in laundry.The reception staff and housekeeping are lovely. They appear to be long term employees and happy in their jobs.We ate at Cinnamons a few times - it gets very busy on weekends for breakfast as many come from outside the hotel for their guava pancakes which are a huge serve and worth trying . Try Magokoro nearby for lunch and Wailana coffee house serves good value diner food. We liked the Japan Village walk food court at the Ala Moana Centre opposite foodland under Nordstroms.The only thing lacking is a good swimming pool but I think if you come to Oahu , it's best to swim at the beach. If you want to have access to a swimming pool and be beachfront then the Ilikai may not be for you . However I think you get a more spacious room with a kitchen for a more reasonable price than the beachfront Waikiki hotels and we don't mind the walk . We will be staying here again when we return

Our family is a regular visitor to the Oahu island. We normally stay at a very popular resort next door to this one. As our children are now large teenage boys, we need proper bedding instead of roll-aways and sofa couches. Plus our usual resort next door does not have interconnecting rooms, or can provide assurance that two rooms booked would be on the same floor near each other.This, we searched the internet and found this hotel which has two bedroom suites, including kitchen facilities.I was hopeful at the time of booking that this hotel would accommodate our needs and upon check-in I was super impressed.We had walked past this hotel many times in the past and honestly its exterior gave me the impression it was old and dated.Well I was pleasantly surprised. Our two bedroom suite is just beautiful. It is very modern, with ample room and surprisingly has three bathrooms. The master room is a great size and the bathroom is huge with a double shower, separate toilet, double vanity and bathtub.The other two bathrooms have a shower, bathtub, toilet and vanity.The kitchen has modern appliances and has ample space.The only unfortunate downside is the main pool is currently under maintenance. But there is a wading pool on the second level. The beach and lagoon are within 2 minute walk, so this isn't a major deal breaker for us.Our family has always found this location great, as it's within 10 minutes walking to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and 20 minute walk into downtown Waikiki. Plus, every Friday night is the firework display from HHV.We found this hotel to be great value for the accommodation it provides families that want to be together.We will definitely stay here again!

Depends on your priorities. If you want a view, a little quiet, and a kitchen, this is a great bet. If you want an awesome pool and a little busier environment, the Ilikai is not for you.We stayed in room 2206, overlooking the Honolulu Marina, from March 24-31. The sunset view was incredible and the room was exactly as pictured on the website. I chose this hotel as I wanted a kitchenette. The kitchen was very well equipped with almost everything you could need for a week stay (except maybe food storage containers, but no biggie). I did cook about 4 or 5 dinners there so the kitchen was put to good use. The housekeeping was also very good. Please note that if you stay in a room with a sunset view you will not be able to see the fireworks show from your balcony that the Hilton next door puts on Friday and Tuesday (I think?) night. You will need a room on the other side of the hotel. The only other downer was that the pool was closed during our stay -- and nobody told us until we got down there. The pool itself, if it had been working -- was very underwhelming. Nothing special about it at all. Our room looked down on the two pools next door at The Modern Hotel and we were very envious. But because a kitchen was our top priority, the Ilikai won out for us. I would definitely stay there again.

We stayed in an owner-rented condo and lived this site. 2nd time we've visited and staff and residents are very friendly. North of Waikiki, so beach less busy and have use of Hilton Hawaiian Village lagoon. Bit of a walk to Waikiki shops and food, but worth it for location. Less than 1 mile walk to Ala Moana shopping mall. Highly recommend.

We were at The Ilikai March 30-31 in a junior suite (2208) on the 22nd floor. What a fantastic view - straight out into Honolulu marina. Room was spacious, clean, had a full kitchen, with a large flat screen television on the wall. I am tall, and large - you could have put six of me in the stall shower - with reasonable water pressure. Good location allows easy access to several restaurants, and the Ala Moana Shopping Center is only a 10 minute walk. We did not use Cinnamon's, and my review of Sarento's is submitted under separate cover.

We booked room 1236 and it was perfect. Although the Ilikai is an old building we were fortunate to get a condo that had been somewhat renovated. The condo has plenty of space for a couple and is in good condition, cosy and tastefully decorated. The condo included free Wi-Fi, a well equipped kitchen and a very comfy bed. There was plenty of spare linen, beach chairs and an esky to use. The condo is very sound proof too so you don't hear any outside noise when the doors are shut.The view from our lanai was good as we could see the Hilton Hotel's (which is next door) lagoon plus a partial ocean view. Some nights the Hilton had a show on the rooftop of the car park which we could watch from our lanai. We had a few meals at Cinnamon's restaurant and although it's not flashy the food is fine and the staff are very pleasant. It has a great view over the mariner too. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance...mostly along the ocean front and a wonderful bar in front of the Hilton Hotel with great ocean setting.All tour buses pick from out front of the Ilikai so its very convenient . Across the road is a booking booth for all tours and we found them to be helpful. There's an ABC shop across the road (tad expensive) but if you walk past it, go down the side road there's a bigger and cheaper grocery store . Ala Moana shopping centre is only about a 1.5kms walk away. We booked through Hawaii Vacation Properties and they were excellent with all information and correspondence.

Been staying in a condo for 2 weeks and sudden closure of pool "indefinitely" very disappointing. The alternative is new small wading pool, and multi,kids!So...aware those intending book check first. THere should be a posting on their websiteNo improvement in Cinnabon Cafe from last year. UNless you enjoy cardboard friesDont order them !!! Its so tired, no atmosphere!, staff dressed in black...very un Hawaiian.Be sure to read "fine print". SArentos at the Top,of Ilikai. The Wed night Happy hour at 40% off applies to drinks and food at BAR and not in restaurant!!! Be aware..we Werent and ended up with overpriced warmish food and served by 7 different people!!!Nothing special except view.

Great hotel with excellent views from the room balcony. Excellent pool area and in an excellent location next to Hilton Village & lagoon. Ala Moana shopping centre a short walk and Snappers Bar just across the road.Would highly recommend.

The Ilikai is right near the end of Waikiki so you do have a walk to get the main beach. The hotel, originally a condo was built back in the 1960s, heck it's featured in the opening credits of the original Hawaii 5-0. We had a renovated on bedroom on the 24th floor and we couldn't have been happier. The big screen doors opened for a panoramic view of the beach, we say the fireworks (every Friday) right from our balcony. The Ilikai is kept clean and so was our room. The walk to the beach is short and the hotel has little beach chairs. The Ocean View made this amazing.

My family and I stayed a week in this hotel on the top floor. Our room had 2 bed 2bath and a full kitchen that over looked the marina and ocean. The view and the room were stunning! We loved it so much we are coming back next year for spring break!

We stayed in the condiminium part of Ilikai which required self check-in instructions. The room was spacious with a great view and full kitchen facilities. Bed comfortable with extra pillows in the cupboard if needed. Downside was the air conditioning unit was very noisy and wasnt quite up to the job. The bathroom basic but fine. Unfortunately although the towels had been laundered there were unpleasant looking marks on a couple of them. The complex is situated close to beaches, shopping, and a range of restaurants. Would definatly stay again.

We stayed in 1102, which had ocean, marina & sunset views. The Ilikai was close to shopping, restaurants & the beach. Bus transport was cheap and handy right outside the Ilikai, this was the designated pick up point for tours that include pick up as well. The only complaint we had was that the air conditioner was very noisy.

We liked this locations and it's walking distance to several shops and restaurants. The beach and nearby lagoon are awesome with several bars to choose from. If there was a negative, it's that the pool was never open.

we rented a condo 2039 with a harbor view the condo was very clean and plenty room for two people every thing we needed was included even beach chairs and umbrella the bed was super comfy We have stayed in other hotels in Honolulu but for us the Illikai was the best so far Staff were all very friendly and eager to help The pool area could use some umbrellas we did ask but were told not available and we should go upstairs to the other pool which is shallow and not for swimming .the Illikai is close to the lagoon and the beach and is not as crowded as the other end of the beach you can get a bus out the front to almost anywhere for 2dollars fifty If we return to Honolulu the Illikai wil be top of our list of places to stay

We rented a small suite with kitchen and sunset view. It was very clean and nice. The weather did not cooperate and we spent a couple evenings avoiding the sheets of rain, so the view and kitchen were much appreciated. I was there on business and my wife traveled with me. We didn't rent a car so didn't worry about parking fees.PS - we loved the vintage shirt store called Bailey's.

The Ilikai is an interesting building, an iconic building from the sixties, which is part hotel, part condo rental and part residents, which results in always having someone interesting to chat to in the lift!.Views over the lagoon, Friday night fireworks and the sunset are just stunning. Room was comfortable if a little small.If taking tours this, hotel is one of the first pick ups but also one of the first drop offs, a bonus after a day site seeing. small supermarket across the road (forget the hotel supermarket) or a short 5 min walk to a local supermarket (Food Pantry)Excellent base for your Hawaiian holiday.

At our recent stay here we found the staff very friendly and helpfull. The down sides were we had crib brought to our room and found it sort of dingy and also doing laundry there.....well the wash machines are in dire need of upgrading. Will not be returning to the area in general as we found everything very expensive including the parking. I do believe the place u stay at u should not be charged extra to park there.

We rented out a condo for our stay. Very clean and comfortable. Had all the necessities we required, except for a laundry. There was a laundry on our floor though. One of the best things about staying here was the location. Most buses and tours use Ilikai as one of there pickup points which came in really handy. Look, it is not right in the heart of town, but a nice stroll (20 minutes) from or there in the evening after a great meal. Highly recommended

My family and I stayed here and loved every minute we were here. The room was very clean. The kitchen was very handy when you have children and nice big fridge to put all our food and drink in. Was a 3 min walk to the beach. And also a very nice lagoon down the bottom of the hotel. 10 min walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and that's where my wife wanted to go all the time. The restaurant and bar downstairs had great food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Alot of restaurants close by aswell so food is always available. Best place is Buffalo Wild Wings straight accross the road, brilliant wings and great beer. All up a great place and we would definately return here.

I spent three nights in this hotel. The staff were very nice, the room was fantastic, especially for the price, and the location was also great (beach close by, a number of good restaurants in the area).

We loved our stay at the Ilikai. Perfect location, decent pool and beautiful beaches. Our condo was very nice...small but very nice. Great for families or couples...you won't be disappointed! Love the coffee shop---delicious drinks and amazing Acai bowls. Check out the fireworks on Friday nights---awesome show from the beach!

We were on a business trip that came up very suddenly and we could not get into our regular hotel. There was availability at the Ilikai so we took it. Not expecting anything extraordinary, we were very surprised. The friendliness and warmth of this hotel has put it into our must do again list. A perfect location, nicely decorated room with full kitchen (except for dishwasher) made it a great place to stay for us.

My fiancée and I eloped while on Oahu. We were looking for a hotel that had a contemporary luxury feel. The Ilikai has recently renovated their top floors and we were pleased to see the photos well matched our experience.Things we liked:The modern clean design of the rooms (see attached photo)The ocean view was quite nice although not all ocean as the hotel is set back from the beach by several 100 meters (see attached photo)The staff were friendly and helpful, especially housekeeping.Air conditioner was modern split unit, very effective and pretty much silentWalk in tiled showerGood quality bedFree wifi in rooms and throughout hotel. Wifi bandwidth and reliability was excellent in the rooms.Close to public bus stop which always provided a ride down the beach if we were in a hurry or tires of walking. It's $2.50 per person and valid for two hours in any direction.Taxi to airport cost about $30, better than taking the shuttle if you're a couple.Fresh beach towels and beach chairs available every day for free.Things that we didn't like:Pool area lacked charm. Wasn't an area we want to hang out at when compared to other properties. Cinnamon's Restaurant was a goodPlace for breakfast but didn't have Much atmosphere. We ended up having several meals and drinks at the neighbor property which is a boutique hotel. Tiny TV, too small to be etched from bed.I'd recommend this hotel ifyou're looking for a lower cost suite very near the beach at the quiet end of Waikiki. We will likely try another spot if in Waikiki again soon.

I went with my family total 3 of us. It was very very old. outdated amenities. Pool was small nothing to do for the kids. Gym had 2 treadmills and 1 set of free weights. Horrible. Service was terrible. We called one night for a pillow and service for the dvd player/ps4. No one ever showed up. It was not cheap either. The room was updated but walls are thin. The elevators were old and rickety. Location awesome. Mattress on bed, lumpy as well as the one on the couch bed. Kitchen great. Bathroom okay. Balcony great. All in all. If you like luxury don't go. If you don't care about it and don't mind bad service, then have a good time. Ps. Not even a map of the hotel and where everything was located and no offer of services for anything else.

We had room 1115 which was great and comfortable, with full kitchen, king size bed, sitting room, balcony and bathroom. It had heaps of storage so we could unpack and enjoy. Shower had good pressure. Good location. We had friends in other condos, all good. Interesting background, as hotel used for Apollo 13 wives and astronauts & Hawaii 5 0.

My wife and I come to Waikiki Beach almost every winter for a couple weeks most years we stay at other end of beach down by the Honolulu Zoo at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel.This year we decided to give the Ilikai a try were looking for something a little more roomy with a full kitchen and comfortable living room furniture. After doing this year in and year out we have tired of eating meals out in restaurants not just the cost just can be a bit of a rat race in Waikiki if you don't really want to do it just need to gets done (eating) gets very old after while.We were very pleased with the room( 2436) we were assigned everything had been remodeled looked like new , the living room had a comfortable chair and couch in a nice pit area with a large flat screen TV ,the other part of the room had a king size bed that was arranged in such a way that you could easily watch TV from that part of the room as well.The kitchen had everything we needed full sized stainless steel appliances ample cabinet space .Bathroom was large and nicely done huge vanity top to spread out on .The Lani was huge by standards we were use to over the years in the hotel room down by the zoo and nice views of Dukes Lagoon, Pacific Ocean, and Hilton Hawaii village I enclosed a couple pictures I took from the Lani the one of Dukes Lagoon and Pacific Ocean was taken on super bowl Sunday 1st quarter ( lol ) what a view.This hotel seems to be a favorite of seniors tho my wife and I are still working we did enjoy the quiet and there ability to keep order very little shenanigans going on in this hotel one evening there was a very loud obnoxious group on the Lani above us when the hour got a little Late I did call the desk they had had a few other complaints but we're having trouble locating the problem guests after my call there was silence and that was the end of the problem I was very impressed. We have had similar problems in other hotels the management in that facility give me nothing but lip service and the nonance continued if you're Looking for a quieter building this might be your place. One last thing I didn't mention the money was very comprable to our Oceanfront Hotel room at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel we double the square footage and added all those amenities.Not knocking the Aston hotel because we've had many good trips there and we love that end of town but we were really really impressed with the Ilikai has really given us something to think about for next year's trip.Also before I close this hotel has 2 nice pools and easy access to both Dukes Lagoon and Waikiki Beach in front of Hilton Hawaiian Village a very nice strip of Waikiki Beach. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL IT EXCEED MY EXPECTATIONS. Joseph C Bydlon

We stay at Illikai for 6 nights during winter days. The room is luxury room, which is with whole kitchen and just reorganized. The hotel is locates at the North area of Waikiki, with a nice ocean view. You can find the beautiful sunset every day~ 我們在這裡待了六晚，在二月的冬季。房型是luxury suit 是含有廚房剛裝修好的，飯店的位置在Waikiki的北區海岸邊，臨著希爾頓飯店，有美麗的海景，每天都上演夢幻的落日美景～

We stayed in one of the Suites. It was clean and very well equipped. The bed was extremely comfortable as was all of the furniture. The views are very interesting because you can look all the way down Waikiki Beach but also see the boat traffic coming in and out of the harbor as well as planes taking off from the airport (but no plane noise). There is a large Park next door for morning walks or jogs. There's a nice rooftop Italian restaurant, but also be sure to check out Pier 37 for fantastic seafood (a short cab ride away). Many other good restaurants along the beach as well.

I keep coming back here. I know the person who responds to these reviews will often correct the reviewer as to whether they stayed in the actual hotel section or in a private condo stay but I don't think that matters for the purposes of review as people coming to check out the TA website won't discriminate between these -they are just interested in the facility as a whole.My stay was great and as I have outlined in previous reviews, here is why I love this place:* On the edge of the hustle and bustle of town so close to the action but slightly away from the chaos - its a 10 minute walk in to the Ala Moana Centre and a 15 minute walk into the centre of town so close to everything* There are a few places to eat at the Ilikai itself and stacks within a very close walk of the building - check out my other reviews for the places we have tried in the immediate area* The in-house supermarket is great for self-catering* The older style of building means it is generally pretty sound proof (except for people who insist on dragging their balcony furniture across in the early hours of the morning!)* Value for money - its rare to find a hotel room at a reasonable price with a water view -this is one of the few places that offers this - I have stayed at the gigantic place next door and a decent water view costs a whole lot more* Only small issue was at least one and possibly two lifts seemed to be out of order for short periods, sometimes there were queues and we had to wait for a second round to get in - not all the time but happened on a couple of occasions.Otherwise, I'll be back!

Check In procedures were executed well, they place a hold on your Credit Card for the amount of the stay, we were 2 couples so had separate suites on the second floor, I highly recommend asking for a higher floor as the road noise from the street side (if you are on that side that is) unfortunately comes through clearly, I was awoken on more than once occasion by police cars blaring past or loud cars, bikes revving their engines. Pools are nice the restaurant serve nice cocktails during happy hour as well breakfast pancakes are huge, iHop and Redlobster right around the corner, be warned the wait at Redlobster is always on so suggest going and getting the booking card at least 30mins before you want to have dinner. The place is clean, easy to find central with the Ala Moana mall a mere 10min walk, so walk it don't take a cab you can buy yourself a big meal in the foodcourt for the money you will save! Some great deals then of course you can got the outlet mall which is about a $70US cab ride away or if you have Uber it is half that... so suggest getting Uber as with the ~$60 US you will save you could buy yourself 2 Armani T Shirts. The mini mart in the hotel has everything you need from medicine if you're ill to booze to get you to require meds! Highly recommend staying here - Oh one thing! Please have hot water kettles in the room, the coffee machines aren't sufficient to boil water for tea etc.

The hotel is a bit older but has been renovated and looks fantastic. The staff were nice and helpful . The onsite restaurant served excellent breakfast at a reasonable price. The view was amazing. Easy walk to mall and restaurants. overall a great experience.

Stayed in suite 2206. The view was fantastic, and the room was just as lovely as promised. Front desk staff were so helpful (thank you Patrice!) with any last minute changes we needed due to flight schedule. Thoroughly enjoyed our 10 days there.

This room has a peek a boo view of the beach with 2 balconies. When we entered the suite it was nice and cool and very clean. The amenities within the unit were very good and spacious. We slept 4 people very comfortably within the 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The building, although older, is very nicely renovated with a lovely new lounging pool on the 2nd floor. I would definitely stay at the Ilikai again. This particular unit needed to add linens -- there were not enough towels for the bathrooms or the kitchen for our 5 day stay. We ended up using a handtowel for the bathroom in the kitchen. Also, the beds were made with flat sheets on the bottom rather than fitted sheets which was very uncomfortable because the bottom sheet kept coming off. If not for the linen issues I would have rated it a full 5 stars.

What an amazing place! The view was incredible. We stayed in a 2 bedroom and the place was spacious, beds were comfy, bathrooms had plenty of room, kitchen well stocked. And that view! We will definitely be back!

My husband and I stayed here from Saturday until Wednesday.The good:- Great view from room 2204. Updated with a spacious bathroom.- Great location. Near stores, restaurants, and the Hilton Hawaiian Village. (Go there to shop and dine!) - We were able to walk about 2 miles to a full-size grocery store.- Good coffee shop for morning coffee. Kind of expensive but good sized market on property.- Easy check in. - Good valet service.- Great access to the beach boardwalk.The bad:- The restaurant on property did not look good enough to entice us!- The pool looked pretty small.- The concierge called us three days into our visit to tell us that they had coupons for us!- Customer service is good but not over-the-top!- The common areas of the hotel are nice but need updating. Not bad, just need updating.- Air-conditioner controls were confusing.We would recommend staying here. I don't know that we would go back to Honolulu, but it was a great place to stay while we were there.

Third visit to the Iconic Ilikai hotel staying in a studio style 1 bedroom private condo with full kitchen, comfortable bed, renovated bathroom and balcony with magnificent ocean/lagoon views. The condo was very spacious and very clean. We have stayed three times in two diffrent condos on the 21st floor. Love the large breezy hotel lobby and landscaped gardens. Cinnamons Restaurant is good for breakfast overlooking the marina.Bus and Waikiki Trolley stop at front door, 10 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and a 15 minute walk to downtown Waikiki. Plenty of nearby restaurants and bars. Less than 5 minute walk to the lagoon, beach and marina.

My wife and i went there for 4 days the first night we arrive at 1.00am,very tied but the front of the hotel view just blew the tiedness away.So we stayed one night in a blvd room view it was very modern. the bell desk kid was there at night and helped me with the luggage.the second day we moved to the other room it was really nice with 95% ocean view.Only complain is the room cleaning ladies did not washthe dishes at all,i mean till the day we checked out.Very safe location to walk around day an night.They do charges car valets an it's not cheap,it dose state in the bottom when booking so don't be surprised.We will be coming back there in near future.
user_name:
Neil P
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Great view from the room, loved the balcony!Very nice one double bed studio with partial ocean view. Located between the Wakiki Beach and Ala Moana shopping center. kitchenette goodFront Desk staff very nice.Minus: the building and room seems old and needed renovation

We were in an apartment. 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, lounge and kitchen. Very comfortable beds and pull out sofas which were also very comfortable. Very helpful concierge. Saved us a lot of money with his advice. Nice coffee shop and restaurant in the lobby. Also a handy mart with everything you could need. Nice walk next door to a little village which had more restaurants, shops and icecream. Easy stroll into the main street of waikiki. The pool area was adequate but not a great atmosphere, however with the lagoon and the beach you hardly need to go there. Also there are pools with bars and snacks nearby.

We were disappointed upon check in as the room we booked on TripAdvisor said we would have 2 King beds plus 1 sofa bed which was important to me as we are travelling with 2 teenagers 1 girl 1 boy so we needed 3 beds. Upon check in I learnt that TripAdvisor was wrong and all the rooms in the entire hotel are the same size and all have open plan 1 King bed and 1 sofa bed.I was pretty upset about it but the manager contacted me and refunded me 1 night plus the resort fee and gave us a voucher for breakfast on one day of our stay. I can honestly say I would not have booked this motel had I have known what the correct room configuration was so I was definitely misled by the TripAdvisor listing. Having said that, the positives are;The location is perfect, about half way between the Royal Hawaiian centre and Ala Moana Mall if your into shopping; great restaurants only steps away; easy access to the Hilton Hawaiin Village with all its restaurants shops and facilities. Easy access to a lovely beach area, you can even sit on the lawn under shade whilst beaching it if you walk a block to Fort DeRussy and go to the beach there, it's also a great place to people watch as there are constant games of volleyball plus beach hire for paddle boards, surf boards, water bikes etc.The rooms are spacious and it's definitely worth paying extra to have an ocean view; our room had a PlayStation, good size flat screen and free unmetered high speed wifi in fact I had my hdmi cable with me so plugged the iPad into the tv and streamed movies every night and no problem with speed at all. There's a good 7/11 type shop in the hotel and a good Lunch and brekky spot as well.The only 2 negative's I have found is the hot water is not hot enough and I have tried it at varying times of the day. I can't find anything in the room that regulates the temp so I presume it's resort wide. I have had no cold on at all when having a shower, just the hot water full on and with not full on it is a normal temp hot shower as in its not cold or warm it is hot. But you know how on a cold day or when you come back from a swim and step into an airconditioned room and you just want a nice hot shower to warm up your bones? The showers here are not hot enough to satisfy that situation. The second is no drinks are provided at the sunbathers shallow pool, I'm not sure about the deeper pool but I haven't spotted any drinks when looking down on the area from above.The room is comfortably big enough for 3. If you have mum and dad in the king bed and 1 child on a roll away up against the verandah curtains, you can leave the couch as is and still have a living area. If you had 4 people I would recommend getting a 2nd roll away and not using the sofa bed as without a sofa to sit on it could become difficult. There would be room for the second rollaway next to the King bed with a bed side table width between. Sorry one other is that there is no kettle in the room, only a coffee maker which made it hard when the kids just wanted a cup of noodle soup as I had to boil water in a saucepan.One other positive is each floor has a laundry with drink and ice machine and detergent dispenser so it really has everything you need.One more hint, if you need a hire car, Envy car hire will deliver the car to the hotel and pick it up from hotel when your finished.I would definitely stay either here or at the Hilton next door if I come back to Hawaii although if you don't need to be in the thick of the resort area, I would stay at the Kahala:)

Excellent location, with only a very short walk to the main strip and also to the large shopping malls - also with the lagoon and beach less than two minutes walk from your door no matter which room you stay in!

We stayed here for 9 nights in January 2017 and were extremely pleased with the hotel. The rooms are lovely and new, very spacious. The hotel itself is very nice, it has two pool areas, a lovely little cafe downstairs and offer unlimited free new release dvds. They forget to mention that they'll charge you $18 per day amenities fee and $28 per day for valet parking. With tips for the parking this was an additional $450 over 9 nights that we wasn't expecting so just be aware. Other than that little shock, we were really happy with our stay.

We rented adjacent Jr. suites rooms each with a small sofa area, kitchenette and ocean view for 4 nights. The rooms were surprisingly quiet especially considering the size of the hotel. Rooms were clean and light and made up promptly each morning. Location was a short walk from lagoon and beach and pool was surprisingly small for such a large place. Second pool was for for wading. 15 minute walk from the busy shopping area but I didn't mind being removed from the crowds. Taxi service was excellent and friendly to/from the hotel all 5 days. Food, lazy service and overall cleanliness at the outdoor restaurant left much to be desired. Skip the ginger ale and Moscow moke which tasted like men's cologne.

Large room with kitchen over looking Hilton resort and Lagoon. Like a lot of hotels in Honolulu- there are signs of an ageing building. No complaints about the room. Clean and tidy and probably renovated in the last few years. Close enough to walk to Waikiki and shops. Very walkable to Ala Moana mall. A main pick up point for tours and buses right outside. Would stay again. Did not dine in the restaurant. The little cafe has excellent coffee.

Stayed 6 nights. Great view over the marina also sunset views. The Hotel is in a quite area away from all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. 10 min walk to Ala Moana shops. Suite 2002 on the 20th floor. 2 double beds & sofa bed. Enough room for 4. Good value

We stayed in the condominiums. Had a nice Junior Suite. The rooms were recently redecorated and nicely appointed. The king size bed was very comfortable with high quality linens. Only had a shower. Large wall of windows and a nice balcony with a spectacular view. Stayed three nights before driving to north shore. A perfect respite in a cosmopolitan area. This is the hotel on the introduction to the old and the new Hawaii Five-0. Both generations of McGarretts stood on the penthouse. Classic, old, great location, nicely appointed.

This hotel is not at the overcrowded boulevard at the Waikiki beach. It's about 15 minutes walking and than you are at the boulevard where all the famous, and really expensive stores are. Stores like Chanel, Dior, Yves Saint Laurent etc. It's almost you walk in Milan or Paris!The Ilikai has a good service and the staff is friendly. Our luxury suite was good and they cleaned the suite every day. So you get what you payed for! What you see on the pictures on their site, is exactly what it is for real!The bed is big, so is the living and the kitchen area. The bathroom is oke, beacause there is no bath, only a showe without a massage. But it's a clean bathroom.I'll give this hotel a 8 of ten!

Ilikai Hotel & luxury Suites Is up there for a great place to stay on Waikiki Beach. The views are to die for & most rooms are front row seats to watch the Friday Night Fire-works. It has two main pools & Restaurants, Coffee shop, Convenience Store, Hairdresser ,Clothes boutique, & Central to all Waikiki Shopping & Boating Marina & Beach.

At a very last moment, our family decided to do a staycation at this hotel. The guest services were awesome. The front desk was extremely helpful and accommodating us with the sweets. There was some confusion as I booked online but wish to change my accommodations once there. They were so helpful and accommodating. It's very refreshing to see people who enjoy their jobs and go out of their way in customer service. Beyond that, The room was perfect. We had a two bedroom suite which was spacious, clean and very efficient. They were nice appointments and the children love the kitchen. We had a top as well as a shower. The room was very modern and well decorated.The kids had fun at the pool, I'll be it it was on the small side. There are many guests along with older residents. They were quite a bit of rules but the children manage to have some fun in the pool.The hotel was perfect but a little far away from the center of Waikiki. Took a bit of a walk to get to Waikiki and the children were quite tired of the walk There was no room service that I know of however, there was a fantastic market downstairs which was well equipped.There's also a fantastic breakfast restaurant called cinnamon which was very delicious.There is also ABC stores and other restaurants and food eateries nearby.Overall, the best vacation ever. This definitely beats aulani and ihilani for our family with kids between 7-11 years old I highly recommend this place but I'm reluctant to as I don't want it to get too busy that we can't have accommodations readily available

We rented a room via VRBO & it was satisfactory. The hotel is typical of the area; pools, fountains, etc. We had a view of the ocean which is nice until the luau on the top floor of the nearby parking ramp started. The luau is most nights from 5-8 & everyone on the ocean side of the Ilikia as well as many properties of the adjacent Hilton have a front row seat EVERY night whether you want it or not. So....if you stay here, highly suggest requesting a marina view. That said, there are 2 pools here; one is a large "family" one, the other is supposed to be a sunbathing pool although several parents bring young children to frolic with various beach toys amongst the in-pool lounge chairs. The beach is about a two block walk. The concierge was very helpful in helping us book a tour of Honolulu. The front desk was not so helpful. The airline we used to fly between islands does not yet allow phone boarding passes. I went to the front desk to ask if there was a place to print them & was told they were out of ink. I asked if they'd have ink the next day and she said no. She added I could go some place by the Hilton but she couldn't provide the name of the place or the location. I tried again with another employee the next morning and was told that since we rented from a private owner, it would be $50 to use the self-service computer to print our boarding passes. We printed them for free at the airport. After a long day of sight-seeing, we opted to eat at Cinnamon's at the hotel. Don't bother.

I was so excited to stay at the hotel where the iconic picture of Hawaii 5 O's Jack Lord was taken. the picture where he stands on the balcony looking out. It is still an astounding view and balcony! we had a beautiful suite with a well equipped kitchengreat location in the heart of everything!friday nights they have fire works next door.we chose to have a harbor/beach view so traveled out of the room to see them! great spot especially for a long term stay!

We needed a room on short notice as the nearby condo we had rented was completely unsatisfactory. The front desk receptionist, Richelle, was very pleasant and worked hard to explain the options and costs. We ended up in a luxury suite on the 24th floor with a large patio, nice view, full kitchen, and valet parking for less than we had paid for the supposed luxury condo next door. Never again will I pay up front for personally owned rentals where you have little recourse if they don't turn out as advertised.

550 sq ft rooms with king bed ,fold out couch,2 sitting chairs,apartment sise kitchen with eating bar and stools. We ate breakfast every morning in room,usually fruit and yogurt,but we also had egg sandwiches. ABC stores sell everything one needs for these suite rooms. Spent little time in room except for breakfast, change clothes,bed time drinks on good sise lanai. Rooms were very quite ,clean,good sise bathroom with bathtub. Stay away from boulevard rooms,lots of traffic and noise.

This review is a rating of the condo side not the hotel. I rented a unit for ten days as a vacation rental. It is great value for the location. I stayed on the ocean side with an awesome view of the lagoon and the beach/ocean. I was a bit disappointed with the room as the carpet was really dirty and the shower pressure was terrible. But loved staying here nevertheless. Just be careful when you book to check out the renovations and updates to the room. I didn't want carpet but really liked the view and there wasn't alot of options left without carpet and a good view. Book very early if you want to go here it books up fast. A pool has been added and the existing one upgraded since I was here last, which was very nice.

We have stayed at the Ilikai many times over the past 14 years. We found that it was close to the Shopping centres, the Lagoon and downtown Waikiki. Friendly staff great service and you get to see the Friday night fireworks up close. We stay at this hotel as it has a kitchen with dishwasher, stove and fridge. On the occasion that we needed a bigger fridge they supplied it at no extra cost. Would recommend the hotel always.

Hmmm - it was once so grand, but now it's simply "just ok." Nothing beautiful and breathtaking - lobby is not vibrant or even welcoming - it's just "a lobby." The rooms were fine, the bed was absolutely horribly stiff and uncomfortable - the cleaning staff did a great job. The pools. Truly odd and not worthy of spending time at them. (You are not beach front at all - so to me, why not make your pool areas amazing?) Best part of the hotel was the restaurant, Cinnamons. They have a wonderful team for breakfast or late afternoon outdoor bar/stop. Would not stay here again, and would not recommend it. Sorry!

After reading other reviews, I opted to pay an extra $50 a night for an ocean facing updated jr. suite, I thought it was worth it. Spacious bathrooms, necessary kitchen amenities, big bed and huge sliding doors overlooking ocean made it very relaxing.Front desk staff/reception could be improved upon. I had contacted the hotel weeks in advance about an early check in. We were coming in on a red eye from Japan and really could have used a place to shower and change. I received a response back promising to do everything to accommodate us early. I called desk when we arrived, they had no record of request. I asked if they could call me when room was ready, never happened. None of the desk staff was very welcoming either. In the future I would look for a condo/vrbo rental.

The location was perfect for my family (4 Adults and 2 children). Photos are exactly the same as on the website. The property manager was available straight away to let us into the condo when we arrived in Honolulu. Great views of the ocean and marina. Walking distance to everything such as shops, restaurants, Waikiki beach, Ala Moana shopping centre etc. The condo was spacious, very clean and tidy. Highly recommend.

Nice room with good functioning full kitchen. Short walk to anywhere.Clean room, friendly helpful maidsPools were clean main pool a bit dated. Newer pool is more of a shallow water sit down type. Beautiful beach but you may want water shoes at this end. Overall good place to stay and budget friendly!

English below:このホテル、アラモアナ・ワイキキを昔から知っている人には馴染みのあるものです。割り当てられた部屋は「改装したばかり」との触れ込みでしたが、そもそも作りが古いので限界があります。浴室のドアは50年もののホテルを反映する古いもの。窓に至ってはコの字型のフックで締めるといったもの。テレビやケーブルは、宙ぶらりんにぶら下がっていて、隠すことも、壁に沿わせて体裁を作ることもしていません。Wi-fiも無料で使えるのは、アメリカでは珍しいサービスですが、やや遅い。部屋の電話が無料なのはありがたいですね。古キッチンとはいえ、ディスポ―ザーはないし、冷蔵庫のドアは放っておくと全開します。取っ手も反対向きで使いにくい。このへんがアメリカですね。シャワーのカーテンも短いので、下手をすると床がびしょぬれになるのでご用心。水の出はあまりよくないです。アメニティはなし。アメリカなので、歯ブラシなどは鼻からありませんが、シャワーキャップや髭剃りなど、このランクのホテルなら出してよさそうなものすら提供してくれません。コンシアージュのオリエンがあるというので一応行ってみると、にこやかに迎えてはいましたが、まず使う英語が30年以上前のもの。男女のペアで現れると女性はMRSと呼ぶ。今時あり得ない。もっと問題なのは、これを指摘されて少々気を悪くした彼女、今度はこちらはハワイの元住人といっているのに、高額のオプショナルを売り込もうと試みたけれど、こちらがさっさと切り上げようとしているサインを読めず、さらにご機嫌を悪くしていました。ハワイにはリピーターも多いわけだから、こうした柔軟性のなさは、最初の笑顔を帳消しにしちゃうんだけどなぁ。The Ilikai has been still a landmark of the area, though nowadays it's been surrounded by upscale condos and hotels. The front fellow informed us that the room we were assigned had just been renovated; however, the hotel was build in 1964 and the bathroom door, window lock, and many other features suggest its "history." Free in-room wi-fi is great but it's a bit slow. The free domestic phone use is helpful. Full kitchen but no disposer. And the fridge has the door on the wrong side and opens 180 degrees to let the cold air leak quickly (other makers would sell better quality appliances).The shower curtain is short and guests must be careful about shutting it well so as not the water wet the floor. The water pressure is weak. Few amenities, no razor or show cap.The people at the front desk were friendly but the concierge lady needs to be more flexible and updated. We were a male-female pair and she immediately decided to call the woman "Mrs." When the woman corrected this language, she appeared to be offended. She was also not happy to hear that we went to the desk to see what they could offer to us (and out of courtesy to respond to their invitation to visit the concierge), former residents (not tourists) of the island. After figuring out that we did not the kinds of orientation she tried to sell, we politely sent her signs that we had no business and that we wanted end the conversation quickly, but the lady was not flexible enough to deal with people like us.The Ilikai is conveniently located. But it needs update, upgrade, and flexibility to deal with the increasingly diverse guest populations.

Our room was renovated and clean. It also had a nice kitchen so if we had stayed longer, it would have come to good use. The hotel had a super market inside too. It had everything you needed and it was also situated in a good location next to the Hilton where there were many restaurants, cafes and bars. Across the street were rent a car offices and massage places as well. A short taxi ride to down town or center as well.We did not get a room with a view. The city and mountain side is quite noisy with traffic although we were on the 9th floor! If you open the sliding door to the balcony, the sound was nearly unbearable. You need to go through the Hilton to get to the beach. There is no direct beach access. It seems like this Hotel used to be used in the original intro scene of "Hawaii five-O"- TV series (1968-1980) where the camera shoots Jack Lord from the helicopter to where he is standing outside on the top floor. I heard that this hotel used to be a luxuary hotel but now you can see that it was built quite a while ago and the place seems kind of run down and abandoned. I would say it's a nice average hotel but not luxury. Especially the hall way to the rooms and the lobby floor which had no tenants in many rooms looked shabby.The cleaning was very well done. The reception was average and the concierge was average too. The lady who was in charge was very young and seemed inexperienced. A kind and pleasant personell but not very knowledgeable or creative. She also seemed very tired and I felt very sorry for her that she had to take care of the concierge all by herself even though there was space for 2 more colleagues to sit and work there with her.

Some apartments are better than others. We stayed in both 08 and 24 versions. 08 has a marina view. 24 has a lagoon and toward diamond head view.Apartments vary because some are privately owned and some are managed by the hotel. Originally built over 50 years ago, condos vary in renovation standard depending on ownership. Check photos for the condo you are interested in online before you book.Toward the western end of the Waikiki stretch, so there is a short but pleasurable walk involved to get "into" the main drag. Great views if you select the right room on the right floor.We will be back armed with the floor and room location knowledge as they represented quality, private accommodation at a good price point.

Unfortunately we were only here a night but everything was great. The location is right on the water with an excellent view. Very clean and updated with a full kitchen. I would recommend staying here if you are here for a few days so you can go to the local markets and utilize the kitchen. The restaurant downstairs has a great happy hour and an excellent brunch, serving the top 5 pancakes in the US.

We had 10 nights in this condo (apartment) it was fantastic Phil the owner popped to say welcome on our arrival we cannot fault our stay in this condo (apartment) there was three of us plenty of room lovely and clean the extra bonus was having beach towels beach chairs boogie boards etc provided the view of the lagoon and beach was a welcome site all day and the Hilton Friday fireworks were great from our balcony the Hotel pool and facilities were great not to mention the coffee shop in the lobby we would recommend this condo.

The Ilikai is fine, nothing more. It suffers in comparison to its Waikiki neighbors, which have seemingly managed to remain contemporary and up-to-date. The Ilikai's open-air balconies are a plus, however. But the dated carpeting and furnishings knock this hotel down several rungs. The rooms are outfitted for pre-laptop and cellphone days -- outlets are inconveniently located. This hotel needs a reboot.

We stayed for just 2 nights prior to flying back home. Wanted to do some shopping at Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Did get a good deal when phoning the hotel directly, however, on check in they wanted to collect the resort fee, which was supposed to be already part of the quote. This resulted in a bit of a hassle, as the ft. desk agent was not able to make a decision and was a bit unfriendly. However, the rooms with kitchen are very nice, spacious and clean. I believe newly renovated. There is not really a direct shuttle to the shopping centre, as you would have to walk to Aqua Palms, the partner property and take the shuttle from there - something we were not told when making the reservation. In the end we simply walked to Ala Moana right from there. It is just a 15 minute walk anyway.

We booked an economy city view room via Marina Hawaii Vacations.PROS:-Pricing was reasonable and you get what you paid for.- Room is a bit dated but perfectly sized for a family of 4 ( 2 adults, 2 toddlers).- Sliding doors across the bed allows you to create a 'bedroom' so adults can still sit on the lounge while the kids are asleep in bed. - Pay as you go laundry and dryer.- Cinnamons has lovely food and a free hula performance every Friday night.- Aroma cafe has the most amazing flavoured coffees and acai bowls, but be prepared for a long wait at peak times.- Pool is clean, you have the options of a wadding pool in 2nd floor for kids and a general pool downstairs.- Grocery mart has most of the basic items you need and long operating hours. Friendly staff as well. - Also 2 ABC stores within close proximity.- Duke lagoon is very close, suitable for kids.- Proximity to Hilton also means really good fireworks view.- Walking distance to Ala Moana.CONS:- Not sure if its just because we booked with Marina Hawaii Vacations, but only a very small starter kit is provided. We ran out of rubbish bags and toilet paper and had to top up twice.- kitchen utensils and equipment is dated.- carpet is old, we wore slippers in the room all the time.- Valet parking is terrible at peak times,they almost lost our car once. Took us 20 minutes to sort everything out with 2 screaming kids.- Nothing to do at night.- Not many restaurants close by.CONCLUSION:Illikai is good if you are looking to stay off the main strip, want to be close to Ala Moana and dont want to do anything at night and are happy to do takeaways or eat at the hotel.If you are looking for the stereotypical Waikiki experience this is not the place to stay.

Great location.We stayed in the Diamond Head tower.25th floor with the ocean view.The view was fantastic. The room was good.It was well maintained.The service was fantastic. Anytime we needed something we called and the thing was delivered to our room within minutes. The daily cleaning was average at best. They changed the towels and the sheets. The location was fantastic. The lagoon right outside the hotel was perfect for the kids with some water activities. The beach is also less crowded than Waikiki and it is good. There are a lot of restaurants around the hotel. The Hilton hawaiian village and Ala Moana shopping center are also very near. We availed of the free beach towels aa they were very convinient. The kitchen was also well equipped.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment overlooking the marina and ocean. As others have said you are a 10 min walk to central Waikiki and a 5 to 10 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping centre. There are unlimited amounts of restaurants in the immediate area and a local supermarket at the end of the street opposite the building, another 5 minute walk. We stayed in Apt 510 which was in excellent condition and with everything you need. This Apt also had 2 balconies which was very convenient. Plenty of ABC stores within a minute or 2. Hilton Village next door. Great place for families to stay.

Great location. Trolley and bus stops right outside the front doors for things that are not with in walking distance. Rooms are spacious and clean. ABC store on the main floor and restaurants in the building.

We stayed in a spacious 2 bedroom suite on the 11th floor with lovely views of the marina and the ocean. Although we couldn't see the Friday night fireworks from our room, you got very good views by just walking 5 mins down towards the marina. There was also live music and Hula dancing on Friday night. You can also catch a bus easily to the Waikele factory outlets (E bus and then 433 or walk)

The Ilikai is in an excellent position as it is central to shopping at Ala Mona and also the Waikiki night life and day restaurants. The trolley stops right out the front. The condos are fabulous as they are fully self contained.

The title says it all.A bit dated but an iconic spot (as seen in the original Hawaii 5 0 TV show)Bus stop and trolley stop at front door for easy access to anywhere.Just be careful that if you book through something like Expedia you may end up in the time share units. Not a problem but they'll want to give you a sales pitch but then there is the $150 credit you get regardless. Made our tour of Pearl Harbour for the 2 of us just $30.

This is one of the better Hotels at Waikiki Beach. Our room was equipped with a kitchen and we also had a room with a nice view on the 22nd floor.Staff was very friendly and helpfully.Also the room rates where reasonable compared to other hotels in this area.Would stay there again.

We are very familiar w/Ilikai in Honolulu because every year we spend a month or more there. This summer was our 8th year in Oahu. Ilikai is an old hotel, almost historic. Part of it are hotel rooms, partially owned by individuals as short term rentals and etc. There is not a whole lot going for the building other than its location. It is a huge structure, due to its size and age there are some drawbacks. To start with there is no AC in the building. Hallways need upgrade. Couple of years ago hotel renovated few of the upper floors and units and sold them. Each individual unit has its own AC unit in the balcony (lanai). Some of those also older AC units and make too much noise and ruins your enjoyment of the lanai. The worse part is the roaches. Even though the entry of the building and most of the rental units seem to be clean unfortunately there are roaches every where. They usually come out at night, if you are walking bare feet inside the unit, in the dark, be careful you may step on one big crunchy roach. Never leave food on the counter, put everything in the fridge and take your trash out daily sometimes 2x a day. Having said that, the units facing the ocean and the marina have beautiful views. Some units are renovated and fairly tastefully decorated. If you want to stay there look at the pics, don't pick any of the older ones which has carpet on the floor. The whole building needs to be sprayed for roaches on regular basis. In that size of a building if you cant do the whole thing at once those creatures will travel from one section to another. All public areas and private units have to be done at the same time. Most units are studio's, some are 2 bedrooms as well as the penthouses. It is not cheap to stay there but I guess you are paying for the location and free roaches !!!!!

I first stayed in this property some 35 years ago, when the options for luxury on Waikiki were limited and the iconic building lorded over Ala Moana Boulevard and the nearby Hilton Hawaiian Village.
