Today, among the amazing growth of the city, the updated and thoroughly modernized hotel is still the best place to enjoy Waikiki in luxury and Pacific splendor. The view of Diamond Head and the Koolau mountains from the beach frame the experience with the nostalgia of the Honolulu paragon the Ilikai was, and the contemporary offerings that make it into what for me is now the quintessential Waikiki experience, especially when the torches light up at sunset...

I picked this hotel because of the room and the relatively low price compared to surroundings hotels. I also needed a place close to the conference I was attending so my options were limited. The room was probably remodeled recently which is always a plus. It included a living area with a sofa, 2 chairs, and a coffee table. A full kitchen with recent full size stainless steel appliances. A slightly larger than usual bathroom also remodeled recently. Overall, the room had everything I expected. The only thing missing was a desk but most people won't need one. Also, the A/C unit was way to noisy. The location of the hotel was good but not great. It is within walking distance (10mn) from a very big mall. You'll have some dinning options but most of them are on the not so healthy side and all are relatively expensive. Good thing that I had a full kitchen. What made the Hotel location not great is that it had no direct access to the beach. It's not far, perhaps 5mn from room to sand, but I would have liked a more direct access. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. Just be aware that they seem to have rooms and/or sections that have not been remodeled yet. It wasn't clear to me how to differentiate them.

Great location! Excellent view, if stay on Friday, can watch firework right at the balcony. Room was nice and clean, kitchens appliances was fully equipped. Free unlimited DVD was a bit old but it's free!

We have stayed at the hotel for a week with 6 and 3 yr olds. The room was spacious, cozy and very clean with full kitchen and refrigerator. Hotel is located very close to Hilton Hawaiian Village, Lagoon, Waikiki beach, dining areas, bars within walking distance. Convenient store and gift stops, casual dining area is located on the 1st floor and coin laundry machines are on every floor- so every thing was very convenient for a week stay. Shuttles and bus line stops right in front of hotel area, thus easily get to anywhere using public transportation. We have used pink line shuttle to Shopping center for free( for JBC card holder- whole family is without charge ) One thing to mention, We reserved the ocean view room expecting to see the ocean in the room but the view from the room was city(building view) and were able to see the ocean from the balcony area. We asked to the staff the front desk if there were mis-arrangement on the room type, but there wasn't. It supposed to be able to see the ocean from the balcony between the two buildings. So that was a little disappointing because when making the reservation, the ocean room was a bit higher priced than the city view or half ocean view rooms. I dont see a reason to spend more to reserve ocean room?- except that, everything els were good. I would recommend for the family looking for best value. 7세4세인 두 아이들과 가족여행으로 일주일 지냈다. 일층에 편의점(라면도 있고 과일도 있고) , 각 층마다 코인 세탁기가 있어 매우 편리했고 공간도 넓고 무엇보다 청소상태가 매우 우수했다. 주방도 아주 깔끔한 풀키친으로 냉동냉장실이 완벽히 구분된 냉장고가 있어 음식을 테이크아웃하거나 만들어먹기 좋았다. 다만 오션뷰로 예약했으나 방에서는 바다가 안보이고 건너편 힐튼 호텔이, 발코니에 나가서야 두 건물사이로 바다가 제한적으로 보였다. 예약시에 시티뷰와 하프뷰 옵션이 있었고 우리는 그보다 살짝 더 지불하고 오션뷰로 예약했음에도...방이 완벽히 오션뷰는 아니었다는거. 방에서 바다가 그림처럼 펼처진 전경을 생각한다면 확실하게 체크하는 것이 필수! 그 외엔 모든것이 깔끔하고 편리했다

Arrived early and room was ready, a real benefit after the red eye from Sydney. Very clean and well-apointed room. Great location close to Ala Moana Center, and all bus and trolley services. Taxi from airport is easy and good cost.

We absolutely LOVED our 15 day stay at the Ilikai. We had a group of 7 with children and booked a 2 bedroom suite on the 24th floor. It was breath-taking! There was a small kitchen, living and dining combo, plus 2 beds and 2 baths with a wrap around lanai offering ocean and downtown views. We got to watch the Friday night fireworks from our picture windows, watch the fire knife dancers perform at the Luau on top of the Hilton next door and, we just loved the gourmet breakfast every morning. One thing that makes this hotel stand out even more is the fact that one of our boys--age 5 rushed ahead of the group and went down the elevator without us. We followed but couldn't find him. I alerted the front desk staff and within 30 seconds they located our son!! This Mama was so relieved! There are cameras in every public space and they have a state of the art communication system. It helps that they also have staff everywhere. He had gone down to breakfast by himself, stinker! We also appreciated how we couldn't hear anyone and they couldn't hear us. Such a great location for families--beach access and everything close to downtown Waikiki. We can't wait to return!

Good hotel, within 1 mile from popular Waikiki attractions. Cheaper, good value for Money. It has one decent restaurant.Nice beach and laguna for kids to swim, can see firework on Friday evenings, Live music show on Friday evenings

We stayed here with my family for 7 days in November 2016. The staff at check in were great and we were directed to our room. We had a newly refurbished room overlooking the marina the Luxury Junior Suite Sunset Ocean View room. This was fantastic.It was great to have a kitchen, to prep meals. The oven was completely new! The Ilikai is a great location in Waikiki as it is not in the main hustle and bustle of the tourist strip. It is also a great walking distance to Ala Mona Shopping Center. Foodland Farms is a great supermarket with fresh produce. Make sure you give them your phone number to get the special prices. The pool on the first level has also just been renovated. It is a smaller pool, not really for proper swimming but excellent for kids. There is a bigger pool on the ground level which is a proper pool. We will be back for sure, many thanks for the excellent accommodation and service.

24th Anniversary Celebration!Hotel is lovely, we had the Jr suite , it was huge with an amazing view looking out to the ocean and fireworks! Every Friday night at 7:45pm Fireworks starts at the beach, if you can't see it from your room then you can make your way to the beach. Next to the Ilikai has a beautiful lagoon, it's a man made lagoon that pumps in salt water you can rent beach water trikes or even better, we found a place across the street next to McDonald's. A little surf shop rental... You will pay 30.00 a whole day... instead of paying 40.00 an hour from the rentals at the lagoonMahalo Mr. Kawakami ♡

I would stay at this hotel again, primarily because they do have a kitchen available (which I need when traveling with my family), and the room was large overall. The ocean view was a definite ocean view - with a marina view - although it was blocked by the other 1/2 of the building, so that was unfortunate and lessened the pleasure of the view. I had several non-working items: AC blew hot air (did get fixed the second night), Wifi was a disaster and cut out every 5 seconds (which was a problem because I was there for work), safe didn't work (and did not get fixed). There was no information in the room about where to eat etc . I had to try and go online to find out about the restaurants (which took forever since the wifi cut out constantly). The valet staff, albeit friendly overall, stood around and watched guests lug their suitcases up and down the stairs, instead of assisting. The hotel overall is in good but not pristine shape - good enough that I would come back because of the kitchen. But probably would look for somewhere else if it didn't have a nice kitchen. So 3.5 stars.

Very pleasantly surprised by this place. The bellman was our first impression with very warm and welcoming customer service. Our room was beautiful and the housekeeping g staff were superb with fresh linens every day without the card saying if you want fresh towels throw them on the floor. I appreciate that very much! My only complaint is the front desk could use more staffing - it seemed as though they were always busy and spent a lot of time with each guest making others wait. They were very friendly when we approached but we did have to wait if we needed assistance. Overall I highly recommend Ilikai Hotel & Resort! It is located near the beach, has a great pool and easy to navigate anywhere in Waikiki.

Inside = Awesome, Exterior = NotStayed for 3 days and turned into 6 days. Pros+ Very nice, spacious, furnished suite. Floor to ceiling, wall to wall sliding windows.+ Tasty breakfast spot in lobby+ Tucked away from touristy spots, more quiet.+ View fireworks on Friday+ Nice, helpful staff+ Close to Ala Moana mall / restaurants.Cons- Their old, stale exterior circa 1960s initially turned me off to this hotel.We'll be back!

What a great time....room was great and so was the view. Got to watch the sunset on my balcony every night. The staff was friendly, we loved the free DVD rentals and lemon water. This is close to lots of restaurants and the beach. We will be back.

Love this place!!!! Close to all the action with great facilities. We chose a sunset view suite & got a room on the 22nd floor with great views & amenities. Staff were all friendly & helped us out with booking a shuttle to the Waikele outlet shops. The onsite restaurant Cinnamons is the best for all day meals but breaky is the best. A must try is the guava chiffon pancakes & you can't go by the guava mai tai at happy hour. Great spot to see the Friday night fireworks too! Will be back Mahalo

Wow arriving to our apartment we were so impressed with the view!! With three small children, the lagoon was perfect. We could sit back and watch them from the edge without any worry. We would walk to the Waikiki strip in 10 minutes and was such a beautiful walk especially on the way back when our tummies were full! We also caught the bus in on other days and the kids loved the site seeing! We were able to catch a bus to Pearl Harbour without the tour which saved a bit! Short walk to the famous Ala Moana shopping centre which really needs to be seen to be believed. The apartment was perfect, with fridge, cooktop, microwave and with Food Pantry only 10 minutes away, helped save on eating out every meal. In saying that, the sushi downstairs at the onsite convenience store was really good! Hotel reception was very helpful as well as their bookings desk. We also had a washing machine and dryer on our floor so that was definitely a bonus for us. A must stay and will be back for sure!

Perfect location for a relaxing vacation. The view from the lanai was fantastic, blue sea, Friday night fireworks, couldn't have done any better! The condo is ultra modern, very clean and very comfortable. Highly recommend, you couldn't do better for a perfect Hawaiian holiday.

The Ilikai hotel was perfect for us! The hotel and the room were both beautiful, spacious and clean. The location was perfect, just steps away from the beach and lots of amazing restaurants and shops. We will definitely be back!!!

We recently went to waikiki and on the recommendation of friends who were travelling with us, stayed at the Ilikai Hotel. They had commented that the rooms were spacious and well appointed and the location was great. We couldn't agree more - whilst we were a 10minute walk away from the main hustle and bustle of waikiki crowds, the location was quiet and relaxing and a gentle 5 min stroll to Ala Moana Center. Nice spacious rooms with kitchen and full facilities make this a great place to visit. The rooms had been refurbished a few years back and were still in good shape. Friendly staff were always happy to accommodate our requests - even arriving at the hotel before 10am, we were provided with our room. If you prefer to be closer to the vibe of waikiki and more restaurants then suggest staying elsewhere but highly recommend the Ilikai Hotel otherwise. We will stay there again without doubt!

We stayed here 3 years ago for around 7 nights. Had a balcony view of the beach, lagoon and fireworks that occur every Friday night. Room was brilliant with everything we needed including a kitchen. Beach accessories including snorkels etc were also available in the room. Loved it so much we are heading back again in a few weeks.

This was a nice place to stay. Friendly staff and clean room. The cleaning crew was on "island time", they cleaned the room later in the day than we were used too. A few days the room wasn't clean by the time we came back. Only a small problem but worth mentioning. This was our first trip to Hawaii. Not the "resort style" of destination we were used to in the Caribbean. The restaurant and bar closed early not leaving us many options for a "night life." A nice hotel in a nice location. Close to the beach and lagoon. Easy access to interstate H1.

Room 1938 had an amazing view of the lagoon and the Friday night fireworks.A great feature of this room was the sliding Japanese style door which could close off the bed so we could put our daughter to sleep more easily. Then we just moved her to the sofa bed. Had everything we needed for our stay. A small shop for groceries, a great coffee shop, and Cinnamon's Restaurant downstairs were very handy.Short walk to the beach, a little further to Ala Mona Sopping Centre, and bus stop right outside.

We were lucky enough to get a renovated and lagoon / beach view ( we requested these ). These are a good sized studio apartment with stove / oven and full sized fridge. It has a great restaurant upstairs dong have breakfast at the restaurant downstairs attached to it. It's near the marina side of Honolulu. Not to far from alamoana shopping and $8 can ride to the "strip" The $28 a day ( tip not included ) valet parking fee is steep. All in all. I'd recommend staying here.

An amazing place to stay. 5 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Beaches at your doorstep, swimming pool. Cinnamons Restaurant with its beautiful food and staff, Bus stop outside, just seemed to have everything. I loved the 10 minute walk along the waterfront into Waikiki. Staff were very helpful. We had an amazing holiday. Only letdown was using Island Express Shuttle to airport recommended by Hotel. IES has the rudest, most arrogant staff and I would look at their Facebook page for the reviews. We were in Room 2320 and able too watch the La'au across the road lol...but yes I would definitely stay here again.

We had a wonderful honeymoon stay at the Ilikai ! The location is great: many shops around, many beaches (I recommend the Ala Moana one, which was not as busy as the Waikiki one), a pool and lots of restaurants ! We would definitely go back there if coming back to Oahu.

We stayed in Apartment 627 back in June 2016, had the most wonderful 16 glorious nights! The apartment was just gorgeous and the whole 'Ilikai' Experience just left me wanting more!!! Highly recommended!

Stayed here for two nights. Delighted to find the nice remodel work to all rooms. We have four couples travel together, all were satisfied with the rooms and the consciences nearby. It is an Apartment suit with belcony in all rooms. The kitchen is large and well equipped with full size refrigerator. We enjoyed sipping wine and watched the sunset at our belcony. Nice easy walks on the beach! The only complain is the watery in room coffee. Hope they can upgrade it. Or bring your own.

Amazing views from our room on the 12th floor overlooking the marina & lagoonAwesome fir the Friday night fireworksIts a bit dated & daggy, supermarket was super handy, outside grounds are lovelyAte at the restaurant on the ground floor twice, first time had a yummy breaky but service was ordinary, then went for dinner & the menu was terrible, really struggled to pick something, then when we were leaving the waitress was rude and said we didnt tip enough! What the! So we gave her $10 and never went back Tried to book tours at the tour desk twice, long waits and unhelpful staff both times, once I just had a question about the trolley and she had no clue, pretty much handed me a book to work it out myselfPool area was nothing special but fine, staff were always lovely, only went down once and had to wait about half hour for a loungePersonally if I went back to Waikiki id stay in the heart of it, i found the Ilikai a little bit too far out, but the $2 pink line is easy to get down there, I think there is a cheaper bus option but couldnt get anyone to help us to explain it to us so kept paying $2 a tripIf i had kids though it would probably be perfect with great easy access to the lagoon & beach

We had a fantastic vacation staying at the Ilikai! The location is perfect - close enough to walk to both Ala Moana Shopping Mall and the Waikiki Beach area, or easy to catch the Pink Line bus right outside the front of the building.Our apartment was a private rental, booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals, and was located on the Penthouse floor (2607 - The Sky Penthouse). As a family of five adults, we had a comfortable stay in the apartment and really appreciated the air conditioning as well as the full kitchen. We had no trouble with noise, and found the whole floor to be quiet and peaceful. The view from the lounge and main bedroom is incredible - we could see Diamond Head, the lagoon and the beach, and we were also able to watch the Hilton Hawaiian Luau, as well as their fireworks show, right from our lanai. For those who are interested in an apartment review, for penthouse accommodation, the size of the lanai was slightly disappointing as it was very thin and difficult for us all to enjoy it at the same time. On arrival, we were unfortunately disappointed with the level of cleanliness of the floor. The apartment has tiles throughout, and by the end of our first night, the bottoms of our feet were very dirty. After staying in other privately owned apartments, we were also surprised to see that there was no washing powder included. We ended up going to the Laundrette on the level below and purchased some from one of the machines. We loved the facilities at the Ilikai Hotel that were included in our condo stay. Access to the pool was enjoyed by the whole family, as well as the live music in the lobby on weekends, and we adored the lovely staff (particularly Maurice!) in the convenience store downstairs. There is no shortage of fantastic eating options nearby, and we enjoyed meals at many of these restaurants including Bubba Gump (Ala Moana), Outback Steakhouse, Wailana Coffee House and Goofy Café & Dine, and we loved having a McDonalds right across the road. We walked just a couple of blocks to the Food Pantry on Hobron Lane to do our grocery shopping for the week.We rented a car during our stay, and chose Alamo Rent A Car, which is located in the Discovery Bay Centre across the road. Rather than using the valet parking in the hotel, we utilised the self parking behind the Red Lobster, which was $20 a day.Overall, we had a wonderful week at the Ilikai, and can't wait to return to Waikiki one day soon!

We booked through the Ilikai website (previously had booked at the Hilton, right next door) and got a discount for switching over. We were glad we did.The hotel was a classic hotel, the one in the opening scene of Hawaii 5-0 with Jack Lord. The hotel was attractive, numerous elevators and 2 pools.The room was like a condo on the 25th floor, and had a lanai that overlooked the harbour and featured beautiful views of the ocean and sunsets. The lanai was large and relaxing.The room featured a stove, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster and dishes/utensils. It was a modern looking room, king bed, large screen tv and walk in shower for 2.The bed was ok, not incredibly comfortable. There was an electronic safe and closet for hanging clothes. The maid came in during mornings to clean the room and restock towels/coffee.The price was very good compared to other hotels with similar features. The resort fee was $18 compared to $30 that most charge. We had towels and chairs for the ocean, dvd and playstation games available to us.I visited the adult pool with relaxing lounge chairs in the water. The pool was not for swimming but rather relaxing. There were lots of lounge chairs and umbrellas available.Across the street was ABC store that sold everything, McDics, a Wing place, Outback, Red Lobster and other restaurants. All tours that we booked picked us up right in front of the hotel and was a main pick up for most tours and hotels in the area.The beach was a short walk and was in front of the Hilton.I would stay here again and recommend it to others. Great specials on the website.

We stayed 2 nights at the Ilikai to finish a three week Hawaiian holiday. This was our fourth trip to Hawaii and we normally stay in central Waikiki, so it was a nice change to check out this end of Waikiki (near the Marina/Ala Moana shopping centre). We payed a bit extra to get a room with an ocean view and this was superb on the 25th floor (room 2516 on the 2nd highest floor). The Ilikai is 50 years old, but overall is very well maintained and retains an attractive appearance in all common areas such as lobby, lifts, corridors and main driveway. Off the open-air lobby there are a small number of shops including a casual restaurant/cafe, a good coffee shop and Whaler's (similar to ABC shop). Our room was a 'junior suite' and included a stove, microwave and large fridge and therefore you could store/prepare some meals if desired (this is above most basic hotel rooms). The room overall was very nice, but did have a couple of marks on the carpet and a lot of marks on the wall on one side of the bed, where I suggest people store/open their suitcases (as there is no where else). It is an easy walk to/from the Ala Moana shopping centre, that has a large number of shops including some restaurants and a food court. Overall, a good place to stay.

We have stayed here 9 times and have enjoyed every visit. The open air registery area is a real experience and absolutely says you are in America's Paradise. Spacious room and balcony and great restaurants. A short walk to the quiet end of Waikiki Beach.

Its an excellent Place to stay close too all amenities (shopping, eating etc.) IIikai Is clean and good for resting and very Close to the Ala Moana Shopping Center excellent for all your shopping needs

We stayed here for our honeymoon. Nice renovated room on the 23rd floor. It's definitely worth paying a little more for an ocean view. Gorgeous day and night. And a great place to view the fireworks from the Hilton on Friday nights, too!Bed was quite comfortable and the room was always cleaned very nicely! Great to have a kitchen will all the things you'd need.They just opened a 2nd pool area on the 2nd floor mid- October. Both areas were sufficient for our needs. We also never had a problem finding a chair!The front desk staff remembered us throughout our visit and we're always very helpful and accommodating.Would definitely stay here again!

We were pleasantly surprised at how well-kept this property was. From the lobby you could tell this was an older building and the hallways smelled a bit old, but the suite was nicely renovated with good furnishings. The view was nice with large windows all around. The kitchen was fully stocked with utensils and such except that the pots weren't usable. They looked very dirty like previous people used it/burned something and tried to scratch it off and thus damaging the pots? We needed to boil water but the kettle didn't look good inside either as there was some black residue of some sort. Bathrooms were clean and the heated toilet seats were "interesting."A bonus was getting to see the fireworks up front on Friday night from the balcony!Location is great for walking to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and Wal-Mary. The Hilton beach was nice too (except for the rocks - water shoes are good to bring!). The Açaí bowl from the coffee shop downstairs is the BEST! We had them from many different places and this one was the best by far!

We stayed at the ilikai for 2 nights. We were on the second floor newely renovated (same floor as the new pool). Not great for the view (we had partial ocean view) but everything else was awesome. Clean spacious room with everything you need (kitchenette). Nice walk to get to the beach which is butifull and clean. very familiy oriented with the lagoon. The nicest sunset i've seen.

Great price and location. Plus you get full access to the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door, so two hotels for a great price. Make sure you do the outrigger boat excursion, and visit Duke's! Walking distance to plenty of restaurants, easy for Uber to find, rental car is across the street. Rent a car and drive an hour up to north shore, definitely a great day trip. Ilikai staff are very helpful as well with discounts and recommending excursions. I really enjoyed my stay here.

I was impressed with the cleanliness and spaciousness of the room I had. The hotel staff was personable and friendly. Nice store in the lobby where I got 1/2 and 1/2 for my morning coffee. Easy walk to the Hilton Waikiki Village and beyond. As a woman traveling alone, I felt extremely safe in this property. Would definitely stay here again.

We booked through Hawaiian Vacation Properties LLC and it all ran smoothly. We stayed in suite 2002. It contained 2 double beds, kitchenette and bathroom. The kitchen, beds and living area were all in one room, but it was a pretty good size and we, 2 adults and 2 teens didn't feel as though we were too squashed in. There was a small but nice balcony overlooking the harbour. There were boogie boards and beach towels for use. Were able to use the pool downstairs as well. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the Ala Moana International Marketplace. It's not in the heart of Waikiki but a short 10 minutes walk, and really it was nice to be able to walk home at night along the beachfront. We didn't feel as though we missed out on anything as we were out every night anyway. I would stay here again. There is an ABC store for snacks and drinks and souveniers in the building and a few gift shops.

Just enjoyed a fantastic 10 day stay in a very comfortable and well located condo at the Ilikai complex. The Ilikai is an iconic hotel at the northern end of Waikiki which makes it handily located to the shopping at Ala Moana, the less populated but just as good beaches behind Hilton Hawaiian Village and all the action of central Waikiki is only 10 minutes stroll away. This seemed a very safe and thankfully quieter part of Waikiki and not once did we feel for our safety whilst wandering around at night As many others have, we rented through Waikiki Beach Rentals and found them very easy and professional to deal with. The condo was on the 20th floor (2020) with a beach and lagoon view. The best aspect I believe as it not only afforded the best views of fireworks, Hilton luau and beach etc but was well positioned for morning sun whilst avoiding the heat of the afternoon sun experienced on the marina side of the building. The condo was well maintained and fitted out with all the comforts needed and was well presented on arrival. The use of a keypad for entry rather than a card or key was very handy and most welcome. Good air conditioning, towels were plentiful, the granite kitchen had reasonable appliances and utensils for cooking if you preferred. New full sized fridge, large Sony Bravia TV, comfortable bed and adequate indoor and outdoor furniture. Cleaning during a condo rental is in your own hands for the duration of your stay but can be paid for if you wish. Vacuum cleaner, brooms etc all provided. The highlight feature is definitely the lanai to sit out on with a morning coffee or evening beer and to just soak in the view. All was well maintained and very clean on arrival. Early check in is available at a $30 fee otherwise its 3pm in as usual with most hotels. Something to consider and arrange if you have an early arriving flight.The Ilikai complex itself has a few shops and a very well priced and perfectly good ground floor restaurant in Cinnamon's that was fine for informal dinners serving a good range of delicious food and also does a pretty mean breakfast. The bar was a great place to unwind for evening cocktails with live music and a sunset view over the marina. On top of the hotel is Sarentos Restaurant which was a more formal venue that also served excellent food with some of the best views you will find. There are many good restaurants within a 5 -15 minute walking range but it still amazes how we often find some of the better places are often within the hotel where you stay.As a condo guest you have limited contact with the hotel staff but are able to use the concierge to book tours etc. We found them very friendly and professional to deal with when booking a hire car and a tour. The advantage of condo rental is definitely price and value. The disadvantage, if you could call it that, is that you are pretty much self sufficient for your stay. However, our travelling companions had a small wifi issue in their condo which was dealt with promptly by who we presume was the hotels onsite maintenance people so you are not completely on your own in a time of need. Reassuring. There is a lot to like about the ilikai. Certainly not pretentious or claiming to be 5 star but seems to be clean, well maintained for its age and run by a friendly and efficient crew. We found nothing at all to criticize or dislike about our choice of accommodation and an Ilikai condo will be definitely be our first choice for our next visit.

Stayed four nights during a tour of US Immaculate suite apartment with two separate bedroom / sleeping areas All amenities we wanted including two bathrooms, lounge, two balconies and a great view over the marina Kitchen area was well equipped Well placed for walking to beach, shops and many bars and restaurants

This would have to be the best location in Waikiki. It is away from the hustle and bustle and noise but only a short 10 min walk to the main centre along the beach. We used Hawaiian Vacation Properties LLC who were fantastic. I was a bit unsure cause we only had communication via email but there was no problem at all. When I sent emails to make enquiries they responded straight away.When we opened up the room you could smell it was clean. Everything was spotless. And it had everything you could need. There were beach chairs, boogie board and snorkelling gear left for us to use. It also has a full kitchen just in case you want to cook breaky, lunch or dinner. The king size bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in whilst on holidays and the pillows were super soft. We had a fireworks / ocean /pool view. It was magnificent. The friday night fireworks were amazing and we had uninterrupted views of the ocean and the lagoon.The lagoon was wonderful to swim in and it would be ideal for anyone with little children. Just a 2 mins walk from the unit. The pool was also great. The Waikiki Trolley has a stop in front of the hotel and the Tour Booking Girls at the hotel were fantastic. The Cinnamon restaurant is on the ground floor as well. We only had breaky there a few times but they make the best pancakes and at reasonable price. The Ala Moana Shopping Centre is only 1 trolley stop away or a nice 10 min stroll. It has a huge market place and lots of great shopping. Lots of nice restaurants too.So glad we stayed here and we will definately stay here again next time we visit. I don't think you could get a better room/location.

Five adult family members and a 6month old baby had the best family holiday almost solely due to the accommodation which was extremely spacious - 2600sf with the best views from the lounge, dining and master bedroom areas. This was like a family home that kept us all together and was booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals as this was a privately owned condominium on the top floor (there is a restaurant on the top floor but this is the top accommodation level - penthouse level) There are other condo's on this level but I would go back and stay at this one again for sure. The hotel pool is available for use, there is a great coffee shop below - normal coffee as in Australia which we had every day. We mostly dined out but had 2 breakfast's in the downstairs restaurant which was typically American style - omelettes and pancakes if you chose them. The master bedroom was very spacious like a family living room. The second bedroom led to the second ensuite and the den closed off with a sofa bed that our 30yr old daughter slept peacefully on. The master ensuite was a little tired but functional and I thought the $495US per night was quite reasonable considering we had 2 families essentially and I would thoroughly recommend this for similar situations. On site parking was $28US a day which took up to 11pm at night but we only used this on the first day to make it easier for the bags etc; We used the nearby Red Lobster carpark once at $20US a day but there is 6 hour free parking at the beach but that ceases at 10.30pm and the vehicles are then towed. A number of bays along the water side of the hotel at $US1/hr and free parking at Ala Moana Shopping Centre which is about an easy 10min walk so we parked there during the day when not using the vehicle or at the 6hr free parking and then of an evening at the $US1/hr overnight, mostly only costing $US 10-12 a night. 20min walk to Waikiki shopping precinct and the Duke's lagoon at the front of the hotel was perfect for a dip as was the beach. Fireworks every Friday night which are located on the edge of the lagoon and completely visible from our balcony, many hundreds of locals flood the carpark and set up on the edge of the lagoon having a picnic etc;

Great views, staff not overly friendly in hotel or porters, assistance at concierge desk great, restaurant inexpensive and pretty good food. Valet parking only at $24/day.We stayed on 21 floor facing west with lovely views of sunset.

We had a suite at the Ilikai for seven nights and was not by any means disappointed . My husband and I had a panoramic view of the beach with a direct view of the beautiful lagoon as well. No complaints! Can't wait to visit this hotel and island soon again .Char

We've been staying at the ilikai for years. The rooms are roomy especially if you get one with a ktochen. Gotta have our morning coffee on the deck. Its cental location couldn't be better especially if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of waikiki. The hotel now has a great breakfast/lunch/dinner restaurant. ITs the same as the highly rated Cinnamon's in Kailua. GReat Hawaiian music and hula shows Friday and Saturday nights on the patio, where you can also view the Hilton's spectacular fireworks show. Easy walk to Ala Moana Park and the huge Ala moana Mall. Rooms are super quiet.

We booked the Ilikai through their website and were able to secure a Luxury Suite with Sunset view for a great price. We were attending Hawaii for the 1st time to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary.So glad we chose the Ilikai, the room we stayed in was Room 2302 had the most awesome view and was absolutely beautiful.From the moment we walked in everything about our stay was fantastic. Rod at the front desk was just terrific and couldn't have been more helpful, he was such a great guy and so helpful with any questions or queries we had.The room was sooo beautiful and so clean and well maintained. The pool area is so gorgeous and so relaxing. Cinnamons is delicious at any time of day.The local shop is so well stocked you really need never leave the hotel should you so desire.The hotel is situated right outside a bus stop and the Concierge couldn't be more helpful in booking tours for you or giving you information on buses to catch etc.Being so close to Ala Moana shopping centre is a bonus and also going on bus tours meant we would be the last to be collected and the first to be dropped off which was great after a long day or night event.Everything about the Ilikai is great in our opinion and we will be definitely telling family and friends to check out the Ilikai for their visits.Thank you to everyone at the Ilikai for making our stay so enjoyable we have wonderful memories that we will have forever and we couldn't be happier.Thank you for everything

My family stayed at The Ilikai for 2 weeks and loved it. We stayed on the 11th floor with a Marina view. Ilikai is only 5 mins walk away from Ala Moana shopping centre, and conveniently located close to Teddys Bigger Burgers, Don Quixote supermarket, Wal-Mart, Ross dress for less and TJ Maxx. The Ilikai lobby is pretty amazing, the convenience store is well priced. I used the laundry facilities every other day. Buy your own washing powder as theirs isn't great. $2.50 for a small box of powder, $2.50 for a 26 minute normal wash and $2.50 for the dryer (never used, I hung clothes over chairs on the lanai). Each Friday there is a firework show at the lagoon. It starts at 7:45, lasts for 3 minutes and is amazing. Cinnamons have a great selection of cocktails to try. The Pink line trolley stops right outside the Ilikai and each trip is $2 per person. In our room we had 2 double beds and a queen size pull out couch bed. This was extremely uncomfortably for two people has the springs were coming in from the sides. The double beds were quite comfortable. The AC was extremely effective. The Iliikai is great for families and couples. The pool is heated and has loungers around the pool. The attendants give u as many towels as you want.

My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel for a week and really enjoyed it! The rooms were very nice and had everything we needed. The kitchen was great with a full size refrigerator, microwave, and plenty of plates, cups, and eating utensils. The room had a decent sized flat screen TV as well as a Play Station 3. In the lobby was a rental machine that you could get new release movies and video games to use with the Play Station. We really enjoyed being able to grab a new movie each night and relax in our hotel after a long day exploring the island. The bed was pretty firm but still comfortable to sleep on and the pillows were a typical hotel pillow that allowed your head to sink to the bed as soon as you laid on them. Had to fold mine or stack two on top of each other in order to be comfy. The bathroom was very modern and clean with a decent sized shower and lots of counter space. The staff at the hotel were all very nice and friendly. The security guards weren't the friendliest or most professional I've seen but that's not at fault to the hotel since they were from a private security company. The lobby of the hotel has a decent restaurant, but nothing amazing, as well as a few little shops including a market that was very handy for us to buy drinks and other small items to stock our fridge with. We never checked out the pool but why would you when the beach was literally a minute walk away. Our favorite part was definitely the proximity to the Hilton lagoon as well as the beach which was just directly behind the hotel and easily accessed with a pathway straight from the lobby. The only negative critique we had during our stay was with the Wi-Fi. We were first unable to log on at all and a maintenance person had to come to our room and even call the service provider before being able to fix it. Once it was fixed we still fought with it our whole trip since the connection was very poor and would go in and out on a regular basis. Luckily we didn't need Wi-Fi too much so it didn't effect us terribly. All in all we really enjoyed staying here and would definitely consider coming back on future trips to Hawaii.

Beautiful modern clean room on the 24th floor. Great view, wish we could have stayed longer! Excellent services, easy check in. No complaints at all. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was a good value for a tourist area. Not right on the beach but close enough.

The hotel was convenient for beach and shopping. Main lobby and entrance are beautiful. My room was good, bed comfortable but furniture a bit in need of updating. Street facing rooms and AC are noisy.

Stayed at The Ilikai Hotel, very comfortable, just a short distance from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but close enough to walk everywhere, Ala Moana Shopping Mall, 10 minutes up the road, easy walk, or catch the Trolley bus right outside the Ilikai. Beach another easy walk.

Was only here for 2 nights but it was a fantastic stay!!From the moment I arrived it was a pleasure to be a guest in this hotel. Exceptional service, clean and tidy throughout the hotel, modern in most areas & the room was incredible. I would happily stay here again on my next visit to Hawaii. Thanks for having me!!

We had a 15th floor room with a view over the yacht club. The sunset from the balcony was a cracker! The place shows a little age but the location makes up for it. I loved the link to Hawaii 5 0 is a bonus

We stay here usually every other year for a few days before flying back to the mainland. This is not the newest hotel in honolulu but over the years they have refreshed the bar/restaurant area, added shops on the ground level and of course the location in the middle of all the action never changes. Studio suite room with stove/oven, microwave and full-size fridge. Large bathrooms with walk-in shower and a nice patio area to enjoy the fireworks and sites. Don't ever lose that authentic Hawaiian charm- its always appreciated.

Great location, views, good size rooms, fantastic servicing, comfortable bed and you can also cook in your room. We didn't do any cooking but loved the freedom of having all the plates and utensils. We stayed for 7 days and it would also be great for longer stays.

Good size room absolutely disgusting condition of sofa bed. The room needs to be updated especially the furniture we only lasted 4 days before needing to change hotels room 1202. Would suggest you checking condition of rooms when booking as there does not seem to be any standards.The hotel public areas are clean and looks good unfortunately the lifts are always out of service putting extra pressure on the ones that work resulting in long waits to get back to rooms.Parking is expensive but half the price across the street.

The Ilikai Hotel is stunning and perfectly situated for our needs. It was a pleasure to have a short walk to the beach without the need to cross any roads. Although situated at the quieter end of Waikiki, there is no shortage of great restaurants and shopping within walking distance. I would happily stay again on any future trips and recommend it to friends.

This was my second time staying here, in a different room but both having fabulous views of the lagoon. Great location, rooms and hotel cater to your every need. Will definitely be making another visit.

My wife stayed in this hotel as a child 50 years ago!Obviously refurbished since then but has a bit of olde world charm. Great service on reception. We arrived very early but our room was ready. The room has a great layout - bed faces the TV over a couch also facing the TV. Wish all hotel rooms were like that?Typical of US hotels there is a coffee maker but no kettle. We bought a $15 one from Wal Mart for our cups of tea and left it behind. Not central in Waikiki but we liked that. Not far to the beach outside the Hilton, walking distance to the Ala Moana Centre and good shopping and restaurants close by. Our pick for the definite future visit!

The Ilikai is the grand lady of Waikiki. Despite its age it remains timeless and well maintained. We stayed here for a week and had no issues what so ever. Its location is central to everything with buses and trolleys stopping right outside the front of the resort. The concierge staff were very helpful in organising taxis and shuttles when necessary. There are three wings which offer different views from each side, depending on what you like. To get the best views of the Friday night fireworks from your balcony, request a unit ending in 28, 30, 32, 34, 36, 38, 40, 42 or 44. We were on the 17th floor in 1742, overlooking the lagoon, bay and ocean. Most of the rooms are refurbished , but ensure you ask for one. The bar offers nice food and cocktails and views of the marina. Incidently the marina is where the SS Minnow left from for its three hour cruise with Gilligan, the Skipper etc, etc, etc. Also the original Hawaii Five 0 opening sequence, featuring Jack Lord was shot on the Ilikai. I would recommend anyone to stay here and I would do so again.

This was our first time at the Ilikai and will definitely be back. Great location away from the hustle and bustle with a very enjoyable walk to the heart of Waikiki. Rooms are clean and very comfortable with fabulous views and fully equipped. The pool is spotlessly clean with a great atmosphere.Everyone is very friendly. We were very impressed with everything about these condos and wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

We only got to stay one night because we flew out the next time for Kauai, but the location was good, we had a great view of the ocean and walking distance to the beach. Clean, large room with nice kitchen and amenities and there's a great little coffee shop in the morning. The pool was nothing to write home about and we actually got up and left the restaraunt because the menu selection was like a diner. Not for us

Your entry to the luxury foyer is shortlived as soon as get into the lift and arrive at your floor, when you are subjected to intolerable heat in the lifts and hallways. Upon inquiring with the concierge as to what was wrong with the Aircon I was informed they do not air condition hallways as you have a wall mount Air Conditioner in your room. It was extremely uncomfortable exiting the room each time in to the very hot and stuffy hallways. Beds in the rooms were very small for doubles and a number of cockroaches were running around the room when we arrived. Outdoor setting only had two dirty stained chairs and a tiny old coffee table. Air conditioner unit very noisy. No bed side tables or lamps and limited storage. No in room safe. We tried to have a pizza delivered to the hotel only to be advised that the concierge would not accept it on our behalf therefore they would not deliver. Internet computer not operational and unable to print anything in their so called business centre and was told by the front desk to go to the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We booked two further rooms for the rest of the family and although they had similar issues with aircon & noisy air conditioning units etc they at least had good outdoor settings and storage.

We spent two weeks at the Ilikai and it really was fantastic. Strongly recommend you do your research first. We had a two bedroom, two bathroom apartment with sea and marina views which were stunning. Breakfast on the balcony in the mornings and pre dinner drinks also watching the sunset.Full kitchen and plenty of room for four adults. It also had a laundry just down the corridor. Do your research though. Other rooms only had street views and weren't as good.Walking distance to the shops in Ala Moana and Waikiki. Buses stopped right outside. Beach and the Hilton lagoon easy 5 minute walk

Stayed in a private apartment which are located above the hotel. Central to everything. Pick up and drop offs start here, beaches on the Island AMAZING!! Must go to Chiefs Luau, amazing evening great entertainment fantastic host. A must is a doors off helicopter tour, our pilot looked like Magnam. Walk up Diamond so much to see and do glad we had two weeks, Pearl Harbour a very emotional place. Just a holiday of a lifetime we loved Honolulu. Lovely people.

We got a room on the 25th floor with a lagoon / ocean view and we couldn't be happier. The room was fully renovated with all new amenities , updated kitchen, living room and bathroom with a spectacular view. We stayed in Waikiki which is great for Oahu and is centrally located on the island . We were within walking distance of everything we needed from food , alcohol and restaurants. Couldn't be happier with the prices , the hotel , staff and Valet parking , as for my man Win the overnight valet who was the nicest guy and just rocked. If you want value, a great hotel that is centrally located and within distance of everything I highly recommend and suggest the Illikai in Oahu , you will not be dissapointed. BTW the hotel restaurant Cinnamon's was great and reasonable

From the moment we arrived we were well looked after, early checkin, clean and spacious room, helpful staff. We booked a room with kitchen, intending to cook breakfasts to save a little money, but the cost of grocery items soon changed our mind, so the kitchen was not really necessary after all. The hotel was extremely conveniently located with every possible transport option right at the door. The lagoon at the back was an asset for an afternoon stroll and provided easy access the the nearby beachside bars.

Booked room 1131 which was fantastic facing west so got a great view of the beautiful sunset each night. Room was spacious and well appointed. Hotel had all amenities you need. Close to bus stops where you can travel anywhere on the island for $2.50. A hint though if you want to save money hiring a car catch the bus to the airport to pick up and drop off, saves about $80-$100.
user_name:
Scotty M
Greater Wellington, New Zealand

review_body: The Room.This is coming at you from a Birds Eye View from one of the 19th floor, Oceanfront even numbered rooms ranging 1927-1944. You still get the same similar view from a slightly different angle in the even numbered rooms ranging 1911-1926. We normally do the all-inclusives but here in Hawaii at the Ilikai we went full out with a full kitchen. A scissors would be a welcome addition to the utensil supply - but the sharp steak knife worked good enough. Still we kept in-room preparation down to a minimum as there are plenty yummy places to dine - just be prepared to pay the typically higher State prices. Honourable mention goes to the Tropics Bar and Grill, LuLu's and Cheesebuger Hawaii - yum, yum and more yum - search them out. The first one even provided an excellent sunset dinner complete with a band with good tunes named the Pyranhas I think. Search out the Food Pantry for good prices to stock your fridge and cupboards. A blender was provided but we brought along our own ninja for daily green smoothies! We liked the room but from the online booking it seemed like there was only rooms with one king sized bed. Our special request for a room with two beds was honoured making our stay most comfortable. The alternative would have poor Randy sleeping on the couch or floor lol. I brought along a long extension cord and it worked well to enable me to power/charge a couple of devices bedside. AC outlet space was limited and not so convenient. It is a retro hotel after all. We had no issue with room service. We left tips from time-to-time and a bigger one on check-out. But not sure if it was a resident or guest that was ragging on a housekeeper one day for not doing an adequate job. She was not quiet about it with her door hanging open. Both having been in the resort-service industry, we felt bad for the housekeeper. While we didn't have all the facts, the incident could have been handled out of guest' view.The Hotel.The island of Oahu is rich in historic/popular celebrity residencies (not like the Vegas-style celeBritany-residencies lol). The Ilikai is no different with Hawaii Five Oh opening scene shots and John Lord even lived in the Penthouse for a time. The hotel was one of the originals and as such our floor was very retro. The 22nd floor looked renovated and this is where we went for side-pop and ice even though ice cube trays are provided in the roomy freezer. A couple of washers and a couple of dryers in each floor's laundry room helped to keep luggage down to carry-on size. I would say if you are pressed for time on any of your ascents or descents on the elevator - take the bather's elevator as it seems quicker and less used. But most times we got good runs up or down one of the five main elevators without too many milk runs. We were disappointed on our last night stay when we went up to the 30th floor Piano Bar and Restaurant for happy hour forty percent off food pricing. Expensive as expected. Great ambiance and views. Excellent service. Classy. Classy licks from the piano player. And the disappointment comes from the outside-looking glass elevator being out of service. One of the five main elevators took us to the penthouse (floor 26+) where we used penthouse accessible elevators to Sarento's on 30th. The main floor lobby is spacious and I love standing in the BREEZE-WAYs leading into the hotel. There is nothing like that rush of air to refresh you! Wander around back for some shaded seating after wandering through a calming landscape of trees, plants, birds, flowers and water. Unless otherwise-specified most places on the island encourage you to pick the flowers. They grow plentiful. When checking-in and at the front desk, turn to your right and go immediately to the far end and get a refreshing small cup of lemony ice cold water - schlurp! A ramp down back of the hotel provides easy access to the beach and lagoon. The hotel provides extra beach towels and close-to-the-ground seats if you like. We only used that service once. Hotel service fees also got us free DVD selections too but such activity never came up. The TV went on rarely before bedtime. A daily newspaper arrived at our door each morning which was our source for an Annual Greek festival happening down at the Ala Moana Park that we walked to. We opted for a nice walk of that beach at the same time in preference over walking the Ala Moana shopping center across the street which would have also given our step counters something to brag about too lol.Amenities.The Ilikai Hawaiian Aroma Cafe on the main floor serves up a mighty yummy Coco Choco Mocha - yum! For you smokers, the hotel is non-smoking by law. Just ignore those who ignore the law and don't look too closely at surrounding balconies or ya might find the odd ashtray sitting on lanai tables lol. We abided and early morning/ late evening smokes were had in the designated benches out back overlooking the marina where Gilligan's Isle opening scenes were filmed. Other times right out-front off to the side by some parking offered a good shaded smoking area. If the shade don't matter - out back will bake ya good as did us from time to time. Yes we know, bad habit - but we seem to be only vacation smokers. Can't get menthol smokes in Alberta Canada anymore - dontchya know! The main floor Oahu Market has a good variety store selection where I got my lemons to make something one guest called my "poor man's lemonade". Hooked on half a squeezed lemon (I brought a small manual juicer too), a bit of sugar, lots of ice and spring water purchased from the market. If need-be almost every street corner has a "first-three-letters-of-the-alphabet" store. I picked up some large plastic cups from somewhere like that - but I preferred the plastic over the provided glasses and coffee cups - especially for out on the lanai and in the bathroom. There was good supply of towels and papya-based soap, shower gel, moisturizer, shampoo and conditioner. We got our concentrated sunshine for about an hour every day pool-side. Morning time about nine after the lane swimming ends did us well with always a couple of lounge chairs by the pool. They are kid friendly with their floatation devices and most entertaining watching parents teaching their kids to swim. One could do a blog about the swim-coaching methods of parents at the Ilikai pool and maybe make a book of it - The Good, The Bad, The Ugly - we saw it all at other times of the day.Getting Around Town.Doing a couple of tours? We found we were usually the first picked-up from a string of hotels and best of all - the first to be dropped off! Location was great for us even with the populations of the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door. The beach can be walked right down to the thick of things with the busy Waikiki beaches. I think we came upon three board walks with waves splashing up at times and one beach area between boardwalks that had to be carefully timed or get all wet during high tide. Go left from the front of the hotel to cross the street at the corner to catch TheBus #42 and take it to the Stadium every Wed, Sat and Sun for a flea market. Or, stay on the hotel side of the road and take TheBus #42 or #19 to get to Waikiki beaches and shopping or as previously mentioned to the Food Pantry, We even used the #42 from across the street to get us down to Chinatown and some pier viewing harbour-front and down by the Aloha Tower before getting a return trip on the #19 with our transfer - cost - $2.50 each. I think it was TheBus #20 that got us up to a top near Diamond Head Crator. We walked the hike up and only just to after the tunnel; took a few pics of the switch backs up and turned around. We were actually unprepared wearing only sandals - not appropriate for a good hike. Coming down to the bottom of the hill you too can take pics of the Blue Stop sign?? Don't ask us but we took pics of it anyhow. We ended up walking all the way down following the bus route which got us down to the edge of Waikii Beach and where we found LuLu's. THAT was do-able in sandals! If you get the chance we recommend the Circle tour of Oahu - you might want to update your plans and do some further-reaching exploring after that informative enjoyable tour. Like-wise even though you get to see nightly shows of the Hawaiian Village rendition of their Luau from your lanai, the Authentic Hawaiian Luau at Paradise Cove is the one you want to attend. Count yourself blessed if you get Cousin Rich as your guide with Captain Sexy as your driver! I've already said too much 'cause, "what happens on the highway, stays on the highway." lol.Any reference to "We" refers to Bob and Randy - Canadian Heat and Sun Seekers. All offers of similar reviews will be considered - again lol.Bob and RandyRaving of Good Times, Good Places in the Sun.

We stayed in a studio apartment with 2 double beds, spacious apartment, full kitchen, beautiful views, glorious. The pool was lovely and they were in the process of building another when we stayed. Facilities in the Hotel was Cinnamons a great restaurant on the ground floor, (do lovely strawberry dacqaries) They have a little grocery shop and a coffee shop with excellent cappuccinos. Bought a lovely dress in a boutique there as well.We were on the side with views of the lagoon. I would definitely stay there again but probably stay in the wing that has full views of the lagoon from inside the unit. The sunset from the marina side is also nice. With the lagoon side you can see the louas performances at the Hilton Hawaiian and the Friday night fireworks from the unit which is fantastic.

What a great hotel, we rented a condo on the 23rd floor had everything we needed. We could stay in and cook for ourselves or head out for something cooked by others. The staff were really helpful apart from the girl who organises day trips, she really wasn't much help at all and needed an early night as she could not stop yawning! We would definitely head back here again, really central.

A great but slightly dated property. Good on site restaurant, bus stop right outside, always a taxi waiting at the door. Hire a condo rather than a hotel room - much better value for money if you can live without having daily room service.

Ilikai was perfect for us - couple in our mid 40s with no kids. We rented a condo unit on the 17th floor for two weeks and it had a stunning view. Condo had everything we needed to be self sufficient, along with use of a couple of pools, communal laundry room, easy access to the beach (Hilton Lagoon end) and plenty of convenience stores close by. The Ilikai is at the Western end of Waikiki, which is great as it means that the area is quiet and relaxed, but close to both central Waikiki and also the Ala Moana Mall. Also many airport transfers and tour companies seem to pick-up/drop-off first at the Ilikai, which makes for quick and easy transfer times.

Walk to all major shopping (except the outlets),Dining,beach & lagoon,watch the magnificent fireworks from your room on Friday nights.The Illikai isn't a luxurious resort,but it has all amenities,ie pool,small gym,cafe,bar & dining with all pick-ups for tours out the front.The hotel has been revamped & very appealing to the eye, I've stayed as a guest through the resort and had very comfortable bedding with all room services & fees,and also as a private guest booking through a rental company with no hotel contact as such,but still had pool access,the room was clean & tidy,although i found the beds were uncomfortable,but the daily cost was significantly less and well worth it.I feel the pool needs a major update its not enjoyable for older / childless people as its packed with kids nearly all day,and its only a small pool.Over all i love the illiai and it is my go to when in Hawaii

It was a very memorable place for me and my college friends. The first time that we had our reunion, outside the Philippines, and we definitely had a blast visiting nice places all over Honolulu. The pictures will say it all! We stayed at Ilikai Hotel in Oahu, we walked to Waikiki Beach, went to see the Diamond Head Crater at Kahala Lookout, we also checked Nu'uanu Pali Lookout, the Arizona Memorial at Pearl Harbor is also a must to see. The National Memorial Cemetery is very beautiful. Byodo-In Temple is very majestic.Over-all, Hawaii is one of my favorite place to be.

I stayed at this beautiful hotel 52 years ago when I was 12 years old! It was rand new and the movie Hawaii was being made on the island! My little sister and I met some of the crew staying there! Our room was like $25 a night and there were 5 of us with a room overlooking the ocean and Diamond Head I visited in May while cat sitting for my nephew at north shore! It is still as beautiful as when I stayed there 52 years ago! My son got engaged on top of Diamond Head may 17th and we spread my husband's ashes at Kaena Point all in same trip! Love the Iilikai

We were in a condo on the 6th floor. The unit itself was just okay. The balcony overlooking the lagoon and ocean is what you pay for, for sure. Very minor things could be done to this unit to make it great (curtains that block light, sheets that fit the bed, Kleenex) but we would come back to the Ilikai for sure...just maybe not this exact unit. The location is perfect. I was afraid we were going to be pretty far from everything, but with the trolley system set up here, we could get to or walk to almost anything. I really don't see a need to rent a car here...we haven't missed it one minute. The hotel is right next to the Hilton Hawaiian Village...tons of shops and restaurants. The restaurant on site, Cinnamons, was really great for both breakfast and dinner. There's also a convenience store on the first level with everything from groceries to gifts. The coffee shop on the main level is ok. Nothing to write home about, but for coffee, just fine (skip the pastry). The only real negative I have about the Ilikai is their lax smoking policy. We were told it's a completely non-smoking hotel and grounds. Every single time we sit on the balcony, the man in the unit below us is smoking. Every time we leave from the front, someone is smoking right by the valet. Every time we walk by the pool, someone is smoking. It's just super unfortunate when being outdoors is such a spectacular part of being in Hawaii! Overall a great stay...a few hiccups. Really wanted this to be a 5* but just wasn't.

The hotel was ok.. I really didn't enjoy it. I was forced to pay a resort fees for services I knew from the very beginning I would never use. I was there 5 days on business and to attend a wedding. My actual time in the hotel was very little. I was surprised that what little time I did spend at the hotel there was very little offer of beach access and the pool was not much to be impressed with. I did like the central location of the venue and the staff was very nice. The room was updated and convenient, but the bed was hard as a rock. I will not go back.

Family of 4, 2 kids aged 10 and 7, spacious room with kitchen, so served our purpose as we intended to eat-in as much as possible.Hotel is old, but actually doesn't show its age that much. Very basic, average hotel, but exactly what we were looking for, within our budget.If looking for luxury, not the hotel, but if staying for more than a week, need a kitchen, close to the city, really does serve its purpose well.

Special treat for the last 4 nights in our Hawaiian Islands holiday was to book the penthouse of Hawaii Five 0 fame. The view is superb, the suite needs some love and attention. As we often eat at home when we travel we were extremely disappointed to find not one item of basic foodstuffs in the kitchen....not even salt and pepper. This is the first time I have ever encountered this.

The last time I went to Hawaii, I decided to return to the Ilikai. It's a decent hotel. It's at one end right of Waikiki beach, next door to the picturesque Hilton Hawaiian Village. There's no problem visiting the resort next door. The Ilikai is close to a marina and the big lagoon. The beach is visible from the hotel, but a short walk. The Ala Moana mall is fairly close too, and in walking distance. I've stayed twice now. The first time I had a massive contemporary hotel room with balcony overlooking the lagoon and ocean. You can watch fireworks on Friday nights from your balcony. The last time I visited, our room was smaller, and overlooked the marina. I'm thinking the room was actually a condo ... There was a cute, modern kitchen with granite countertops. The bathroom was smaller, but came with a high - tech toilet. The room had a nice layout with a bed, couch , and dining table. The hotel itself is dated on the outside. The pool is not fancy. There are bus stops right out front of the lobby. I think this building is part hotel, part condo, and part time-share. You really see a variety of people staying here. There is a laundry room on every other floor. The quality of the machines is so-so. The dryers get super hot, and ruined a couple articles of my clothing. I would still use them, but also keep an eye on your things.

I had stayed at 2 hotels prior to the Ilikai because my apartment had flooded. The restoration was taking way too long. I have been out of my home since April and was booked into the Ilikai on June 6 with a possible checkout on September 4th. The Staff are so nice and since I have valet parking and don't drive at night, the day valet personnel are like my Ohana. The bellmen are fantastic and treat me like a long lost friend. The housekeepers are so sweet and I just love this place, even though I have the boulevard view. The ocean view would have been awesome. The front desk personnel are so helpful.I have told all of my friends about my experience at The Ilikai and shall miss you all when I return to my home.The one bedroom luxury was clean and quiet.Aloha and Mahalo,Patti S

Such a great hotel. Safe, clean and accessible. Best of all it is right on the lagoon, just a walk down the hotel. This is amazing for kids as it is shallow and is like a beach with no waves! Just what you need. Def better than staying at Waikiki I think! Also right outside the hotel is a bus stop which for $2.50 flat rate takes you to the mall or Waikiki ect. There is a supermarket ( food pantry) 400m from here also! It is located next to the Hilton hotel which has a really cool village to go to and eat/play/watch the fish ect. And if you can get a room facing the beach then you can see the Friday fireworks. Loved it for our 3 month stay

We stayed on the 23rd floor in the junior suite rooms with an ocean view.These rooms were just divine, spacious and comfy.The view was absolutely stunning and the house keepers were fantastic.Loved this place and would stay there again in a heartbeat.only a 5 min walk to Ala Moana Mall.

I stayed in room 2104. It had 2 comfortable double beds and a sofa bed. Fully equipped kitchen. Air conditioning and a good view from the balcony. The building has good amenities. The pool could do with more shaded areas, but the pool lady is the happiest most friendliest lady you'll meet.The building is in a great location, minutes from the beach and a short work to shopping malls, bars & restaurants. Good value for money :)

This place is amazing.. our room is like an home from home the appartment was lovely, fantastic view over the harbour and your not far from the main strip of hawaii at all you can walk there through a lovely park or be lazy and get the trolley buses.. The resturant at the top of this hotel is a MUST not only for the yummy food and cocktails but for the view and the amazing staff. Couldnt have wished to go to a better place i will be coming back

Although I stayed in a condo at the Ilikai I cannot say enough good things about it.The service from the bell hops was excellent, and the hotel itself was great. A wonderful coffee shop Aroma and an excellent restaurant Cinnamons. For views and higher end dining the penthouse level has a restaurant and the vews are stunning!Each evening there is Conch blowing ceremony and Hula dancing and music downstairs and on Friday nights the Hilton (next-door) puts on a Fireworks show which can be seen from many rooms or if not certainly from downstairs!Close to the Ala Moana complex and many other stores or just take the trolley to Waikiki Beach, it is also within walking distance!

The Ilikai is a nice hotel in a good location not too far from the main strip in Waikiki. There is a bus stop literally at the door taking you to the centre of the action. Close by there are restaurants to choose from or a 10 minute walk to some great choices at the Ala Moana centre.We were a little disappointed with the pool area. The pool itself is fine but there is only 5 umbrellas for anyone who wants shade. Almost impossible to grab! Also, the pool closes very early at 7:30pm. It has the potential to be a gorgeous space with not much effort!We found we needed a car. Top tip is to park next door at the Marina for $20/day. Don't risk the street parking as the officers are pretty vigilant! The lifts are a nightmare and generally several out of order. Expect to wait and don't forget anything when you leave your room!The balconies are fabulous! Really big with a great view day and night...Enjoy!

We were travelling with an extended family group of 12 from New Zealand and it was up to me to find a hotel in Waikiki that would suit us all. As it turned out, The Ilikai was an excellent choice for our 8 day stay.The location of The Ilikai was ideal. You have easy access to the lagoon and beach on one side of the building without having to cross any roads. We had a couple of surfers in our group who hired boards for the week and it was really quick and easy for them to carry their boards from the hotel out to the break in front of the hotel. Likewise, our snorkellers in the group photographed turtles just off the shore.The Ilikai is ideally located too for transportation. We hired cars from Alamo straight across the road for a few days, we had also arranged tours to take us up to the North Shore during the surf comps and the hotel's location provided excellent access to be picked up and dropped off by our Driver. We all walked down to Ala Moana shopping centre easily and you have bus stops just outside the hotel on both sides of the road which is a bonus to take you anywhere around Waikiki.Cinnamons Restaurant was really nice, and for my 3 weeks of staying in Hawaii, they made the best cocktails I tasted on my trip. (Especially the Mai Tai)The hotel grounds were beautifully maintained and although there was a bit of construction going on, it didn't impact on us negatively. We all had different views from our rooms, our family loved our high level 2 bedroom Marina view and would request that position again. So I guess the measure of a hotel's success is when everyone in the holiday group asks "When are we going back to The Ilikai?" 2017, we're looking at you!!

My wife an I began planning our 20th anniversary trip to Hawaii a year ago. We spent a lot of time researching to choose the right place to stay, places to eat, etc. As we enter our second to last evening (of 8) at the Illikai, we are SO glad we chose to stay here!Wes and his crew have been great, from answering requests and offering advice before we got here to check-in to maintaining the facility to the concierge services to valet parking to the restaurants to the safety/cleanliness/amenities at the hotel, we say THANK YOU!Thanks too to all the TA's who stayed here in the past year and helped us to choose this great hotel!So we're paying it forward. Feel free to send questions, we'd be glad to help you if you're even thinking of staying here.The hotel location is perfect....east end of Waikiki beach, right on the lagoon but within walking distance of downtown, the Ala Moana mall and the main part of Waikiki. We found other beach areas west of us to be crowded but the area between the Illikai and next door Hilton Hawaiian Village offers plenty of room, plus the man-made lagoon between the two properties was great to relax.EVERY member of the staff we have encountered in the last seven days has been great. There are two restaurants and a coffee/breakfast place in the hotel. Sarentos on the 30th floor was very pricy but the food was good (see separate review) and the view was great (fireworks on Friday eves). Cinnamon's off the lobby did B/L/D for less than many surrounding restaurants with better food and service.Many great restaurants nearby- we highly recommend Chai's Waikiki across the street (see separate review).Hotel concierge hooked us up with a rental car to tour Oahu for $30 less per day than our online reservation and it was right across the street. Valet ($28 per night) wasn't cheap but it was handy to keep the car safe nearby and available when we were ready.Laundry machine in our floor (22) was $2.50 each for washer and dryer, soda/water in vending machines was $1.50.Room was great, comfortable bed, living room area with pull out couch, big bathroom, kitchenette and big lanai with a great view!Store in the lobby had basic food needs plus liquor, soda, mixers, snacks, souvenirs at prices not that much more than local ABC stores and was open late.Room was cleaned every day (thanks Remy) and service was great and very friendly.There is no A/C in hallways or elevators, but we never waited more than a minute for an elevator.Can't rate the pool, we spent our time at the beach and lagoon.There is a resort fee but it included SBS rentals, wifi, beach chairs, etc.Thanks Wes and staff! If it wasn't for missing our kids, we'd move in!

We were very happy with our room, service with at the front with the bell boys (men) was great! So helpful, kind and respectful. Service at the shop downstairs was always really great. Ladies in the massage place could do with a smile and be a bit more approachable. Didn't book with them based on the fact we felt unwelcome. The lady who dealt with us at the activities desk made us feel like she didn't have time for us. My friend and I were quite embarrassed by her manner reminding us several times her lunch was waiting for her to eat it. I think we caught her at a bad time and we really didn't want to book through her but Ilikai did a better price for the Pearl Harbour tour. Walked away feeling pretty disappointed by her. The pool staff are exceptional! Always happy and accommodating, chilled and just so nice! The lady down there helped us heaps with finding our way around Waikiki! Special thanks to this lady xxx. All in all Ilikai is nice, not really really flash but for the price we were impressed and happy with what we got.

With a view over the marina and a fully equipped kitchen, this studio condo was all that we needed for a family holiday. We booked it through waikikibeachrentals.com, and it was all ready at 3pm as stated. We had arrived early so stored our bags at the hotel concierge for $1 per bag - very convenient.The room had a couch that converted into a double bed, as well as a comfortable queen bed with a memory foam mattress. There was a privacy screen that we were able to pull across at night. making two bedrooms.The deck was plenty with seating for 4 - lovely to enjoy a drink to watch the sunsets.We went to Don Quiote for our food shopping that had plenty of fresh meat and veggies (Walmart does not). We used an Uber to get there making it very convenient. There is also small convenience store on the ground floor, and two ABC stores within a block if you just need a few food items.The Ilikai is well located, in easy walking to Ala Moana or down the beach to Waikiki. There is also a bus stop right out front which also takes you to Waikiki beach. The Hilton complex is next door, great to see the fireworks over the lagoon on Friday night.Although the pool is not huge, one end is very deep giving space for swimmers. There is a lane divider to help little kids from getting out of their depth.

Rented a condo, 1728, in the hotel was not impressed however you get what you pay for. location is great and views are nice. The condo owner is very concerned about keeping the air off to save money when not in the room, however the pillows are completely flat to the point they should be thrown away, paint on walls all scuffed and chipped, bathroom smelled of vomit because the shower curtain was moldy, and the carpeting was coming up. They don't provide a safe for "your safety" because of power outages. I've never seen or heard of that anywhere and key Safes are available. Service is alright, hotel is too busy staff cannot keep up. They need to hire more people to accommodate the mass amount of people in this building. For amount of people staff did their best. No air in hallways or elevator and expect to wait in long lines just to get on one. The halls were filthy, floors not vacuumed ever, even in the early mornings, and there was garbage sitting on tables near elevator that sat for awhile. This place could be a wonderful hotel/condo unit needs some love.

We were a group of 4 on a 2-week long Hawaii holiday and suite 509 was value for money and perfect for all our needs!Our reservations were handled by Kelli Kuwamura of Marina Hawaii Vacations. Vacation planning was seamless with Kelli and her team. I had challenges with due documents that needed to be reprinted asap and the team helped me sort it out - lifesaver! Unit 509 was well-appointed with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a well-stocked functional kitchen as well as a spacious living room area with a large flat screen TV. As a corner suite, we had an expansive L-shaped balcony which afforded us views of Ala Moana blvd and more.
