WIFI connection was great (and free) and the use of the phone line for local calls (also free) was very helpful in contacting local restaurants and tours.The location of Ilikai was a major advantage (walking distance to the mall/beach/park) and the fact that it was pretty much a landmark in itself was useful as a reference for airport/uber/lyft/tour pick up/drop off.Points for improvement would be the fitness center and the pool.
user_name:
Ana Virginia Ma... B
Metro Manila, Philippines

review_body: we recently rented room 737 and reported a not-working garburator when we tried to use it. the owner then charged my credit for fixing it when we were not responsible for it's failure and refuses to refund the cost. DO NOT report faults in the units as they will use you to pay for their maintenance.

WE wanted a quiet vacation after a hectic period working. Didn't want to party just read and relax. IIikai is a very pleasant and relaxing. If you want to eat, play, dance everything is close by. The hotel is next door to the huge Hilton complex and you can see the firework display from the Hilton each Friday evening from the rooms at the IIikai.

Friendly staff, clean hotel, good location. We got a junior suite and it had a kitchen. It was great. The downside to hotel had to walk to go to beach and the pool was quite a disappointment. We did get to rent free movies. This was included with our resort fee. The room was a good size and it was very clean. We only stayed for 3 days but would come back again.

It was the first high-rise luxury hotel in Hawaii when it opened back in 1964 and it is still going strong. Situated on the Waikiki beach it's close to just about everything. The Lagoon in front gives you a chance to experience the ocean without having to worry about currents or sharks.Don't miss to have your fridge daily stocked with fresh fruit. Sun ripe pineapple picked the same day is a treat you'll never forget.

We had a great view of the marina and ocean, and a balcony with table & chairs. The unit had 2 queen beds, a sofa, a large TV a desk & chair, + a full kitchen all in A1 condition. There were even chairs for the beach, beach towels and plenty of towels. It was on a bus stop & a short 5 min.walk via the beach to Waikiki Beach. And free Wifi. We would stay there again, and we would recommend this condo to anyone.

Friendly staff, clean grounds and within a short walk from numerous dining options and of course the beach. Easy access out the back to the Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon. Good view of the Hilton's fireworks of Friday nights. Convenient store in the lobby area but the ABC across the street seems to have lower process for most items.

Wow what a view. We overlooked the lagoon, the marina and ocean and I could just sit and look at it all day if possible. The room was fully equipped and kitchen, lounge and very clean and comfortable. The furniture could be a bit slimmer style to allow more room.

Extremely pleased with our stay here. Was disappointed that the condo organization, not the hotel , had the pool closed for 2 days. We had questioned why with another pool yet to be opened , for whatever reason, they did not wait for the cleaning to be done so you would have a pool. My husband had questioned any renovation, work etc., prior to booking. So disappointed in this decision. My daughter/Husband had a BRBO and we had a hotel rental, both of which we were pleased. Loved having the lagoon, pool except for the 2 days and beach to pick from. The beach though closest to hotel is almost impossible to walk on both on the sand and in the water. I have never felt such sharp rocks on any prior beach trips. I have been on many. Maybe because it's used by the public??? On down it's good though. Our trip did not end well though. My husband left one of my bags at the desk. We noted this after getting lost trying to find United departure, so lost time as we toured your great city one more time. Almost like the Circle at our we took. The guy at your desk was great and just thought my Husband had not returned. Please thank him immensely. I did not get his name in my anxiety. It was about 11 AM your time. Your front desk guy worked fast to have Charlie' s taxi bring it to us. This service also great, guess that's why he called them. Baggage ck in was 45 min prior and we were 30 min., but not any of your all's fault. My Husband's yes.......Julieanne from United then to the rescue. Booked me another flight with no charge. Miss you all already. We will return.

We stayed here for three nights on the way to Australia. The rooms were great, with a sunset view. We took the city bus into Waikiki. The hotel restaurant Cinnamons is fine for breakfast. For dinner we went to Chart House (just around the corner) happy hour twice and once to Goofy's. The pool was fine. I rented a bicycle near Goofy's, and covered a lot of ground.

I went in April 2016 for my best friend's birthday and we enjoyed it. We booked a trip to Dubai for her birthday, but somehow the website we booked through (cheapoair) didn't process it completely. That trip was paid for but they "claimed" they didn't process it because they weren't able to get in contact with my friend to complete the payment, although the money was already taken out of her account. We booked it on a Thursday night and left the next morning. We upgraded our room because the first room on the 10th floor had a run down looking bathroom and the room was very outdated. The hotel switched our room to the 24th floor and it was much better. The shower itself was a little smaller than I expected but at least it was spacious and clean in the bathroom where we were able to share the mirror to do our makeup (lol). Our room had a pool/beach view as well. The hotel was in the perfect location to get to the mall and we got a great deal on the 3 activities for our stay. The natural pool was so pretty and convenient being next to the beach and other hotels. They also had a Dairy Queen next door. I will stay here again when I make my return trip in the near future.

We initially had booked a room at a cheaper hotel and when we arrived it was disgusting so after finding the Ilikai and reading reviews we decided this was the place to stay. Rooms were adequately priced and very spacious! There were three of us women and we got a king room with a sleeper sofa. The room was huge with a full kitchen, super clean, decent views of the city. The Ilikai near the beach and just a short walk to the Hilton Hawaiian which had an amazing beach and lagoon. Our friends stayed at the Hilton and liked our room better. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants but visited a few of the shops in the hotel, nothing special but ok. We were all so impressed with the Ilikai rooms, location, price, and cleanliness. Will definitely stay again and would recommend to anyone!

Wow the rooms are great and so clean. The customer service is over the top. There are places to eat and shop everywhere. This place has everything you need. The views are breathtaking. This is the place to come to for relaxation and entertainment. Triple Forks Hunting

The Ilikai is in a fantastic location, great views overlooking the marina, right beside the Hilton Hawaiian village. Felt it was very dated, studio apartments a good size, but the pool area was a huge disappointment, very small for the number of units in the complex and the biggest negative no shade and no umbrellas, it was an easy walk to the beach. Easy walking to alo Moana shopping centre.

Everyone was telling us that we would get bad weather in December. We were there for 6 nights and only got rained on once while we visited during the last week of December through NYE 2016. The Illkai was very comfortable. I love that they have several restaurants downstairs you could take advantage of. Pricing wasn't too bad.

My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary in May. The hotel was in very good shape for the age of it. We did stay in an updated luxury room which maybe made the difference. My only complaint was that we paid the extra money for the mountain view room and it wasn't worth the extra money. Yes, you could see a glimpse of the mountains but the flip side is that the rooms face the VERY noisy street. We could not enjoy our balcony at all because it was simply too noisy to sit outside. At night we slept with a sound machine on to drown out the noise of the traffic which allowed us to sleep but if you are a light sleeper be careful of booking this side of the hotel. We did not complain about it as we spent a lot of time away from the room and as noted, we were able to sleep so we stayed. Because of that I can't comment on if they hotel would have been accommodating with moving us. Overall though we enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai and although it is not right on the beach it is very close. It is also close to walk to the downtown centre and all the shopping. The free wi-fi was very dependable. Better then at most hotels! (Always a bonus!)

We rented 2020 for our last 4 nights of a 2 week tour on O'ahu and Big Island.Lovely bachelor suite with king bed in quite part of Waikiki away from the crazy tourist area. Better beach area in front of Hilton Lagoon but swimming is difficult as beach is not maintained and full of rocks.The view from the room is awesome. You can't hear the ocean over the waterfall from the Hilton pool but not a big deal.Room was ready for us, clean and comfortable. Great for a couple! Highly recommend this unit. Everything was perfect!

This place is the best place to stay in Waikiki. Very clean, staff is wonderful and very reasonably priced. You are so close to so much like the beach, lots of restaurants, shops, shopping mall, trolley, etc. Highly suggest hopping on the pink line trolley and taking thay around to explore. Would recommend to anyone!

The pool area could use a HUGE update. When overlooking the Hilton with water slides and hot tubs is hard to get excited by a boring small pool. Granted it's Hawaii and there is a beach but this is not right on the beach and there is a bit of a walk to get to the beach. Sitting outside at cinnamons was very nice, but when we ate inside there were leaks in the ceiling, under a 25 story building... Makes you wonder what's going on above the restaurant...breakfast was delicious though.

We stayed at the Ilikai, room 1804 in June 2016. It was exactly as described on web sites. We had a fantastic view of the marina and sea beyond. The room was comfortable with good cooking facilities if you choose to stay in. There is a Food Pantry on Hobson Lane a couple of blocks away. The Ala Moana mall is nearby, this is full of hundreds of designer stores, some with sales.I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

After intensively searching for a place to stay in Hawaii for our 20th Anniversary, we picked the Ilikai. I must admit I was hesitant because of a few bad reviews. We were going to be in Hawaii for about 2 weeks so wanted to make sure we made the right decisions for our 1st trip to paradise. Any bad review is an example that you can not please everyone all the time. I felt obligated to leave a review for people that are in the same place we were...searching for the right place to stay for the right price. We stayed in an Oceanview room with a kitchenette and it could not have been more pleasant. It was walking distance to shopping, Denny's (ask for Mona) and of course the Beach. The staff was friendly and helpful. A definitely recommend and we will stay again if we make it back to Hawaii! ...Oh by the way, we stayed in the hotel part...it seems they have a condo section as well.

My wife and I stayed at the Ilikai for 14 nights. Early morning check in after a 22 hour trip, “wow" what a bonus, much appreciated. Very quiet on the 24th floor. Fantastic Ocean, Marina and sunset views well worth the extra. The room had everything we needed, even though it wasn’t one of the revamped rooms it was very clean and tidy. King bed was comfy, nice sitting area so you don’t have to site on the bed. Well equipped kitchen and coffee machine, bar fridge, no freezer. Huge shower with the best view out over the bay. Even no hot water for a couple of days didn’t dampen our stay. The in room wIfi is faster than most hotels Iv stayed at. Perfect location for us, walking distance to Zoo and Tower restaurants, 5 minutes’ walk over the river to Ala Moana shopping centre. All buses stop right outside hotel, car hire and pick up right over the road, we hired a convertible Camaro and lived the dream. All the staff were excellent. We had the best cleaning lady in the world, what a wonderful happy person. Dana the event’s organiser was so helpful, she went over and above what we expected, what great personal service, both are a true asset to the hotel. Everything at your doorstep, great choice of pool, lagoon, or beach? mmm which one today? We will definitely be back.

We chose the apartments for meal convenience . We did book a water view room but was " upgraded" to a marina view room. I must say the views were amazing from the 22nd balcony. we could see the planes landing & taking off from Honolulu Airport as well as fighter jets (F22?) from Hickam AFB. Rear entrance was directly to the Marina & Hilton Lagoon and front entrance to Ala Moana Centre 10mins of comfortable walk,$2.50pp bus opposite site of the road & $2pp return on the Pink Line. DO HAVE the correct amount as they frown upon giving change if they do at all!Foodcourt at Ala Moana is ample for all your requirements. More exquisite is choosing your own live lobster/crab at Red Lobster Restaurant next door. Views from Saranto Restaurant in house which sits top of the building is phenomenal.ABC store across the road has all your other convenience shopping. Maurice at the in-house Ku'ai Supermarket will also try and sell you a "healthy" doughnut. He is most charming & friendly. Hilton Village next door also has some great shopping & Restaurants with live music. Rooms are serviced everyday. Do leave a note of your requirements of any extras like towel or sugar. Do leave a few dollars for the maids daily- they do an amazing work. Waikele Outlet pick ups outside the hotel. Approx$21 taxi to Diamond Head Mountain Crater drop off. Was better & more convenient for us than other option. See Rod at the reception if in need. He was the most helpful of all and Dana at the Service to arrange your itinerary.$5 to wash & dry at the Hotel all our self service laundry. Quarter machine at reception. Nice chilled lemon water also available there. Top it off - FREE DVDs of latest movies available by reception if too warm outside. And don't forget huge fire works at the Hilton Lagoon every Friday!! Aloha & Mahallo :)

This is our "go-to" place when staying in Oahu! We were on the 23rd floor and enjoyed fantastic views of the city and the west end of Waikiki. Clean, very nice bed, and accommodations. As we had to do a little work while there, I was impressed the dedicated high-speed modem right in the room, so didn't have to rely on the shared Wi-Fi. Price is right and great access to whatever you want to do in Honolulu. Highly recommend.
user_name:
Mike S
Corona, California, United States

review_body: When we go to Hawaii we found staying at the ilikaii suites was our best place to stay. We had a ocean View so had a great view of the fireworks every Friday night. It was really quiet and within walking distance to the Ala Moana Shopping centre and also to the nightlife, resturants etc. on Waikiki Beach. Nice pool that has salt water and is not cold. Close to the beach in front of The Hawaiian Hilton Hotel. Also close to the Lagoon. and the Harbour. Loved staying here and when we go again will book here. Last time we went was all of Feb. 2013. We hope to go back this year depending on the dollar.It would not let me put this on without a travel date. All they had to pick from in Feb. was 2016. Our Friends were there then and nothing has changed since we were there last. We have stayed there 4 times already and other places prior to this one. This is our favourite. have been to Oahu 15 x.

We were very impressed by the hotel. at a quieter end of Waikiki and looking out towards the lagoon and marina.Yes it is old and a little dated but very clean.Friendly service ..Perfectly adequate freshwater pool with a nice quiet feel.Not really suitable for children to swim in as no shallow areas.We would stay again and preferred it to The Outrigger Reef where we stayed in 2014..The hotel is only 8 minutes walk away from the wonderful shopping at Ala Moana centre and not far from main shopping and dining in the centre of Waikiki.

Centrally located hotel that was clean and moderately appointed. The room had a huge balcony that we enjoyed nightly. You could see the Friday night fireworks display from the balcony ( east side). Staff were very helpful, especially the concierge who helped us with our plans and shopping. The hotel is close to the beach and easy to access. The main floor coffee shop was not great and I would advise to eat elsewhere.There is a small grocery store in the attached mall with lots of choice. There is an ABC store half a block away with more groceries if needed. I would stay here again.
user_name:
R R
New York City, New York

review_body: Enjoyed the Ilikai very much. Stayed on the 20th floor, in a suite overlooking the ocean and yacht harbor. Perfect location. Felt very safe and the hotel was very clean and cared for. Loved walking along the beach and taking the bus all over the island to more remote locations. Meet local people and tourists alike and had a wonderful relaxing time.

This was our third stay at the ilikai hotelA clean well maintained hotel close to the Ala Moana shopping mall The room had a great view over the marina Having to pay for parking was a bit expensive but this seems standard for Waikiki

This is the second time my wife & I have stayed at the Ilikai, on both occasions in a one bedroom condominium facing the ocean & the Hilton Hawaii'n Village resort. From our unit we get to see the fireworks on a Friday night & last night although only a Thursday. The Waikiki busses leave from out the front of the Ilikai & it is only 800 metres to the Ala Moana shopping precinct, a must for the ladies. There is any number of quality restaurants in the immediate area & within 1 km you also have Lewer Street with many more. Last night was our second last for this trip & we decided to take advantage of the happy hour offering at Sarento's on the 25th floor. Whilst we are not wraps for the restaurant the small plate menu with discounted wine & beer is great value. We will be back next year

10 Star Plus In My Opinion! The Best Part Of Our Trip Was This Room. I have travelled a lot and had my share of luxury rooms, there was something about this place that was stunning. I requested mountain view being from Florida I could care less about the water. The fog came through all day. The rainbows were abundant. This room was magical. We slept with the drapes open to awaken to rainbows and fog. The busy streets were fun to watch at night the party buses hurled through the street with laughter and fun. We had a full kitchen and a grocery store across the street. We were able to eat and pack light not relying on restaurants too much. We hike everyday and nothing was more then a 45 minute hike. This hotel was the absolute perfect location for anything you wanted to do and it was very inexpensive.

What a Fabulous and Iconic Hotel. The view was amazing from the balcony with the Hilton Fireworks on Friday a real bonus. The room was laid out great, with a small kitchen and small bathroom. The pool downstairs was nice and heated to perfection. Within walking distance to everything or there is a bus stop located right out front. We couldn't ask for more and would highly recommend staying here! Tips - Parking around corner at Lazy Lobster USD20 per night.

We had a studio ocean view for a family of 4 (kids 5 and 1) and had a really nice stay here. Ask for one of the remodeled units. There are also units available direct from owners (on vrbo and the like) but we went straight with the hotel so we could have housekeeping and a renovated room. The lower floors have not yet been renovated so ask for a higher floor. The kitchen was super nice: granite counters, microwave/convection oven, etc. There is one set of washer/dryers on each floor. The view of the lagoon and the ocean was lovely from the lanai. The location is perfect: a short walk or $5 cab ride from a small grocery store, next to Hilton village which has an urgent care in it (we used it unfortunately), next to the lagoon which has no waves for the little ones and the beach, about a mile from main Waikiki Beach area and major shopping centers. There is a bus stop out front, convenience store in the building, and DVD rentals. The pool is nice, although not huge or fancy like the resort next door. The toiletries in the room was actually the nicest surprise for me! Paul Mitchell Awapuhi keratin conditioner rinse- why is this a big deal? It made washing sand out of and detangling kids hair easy after a day at the beach. Housekeepers were all so nice- really all of the employees were helpful. They leave you Honolulu shortbread cookies in the room when you arrive (so delicious I bought more when out shopping). All in all a nice stay. Things to note: there are only two chairs on the lanai and no chairs that can really be dragged out there from the room and the knives in the kitchen are dull (cutting up a pineapple was very very difficult) so bring one from home.

What a wonderful hotel staff were amazing and this wonderful country you have, we will definitely be coming back and if you can get the little travel book that they give you to get discount on food which helped as we didn't realise how expensive Hawaii was, but that did not disappoint us we had a great time just a shame we were only there for 4 nights we will be back

Location was awesome with Ala Moana shopping in one direction and the amenities attractions and restaurants of Waikiki in the other. We were staying in a 2 bed, 2 bath mountain/city view suite. The rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. The housekeeping service was excellent and friendly. The full kitchen helped save $$ on breakfast, there's an ihop and a very good old school diner just across the road if that's not your thing. The pool at the Illikai isn't the greatest but it does the trick... (if you're feeling cheeky you can always sneak over to the Hilton Hawaiian village pools next door)

I had a Standard Room, Kitchen, Mountain View but it looked nothing like most of the photos that I see on TripAdvisor and Hotels.com. I came alone and got a decent deal on Hotels.com, so I guess I was given one of the most outdated rooms at Ilikai. I was on the fifth floor of the hotel. My room obviously was not one of the updated modern ones with new marble kitchen counter and refrigerator. Also, I noticed that my sheets had not been changed during the four nights I stayed there. I don't know if this is something that needs to be requested to the housekeeper.Staying at the Ilikai is very convenient as most tours pick-up at this hotel and it is by Waikiki Beach. But given the location and price, all rooms need to be updated. Guests should not be given old rooms based on bad luck of the draw or at the receptionist's choice because that person is single or got a good deal on a website. For these reasons, I give Ilikai an average rating.

We stayed on the 17th Floor and had great views across the pool and beach. We researched and were also able to see the Friday night fireworks and dancers below at the Hilton. The Condo's were spacious with great kitchen area. The gym was not available to Condo users but all other areas were. We stayed in 4 different rooms and all were really lovely. Buffalo wings across the road was great for food and drinks. We hired a car at Alamo which was located across the road, and drove around the island for a day. The outside looked outdated from the pool area but everything was really lovely throughout.

Built in 1961, the Ilikai was a revolutionary Waikiki building. It still holds its original attractions of proximity to the Ala Moana, convenience and views over the Harbour.The studio rooms are large, well designed and airy with nice, clean, original style bathrooms.

We checked out before checking in. There were a few of us traveling together and we were slated stay here. But upon some of the group entering the rooms they were crawling with roaches so we were assigned to a different place altogether. I must say that the lobby is beautiful and so is the lanai on the back of the hotel. It is on prime ocean property and has a beautiful view from that side always. It is an eyesore from the front as the individual room lanais are facing a major street. The lanais are laced with clothes hanging to dry, papers taped to the windows, towels all over. It just looks so and from the street view. This is an iconic hotel in the Ala Moana area of Honolulu and should represent that both inside the entire hotel and out.

Stayed at the Ilikai October 2015. This is a beautiful Hotel with lots of amenities. The Restaurants on ground level are fantastic, good food and good atmosphere. Love the open feel ot this Hotel & friendly staff.

My husband & I stayed here for 4 nights a week ago. We loved it. Only 4 or 5 of the top floors are run by the hotel, these are listed as the Luxury rooms. The rest of the place is time shares and condos. I believe the hotel manages some of the time shares and condos for people, so do not book anything but the luxury rooms or who knows what you'll end up with. The hotel rooms are remodeled nicely, have full kitchens, and the windows and sliding glass doors are floor to ceiling, which makes for some amazing views!!! Everyone at this hotel was really nice from start to finish, which in Waikiki isn't always the case. We booked a ocean view room & when we got there were upgraded to an ocean sunset room, which was really nice! Views, views, views. We looked out onto the harbor and ocean beyond. We saw some amazing sunsets on our rather large balcony. Maid service was very good, she even cleaned the top rails on the balcony daily. At first I was worried about the location since its on one end of Waikiki, but it was actually perfect. It's literally right next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, where the craziness of Waikiki really begins. After spending 5 days in Waikiki we were so thankful to be staying on the end of it instead of in the middle of it. Waikiki is like Vegas, without the gambling, tons of people, cars, stores, food, lots of hustle n bustle. It was so nice to come back to the hotel and feel like you were in s relaxing place, even though you were just next door to the chaos. Often we hung out in the open lobby in the evening or courtyard looking at the harbor relaxing. The store they had inside the hotel was actually cheaper than the 10 plus surrounding abc stores. Cinnamon's was great for breakfast & Sarento's on the top floor had amazing views & great food, expensive, but great for a date night of fine dining at its best. The pool is nothing to write home about, but we just literally walked right next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and used their pools. The lagoon was also nice & the beach is right there. We walked the entire Waikiki strip several afternoons & evenings, you are close to everything. We also walked to the Ala Moana shopping center 2 blocks down, that place is insane over 300 stores, a bit much for me to take in. I highly recommend this place, it will now be my go to for Waikiki. We just loved it all the way around!

First of all the view from the 23rd floor, while not the beach or ocean was quite beautiful. The view was of Ala Moana Blvd and the surrounding mountains. The suite itself was spacious although not really a suite. it did have a living area and a full kitchen with a breakfast bar. full size fridge and a real stove and oven. Pots pans utensils and dishes were provided. The bed, while a bit stiff for me, was comfortable and clean. Bathroom was also spacious but it was a bit awkward getting past the commode into the shower. pretty much impossible if your spouse was sitting down at the moment. Not a big deal.Parking is by Valet only but there are no call downs I just told them when I was going to need my car the next time when I dropped it and it was usually in the "ready" parking when I came to get it. Check in was exactly as expected, I would have preferred expedited check out where they slip your bill under the door in the wee hours and off you go. The beach bar was nice and the music not to loud but it was definitely a production bar and not all that laid back. One other thing I did not like was to get your luggage into the hotel by yourself you had to go out of the way to a luggage elevator. No "let me take that for you". but a stern "NO" when you approach the stairs or escalator. followed by directions to the elevator.

Great old hotel, with nice views of the Pacific. The building is pretty old, but that means large rooms with great balconies. The rooms was decorated nicely, and was very clean and comfortable. I think I spotted Don Ho in the lobby.

Highly recommend you check out staying at the condos at the Ilikai.Condos with odd numbers face the Marina, City & Ala Moana Park ( Great for watching the 4th of July fireworks). The even numbered condos face the Hilton lagoon & ocean view, were you can see the Hilton Luau at 5.30pm from Sunday to Thursday & the Hilton lagoon fireworks at 7.45pm on Fridays.Ensure you get a updated condo on a high floor.

We've been coming to the Ilikai since I was little and every time, I find something else to like about it. The Staff is so helpful and friendly, the amenities are great and the rooms are large and spacious. It's away from the hustle and bustle and the tourists of central Waikiki, but that's my preference...just know that it's not on the main drag.

When we arrived, we realized that we made a booking mistake booking a time slot for 3 days starting 3 days earlier. Meaing that we were officially supposed to check out on our day of arrival.I explained my situation to the front desk. Rob from the front desk explained to me that this was a "no show". But they took it very professional and after 30 minutes succeeded in getting me and my family a room: same size, same conditions and not additional pay. Yes, I did not have to pay anything -- they just accepted my original booking. What was more amazing is that they had to rearrange the rooms for other guests to make our room (the same room) available for 3 consecutive days. And you can imagine how difficult it is as they had 98% occupancy rate.My family was releaved. We had great holidays.At another occasion, another frontdesk person, Richelle was extremely helpful solving my problem because my car was towed away. She found out the address where my car was now and I could solve the problem in no time.We loved the kitchen in the room. It was great. When we forgot to wash a few plates and coffee cup, housekeeping would do it for us.Location was also good. Very central. Close to major car rentals. Bus stop with lines 19 and 20 infront of hotel. I think you can even take the public bus from the airport for 2.50 USD/person (instead of 30USD taxi).The only little things that showed room for improvement: no rack for hanging the washed clothes, no rack for the washed dishes to dry, the ice cube machine was broken on our last night, the refrigarator was a little loud and the water was not warm (I think they had plumbing problems on the 10th floor.That's a reason for 4 stars instead of the 5 stars that they would have deserved for the extremely helpful frontdesk staff. Thumbs up. Keep up the good work at frontdesk.

It stands at the very southern tip of Waikiki, so you can have a non-crowded swim. It's also closest to the airport. The rooms are ok but very outdated as the building itself. Parking is very problematic. Hotel pictures feature a tennis court - they've closed them years ago though. Bad couple of restaurants on site.Probably still a good value for your money since everything else is even more expensive.
user_name:
uniqum
New York City, New York

review_body: Thank you for the petals. Love the dvd machine and PS3, definitely kids friendly. The ocean view suite is nice and cozy. I don't mind waking up with this view every morning (see pic)Fews things I would like to point them out tho: 1) towel rack should not be on top of the toilet cause when hanging the towels, they tend to touch the toilet...2) wish some basic vanity is provided in the roomWith that being said, I think this hotel is definitely great for family trip!Thanks again.

My room is absolutely lovely but the issues lies with the small things. No hot stream of water above the tenth floor because of plumbing issues. When I go on vacation and paying a lot of money for a hotel stay. I expect the best. When I ask the front desk about the water concerns, there reply is I hope its works by the date. Well, the day arrived and still nothing is done. I ask for a room to take a hot shower, they give a room with a bathroom that had not been cleaned. I go to wash my clothes and two minutes on the washer barely a stream of water comes out. The fitness room has equipment doesn't work and many of the items are out of date. I would not stay here again and would not recommend it to a friend nor coworker. Maybe someone else will have a better experience. I am so done. Bonus, the cleaning staff are very kind and helpful. Mahalo

Ilikai Suites is a wonderful hotel offering full kitchens, excellent staff, and many amenities including free DVD movies, beach chairs/towels, and services to help you get the most enjoyment from your time in Hawaii. Kudos to Wilma, our lovely housekeeper who kept our unit gleaming. The only reason I would not rate this 5 stars is their valet car parking costs $28/day + there is another $15/day resort fee on top of that. They should include these charges in their advertised rates.

Great location, right on the beach, views to die for and, for all you original Hawaii 5-0 fans, this is Where McGarrett was on the balcony at the beginning of every show. Hotel itself was a little dated but, if you like TV history, you can't beat it. A must for you diehard 5-0 fans.

Overall we had a good stay. The service was very good, our room was lovely, a suite with full kitchen which included a coffee maker with coffee and best of all this amazing box of Hawaiian shortbread. The location is good for cruise ships, for being next to the lagoon which has tons of fun crafts to rent for kids/teens, and for viewing the fireworks. The price was excellent and they offer a lot of promotions so keep a look out before you book. Issues however were: 1. our room was too close to the elevator and we could hear dings and loud talking in the hall so make sure you request a room at least several rooms from the elevator. 2. beware of what ocean view actually means. our ocean view room meant that if you were in the room and looked out all you saw were buildings. however, if you went out to the deck and sat to the very far left side or leaned out over the balcony you could see the water. i would call it a partial ocean view at best. if you want to look directly out to the water you need to specify that and I would estimate only about half the ocean view rooms do, the other half are on the sides of the building facing other buildings. 3. the first morning there was an overwhelming septic smell on the lobby level, so bad we couldn't eat at the restaurant for breakfast. no one could explain it other than someone offered up maybe it was low tide at the lagoon-- but I live near the ocean and it smelled more like sewerage to me. 4. Do not eat in Sarentos Italian restaurant located in the building! The food was god awful and the prices insane for the quality. My fish was small and overcooked, the gnocchi the worst I've ever had-- rubbery and tasteless.

Having read some of the reviews of this hotel I didn't have any doubts about going to spend a week there. The location is perfect, situated around any and everything you can think of from the beach to the shopping malls to car rentals and marines. My husband and I stayed at Ilikai hotel for one week celebrating his 50th birthday it was the most relaxing and refreshing week. We were in room 2580 great ocean view, the whole outlook of the hotel was not your Hilton but inside was clean, breezy and beautiful. There were shops inside on the main floor everything you think you might have left at home was right at your footsteps, things were expensive but it was worth it after all it was like a convenience for all your needs. Our room had a king size bed and kitchenette very, very clean, the view was awesome and our house maid was very pleasant her name is Fannie. We were just under the penthouse floor and at the top of the building there was a restaurant Sarentos which we dined at for my hubs birthday beautiful view of the ocean and buildings an amazing sunset. There is a 24 hour service restaurant where you could get breakfast, lunch and dinner Wailana breakfast cost us $30 but it was very filling, that was steps away from the hotel and close to Hilton Hawaiian as well. The other places around was Goofy they also had a healthy breakfast which was around $32 but it was also worth the money, that meal would take you to almost close to dinner time. There were a lot of ABC stores around so if you ran out of anything it was not a problem to get it, as well the mall was within walking distance about 15 mins or so but it was a nice walk. There was also a McDonalds and Buffalo Wings but I didn't enjoy the buffalo wings so will not recommend, Red Lobster also. Sun was out but it was breezy so the walk was fun. Did 3 tours but I will not recommend the Atlantis tour unless you have never been in a submarine and would like the experience otherwise don't waste your money and its a lot cheaper to book the Atlantis tour on the beach as oppose to booking when you go to the breakfast orientation...... Paradise Cove tour was awesome it included some games and shows and a luau, people were so friendly and our tour guide on this one was cousin Flo she was AWESOME!!! We also had a Dinner cruise which included some fireworks as it was the new year eve of Hawaii I think, sorry can't remember, that was a private dinner and a free photo of you on the cruise it was the best!!!!! We also rented a car and drove to Pearl Harbor but just cruising at night not to visit also drove around sight seeing and it was beautiful. I think 5 days is too short I wish we could have stayed longer but we are definitely planning another trip but to Maui and with the whole family. The man made beach we didn't go too but the public beach we did and the water was great, sun was scorching but it felt awesome just relaxing and enjoying the scenery. There was also a $15 fee per day for the resort which I believe included the wifi and other ammenities as well if you rent a car you pay $30 or 35 per night at the hotel but a block from the hotel you can park overnight for $20 for 24 hrs.

The Ilikai hotel is located in a prime location next to the Hilton Resort in west waikiki. The hotel decor was outdated and overall pretty dingy. Curtains were old and had stains on them. This hotel could benefit from a facelift.

The Ilikai is a great hotel/condo located at the quieter end of the Waikiki strip (right next to the iconic Hilton Hawaiian Village.) Every room has a small kitchenette to make extended stays an option. Or, if you just want to spend the weekend, it is great to have the amenities to make a quick breakfast or a snack. The hotel is a short walk to the busy main Waikiki beach and there are plenty of restaurants and shops near by.

I have been coming here for a few years.I like the fact that it is off the main beach and within a short walk to the lagoon and small private beach of the Hilton. Great sunsets, the pool is nice and the rooms are spacious. Yes they are older but some have been updated depending on whom you rent from. We like that it is a 15 minute walk and you are in the heart of Waikiki shopping and entertainment. A nice way to spend a morning or evening with a walk to and back from town. Beautiful sunsets and Fireworks every Friday by the beach. A great alternative to being in the middle of everything.
user_name:
Marc L
Renton, Washington, United States

review_body: I stayed here as part of a group of musicians. We were all very pleased with our accommodation. I know this was built in the late 60s and was one of the first high rise hotels. It has beautiful gardens, an easy going atmosphere, a really great souvenir, grocery shop underneath, even the clothes shop was rather nice, although the items can be found cheaper elsewhere, it was reasonable.My room was huge with huge bed, light and bright with a great roomy bathroom and a view of the mountain, which means a cross section of the busy streets from up high, so noise wasn't a problem, and also spectacular to me. An older style kitchen, but everything was there. Lovely Hawaiian touches, classy lamps and bed covers. Service was excellent, cleanliness too. Truly charming and rather "old world rock star". Well, this is where the stars stayed and Jack Lord twirled on top for Hawaii 5-0 opening sequence. I loved it!There is a lift to the top floor that goes to a restaurant/piano bar where the views are 360, wow! A kind of rustic Italian restaurant, very traditional and somehow historical, I like it a lot. An amazing bar, service and atmosphere capturing a time gone by, but in a very glamorous way.
user_name:
Pauline B
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: My husband, 16 year old son and myself stayed 7 nights at the ilikai and loved every moment of it. It was clean, had everything we needed such as kitchen and enough room for us all. Our room looked out on to the street, we loved sitting on the balcony in the warm air late in the evening people watching. There was a laundry on our floor and a trash area ( I think they are on every floor). The lifts were very fast. The location was absolutely perfect, only minutes walk to the beach where you can snorkel in thigh deep water (perfect for the younger ones) and see marine life such as pretty fish and turtles. There are shops in the complex and a market for all your needs. If you have smaller children the hotel backs on to a man made lagoon which is beautiful. It has paddle boats and boards to hire aswell. We will definitely be back to Ilikai. Thank you for an amazing holiday! Our friends also stayed in the same complex, they loved it too!

Checkin was easy, room great but described as a 1 bedroom apartment on line was actually a studio with a small kitchen which had all the kitchen amenities needed. We didn't use the stove top as we were concerned that we might set off the smoke alarm so opted to eat out or buy take out. Great location, 10min walk to Ala Moana, easy walk to restaurants and cafes, the lagoon and trolley and bus stop to Waikiki was in front of the hotel. Pool sometimes hit a bit crowded but it went in waves and found 3pm and 6pm good times. King bed was super comfy. Balcony was a decent size. Staff were fantastic and had a lovely stay at the Iilikai. Will certainly be back.

Definitely a nice place to stay. Everything overall was great experience. Recommend staying in a room that has the ocean and lagoon view. You also get front row seats to the fireworks every Friday evening. Not sure what else to say. Our room was fully stocked with towels, toiletries, linen, silverware, all kitchen stuff, and well maintained.

I selected Ilikai Hotel & Luxury Suites as my hotel stay for a recent HNL trip booking a one bedroom suite facing the ocean. My flight into HNL arrived in the morning therefore only expected to check in after 12pm so we decided to leave our luggages at the front desk. Upon checking in, surprisingly we received our room key (that was around 9ish) (and maybe it is a weekday in which rooms were not fully occupied). I was not impressed with the front desk staff as she did not smile at all but check in was done quickly. Love the room's interior - modern and new although that the building exterior isn't that impressive. I wasn't looking for a typical hawaiian looking hotel nor hotels located near to the busy waikiki beach therefore Ilikai Hotel was a good choice. Near to Ala Moana Shopping Mall - about 10 mins walk though. My room is on the 23 floor, ice dispenser and washing machine available at lift lobby. PS3 gaming station is also available in the room but only a set of controller. We did request for one more but was informed that only controller per room. Videos and games are available for rental at the machine on ground floor. Shops available too, if you do need to get your necessities. Since we were too tired from our flight, we got some items to eat from the shop since there isn't any in - room dining available. Swimming pool at the hotel is small so don't expect much about it. My room is facing the lagoon and Hilton's, and envy the atmosphere that they provided for their customers with activities and events. However, in Ilikai, it is just quiet. It is still quite a walk to the nearest beach, and to the busy street of waikiki but we did get around. Do take a bus to get you around if you dislike walking a lot.

This was a lovely hotel condo with valet parking (very handy). Pool was a bit of an afterthought it seems, but still present. Convenient restaurants, coffee shop, convenience store and many other options on the main floor. Fireworks every Friday. Very helpful staff.

Our family had an awesome staycation during our recent visit at the Ilikai Hotel & Luxury Suites. Doreen at the front desk provided excellent service - friendly, helpful and efficient. Upon entering our room, we noticed a nice welcome amenity with a hand-signed note from the General Manager, Wes Kawakami. It was a nice surprise. The luxury unit that my family stayed in was newly renovated and spacious. It was also equipped with a full kitchen which made it very convenient for my family. Our ocean view unit provided spectacular views of Waikiki Beach, Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon and the marina. We were also able to view the Friday night fireworks from our room.This property is located in such a convenient location, just steps from the beach and great dining options. In addition to the great on-site dining options (Cinnamon's at the Ilikai and Sarento's at the Top of the Ilikai), we also tried a few great restaurants located next door just a few steps away, Magokoro Japanese Restaurant and Goofy Café.We will certainly be returning to the Ilikai Hotel & Luxury Suites for a fun and relaxing staycation.

We were visiting Hawaii for the Iolani Basketball Tournament and we choose this hotel not know it would be right across the street from where the players were staying. Very convenient, since our son was playing and we could also do some sight seeing without having to chase him down. Upon arrival the hotel was nice on the outside and the staff was very helpful. The room we booked had a kitchen with the view of the mountains!! Awesome view and highly recommended if that is your thing. The hotel is close to the mall, walking distance if you're a walker and it is a few restaurants in the area. One in particular, my wife and I ate almost every day was Snapper's!! Check my review on the restaurants! The hotel has a couple restaurants, but the one at the top of the hotel is the best. Great for couples and pricey, but great experience. The pool area was kind of wack, so we mostly went to the beach which is right behind the hotel. Valet parking at every hotel is expensive, so this one is no different. Overall great experience and we would stay here again.

The Ilikai is a great hotel to stay at. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They booked all our tour for with no hassle. We had an ocean view room and it was amazing. Waking up to the view of the ocean every morning was a treat.Room was clean and stock well with everything that you will need.The bed was comfy and the wifi worked well.The Ilikai is located centrally and all the busses stop right out the front and so do all the tours.

I stayed here for the first part of our 2 week stay in Hawaii and overall have only positive things to say about this hotel. I got an ocean view room, and it was well worth the upgrade to wake up and see the beach from our balcony, located on a higher floor. The rooms have a very "home" feel, and it makes you forget you're even in an hotel room. The kitchen is the major pro, since eating out for every meal can get expensive. This hotel also isn't a resort, so I'm a little wary about why you have to pay a "resort fee". It's not as steep of a fee as other hotels in the area, and is pretty reasonable. The worst part of the hotel had to be the gym, which needs major updating on all of its equipment. The treadmill and elliptical were very old, and rusted which was kind of gross. But if you're looking for a nice comfortable room in a simple no fuss hotel, with a good location in the Waikiki beach area, this is a great choice!

A hotel not right on the strip but so close it is a short walk, with the ocean right at your feet and the Hilton Hawaiian Village lagoon right beside. Lovely renovated rooms on the top four floors which we were given at both our check ins. Well appointed with fridge, stove, micro and sink etc. Also comfortable bed with several different views from city view to harbour to ocean. Make sure to ask for the ocean view as it is lovely to see the sunset. Great for an extended stay although Cinnamon's Restaurant is excellent for breakfast lunch or dinner. Close by are many dining choices from fast food. Thanks to Donna Morton from the front office for making the stay enjoyable and I look forward to returning, the sooner the better.

Booked in here at short notice after vacating the Hilton Hawaiian Village after one night. Found them so good to deal with and the condo had every conceivable appliance and utensil that you could wish for. The space allowed us to truely enjoy our stay in Waikiki and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. The balcony was large and had views to die for. The position meant that it was in easy walking distance of Ala Moana (10mins) and also the main stip of Waikiki and also the park and lagoon. The common areas were kept wonderfully maintained and the pool guys were fantastic. Never a problem catching the elevator either, unlike other establishments.

5 girls on a trip and our condo we rented at the Ilikai was perfect. They even gave us a late check out to accommodate our late flight. Was an awesome place to stay, we would defiantly rent there again☀️ The condo is right on the beach and the lagoon close to shopping. Beautiful pool with lounge chairs and towels provided and well looked after. Nearby we found the Harbour Pub with great happy hour prices.

The Ilikai is a beautiful space with a nice view of the lagoon and beach. There’s also the other side w/ a harbor view. I, my mother and grandmother stayed in a private condo which was okay. The front entrance and lobby always seemed busy but once inside, in the garden, or the pool it was peaceful. Although the city noise was ever present, but it’s Waikiki after all. The pool was heated, moderately sized and a pool attendant was nearby for towel service. Avoid the chairs closest to the beach because the designated smoker area is on the path behind the bushes. As of February 2016 they are building an additional pool area. There are plenty of shops in the lobby everything from souvenirs and groceries to wedding planning and photography. There was live music and hula dancing in the garden to enjoy and the 2 min fireworks show on the beach every Friday put on by the next door Hilton Hotel. We ate breakfast and dinner once each at Cinnamon’s next to the garden. They serve diner like food and it was tasty. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and within walking distance. There is an ABC store right next to the hotel for simple grocery items. Check out The Cheeseburger Waikiki restaurant, a 7 min walk for casual dining and delicious burgers. Be prepared for heavy pedestrian tourist traffic. For parking we utilized the valet service $$ so we didn't have to worry about that and they were always prompt.Overall the Ilikai was a pleasant hotel/condo experience in the bustling Waikiki. Next time I would book a hotel rm and not a private condo so I could benefit from maid service and other hotel amenities not provided. In a private condo you're on you own.

This is one of the oldest hotels in Waikiki, but with so many quirks to it. A really nice place for a staycationers like me. Most of the rooms here have kitchenette and the rooms are big enough. This hotel is only few steps away from the beach, a walking distance to many restaurants, shops, boutiques and the biggest mall in Hawaii.

Was here for a week for vacation and we had 2 suites on the 17th floor, overlooking Waikiki. One room had a king with a sofa bed, the other room had 2 queens. Both were meticulously clean, with fresh crisp linens and spotless kitchens and bathrooms. We were able to enjoy some time on our balconies throughout our visit and enjoyed the beautiful view altho there was a group of smokers below us a few floors and we could sometimes smell their cigarettes (bleah!). The lobby was spotless and beautifully decorated with huge fresh tropical flower arrangements and front desk staff were all courteous, polite and friendly. The gift shop was also neat, clean and well stocked and I enjoyed chatting with the friendly clerks. Their swimming pool was small but well kept; pool staff were friendly and helpful and showers were very clean and fresh. Their coffee shop overlooks the marina and one could sit and enjoy the beautiful sunsets directly out back; we decided to walk past the Hilton Lagoon (next door) and head towards Diamond Head to enjoy the beach at the beginning of the stretch that is "Waikiki". The water is peaceful enough that my 13 and 9 yr old niece and nephew could enjoy it without worrying about rough conditions, altho as always, they did have adult supervision. It wasn't too crowded and the view, whether looking east to Diamond Head, or west towards the sunset, was amazing. Valet staff was exceptional; everyone was always professional, polite and helpful if we needed abit of directions and they were always prompt, even during busy times of day. The location of the Ilikai is excellent too, as you are right on the "strip" and can walk anywhere in Waikiki, from Ala Moana Shopping Center, all the way over to Kapiolani Park. There are ABC stores every block, a Crazy Shirts on the corner, McDonalds across the street and Hilton Hawaiian Village is next door with their own Starbucks. Oh, and don't forget Wailana Coffee Shop across the street too; great food at great prices, with a throwback atmosphere that makes you remember when you were a kid and waitresses called you "Dear". CONS: None, altho I personally prefer to get away from the crowds in Waikiki, you cannot beat the location for convenience and proximity to many things. PROS: Excellent staff everywhere we turned! Exceptionally clean suites. None of us wanted to leave the islands. 5 star service and accomodations!

We again chose the Ilikai because of its location, price, and views. We were upgraded to the 25th floor (hotel room/not privately-owned condo), and had great balcony views of the Hilton rec-water area, and ocean (we were facing other hotels, but if you placed your chair on the very left, had good ocean views). One unexpected perk was Friday nights, when the Hilton put on their fireworks show. We had EXCELLENT views from our balcony - and you could actually hear the "pounding" as they were going off. The Ilikai room had friendly maid service, clean rooms and bathrooms. The concierge downstairs (Danielle) was EXCELLENT and we used her for arranging car rentals, activities, etc. We would definitely come and stay again!

The Ilikai is our favorite hotel in Honolulu. We stay here often and have never been disappointed. I believe all of the rooms are suites now, with complete kitchens (though most do not have an oven or dishwasher, they all have a stovetop and full-sized refrigerator). Also included are a toaster, blender, microwave, cooking utensils & baking dishes, even wine glasses. Everything you'll need is provided: paper towels (very thin ones), dish soap, a dish scrubber and dishcloth. The rooms are nicely updated...spacious and comfortable, but next time I will bring my own paper towels and toilet paper, and some cleanser for cleaning up the pots & pans (a couple were pretty dirty). Wifi is easy to set up (and free). Parking is valet-only, and not cheap, so factor that into your plans. In all, we have never been disappointed with this historic hotel.

7th time we have stayed at Ilikai condos this time 1120 -view is always spectacular over the Hilton lagoon you won't get a better view for the price in Waikiki - great spot 5 mins to ala Moana shopping 20 mins to heart of Waikiki surrounded by good shops & restaurants. We have stayed in units from floors 8 to 22 high floors have great view but it's a bit heady Over the years the Ilikai has spruced itself up with shops- great /coffee shop - lovely with great service but give cinnamon's restaurant a miss it was so much better when it was a sports bar if you want a decent mai tai go next door to Hilton - parking out back Nothing negative to say about Ilikai that's why we keep coming back it's a great spot whether for a stopover or 2 weeks

Gorgeous ocean and lagoon view from our room. Steps away from the beach and easy access to shopping and local restaurants. Beach is a lot quieter than downtown area, so it feels more peaceful the way Hawaii should be!! Such a nice place for a couple's getaway!!

Walking to Waikiki Beach is 5 minutes away. Our porch overlooked the boat harbor. The setting sun is incredible and Diamond head was just to our left. The rooms are large and comfortable. We didnt have to rent a car as the bus schedule was in front of the Resort. As senior's we got a 5 day pass for $12. We live in the boonies, so it was wonderful being right in the middle of it. A short buss ride to one of the best Chinatown's in the USA.

We stayed at the Ilikai for 9 nights and we were very happy with our accommodation. The hotel is an older building, but well maintained.We were two mother daughter groups, and we booked two ocean view rooms with kitchen. The king size bed in our room was extremely comfortable, and we had the option of a pull out sofa bed. The room was a good size, comfortable and clean. The kitchen was very well equipped - we used it for breakfast and some other simple meals, but we could easily have cooked dinner every night if so inclined. The staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. Our room looked out over the hotel pool, the Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon, the ocean, marina and some of the Hilton pools next door - a very pleasant outlook. Facilities within the hotel were pleasant, we had everything we needed. There is a small convenience store in the lobby, along with a coffee shop and some nice touristy type shops. We weren't impressed with Cinnamons restaurant in the courtyard, and we didn't try the rooftop restaurant. The hotel is conveniently located for many restaurants in the surrounding area and there are numerous stores and restaurants in the Hilton complex which is right next door. The hotel pool was a bit crowded, and too warm for my liking (although my friend preferred the warmer water), but the lagoon is right next door and that was great for swimming. The beach is also an easy walk, just the other side of the lagoon. The hotel provided free beach chairs and towels whenever we needed them. The hotel is also well situated for other activities, with the Ala Moana shopping centre an easy 10-15 minute stroll down the road, and it was an easy pick up point for tours and transport right out the front of the hotel. The Trolley stop is right outside, and The Bus stop is next door - simple! We were able to walk to the main stretch of Waikiki and back either along the beach front behind the hotel (slightly tricky in some places) or via the streets at the front, which was a very easy walk of about 20 mins. This hotel had everything we needed, it was comfortable and friendly - and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again

This hotel is perfect for those who want to be on the edge of Waikiki, but just close enough to be a quick shuttle ride, trolley or taxi away from everything. It's a walkable distance to the shops, zoo, ect., but it is not a short one. Have good walking shoes and an energy bar! The grounds and room are impeccable, and staff super friendly. It has a great everybody pool, with a second under construction. An ABC store is right across the street but there is a little Mart off the lobby that actually has better prices. Tip: The coffee in the Mart is 1/5th the price of the coffee shop in the lobby! I've been to this hotel twice and It's my favorite place to stay on Oahu!

From the beautiful entrance with the leaping whale statue at the waterfall fountain to the nice stores in the lobby and the view going out to the beach, this hotel is very contemporary and exudes luxury. The staff was very friendly and helpful at the Ilikai. We met Dana, a customer relations representative, earlier in the day on a whaling excursion and she was very friendly and helpful, even recommending the restaurant at the top of the hotel. I don't think you'll go wrong staying here.

She's a bit if an old girl now, built in 1964. The hotel is undergoing a bit of an update with a new pool. The rooms are large with a full kitchen. Lots of mirrors in the room make it feel larger than they are. Would I go back? YES without a second thought. Loved our stay. Plenty of facilities within the hotel (shops, coffee cafe). Cinnamon's restaurant good to eat breakfast but it's very popular and sometimes there's a 20min wait. Restaurant at the top (Sorrento's) a little disappointing for the quality of food and expensive. Great location, loads around the hotel, 15min beach walk to Waikiki beach.Don't miss the fireworks on Friday about 19:45 thanks to the Hilton next door.Ask the 'Adventure desk' in the lobby for discount car rental and trips. They will book it all for you.

We stayed in a room with two queen beds and a pull out sofa, this was enough space for 4 of us to sleep with a kitchenette and decent sized bathroom.Great location, very affordable! We would have preferred room service every few days instead of once every 5 days.The reception staff were fantastic, very helpful and friendly people! I would definitely stay here again.Stayed MAY 2015

This was our second time staying at the Ilikai and it was better than the first! Our room was on the 24th floor with an ocean and partial marina view. The room was very clean and updated and the bed was comfortable. We especially like the valet parking. It does cost $28. 00 per day, but the security and convenience is worth the price. The resort fee includes beach towels and chairs which we used every day. Most everything we wanted to do on Waikiki is within walking distance as is the Ala Moana mall. The staff was not overly friendly, but they were not rude. If we ever go back to Honolulu we will probably stay at the Ilikai again.

The kitchen was fine, the bathroom needs some shelves for toiletries. the end wall is all mirrors so your neighbours can see you all the time if you open the curtain, awful!! It is a good location, but we faced out to the main street and that is very noisy, can not sit on the deck and enjoy your wine at the end of the day! So, ask for a suite facing towards the beach!

This is a centrally located, long time landmark hotel. Very convenient with nice shops and very close to great restaurants. The staff is friendly. We had a studio with a city view which was clean and amazingly quiet given the amount of traffic on Ala Moana Blvd almost 24 hours a day. When you make your reservations be sure to request a marina view so that you will be able to sit on your patio in relative quiet. The full kitchen is a great benefit. In a city that has thousands of hotel rooms to offer travelers, this is a clean, economical and overall good choice in Waikiki!

We stayed in room #339 at the Ilikai for 6 weeks, this is known as a 1 bedroom, however all 1 bedroom units are simply large studios. At first glance we were very disappointed. We saw stains in the carpet and rips in the furniture.The chaise lounge and couch, besides being ripped have lost most of the foam and now are very lumpy and need lots of pillows to sit on, so you won't feel the large springs. The taps in the bathroom are rusty and I tried cleaning, but the rust is there to stay. The owner said he slept on the couch and it was passable but no luxury, and explained that the Ilikai is not a high end resort and priced as such. The owner did say that the rips have been fixed, but I feel replacement should be the only option. We had company over (they were also in a room at the Ilikai) and they could not sit on the lounge chair, very uncomfortable, certainly not like their upgraded room. The appliances have seen better days, but work well, a shelf in the freezer would be great.The hotel has a very small pool, but the towels are plentiful.The location and views are great, wonderful area for walking and not too busy. The AC unit is very quiet and works well. The lanai is large and has a nice view of the marina, and the beautiful sunsets. If this room would be updated like many of the units at the Ilikai, then I would return to room #339, but not the way it is now.

This property is located adjacent to the Ala Moana harbor at the western end of Waikiki beach. My room was a very nice studio with a harbor/ocean view. Other than false fire alarm my first morning, it was very peaceful and offered shops, a fitness center and a couple dining choices on site and off. Located near the Hilton Hawaiian Village and tourist destinations, it is convenient yet quieter than other parts of Waikiki beach. Definitely recommend.

I just love this place!! Last year I stayed on the 17th floor with city view and this year we are booked on the 13th floor with ocean/marina view. It is centrally located to everything and I love that it is one of the major pick up points for tours of the island. The room/studio is so much larger than your average hotel room and less expensive too!! I love having the full kitchen and king size bed. I book through hawaiianvacationpropertiesllc.

I stayed in one of the upper floor, oceanfront, 2 Bedroom 2 Bathroom suites managed by Aqua Resorts. Breathtaking views of the ocean, boat harbor and lagoon. Large balconies from each bedroom and living room.Luxurious furnishings, flat screen TV's and full kitchen with granite counter tops. Great, friendly and helpful staff to top off my 3 day visit. Highly recommended.

Are you coming to Honolulu for a convention? If so, read on. You know the deal: you are a long way from home, Honolulu really isn’t such a nice place, and you are facing a soul-sucking schmoozathon with professional strangers for hours on end. What would help? A pleasant hotel: Warm lobby, nice room with pictures on the walls that don’t look vaguely like rebar, courteous staff that makes you feel welcome, nice cozy bar. Those all take the sting out, right? Well, here’s the deal: this hotel bats about .300. OK for the majors, less good for a hotel. Here’s what you will experience: you pull up to a massive building, circa 1965, built in the style that I can only describe as Cinderblock Revival, with Tiki Torches. Checking in, the desk person is friendly, barely, as she walks you through all the stuff you get for the mandatory “amenities fee” that will be larded onto your bill, including a $50 “credit” for dining at their not so lovely restaurant. Use it or lose it. And in case your meeting starts early, forget it, the restaurant opens at 7AM. What’s to like? The rooms are remodeled and actually rather nice. It’s an easy 15 minute walk to the Hawaii Convention Center. If you get a free couple of hours, the beach is very close. Oh, and the bar at the Hilton next door isn’t too bad. Oops, did I say that? Well, now you know.

The suite was immaculate. Kitchen was well appointed. The shops downstairs were handy. The pool staff were friendly and helpful. Plenty of room for three ladies and all their stuff. Quiet and great view of the harbour.

Spectacular view of the ocean. A lot of construction going on which made it hard to enjoy the balcony. Suite could use a few more things in it to make it better. ie can opener, dish clothes, oven mitts, buggy to pick up groceries in. Other than that, it was lovely and comfortable with air conditioning. We had 2 double beds, with a room divider

What a GREAT trip Unit 1718 was a perfect location for our trip ! Relaxing Great ocean views and convienant to beach and shops . The building it self could use some renovation but all in all Great Value for the location. Unit 1718 is setup for you to go to the market and get your food to cook when you get tired of going out to eat. Tried to book again for June but all booked up so went with a different unit in the building with alike views.

Pros: 1) The location is at the very tip of Waikiki--- it is out of the hustle and bustle (which could be a con) but from the beach/lagoon side, you can walk miles of sandy Waikiki Beach. It is a great location for avoiding the major downtown Waikiki traffic.. Yet, it is also a short walk or bus/car ride to Ala Moana shopping centre, downtown Honolulu. 2) The entire building itself is very clean and they are in the process of upgrading the hotel and apartments are privately owned. Most have gone through extensive renovations and modernization. 3) The restaurant Cinnamons downstairs is fantastic for breakfast (we did not try lunch or dinner). The price was comparable to a highly recommended local spot (Diamond Head Take Out- which you have to try on your way to or from your hike). Portions were very generous. 4) All the employees were pleasant and helpful (even in the midst of the chaos of the Honolulu Marathon where entire Waikiki is shut down! 5) Pick a room that has a lagoon view so you can be in direct view of the Friday Night fireworks show! It is spectacular! If not, try and get reservations at Shorebirds (which is walking distance too) or beach front restaurant for dinner. Fireworks begin at 7pm. 6) Ditto on the previous post re: parking. It is very convenient. Cons: Not much about the hotel itself, but because condos privately owned, it is hit and miss.. I made the mistake of booking the room one less night and just realized this prior to leaving. Fortunately the management staff was able to get me a room just across from ours-- what a drastic difference! Ours was original--- I MEAN ORIGINAL! Nothing was upgraded, not even the bathroom sink- it was 70s style. And our floor was not upgraded yet (as mentioned, the entire building is getting a facelift). So as such, the carpeting in the halls were disgusting and some hotel room doors looked dirty. This is the reason why I have to rate the rooms as "poor"-- but just do your research and ask what has been remodelled because the pictures can be deceiving. There was also a room on our floor that was constantly cooking something (yes it smelled good) but totally not what you want to smell when you come into a "hotel". Because units are privately owned, you have to get out of the mentality that it is a "hotel" and many live there permanently. We didn't get too much noise from where we were 5th floor corner unit overlooking marina and lagoon. Finally, when we got there, I didn't expect to find no toiletries-- again not sure if this was an oversight or if it is the decision of each private owner. There was a kitchen but no sense in using if you don't have any dish soap!

well, best to say brilliant all round! spent a month in a 12th floor apartment privately rented. location - right at the beginning of wakiki tourist area which meant you have the option to walk 10 mins into the really busy areas or 10 mins in the other direction to the worlds largest outdoor shopping centre.immediately outside are bus stops which cover routes to every part of the island.Consider bus passes and just hop on and off with the locals. The main waikiki beach is ok but in the other direction is magic island and alamoana beach which are quieter and better quality.Local supermarket opposite down a side street and you have a full kitchen, which saves you loads of money.we really loved this hotel and during our month saw, visited lots of other hotels in this area and would want to come back to the ilikai. Wish we had tried cinnamons sooner as the evening menu was good value.So much I could say but I think you get the picture.

I love this hotel and I know that though out the years it has undergone a lot of changes both physically and internally. I still find this a perfect place to stay for a weekend getaway. Good valets parking, customer service, and big clean rooms. Love the location as it is near Ala Moana and the beginning of Waikiki. Parking also by Alawai and lots of great food places within walking distance. Love this hotel and always will.

Pros: They are really upgrading the hotel & doing a beautiful job. We stayed on the 25th floor with city views and were very pleased with the room. It has a small kitchen so you can cook & eat in, the only slight problem was that there's no dish rack to put dishes in after you wash them. All the employees were pleasant & helpful. If you don't want to drive anywhere, Cinnamons is adjacent to the lobby it has great food & full bar all day & they had live music on several nights. There's a small market downstairs. Great location for avoiding the major downtown Waikiki traffic, yet close enough to walk anywhere in Waikiki or Ala Moana. Just 2 miles to downtown Honolulu, which we walked almost everyday. There are SO many stores & restaurants near by. You can see the Fri night fireworks show from the walk way behind the hotel, overlooking the marina. I would definitely stay there again!Cons: I really have no complaints about the hotel. However, on the city side, you can't really leave the lanai doors open unless you don't mind constant traffic noise. Parking is Valet only at $28/night. There is a public parking garage across the street (above the Red Lobster) that has in/out privileges for $20/night get a receipt if possible & be aware of following the directions, if your ticket doesn't work they will try to get $20 each time you enter! Also strictly follow the parking notices in the back around the marina & the Hilton pond. Tow trucks are there at 10:30 pm & will tow your car IMMEDIATELY. You will have to get to Sand Island & pay $150. to get it back, yes we learned the hard way!!

I have been traveling to Oahu since 1972. I have seen a multitude of transformations and changes take place in Waikiki. And the Ilikai has been at the height of popularity in the 60s and 70s and then went thru some years of losing its appeal. But now there is definitely a resurgence and transformation taking place at the Ilikai. Unlike most of the Waikiki hotels, it still captures "traditional" hawaii which is lacking in so many of the hotels now. We noticed there are many transformations that are taking place now to put this property in the place of what we predict is going to be one of the best properties in Waikiki. I am not sure what is going on but the units on floors 21 thru 25 are over the top. Very impressed!!
user_name:
Annie8991
Anderson, South Carolina, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Ilikai from November 20-28 of last year, while spending Thanksgiving week with her mother who lives in the neighborhood. For the past fourteen years, while visiting her parents once or twice a year, we have invariably stayed at the Waikiki Prince Hotel located a little more than a block away from the Ilikai. All the rooms at the Prince are ocean front, the hotel is clean and well managed, and the room rates are very reasonable by Waikiki standards. What’s wrong with the Prince is that in all those fourteen years, the rooms have never been refreshed. What was once high end and modern, has gradually become tired, worn, and dated. The Ilikai celebrated its 50’th anniversary in 2014. For a hotel, a fiftieth anniversary can be a good thing or a bad thing. If you’re old enough, the Ilikai’s exterior façade, with its continuous, wrap-around, balconies, sliding patio doors, and turquoise decorative panels, will take you back to the heyday of sixties, high-rise, hotel-apartment, architectural design. The same can be said for the Ilikai’s lobby. In the nineties, my in-laws spent a month or two at the Ilikai every winter. Only thirty-something years old at that point, the Ilikai was already showing its age. The rooms were tired, worn, and dated. At the time, I would have characterized them as ‘tacky’.This past November, on the recommendation of a family friend who reported that, under new management, the Ilikai had undergone a major renovation and face-lift, and based on what appeared to be, a very competitive room rate, my wife and I decided to give the Ilikai a try, and we were certainly glad that we did.The public spaces will not impress, but then, the same can be said of ninety percent of Waikiki’s hotels. The reason to stay at the Ilikai, and what makes the Ilikai an exceptional value, are the rooms on upper floors 22 through 25. By urban, downtown, hotel standards, the rooms are large and spacious; suite-like. The rooms have full kitchens with full-sized appliances and granite counters and breakfast bars. The kitchens are open to the rest of the room making them bright and full of light. The bathrooms are large and modern with marble floors and granite vanity tops. There’s no tub, but the shower is spacious, made to feel all the more spacious for the lack of a shower door. The living space is, more or less, equally apportioned into two areas; a ‘living room’ with a couch and arm chairs and credenza and flat screen television, and a ‘bedroom’ comfortably accommodating a king-sized bed and night stands. No part of the overall room feels crowded or cramped. Again, spacious. And all of the furnishings work together. All the furnishings are new, high-end, and well-coordinated. Go look at the room photos. They’re representative and accurate.One of the best things about the rooms is each room’s individual, stand-alone, HVAC unit, operable via a remote control. The unit is well sized and powerful. Whatever your individual preference, especially for sleeping, you can quickly and quietly achieve whatever temperature that suits you. And unlike so many subtropical hotel rooms, the Ilikai’s HVAC units dehumidify nicely. There’s not even a hint of mildew or mustiness in the conditioned air. I believe all rooms come with a full balcony. Ours faced the ocean; more accurately, the Ali Wai small boat harbor. Again, refer to the room photos; representative and accurate.And the Wi-fi was fast, 24/7. The hotel staff are uniformly friendly, helpful, and accommodating.
