Worthy of particular commendation is the valet parking staff. We did a lot of in and out. I doubt I ever had to wait more than a few minutes for my car, even at the busiest of times.And then having nothing to do with the hotel itself, the Ilikai’s location is worthy of note. Located on the north end of Waikiki, you avoid a lot of the noise, traffic, and congestion found at the heart of Waikiki proper. On our first trip to Honolulu in 1984, staying in an ocean view room on a high floor of the Waikiki Marriott, on my first morning in Hawaii, upon throwing open the room’s sliding patio door, I was greeted by the smell of the neighboring Burger King’s kitchen exhaust, some thirty floors below. You’ll get none of that at the Ilikai, especially if you stay on the ocean side. The Ilikai is a ten minute walk from the geographic center of Waikiki and Waikiki Beach, and in the other direction, a similar ten minute walk from the Ala Moana Mall, the epicenter of Honolulu shopping. Excellent location, rooms, and prices, making for an exceptional value. You won’t be disappointed.

We found this hotel thru Trip Advisor. We had the perfect room with the perfect view. If we ever have the opportunity to return, we will definitely stay at this location. We had a view of the lagoon. The Friday night fireworks were gorgeous from our room! we rented a car for the week and parked in the public parking at the marina. It worked like a charm for us!

I travelled to Hawaii with friends with Honolulu being our first island. The hotel was more than we could have wanted. It was situated in a perfect location for our needs, with a short 5/10 minute stroll into the main downtown area where all the bars, restaurants and shops were. It was location on the beach, with stunning views, next to the Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort which was also beautiful. It has a very small swimming pool, but with the ocean a stones throw away, it didn't bother us. The hotel has all the facilities you could want, various shops, rentals vendors and more. Outside the hotel was a bus stop going to all the locations you would need on the island. Pearl Harbour was the further destination and it was a 45 minutes bus ride. The room in which we rented was perfect and done exactly our needs.

I booked a one bedroom apartment (ocean and lagoon facing) I found it to be good value compared to small hotel rooms if you are chasing that view.The exterior of the property and pool areas are very circa 1950 and could do with a freshen up. The pool area is well used and it proved difficult at times to secure to deck chairs together. The pool does not see much sun till around lunch time .As it was our first time to Waikiki I did feel we may have been a bit to far away from the main hub. But on a positive side it made walking to the Ala Mona shopping centre a breeze ( try the 4th floor restaurant near Macys for great happy hour entertainment and good reasonably priced food) . There was also a huge Wallmart nearby to stock up on food for your apartment.All in all a reasonable hotel for what you pay ......

I loved the area we were in. There were 3 groups so we had 3 different condos. The one I was in was in need of a facelift. The other 2 I could tell had been remodeled. They were so much nicer. However it was nice for all of us to be close and it didn't take away from our enjoyment. Lots of things to do within walking distance. Would go back again.

We rented this condo for 10 days in December, it worked nicely. The rooms were clean and modern, it is really a large studio. It was an adequate sized kitchen for accommodating 3 or 4 people, the living area had two double beds and a couch that converted into a standard bed. The room's view was outstanding, we were facing the marina and watched the sunset every night. Since it rained a couple of days the rainbows were in full force. Great location.

My family rented until 1001 through Ali'i Beach Rentals and it was great. This is a very nice property with some good common amenities. The little market in the lobby level was super convenient (albeit slightly pricier than the grocery store around the corner) and there was a nice little pool. The best thing was how conveniently located it was. The room itself was very nice with a King size bed and a futon foldout couch. There was a nice kitchen which was more than serviceable for our 3 days/nights. The cupboards (linen and kitchen) were sufficiently loaded for our needs. One tip that I discovered a little late. The parking in the Ilikai is a bit pricey ($28/day) but just across the street they have 10 hour parking for a mere $7 or 24 hours for $20

The floor we were on smelled bad. Our third floor room's balcony overlooked construction of the balcony below. Our room was fairly clean, for the most part, with the exception of the fridge door, which was filthy. Water pressure was terrible. Hotel staff were friendly & helpful. I probably wouldn't stay here again with so many other choices.

This is definately a good place to stay Rooms are big with kitchens which allow you to have some variety in meals. Pool is adequate and location not bad Easy walk to shopping centre and about 10-15 walk into central Waikiki Beach easy to get to and good swimming beach for kids as is Hilton Lagoon Playstation and free Blu Ray hire add to experience as does unlimited wifi. If you dont want to be in the middle of waikiki tourist shops this is a great option only 5 mins away

Our second fantastic stay at the Ilikai Hotel in a condo. We stayed in the condo next to the one we stayed in last year. The condo was spotlessly clean, freshly painted and had a new bathroom. The studio style condo had a king bed, full kitchen, big screen LCD TV, sofa and large balcony with a table and chairs. Beautiful views of the ocean, lagoon, pool, marina and Friday night fireworks. The free wifi was a bit unreliable this year unlike last year. We were very happy with our stay at the Ilikai Hotel.

I was booked into this hotel with a fellow work colleague back in November, on the same booking. However the rooms we were offered were vastly different. When I checked in I was offered a room on the third floor, which overlooked some construction works currently going on at the hotel. The room was ok, and perfectly serviceable, however the noise was very noticeable, and the decor sadly dated and drab. After making a complaint to the hotel, they kindly offered me a new room, this time on the 22nd floor, and in the newly refurbished rooms which are light-years ahead of the rest of the hotel. The location is fairly central, and the view from the rooms are brilliant. The hotel lacks any mid-range restaurant, with only two polar opposites available - an open air 'beach' bar offering light burgers and snacks (nothing that special), and a high end Italian restaurant at the top offering excellent views (didn't try it) I would recommend the hotel, but only for the upgraded rooms, sadly the difference between the two means that booking the cheapest rate can mean pot luck with what you get - my tip, pay the little bit extra to get the upgraded experience.

Stayed 1 night prior to leaving for pride of America cruise. Allowed us early checkin - a real blessing after a 12 hour flight! Staff very friendly and room came with nice kitchen. Laundry facilities and ice machine on every floor.free wifi. Room size bigger than our room in trump. Right next to hotel that holds fireworks every Friday night. Nice reasonably priced hotel restaurant cinnamons with lovely views.impressed and would definitely consider it again. Location not so central to Waikiki shopping but short walk to ala Moana. McDonald's also very close!

Awesome place to stay, well located with restaurants and convenience stores nearby, close to the biggest shopping centre on the island and a short stroll to the ocean, our second time here and we will be back again for sure. An easy drive down to Waikiki beach should you want the hustle and bustle of the tourist strip.

The Ilikai is well located in Honolulu. It has restaurants across the road and for the budget conscious, McDonalds is just across the road as well. The only down side is there is no parking at the Ilikai, but we found a car parking place just around the corner. The room was comfortable with a great view. Managed to get a last minute deal which was great. Would stay here again.

The hotel was really nice. Rooms were modern. Ensure you request a room overlooking the lagoon and the beach. The sofa bed was adequate too. The restaurant in the hotel is NOT good. The food isn't cooked fresh, it appears to be already made and heated up. Definitely suggest eating somewhere else. The FREE live music and and show is just okay. If your overlooking the Hilton, the entertainment on their stage is must better to watch.

We checked into the hotel at 3pm. Carpark is chargeable at USD$28/night. You can get the beach towel from the reception desk and can borrow DVD or Playstation games from the machine in the lobby.The room is big, clean and tidy. There is a balcony which faced the sea.There is a Playstation in the room where you can watch DVD or play games.There is a kitchen which has an old stove, microwave and big fridge. The cupboards in the kitchen is quite old looking. The bathroom is small and has a small tub.We walked to Ala Moana Shopping center for about 10-15 minutes. There is ABC stores, eateries and McDonald's near the hotel. We also walked to Hard Rock Cafe. Everywhere is within walking distance.I will return to this hotel again.

We booked through the website Waikiki Beach Rentals, which was an easy process done online. Our unit 1616 faced the lagoon and it was such a pleasure to wake up to the beautiful view every morning. With 2 Double beds, a full kitchen and air conditioning it was the perfect place to stay with my family. The building itself was in a great position, The lifts were fast and rarely did we have to wait. We stayed for 2 weeks and could have stayed longer. Parking was expensive so we alternated between the Red Lobster which had different deals and the parking at the marina which is timed. Loved it.

We enjoyed our room, although not huge Waikiki fans after this trip. We stayed in a studion suite with a full kitchen and lots of space.We had a partial ocean view, as described you could see part of the ocean, sorta. Right on the edge of downtown, lots to do and see.Bed was a little hard, and the pillows were way too big, but overall nice.

I stayed at the Ilikai 12 months ago and I couldn't have been happier. The room we stayed in was on the 21st floor with amazing views of the lagoon, ocean, marina and pool. We booked again this year and spent 10 nights in another amazing room just next to the one we stayed in last year. It was impeccably clean, looked exactly as the photos showed! The bathroom was new, the kitchen great...nothing to fault. We booked it through waikikibeachrentals.comWe had lots of rain, in fact a week of it, the laundry got good use!Free wi fi but it wasn't always reliable.Would highly recommend this hotel. Will certainly return!

We stayed here for 10 nights. Had a lovely huge 2 bedroom apartment fully self contained. Higher floor which was great. No ocean view, which would have been nice. Management very helpful and replaced the toaster, which didn't toast too well. Would stay again. The only drawback was no access to the gym with our booking.

We always rent a condo here when on vacation. All I can say is location, location, location. We always stay on the ocean side. Views of the pool, lagoon, marina, and ocean from your lanai. One of the best seats for the Friday Night Fireworks. We enjoy having the full kitchen when we do not want to go out and eat all the time. Great selection of stores and the 2 restaurants located here are excellent. Short walk to the Ala Moana Mall and Ala Moana Beach Park. Lots of great restaurants close by.

We stayed at this Hotel for 7 nights. Loved the location, about 15 minutes walk to Ala Moana. And about the same to the other end of Waikiki to the restaurants, shops etc.We had a room with a full kitchen which was very good as we found a great little supermarket 6 minutes walk from the Hotel. It was Food Pantry, everything we needed was there. There were 8 in our Family party (3 rooms) having a kitchen was such a bonus.Lovely helpful staff, great housemaids. The pool area very nice. We will return to this Hotel.
user_name:
Anne N
West Auckland, United Kingdom

review_body: Had a very nice staycation with the wife for anniversary. Booked ocean view renovated. It's not oceanfront view but balcony has a view of harbor, Ala Moana beach and magic island. Hotel calls it ocean sunset view. Room 2539. We initially were on 22nd floor but since room wasn't ready asked what was and desk clerk asked if I wanted 25th(one below penthouse) sheah! Room was big, nice FIRM king bed. Full kitchen , nice furniture, pull out sofa and big bathroom albeit walk in shower. It looks like price does not include $15 hospitality fee on site but I did get discounted valet parking half off at $14. Coffee provided does not exactly fit coffee maker( kind weak for amount given). Free dvd card was nice so rented a few DVDs for free. Huge balcony and felt private when you were sitting down. AC worked great. The whole room felt very clean and no mold in bathroom as with older hotels of this type hence why I'm giving 5 stars. Got a late Check out till 2pm and valet was very quick under 5 minutes. Cinnamons cafe another story; went for lunch- ok food, ok service, felt like the waiters couldn't be bothered- surprised as Its a local restaurant in a now locally owned hotel. Disappointed in Cinnamons. Btw there really doesn't seem to be AC in elevators and floor hallways! Haha but no biggie, this is Hawaiian style! Oh pool was fine , no hot tub but there is a gym - not modern with real towels but does the trick if you are desperate to work out. Closest pool is the lagoon. Overall nice hotel stay! Aloha!

We stayed here from the 27th Oct - 6th Nov. We have stayed in Hawaii before so we thought we would give this place a go as it had a full kitchen, which is what we were after. We loved the location, close to everything - Ala Moana centre, beach, waikiki main strip, restaurants & the waikiki trolley stops right outside the ilikai on the main road.We had a room with the city/mountain view on the top floor - 25.We had a large bedroom, balcony, full kitchen, wifi, free dvd rentals & good sized bathroom. The only downfall was the bed. It was too hard probably cause it was placed on top of a boxed bed frame instead of slats, so luckily i found the pull out sofa bed and my husband & i slept on that for most of our stay. other than that everything else was awesome!

We stayed here from the 5th Oct - 17th Oct 2015, We had a few people recommend this place to stay so we thought we would give it a go & I have to say that we weren't disappointed at all. We stayed in room 1540 rented it through Waikiki Beach Rentals, they were easy to book with & they replied quickly. We had no trouble at all. The Condo was very clean a little on the small side but when your out a lot it's big enough. The location was great as we didn't want to be in the main hug. The view from our room/balcony was great over looking the Lagoon opposite the Hilton, with a bonus view of the fireworks on Friday nights. There is a bus stop just outside & across the road from the Hotel, there is also heaps of shops just minutes walk away around the Hilton Hotel

Booked via WaikikiBeachRentals.com and stayed in APT# 1407 facing the City. The studio (they call it 1 bedroom) was great. New Kitchen, beds and sofa. Large Balcony. The complex is a bit tired but very clean. The pool is Ok, and it compares to most others in the area. The hotel is the pickup point for most tours in this area, this was perfect. We were able to check in at 0930 which was a saviour after the long overnight flight. Walking distance to shopping centre and Waikiki is a plusWe had no interaction with the staff as its a private condo. They give you the door code when you book, so you go straight to the room. Would definitely stay here again

Booked an apartment though a "airbnb" type webpage. The owner was great, letting me know how to pay the balance, and what we needed to get to the apt. Not having to check in was a bonus. Our studio (or 1 bedroom as they are called) was huge, with everything you need, large king bed, fully functioning kitchen, big bathroom. Laundry facilities were down the hall. We picked a "beach" view apartment it didn't disappoint. The Ilikai is about a 10 minute walk from Ala Moana Shopping Centre, and 10 minutes from all that is the rest of Waikiki. The onsite shop is a little more expensive than the ABC stores (of which there are 3 minutes away), loads of local places to eat - big names and more local fare.I had stayed at maybe a 3 star place in Waikiki before, and it was a dump compared to the Iilikai, so price wise it was great value. I cant comment on staff, as we had no interaction with them at all.Would I stay there again - sure, it will be interesting to see other apartments.

Three ladies stayed in Suite 1733 & would highly recommend it to future vacationers. Clean, bright & cheerful. Quite comfortable & well stocked with amenities. We had two small situations & both were handled immediately. Only negative comment would be no tv trays or end table to set a beverage down & bad odour of bathroom tap water.- Sue.Water odour & disconnect on the sink in bathroom. A small coffee table would have made for a better social circle indoors, otherwise would be happy to return to 1733.-Judy.Suite needs coffee table & end table. Sink run off in bathroom not connected. Kitchen very well stocked & lots of fun cookbooks for reading enjoyment. Perhaps provide bath mat.-Anne.

Enjoy every September a month of Hawaiian AlohaView from Room 641 - sunrise & sunset suburban Cruise ships entering Waikiki harbor and leaving Harbor View of the airplanes landing and taking off from the Honolulu AirportHotel Fabulous views, clean, quiet Pleasant visit due to an exceptionally trained staff

Customer service was excellent at the Ilikai. First a special thanks to Marie at the front desk. I had an urgent business matter and she helped me print and fax my documents with a smile and without hesitation. She saved the day.We really enjoyed the valet parking service at Ilikai. I don't think we waited more than 3 minutes every time. It was worth the fee not to worry about finding a parking space.My sister & I really enjoyed our room (#1009); actually, a suite. 2 bedrooms & 2 baths, split floor plan, full kitchen, long living room & dining area with walls of windows. Plus 2 balconies. And very clean.We also enjoyed Cinnamon's Restaurant on the property; great service & food. The marketplace store was very convenient too.Location is great. Just a few minutes walk to the Lagoon and Waikiki Beach and the marina. We appreciated the free towel & chair rentals.

The property includes killer views, not too far to the airport (closer than many), pool, beach, grocery, concierge, cafe and restaurant. Public spaces a bit tired but schedule for a refresh from what we could tell. Very attentive staff, friendly desk.

This was my first trip to Honolulu and I had looked at a number of options before booking the Ilikai. It ended up being a great choice.The location is near ideal. I didn't really want to be in the middle of Waikiki, this is more on the edge of it, which means that while it's still a busy area, it's not quite as crazy as other areas can be.We ended up in a Luxury Ocean View Suite. We had booked a Mountain View, but they upgraded us on arrival. 23rd floor, beautiful view over the lagoon and we arrived on a Friday, so had a front row, balcony seat to the Hilton's fireworks display (which they do every Friday). It was spectacular and a nice way to begin our visit.No need to upload pictures, the pictures on the website are exactly what we found. We were in one of the renovated suites. While they aren't large, they are big enough for two people and quite comfortable. There is a small but full kitchen. Full-sized stove, refrigerator and microwave. The kitchen is stocked with the basics - pots/pans, dishes, glasses, cutlery, toaster, coffeemaker, cutting board, knives - so eating breakfast, and an occasional dinner, in was a breeze. There is a nice-sized grocery store just a few blocks away on Holbron.Bathroom is big with a walk-in shower. My only complaint is the lack of places to hang towels. One towel rod and one hook. But it's a small complaint!Big balcony and well shielded from your next door neighbors, so they feel private. We were concerned about the bed at first - it felt too firm. But no problems sleeping, so really can't complain.One of the nicest things we noticed is that the room was really well insulated from noise. We never heard anyone in the hall, next door or below or above us. Extremely quiet. There is a $15 per day "resort" fee. That includes the wifi, unlimited blu-ray DVD rentals and a daily paper (maybe it includes more that I missed). The wifi slowed down for us on occasion, but mostly worked just fine for surfing the internet and checking e-mail. I don't think it would have been fast enough to stream anything. The DVD offerings were good and a nice convenience.The restaurant on the lobby level, Cinnamon's, was fine if you wanted something close and straight forward.We would definitely book this place again. I don't know that we could have been happier.

The service was excellent from check-in to check-out! My husband and I stayed for 6 nights and enjoyed every moment. We loved how equipped each room was with all the necessities needed to utilize the room to it's full potential (serving & eating utensils, cookware, dishes and appliances). Upon check-in, Mr. Rod, the front desk agent was very welcoming and professional. He had a great introduction of the hotel and we were very delighted on our decision to have stayed there. The bell service folks were wonderful and their customer service was top notch. Housekeeping was also very thorough with their duties and work very hard to maintain the cleanliness of the room. It's just a walking distance to all the shopping centers and entertainment in Waikiki. All in all, we were very satisfied with the hotel and highly recommend the Ilikai to others.

Great place for a stay at Waikiki. Close enough to enjoy the spoils of the more expensive places (Hilton Village next door) if glaring expense is your thing. We booked a room privately, and it was fantastically appointed and the process was a breeze.Lagoon at the back door, great views.Only downside was the balcony, whose bars were spaced too far apart, meaning it was impossible to enjoy the space with our 18 month old.

We stayed in a private Condo 1814. Awesome ocean and lagoon views from our Lani. Perfect position to short walk to beautifull beaches, restaurants. The Ala Moana Shopping Centre, ABC stores. Lovely walk around the Boat Harbour. Condo was very roomy, open plan with lounge chair which could use with an upgrade, a bit hard to sit on. Great size kitchen. Beds were so comfortable. Roomy bathroom. Air conditioner needs attention as was dripping with condensation on the back of the TV. Our Condo was very quiet., Very, Very, reasonable costs to stay in such a place of high standards that has so much to offer. Our stay there was amazing and certainly made our Hawaii holiday fantastic. Would certainly stay there again and highly recommend a private Condo as a cheaper alternative to holiday.

We stayed in a private condo (1312) for 6 nights in October. Easy to book and access as per directions from owner. The views are wonderful just as pictured. The room itself was great - modern and roomy. Everything one could need and want was available. The beach is close by, an easy walk. Take water shoes as the bottom is rocky. The pool is on the smaller side but refreshing. There is a little market store downstairs for a reasonably priced coffee and to pick up things. We watched the Friday night fireworks on the Lagoon from the balcony. The only drawback to our visit was the construction noise as there are some renos going on.

We had the absolute pleasure of staying at Ilikai private condo 1312 for 4 nights Sept/Oct. 2 adults & 1 teenager. It was amazing from the view to the fully equipped apartment, pool, wi-fi, close to everything including buses etc at front door, fireworks on Friday night. We were also lucky to be able to get an early book in & a late book out without any problem.

The view and location is wonderful. A short walk to the lagoon and beach. Pick high floors. Traffic noise can be crazy if air conditioned is not on. Room is clean. I picked the renovated 25th floor. Service is good. No complaints. I am staying here for 3 weeks.

The 3 of us stayed here for 8 nights (in the junior suit which was meant to sleep 3 people). The ladies downstairs in the office were very friendly and helpful.While its advertised as a hotel, its really a serviced apartment i guess. We found the arrangement a bit confusing as we were sure what you could ask for or not.For example you can ask for fresh towels/toilet paper daily but your room is only cleaned every 4 days.The cleanliness of the room was not great and the first set of towels they brought us were all stained. Overall i'd say they need to step it up when it comes to cleaning the kitchen and bathroom.We didnt have water views so i cant comment on that, we were facing the street which was nice at night actually as all the towers were lit.Tip:One thing to be aware of. The lady in the office does help plan activities for you which is great but sometimes you get offered a discount for attendance of a seminar.For example we were going on the waterfall tour and they gave us a discount of $40 per person to attend a 90 min seminar by their parent company. But what happens is the 90 minutes turns into 5 hours of your time while the real estate agents try and sell you property.Do not agree to attend the seminars, its a waste of your time, just pay the extra $ and free yourself!

The hotel may not be in the middle of all the Waikiki nightlift and attractions but it's a quick cab ride away. Beautiful views of the Marina and the ocean. Rooms are apartment style and very spacious. They have kitchenettes and a small living room area as well.

We stayed in room 1543 for a week. Luxurious two bedroom apartment on the 15 floor with sweeping views across the marina, lagoon and beach. Not far from the Ala Moana shopping centre and waikiki shops. Amazing vantage point to see Friday night fireworks too. Trolley bus stops right outside. Real Italian coffee served from Ilikai coffee shop on ground floor highly recommend.

We stayed late September into October for 7 nights and we loved it. There were two adults and two children and the condo offered plenty of room for us. There were two double beds and a double pull out sofa bed. A small kitchen but it had everything we needed - full oven and cooktop, microwave, jug, coffee machine and everything else you would expect. Beach towels, cooler bag and beach chairs were also included. The location was fantastic - short walk to Hilton Hawaiian Lagoon and facilities. The restaurant in the building was very reasonable and the service was great. The rooftop bar and restaurant was also wonderful. We had a wonderful time and I would highly recommend condo #1820 - just perfect for a family holiday.

Stayed in an upgraded Luxury Ocean View room as part of the hotel. The Ilikai is a combo of privately owned rental properties and hotel rooms. Based on other reviews, the condo rental quality is specific to each unit, and as for the hotel, not all rooms have been upgraded. So if you want a room with modern amenities, you will want to spend a few extra bucks for the upgraded rooms. The "Luxury Suites" have kitchens, which was great to help keep food costs down, as food in Honolulu/Waikiki is expensive. I had a King bed, which was very comfortable. The kitchen had pretty much everything you would need to make basic meals, including a toaster and blender! Full-size fridge/freezer, more then enough space for extended stays, if necessary. The beach is about a 5-10 minute walk from the property. There is a market onsite that has a limited selection of food items, and an ABC store 3 minutes walk across the street. If you can, hit up one of the farmers markets for some amazing fresh produce.I ate a couple of meals at Cinnamon's onsite, I would highly recommend for breakfast/brunch, especially the pancakes.The hotel does charge a $15/day resort fee, which is the lowest I saw for any of the Waikiki hotels. You do get a daily beach towel, a nice one, and a beach chair, if you want it as part of the fee. Valet parking is about $30/day if you have a car. I rented a car from Advantage onsite for 2 days, which was very convenient and priced competitively.Overall, a nice property, good for couples, families, large groups, or solo.

We had booked into Suite 1235 , and were v happy to find that it was exactly like what it advertised for . We stayed here for 7 nights . The Ilikai was made famous during the days of Hawaii 50 , and has since been v well refurbished. Our suite is well appointed, with a fully equipped kitchen , a spacious lounge area , TV and a good sized lanai. facing the east , and a good pool to boot Location -wise, we have the Modern Honolulu on our east! and the Hilton Hawaiin Village on the left. My daughter and family stayed at the lagoon tower at the Hilton , and it was perfect for us to get together, as they were literally right next door. This part of Honolulu is quieter , and not as busy as Waikiki beach, but it has it's fair share of fast food and convenient stores to save us from having to eat expensively at the hotels all the time. What,s more, there are buses right in front of the hotel that would take one to any part of Waikiki! including the Diamond head crater. I would come back here anytime!

We stayed in one of the condos, overlooking the harbor. We were so pleased about everything for our stay! The valet parking attendants were friendly and fast, the lobby beautiful, many shops on site. Also a wonderful restaurant and bar, Cinnamons. The wonderful lady checking us in to our condo was so pleasant and explained and showed us everything about the place. We will definitely stay there on our next trip!

Was put in this hotel after a prior reservation got cancelled. Pleasantly surprised by the quality of the rooms at this property despite the very dated exterior (circa 1970s). What I liked ... 1. Rooms: well renovated with modern amenities. I liked that each room had its own unique wireless modem. Bed was extremely comfortable. Kitchen had all the facilities for a long stay. Bathroom had Grohe taps and shower heads. 2. Location: on the quieter side of Waikiki. Next to Hilton Hawaiian village and easy walk to Ala Moana Mall. Plenty of dining options including the famous Wailana Coffee House. Private beach. 3. Fireworks: you can view them every Friday night on this property. What I didn't like ... service. Front desk was grumpy and slow. Concierge, indifferent ... they couldn't help with directions to bus stops.

We had traded our time to stay here. What a great surprise. We have never been all that crazy about our current time share company and we're just totally blown away with the Ilikai. This time share was the Shell Vacation Club Waikiki. Never were we pushed to go to any reviews for their other properties. Whenever we entered their office the staff always stood up to warmly greet us. They were very helpful whenever we asked them for assistance.Regarding the Ilikai, Cinnamons Resturant had great food and service in a very pleasant setting. The pool was clean and the pool attendants always greeted us with a smile. In fact, EVERY staff member we saw at the resort always greeted us with a smile and a Hello. The restaurant at the top of the Ilikai, Sorrento's, was fantastic. We were there on a Friday night and viewed the fireworks display put on by the Hilton Hawaiian Village. A nice treat to end our dinner.

We stayed 13th floor room 1326. Good size good views.I rate our stay a 4 as it was very good BUT it could of been better -read on. We spent most days in the center of waikiki beach tho ,which is far from the hotel . The hotel is far away from where action is. If we were to return we would look for a hotel on waikiki beach near moana surfrider or outrigger. These hotels are on the front line of ALL the action and you can just walk directly across the road from them for All the luxury boutique shopping saving you lots on taxi fares. Hire of surfboards umbrellas chairs is cheaper in the middle as opposed to ends of waikiki beach. For eg those tractor looking pedal boats at the lagoon of hawaiian village next to the ilikai are a whopping $60 US per hour not to mention the surfboard hire costs which is dearer too. By the way if you want surfboard umbrella chair hire there are very cheap rental shops like a rental shop called quality surf board hire which was $20 US for the full day for a surfboard and they threw in a set of wheels to take it to beach for free and you could have it till 8pm not 5pm like most.We found waikiki beach and the island of oahu to be a classy holiday destination. I suggest ,if it is to high a price a hotel with ocean views then consider spending less time on vacation to compensate without compromising the quality of your stay. Your better off not wanting to leave hawaii then you are dying to return home early.This is an honest appraisal of our family stay and i hope it helps you. Enjoy

We rented a private condo for 3 weeksThe units are comfortable and clean and has everything we neededOur view was amazing over the marina The block is very quite and in a great locationBus stop right in the front of the hotelGreat that check in was self service and keylessLaundry on every floor Highly recommend

We spent a week at the Ilikai in July and it was amazing. We had a two bedroom unit facing the ocean that had recently been renovated and was absolutely beautiful. Housekeeping was great. The concierge, Dana, was also great and got us set up with very nice tours and trips. The Ilikai is perfectly located near Waikiki. My only complaint is that the kitchen could have been a little better stocked in terms of dishes, glasses and coffee mugs. But that's a small problem.

At the last minute I cancelled my reservation at the Hilton Hawaiian Village because I found out about the Illikai......this was the BEST decision ever! Amanda was very helpful and knowledgable when it came to making my reservation. Upon check in the gentleman was very pleasant. Throughout my six day stay, Patrice was always at the desk with her smile and pleasantries. Every staff I encountered was exceptional beyond belief from the moment I entered the Illikai until the moment I left. I will definitely return next year. I hope to stay back in rm 2522..... The view, comfort and cleanliness of the suite was impeccable.

I went and stayed at this hotel with two girlfriends. We got a room that had been recently renovated had a full kitchen with full-size fridge and stove and sink. It was really lovely and had a great view! It had a pool and was right in the heart of town. The bellmen were understaffed n slow but the front desk staff was great. The main bed was comfortable but the sofa bed was not so comfortable but everything else was fantastic!

We were staying at the Hilton across the road from this hotel but have passed through it a couple of times to gain access to The Modern and restaurants at the back. The hotel is very impressive to our surprise as it looks like crap from the outside. Very clean, nice staff and modern looking. Would be happy to stay here in the future

If you are looking to be right in the middle of everything in Waikiki then this is a great location. You get to enjoy all the city center has to offer with a very short walk. The Hilton Hawaiian Village is next door so all of the great shopping, beaches, fireworks, lagoon, restaurants ect are close for half the price. The condo we rented needed some maintenance repairs and better deep cleaning but was a good deal for the price and worked great for us.

We rented condo 1038 and it was just the ticket regarding views, cleanliness, comfort etc.King bed and a nice bathroom along with fully functioning kitchen made our stay ideal.Located just away from the maddening crowds of Waikiki but still with ocean and lagoon views.Also, the Lauau show at the Hilton is easily viewed from the lanai. Free show really!Local contact was responsive with new batteries for remotes.Just a short walk to Ala Moana shopping and about 15 mins leaisurly walk along the bechfront to Waikiki beach.Decent pricing, clean, comfortable and handy location.Ticks all the right boxes.

Just stayed for 4 fabulous nights here in a luxury ocean view suite. With great views over Waikiki & if you stay on a Friday night you get prime viewing of the Hilton fireworks. The staff are very welcoming & down to earth. There are several shops on site & a great restaurant..Cinnamons which does the best eggs benedict. If you are looking for accomodation with kitchen facilities & laundry then give this place a go. Will definately stay here on our return visit.

We are about to finish our stay at our condo at the Ilikai and cannot recommend this property enough. We rented a condo from Waikiki Beach Rentals and the room is exactly as described. Our room faces the lagoon and the ocean and we got to experience the Friday night fireworks at the Hilton and the luau which is on most nights. Easy access to the beach and to the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Quieter end of Waikiki but the trolleys stop out the front which is perfect. Five minutes walk to Ala Moana. Only one fault in our unit is that the beds are too soft and out of shape.

From the moment we drove up to front of this hotel we were warmly greeted by personnel.. They were all very friendly and helpful ... Did not fine a rude or unfriendly person at the hotel... Super clean . The room had a full kitchen we were able to save some money and cook meals in our room . Had a sofa and a balcony with great views . This was well worth the money . Only bad thing was the amount of money for parking per day . Also can only valet park however the people at the valet area were very speedy and attentive as well as friendly, especially the two gentlemen and lady that we dealt with during the morning shift .

My wife and two children rented a Condo from Waikiki Beach Rentals and had an very positive experience in Hawaii. The room was exactly as described and the location was second to none. I recommend renting one of the Condos with the moving walls as it allows for the children to be put to sleep in a closed off area.

We booked through Waikiki beach rentals & the description & photos where exactly what we got. Being higher up it was quiet & not disturbed by street noise (room 2032) The view of the pool, lagoon then beach were breathtaking, perfect vantage point for the HHV fireworks display on a Friday night. The bed was really comfortable, we had a futon which our teenage son slept on quite happily & being 6 foot it was perfect for him. Location wise it's the quieter side of Waikiki which suited us, only a 10 min walk to Ala Moana, all the tour & trolley buses stop right outside the front door & there are loads of eating choices available. We'd happily book here again.

Close to the large alimonoa shopping mall 5/6mins walk away. reasonable restuarants arround the streets. The hotel itself I thought the bistro downstrairs was very average.We booked 6 months ahead and asked for twin beds in apartment only to find they hadn't any available in what they call the refurbished apartments, when we got there. We had to take one that was very tired looking. The one thing I thought was very good was the hairdressing salon, very classy and very nice people..

The hotel is at one end of Wiakiki so its a fair walk to get the the Diamond head end. The beach at the Diamond Head end is nicer, although the lagoon next to Ilikai is great for kids or if you prefer to sit on nice grass under a palm tree. We had a 2 bedroom condo, room 625.The room itself was great and we really appreciated the small things that make all the difference - clean, 2 bathrooms, all the kitchen utensils you could need, free wifi, even a beach umbrella, masks & flippers. Thanks heaps Christy.The condo has 2 balconies, both with city views, although it does face the road which is fairly noisy but this would be the same for any apartments in Wiakiki facing the hwy.Ocean views would have been a bonus but for the price, I don't think I could have expected anymore.

Apartment 1728 - self contained apartment well located to the beach, marina, mall and well serviced by public transport. This apartment is near the centre of the building and the lifts (minimal noise) and you can see and hear the nightly luau on a rooftop the next hotel over. The view from the balcony is brilliant for the Friday night fireworks courtesy of the Hilton. There are small convenience stores nearby and a number of places to eat.

My family and I spent our vacation here in May 2015, and I can only describe our stay with one word " excellent" . The room was spotless and comfortable. We had a great view and the location was great ..easy walk to the restaurants and entertainment.
user_name:
Carolette S
New York City, New York

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Ilikai unit 1616. It has lagoon/ ocean view and we've used the lanai to watch the luau at the Hilton Hawaii Village. It has easy access to the lagoon, beach, ABC stores and tour buses just in front of the hotel. It is close to Alo Moana shopping centre. We booked the unit through Waikiki Beach rentals which has lower rates than other sites.

Got upgraded to luxury mountain view for my entire stay. Spacious, clean room with great cooking facilities. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. Large swimming pool and great for family as its not as crowded as the ones in the strip. Close to Ala Moana mall. Would definitely go back again next time in Hawaii.

We booked a 2 bed 2 bath Condo and it was perfect - room 426. Great facilities, everything you would want - like a home away from home. It was very hot whilst we were there and we had an aircon leak - it was fixed within 15 minutes of letting them know. The unit was very clean and tidy. Initially thought it was expensive - but it was very good value when compared to other places! Would use again!

The Ilikai Hotel is our preferred hotel in Honolulu for short stopovers and again we were very happy with the stay. We had a ocean view room with a kitchen on the high floors so the view was good. Many of the rooms have been recently refurbished and are in very good condition and quite large for an older hotel. The kitchen is a definite bonus as there is a supermarket a short walking distance away allowing for breakfast and some dinners in the room. The staff were very helpful as always and we look for ward to our next visit there.

This is the second time that we have stayed at the Ilikai. It is not the fanciest or most modern but having a condo in Waikiki saved us a ton of money on meals. We paid a little extra and got an ocean front room. It is right at the end of Waikiki and right on the boat dock which we loved to watch. We will stay there again

My husband and I stayed for 3 days and this was a great, clean, modern condo with all necessities and a full kitchen, along with a gorgeous ocean view from the balcony. My only minor complaint would be that while clean, some of the bathroom linens needed to be replaced. The property was beautiful with quick beach access and a running path, as well as a restaurant and other convenient shops, and a short 15 minute walk to a busy area with lots of shopping and restaurants. Highly recommended if in Waikiki!

Great location in Waikiki, has a nice outdoor bar/resturaunt. Rooms are in need of renovation- I'm thinking decor is Brady Bunch era. Hotel used to be very competitively priced so ok to overlook "antiquatedness" but probably could do better at current rates.

Wouldn't normally choose Honolulu for a HI vacation, but I was there on business and it was easier to stay put and have my wife join me for an extra week. Our one bedroom Condo 1639 was perfect for us. Clean, and well stocked with the basics (e.g. kitchenware to use in the small kitchen, snorkeling equipment on the deck, laundry down the hall) so it was a perfect base from which to explore the Island with our rental car. Right on the beach, with 10,000 other people, but it was still nice. I had spent the previous 2 weeks at the Hilton Waikiki Village next door and while it was much more lavish it was much more expensive - bars, restaurants, everything was more expensive. By contrast the Ilikai was more spartan (any place would be compared to the Hilton) but very well maintained and beautiful. In fact I liked my Ilikai condo much better than my lower level Hilton room; our view from the 13th floor was excellent. $20/day parking stung a bit (across the street at the Red Lobster) but I got used to it. Very pleasant walking distance to the very expensive but impressive Waikiki shopping district. A friend of mine described Waikiki as "Las Vegas on a beach", which isn't too far off. So it was good to do once, or maybe again some day, but our next trip will be to a more secluded spot, likely on one of the other islands.

We stayed in one of the privately owned condos of the Ilikai. It was facing the Hilton and the Lagoon, and we loved it. There was a kitchen (stove, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, blender) and there was a washer/dryer available on each floor. Each condo is different and depends on who owns it, so I recommend to check the floor plan of the building and look for where you want to stay. From our condo, we were able to see the Friday fireworks in the Hilton and the luau, drinking Mai Tais and Pina Coladas in our lanai (balcony). The pool is small; however, I never saw it crowded (as I have seen other pools in the area). Because it is located in the very end of Waikiki, it is a 15-20 minutes walk to Duke's statue (and central Waikiki), but the beach in front of the hotel is super nice too. There is a Safeway almost a mile away, but the shop downstairs is well stocked and with very decent prices for Hawaii. Several restaurants are in the area, and the Ala Moana shopping center is nearby. Keep in mind that condo guests do not have access to Ilikai's gym, only the pool.

This hotel is amazing. It is clean--- rooms are newly renovated and updated beautifully and the location is amazing. We had a room with a full kitchen that was fully equipped. The AC kept the room nice and cool. There was not a lot of noise although the hotel was pretty full when we were there. It is an easy walk to the beach----the beach access is right in front of the Hilton which is next door.The valet service is efficient and easy if you have a car. The staff are very friendly and accommodating.

We stayed on floor 10- room 38 which faced toward the Hilton resort and the lagoon. It was nicely appointed with a full size kitchen, massive king size bed, a lounge area, and the good thing is through booking via holiday rentals you get to pick the room you like, rather that just get checked in to whatever is available. Prices were better that way too. So you just arrive and go up to your room, dont need to check in, and you can come and go as you please. If you book this way, you dont get daily room service. On our side all the rooms with even numbers face the lagoon view, Hilton side, the odd numbers face towards the marina. which is fine I guess , but the lagoon view side is , in my opinion the way better view. On the marina side you will also get the afternoon sun blazing in on that side. Our side enjoyed morning sun, and when it gets really hot, it was in the shade. Our air con was noisy for first 2 days until we figured out how to adjust various settings,so had to sleep with ear plugs. That was the only down side, everything else suited us just fine. Loved it , and would definitely come here again. Rooms way bigger than a standard hotel room. Ilikai is a 5 minute stroll from the Ala Moana shopping centre.

We loved staying here. It's a bit off the main beach at Waikiki, a little to the north. You have to walk about 15 minutes to get to the main beach area, but it's a nice walk right along the shore. We had a view of the marina, which was great because we got the sunset rather than the sunrise. Lovely lanai, nice amenities. We would definitely stay here again.

We rented one of the owned apartments within the Ilikai hotel complex. It was at the end of the wing facing the street looking towards Waikiki. It had two bedrooms each with their own ensuite which was great. It was a little dated and shabby but very roomy and a great place to stay. The complex is near the Ala Moana end of Waikiki which we really liked because it was not as busy as right in town. It is right next to the beach, handy to the mall, handy to the buses and all in all a great place to stay. Our apartment was not serviced but there were washing machines and dryers at the end of the hallway to use. We had a couple of things needed attending to in the apartment while we were there and someone came straight away to fix them.There was plenty of eating places around and if we wanted something easy we just walked along to the food court in the mall.We swam in the sea every day as we did not find the pool refreshing as it was very warm when we were there.
user_name:
Trish S
Auckland Region, New Zealand

review_body: We just stayed in condo 1637 and everything was great. The first thing I look at is the bathroom, very clean and updated. The entire space was very comfortable. Owners gave great advice on where to eat and things to do. One thing to know, this is not a hotel room, privately owned so help from hotel staff was hit and miss.

2015 marked the 3rd or 4th time that we booked at the Ilikai. Each time we have been happy with the different units that we rented.The condo was clean and was secured with a door lock that uses a key card. This property is next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Hale Koa resorts..... A little bit away from central Waikiki and closer to Ala Moana Shopping Center, the Ilikai is still a convenient place to stay if you are not adverse to walking a few blocks.We found convenient parking at the Marina area just behind the Ilikai, usually for about $1 and hour. Most spots can be used for overnight parking, but some can not, so be careful. You need to pre-pay, so you only need to know your schedule so that you can leave before your time expires.We prefer units that have a view of the Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon so that we can watch the Friday night fireworks from the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

Totally loved this location perfect seaside view and close walk to the Hilton lagoon .... Great spot for families .... Good size kitchen . Shops in the lobby had most things we needed. Bus stop out the front on Main Street ..... Cinnamon cafe downstairs had the best red velvet pancakes ever

Our actual room was ok but also found lift and corridors very hot. We booked through booking.com and found out it was someone's private condo so we had no help from reception. Unfortunately my daughter left her phone in a taxi from airport. .the concierge would not let us even use hotel phone for such an emergency.The pool is dated and no ambience. You can however walk into the Modern Hotel pool which is way nicer..The actual room was fine clean and comfortable.If you are only going to the top restaurant for a drink don't expect a view...these tables are reserved for people who dine there..it is however worth going up just to look out the window in the entrance of the restaurant.

Very comfortable modern hotel.My suit was on the 23rd floor, had a great view of the city and mountains, was very spacious, had a little kitchen in it (well equipped), and a king-size bed.The corridors are not air conditioned, so it was VERY hot as soon as I left the room, and the elevators are the worst.Valet parking for 28$ a day is a bit much if you ask me, but to be honest it's the same on all the hotels on Waikiki.

Went to the top restaurant and bar for a sunset drink. Years ago it was called "the top of the I" ((now it it called Sarentos)) food was average but we went for the view and drinks! Amazing views! Very romantic! Would go again. Great wine selection.

The Illikai fills a niche that will meet the needs for some people and will fall very short for others. It's not a fancy or trendy spot, but it is clean, comfortable and an affordable option in an ok location. Nothing really stands out about the property though and it doesn't excel in any one area. Obviously, there are areas where it could improve, but overall, its a solid property. I stayed in a Luxury Mountain View room which featured a sitting area and a full kitchen. While I would hardly call it mountain viewing, the room was a nice size and I appreciated having a kitchen, although I imagine many will not care about that feature. The room also featured a balcony which was slightly marred by the fact that it also had a big exhaust unit on it (from the AC?) which blew air on me if I got in its half. Additionally, given the layout of the hotel and me being in an 01 room, from my balcony I could see into many other rooms on my floor (and they could see into my room). Didn't really appreciate that. There are some other minor critiques such as the placement of the toilet right in front of the shower entrance or the size of the TV given the distance from the bed. The theme here is solid, but nothing special. The location is good - just a short walk to the main beach areas and also to the Ala Moana shopping. Not super close to either one, but another area where the hotel is good, but not great.In general, the service was pretty good, but check in was extraordinarily slow. I had to wait over 10 minutes while they checked in the two people in front of me, because they explain all the little extra fees and whatnot. $28 for parking, $15 resort fee (for basically nothing) etc. While I ordinarily ding any property with those types of fees, unfortunately, this is par for the course in Hawaii. Another weak spot was bell service as it just seems understaffed. For a property with this many rooms to have 1 person on duty for large stretches of the day seems a bit odd.The pool area is small and very plain - it's definitely not an attraction. The hotels nearby had much more exciting designs and layouts. There are shops, restaurants and convenience stores on the main level which many took advantage of.Ultimately, its a value game. The Illikai is fairly priced for what it is - a solid property, but certainly not to be confused with a luxury or 4 or 5 star locale.

Very nice hotel but to be honest a little tatty especially as its nieghbour is the SheratonIt has events at the hotel and can book tours if needed.I booked a surfing course and my brother hired a mustang to say he had driven one.Very close to the beach...The hotel is very overlooked though as you look out of your balcony you look straight into the Sheraton balcony

Very nice, clean grounds, beautiful garden area. Great location, walking distance to beach, mall or numerous restaurants. Trolley or city bus picks up directly in front of the hotel. Exact change required. Two dollars for trolley, 2.50 for bus, one way. It is an older hotel, so the air is a little stale in the hallways and elevators and is even hot at times. But other than that everything was nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a car rental place in the lobby which was also very convenient. It's a very busy area!

This hotel was so lovely , has been around a long time but the rooms are remodelled and have everything you need. The staff are very friendly , helpful and efficient. Views are great on the beach/sunset side. Everything you need in one place with just a small walk along the beachfront to the action of Waikiki , this hotel was where they filmed the original Hawaii 50 and looks over the marina where Gilligans Island, SS Minnow took off.

The room at the Ilikai was very spacious and clean. The location was great as there are a lot of restaurants nearby, you are close to shopping, and the beach is just a hop away. Just outside the resort by the lagoon they have fireworks on Fridays.

Was gonna give 2128 5 out of 5 till I saw the condo next door which was very recently refurbished. We loved the view and the space and the full kitchen. Laundry room around the corner. Great location in quieter end of Waikiki. Hotel was nice. Pool never too busy. We all enjoyed the lagoon as well for swimming as well as the sea. As mentioned, the bathroom needs a refurbish with a walk in shower like next door. Nobody really has a bath these days do they ? Would def rent a condo here again.

recently had four nights at ilikai hotel ,paid the extra money to stay in the ocean view sunset rooms,all good, rooms excellent ,well furnished with kitchenette ,very comfortablelast two years we stayed at trump international,with low aussi dollar couldn't afford there tariffs this year,this was a great alternate,rooms were excellent,however they let themselves down in concierge bell desk area,non existent as far as we were concerned,on arrival no one to help carry bags same when leaving,i asked a dis interested man sitting at the counter one day for directions ,he was too busy counting money to be of service.On arrival at 3.00pm room not ready and the fitness centre is a disgrace,dirty,no weights,equipment not working and out of date,third world,in 2015 a first class gym is a must,all this balanced by a clean fresh rooms,no airconditioning in hallways,great location to everything we wanted

We had apartment 2023 . It was very clean, reasonable sized and had a full kitchen including freezer and access to washing machine. We looked out over the street but being on the 20 th floor that was fine not to bad traffic noise really good sized balcony with chairs and table the room has a good queen sized bed and a double pill out couch which is very comfortable. Suitable for one adult ( the pull out not two) the hotel is great it's really central to the buses and easy but hot walk to Waikiki. It has a good deep swimming pool and a abc shop in the complex. Would really recommend this hotel and this apartment for a small family or couple and a child.

Families,and couples who love the ability to have a kitchen where you can cook a meal and still have all the hotel facilities will love this Hotel. The Hotel is at the quiet end of Waikiki Beach and has amazing views over the Hilton Lagoon and towards the beach. We saved so much money as we were a family of five and could easily fit into the condo as it had a pull out sofa bed for our teenage son. The fireworks were right outside making the 4th of July even easier with the kids.

We came in for pre-post Transpac Race accommodations and this was our second stay at the Ilikai. We booked two condos as the location is ideal for getting to and from the docks and the Hawaii and Waikiki Yacht Clubs. The booking arrangements clear and easy. The condos were clean and checking in and out was not a problem. One condo was far better condition than the other. The lesser one lacked a good bed and did not have black-out curtains. It pays to book ahead as rates significantly increase the closer to the event.

This is our second stay and it has not disappointed. Fab condo, close to everything. Looks over the Hilton and the beach. Would recommend to those wishing to have an apartment experience rather than a hotel experience. Shall be back in the near future

We stayed in the condos #1318 (13th floor) and was absolutely awesome. The views were to die for and we had full view of the Hilton Hawaiian Village show that was every night including the fireworks on Friday. Our condo was 2 bedrooms, separate lounge and kitchen will an long balcony. Air conditioning throughout and main bedroom had a jacuzzi and the room was very large. Recommend staying. Booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals. Close to Ala Moana Shopping centre and buses to Waikiki main street

First, I would like to Thank Mike the owner of this condo for providing such an amazing home away from home experience. I would also like to Thank Paul who greeted us when we arrived and gave us a tour of the condo and tips on what to do while in Oahu. From the booking to our arrival was top notch from my point of view. I really loved the Captain Cook app that we received prior to our arrival. This condo #1944 was absolutely perfect, it was very clean and well maintained and very comfortable for my family of 4. It looks just as you see in the pictures from the kitchen, furniture, floors, master suit, guest bedroom suit to the views - so no surprises. My family rented a car so the designated onsite parking spot was an added bonus, so no parking or valet expenses. The master has amazing views of the harbor, lagoon and ocean, and the guest bedroom with two twins and a lanai worked perfectly for my two adult daughters. The ac units work great and both ensuite bathrooms are fully upgraded. The kitchen has everything you need if you wanted to prepare meals. There’s beach accessories available for use. My best moments in this condo was spent out on the lanai, every night I fell asleep out there just listing to the waves.This location is close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. There was trolley stop as well as tour bus stops at the front door of the Ilikai which was very convenient for getting around Waikiki. I would most definitely choose to stay again in this condo should I return to Oahu. The condo and views are spectacular, I would highly recommended this condo.

Stayed two weeks in Jan 2015, three of use, we loved it, Stay in Hawaii every year , first time here but great choice , it has everything you need and we will be booking again same room and everything. Lots rooms and great kitchen, even had beach chairs nice bonus!

We stayed at the Ilikai in a privately rented condo on the 17th Floor at a fraction of the cost of a hotel nearby. The condo itself was gorgeous with everything we could possibly need and after having spent a few nights in a hotel it was wonderful to have a kettle and a proper cup of tea! The views were to die for, location was ideal and couldn't fault the hotel itself. It had all of the style and grandeur of the 70's when it was built and I could just imagine some of the world famous stars it played host to strolling through the lobby. Would highly recommend.

The location was good and real close to restaurants, shopping and the beach. The mall is approximately one mile away. If you book a modern room, there is no dishwasher. Our room was clean and the hotel was remarkable quiet despite its size. The terraces are large and with an ocean front room, you can view the nightly entertainment at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort. There was only one washer and one dryer on our floor (23rd). Customer service was good. The $15 resort fee seemed worthless as there were hardly any beach chairs available to rent. I suggest renting a car however for a compact car rental is approx. $100/day. Parking is $28/day at hotel but there is public parking behind the hotel in Lot A and the cost is $1/hr. The beach is very rocky behind the Illikai hotel but becomes less rocky when walking towards the Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort. The sand is also very rough and course-- not soft sand you may find on other beaches. The trolley rides are good to take around the Waikiki area; especially the Pink line. Expect crowds at the beach and lagoon. If you can rent a car, I would suggest doing so. There are far better beaches in the North and Eastern Shore areas and the views are spectacular! Everything is costly; even fast food restaurants so be prepared to spends far more in food and entertainment than you ever would on the main land. One last tip unrelated to hotel, if you plan to visit Pearl Harbor, get there when it opens. Slots for entry fill very quickly.
user_name:
Cindee F
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed at The Ilikai Hotel in July 2015. We booked through a private owner and stayed in a Condo. Views were amazing and the room we had was great. We are a family of 4 with 2 teenagers. The Hotel is in a great location close to Ala Mona Shopping Centre, about a 10min walk. Beach is on your doorstep, short walk into the main strip pf Waikiki. Bus stops outside the hotel. I would stay here again on our next trip to Honolulu.

VERY CLEAN! awesome view. Especially on Friday's for firework night. Close to the beach and next to the Lagoon. Our family looked forward to coming to the condo after full days of fun. Clean kitchen with all amenities necessary to cook. Perfect for my 5yr and 8yr old boys. Would come again.

Privately rented a condo at the Ilikai in Waikiki Beach. This hotel/condo building was part of the regional Hawaii 50 TV series. The unit 2022 was in top shape. All appliances and kitchen needs were met. The bathroom was somewhat updated with a nice, big walk in shower. It is a perfect space for a couple. I would think it a bit crowded for any more than that. Our balcony overlooked the Hilton lagoon, which was such a soothing and bucolic view to awake to each morning.For that particular condo, I would recommend adding additional seating on the balcony.Softer, cushy chairs would be a lot more comfortable than the two straight back chairs that are around the small table. Also, for some reason the TV remote did not work in the unit, which was annoying.The building is centrally located so you can walk to everything. It also has valet parking (for a hefty price) and internal shops for your convenience. The small grocery store sells milk, bread eggs and other staples. The pool is an easy walk and never crowded.All in all, it was a wonderful stay in unit 2022 in the Ilikai

We loved staying at the Ilikai Hotel this July! We had a premium ocean view luxury room. The room was absolutely beautiful. If you book through the hotel, you have the option of their remodeled rooms on the top floors. If you book through a private owner, it will depend if they have remodeled their unit. Our unit was stunning. Loved the white light color scheme and the kitchen and bathroom was great. We were in room 2414 and our view was amazing. Saw the ocean and lagoon. Saw the fireworks Friday night. The Ilikai is at the beginning of Waikiki so it's less crowded and quieter. You may need to walk a bit along the beach for the best beach spot but it's okay because you come back to a quiet beautiful hotel.take a taxi to Whole Foods and you can cook and save on food. Make sure to have cash so you can tip as needed. Take a circle island tour from the hotel and see the rest of the island!

Remember Hawaii Five-O, the original? This IS the hotel where Steve McGarrett spent a lot of time chasing bad guys. It is a great hotel and condo/VRBO. We stayed in 912 for 6 months and it was very nice. View of the Hilton lagoon and ocean beyond. Watched whales from the lanai. Granite kitchen with palm tree décor and fully furnished, king size bed and comfy couch and chair. Updated bathroom. Very lovely for short term or long term. The restaurant, Sorentos, is 5 star in our opinion. Outside elevator is amazing!

Great location and so easy to see all of the sights, a must to stay. Great views of the ocean and friendly staff happy hour goes for at least 4 hours  Some the best eating houses are close by, try the Red Lobster

The hotel is at the beginning of Waikiki beach and right across from the lagoon. Overall average and the rooms are vastly outdated. The lobby is clean and modern, but once you get tot the rooms it is a different story. The hallways were dark and dirty. They also were oppressively hot! The rooms were reasonably clean,but the furniture had cigarette burns and the beds uncomfortable. Overall a decent stay for shopping and dining, but it seemed that the better places were further down the beach.

We stayed at the Ilikai for 10 nights and it was a great place to stay. The pool was fabulous and so close to the beach. We rented a car from across the street and explored the North Shore too. Close to restaurants and shops and everything you need to relax. Get a room with a Lagoon view and you can see fireworks on Friday nights and if you are lucky, you can see the Hilton's luau every night too.

The Ilikai Hotel is one of the older hotels on Waikiki and the facade might give that away. We stayed at one of the rooms in the condo side. The rooms were spacious and clean with a full kitchen. Internet service looks to have been upgraded or nobody is up surfing the web on what to do at 4am in the morning when your body hasn't adjusted to Hawaii time. We liked staying at the Ilikai because it is on the quieter side of Waikiki. It's a nice 15min walk to the main strip and just under 10min to the Ala Moana shopping center and Ala Moana beach.There is a Hula show every Friday and Sunday. It's also a short walk over to the Hawaiian Hilton lagoon to watch the Friday night fireworks.There are two restaurants at the Ilikai. Cinnamon's restaurant/bar is serves up some great drinks and delicious food (guava pancakes!) and Serento's at the top of the Ilikai offers an amazing panorama of the area. Morimotto's (as in Iron Chef Morimotto) restaurant is next door and should definitely not be missed.If you want a bit more luxury accommodations, you can book a boutique style room at the Aqua Ilikai Luxury Suite side of the hotel. If you're looking to get away from the crazy beach crowds and screaming kids, give the Ilikai a look.

I've stayed here a number of times. The rooms are different as they include apartments as part of the hotel rental program so you may get a very different unit each time. All have kitchens or partial kitchens. Many have views of the ocean though some have a view of other buildings but in higher floors you can see the mountains. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel and all tours will also pick you up in front. It's only a short walk to the Ala Moana Mall, theFood Pantry for groceries or the main shopping area of Waikiki. It is a quieter area than in the midst of Waikiki but still very convenient. In the building is a grill, coffee/sandwich shop, and a small market. There are a couple of ABC stores within a block and plenty of restaurants from the high end Morimotos to McDonalds.

We had a huge, refurbished Ocean View room on the 23rdnd floor. Our room was an 'even number' (the even numbers in rooms 2310 to about 2330 look out to the ocean. The views were beautiful, with the Hilton Resort on the left. Especially good to watch the Friday night fireworks which go off in front of the Hilton Lagoon at 7pm from your large balcony.The housekeeping service was spotless. The suite had a fully equipped kitchen which was wonderful. There is a laundry on each level with washing machine and dryer. The cost was USD2.50 per load. We paid the USD15 daily amenity fee which included unlimited wi-fi, daily newspaper, in room movies (which you chose from a kiosk in reception). I was amazed to learn that when the hotel was built on the mid 60's, it was the first high-rise resort hotel in Hawaii and the tallest condo in the world! I would definitely stay here again.

Sixth time in Hawaii, first time at the Ilikai. Our family stayed in two penthouses on the 26th floor, which were large and both very different. #2613 has a phenomenal balcony that overlooks the marina below and out over the pacific ocean. The balcony is the one shown at the start of the old Hawaii 5-0 show. #2603 was the other room and although it was better appointed, the balcony was pretty much non-existent.The Ilikai is in easy walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping center, which is undergoing large reconstruction to make it even better. The Ilikai is also only moments from the heart of Waikiki, so is in the perfect location for families.The small store downstairs is handy, however very expensive, so I would recommend going to either one of the ABC stores which are two minutes walk away in either direction once you exit the building on to the main road.I would highly recommend the Ilikai, predominantly for location. The building is a bit dated, however so are many of the larger buildings in Waikiki.

We stayed at this hotel for 6 days and we had a good time. The room is spacious enough for a family for four, and having a kitchen is a plus. Swimming pool is ok, not too crowded during our stay, and the beach is also a walking distance, although Waikiki strip is a few blocks away, we would still going back to this place. And the staff are very helpful and polite too.

The room was nice and catered for our family. We were two adults and one child.The bed is big enough to accommodate the three of us, if one wants to do that. In our case we made use of the sofa bed as well, which was very comfortable for our child. The balcony is very spacious. The kitchen is fully equipped with all the necessities, we even had a blender which we made good use of.In terms of location, the hotel is on the first stop if you are taking the airport shuttle to get to Waikiki. The bus stop to go to the other parts of Waikiki is just outside the hotel. It is also close to the Hilton lagoon, just a few minutes walk, and therefore easy to go and walk the firework on Friday nights. Options of eating out is limited to the hotel, McDonald, Indian restaurant and a few other places. You have to take the pink line (trolley bus) to get to the much lively part of Waikiki, and also the best part of Waikiki beach. Having said that it is easily to go to Ala Moana Centre (shopping centre) from Illikai, as it is possible to walk (around 15 mins walking...at least for me..). You can also take the pink like to go, and that is only one stop away.Usually the room is well stocked with towels and amenities, but the downside of staying at Illikai was the room is cleaned every 3 or 4 days. Considering the amount charged per day, the room should be cleaned much more frequently.We had to run around to get additional toiletries every 3 days.There is also a grocery shop on the premises, this was much appreciated to stock up on any necessities. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.We had free wifi the entire stay, and we loved that.We enjoyed our 7 days stay at Illikai, with the exception of the 3-4 day cleaning service. We believe this should be reviewed as it is a gret feeling to walk into your room and your bed is made and your bathroom is well stocked, without to run around to get soap!!! Such a little thing can make a big difference to someone's life and dream holiday to Hawaii.

Our group of five stayed in an apartment. The location was quite convenient and the room was tidy but the service was lacking. When we used the laundry dryer on our floor one night, we discovered that it was accepting our money but not working properly. We asked the the night time concierge for assistance but he rudely told us that he would not return any money and that we should ring the number listed in the laundry room. I understand that these things happen.. machines break down.. however, I was surprised at how cold and unhelpful this staff member was. This person could have assisted in a number of ways (eg. offer to chase up the repair of the machine, inform us of other laundry facilities, etc) instead of assuming we were after a refund and turning us away. It is disappointing that a hotel of this price and caliber offers such poor attitude towards customer service. would not recommend.

We absolutely loved staying at this hotel. The room was huge and lovely furnished. Beautiful views and lovely staff. We also appreciated having the kitchen for making morning coffee and reheating leftovers.

loved the llikai we had a self contained room with kitchen it was a really good size and had been refurbished recently everything was in A1 condition. make sure you opt for ocean view room we were on the 24th floor facing ocean and the lagoon. friday nights they have a fireworks show we had a prime position to watch it.really easy walk to ala moana shopping centre and easy walk to the main shopping in Waikiki.

Stayed here for a couple of days pre-cruise. They assured me our 2BD suite had twins in one room. I called to confirm b/c that wasn't on the website. Got there, two queens. Doesn't work for teenage boys. Asked them to give us a free cot since it was their mistake and they did.Desk staff is nice enough but incredibly slow. Have to check out towels with cards, but then they didn't even count when we returned them.The pool area is not very nice. We accidentally went to the pool next door and were summarily kicked out. When we found our own pool it was COLD and without a view.Nice location close to Waikiki. Can see the HHV fireworks from the deck on Friday nights. Cinnamon's downstairs is good for bfx.

Been here now for 10 days 4 to go and its been a great place the partial view is beautiful . from my balcony I get to see A Luau for free as they perform every day .The room size is perfect with the kitchen and the price was right for this cozy place.My only downer was Sarentos resteraunt on the top floor with breathtaking viewsThe food just didn't fill the bill.Average food at best.

My family stayed in a rented condo on the 12th floor through Waikiki Beach rentals in June 2015. The price was right. It was close to Ala Moana and Waikiki.The check was easy (all thru a very detailed email). The unit was clean, spacious and had a great view. We watched the Friday night fireworks from our balcony. We rented a car for 2 days/1 night and paid $28 for valet parking with unlimited in-and-out privileges. We tipped the valet each time because they were so pleasant. I would definitely stay here again. If you are looking for a 5-star hotel, this is not the place for you but you're not paying 5-star rate either.

Through VRBO we rented a condo here for two weeks. The condo was very clean with a full kitchen, the bathroom was renovated with a nice big shower. We could watch the beautiful sunsets in the evening from our Lanai. The location is excellent at the quiet side of Waikiki close to Ala Moana Mall and restaurants. The shuttle trolley stops right outside as does the the tour buses. It is a short walk to the busy part of Waikiki for more shopping and restaurants. The beach and lagoon are close. We found the pool a good size and always could find chairs. It was a nice convenience to have the beach towels, mats and chairs supplied.We would definitely stay here again.

I know many people had written great review about this place but i feel inclined to write it again. We spent 10 days at Ilikai Suite. We rent it from the TripAdvisor's vacation rental and got it a pretty deal. We had the fireworks and ocean view. Highly recommonded. Not only you got to see the fireworks every Friday night but you get free viewing when Hilton has its dance show at its building top. I think there is a show once every other days at the very least. We almost rent a car and we were glad we did't.
