The whole island runs on an award winning bus system and you can get to almost all attraction using the bus system with the stops just outside of the hotel's door. You can download apps ( i can't remember they are call at the moment) and it even tells you when the buses will arrive and what the connecting buses will be. It's $2.5 for adult and $1 (?) for kids 6 and up. There is no need to pay $15 to get to most of the attractions. If you only are going to stay at a place briefly, you can even use the transfer paper strips to return to go somewhere else. Just make sure you ask the driver for it. As for food, there is a full size kitchen. Yes, grocesary was expensive. $3 for 6 eggs at the ABC store. But there are a couple of larger supermaket near by walking distance. But if you are willing to cook, you are still saving tons of money eating in. Either way, the options are yours. Beach is across the street (more like a bridge). Not the finest sand but it's a beach. You do have to travel to the east or north side of the island for the finner sand. Overall, we love the place and would stay here again if we ever come back.
user_name:
Munchkin823
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: We have just returned from 10 nights at the Ilikai. We booked apartment #2021 through Waikiki Beach Rentals and in our experience it was very easy and great value for money. Not having to do a hotel check in and having a code to access the room (instead of a key) was fantastic.The room, although called a 1 bedroom apartment, was really a bigger hotel room but with a great kitchen. It was clean, well equipped and in a good location. There are 6 lifts, so unlike other hotels I have stayed in getting in and out was not an issue. I read reviews about the pool, but we never used it - why use a pool when there is a lagoon and beach at your doorstep? That said, it looked the same size as every other hotel pool in Waikiki and there were always pool chairs available if we did want to go there.Back to the room - the kitchen was modern and practical with a big fridge. The bathroom was fine and we had beach towels and bathroom towels. There was also a lot of storage space for your toiletries.Room wi-fi was brilliant.The king size bed was massive and the kids (7yo and 2.5yo) slept on the futon. The wardrobe was also massive with lots of hanging space and clothes hangers.The balcony was great and had an awesome 'egg chair' that we all loved lying in and watching the traffic go by.Each floor has a laundry that you can use for $2.50 per load.We used the valet parking - even though I read it was more expensive - as for the daily price you could come and go as much as you wanted and they were quick and it was easy.The location was great - beach and lagoon at your doorstep and close to shops, food, etc.If there is anything missing in the apartment I would say that I would have liked a window that we could leave open at night for fresh air, as I was not comfortable leaving the sliding door open. The only other thing we would have liked was a clothes airer for the beach towels and clothes that I did not want to out in the dryer.The cinammons restaurant downstairs was very good and we went there multiple times for breakfast and dinner.From the Ilikai it was an easy walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and into the busier part of Waikiki and the Pink Trolley ($2 fair each trip) was directly out the front of the hotel. The abc diagonally across from the Ilikai stocked the best selection of fresh fruit and vegetables than I saw in most other abcs.Next time we come back I will definitely stay here again.

My wife and I rented a condo here in June 2015 and stayed for 17 nights on the 20th floor. Great views out to sea and towards Diamond Head and Waikiki. Excellent location, 10 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping center or a 20 minute walk to the middle of Waikiki. Bus and trolley stop right outside the door. We have visited Waikiki many times over the years but from now on will always stay here as the value for money and room size is so much better than hotels in the middle of Waikiki. Advantage of a full size kitchen and appliances.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for a few nights before moving onto the big Island in August 2014 (it's taken me far too long to write this review!) staff were really helpful after our really long flight, for us the location was excellent just a short walk along to the main Waikiki beach and the price was great. I would recommend wholeheartedly.

My wife and I rented a condo at the ilikai for a week in June. The building itself was quite nice but felt like it was a bit separated from the action of Waikiki. It isn't a long walk but my wife got tired of it pretty quickly. If you rent a private condo be prepared to have no food in the kitchen, not even salt and pepper. It is a great value accommodation though at less than 200 per night, it's hard to beat that with a great ocean view and nice bed and living room area.

Located on the western end of the Waikiki beach strip, Ilikai is an iconic condo offering fantastic views of either the lagoon and ocean or views over the Marina and ocean.Yes, the building was built in the early 60's but has been refurbished. The large open foyer is inviting and the staff are very friendly. We stayed in room 2006 and could not ask for more. Fully equipped kitchen and a balcony to watch the sunset after a day at the beach with a cold beer or glass of wine.There may well be better accommodation hotels in the area but i would doubt that you can beat the price.Would happily recommend Ilikai to anyone and will surely stay there again

The Ilikai Hotel is conviniently situated near the lagoon and Waikiki beach. We would go to the beach in the mornings and shop in Ala Moana Mall in the afternoon as it was just a short 5 min walk. At the corner of the hotel is an ABC store where you can buy food, water, and whatever you need. Kalakaua St. where a lot of restaurants and shops are is just a leisurely 10 minute walk. What I love about this hotel is it has its own kitchen and there are washing machines and dryers in each floor. We saved alot by eating breakfast in our room.

We stayed here while on a week of government travel. We were pleasantly surprised by the room. It was very large with a complete kitchen, living area and balcony. View was incredible although location was not in the middle of the activity. It was around the marina however, there was a walkway to access the other hotels and ocean front. We are returning this month but will be staying at w hotel closer to beach area.

We stayed at one of the privately rented rooms at the Ilikai and we loved it. It was located nice and close to the beach, shopping and restaurants and our room enjoyed a magnificent view over the lagoon and beach area. We loved the nightly traditional Hawaiian entertainment downstairs and also loved the fact that the fireworks were also close by. The rooms were spacious and well-equipped. The Ilikai offered everything that we were looking for at a reasonable price. Highly recommend.

I chose to stay at the Ilikai because when air crew this is where we stayed when it was the IN place to do so, and I am so glad I did again so many years later!Unfortunately we only had the one night, prior to a cruise, otherwise I would have happily based myself here for a couple of weeks. The room/apartment was wonderful, with every convenience required to live as a home. Excellent cooking facilities and utensils, I would prefer to be able to purchase fresh produce for some home cooking, I am not particularly keen on American restaurant food in general, but their supermarket fresh options are superb, so having the ability to home cook in Hawaii would suit us . Not to mention the savings to both wallet & waist!!I read some reviews which say the rooms are a bit dated. This was definitely not the case with our room, everything in it seemed to be new, so perhaps a request for an updated room would be the way to go for a more extended stay.The Ilikai is very well located, a 5 min walk to the AloMoana shopping centre, on the beach, closest hotel practically to the airport and the Cruise harbour, and yet almost in the heart of ALL the action. I would most definitely choose to stay again should I return to Honolulu.

We like the location of The Ilikai----within walking distance to the heart of Waikiki, but not in the midst of all crowds and traffic. Also, it's on the beach with great views of the ocean. The staff was efficient, professional with the warm Aloha spirit.We stayed in one of the recently renovated rooms. The decor was very attractive----marble countertops in kitchen and bath, dark wood doors, comfortable furniture, etc.We will definitely stay at the Ilikai again.

I am a former Honolulu resident who remembers the Ilikai Hotel during its glamour days. Those days are now long gone but this is a nonetheless charming place to stay for the right person. The property, as mentioned by others, is dated but still retains an old-fashioned, breezy, open-air feel. If you long for a gorgeous modern pool, this property is not for you (but the somewhat oddly attached "Modern" might be-- their pool is lovely). The pool here is small and filled with kids and surrounded by cinder blocks painted blue. But what the heck are you doing going to the POOL in HAWAII?? The property is an easy 15 minute walk to Ala Moana Beach Park (and Magic Island, an additional 5 minutes walk)-- the best swimming beach on Oahu. If you must go to Waikiki Beach, the "Lagoon" and Duke Kahanamoku Beach are about 10 minutes away walking down the incline in the back. Although I love renting individual properties (which you can do since there is a condo component to the hotel), I decided not to take any chances and we stayed in the luxury suites-- a 'sunset beach view' room. It was spectacular. From our 22nd floor perch, we could see the boat marina and the turquoise and blue waters of the Pacific beyond from every point in the room. There is a sizeable lanai with a table and 2 chairs for evening cocktails and morning coffee and Hawaiian sweetbread before a morning swim. The room looked newly refurbished and was clean and well kept up by friendly hotel maids. The mattress was fine and the air conditioning was ample, important in frequently hot and humid Hawaii. The kitchen was well-equipped, and although we enjoyed several restaurant splurges, we also used it for re-heating left-overs and making coffee and breakfast. The full size refrigerator held our water, sodas, and beer. There were plenty of utensils, cups, glasses, plates, and pots/pans for 2 people. The hotel also included a tiny dishwashing soap bottle, paper towels, and 2 large bottles of water. Also, a box of gourmet cookies! While the room would've been great without any further amenities or services, we also took advantage of free beach towels (that you can exchange for fresh ones at any time), a rental car service inside the lobby that turned out to be the cheapest of any that we looked at, as well as a coupon for 1 free DVD rental. We didn't use beach chairs but those were free too. The wi-fi was also free and was fast and reliable. A local newspaper is delivered daily. There is a standard over-priced hotel shop but ABC discount store is just across the street. Added to that, there is a conch blowing and torch lighting ceremony nightly and fireworks on Friday night. No room service but you can buy all manner of Asian and local goodies at Ala Moana up the street, bring them home, and heat in the microwave (and eat on the lanai with an ocean view!) so who needs room service? There is also a coffee shop type place with an ocean view, which we didn't go to and a fancy Italian restaurant on the top of the hotel. Although we didn't eat there, we did have a sunset mai-tai on our last night. The view is spectacular. There is also a nice coffee/cappuccino place for the caffeine addicted. In short, this was the best valued and most beautiful room for the money that we've ever stayed in in Hawaii. Definitely a 5 star room and experience!

We stayed a week at the Ilikai Aqua 5-31 thru 6-6 2015. Myself (55) my wife (49) my daughter (18) and son (16). We had a king size bed, fold out couch and a "roll-a-way" bed in our room. Although a bit cramped together we enjoyed our stay. One thing that you need with teens is unlimited, in room wi-fi which is included with the 'hospitality fee' of $15.00 a day. The fee also covered gym use (which I will cover later) free beach towels and beach chair use, SO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THIS, don't get hosed renting these things at some distant beach. The room had a full kitchen and basic utensils so we went to Wal-mart and bought groceries to make breakfast and lunches. Food in Hawai'i is very expensive so every meal we ate in room saved us 40-50 dollars. The bathroom was a single basin, shower only deal with granite counters and lots of storage. We live in so. California where water is treated like a commodity, so having a full pressure shower was nice, but remember no matter what the forecast says it's ALWAYS raining some where on Oahu, all that water comes at the expense of being rained out for a while vacationing. The room it self was decent enough, a little worn but totally functional.  You have to remember the Ilikai was built as apartments originally, so you have to make some concessions to luxury. The pool is spartan, just a rounded rectangle with lounge chairs, the gym is large with 20 year old Paramount machines, 3 elliptical trainers (two out of order), two exercise bikes, one rowing cardio trainer with 3 mounted TV's. The gym is unattended and was basically completely empty when I worked out at 7 am every morning. We did not eat on the property restaurants so I have no idea about the quality of service or food in them. The front desk was accommodating and efficient. The Ilikai is the building Jack Lord was photographed on in the introduction of the old TV series "Hawai'i 5-0" that is celebrating it's 50 anniversary, so the front desk had Hawai'i 5-0 playing 24/7 on a TV behind the front desk, watching while waiting in line they obviously used the hotel for every single "location" shot as you will recognize tons of areas around the hotel!The lagoon right out front is a great place for renting paddle boards and pedal boats, very calm and relaxing. There is a board walk that extends toward Waikiki that is about 1/2 mile long, this is great morning walk, if you are so inclined. DO NOT rent anything from the beach rental place at the end of the board walk or use this beach! It has very sharp rocks and learning to paddle board over these things was like trying to stand up on a surf board over a bed of nails!Over all a great experience I would recommend the Ilikai for families on a budget wanting a good location and not worry about rowdy party animals around you all the time.

Room was clean and tidy,bed was very comfortable 5 oversized feather pillows. Very good water pressure in the shower. Kitchen has full compliment of pots pans and utensils. Coffee pot and mugs were dirty so I just bought it in lobby shop.

One of the best hotels I've stayed at! Literally outside your back door is the Pacific Ocean and Waikiki beach. Only down fall I seen was no room service. Which means no food delivered to your room. But the service otherwise was great!! Our room was awesome too!

Me and my husband and a friend, the 3 of us stayed at the ilikai condo section for a week. The room is very roomy even with the 3 of us. I like the fact that it's got a kitchen. Even though we didn't really cook, but we did bought some milk and cereals. The view we have its an ocean view, overlooking the lagoon. Very convenient to go the the beach, but the sand at the lagoon is very rough. I would rather drive elsewhere. Parking is valet only, no self parking. Which means you need to tip the driver every time you wanna use your car. The valet is very quick and friendly regardlessly. Overall a above average place to stay and reasonable price compare to many other hotels in Waikiki.

I arrived in the evening just in time to catch dinner at Cinnamons. Good restaurant with good drinks. All staff were very friendly. I liked that it was so close to the beach and the lagoon. Nice amenities. The room itself was dated. I got a room with a kitchen due to my long stay. There were very few plates, pots and pans etc. The room was quiet. I would recommend this hotel. It is in a good location. At the edge of Waikiki, close to Ala Moana park and center. Lots of things within walking distance and right on the bus line.

Spent a week at Ilikai in a condo rental. All facilities provided. The unit is renovated and tastefully furnished. Everything you could possibly want. I didn't cook but the kitchen facilities appear to be very good. My unit was on the ala moana bvld side and the morning sun may be an issue if you are not an early riser.Shop in the foyer and ABC store next door. Restaurants across the road. Buses are on the door step. It's an easy walk to Ala Moana centre and Waikiki beach.Would definitely recommend.

The hotel is older but our room had been redecorated and was in excellent condition (I think it was room 2129? - defintely on the 21st floor with a veiw over the marina and along the coast towards Pearl Harbour. Great location and at a good price. Would stay again.

We spent a week here. Full kitchen. Very clean. Nice big balcony. We were on the Oceanside. We saw the Hawaiian Hilton luau each night. Got to see the Friday night fireworks from our balcony. Everything had been renovated. Great Hotel. Love the open lobby.

This is a great place to stay. We had a corner sweet with 2 balconies. View of the beach, city and marina. High up floors advised for view. Friendly hotel staff. Daily room cleaning. Small kitchen to do your own thing. Close to shopping and restaurants. We saw 2 fireworks shows while we were there probably a wedding but lots of fun.

This was our first trip to Honolulu, and fortunately we had friends who had been there several times and who recommended the Ilikai. We stayed in a condo/suite that had a furnished kitchenette. Very nice room with a large screen TV and free internet. The location is excellent, with transit of all types at the front of the Hotel. We brought a few groceries from a nearby store and ate more than one breakfast on our balcony, which looked onto the Marina where the old Gilligan's Island tour actually was filmed when it left harbor. The hotel's lobby area is quite lovely and the restaurant on the ground floor was excellent, with very good live music. Laundry facilities are provided (at $2.50 per load), but beware that they are public. We found a bit of sand in one of the washers we used, for instance. Each condo/suite seems to be independently owned and is furnished differently. One common thread seems to be the air conditioners are slightly underpowered, but we were never uncomfortable. We'd gladly stay at the Ilikai again.

I recently spent a week in waikiki and stayed at one of the condos at the Ilikai (unit 2020). If you're looking for luxury, this is NOT the place for you. That being said ... it is one of the most affordable stays in Honolulu, and for the price, it's pretty impressive. LOCATION The location is AMAZING. It's located on the outter end of the resort strip near Hilton Hawaiian village. The beach in this area is not crowded at all. We were able to get chairs every day during our stay at various times during the day. You're also conveniently located next to Hilton Hawaiian Village, so you have quick access to their restaurants, bars, shops and activities, without the inflated cost of staying there! The lagoon right outside of the Ilikai is a great treat ... best of both worlds (pool and ocean). Never crowded, safe and relaxing. RESTAURANTS The restaurant was great for lunch (cinnamons is the name i believe?). However, our dinner experience was just odd. The service was off, and the menu was just strange. The food was okay, but again, I'd stick to this place for breakfast and lunch only. That being said, you are only steps away from Hilton Hawaiian Village and can easily take advantage of their restaurants and bars. SHOP The convenient store in the lobby is just that --- very convenient! Plenty of things to pick up so that you can prepare food in your condo, and a variety of souvenirs that were priced significantly lower than some of the bigger resort shops.

We stayed in room 1830 which was described as renovated...bathroom was still pretty average.A little annoying that only coffee was provided - not everyone that stays in Hawaii is from the USA and would have pretty much killed for a cup of tea in the morning!! Knew that if I called housekeeping tea could be sent up but had no money left for the inevitable tip as it was our last night before flying home.Room was spacious and nice and clean with a large balcony with good views. Pool is average compared to both Hotels next door, the Modern and Hilton Grand Vacations. I feel I should comment on our check-in experience...Doreen is well past her prime and should be retired - we had to repeat ourselves a number of times and she really didnt seem aware of what was going on to be honest. Cafe across the road - by the name of Harbour Pub and Pizza - right in front of marina offers a great brekkie from 7am - rather than eating at Ilikai. We did have dinner at the restaurant on the 18th floor - Sarento's - which has an amazing view of the city. Waiter was lovely, food average, view was awesome. Worth going there just to have a drink at the bar anyway.Would probably stay somewhere else next time as Ilikai was nothing special.

The hotel grounds were fabulous. Everything was clean and inviting- from the beautiful waterfalls in the main entrance to the relaxing, open air, dining area and ‘patio’ seating that offers beautiful marina views. Every few nights (2x a week, I think?) there is a small traditional band and dance (Hula) show in the main patio and on Fridays you can see the fireworks from the Hilton Hawaiian next door.The pool area was standard- nothing to write home about, but clean and quiet and well kept with comfortable lounge chairs. My only wish is that they had a bar in the pool area or something more exciting. The beach is not quite *right* at the hotel but only a minute or two walk. This beach access, however, is "on" the Hilton Hawaiian property and while public to everyone, it seemed that the Hilton Hawaiian was more ‘family’ oriented so the beach area was overrun with small children. Also, this area was super rocky and the water much colder than the main Waikiki Beach area, so I did not enjoy the beach at this end of the island quite as much. I found it disappointing, but it did not necessarily take away anything from my vacation, but if your main concern during your stay is the beach, this is not the place for you.The casual dining restaurant on premise was mediocre but suitable. Their drinks were good at the bar and convenient. Service was always great, and it was nice for breakfast but I wish they would put a restaurant with more variety and/or more nightlife in. It just felt…lacking. The fancy restaurant at the top of the hotel is a must see as the views are phenomenal, but either just go for drinks (which are superb) or be prepared for the large expense.It is also worth noting that this hotel is located in the Marina area of the island, so this is not in downtown Waikiki where all the "main" action is. It's about 20 minutes to walk to Waikiki beach and shopping. However, we also found it far quieter with less crowds and bustle than the main Waikiki Beach and this suited us just fine. We stayed in a private condo at the Ilikai on the 7th floor (I want to say #707 but I have since lost the paperwork to be sure). For a 'condo' the room was not much bigger than a typical hotel room, although it did have a nice little kitchette area with full fridge, stove, dishes etc. and this made a big difference for us. The lovely lanai had a marina view which offered perfect viewings of the splendid Hawaiian sunsets every night. The beds and linens were great, although we had 3 of us staying in the room and found that it was not really adequate for that many people- definitely more of a 2-person condo if you don't want to feel cramped. They do have a futon but it was so soft we never ended up using it and instead 2 people just had to share a bed. That said, it was a small price to pay for the kitchen amenities, ocean view, and good prices we got. Also, the door lock system worked perfectly and we loved not needing to keep track of room keys. The booking process was super easy and convenient and I would recommend booking through Waikiki Beach Rentals again since overall, the price of the condo was a really good value for what we got.

The Ilikai hotel/condo building could not be in a better location. We loved walking around the marina and easy stroll to the Ala Moana shopping center that has so many great shops and restaurants. We also walked over to the beautiful Hilton property next door every morning because the Ilikai coffee shop opened quite late. There's a pretty little outdoor cafe but we only dined there once w/so many other choices. There's also a premier restaurant on top with the best views in Honolulu. The ABC store across the street offers anything you need and there's also a good shop in the hotel but their prices were a lot higher than ABC.The pool is great! We had a quick dip everyday after coming back from the beach.nice they provide clean towels. We parked in the lot above Red Lobster and $20/day was fair with in/out.Specific review of #813. Very nice lanai - the view of the mountains and Ala Moana activity was great. Beds were adequate comfort. Bathroom & kitchen had nice touches and very clean. The reason we'd not return to this specific condo ... there are only mini fridges so we had to buy ice everyday. One of them was not very cold. The sofa is more like a futon and so uncomfortable we hated sitting on it. But the biggest problem is the old fashioned in-window air conditioner. It barely cools the space and makes so much noise ... super annoying at night. We were lucky we had such trade winds that this trip to Honolulu was not so hot as usual as the air does not work.The door lock system worked perfectly - just as instructed. The booking process was super easy and convenient so I will use Waikiki Beach Rentals again and recommend. The price of the condo was a really good value.Overall this was a great vacation. Will come back to Ilikai again - sooner than later.

We thought we were getting a good condo. But to our surprise, we got a great condo!Our first morning, it was hard to get off the lanai's! The unit was on a lower floor, but this did not impede any pleasure we got throughout our entire stay!Furnishings, amenities, and features were comfortable and the location was ideal!We have many more family members traveling to Hawaii this year from Europe, and we will recommend this unit to everyone without a moments hesitation. A definite repeat performance guaranteed!

We stayed at the Ilikai 30 years ago so decided to revisit this hotel. As we entered we felt we had gone back in time. I had forgotten how spacious and open the lobby areas were. It is very inviting. We were given one of the refurbished rooms. We were the first to use this room so there were some initial teething problems. All concerns raised were dealt with quickly although it was a little frustrating. It's only a short stroll to the ocean. The lagoon is very safe, especially for children. The Ala Moana Mall is within walking distance. It's not far from the Waikiki Shopping Plaza. However it lacks the vibrancy of this area.

I spent the past weekend in Waikiki, and stayed at one of the Ilikai Luxury suites on the 25th floor! I had an awesome experience! Located just at the edge of Waikiki, so quieter than most Waikiki properties. I had a beautiful suite, with the most amazing view of the Honolulu Harbor, Lagoon, and Ocean. Full kitchen, great King size bed, and nice furniture! Found the service impeccable! Everyone smiling, courteous, and friendly! Will go there again in a heartbeat!

Just got back from a wonderful stay at the ilikai. Was travelling with 4 other girls and we all shared a studio condo. Even with 5 of us in one condo there was plenty of space and never felt cramped. The view of the marina below and ocean is beautiful from the large lanai. The pool staff are very nice and the building is very well maintained and clean. Can't wait to return!

We stayed for three nights at the Ilikai at the end of our vacation on Oahu. Overall, I think it's a good value for the area. We booked via the hotel's website with a AAA discount--this is important because some people end up booking condos at the Ilikai, and have expressed disappointment with the condos. Our hotel room on the 24th floor was lovely--updated furnishings, including a king bed, sitting area, and a kitchenette (stove, microwave, fridge, toaster, and coffeemaker and dishes/silverware for 4 people plus some basic pots & utensils). It was quiet--we never heard other people on our floor and the street noise wasn't too bad (kind of unavoidable in a city). The only real downside was that we were expecting a nice pool--the one at this hotel is very small. Technically the hotel isn't on Waikiki Beach (that's actually a couple of beaches down the way to the left if you're facing the ocean). Hotel guests can access a small man-made lagoon, and then the beach starts (again, to the left of the lagoon if you're facing the ocean). This part of the beach was somewhat crowded and the sand was pretty thin (we tried to put up a sunshade that has stakes, and about 2 inches below the sand was rock/concrete). Your better bet for the beach is to walk over to Ala Moana Beach Park, which is on the other side of the marina (to the right if you're facing the ocean). There you'll find a small protected area that's great for swimming (some rocks are piled up to create a wave-break so that the swimming area is calm), and further down, there is an even larger beach area.

This hotel was about the same or lower in price as many other Waikiki hotels; however, here wehad 650 sf and a kitchen. Lobby is beautiful but not overly large. Suite (ours was not yet refurbished) was very clean and nicely furnished. The kitchen needed updating but was still veryacceptable. Great bed, large lanai. Mountain view is actually street view with mountains betweenthe buildings. Ala Moana is very noisy, but thick windows kept out the noise at night.Staff very friendly. Friday night we ate at the outdoor restaurant (moderate prices) and were treated to a fabulous Hawaiian show of music, singing, hula dancing followed by the fireworks from Hilton Hawaiian Village. Disadvantage is a bit of a walk to Waikiki Beach 5 mins. or so (hotel is on a marina and next to Hilton's lagoon.) Advantage is not coping with the crowds. The hotel has a more sedate clientele.

This is a beautiful hotel in a great location. Pool is awesome and surroundings are the best! Great music and views of Waikiki, fireworks, surfers, rainbows, and morning surfers! What can i say other than Waikiki is the most beautiful place to visit. My husband says it is paradise times two. :)

We stayed on the 8 th floor overlooking the Ala Moana Blvd. The apartment was good. Well equipped comfy beds. The view from the balcony although onto the mountainside and street was actually nice. The main issue was the noise at night into the early hours. Also from above and along the corridor. One other tiny niggle was that we were not able to rent DVDs I was told by the rather moody lady at the desk it was for hotel residents only thought that was what I was but could not be bothered to speak to her further. Nice stay easy access to beach.

Having a wonderful time in Condo 1436 Booked through VRBO - absolutely everything we need here even down to beach towels and chairs - if you want to self cater the kitchen is fully stocked with appliances, pots and pans etc, plenty of linen and bed is really comfy. The extent of our self catering is having afternoon cocktails - there are wine glasses, champagne glasses, beer glasses etc. The view is fantastic overlooking the Duke Kahanamoku lagoon, the Hilton Hawaiian Village and their luau each night - looking forward to the fireworks on Friday night as we have a prime spot to watch them. The owner of the condo was great to deal with and everything is exactly as advised. It was so good to jump in a cab at the airport and come straight to the unit, open the door and the holiday began - no hotel checkin, having to wait if your room not ready - keyless entry is great - you can leave everything in the unit and head to the beach without the worry of where to leave money, key, phone etc its been a good experience - highly recommend. Tip take binoculars so you can see the luau dancing better.

We needed a place to stay while visiting family in Hawaii with a kitchen. This is an older property with a "homey" vintage feeling. We had a studio condo with a well equipped kitchen. Perfect for our needs, since we did a good deal of cooking and entertaining family. It is a good central location for walking. The Hilton Hawaiian village is right next door providing a nice place to walk in the evenings. Friday entertainment was nice at the hotel too including fireworks. We had a very positive experience and stayed for one month. Only down side is valet parking is $30.00 a day so be prepared for that. We would stay there again-

We booked a Mountain View Luxury room through the hotel reservations number. It was recently updated and had a terrific fully equipped kitchen. The room was really nice. I stayed at this hotel many times as a child and I was happy to go back again if only for a couple of nights.The check in process was great - very friendly staff and we were there a few hours before scheduled check in time.. no problem at all. Check out was just as easy.Our room was up on the 21st floor and had a large balcony with city and mountain views. The King bed was reasonably comfortable as was the pull out sofa for my son. Two big free bottles of water and some tasty Honolulu cookie co cookies were set out for us upon arrival. Also Wifi is excellent as the box is right in the room.Towels and beach chairs are available from the front desk and you are just a short walk to the beach/lagoon area. We sat in the lagoon area on the Friday night to watch the fireworks at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. There's also a decent shrimp truck beside the lagoon to grab a bite to eat.We ate at Cinnamons which was ok fare and good friendly service. The pool area was clean but can get busy enough that there's not much seating. The beach is close though and there's decent snorkeling along the reef in front of the Hilton next door.We got this room for under $200 a night and for the location, modern room and full kitchen it was worth every penny. I would stay again.

I was given a room with a stinky smell - must be from previous people cooking fish - The room was also not very cleaned, from the toilet to the kitchen counters as well as the standing mirror, they look very filthy. The walls also need repair and repaint. I called the front desk to ask for some kind of fragrance to spray the room - they said all their employees went home already - I was really surprised because I've stayed at many hotels before but this has never been the case. I asked to change room because there was no way we can relax in this smelly room, so the front desk gal asked me to come get the key for another room she said is available. This room is smaller and on a lower level but at least it does not have the fishy smell so I took it - though I felt I have been paying too much for this kind of "luxury suites" and service. In the morning when we left our hotel room, we asked the cleaning lady for a "do not disturb" sign - she gladly gave it to us and asked if we need anything change in the room, we said we don't need anything. We put the sign on our door and head out. When we returned, the sign was still there but someone has entered our room and organized our stuff. We asked the front desk why this has happened and they said the sign does not belong to their hotel! (but it was given to us by the cleaning lady!!!) We asked them for their "do not disturb" sign but they said they don't have it! We also asked for 2 clean sheets and they said they don't have any available either!! This is only our second night here - this hotel has so far gave us somewhat a bad experience. I will update more after our trip but I don't think I will ever book this hotel again!!! Not for this price!

We booked room 626 through VBRO. The booking was quite easy and is separate to the hotel, although the hotel staff were very accommodating with generic requests (tourism stuff, valet parking etc.)The room had a good view of the lagoon and ocean. Only downside was the work going on at ground level, but that cant be helped.The location is quite good, just to the west of the main Waikiki area, but only a 20min walk to Dukes. Everything is within a short distance, or you can catch the bus or trolley.The room met our requirements well. Plenty of room to spread out, a balcony with a view (with some swimming gear supplied), access to the pool, with cooking and food storage facilities, and washing and drying just down the hall. The room was very neat and tidy, and overall was great value for money (would've cost easily twice as much 200yds down the road).We will stay here again!

Awesome Room, newly renovated. All amenities are provided. Location is close to everything, but not congested from the tourist traffic. Daily parking above Red Lobster (across the bridge) worked out conveniently.... $20 @ day.I'd definitely stay here again!

We stayed at the Ilikai Hotel for a week in the wing that overlooks the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Hilton lagoon. The room had a great view, of the lagoon, the ocean and the hotel pool. Our lanai (balcony) got some sun though not too much and was perfect for breakfast and a coffee before the days activities and then an afternoon drink as the sun went down. The Ilikai is one of the oldest properties at Waikiki, though has been tastefully refurbished and still manages to hold its charm. There is an ABC shop for basic supplies close by in either direction, maybe a five minute walk at best and there is a shop in the hotel with a good range of souvenirs and basics including food, snacks and alcohol.Our room had a microwave, full sized fridge and a full stove with an oven, so you could go wild with cooking if you wanted to. There are lots of places nearby to eat out if you wish of course and the beach is a short stroll out the back door. There's wifi in the room, though at times it was painfully slow, probably due to the load? Lots of people trying to use it at once? Having said that, there didn't appear to be lots of people staying in the week we were there.We'll be back.

We stayed in a privately owned condo for 9 nights and have a ball. Staff were friendly. Location is ideal and everyone knows where it is. Pool was great for kids and we walked between it and the lagoon and the beach - couldn't have wanted for anything better. Would recommend without hesitation. Great wifi. Coffee at Aroma Café was the best. Little shop was handy but there was two trusty ABCs within 2 mins walk either side of hotel

We returned yesterday after 6 nights at the Ilikai staying in a condo. It was my first visit to Waikiki and I was a bit surprised by the hustle and bustle of the place. We loved the Ilikai as it's on the quiet end of the beach and close to the Ala Moana Mall which my son's loved. We ate breakfast at Cinnamon's downstairs and didn't get the rush and up sell of the restaurants further up the beach either. My only gripe I guess was that even though my 15 and 11 year old loved the pool this building has a lot of elderly residents and the pool rules were over policed. A big thanks to Wayne who organised a stretch limo for my son and husbands birthday trip to the airport. My son never stopped smiling. Maholo.
user_name:
Allena D
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: It's easy to get anywhere from this hotel. Rental cars and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is well maintained and sunset is announced every night. Fireworks every Friday night. Loved it

My husband and I have just returned from Hawaii and while in Waikiki we stayed at the Ilikai suites. They are very comfortable, clean and have all essential things you need for a comfortable stay. It is about a 20 minute beach walk to the main shops and restaurants in Waikiki. It is out of the business of the touristy area, but there are plenty of places to go to within walking distance!

Nice old building on the quiet end of Waikiki.Most of the apartments are private condos for rent, most have 3 day minimum, but there are some that you can rent for only one day. Also a ~200 room hotel (rooms are the same as the one bedroom condos, but decorated all the same).

stayed here for 12 nights, room 2332 from the 16th march. fantastic room, spotlessly clean. towels, toiletries and coffee replenished daily. pool was lovely, we always were able to find a sun lounger. we had a spectacular view from our balcony and was a prime spot for watching the firework displays. food and drinks are quite expensive. this is our first visit to this amazing island and hopefully not our last. we loved it and the hospitality was second to none.

We desperately needed to get away to be romantic and have a lot of elegance and be spoiled to pieces. 1128 is completely newly remodeled and it and its sister unit 1928 are the two nicest units in the building -- no doubt about it -- we peaked in at them all! These two are drop dead gorgeous with every upscale amenity because the owner is a travel writer and knew what her guests were looking for and put in European plus beds and towels and bedding, Italian leather furniture, all new appliances that are full sized and they greet you with food and all the paper goods so you don't have to arrive and go out and shop. It's relaxing and cozy -- the colors soothe and the decor is so upscale and gorgeous that you never want to leave. We have already booked for the same time next year. I am not only a princess; in real life I am a countess and I demand the best and got it here! The view is amazing and we watched the fireworks from our lanai and fell in love all over again!

Probably the place that allowed Honolulu to become one of my favor or ite places on earth....front desk super friendly . The layout was amazing the rental was unique and we'll maintained...the view off of the balcony was to die for ( overlooking the marina and the ocean epic sunsets!!!).....try having a night time snooze out there ......wowza....the location was great (near the hilton) the pool was private...Bring sunblock I blistered (with a 30 on.) A great place indubidably...there is so much more.....however you'll have to see for yourself

We stayed in a luxury ocean view room for our first holiday in Hawaii (9 nights). Rooms on floors 23-25 are newly renovated so are more expensive but are totally worth the extra $ as they are stunning! Warning, don't ask for a lagoon view or you may end up looking at the back of the Hilton! Thankfully the hotel staff were very helpful and let us switch rooms when we weren't happy with our original lagoon view. Request marina / sunset views if you want to sit on your balcony (or lay in bed) and watch the waves roll in. This place is perfectly located right next to Hilton Hawaiian village (lots of shops, restaurants etc), it has direct beach / lagoon access and you can practically see the Ala Moana (big shopping centre) from the front of the hotel. We had a hire car so we could explore the whole island but many times just walked in to "town" as it's less than 1 mile away (and saved the hassle of parking) walking either via the road or along the beachfront. Facilities are a little older than other higher priced waterfront hotels, but it all adds to the charm of this iconic hotel... We loved it and would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend this hotel to those who want to stay somewhere less busy/noisy but still very central. PS - the cafe downstairs makes a great latte for those real coffee drinkers :)

We stayed in a mountain view room run by the hotel portion of the property. All in all this was a pretty good hotel. Pros: lobby area very nice- wifi worked excellent- most staff were friendly- free dvd machine in lobby had a great selection- towels and chairs for beach at front desk- location was excellent. Walking distance to beach and most amenities while being just outside of the chaotic Waikiki core- valet was amazingly quick and always frendly and helpful-very large lanai- room felt very roomy even with 4 peopleCons:- Maid service was a bit spotty- kitchen amenities were very sparse- room was very dated, worn out and bit dirty. Walls dirty, fride smelly, etc. fixtures old. ( We were however in a suite that has not been updated yet, for more money updated options were available)- not enough seating space at pool, if you didn't get there early in the day you were usually out of luck finding a chair. (Pool was nice though and staff friendly)- found one cockroach in the room mid stay-parking is quite expensive on top of a resort fee-AC very noisy

We rented a private condo through VBRO number 1836. It was modern, updated and can sleep 6 comfortably. We had an ocean view and view of the luau that the hotel next door puts on. The beach right in front of the hotel next door is wonderful. It is public but not that busy and there aren't any rocks unlike Waikiki beach. This area is way less busy then downtown Waikiki and I am so happy we chose it. We saw sea turtles the first day we swam there and we were only waist deep in the water. It was fantastic. This hotel is part hotel part private condos. The condos are cheaper then the hotels, just be sure to get an updated one. You can choose a marina view which shows the sunset but you really don't see much of the ocean as the marina is huge, or an ocean/lagoon view or a city view which is also nice as you have a view of palm tree lined streets but it's noisier on that side with all the traffic. I watched surfers from our condo and there is a lovely lagoon to swim in as well as the beach.

We stayed in Ilikai #1944. This home was absolutely perfect for our short stay in Honolulu. It is a very nicely appointed (high-end) unit with a comfortable layout for our family of 4. It looks just as you see in the images - no surprises. It was very clean and well maintained. We really appreciated the wonderful service provided by the property managers and would not hesitate to rent again. The location is close to beach at the north end of the Waikiki area, right next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, loads of restaurants, shops and an easy walk to Ala Moana. Having the parking spot was great. The master bedroom has lovely views of the harbor and ocean, and the guest bedroom with two twins worked perfectly for our two young kids. The ac units work great and both ensuite bathrooms are fully upgraded (our kids loved the Toto toilets). It was quite windy one of the days/nights and the noise level was very reasonable. The sliding doors are a bit sticky to lock and unlock, but that was not bad for us since I knew the kids couldn't open them on their own! The only negative was that the kitchen lacked basics of Salt, Sugar, Oil and any spices. Not a big deal, but it would be nice not to have to buy those items (I sure hope they keep them for the next guest since we used so little of them). There are beach toys and chairs available as well. Overall a great property with fabulous views. We would highly recommend one particular restaurant: Chai's Waikiki just a block and a half down Ala Moana Blvd. Great staff and some of the best food for a casual meal. Also, if you have not eaten at Marukame Udon on Kuhio Ave, that is also a must. But get there early since there is always a line (they open at 11 for lunch).

What a great place to stay and so convenient! Special thanks to DANA at concierge who helped us plan the whole trip once we arrived. Wonderful suggestions, much better rates then we could get on our own and so knowledgable about Hawaii. Saved us alot of time! Thank YOU! we will be back. :)

Stayed in unit 2014 at the IIikai for 2 weeks in Feb 2015 my family of 2 adults 3 children coming from Australia. I booked the apartment through Waikiki Beach rentals and saved a lot of $. The whole booking experience was seamless. The room was spacious clean and well equipped with the most beautiful views of the lagoon and ocean. We sat on the large Lanai and watched the whales in the mornings just playing. The hotel is a beautiful original hotel. Very friendly staff who are more than happy to help even though we booked privately. Reggie at the tours/info desk was fantastic and gave us so much advice on the best tours suited to our family as well as places to eat etc. The pool is nice although the rules are a bit strict. The restaurant down stairs was nice especially on Friday nights with Hawaiian Ukulele and Hula dancers there. The café has the best coffee I found but closed a little early. Other than these we enjoyed our stay at the Illikai and highly recommend using Waikiki Beach rentals to save some $.

This is a fairly handy position along Waikiki. It is very close to the lagoon pool and beach.From here you can walk all the way into the main Waikiki centre, shops and beach.There are as small number of diners and restaurants nearby and the bus stop into Waikiki Central is right outside the hotel.We had a larger room for 4 adults with 2x king beds, as we were traveling with family.The hotel is a little old like everything in Hawaii. Maybe too much money goes to wars and not infrastructure!

I rented a suite at the iliaki through VRBO. The unit was amazing. The suite was well equipped with a full kitchen, kind size bed and full bathroom.Had a view of the marina which was amazing day and night.The ilikai is a 15 minutes walk to downtown waikiki. You can walk though the beach.The Ilikai has a nice pool, a restaurant, beautiful lobby, coffee shop and a little store fully equipped for grocery shopping.It is a great location. Beautiful park on the beach after the marina.Thoroughly enjoyed it.

Staying at the Ilikai was a different Waikiki experience than we have had before in Waikiki, Our condo (2016) was very comfortable and outfitted with all the necessities. There was a large flat screen TV, a kitchen complete with even a rice cooker, a large balcony with comfortable chairs for enjoying the view of the Hilton Hawaiian Village lagoon and the ocean beyond, very comfortable beds and was spic and span. If you hate heights, as does my husband, do not stay up on the 20th floor. Also, one word of caution....if you stay on the side facing the Hilton Hawaiian Village, be prepared for lots of noise. All day long there were shrieks from kids in the large pool across the way. And there were lots of those annoying back-up beeps from vans and trucks across the way. One good thing about that side and our condo though is that you can watch the Hawaiian Village Luau entertainment nearly every night right from the balcony. Even better, however, is the free Hawaiian show right there in the courtyard of the Ilikai most nights. Fairly new is their restaurant overlooking the yacht harbor. It is a branch of an extremely popular restaurant elsewhere on the island, Cinnamons. Sitting outside in that warm balmy air enjoying cocktails and delicious reasonably priced food was wonderful. During Happy Hour drinks are just under $5, and there are many appetizers for $5 and $6. Also, from the Ilikai one can watch the Friday evening fireworks at the Hawaiian Village. The enormous Ala Moana Shopping Center with several good restaurants is within walking distance, and there are other good places to eat nearby. One huge plus is a large ABC store across the street that has not only souvenirs but a large grocery selection with fresh fruits and vegies, liquor, meats, milk and most any necessity you might have forgotten to bring. And for trips further than walking distance, Oahu has a fantastic bus system with a bus stop right in front of the Ilikai. Seniors ride anywhere for just $1. In fact, one Saturday we took the bus up to the college on the side of Diamond Head for their terrific Farmers Market. For just $1 we could take the 45 minute ride up there and use the transfer to get back. What a bargain!If we were to stay at the Ilikai again, we would definitely stay on the sunset side of the hotel where the views are beautiful, and it isn't noisy.

I had a first at this hotel, I was told couldn't shift the louge chairs at the pool into the shade. Per management the chairs are not to be moved, really ?? Nice rooms but they are NOT accommodating to their guests.

My mother and I stayed in one of the newly renovated apartments on the 24th floor for 2weeks in Feb/March.The room/apartment had one large King bed a and a pull down sofa bed with plenty of room for both, in fact I slept on the sofa and it remained down the whole time without any real space problem.The apartment had a new full size kitchen with stone work tops an a large fridge. The bathroom was also clean and new. The apartment was serviced, cleaned and fresh towels put out everyday.... and the staff were lovely.Free WIFI and newspapers were also a bonus. Any problems or inquiries were dealt with promptly by the hotel staff and I always found them helpful and polite.I would definitely stay here again, location is great and the pool is smallish but perfectly adequate.

We booked a privately-owned studio condo (#441) at the Ilikai Hotel through Alohana Realty. The booking process was seamless. Gavin at Alohana communicates well and is really responsive. They ask you what what code number you want to use, so you can use a birthday or something easy to remember. Upon arrival you punch in the code to get into the room. No check in. Could not be easier.The room, though not luxurious, was well furnished and clean and really good value. The kitchen had been recently renovated with granite counters and nice solid wood cabinets. I chose this particular unit because it had two twin beds and a pull-out sofa, so my mom, my sister and I could each have our own bed. The beds, even the pull out, were comfortable,We had a nice 4th-floor view of the marina, and as a bonus we got a view from our balcony of the hula and Hawaiian music performance that the Ilikai put on that Friday night.I would definitely book this room again. Booking a privately-owned unit as opposed to an Ilikai-hotel-owned unit is usually substantially cheaper, but there is a downside. Each privately-owned unit is furnished by the owner, so each is different, whereas the hotel units are pretty uniformly furnished. Also, you pay in advance so unless your dates are firm, you risk losing all or part of your payment, depending on the policy of the booking agent or the owner.

My family and i stayed here for 2 weeks in a private 2 bedroom. The room was good and big enough for 5 of us. The location was great a 5 min walk to the ala moana shopping center and a 10 min walk down to the main street of hotels and restaurants. Had the duke lagoon on our door step which was great for my little one plus had the beach and swimming pool right there as well. Was a great central location and had everything we needed for a family. Would definitely stay there again such a beautiful locatiob.

Location was reasonable. It is only a 10min walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre and about a 15 min walk into Waikiki. The pool is........ well it is a concrete pool, don't expect a resort style pool. For me I would have preferred more of a resort hotel that had a nice pool where you could order a drink and something to eat and spend a few hours, this is not possible here. It is not on the beach although from some of the photos I saw prior to going I expected it be all but beach front. Our apartment looked out to other buildings and was not that pleasant. We would not stay here again. It just depends on what you want out of your holiday and accommodation, for us it was disappointing. As I said if we were to go back I would stay else where, even the Hilton Hawaiian next door! It looked very touristy but it also looked a lot more like what you would expect from a Hawaiian Resort. Oh, and we found it quite noisy, as I said we looked out to the Hilton Hawaiian and there was a lot of traffic noise which was surprising as it was not a main road.

Stayed in a privately owned condo on the street side, #425. When we first walked in we were greeted with a musty smell and the drapes and furniture were dingy looking. However the majority of the condo had been renovated and it was clean and the musty smell went away. Next time I would definitely get a room facing the water. This street is extremely noisy. There is constant traffic and the buses are loud. Was awoken to some rowdy passerbys in the middle of the night. The location is great. Beach is a short walk away, lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance and bus and trolley stops are right out front. We dealt with 3 different concierges and one was not that helpful. Once we told her we weren't interested in a Pearl Harbor tour she lost interest. She never told us there was a shuttle available to Pearl Harbor, found that out from a different concierge. Never used the pool, it didn't look that inviting, we always went to the beach instead. The elevators are super fast which is good because the Ilikai has over 1000 rooms. Would stay again, but never facing the street.

4 th time recently and love this place. Large rooms, free wifi, great staff and amenties. The view of the lagoon next door is fantastic and Friday night fireworks gives you a front row view. And the coffee shop downstairs makes the best cup of coffee in all of hawaii one of the main reasons why I stay at the Ilikai.

Good location and hotel itself fine, but the noise on the street side is excruciating, so we're taking off points. How Honolulu allows the loud motorcycles in huge groups revving their souped up engines is beyond us !

Stayed here for 12 days recently excellent apartment (23rd floor) great kitchen, fabulous views ideal location, short walk to Waikiki beach, and to Alamoana shopping Mall.Bus stop at door ($1.50 per ride) also Waikiki Trolley stops here.My thanks to Richelle and Don at the front desk for all there assistance, they certainly exceeded my expectations of customer service.

We went with our kids and had a great stay and plenty of room. It was nice to have a clean comfortable place and the ability to cook food. Good location, parking was a little expensive, but it was nice to do vallet parking.

The ocean views range from spectacular to so-so if you lean out the balcony. Overall the rooms are quite nice with great amenities. A functional kitchen was an unexpected and nice touch. Rooms are clean and recently updated. The courtyard is outstanding! Prices are what is expected for Waikiki beach. Tip for the traveler -- grab your coffee and to-go breakfast across the street ($6-$8) and eat in the outdoor dining area behind this hotel. The dining areas adjacent to the hotel are not owned by the hotel and is quite expensive, breakfast ~$25.

Great location! Watch sunsets from the lanai every night! Walk to lagoon & Waikiki beach in minutes. Close to restaurants & mall. Walked to Aquarium and Zoo with two year old in ½ hour. Didn't need a car, bus only $2.50 if tired of walking. Pool was okay, a little small for size of building. The building is dated as well built 50 years ago, first large hotel built in Waikiki. Some units advertised as one bedroom which was what we stayed in. The unit wasn't a one bedroom it was a unit with an accordion door which did not close at the end and had a 1 foot gap at top so allowed sound and light into room when we put our two year old to sleep. Door wasn't much more than a privacy screen. We lucked out though daughter slept well as long as we were quiet and didn't have a light on…must have been the balmy night air. So if you are looking for an actual true one bedroom don’t stay here. However, it did work out for us in the end so we would stay again, mainly because of the location.

This review is for the renovated luxury mountain view room. We were on the 23rd floor and even had a slight view of the ocean. We could also see Hilton's luau from our balcony which was fun for the kids. The kitchen was nicely stocked. The room was very pretty and had recently been renovated. I also liked how the balcony was very securely locked so my 3-yr-old couldn't unlock it. The room also has a pull out couch so great for the kids.If you are staying in Waikiki, I would definitely recommend this hotel. Location was great, Cinnamon's had delicious breakfast (Kalua pork benedict, red velvet pancakes, and guava chiffon pancakes - yum!).We didn't use the pool as we went to various beaches on Oahu but it looked nice. If you think you are going to spend a lot of time at the pool, Hilton might be more of your thing.

The limo drops you off at the portico. You enter the lobby and you will be thrilled with the spectacular view of the Pacific Ocean and the Ala Waii Boat Harbour. Choose a room with an ocean view or the mountain/city view. A short walk brings you to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. To start buy a perfumed Hawaiian Lei. Then Hawaiian shirts and shorts. A muummuu for the ladies. Feel the Hawaiian ohana everywhere. The Aloha Tower and Marketplace is a mile to the west and Waikiki Beach a mile to the east. Walk or take the bus. The air is filled with wonderful scents as you pass the picturesque scenery, flowers everywhere and swaying Palm Trees. Pay $5 and a Hawaiian boy will clime a tree and deliver a fresh coconut. A sharp chop with an axe and you have a delicious drink and meal. aloha

We booked this property through VRBO and it is everything as described. It is so nice to be located within walking distance of popular beaches and attractions without the hubbub of resort chaos! The hotel is half rentals, half guests and even though we are not officially 'guests', the staff is very accommodating and helpful. We are in a unit on the 21 st floor. We have a million dollar view of the marinas below, the channel to the ocean, Ala Moana surf break and best of all, the sunsets are incredible! The unit is well appointed and kept up to high standards. Just right for my husband and me. We had cable TV and super fast WiFi. Two restaurants and a small coffee place is on site.We spent the afternoon at the pool. It is not one of the huge tropical lagoons like the pools next door, but it was clean, towels are provided, showers and restrooms are on site. Loungers are in high demand....we had to sit for awhile before two were available. Grocery store is three blocks away, Food Pantry. 'Good' prices if there is such a thing in this town!

I spent 2 weeks at the Ilikai 10 days in unit 1902, and 4 days in 1130. The property is well placed at the west end of Waikiki - close enough to enjoy Waikiki, but far enough to get out of the chaos if you want. The absolute best part of Waikiki beach is a short walk - in front of the Hilton and Hale Koa hotels. Unit 1902 has an amazing view of the marina and a west facing orientation so there are beautiful sunset views. Unit 1130 has a view of the ocean and Hilton lagoon if you sit towards the edge of the lanai. Both were comfortable and clean.

Love this location and the great views of the lagoon and ocean. Having a kitchen was great, as it saved us from eating out every meal. The room is so nice, newly remodeled and very luxurious. The corridors were very nice and clean. Hotel has the nostalgic feel to it without looking old. Very clean and low key atmosphere - not pretentious like other more modern hotels. Love it.

We originally booked in a different hotel but cancelled after one night as it was awful (Aqua Bamboo Waikiki) and booked here last minute because we had no other choice. It ended up being such a blessing! Right from the start the reception was so nice, room was perfect and way bigger than we expected (we also got an awesome rate for a late booking, so definitely ask for a cheaper rate if you book last minute!). Room service constantly checked on us to see if we needed anything and everyone was so nice! 10/10 would stay again.

The building itself is a 3 star. Location is good. Unit 1026 is another story. I stayed 3 days with a friend and found carpets were sticky and stained with dirt etc and had to wear socks when walking around. The walls are dirty, furniture is stained and hide a bed is some old delapitated worn out bed. Mold all over shower curtains in the one bathroom I was using. I would not recommend this one at all. Just sayin. .

Ilikai resort is in a quieter location of Waikiki, next to the Modern. The building is dated and the pool is very very small. A lot of the apartments are individually owned and decorated in certain styles. It was an enjoyable stay for our first time in wiakiki, on our next visit I would most likely stay next door at the Hilton.

We stayed in room 2339 from Jan 21-27. Beautiful room, fabulous view of Ala Moana Park, the marina, the ocean! This room was perfect for 2 adults and 2 kids under the age of 6. Full sized kitchen, housekeeping kept our room super clean (they even did dishes!), much much better than I expected. Great staff, the laundry facilities were always available, close to the beach.The exterior is a bit dated, we felt a little out of place in the pool but the kids loved it. Not a huge fan of the fitness equipment in the gym (no free weights), but we adapted. I wouldn't take the shuttle to the hotel from the airport again, take a cab instead ($80 vs $35).

We've stayed at the Ilikai on every one of our biannual visits to Hawaii since 2007 and consequently have seen the hotel go through a renaissance of sorts. We kept coming back due to its excellent location, the spaciousness of the rooms and its value. On our first visit it impressed us as an old and "tired" hotel, that was in need of renovation. It was built in 1964. By our third visit, steps were started to upgrade the shops in the lobby. In addition, some of the rooms in the hotel were being converted to condominiums. On our fourth visit, the shop conversion program was well along as was the conversion process. The shops are now all very good. This year the room were in had just been converted to a condominium. It had a full kitchen and other improvements. However, the closet space was dramatically reduced and in a location making it inconvenient. The bathroom had only one towel bar placed so low over the toilet that a bath towel placed on the bar hit the top of the toilet tank. A hook on the back of the door would have been useful. The lanai furniture is new, but the chairs aren't as comfortable as the old ones and the table is smaller. What is still the same is the fantastic view from the lanai. We'll likely return in two years.

We booked through the hotel and got a room on the 23rd floor facing the Hilton Lagoon and the ocean. The room has been remodeled, so was very nice. I think we almost had the entire 23rd floor to ourselves. The afternoon sun was really warm on the lanai, but it provided great sunset views. This is right next door to the Hilton. You could watch their fireworks on Friday night. Easy access to Waikiki beach.The bed was a little on the hard side; the sofa bed mattress was soft and needs to be replaced. The lanai was great; quiet A/C unit. The kitchen was adequate for our needs; the knives were very dull and in need of sharpening or replacement. The night the wind blew all through the night you could hear it through the lanai doors. You could also hear the doors shaking. Not a good rest that night. Free wifi, it was fast.The bathroom had a few minor issues (no fan; could hear wind when it blew; only shower; no tub; the sink faucet is too close to the edge of the sink).It is very easy access off Ala Moana. Parking is $28/day- valet only. Parking in Waikiki is expensive. There is a close parking garage for $7/10 hours, but we didn't want to be watching the clock every morning and evening. There is an ABC store right around the corner. Next door all the Hilton shops and restaurants are available. It is also a close walk to the Ala Moana mall which has an above average food court and other fine restaurants. Overall, very pleased with the stay. Would stay here again.

We stayed at the Ilikai room 325 for 3 nights and loved it. It's a 2 bedroom 2 full bath condo with updated tiled floors, kitchen, bathrooms, and furniture. There was only 3 of us although the condo could probably sleep 6. As this is an end unit, there are windows and balconies on two sides so there's lots of natural light. However since both those sides face streets and the hotel next door, we didn't open the curtains or sit on the balcony. Parking doesn't come with this condo so we paid to park in the Marina overnight for 10 hours ($1/hour).We would love to stay here again but it is pricey. It's probably a better deal if we had more people.

From check-in to check-out our experience at the Ilikai was most enjoyable. We made reservations by calling the hotel and booking the snooze and cruise which included a car rental and free valet parking. Because parking at the Honolulu Zoo was at a premium we took the trolley which stopped right in front of the Ilikai and left us a block from the zoo. Very convenient. The location was great. Away from the madness of Waiikiki and yet within walking distance. Our room was newly renovated with a great view of the Pacific Ocean, Diamondhead and the HHV lagoon . Dinner at Sarento's at the top of the I was great. Food, service and view were all we could wish for after waiting 48 years to return.

This hotel is on the main drag, which can be loud. However, the hotel boasts 25 floors, which means the higher you go, the less road noise you deal with. But don't be fooled. If you are on the highway side "Mountain View," you are still going hear the road (and sirens and buses and motorcycles) even at floor 22. The better bet is to spend the extra $30/night and get an ocean view (aka, non-Mountain View) room and have quiet. Some of the rooms are gorgeous. Recently renovated with top-of-the-mark design, the rooms are both cozy and extremely functional and pretty. Our king-sized bed with new mattress and white linens, was flanked by modern night stands and was footed by a great bench. Move about 5 feet away from the bed and you've got a comfy modern couch with elegant, modular end tables and side tables. Both the bed and the couch face a very large TV. Our kitchenette had everything--except a dishwasher. However, the cleaning service will do your dishes each day, which is nice. The bathroom follows suit with nice amenities and clean, large showers--big enough for three (if you're so inclined ;)One of the best parts of this hotel is the large lanai. Ours had two chairs and a table, which allowed for a great view of the mountain--and road noise. (More on how to avoid that in a minute.)Here's what you need to know: Get one of the rooms on the top four floors. They are the only ones that have been renovated to be awesome. The others, eh, not-so-much. And get a room facing away from the street.Other stuff:Parking is valet only and $24/day. ($12 if you're military or on business).Towels and chairs are free to use, but you have to use towel/chair cards to get them from the front desk. Easy peasy though.Pool looks good, but I'm a beach girl. Beach is right there...but you'll walk a little bit to really get there. This hotel fronts the marina. For us it was so not a big deal. If you had little kids, this might be a 10 minute walk. Staff is nice. Free wifi

The Ilikai is one of the oldest hotels in Honolulu, opened 60 years ago but refurbished to make it one of the greats today. It has a large and welcoming entrance, shops and boutiques and great guest rooms. We were on floor 22 of 24 and had a great city view of the route our morning walk. The room was all you could want - a kitchen with everything, including a coffee maker, hotplates, microwave, large fridge; a king size bed with great mattress and pillows, a lounge area with big flat screen TV, a really good bathroom and a very large balcony. The Ilikai is on bus routes to Pearl Harbour and the airport and downtown to the action area. There's an ABC store diagonally opposite and a great swimming pool. Staff are efficient and friendly.

We had a wonderful month long stay in room 1602. Renting the condo through Waikiki Beachfront Rental was hassle free and easy. Any problems that we encountered with the unit, eg. Broken microwave and DVD player, were fixed immediately upon request. The staff were friendly and efficient.The accommodation in unit 1602 was wonderful. The corner unit created a lot more privacy and protection from the afternoon sun. The views were spectacular. We spent many long hours on the lanai. Appointments and fitting in the unit included granite kitchen and bathroom and a stainless steel French door refrigerator. Proximity to shopping was very convenient.Any issues we had with the unit included minimal storage, cracked vinyl bar stools, an extremely uncomfortable lounge and lingering smoke that wafted into the unit from other lanais.This was our second visit to the Ilikai, booking through Waikiki. Beachfront Rentals. We will definitely be back.

The best part of staying at the Ilikai is the location. It is next door to the Hilton Hawaiian village. You get the benefits of shopping and the lagoon and beach without paying the price. It is also next to the marina so there is lots of parking. Be careful you need to pay in the private lot for overnight parking. It is also walking distance to ala moana mall. You get the Waikiki feel without having to be in the hustle and bustle of the main stretch of Waikiki. Loved it there. Staff is friendly and the rates to stay were reasonable.Great access to the H1 and to Nimitz (airport).

I checked out many different options and went with ilikai. Like others we booked through waikikibeachrentalsdotcom. I was a bit hesitant, but found the experience straight forward and honest. We booked and paid online and the condo was exactly as advertised. This unit had a sliding wall which divided the suite into two. Convenient if you have a sleeping baby.I rated it excellent due to the price and location.

The newly upgraded rooms are nice and the views can't be beat.The fitness center is a joke. All of the aerobic equipment is barely hanging on. It looks like stuff that would be offered at Goodwill for $15, and even then no one would buy it. I can't believe this top notch property would stick with this equipment.Our bathroom floor had a dried out contact lens on the floor for five days until I picked it up (neither of us wears contacts) so I guess it is safe to assume they aren't mopping or vacuuming in the bathrooms, possibly even between visits. Other than that the housekeeping was good.These complaints said, this is a hard hotel to beat. The views are spectacular (since you are in the Ilikai, you don't have to look at it) and the location is great, especially if you are interested in venturing outside of the tourist ghetto that is Waikiki.We didn't rent a car but it looked like the valet was overwhelmed frequently, so if you have to park, be prepared to wait.We requested a room with a shower (not a tub) and this request was accommodated. Didn't expect that.

We booked through Waikikibeachrentals.com. I found the booking in real time a bonus booking from overseas as most private condo's you have to email a request and wait for a reply and with time difference this can be a little frustrating as it appears available then you get an email to say it is not.W.B.R. was a very easy and professional booking service to use.Our condo overlooking the marina and restaurant area was lovely,the room was cool as we did not have direct sun in the morning.The aircon was great,and the bed wow it is very comfortable.The condo is well stocked and clean,it does say the sofa can sleep an adult(it is not a sofa bed) so it would not suit a very tall person.The position was great,walking distance to Ala Moana shopping center. The buses leave from right outside the hotel and you can enjoy the entertainment /food court of the Hilton next door.Once inside the room you do not hear any next-door noise,running taps,flushing etc.A great place to stay.

We stayed in this beautiful condo for one week at the beginning of November 2014. We rented it through Aloha Condos but all of the correspondence seemed to be directly with the owner Helen Ting. The condo is fairly small - just right for a couple. It has been renovated and has a very nice modern kitchen and bath. The lining room is partially separated from the sleeping area by a wall. It was very tastefully decorated and had an elegant feel. The best feature was the lovely balcony overlooking the marina. It was great for having morning coffee (often seeing a rainbow over the Ala Moana area) and having a drink watching the sun set over the harbor and ocean in the evening.The condo was very clean and quiet. There is good high speed internet included as well as basic TV channels and free long distance calling in North America. There were plenty of towels and some initial amenities (paper products, soap, shampoo, etc.) The building was very nice and clean. The pool was also nice although it closed a little early at 7:30 PM.The beach was a pleasant walk away on the opposite side of the Hilton Hawaiian Lagoon. Some beach equipment was provided (although we did not use it). Some nice beach towels were also provided.I do recommend renting a car to see Oahu but the on-site parking is valet only and very expensive. There is a self-park garage a short walk away on Hobron St. They will give you a special 24 hr. rate if you tell them you are staying at the Ilikai but even that is $20/day.This was not the cheapest place to stay (although we were able to save some money by eating breakfast on our balcony each day) but we loved it and would stay there again. If you really like an active nightlife, you would want to be a little further down the beach where the action is, but if not this is an ideal spot.

I rented this condo via waikikibeachrentals.com and it seemed to work perfectly. The condo was exactly as the pictures looked. Sorry I dont have pictures. The kitchen does look a little larger in th e picture as it was actually a little small but had most everything.I didnt explore the hotel at all really just went to the shop downstairs that was well stocked with most things you would need. I didn't even see the pool.LocationPretty good not far from the beach but you still need to drive - beach being the main waikiki beach. The Hilton lagoon and the beach is right in front of the hotel. I didn't actually swim in either. Opted to drive to waikiki one day and then northshore which had the most amazing beaches so go there. ParkingValet is $28 a day. there is a self park a short block away for $20 a night.
