I think you can park at the lagoon as it's public til 10:30pm for free and there may be even overnight parking there but I'm not sure.CondoThere were more towels than listed on the website. Website said 4 total 2 in each bathroom. But there were 3 in the bathrooms, plus 2 beach towels, plus three more in the drawer of the room. I didn't sleep in the master but my roomie said the shower was like needles she hated it but it had a big closet, it's own bathroom and a laini. i think it had it's own air con too. The other room didn't have aircon but instead had these fans that sucked air from the living room which was air con'd. There was another laini off this room and the living room. The bathroom is shared so there is a door d the room and out to the living room. The bathroom door didn't have a lock? as they were sliding doors. Same with the bedroom door. This room was smaller with a hutch for a closet and a dresser.Both rooms had queens.The living room had a queen pullout and a twin pullout. So it accommodated 7 of us perfectly. Not sure why the website says it only is for 6. The kitchen as I said is a little small but had a dishwasher (two in fact) small ones, two mall fridge drawers, a freezer on the other side of the wall which was weird, stove, oven, microwave, coffee maker, toaster and rice cooker. had all the utensils and such but no condiments or anything or like foil. There happened to be saran wrap.There is a TV in each room. There is wifi but it was kinda spotty.An ipod player as well. Overall good stay. clean and nice. Message me with any questions.

Loved our stay there in October. Though we had a bit of confusion when cab driver dropped us off at wrong entrance, took a bit of juggling getting all our luggage back to correct entrance and up stairs. Room was very spacious with a fully equipped kitchen which was a bonus. Great location, lots of eateries close by and short walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Excellent shopping to be had.

My husband and I stayed at the Ilikai through an independently owned condo rental via AirBnB. We stayed over New Years Eve and had a fantastic experience. Due to the jetlag, we weren't able to go out and enjoy the festivities, but we were able to see the fireworks right from the lanai. This hotel has everything you need, and it's a perfect location. There is a walkway from the front of the hotel down to the Hilton Hawaiian Village Lagoon area, where I liked to sun myself each morning. It's a short walk to everything on the strip from the Ilikai, and you're paying a fraction of what people are paying to stay next door at the Hilton. There's a great parking rate ($20 for 24 hours, $7 for 10 hours) at the garage above Red Lobster one block over from the hotel. The best part about our room is that it had a full kitchen and sitting area. The water pressure was incredible. This was a privately owned condo in the building, so I can't speak to the hotel rooms, but if they are anything like this one you won't be disappointed. We were able to hold our bags with the bell hop for $1 per bag since we weren't hotel guests. This is free for hotel guests. There is a coffee/bagel place as well as some shops and a little market in the lobby. There's a restaurant at the top of the hotel along with a restaurant overlooking the marina on the main floor. This place has everything you need!

The price of these condos is unbeatable. Booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals. Our condo was clean and had everything we needed. The position is great, and there is cheap parking at the marina behind Ilikai. The restaurant on site is small but the food was great. There is also a convenience store on the premises. The only negative I took away from the Ilikai was their pool area. It had lots of signs up around the pool saying it was wet (really? Around a pool!) there was a pool rope dividing the pool which made it difficult to use the whole pool with kids. And it wasn't a particularly child friendly pool, the pool attendants (fun police)where extremely hard on the kids when it appeared they would be having any fun at all. We hardly used the pool as we were at the beach most of the time but the kids liked having a swim after a day at the beach. Other than this though, it was a great place to stay as a self contained condo.

Beautiful Room , Fantastic view, very very clean , remodeled recently we're guessing. Great Sleeping accommodations and Comfort.... Oh The View - Wow.... We always like the great great location and ease of getting around from the Ilikai...... and this room is worth sharing the info!!!!!!! We're booking this room for next year - tonight !!!!!!!!

We stayed at the Ilikai Condo rentals from December 24th 2014 until January 2nd 2015. I'm going to give you the good and a little bit of bad. Not bad enough to not stay again. Oh no, I would stay there every visit now.  Somehow we thought it was a one bedroom but it was a bachelor suite so if you don't mind close proximity to each other sleeping, it's fine. The beds were okay but the futon is not really something I would want to sleep on again,. Nevertheless, we loved it! Great location and you can see the friday night fireworks at the Hilton from the suite. The laundry room and elevator are close but not close enough to hear either one. They had all the amenities that we needed including a blender, toaster, kettle and coffee maker. The bathroom is a great size and the unit was clean and welcoming. To enter the unit, you used a passcode instead of a card or key. Loved that! The buses and trolleys were out front and you could walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre as well as the beach.The pool is small so this is ideal for families. The pool attendants were awesome. Just a note, when you key in your code to leave, turn the knob as well or you could leave without actually locking the door. Would I recommend this property? Absolutely! Thank you Anthony Montoni for sharing your rental with us! The Hilton's luau is on a roof top across from the Ilikai so it's kind of fun to watch and listen. We went to the Paradise Cove luau. Watch for that review as we loved it. It has a full kitchen which we utilized every day.

Years ago the Ilikai wa a great place to stay. Today it's closer to faulty towers than an acceptable hotel for travellers. Very dated, old and tired and the staff generally seem affected by the same lethargy .The room we stayed in was large enough but with a leaking sink for the entire duration, a failed door lock that took over an hour to rectify plus no available room service this is not a hotel we would return to.

beautifully set up...loved the location...loved the no key concept....great views....although it wasn't till the ladt day we realised the door had NOT been locking so please check on your first day...so blessed nothing was pinched....luved the laundry on each floor...machine in foyer for change for it...

This was a visit I will never forget! Hawaii was amazing! The apartment was excellent,with the most amazing view over the laguna,Diamond Head crater and the ocean.The apartment was clean and airy with all the necessary facilities.The service was great,especially the valet service guys,who were always smiling and very polite!We dined in the restaurant at the top of the building and the food was delicious and service outstanding!

Stayed here last winter and I have been intending to write a review as we had the most wonderful time. We had a two bedroom corner suite with a full kitchenette and this made a world of difference in terms of space and convenience. It meant we could go shopping for our favourite food, my mother could whip up her famous breakfasts at leisure, which she loves to do, and we could all enjoy precious family time. Far healthier, more convenient, cheaper and more fun start to the day. So we can't comment on the hotel breakfasts, but we can definitely give thumbs up to the food and service at the fabulously luxurious Sarento's. Similarly we didn't have much lunch there either as we tended to be out during the middle of the day - but remember thinking the burgers at the Grill seemed a bit overpriced. There are too many dining options in this part of town to stay within the confines of the hotel.I was very impressed with the spaciousness of the accommodation.The suite definitely had a "lived in" look, but everything was functioning and more importantly, scrupulously clean. All chaos put to right - including the dishes- every day, so we were pretty pleased when we returned at the end of the dayApart from that what more to say? This is Waikiki, Honolulu at it's finest. The hotel's location means it's six minutes walk to the lagoon, which is perfect for the kids and activities like SUP and paddleboating. At the end of the week we felt safe enough for our 8 yr old to run down ahead by himself because we could see the lagoon from the room.The trolley stops outside the hotel which could not be more convenient for shopping and sightseeing tours. As a family we like walking so the longer distances down the boardwalk were appealing. Not being right at the centre of the action meant that when we returned to the tranquil end of Waikiki we felt like we were coming home to rest, relaxation and the ode-inspiring sunsets from the balcony.We will return!

We rented a private condo in this building and were most impressed with the view from the lanai. You can watch the Friday night fireworks from the neighboring Hilton without ever leaving the comfort of your own room! The property is also in a great location for exploring the "touristy" parts of Waikiki.

Currently in the middle of our 8 night stay for a family xmas vacay w our kids ages 6, 4 and 1. Booked last minute via bookit.com due to a scammed vrbo listing. Initially only had a mtn view available when I booked but we requested an ocean view in a newly remodeled suite and got our upgrade to the 22nd floor-well worth the extra 600 and a steal considering its christmas. Lanai was huge and had expansive views of the ocean. Kitchen fully stocked w all the appliances and so we were able to cook breakfast sometimes and stock snacks/drinks for the kids. The suite was so new that you could spell the fresh paint and we had to call engineering to put lightbulbs in the lamps. Only knock is that the pool is small and dated especially for such a large hotel. Good location close to ala moana mall and don quijote 24 hr asian shopping market. Perfect place for families wanting a condo style accomodation and in the quieter side of waikiki but close enough to walk to the hustle and bustle of kalakua. Would def stay here again

We stayed in this fantastic unit for a week and the newly renovated property exceeded our expectations. We read the Ilikia is looking tired but we found it well above what we expected. As this was the first time staying down this end we were concerned how far it may of been away from things but the location is perfect for all Waikiki has to offer including the major tour operators stop out the front, it's a 10 min easy walk to the major shopping centre with all its shops and resturants and 15 min back to the centre of the strip. The perfect place for a family to stay without breaking the bank.

I stayed at the Ilikai in April 2014 through a vacation resort facility a d hated it. It was the worst stay ever. This time around actually staying in the upgraded rooms was nice. I had a beautiful view from the 23rd floor and it was AMAZING! The bed was not too comfortable but it's hawaii ... Who stays in bed! I would stay here again with the new upgrades, free wifi, and a great coffee spot down stairs its awesome!
user_name:
Sarah K
Cleveland, Ohio, United States

review_body: We stayed at this hotel in an ocean view room with a massive balcony! This is an older hotel not on the beach but a very very short walk to a gorgeous piece of Waikiki that had countless wedding photos taken early in the day here! We had a stunning view of the ocean and the Marina below..walking distance to good restaurants and shopping! There was also a local bus that was an inexpensive way to travel around the island for some sight seeing! Staff was courteous friendly and room was super clean! Totally enjoyed our stay and would rebook there again!

Room was tight for 4 adults & luggage although clean with the exception of the shower curtain. Had a small kitchen with full size fridge, stove & microwave. Great view of the ocean & Diamond HeadWould stay again

Ilikai #1944 was fantastic, there were 5 of us and it was our first stay here, we will definately stay again, the location was sensational overlooking Waikiki beach and the Condo was pretty much brand new, well stocked kitchen and 2 big balconies, highly recommended. We were met on arrival and given our keys and valet parking pass which was very handy because we had a car. The location on Waikiki beach was very close to the Ala Moana centre and a short walk to the main shopping strip.

We thought our stay at the Ilikai was fantastic. Very cool chic mid-century appeal! The apartment was well appointed and maintained. The studio suite was spacious and we the kitchen areas was fantastic and we made good use of it.. The Ilikai is located just as Waikiki begins and so for us we liked the quiet as opposed to the more hectic pace of inner Waikiki. The trolley and bus stop outside and so is very convenient and no car is needed to see most of Oahu's sights. There are plenty of convenient grocery stores and some decent local restaurants nearby.The room had a nice view of the lagoon and the Friday night fireworks at the Hilton Village.All in all would recommend for anyone wanting peaceful stay in condo with good value for dollar - and of course as a big Jack Lord fan was very cool to be in the building from the opening sequence of the original Hawaii 5-O!

This our third stay at iconic Ilikai condos and have been very much let down with the standard and cleanliness of our 19th floor condo. Listed as recently renovated and one bedroom/studio it overlooked the marina and ocean which was beautiful. On arriving after along flight the condo looked OK but on closer inspection we found the cleanliness left a lot to be desired. Human faeces on the bathroom floor, lumps of dirt throughout and makeup all over the bed linen. The bed linen was paper thin and grey not white and pillows were flat as anything. The toilet did not flush so we asked for it to be repaired which was attended to promptly. The toilet did not work properly after that. Strong smell from drains after shower as used. Appliances very old. Lanai furniture very dirty. I am sure this is not the case with all condos, but the Ilikai is 50 years old and it shows. Waikiki Beach rentals have strict conditions on rentals so read the fine print. Family rented condo at same time and had similar issues.
user_name:
Kathie w
New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Booked a private rental condo online at a fraction of the cost of the hotel rate. The condo was spotlessly clean and had been renovated in the last few years with modern kitchen appliances, 40 inch LCD TV and bathroom with a deep Japanese soaking bath. We were on the 21st floor with ocean and lagoon views from our large lanai(balcony). Only 10 minutes walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and 15 minute walk to downtown Waikiki. Lots of nearby places to eat and ABC stores for supplies. There was a public bus and trolley stop at the front door of the hotel which was very convenient for getting around Waikiki and tour pick ups. We really enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai Hotel and will return for another relaxing holiday.

We booked an ocean view room 818 and were delighted with the views. The Ilikai is centrally located within walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping centre and is a short stroll to the beach and lagoon. Perfect views for the Hilton Luau and the fireworks on a Friday night. The apartment was quiet, had an adequate kitchen and the beds were comfortable.

Ilikai 744 remains an exceptional find. The convenience of location and quality of condo made our vacation top notch. While the Ilikai's amenities don't exactly rival those of the adjacent Hilton Hawaiian Village, our teenagers loved this condo. Beach here does not have the best quality sand or waves, however you're a short ride to other Oahu areas (reco the windward side of island for better sand and consistent waves). The Waikiki nightlife is within easy walking distance yet far enough away from noise intrusion. There are great restaurants on property and even a Dairy Queen within a quick walk (should you need a mainland dessert vice during your trip).

We had a street view room. Even though it's a lot of traffic, we didn't hear any of it in our room. Stayed at the hotel the first time(2012), and rented privat at one of the apartments the second time(2014). The staff is helpful, and the hotel cleaning is satisfying. There are a small store by the hotel lobby. Used it a lot. Along with the coffe shop! The pool area wasn't the best, small, and always full. But with access to Hilton Lagoon, and the beach just next to the hotel, the pool area wasn't a big deal. Since it's a walking distance to beach, Ala Moana Shopping center, Waikiki and a bus stop next to the hotel, I'd stay here again.

I have just returned from an amazing 10 nights at this hotel. It's hard for me not to rehash comments made by other reviewers but honestly, this hotel surpassed my expectations in every way.The hotel is clean, the condo was spacious and the view from our 21st floor were spectacular. We overlooked the pool, the lagoon and the beach. We spent lots of time on the balcony soaking up the atmosphere, the entertainment from the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door and the fireworks which are on each Friday night at 7.45pm.The kitchen was great...all updated appliances and utensils. We mostly ate out but breakfasts we had at the condo as typical of most holidays it doesn't take long to tire of fast foods. Great 40 inch tv and DVD player in room too.Beds were comfy, towels and linen great. Laundry on every floor...$2.50 per wash plus same fee for dryer. Remember to save quarters as no change machine in laundry but one available in main lobby.Fifteen minute walk into Waikiki central or 10 mins walk to ala Moana shopping centre. Bus and trolley service is great...stops at front of hotel.Lots of places to eat nearby...we discovered the Harbour Pub ....great happy hour there each day and meals great too...particularly convenient after a full day out.For those who have given negative feedback...you must be hard to please.We actually booked this unit through an Internet rental site...a far cheaper alternative than booking through the hotel directly.I can't wait to return!

We booked an ocean view room. Even though it is not front view, it still can see pretty well of the lagoon and the beach from the patio. The room is nice sized with a small kitchen. Whipping up breakfast is easy especially there is a small store downstairs to get everything you need. The swimming pool is small without a view. The hotel is located next to Hilton so you can use their lagoon property as well. The ABC stores under Hilton is much bigger and has variety of things including gifts. The location is also convenient to the center part of the strip. If you go south to the diamond head, it is too far thus need taxi. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, for its comfort and nice ocean view.

I stayed at the Illikai with friends In June.we had several rooms overlooking the lagoon and beach.to wake up every morning to this spectacular view Had a calming influence and kick started many great days Seeing the sights shopping swimming etc. The location of the Illikai is tremendous with shopping and restaurants and bars within a short walk, not to mention the outdoor bar at the Illikai serving the Best Mai Tai's you will ever taste along with lovely friendly service. Do yourself a favour and book a holiday at the Illikai you won't be disappointed.

We needed a 2 BR apartment for the three of us, and this was one of the few more affordable options. This is a 60's hotel that has seen some renovation, and our room was perfectly clean and pleasant. Glad we rented direct from the hotel, as it looks like some of the owner-rented units could be rather tired, rather like the stuffy, humid hallways. Beds were not all that comfortable. View of mountains behind other high rises gave some relief to an otherwise noisy urban setting.I was not pleased with the $30/day "hospitality charge" which covered such "amenities" as a cup of water when we checked in (!), and a shuttle which just runs between sister hotels and an unpredictable schedule, about every half hour.However, we were happy to have a kitchen, and the location was convenient - walk into the heart of Waikiki, or take TheBus or trolley. Given the options on Waikiki, this isn't too bad...

Had a 2 day stay, due to emergency room visit. But this Hotel, location, made it relaxing. Marina views, lagoon,next door, great for quiet sun time, away from the crowds. Pool are small, and lobby restaurant not too great. Missed going to the TOP. Floor for drinks and view. Staff very friendly, we had King Room, sofa, eating table chairs and wee kitchen. Shower only bathroom. Nicely done.Would stay again. Our bed was too firm, but seems that is the norm now.Lots of stores near ABC has it all, lobby convenience store also.

We rented a penthouse apartment in the Ilikai Hotel for a family of 4 adults. We chose this area as I was attending a conference and the convention centre is about 15 mins walk or 5 mins by Uber. Previously we had stayed in the Waikiki area.There were many pros-the Ilikai at Ala Moana is a good position in that it is 10 mins from the Ala Moana mall (great shopping for all ages and open until 9pm), close to several beaches and the Hilton Lagoon, and there were splendid views from our apartment over the marina and out to sea.The Ilikai is an older hotel, and as a vacation rental, the hotel does not provide any services (not even how to catch the bus, of which there were several stops outside). There is however a pool one can use (we didn’t, very spartan and uninspiring surrounds compared with the beach), a convenience store on the ground floor, and a coffee shop and restaurant which we didn’t use. One can also order in food ( California pizza is a good option, but avoid the ihop across the road).Next door is the Modern Hotel with very friendly staff and a lively pool area and a well known Japanese restaurant . On the other side of the hotel is the massive Hilton complex.The apartment (2602) was huge, and easily accommodated our grown up children with good cooking facilities, a comfortable couch and chairs, and good beds. There was great free wifi.The décor is dreadful-all white with low hanging chandeliers. There are two bedrooms which could be main bedrooms and one inside bedroom with 2 single beds. Two rather dated bathrooms are available but one is only accessed through the master bedroom. There was plenty of storage. The views from the large deck are beautiful. Cons-the air conditioning is simply not up to the task and needs replacing, ditto the outdoor furniture on the deck. We were always uncomfortable with the heat at night. One of the bedrooms is too crammed with two king beds, and also a couch, and two chairs. My husband had to move the bed to be able to get out of bed.. There is no phone. There were beach mats but no beach chairs which would have been appreciated. Similarly when one arrives late at night from an international flight, having some long life milk in the fridge would be helpful.We rented through Lais Costa at Hawaii 5-0 rentals and she was very helpful. We particularly appreciated a late check out when we needed to return to NZ on a 10.30pm flight. The apartment is expensive but given the position and size, we did not see a better option (so glad we were not a the Hilton next door) and we would definitely consider this apartment again. difficult to comment on others in the complex-we heard both positive and negative comments from other travellers and I wonder if there is significant variation.We rented a convertible car on this trip for several days (fun but expensive from a rental place just down the road) or one can go to Alamo across the road, cheaper but no convertibles. Driving up to the North Shore or to the Kailua beach region shows another lovely side of Ohau.We enjoyed breakfast just down the road at Goofeys (turn right out of the hotel and walk a block, look upstairs), slightly less so at Roys on Waikiki beach ( great views, food somewhat tasteless), shopped lots at Ala Moana (there is also a Nordstrum Rack not too far away), used Uber very easily to get around and went to the beach just in front of the hotel, or walked along the boardwalk toward Waikiki. Our friend enjoyed the outlet shopping for their children but commented there were no facilities.Hawaii again delighted!

We rented this room privately through a website and really enjoyed the experience. The price we paid was much less than the rack rate ffered by the hotel for the same room for an extra night. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from Ala Moana shopping centre and approx 10 minutes walk from the centre of town. There are different levels of fitout in the hotel and we were in a recently renovated room. The views of the harbour were nice and there was everything we need to enjoy our week in Honolulu.

We originally booked at Hilton Hawaiian but I found this place a friend recommended it. We stayed in condo #1122. It was fantastic. Had everything you need. It is privately owned so the owners had a cooler, beach chairs, and beach towels.It had a full kitchen, dishwasher, king size bed .It was a studio style condo but it was LARGE and well sectioned off.It also had a pull out couch. We saved WELL over $1200 decided to stay here and they room was ocean front and every bit as nice. There is STILL a walk to the beach but we used the Hilton lagoon all week. No one cares if you use the lagoon.The pool was nice put not fantastic . We didn't use it much...I mean you are at THE BEACH!! The staff is constantly cleaning this hotel .I always daw staff somewhere. It was definitely cleaner than the Hilton. I was also really happy with the general store had anything you needed.

This was a good unit with a king size bed and full kitchen fantastic views looking over the lagoon and beach, the pool was nice although not big, fireworks were fantastic, the lobby was extremely hot we had free wifi in the room which was great, the only bad thing was it didn't have a kettle so we had to boil water in a pot which is not safe if you had children holidaying with you, although our next trip we would rather be closer to waikiki

we loved everything about this unit, the view of the fire works was amazing we loved waking up looking out at the beach and lagoon. it has everything you would ever need. eating meals on the balcony was amazing. the kids loved the free wifi. Two bathrooms and heaps of storage. We found the ceiling fans were great as most other rooms don't have them.

This is our third stay at the Ilikai and while we keep thinking we will try somewhere else, there is really nowhere else that is just such good value for money. This time again, we rented a condo privately through VRBO (1727). I like the Ilikai because the older building means it was built in a time when they made the walls thicker and thus its more soundproof. Its also one of the only places in Honolulu where you can get a genuine water view for $200 or less and get a kitchenette as well. I like being out of the hustle and bustle of the main town centre but still close enough to walk and being close enough to walk to the Ala Mona Centre. I have stayed in three different units each time I have stayed here and have had no complaints despite each one being different. I like this place.

What a pleasant surprise this hotel was! On Honolulu harbour it was comfortably close to the port, ideal for us as we had a night between cruises. However we could comfortably have stayed much longer. Great apartment style room with full kitchen, great views and comfortable bed. Close to everything. Extremely helpful staff. Would stay here again.

My husband, 1 year old daughter and I stayed in apartment 2030 for 10 days in March 2014, booked through WaikikiBeachRentals.com. The condo was recently updated and the decor is contemporary and hotel-standard. All amenities necessary to self-cater, and a coin operated laundry on the same floor. We could not have been happier with the value for money. Studio size, but still fit a king size bed, separate lounge area and full size kitchen - with the added bonus of wall to wall windows out to the balcony and the amazing views. We ate most of our meals out on the balcony while watching the world go by - at the lagoon and marina! Such a nice way to relax. Definitely loved the unobstructed views of the Hilton fireworks from the balcony! What a bonus.Location is excellent - so close to Ala Moana centre for shopping and budget friendly food; right on the lagoon and beach which is just fabulous, and was not overcrowded. Transport at the doorstep, so quite easy to take a bus down to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, if you don't feel like walking. Soooo quiet - unlike staying in the heart of Waikiki where you seemingly cannot escape the noise. Bed was very comfortable. We felt well-rested here, in our little oasis.Right next door to the Hilton Hawaiian village which we also found good for different family friendly dining options. Booking through WaikikiBeachRentals.com was easy and the service provided by Bert the cleaner was also friendly and efficient.Fantastic value - can't wait to return.

We stayed at apartment 1836 in the Ilikai hotel and suites from Monday 6th October for 5 nights. I booked it through VRBO (like an owners direct or holiday lettings agency). All went well, payments received etc and the owner called MR. Lu was lovely, I actually spoke to him after before booking. When we arrived after a really long day travelling we could not get I to the apartment, I never received the email from the owner telling me the room number or access code.Thank goodness for an employee at the hotel called CHESTER, what a star, it had nothing to do with him as it was a private condo rental and he only did the hotel. He managed to contact the owner and get the required room number and door code, otherwise we could have ended up on the beach!!!!!!!Our apartment had stunning views of the lagoon, sea and the wonderful fireworks put on every Friday night in the Hilton Hawaiin Hotel next door. Our condo had 2large beds, very comfy. The Ilikai is 50years old and is where the original Hawaii 5 0 was filmed with Jack Lord on the 25th floor penthouse. We loved the original features, although a good 30minute walk to the Dukes statue, if you walk on the beach front, that is a quicker walk and much more scenic.We did eat at the Cinamon restaurant just off the lobby, that was not good, they have just taken over and if they carry on as they did our night it will soon close. They were sweeping up and clearing tables around us before 9pm. They also mixed up the order and brought me someone else's. We also ate on the 25th floor restaurant called Sorrentos, it is very pricey, 18dollars for a glass of red wine!!!!!! Views were stunning, but 2meals were killed by over strong seasoning. Such a shame on our last night and a very big bill.Did the canoe ride, a must if you are there. Rental cars are across the road, bus stops outside, and there is an ABC store across the road that sells really good clam chowder soup.Pearl Harbour again is a real must, you can't help be moved when visiting this historic sight.We really did enjoy the 5days.

Stayed here a couple of weeks ago-location was awesome and we loved being on our own in a self contained suite. Overlooked the Hilton Lagoon and Waikiki beach.I have no hesitation in recommending the Ilikai to anyone visiting Honolulu.
user_name:
Brenton R
Adelaide, South Australia, Australia

review_body: We stayed 4 nights at the Ilikai in Waikiki and it was very comfortable, clean and the staff were great. It was a little bit dated and there was a crack in our mirrored wall in the living area that was gaff taped but that was ok, just cosmetic I guess. We thought it could benefit with a make over as it was a little tired and a bit 80's but if you want to be in the heart of Waikiki it's good. The price was quite expensive but if you wanted to stay there for a couple of nights and use it as a jumping point to better things off the beaten track it's good.

We rented room 1330 through Waikikibeachrentals.com. The website was relatively easy to navigate and see each room. The only downside was asking questions about the room - the person answering the emails always just directed us back to the main website.We are a family of 2 adults, a 3 yr old and 9 month old. In hindsite it would have been better to have rented a room with a sliding wall to separate the bed from the rest of the room/apartment. We had a portable travel tent for our baby but it took her a few nights to get used to the extra noise of us being in the room before she would sleep soundly (and we had to tiptoe around and turn the tv down).The kitchen was quite small but usable. The one downside was not having basic items such as salt, sugar, oil etc... Maybe we're used to rentals in Australia where those things are usually provided.The bathroom was decent - the shower space was a decent size and they provided amble towels.The location was good if you spent a lot of time at Ala Moana shopping centre (only a 5 min walk). It was a bit far from downtown Waikiki (15 min walk). However it is right next to the Hilton so we were able to make use of the lagoon everyday and also spent some time at some of the pools at the Hilton (although you will need a Hilton card to be able to use their towels - luckily a family member gave us hers before she left). The beach is also right next to the lagoon as well.For cheaper eating the foodcourt and restaurants at Ala Moana shopping centre are 5 min away. There's also some cheap japanese food across the rd as well (and McDonalds and an ABC shop).If you have rented a car you can park behind the Ilikai at the Marina for $1 per hr overnight. Overall a decent place to stay at a good price.

We were happy with our stay on the 13th floor 1308, private owner through Hawaaian Vacation Prop. The unit faced the ocean, lagoon, was fully equipped as stated. It was clean, the bed was comfy. WE will say the Ilikai is a little older, the rugs in the hall especially on our floor were Very musty smelling. while we did have Beach chairs, they were the Very low/ old ones, so if you weren't in your 20's getting up and and out was hard! ( as well as the Beach towels). the location was very close to the new mall, but further from Waikiki, but w/in walking to both. we definitely recommend getting the trolley (all colored ) pass. it stops right in front of the hotel. we ended up w/ Very Hot weather, so we stayed on the bus w guided tours, and it was fun! But you can hop on hop off. A little more expensive than the bus. but less expensive than paying for a car (you have to pay approx 30-35/ nite parking!)..and you REALLY DONT NEED A CAR ! ..not every day..so think about that before you rent a car for the week. we also used Go808 Express from the airport! Awesome! there is a Advantage Car dealer in the lobby. also, the pool from the pictures, are really the pools from the Hotel Modern-Verycool!, the Ilikai, not so much. the restaurant on the main floor was just ok. Did not like that the concierge wanted us to sit for a '45min' talk to buy time share etc...to get deals on local excursions etc.!..once we said No, he didn't seem to want to give us any more info . All in all good deal for the price.

We were happy with our stay in apartment #1624 for a week we had a lovely view of the lagoon and ocean, we also could view and hear the Luau from the Hilton Hotel. The room was comfortable. This hotel is close to everything and on the trolley and bus line with taxis also available... There is also a valet service available on checkout. Alamoana shopping centre is only a short walk as is the main shops and restaurants. The swimming pool was ok. The pillows on the bed needed replacing as they were wafer thin. but overall it was a good choice.

fantastic value for money and spotlessly clean and well presented. Everything you could need for a self contained holiday. We stayed in Apt 1102 through Hawaii vacation properties which made the whole experience excellent from start to finish. The location was quiet but easy to access most things and 5 mins walk to Alamoana shopping centre and restaurants.good quality fit out in the apartment with very comfy bed ,good shower and extra towels and toilet rolls and a grocery store on ground level.Would highly recomend this property if you want value and comfort.Also provided beach chairs.beach towels

This was our second stay at the Ilikai and if it could have been more peruI can't imagine how Well appointed rooms, quiet neighbors and fireworks every Friday night! Walking distance to shops and restaurants. We had just a wonderful time- again.

STayed here for a week in September 2014 and was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The room was on the 3rd floor and facing the marina and the airport. The room had full kitchen facilities, which was a god send to me, as I am a Coeliac and struggled to find places to eat gluten free in Hawaii. I was able to purchase food at the supermarket and make my own breakfast and lunch.The hotel is one of the older in the area and is dwarfed by the massive Hilton towers next door. The pool, was nice enough but lacking in any character, but the lagood and sea is close enough to get to.One problem though was that we visited here with another couple and we booked the hotel over a year ago and asked for rooms next to each other high in the hotel and facing the sea. They had over a year to plan this in, however we were put on floor 3 at opposite ends of the hotel from or friends??Whilst it is away from the main area of Waikiki beach area, it was a comfortable quiet stay.

Writing this review as we stayed once again at the Ilikai hotel. It was the second time for myself (previously May 2013) and the third time for my mother (previously May 2013 & February 2014). We've stayed at many places in Honolulu, but since our first stay here in May 2013, we always come back. We love the quiet environment and nearby access to the beach, shopping, and places to eat. We made the reservation for our room back in May 2014 when it was a "Mountain View" special offer on their website. Since we always had Ocean View rooms there, we knew we this room would be on the street side, facing North toward the Mountains.When we arrived, the lady at the front desk was kind and courteous. Our room wasn't ready yet, so the concierge placed our bags in the secure storage, while we killed some time until our room was available. An hour later, the room was ready, just as the front desk lady said, and when we made our way to the third floor, to room #335, we were happily surprised it was not a Mountain View room, but a partial Ocean View room that also overlooked the Ala Wai Yacht Harbor! It was beautiful! And the room had a full kitchen with a nook and chairs. The bathroom was very clean and spacious! The staff at the Ilikai outdid themselves once again! It is also great to see the hotel has active security guards in uniform and constantly on foot, patrolling the grounds, inside and out. It's something you don't see too much at many hotels in the Honolulu area. So of there was ever a problem or emergency, the hotel security staff can be quickly located. We were glad they have their security personnel, especially when we stayed, as we learned that there were several thefts at the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door with many unhappy victims and the lack of hotel security presence. Kudos for the Ilikai staff for thinking about their customers' safety and welfare at all times! On our last day, we had an early checkout, so we notified the front desk 24 hours in advance, and once again when at the very moment we left. We did not even have to go to the front desk to checkout. They said to just leave the room card keys in the room and that was it. So easy, so simple! We once again had the most pleasant and memorable time staying at the Ilikai.Thank you, Aqua Ilikai! As loyal customers, we will be returning once again... hopefully sooner, than later!

This hotel is in a great location for walking or catching the bus. Lots of shopping and great resturants around it. The hotel is not so modern and you had to go to the lobby for wifi. The resturant there wasn,t open for breakfast and had a limited menu. The rooms were clean and spacious.

The location is great as are the views from the condo!A car is nice to have but not a necessity. Parking is included which is a great value!Beds and furniture comfortable, kitchen well equipped for cooking. I would rent here again.

We stayed a private rental unit 1334 for 6 nights with family . No problem getting with codes all very efficient.Ilikai as always is well located and great views.The unit has recently been updated , a few tips for owner: spare pillows in the wardrobe, beach seats need to be updated, they are to heavy to carry to the beach.Air cons need updating, the second bed is up against the air con, not very convienient .The cleanliness not really up to scratch, all dirty marks could be easily washed off with a little care.All in all not bad , but needs little things done.

Stayed at the Ilikai 9/13-9/15/14. What a pleasant surprise!-Great hotel, perfect location, spectacular views/sunsets, close to beach, lagoon and marina. Nice hotel restaurants; Sarento's at the top of the Ilikai was fantastic! Bell/valet very helpful and friendly. Hotel room is large! Full kitchen, fridge, coffeemaker, nice living area and a balcony! Rooms were a little dated but everything else made up for it. This kamaaina family will definitely be returning. Thank you!

The Ilikai is one of favorite places to stay. Their staff at the front desk always greeted us with a smile. Their staff were always so helpful and courteous at all times. The size of the room and the Oceanview just can't be beat.

We stayed at the llikia Hotel from the 5-12 September. We arrived early evening and check in was quick and simple. The holiday was booked well over a year ago and we were travelling with another couple so had requested rooms close to each over and as high up the building as possible. So what did we get. You guest it the 3rd Floor at opposite end of the hotel remembering this hotel as 25 floors. That said we had a good view of the ocean and my friend had what he describe as the perfect view. At 9am every morning he could sit on his balcony watching the military Jets take of and fly past.Anyway the room are very large having a sleeping area King size or bigger bed a sitting area with sofa flat screen tv, play station and a kitchen. The kitchen was very useful as it made it easy to have breakfast in your room before going out. We did have a couple of minor problems with the fridge, air con and the play station. However within 5 minutes some one from maintenance was their to fix things. Did I mention the free up to date DVDs to rent for free. The rooms do need updating to this end they have started on floors 23,24,25 so it may take some time before they get to the first floorThe hotel is situated about 10-15 mins walk from the very large Ala Moana shopping complex if you like shopping. We did try to book a couple of trips in the hotel but you can only pay with a card they do not take cash.

This condo is fairly good value. It is in a 50 year old building, which has been well maintained. Pros: Good location (at the west end of Waikiki, but walkable), yacht harbour/lagoon view, renovated kitchen, comfortable beds, quiet, pool passes, good door lock system (no key), front desk help was excellent.Cons: Poor A/C, bathroom needs a good scrubbing, lanai furniture needs replacing, old A/C unit takes up about 1/4 of the lanai, dishes were random pieces, no wine glasses, not enough room for baggage.You can have a bird's eye view of the Hilton luau from the lanai!

We had a fantastic holiday in a very clean & well appointed appartment. The owner was very helpful & accommodating letting us have use of the unit until our flight departed later that night.We love the use of the beach mats & pool toys which saved us having to buy any. There were even snorkels.Being so close to the beach & shops was handy with the children as nothing was too far to walk to & we didn't need to take the bus.Highly recommend the Ilikaii for anyone.

i stayed for one night at the hotel but did use their related cafes several times. The hotel is nicely away from the main marina and I found it to be very comfortable. The room we were in had a nice balcony that overlooked the water and courtyard. For a Friday night it was quiet apart from the regular Friday night fireworks.The room was clean and well presented and it was well located for a walk into down town Waikiki.

This hotel was a short walk to beach/lagoon and our view was from the higher floors overlooking the ocean. It was beautiful. The staff was great. The rooms were clean and open. The lobby and the bar restaurant on the main level was very nice. Great drinks! We went to the top floor restaurant after dark to see the city lights. It was stunning. The food and drinks were a bit pricey but not crazy. The location was perfect and just across the street from the lagoon and the beach. Besides we HAD to stay at where they filmed the 1970's Hawaii 50.

Unit 2108 was very nice. The heights bothered me more than I thought it would though. The view was great. The lobby was nice too. I don't mind walking, but if you want to go to the main part of Waikiki often and then back to your room, I would pick something closer. We will next time.

We were staying in #1122. This is an unit facing the lagoon and ocean, best views also having Friday fireworks and Hawaii culture dance every night from lanai. Thanks to Kat of hawaiivacationpropertiesllc.com, she was so helpful and delightful, she just made my stay trouble free. We were couples with 3 kids, the room was big enough for us, and we enjoyed very much of having our breakfast and the ocean view every morning in the lanai. The location is perfect, Its takes about 8 to 10 mins walk to Ala Moana shopping mall and also the Ala Moana park. The Waikiki beach is just right in front of us, Hilton Village is on the left. We enjoyed very much of walking along the Waikiki beach to the centre of Waikiki in the sunset, and walk back to hotel after dinner. The best of the best is the price, it's a 5 stars hotel but charged 3 stars price. I strongly recommend this hotel to the others.

I guess it depends on what you want out of your Honolulu stay. We wanted a convenient base, close to the beach with self-contained facilities, and that's exactly what we had. Our room was well maintained, had everything we need (including the first kettle I've ever seen in the US - they do exist!) and was perfectly located for Ala Moana Shopping Centre about 12 minutes walk away, The Bus right outside and a minute from the beach. Wifi connection was great, sitting on the balcony with a drink was great and I'd definitely choose to stay here rather than right in the heart of bustling Waikiki on any future stay.

This hotel is very interesting regarding how its run, I was talking to the Bellman and found out some very good things that I wish I had known. I booked this directly through Aqua hotels and paid $192/210$ for Fri/Sat rate. There are only 30 Units left in this place that are actually owned by Aqua Ilikai, these remaining 30 units are being looked at by private buyers and will be sold very shortly, so Aqua Ilikai looks like it may be going out of business soon once the rooms are sold. Had I known this I probably would have booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals so that I could choose which room i wanted to book and those rooms are Very nice and renovated. The room that I had was decent and pretty large and I liked that I had a kitchenette, but it was obvious that the hotel is not spending money on renovating existing rooms. I paid for an Ocean view with Kitchenette room. The room I was in was 742 it had a good view for the Friday night fireworks, but the huge CON was that there are no dark drapes to keep the sun out, so expect to be woken up very early by bright sunlight streaming into the room. It was comfortable but I would not stay there again unless I booked through another site that rented out privately owned units. Another thing that i liked was that you have unlimited use of the "redbox" type of service in the lobby with free dvd rentals. this was part of the resort fee

Great room, The bed was very comfortable. we stayed a week, 3rd honeymoon for our 30 Anniversary. renewed our vows on the beach.(we arranged that prior to our trip). The pool was Ok but we spent most of our time at the ocean. Staff was so helpful and the entire experience was wonderful. Would stay here again.

I stayed at this resort for 5 days as part of the vacations for Vets program, so we interacted with the people in charge of time shares. They were VERY helpful, especially Keysha (sp) who helped us with restaurants, party spots, and other "tourist" ideas. Our room had a balcony that overlooked the street, we had a nice kitchen (but we didn't cook) and it was in the middle of EVERY thing. Right next door was Hilton Hawaiian Village that had a pool and beach that we enjoyed everyday. I would ABSOLUTELY stay there again, oh and almost all the tours pick up in front of the resort :)

We found this apartment/condo online when researching a place to stay in Honolulu. It was way cheaper than staying in a hotel room. The apartment was lovely and had just about everything you could need. Full kitchen , small lounge area and comfy king size bed. The only downside was the pillows were very soft. The view from the lanai was amazing(12th floor overlooking the ocean).Self Check in and out was seamless, the condo/ apartment was spotlessly clean and beautifully made up. The real bonus was no one was in your room tidying. So very private (which we liked).There were a few nice restaurants and shops in the area and only a very short bus ride to hundreds more. Buses stopped right outside the hotel.Would definately stay here again. There was a laundry room on each floor, very handy. near the beach but not in the center of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki/ Honolulu. Also the Friday night fireworks at the Hilton were visible from our Balcony.

This hotel is fantastic! The hotel rooms that have a view of either the ocean or of the mountains.We had a suite and there was more than enough room for three of us. We were walking distance of the mall and the Waikiki district! The staff were all friendly and very helpful

We stayed in unit 1522, we rented from a private condo owner @ WaikikiBeachrental.com. It has everything you need. View of beach is excellent. Extremely clean and neat. It was our honeymoon. We will definitely stay there again! Best trip ever!

Loved this place. We had an amazing view to the ocean and lagoon from our 11th floor unit. The little coffee shop on sight was a blessing great coffee. Bar and grill worth sampling. The location was akey pick up point for most tours. Easy walk into heart of Waikiki.

Handy location, Very accommodating, upon arrival no record of booking through the on-line booking agency however very accommodating to seek resolution of same. The room was enormous and fully self contained and magnificent views of Waikiki beach from the 20th floor. The Ilikai restaurant was fantastic and the setting (as per photos) was just as great unfortunately we only had a one night stay as was a stop over from Vegas back to Brisbane ! Would not hesitate to stay at the Ilikai, if ever in Oahu again.

Great room, beautiful view, very helpful concierge and valet, great patio (not crowded) and Bar and Grill had great food with very reasonable prices. Best place on Waikiki for the price. Would definitely stay here next trip

Stayed at the Ilikai, not in one of the hotel rooms but in a time share. Nice hotel, next to the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Well kept, great pool, grounds and access to the beach. Would stay here again.

Since we had such a great stay at the Ilikai before and after our cruise last trip, I decided to stay there for my whole "girl trip" with my granddaughter. It did not disappoint me. We were unexpectedly upgraded to a kitchenette, which turned out great. We were able to pick up some groceries and lounge around in the mornings since we could make our own breakfast. The location is so close to the Ala Moana mall and the lagoon, both of which my 12 year old granddaughter loved and we spent hours at. This time we were provided with not only beach towels, but beach chairs to take along to the beach. All kinds of transportation and tours stop right in front of the hotel, so it's easy to get a ride to what you want to do. Sarento's Italian restaurant at the top of the hotel is a bit spendy, but EXCELLENT and the view is amazing. It was just a wonderful stay!

We are staying in two condominium one for my parents and one for my husband and I. When we first step out of rental car we were treated like royalty. A personal note with cookies was waiting for us in our room (mom got the cookies but no note) then we got a call to make sure the room was comfortable. Our suit cases were there before us the young man ( forgot his name) offered to take my parents suitcase to there rooms and retrieved several other items for them no question asked. He was so nice! John was also good at the front desk! Could not ask for anything better! One bad thing very minor not enough room on the counter space in the bathroom

Angie H. The Ilikai Hotel & Suites ~ ~ Definitely a great location, with a genuine "Aloha- Spirit" welcome! Was on a brief business trip this time, but am a repeat guest having traveled from the outer islands. It's consistently clean and comfortable with an unpretentiously relaxing atmosphere making it a destination to look forward to, ~ providing a "home-away-from-home feeling." Have always found the staff to be genuinely helpful & professional.

Stayed in an oceanfront room (680 sq ft) newly-renovated, on 5th floor, with kitchen. So quiet, so relaxing, and so well-appointed. Excellently located back from the hectic scene of the beach and traffic on Ala Moana Blvd. We long for another chilled out week in this place, our fave accommodations on Oahu.

Clean, comfortable hotel in a great location near to shopping, sea and sand. Minutes walking distance to downtown Honolulu and designer shopping stores and eateries. Family friendly, not for pets. Parking across the street behind Red Lobster for $20.00 per day.

I have been twice to the Ilikai and found the hotel to represent the true aloha feeling, yep its a classic and there are newer kids on the block but this is one of the grand dames of hotels and you feel it when you pull up to the driveway. the views are stunning the staff warm and delightful and they play vintage Hawaii 5-O in the lobby. never hesitate to return, the place just keeps getting better.

We had a private vacation rental here that works out excellent value compared to a hotel stay. You get the hotel facilities for less money. The only thing missing is wifi and room service. If you want to be away from all the noise of downtown Waikiki then this is a great spot, but it is a bit of a walk if you are constantly wanting to dine etc down the other end of town. Hotel is a little dated but everything in Waikiki generally is.

Booked this with Marina Hawaii Vacations for 6 nights in July 2014. Best view you can imagine, especially to see the 4th of July Fireworks. The view is over the lagoon and marina. Jaw dropping stuff! The unit is very well decked out, with all appliances needed. Only issue is it gets very hot and air-conditioning didn't handle it at all. Clean and spacious and very quiet.The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms great.Walking distance to beach, ala moana and all other essentials in Waikiki.We used the lagoon for swimming, canoeing etc and the beach further over for swimming.Only issue was that it took over an hour to check in after a 11 hour flight from Melbourne, so that was a big disappointing. This was in the level 2(?) office.

We spent 8 nights at the Ilikai and really enjoyed our stay, this is our 2nd time there and would definitely recommend it. Its only a couple of minutes walk down to the beach and a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping centre, which has great shopping and restaurants. The walk along the beach to the heart of Waikiki took only 20minutes. The views from our condo & lanai were magical, we overlooked the marina and the ocean and the condo was clean and tidy, with sliding doors between the bedroom and living area. The bistro/bar of the Ilikai was really good and the service and food spot on. Meals were very well priced and so were the drinks.

Our privately owned studio condo was well equipped and maintained, and we really made good use of its huge fridge and good cooking facilities. Whilst the Ilikai is on the edge of Waikiki proper, it overlooks the Hilton lagoon and the marina, and the ocean beyond. It's right on a bus stop and the huge Ala Moana shopping complex is an easy 10 minute walk away. The condo was a good size for two singles or a couple, but would be very cramped with more than two. Furnishings were good, though the lanai furniture was showing a few signs of wear. We booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals, who were easy to deal with and efficient. I really liked the fact that their website photos and description were completely accurate. A couple of minor irritations were the wifi, which kept dropping out and having to be reset, and the air conditioning, which struggled to pull the temperature down. Having said that, we found maintenance, which we called on to fix the bathroom door handle, extremely prompt and efficient. I should have reported the air con I guess, but I was too busy having a holiday!!I'd certainly recommend this apartment, and I'd go back.

The hotel (condo) room was fabulous, clean, modern and had a great view. The kitchenette was well set up. We used valet parking, and they were quick, polite, and courteous. Awesome location. While the hotel is older, it had a great ambience in the lobby and bar. Couldn't ask for more.

We spent 5 nights in condo 833 booked through Aloha Condos. Their system of booking and entry using a push code on the lock works well. The condo was on the side with a view to the marina and Magic Island. I note other people saying the noise was a problem but not on this side of the building. Loved the condo and having a kitchen etc was great. There is a lovely lanai which we spent most our time on. I thought this was excellent value. The pool for this complex needs updating but as the beach is so close and the pool at the Modern Honolulu next door looks wonderful too. Guess you could go there for a drink and meal. We never used the Ilikai pool. The supermarket shop in the building was handy. The location 20 minutes walk along the beach to the main Waikiki beach was perfect as quieter at this end but close enough to walk or catch The Bus there. The Ala Moana shopping centre is 10 minutes walk and there is a great food hall here and also a Foodlands supermarket for supplies. One thing that was not straight forward was getting connected to the free wifi. They need to make it clearer if the password has a O in it is it number or a letter.

We stayed 5 nights at Ilikai apartment Unit 2022 which faces the lagoon and the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The apartment had a well appointed kitchen and also fast Wifi, large TV and a comfortable bed. The location is down the quieter end of the beach which has the advantage of being away from the noisy night life but is a little further to walk to the main beach & shops. There are restaurants nearby and a bus stop right out the front so it’s easy to get around without a car. The foodland at the Ala Moana Center was the best spot for groceries (a 15min walk or short bus ride) but there are also ABC shops very close for supplies. We booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals and found them very good. We were even able to arrange a late afternoon check out as there were no guests the following day. If you are looking for a peaceful location with great views and the ability to prepare some of your own meals then these apartments are perfect.

My wife and I arrived on a Saturday morning to a clean room with a great view overlooking the boat harbor and ocean views. The front desk staff greeted us as though we were long lost friends. We especially liked the fact that we could walk to Ala Moana shopping center and the Ala Moana beach park where the locals hang out. The hotel itself is very clean and well maintained. The lobby is spacious and has an enormous outdoor area with tables and chairs overlooking the boat harbor and ocean. Would we stay there again? In a heartbeat! Great location.

We enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai - convenient location and the Waikiki trolley stops right in front, as do tour buses. I chose it because of the kitchen (not too many hotels offer this) and it was a good move as we could make breakfast and store leftovers. The fact that room cleaning wasn't daily was no issue for us as clean towels and additional coffee packs are available upon request and the staff is really friendly. Location right next to Hilton was great for evening strolls with live music. Only problem was that I reserved a suite with a partial ocean view and was given a room with two double beds, view to the city - still not sure how that went wrong but, overall, was a good place to stay.

We stayed at condo #1629 by booked through waikikibeachrentals.com.The room was very clean and the bed was really comfortable to sleep. I have no complain about this room. The hotel itself have several store, bars, and cafes which it really nice. The Ilikai hotel is little outdated but they are doing renovation while I was staying there. They are improving the lobby driveway, repainting the wall, and etc. They have 2 options parking which it self parking or valet parking. I do valet parking and they did a great job which I have no complaint.

We had a family holiday in May 14 on Oahu, staying 7 nights in condo 1334 at the Iliaki apartments. Great location, short distance by public transport to Waikiki beach. we had an ocean and lagoon view room, the apartment was well serviced a short stroll to the lagoon and beach, close to shops and the restaurants, I can thoroughly recommend the Iliaki and condo 1334.

Arrived late evening, and a quick and easy check-in. We were on one of the top floors, so a great view to the sea. Rooms were of a reasonable size. Couldn't really fault anything. Everything worked, and everything was clean. Close to the Sheraton complex so a large range of meal options available.

We have just spent a wonderful week in 1540. The unit was clean, bright and well equipped. The view from the balcony was fantastic. We spent hours watching the surfers and the activity in the lagoon. We also watched the Hawaiian Village Luau each night. likai is at the quieter end of Waikiki and our unit was very peaceful at night. It was great to be able to walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. This was the first week of a month in Hawaii and we didn't want to have to eat out for the entire month. Having a kitchen was a bonus. We bought our supplies from Foodland in the Ala Moana Centre. A great selection of fresh fruit and vegetables and reasonable prices. Ask to become a member of their club when you go through the checkout and you will make big savings. We went stand up paddle boarding most days but we walked up the beach and hired from the company next to the statue of Duke - the surfer. They were much cheaper and friendlier than the hire companies outside the Hawaiian Village. Our week in 1540 was an excellent start to our holiday

We stayed in a condo, which we booked through Waikiki Rentals, who were very efficient. Our condo #1409 was lovely - plenty of room with two bathrooms and two bedrooms. Our beds were all comfy (very important) and everything was clean and tidy. The Foodland supermarket is close by at Ala Moana and as our condo had a full kitchen, we had our breakfasts and a few dinners in. There was a nice outlook towards the Marina from one balcony, and the Ala Moana Centre is a short walk away. We were very comfortable here.

Returned to Honolulu to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary with all our family and grandchildren. Loved the location of the Ilikai Hotel on Waikiki Beach. You MUST go see Dana at the Concierge Desk. She saved us a ton of money on our sight tickets --- a lot of $$$ were saved by going through her. Very knowledgeable, helpful, concerned about your good time while in Hawaii, etc.! She became part of our family as she was that much of an asset to us. The hotel is older as we stayed there in 1968. Had ocean view, quick running elevators, good bed and linens, very clean, nice pool and attendants there. Hotel had some construction and was a bit inconvenient. There was an outdoor elevator to assist with your luggage since the escalator wasn't operating. Had 11 family members there. Be sure to see Dana at the Concierge Desk!!! She is great. Hotel personnel for the most part were nice. Always had freshly made lemon water and cups near front desk for you to enjoy. Not bad at all. It's time for a little more furniture renovations though. The restaurant/bar/grill on the ground level was a good place to eat. Friendly staff there. You must see the sights of the city from the top of the Ilikai at the Italian Restaurant! It's pricey but nice way to end your trip.

We actually stayed in a condo not in a hotel room but, the building was very nice and very well kept up considering how old it was. The concierge service was excellent. It was our first time to Hawaii and they were very helpful and informative. Watching fireworks from the terrace at the marina was a wonderful experience.

Lovely, old hotel. We had ocean-view room and the view was nice from our 22nd floor room. Small couch in room was dirty and cushions were truly coming apart. Bed was good, kitchen area and coffeemakers were good, housekeeping service was good and you never had to wait on the elevator even at peak times. Pool is small, but well maintained. Constant construction at front of hotel and ever changing foot traffic flow. Escalator worked on occasion. Most of the front desk personnel were nice, but we had one gentleman who was down right rude when we asked questions. We were there 10 days with 11 family members.

The condo with an ocean view was very nice. The city bus, trolly, and tour buses stop right in front of the hotel. Another great feature was the hotel restaurant with the best salads and reasonable entrees.

My husband and I returned to stay at the Ilikai hotel nearly 2 years after our first visit and once again, we were NOT disappointed. We rented a condo within the Ilikai which was a bit dated, but that doesn't matter when you get ocean view overlooking the Hilton lagoon! We spent hours on our lanai people-watching and getting our sneak peek of the Hilton luaus. The 2 bedroom unit was also a great value when split between 2 couples. The small grocery store within the Ilikai is SO convenient. Everything we needed was just an elevator ride away and it's relaxing not to have to get out onto busy sidewalks and traffic just to pick up a carton of milk. If you are traveling to Waikiki for the first time, it may look (on a map) that the Ilikai is a bit far from the action, but don't let the map fool you. You can walk to many areas of Waikiki in minutes, and it's nice to be away from the middle of the hustle and bustle. You can pay twice as much to be in the 'middle' of the beach, but I'd rather spend that money on excursions and shopping!

First let me say that we rented a private condo from a leasing agent and did not deal directly with the Ilikai or any of the staff. In doing this, we did not have access to the fitness center but we did have access to the other amenities. The location of the Ilikai is excellent and the view we had of the ocean and lagoon from our lanai were very beautiful. The lobby is very pretty, clean, and inviting and there are a couple of shops (a boutique and a convenience type store) and this is very convenient when you didn't want to venture to an ABC Store or Foodland for some immediate needs. The pool was small but very nice (not many people using while we were there) and the water was perfect temperature. As I stated previously, we rented a private condo (2 bedroom and 2 bath) and it suited our needs very well. The decor was very dated and the tv in the master bedroom did not have sound but who goes to Hawaii to spend time in the room anyway. I would definitely stay here again.

That's how long I have been "guesting" at the Ilikai . Great pool and ocean views. I love the location--at the edge of Waikiki (away from the hustle/bustle) and walking distance to Ala Moana shopping center, the premier international and local shopping mall with nearly 300 stores. The YMCA is a 5 minute walk from Ilikai. With a guest pass, at a reasonable fee, you can use the workout facilities and take classes. The hotel has a small Fitness Room with weights and cardio equipment. The location is on the first floor not far from the lobby & the "hall" side of the gym is all glass which is great for security if you like to work out late PM or early AM. Guest rooms are HUGE & some have fully equipped kitchens unlike the majority of hotel rooms in Waikiki. Food and supplies can be purchased at a grocery store across the street. Retail shops at the Hotel are just so so. Large convenience/sundries store is adequate. More dining options would be nice; however, not a big problem because just steps away from the Hotel are numerous food options. There are laundry facilities on each floor. Free Wi-Fi in rooms. Across the street is the Chart House restaurant. Happy Hour sunsets are breathtaking. I will definitely stay there again. Honolulu trips.

We stayed for 4 nights after staying next door at the Hilton. We chose this hotel because of the location and the price. We liked the idea of having our own kitchen and we had done some thorough research online and it seemed great value for money. The room was large and perfect for a family. It was very clean and the beds were comfortable but maybe a little on the hard side. I was really impressed with the room and the view. The kids loved the deep pool and we could walk to the lagoon. We ate at the restaurant and it was good value for money as well plus they had entertainment which we thoroughly enjoyed. We used the kitchen and it was a great way to save money by not having to eat out all the time. I would definitely stay again!!

We received a gift certificate for a room from a friend, who knew we had a pleasant stay previously. We stayed on the 22nd floor and it was fantastic! The unit was very comfortable, with a full kitchen and superb view. We only live 20 minutes away and will more than likely make thisour staycation hotel. Visitors as well as Kamaainas will love it!!

Never stayed their before..22nd floor..the oceanfront view was spectacular..the beds were comfortable and the air conditioning in every room was fabulous! Value for this wasn't bad either..the pool could have used a little updating, but it was still great to get into in the evening hours.

We booked this hotel/suite after doing some research online. Most of the moderate hotes in Honolulu were noted as worn and old. The suite we got was not only very clean,but it was modern and updated.The kitchen was good and the appliances clean and very functional. The countertops were granite and that was a nice touch. The hotel location was key,it was centrally located and therefore easy to get around Waikki. You can either take the buses which ran on Ala Moana Blvd or pick up a taxi. We got a rental car from the airport for the last 2 days of our trip and travelled around the island. Parking at the Ilikai was easy,we just gave our keys to the valet and they handled the rest. The price was steep,it was $28.00 a day !Overall it was an excellent place to stay and if you are very picky like my wife is about things being clean-you will probably like this place. The only draw back for us was traffic noise, it is noticeable if you are on the city side. It was not horrible and didn`t prevent us from sleeping,but it was noticeable. The pool is clean,but on the small side. Walk to the beach is 2-4 minutes,but you will need to rent chairs and an umbrella for about $40-50 a day.(ouch) We were pleasantly surprised by our trip to Waikki as we had heard it was crowded and busy,we never really felt that way.

We stayed on the 21st floor and I have to say I thought the place was fantastic value for money. When I compare what we paid to the other prices around it was great. We had a fantastic ocean view, the room was nice with a good kitchen. The hotel pool was really good and we were only a few minutes walk to the beach and lagoon. The air conditioning was good and quiet and there was even a phone in the room with free local calls. We will be back hopefully.

We stayed in unit 1231 which we booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals. This unit had a great view overlooking the marina with a full kitchen a queen bed and a single bed. This unit was easy to book online with all instructions payments etc. done seamlessly through email and was a great saving compared with booking through the hotel. The location of the Ilikai means it is within walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping centre as well as to Waikiki beach and the great number of shops and eating places available there. Room was very clean with a full kitchen, lanai, reverse cycle airconditioning, flat screen TV , good bathroom and lots of kitchen items. The only downside was the comfort of the couch as it was in need of a new cushion so don't rent this unit if someone is to sleep on it. Another good point to the Ilikai is that there is a coffee shop with light snacks, an outdoor casual restaurant and a more upmarket restaurant all in the same complex.

Stayed at the Ilikai 32 years ago. Two visits in June 2014, show that this property has not just become tired, it's comatose. We would have not gone back for the second visit in June had we not prepaid. The hotel looks like it is undergoing a long, slow refurb and boy does it need it. The first visit was 3 nights in a room on the 22nd floor. Curtains hanging off the tracks, power points falling out of the wall, cleanliness marginal and the bathroom and shower have probably not been updated since the place was built. The second visit of 2 nights (Level17) was a bit better with a partially refurbed room, but still an ancient bathroom.They neglected to service the room without a reminder.If you pay, you get good ocean vies and the rooms are a good size.Staff were just going through the motions with little enthusiasm.Certainly won't be making a return visit to the Ilikai!

This is our fifth stay in unit 527 at the Ilikai and we plan on returning. We absolutely LOVE this hotel and won't stay anywhere else. The unit is totally renovated, modern and clean. Full kitchen with every tool we need to cook, bamboo floors, flat screen TV, and most importantly, gorgeous views of the ocean, harbor, sunset, and garden/water fall below. We book through Marina Hawaii Vacations.

The location of this hotel is good. The hotel itself is a little dated but for the price it's worth it. From our balcony we could see the Luau at the hotel next door. My friends and I had a excellent time in Hawaii and basically just used the hotel as a place to sleep.

LOVED THIS HOTEL! Great price for our family. Staff was nice. Room was big. Beds were comfy. Bathroom was nice! Loved the room view. We had a wonder time staying here. Restaurant's & shopping all around the hotel. We walked everywhere. Friday night we were walking on the beach and watched fire works. It was one of our favorite family vacations. The only thing I did not like was paying for parking. It was pricey. But downtown Hawaii doesn't have parking so it was nice not worrying.

Really enjoyed are holiday as part of a multi-trip to Los Angeles, Hawaii (Oahu) and Las Vegas, we will definitely be going back and would recommend to all.Nicole at the concierge is also amazing! helped me in planning my proposal to my gorgeous fiance. She is very knowledgeable and helpful, the tips and trips she recommended really made our holiday so a big MAHOLA to you Nicole!

We recently stayed for a week at the Ilikai in one of the Ocean view Suites with Kitchen. The room had been nicely renovated, quite spacious and had everything we needed. The best part about this hotel is it's location - directly opposite the beach, short 10 min walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre in one direction, and in the other direction a very pleasant walk to the main part of Waikiki.Highly recommend this hotel, and the prices were hard to beat.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for the 2nd time. Both times in their 2 bedroom suite. The first with an ocean view which was spectacular! The 2nd time we couldn't get the ocean view so we had to settle for the mountain view and to our surprise it was interesting and beautiful at night. Really what made the stay wonderful is the suite. It was very spacious and clean. My family of 4 adults and 2 children enjoy the suites because we are not separated and can enjoy each other's company throughout our "stay cation."We cooked our own breakfast which was convenient because some of us like to sleep in while we early risers could have our coffee and read the paper (which was provided) and leisurely socialize. While the Ilikai is not in the heart of Waikiki, the walk into the heart of it is doable. We enjoyed it as an activity. Driving to Ala Moana beach and Mall is easy to do due to it's location and valet service. Parking fees were reasonable compared to other hotels we've stayed. Most of all the staff was friendly and accommodating.

Great location and at least half the price as Hilton Hawaiian village. Awesome staff from Front desk and housekeeping as hey make you feel you are in a 4-5 star hotel.Will definitely stay here again and will recommend as the savings by staying here can be use towards food and shopping. Rooms are well furnished as stayed at room # 1430 that has an ocean and lagoon view.

We had no idea what to expect when we booked our condo at the Ilikai. We arrived and were pleasantly surprised. It was very clean, the staff was friendly and the location was excellent. Many tours used the Ilikai as a pick up/drop off site and we were right at the beginning of the Waikiki Beach District and could walk so many places. The Pink line trolley stops right at the flagpole and for $2.00, you get to ride all around Waikiki for an overview. We would definitely stay there again.

If you are looking for a fancy upgraded hotel, then look elsewhere. This is a nice, but a bit dated hotel in a great location.
