Pros:Several restaurants onsiteClose to Hilton Village that is almost like a small town with restaurants and shopping Remodeled roomsClose to ocean. Five minute walkWalking distance to a lot of restaurantsCons:Hotel is datedExpensive parking. Just take the busExpensive food. Walk to walmart and you'll save a fortune on food.

Love the location. Warm and friendly hotel and have recommended to others to stay. Currently being updated but it did not interfere with our holiday. Staff very friendly. Great size room. Close to shops, restaurants, activity pickups at front door. Great place

Going to Hawaii had been my dream vacation since I was a little girl. When I retired, I decided I ,would make this dream come true! It was an 'all girls' trip for me, my mom and sisters--what an awesome vacation and one we will never forget. We booked through Priceline, so it was a roll of the dice but it did not disappoint! The Ilikai's location is great--there buses and trolleys stop right outside the hotel! For $2 or so, you can take the bus to Waikiki Beach, the Waikiki aquarium, Sea Life Park and the shopping centers are everywhere. There's nightly luaus right downstairs, at the restaurant (where the food is great, by the way). Their breakfast buffets are the best, you'll think you died and went to heaven! The grounds are well kept and beautiful, very exotic feel. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean...and the views from the balcony are picturesque! Love the Ilikai and would love to go back!
user_name:
m00kii
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I stayed at The Ilikai Hotel & Suites in a 1 bed condo suite on the 28th floor during May.We found the whole complex to be clean, fresh, and well presented. Our suite well well appointed with ensuite shower room, a kitchenette with breakfast bar & full fridge/freezer, living area and double bed. We opted for a room that overlooked the lagoon, and thus had a perfect view of both the Friday night fireworks and the rooftop luau on the adjacent hotel. Laundry facilities are available on each floor near the main lifts.Rooms that overlook the marina would have a nice view out to sea too, but rooms facing the roadway might be somewhat noisier with the traffic etc. Our room was nice and quiet at night.The complex has a small Bar/Grill which serves good food, and lovely cocktails.There is a pool and sun lounger area that is private for residents & guests, and which has Ilikai wifi available. Separate wifi was provided in our room. This was an issue for us as it saved on UK roaming charges when contacting home. One slight negative observation regarding the pool area is the limited number of parasols (3 or 4 only) that are over tables & chairs.It is a 10 to 15 minute stroll from the Ilikai to the main Waikiki nightlife area, but the beach is only a couple of minutes away. The large Ala Moana shopping mall is a 10 minute stroll in the opposite direction & there are several very good dining establishments nearby. We liked this as it meant we were just out of the hustle & bustle of the main tourist/nightlife area, but within easy walking distance of everything we needed or wanted.Parking in the area is at a premium, but the nearby Waikiki Marina Resort at The Ilikai parking garage do a 24hr for $20 rate. Otherwise on street parking is around $1 per hour and is time restricted. there are plenty of shuttle busses that pass the door, so unless you are touring the island, a car is not really necessary. If you do want a car for a few days, consider pricing one for individual days rather that block booking. It might work out less expensive.All things considered, the Ilikai is an excellent holiday resort well worth considering.

We just spent 3 nights at the Ilikai and after spending 4 at a much more luxurious high end hotel down the street we would choose the Ilikai any time we returned to Waikiki. We arrived-805 am from disembarking the cruise ship and even though check in wasn't till 3pm, Chester was able to check us in to our room with a fabulous view on floor 22 by 815!Great location -so close to Alamoana and the trolley stops right out the front.

We booked this condo on VRBO, and it was managed by Marina Hawaii Vacations. Service from them was amazing from start to finish, and we would just go direct through them next time.Apartment was perfect size and location for myself and my wife. We were looking for something just slightly away from the main strip of Waikiki but in walking distance, so this was perfect.The pool is great, although a little small, but that seems to be the case with lots of pool hotels in Waikiki.Our room faced the lagoon in front of the Hilton, and we had a beautiful view of the ocean.The entire place was nice and relaxing, and it was not crowded at all, like lots of the other hotels in Waikiki. No waiting for elevators or in a line for valet.Really recommend this property, and the apartment specifically that we stayed in. Excellent value for money, especially when you are out and about most of the day/night and not really using the hotel facilities.

We stayed in apartment 518 & our friends were in the apartment next door. Check in was seamless as it had all been done online thru Waikiki Beach Rentals. Apartments were clean and well maintained. We were surprised to find no wine glasses in our apartment and it was a nuisance to have to buy a set . Location is brilliant. Easy walking distance to Ala Moana shopping mall. Bus to Costco, Pearl harbour etc outside the front. Good little supermarket 2 minutes walk. Coffee shop downstairs had a limited menu but there were plenty of other places to eat close by. Would definitely recommend if you want a bit of space, ability to cook for yourself and don't need daily cleaning or all the bells and whistles of a hotel.

Great customer service from valet parking to checking in at hotel front desk. Cleanliness of room was excellent. Great facilities. Swimming pool was clean & great laundry facilities. Convinient to shopping locations.

We stayed in 1543 with our Adult family of 3,Total of 5. There was so much room we almost lost each other .Every conceivable appliance[Inc own laundry] on hand, if you need it , its there. Convient location ,Stunning views & stunning lanai's. Would highly recommend this condo to any family or group travelling to Waikiki. Check in was a great surprise, we arrived way early and had access to our room about 11 am instead off 3pm. Highly Recommended.

We stayed at the Ilikai in March for 10 nights. We booked our Condo through VRBO #290807 Captains Condo which room 1638.It had a stunning view and everything supplied.The location was good and the lagoon beautiful.Pool area was well maintained.Buses and tours were easy for pickup just outside the hotel.The Ilikai Bar and Grill was great and very reasonable for breakfasts, dinners and cocktails.The Coffee shop was fantastic.Charthouse was our favourite place to watch the sunset over the marina and the cocktails were very good so was the food and entertainment.We would stay in this location again.

We stayed in a 1 brm with our 18 month old. Full kitchen, proximity to the lagoon and the hilton for dinners out made it a great option for children. It's also a short walk to the mall which was great. My husband went for a Stand Up Paddle board out the front every morning whilst we played in the lagoon. Excellent value for money and friendly staff downstairs. The only drawback was that the railing on the balcony (which was a great size) was not child safe at all. Our 18 month old could have easily squeezed through and fallen 11 stories. Therefore, we only used it when he was in bed. It's quite amazing that the whole building had this unsafe feature. All that said, the positives outweighed that negative, we just had to be super careful with the door to the balcony.

My family and I are Kamaaina's (live on Oahu). We stayed overnight at the Ilikai Hotel & Suites. I was surprised to see how nice the hotel looked, considering that the hotel has been around for a long time. Ilikai made many renovations to the hotel and are continuing to make more renovations. We stayed in a room facing the city. The room was 600 sq. ft., (bigger than many other hotel rooms at other hotels). We had a kitchen which included utensils, dishes, microwave, stove with oven, and a big refrigerator. The room included two queen size beds and a sofa sleeper. It also had a lanai which we liked. The Ilikai has a salt water heated pool which my family and I loved. The pool was heated to a perfect temperature. The day that we utilized the pool it was windy, and the pool felt great! The hotel room and common areas are very clean. Quiet rooms, and the location of Ilikai was great. It is close to a ABC store, Buffalo wild wings, and Ihop. Alamoana shopping center is nearby as well, about a 2-3 minute drive.

Our first trip to Hawaii was made so memorable by having wonderful accommodations at the Ilikai. The condo room was fully furnished, extremely spacious and offered a magnificent view of the lagoon and ocean. A true trip to Paradise! We will definitely be back.

My husband and I were traveling with my sister so I had called the hotel a couple of times before making the reservation to be sure that we would be in a 1 bedroom, King bed and a sleeper sofa with an ocean view.. My fault for not calling back and re confirming when our email confirmation just said Ocean View and did not give a good description of the room type. The room we got had 2 double beds and a sleeper sofa. When I called the front desk I was advised that they did not have any 1 bedroom rooms available because those rooms were being renovated. I asked for a room with a king size bed and was advised they did not have one with a sleeper sofa. I was not very happy about the situation but decided that I was not going to waste the last day of my vacation fighting about a room. This hotel is very obviously needing renovations, every part of the room seemed very dated. The bathroom was the size of a closet, the sink was cracked and wall paper was loose in some places. We did have a view of the Marina and ocean but I'm not sure it was worth the $300 plus price tag.

This was our first time in Hawaii. We found location was great. It's a really nice 20min walk along the beach to get to Waikiki. Swimming anywhere along this sandy stretch is great. Lots of browsing to be had at neighbouring Hilton shops. Lots of restaurants too. The Ala Moana Shopping Mall is a short bus strip, two or three stops or a 15 min walk. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel. Bus fares to Waikiki or Ala Moana are $2.50 per trip, good value. We had a room on 20th floor with really great views overlooking the marina. The room size was was fine. The bathroom was a little tired but ok. The roof top hotel Sarrento's is worth a try, it has great views all along the shore. The pool was good, heated to a nice temp. I would stay here again, especially at the discounted rate we managed to get.

We recommend this hotel for:* location - at the western end of Waikiki Beach overlooking the Marina* spacious from the lobby through to the rooms* quiet rooms* excellent lift service, even separate lifts for guests in swimmers* 2 in-house restaurants and a coffee shop* excellent mini-mart off the lobby which offers anything guests will need* excellent range of eating places nearby including the great value Red Lobster Restaurant* a great Concierge/booking service* helpful staff

The location was perfect - easy to get to shopping, the convention center and within walking distance of great restaurants. The front desk staff's over the top in accommodating your needs and in answering questions about the island. They exhibit the true meaning of aloha!

We stayed at the Ilikai Suites for almost 4 weeks - Dec 2013 and January 2014. We loved it!There is everything you could want at this Hotel. Our room was fantastic - full kitchen, bathroom, king bed and fold out sofa bed for our daughter - and the most amazing views over Ala Moana Beach Park - we will never get sick of that view. Our room looked out over the Marina and the beach. Awesome views everyday!We will definitely be back - can't wait to come back - miss Honoloulu already!!

This was my first time staying at this end of Waikiki (I am usually in the thick of it) and I did enjoy the quieter end of town. The presence of the Hilton next door means that there is lots of shops and restaurants nearby and it is walking distance to the heart of Waikiki and the Ala Moana shopping centre. The pool was a decent temperature and it was great having the option of the lagoon and beach nearby. We had a marina view room and it was great. My parents had a lagoon view and that was even better. I would most likely stay here again, but with my family would probably get a 2 bedroom condo for more space next time.

We stayed at the Ilikai on our Honeymoon. When we arrived we went up to the room and it was not clean. There was hair on the pillow cases and the bathroom was still dirty and when we asked the front desk about it they were very sorry and there had been a mix up in the cleaning department. They placed us in a second room and it was dirty as well. They said they would send someone up to clean it immediately. My husband and I were lying on the bed and without even knocking a lady came in from cleaning services. Hello, have you ever heard of knocking. Thank goodness we really were just lying on the bed. We left for a few hours in order for them to clean the room. When we arrived back the room had been cleaned, but when we turned on the air conditioner in the room it was broken and was dripping water all over the carpet below it and making a very loud noise. We had already moved rooms once and did not want to pack our stuff up again, so we dealt with it, but had to place a towel underneath the conditioner to soak up all the water! It was definitely a step down from the establishment we stayed at while on Kauai, and although the price was reasonable for Waikiki, it was not what we had hoped for on our honeymoon! We probably would not stay there again!

Stayed in apartment 1814 booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals in May 2014. Apartment exactly as shown on website... The ocean/lagoon view was amazing and we had grandstand view of the Hilton fireworks on Friday night. Excellent location with easy walking to beach and ala moana shopping centre and main waikiki beach. Would highly recommend apartment 1814 and booking through Waikiki Beach Rentals was easy and very professional.

Usually I stay at the Hawaiian Village next door. Sooo glad we stayed here instead! Our room was huge compared to HHV...they gave us beach chairs/towels, etc... Share the beach with HHV. The pool was nice too. Staff was friendly and everything was great. We were upgraded to an ocean view without asking--which made things even better!

just returned from our stay at the Ilikai , 1119 city/mountain view . this unit is a nicely redone condo equipped with anything a person would ever need got the beach . the bathroom is a bit dated but clean . there is more city view than mountain view but wasn't a problem for us . one of the best things about the ilikai was the elevators ,there are six , seven counting the bathers elevator . we probably never had to wait longer than a minute for a elevator , amazing for a hotel this size . the valet parking was outstanding , all the guys parking cars were friendly , courteous and helpful . the people at the front desk were a totally different story . they are all smiles and nice until they find out that you are staying in a condo then they turn rude and uncooperative . this happened on several occasions so it wasn't just one person having a bad day . they must have some problem with the people staying in the condos .the ilikai worked out well for our purpose and for the price was difficult to beat .

my husband have stayed at the Ilikai 4 times now and will definitely be back. It's at the end of the strip away from noisy, crowded Waikiki. You can easily walk to the busy area but it's nice to go back to some quiet and great views. We had a kitchen this time which was nice, but when I go on holidays I don' t want to cook. We did eat most of our breakfasts on our lanai. beautiful view of the Marina and the beach. We love the Ilikai, the staff is very helpful, the women that cleaned our room, Trudy was wonderful, very friendly and she did a great job everyday. this is a great place to stay, you should give it a try.

First time to Oahu and we stayed at the Ilikia. The resort is right at the start of Waikiki beach. Easy access to the beach and lagoon. At first we were in a room on the city side and the noise from the street was so loud we asked to be moved to the other side and the staff was absolutely wonderful about moving us. We were moved to the beach view side which was much better. The bar and restaurant were great. The pool area does need some updating but it is fine. The suite was perfect for my husband and I. All buses and tours stopped in front of the hotel. Great shopping not to far from the hotel.

The hotel service and quality is standard. Good access to the beach and hope to have bigger pool to relic where always occupied by small kids.The cleanness of the room is standard. Stay 5 nights but may not stay here again.

We spent 3 nights at this hotel on a stopover and it was wonderful. Great views, friendly staff and a very nice outdoor restaurant, with great value meals downstairs. It is walking distance to Alamona shopping centre, but a long way from the Wakiki strip but buses stop outside all the time.

My husband and I spent a week at the Ilikai Hotel and Suites. The suite was spacious, and the location was perfect. The concierge was extremely helpful, I look forward to returning to Ilikai on our next trip to Wakiki Beach.

My wife and I just returned from a week at the Ilikai Hotel and Suites. The hotel exterior appears a bit dated compared to the surrounding, newer resorts. However, walking into the lobby and seeing the beautiful marble floors and undated interior changed our initial impression. We celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary with an exquisite dining experience at Serentos on the 30th floor. I would highly recommend this resort--but definitely don't miss Serentos if visiting Honolulu.
user_name:
Don K
Missoula, Montana, United States

review_body: The Ilikai Hoel and suites is an oceanfront high rise hotel/condominium.This property has views of the Marina, the Lagoon and the Mountains - hotel rooms or full kitchen rooms. The building rents by private owners or through the hotel chain (Agua). There is a mini supermarket (for that extra snack or whatever), a restaurant, spa, free WI-FI and a pool on the premises. Also the property is within walking distance to a very large shopping mall, two beaches and direct walking into Waikiki via the beach path. There is access to all buses and free trolleys that stop right in front of this property. There are many restaurants within walking distance of this property including a 24 hour coffee shop.Our large room faced the Marina with a fully equipped kitchen and a large balcony that had afternoon sun and beautiful sunsets. If you want morning sun then take the Lagoon beach side. We rented from the hotel chain directly – prices were reasonable since the room, with the full kitchen, is like a large studio apartment. All floors have a washing machine and dryer for your use.The staff in the lobby was very helpful and nice they even gave us beach chairs and large beach towels (which we could exchange every day for clean towels). Whatever we needed (extra towels, soap, plates, glasses etc) the staff at the hotel went out of their way to get it for us. We were very confortable during our stay.in our renovated room. I highly recommend staying here even if for only a few days.

Ilikai has great location, close to Beach, shopping and what is great to easy to get in and out with car.We had Laguna view room...Fireworks from Hilton Laguna Long lanai with great view.This was my 3rd stay in Ilikai.Always good place to go back

We stayed one night at the Ilikai in March this year, while transiting for Molokai. We had wanted to stay here as it is the hotel featured in Hawaii 5-0 (Jack Lord) Room was on 18th floor, ocean view, very big, clean, bed very comfortable. Wish we could have stayed longer as having self catering kitchen would have been useful to us. Hotel location good, easy walking distance to local shops and cafés, marina and beach. Staff very helpful. Only problem we found was as we arrived late - 9 pm - hotel restaurants were closed and we felt too tired after long flight to wander round looking for place to eat. Staff said shop within hotel was open late, and we did find basics, bread and cheese, but very expensive. Pity hotel doesn't have coffee shop which is open late for snacks like sandwiches. But on the whole we would recommend this hotel

We stayed at the Ilikai during December as it was close to the start of the Honolulu marathon. We rented an apartment / condo through Waikiki Oceanfront rental and had no problem with our booking or arrival. We were given a pin code to let ourselves in to our apartment so be aware you will get no assistance from the front desk of the hotel. The building has a combination of privately owned condos and hotel rooms so make sure you choose wisely.Pros: our apartment was newly renovated and had a full kitchen. This made it very easy for us to prepare our own food if we had enough of going out. The view from the balcony was fantastic and the chairs very comfortable. The room had everything we expected including free wifi, shopping trolley and fully equipped kitchen. We enjoyed the pool area even though it is looking a bit tired. I believe they are building a new pool. The hotel also had some nice restaurants, spa and small supermarket. The biggest plus of the Ilikai is how close it is to the Ala Moana mall. We were in Hawaii to shop and this place was enormous.Cons: The Ilikai is at the very start of the Waikiki strip and it was a fairly decent walk (in the hot weather) up to the main area of Waikiki. This wasn't a huge drama as the buses and trolleys stopped at the front of the hotel.Overall, I would highly recommend the accommodation but make sure you know if you are booking a privately owned condo and check if it has been renovated.

Just spent 8 nights at the Ilikai in an Ocean front 2 bedroom apartment on the 22nd floor. Fantastic location, great view, great staff and clean and comfortable rooms. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel anytime. We liked the location as it was close enough to walk into central Waikiki but also just far enough to get way and relax from the crowds. The bar and grill on the ground floor serves great meals and good cocktails, a great spot to spend some time. Looking forward to coming back soon.

We stayed at the Ilikai Hotel and Suites for 8 nights in April and we were very happy with our choice. We had a two bedroom suite for 4 adults and it was large and roomy with a kitchen with a full size fridge also full size dining suite with 6 chairs. The room was ocean view and it certainly was overlooking the lagoon and the ocean and we got a good view of the fireworks Friday night. The beds were very very comfortable the bathrooms (2) were large and roomy. The hotel is 50 years old and it is a little dated in spots but they are renovating and our room had granite bench tops and large sink a 4 burner electric stove with oven which made having breakfast and light meals easy to make and enjoy on the 2 balconies 1 in the living area and one for the master bedroom. All in all we were very happy the cleaning staff did a great job everyday the reception staff were excellent and very knowledgeable and the valets did a great job with looking after our car and bringing it up for us to the main reception every time. The location was perfect out of the busy and noisy Waikiki Beach area but close enough to walk to. There is a large shopping mall about 10 minutes away the Ala Moana Mall and also an ABC grocery store across the road. When looking I compared the price per night of this hotel to others for the same amenities but could not find the same for the same price. I would recommend this hotel for sure and will return to the Ilikai.

We recently stayed here in a two bedroom ocean front room booked directly through the hotel. As many others have mentioned, the rooms are a little tired and in need of a face lift. But for us we found it to be clean and comfortable and the price was right compared to other hotels in the area. Our room had 2 balconies - one with the most amazing view of the ocean and was the perfect spot to watch the Friday fireworks. The other was a marina / city view and nothing overly special. The second bedroom does face that side and got a fair bit of garbage truck noice in the morning. We also had a massive lounge and a decent kitchen. My only advice would be that bar fridges are not appropriate for 2 bedroom apartments as you can't do a big enough shop to be able to cook for a few days. The bathroom in the main bedroom was huge but for some reason had the tiniest bath / shower I have ever seen. With the shower curtain pulled across I actually felt a bit claustraphobic!! The pool area is small and desperately needs to be redone. Having said that, we got the beach towels and chairs from hotel reception and spent most of our days at either the Hilton Lagoon or the beach. All in all, if you know not to expect 5 star luxury, you wont be disappointed. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend to others but tell them what to expect.

Very tired decor, hallway carpets were dirty and the pool was closed 3 1/2 days out of our 7 day stay, if we had known this would not have booked. The one plus was the location to the mall.We were also facing the street, asked to move room for ocean view, but were not able to accomodate us.

So for those who do not know the Ilikai is a mix of hotels and condo units. The condos are owned by many different people so it really is a mixed bag here. My review is about the overall facility and NOT about the unit we rented. Why am I making the distinction? Simply because my experience with my unit and owner is unique. The Ilikai is located at what I consider to be the very beginning of the Waikiki area. Shopping and restaurants are only a short walk away. With that said, you are not in the center of it all and will have to walk 15 minutes or so to find the crowd and the "action". Only you can determine if that is good or bad. In my opinion, Waikiki is meant to be walked. It's a bit like Vegas in that regard. There is good public transportation here but your legs are your best bet. Plan to use them. With that in mind, where on the stretch you begin really doesn't matter.The Ilikai is 50 years old but it is pretty well maintained for it's age. If you want or need frills, I suggest you pay the extra money and go to one of the high end places because I think you would be disappointed with that here. Personally, I do not see that as a negative. It's just a matter of preference. My rating is based on what you get for what you pay.

Just returned from five days at the Ilikai. Here are the pros and cons.Pros: Spacious rooms, although not the advertised 600 sq. ft. unless you include the large terrace. Nicely redecorated. Excellent and very quiet air conditioning. Comfortable beds and bedding. No tub, but large shower with plenty of water volume. Friendly staff. Good on-site restaurant on ground level.Cons: Many floors are mostly condos. The one next to us was being remodleled w/construction noise, etc. Hotel said, "We don't know anything about what the condo owners do." ?!? Just be aware that you are in a mixed-use facility with condos, renters, time shares, etc. "Ocean view" depends on what part of the Y-shaped hotel you are in. In our room it meant you can see the ocean if you lean out over the balcony. Otherwise you are looking at the highrise hotel next door. Evenings, the view is more remiscent of Manhattan than Hawaii, but that is true of just about all of Honolulu now. The Ilikai is not really a resort. They have a pool and a concierge plus attractive (and rarely crowded ) public areas. You can use the Hitlon's lagoon next door and the beach is about a block walk around the yacht harbor. No other activities that we could see.

Hello all! My wife and I stayed here 1 night (03 Oct.2013) in preparation for our transpacific cruise on Celebrity Solstice. This was a very unique hotel downtown Honolulu. In the back of the hotel, they were filming Hawaii 50, which I thought was pretty cool. There is a lagoon out back and then there is the beach. Glorious!!! The hotel was very nicely appointed with an indoor/outdoor courtyard restaurant which I personally found to be very neat indeed. The real reason for my post is the cruise!!! Celebrity Cruises is a n absolute fantastic choice for people that can't afford Crystal Cruises. Plus they offer "free" drink packages which saves you a bundle. Includes all drinks (booze, specialty coffees, fresh squeezed orange juice). I highly recommend this cruise line.

Stayed at The Ilikai in Honolulu for a week in March . It's a wonderful solid old style hotel . It must of been magnificent in its prime , it's now celebrating its fiftieth year anniversary . . 50 years it's a little tired but still in very good condition . The foyer is classic and beautiful . The views are amazing . There are three sections so views from your apartment depend on which way your balcony faces . We had a lovely view of the lagoon and the Friday night fireworks where other apartments face the marina or the front street . Also the apartments can differ on many levels , whether or not you have booked thru the hotel or private condos . Some are renovated fully some a little and some not at all . So getting a nice one is abit of luck . They have a lot of lifts maybe as many as six so waiting for a lift is quick . We went to the bar and grill and had an excellent fish lunch . There is always a doorman at the front lobby . There is a fully stocked shop also in the lobby which is handy and a coffee shop downstairs as well . The pool is always full no matter when you go there but the lagoon and beach are only a five minute walk and much nicer anyway . The balconys are a good size to sit on and have a drink in the afternoon . The apartments have kitchens so are great to prepare light meals , don't think I would be making a roast but a sandwich or salad they are perfect for . Beds comfortable and air conditioning is good . Lovely outside seating area and gardens are well kept . A lot of people live permanently at The Ilikai so the regulars are usually by the pool or sunning themselves . It has a great relaxed atmosphere and it's in a perfect position . I would definitely stay there again

We stayed at the Ilikia for 12 nights in condo 1718, which was booked though Waikiki beach rentals. We had no trouble with this company.The condo was very clean and well fitted out for our stay. We had a fantastic view, as mentioned in previous reviews there is truck noise in the early hours particularly Monday mornings. We have no complaints with the condo, it really was good valve for money.The beach closest to the hotel is not good, lots of rocks in the water, we walked further up for a better spot to swim.The hotel is a beautiful old Hawaiian hotel with lots of charm,the hotel appears to be well maintained and the staff very helpful.Would I stay here again maybe not, it's a bit out of the way .

My first experience with the Ilikai was as a college stutent here in the 1960's. It was the first highrise hotel on Waikiki. What's not to love about it being the setting for the original "Hawaii 5-O" or the hotel of choice for Elvis? Modern novelist Sarah Vowell author of "Unfamiliar Fishes" stays here. Book an ocean-view room with full kitchen. Every floor has coin washer & dryer. There are five elevators. In a week's stay, we never waited more than a minute for a free elevator. The convenience store on first floor is well-stocked. One can even purchase a quarter rather than a pound of butter! This hotel is an institution and well worth the money.

The Ilikai may not be the newest hotel in town, but it has a lovely feel to the place, the reception staff were great (especially Richelle) and the location was perfect for me - walking distance to Ala Moana and Waikiki beach - with the bus stop right outside the door if I wanted to venture a little further. I will defiantly stay again.

I was looking around the HHV area for a hotel that I could afford for a week without resort fees and decided to try my first vacation rental . I'm so glad I did and was lucky enough to have this condo available for the exact dates I needed. It is as described . Everything anyone would need. The view is great ,beds comfortable and kitchen and bathroom well stocked. The owners were very responsive and accommodating . Never had any issues during our stay . We never needed a car because we could walk to Ala Moana Center and Lewers St if we needed to shop and the front entrance is a few feet away from bus stops. I like the sliding sun shade in the balcony . It keeps the integrity of the view but gave me the option to block the sun during certain times of the day . The kettle also needs to be replaced. But these minor issues won't make me hesitate to return to this place. What really puts it over the top is the Ilikai itself. The building is clean and lobby was amazing. Fresh air blowing as if you were outdoors and not too many people so you can definitely relax away from your room. I walked every morning and it was so convenient making my way from the Marina to the Outrigger and back before sunrise. I would not hesitate to recommend this condo for the room itself ,the owners and the Ilikai building itself.

We stay here for Jan/Feb every year. Location is fabulous, short walk to all the shops and beach. We rent privately owned condos from Waikiki Beach Rentals. This year we were not happy with the state of the lanai furniture, but after contacting Scott at the web site it was replaced, so can't complain. The pool area is still ridiculous, towels are put on seats for regulars and seats are not used for hours.

Just back from a 2 week holiday in Honolulu and Las Vegas. We have stayed at least 6 times at the Ilikai and love it here. This time we had condo 1820 with again great views of the lagoon and ocean. We had to purchase new pillows as several of the ones on our beds smelt like very dirty hair. We stayed for 3 nights then left for Vegas arriving back 4 days later into 1820 again. On arrival we found that the bedding had not be changed and were still marked from our previous stay. We don't know if anyone else had booked the room during our time away. We contacted management and a few hours later two very friendly ladies arrived to change our bedding. As we had basically made two bookings for the same room which meant two cleaning fees I expected the bedding to have been changed. We then had a problem with the oven...it wouldn't work which was very annoying as we had purchased food to prepare using the oven. Finally after several calls to maintenance and several days later they said that the stove/oven would be replaced the next day around 4pm. This was useless to us by this stage as we were leaving at 7pm that night and had to throw out the food we had bought to be cooked in the oven. They arrived around 4pm...opened the door without knocking and barged in...then knocked...glad I was dressed. I am assuming at no-one had come to check the oven out and just went and replaced it that they already know it was faulty. This cost us $$$ as we had to get takeaway on the nights we should have been able to prepare meals for ourselves. I love staying at the Ilikai but this time was disappointed with the condo and the obvious problems. One bonus was that they filmed Hawaii Five-O over two days in the rear car parking area and we got to get up close to watch.

I have stayed at virtually every major resort in the Islands and although Ilikai is an older property (originally built in 1964), it has a retro vibe that I really appreciate. Many of the new resorts have a plastic feel to them, but lots of character here. For lots of nice wood accents throughout the property. The rooms are HUGE with full kitchens. Great for families that want to relax by the beach all day and save a few bucks by cooking in the hotel room. Ilikai is also conveniently located within a short walk of downtown Waikiki and Ala Moana Shopping Center.

My wife and I stayed here for a week. The room was large with a useful desk and enough outlets for all our gear, king-size very comfortable bed, large shower with plenty of room for my wife's cosmetics, friendly staff, located on the west end of Waikiki away from the huge crowds further east, yet close to the convention center and Waikiki shopping and beaches. The hotel is gradually converting to condos, but there was no construction noise of inconvenience. Rooms, hallways, and common areas were clean and well maintained.

Great location and great bar that serves wonderful food and drinks for a reasonable price! The hotel rooms are large, clean and pleasant. The beach is easily accessible and bus routes to all major attractions are right outside the hotel.

While the Ilikai may have lost some of its luster since the Yacht Club Tower was sold off, it still has a great location, clean comfortable rooms, great comfortable beds and a friendly staff. I was at the hotel for six nights and while the room is a little dated it was clean and comfortable (and other than sleeping how much time do you spend in your room when you are in Hawaii?). The hotel is located close to great restaurants, shopping, and transportation. Great value.

We stayed at the Ilikai Hotel at the west end of Waikiki prior to moving to our timeshare on Oahu. The Ilikai is celebrating 50 years of service this year and was featured in the original Hawaii Five O series. The hotel is definitely not showing its age. We were warmly greeted in a very clean and modern registration area and our room was also clean and spacious. The Ilikai is situated at the west end of the Waikiki beach walk and we took advantage of this to walk to shopping and eating areas. The only drawback to the Ilikai was that, like every hotel we read up on in Honolulu, street noise can be heard even on our 22nd floor. Fortunately it was not an issue from around 10:00pm until 5:30am the next morning. We will definitly consider staying here again.

Stayed here for nine nights. Our room was overlooking the marina which was excellent. The rooms are very spacious, clean and comfortable. The room was supplied with a fridge, microwave and coffee maker - but no cutlery or dishware to use other than a couple of mugs for your coffee, which seemed a bit strange when you are provided with a microwave??!! The hotel itself was very nice and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only downside was the pool area and the bar! The pool (which is a salt water pool) was a bit dated, and there was no bar service between the pool and bar. We were told its because the bar area is rented out and the hotel will not allow them to provide bar service in the pool area, which meant everytime we wanted a drink it was a trek for both of us to the bar if we both fancied a beer (due to the drinking laws in Hawaii where they will only serve one beer per person). Think the hotel is missing a trick with this one!! Anyway it was a lovely stay - the location was spot on too with a 10 minute walk into the middle of Waikiki. Bus stop right outside the hotel as well. I think to stay at this hotel is budget dependent to be honest. I found it perfectly ok for what we wanted, however if I was going back to Oahu would probably look for somewhere else.

My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the Ilikai and had an enjoyable stay. We had booked a room that was supposed to overlook the lagoon but got one overlooking the marina but as it was late we just decided to stay with that room. The room itself was very clean and big with a king size comfortable bed. There was a small fridge, microwave, coffee maker and safe. The bathroom had 2 separate sinks in the bathroom with lots of room for your stuff and the shower was quite large. There was also a table with chairs in the room as well as on the small balcony which was nice to have. The room was very quiet and we heard no noise from the rooms around us. Staff were friendly and we got a booklet with 20% discounts at certain restaurants around and in the hotel. The location was close to the Ala Moana shopping center and easy walking for us to the rest of Waikiki. The only thing missing was information in our room as to hotel facilities and we were not given any info when we checked in but this was a small point for us. We would stay here again.

We recently stayed at Ilikai for 13 nights. Wanted to highlight to everyone the fantastic service we received from Dana (Shell Club) who is located in the foyer of the hotel and assisted us in booking all our Hawaii tours and adventures. She certainly went over-and-above in making sure our trip was as memorable as we had hoped ! Rhian and Bec...x

Location is great to just walking to the lagoon or beach in 5 minutes. Or to the Ala Moana Shopping mall in 15 min walking. We rented a mini van since we are a group of 5. We pulled in front of the valet desk and hoping someone will service us. The valet service did not call the bellhop to bring our luggages up. We have to carry them up the stairs ourselves. The room is comfortable. When we leave, the concierge took our luggages down in an elevator. And help us load the suitcases.

I stayed here recently with a co-worker/friend for a short short weekend trip. It was only 4 days because our friend was getting married. We needed something that was close enough to places to hit because we didn't want to spend on car rental. This place was perfect distance from the beach (we ran and did AM exercise), neighboring hotels where the wedding party was, the mall and really good local food. ALL WALKING DISTANCE! Its a good no-nonsense spot. Best part, we received a discount punchbook that helped us find new, fun spots and save! We tried a nearby pub/flatbread spot - unforgettable! Staff are nice too, they booked us a shuttle for the airport (better savings than a taxi and less stressful than a bus). We did a package with our flight and saved more. They upgraded our room and gave us a king but we didn't mind sharing (2 girls). We even got a kitchenette and everyone gets a balcony! 1 thing I will say though...some spooky hallways.

Stayed here 3 nights while doing some business in town. Was really not up to par with what I expected. it started from when I walked into the lobby with the fake flowers collecting dust - there were a few green plants in the lobby, but the majority of them were dried up and dying. Really just so tacky. I had checked this hotel out on Trip Advisor and read through several reviews which made it seem like most of the rooms had been updated. Well, I guess I got one of the rooms that was not updated. This hotel also has owner condos so you could get one of the condo type rooms that are all decorated individually. My co-worker got a room that was a private type condo from the rental pool and he said his was really nice with a full kitchen and hardwood floors. Mine looked like it hadn't been updated since the original Hawaii Five-O days (if you are familiar with the original series from the 70's this hotel was used in it quite a bit). My carpet was pulling up, the bathroom door was grimey, there was mold on the bottom of my shower mat (I mean how easy is it for them to spray some bleach when cleaning the room?). The bathrooms were so dated. There were 2 showers in the bath room (one in the toilet room and one with a tub in the outter bathroom) both of the showers used old style vinyl liners so once you got into the shower, it was so dark because the heavy liners didn't let any light in! it was like showering in the dark!! The nice thing was the room was on the 25th floor, which was right below the Penthouse and I had a view of the lagoon and back side of the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The view was great (although they charged me an additional $15 per night for the "upgraded/high floor room"). It was not worth it. During my stay the construction workers were pounding starting at 8am either below my floor or above me doing re-construction apparently. I asked to move to another room, but there was supposedly only 1 room available that once I viewed, I decided to stay where I was and put up with the noise. The other room was on a much lower floor with a marina view but closer in to the elevators so when you sat out on your balcony, the other units all looked directly in on you. I prefer the room at the far end of the hallway towards the ocean as it felt a little more private...just a little.The pros of my stay were that I had a front row view from my balcony on Friday night watching the the fireworks go off from the beach of the lagoon. The coffee shop in the lobby has pretty good coffee. The location is at the start of Waikiki beach so not too crazy busy in that location and about 2 long blocks walk to the Ala Moana shopping center if you are interested. The wifi worked fine for me. I don't think I will be staying here again unless a total renovation has been done.

Room was an ocean view on the 22nd floor overlooking the courtyard and marina. View was awesome, king size bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. Room was well equipped with the essentials. Too busy doing tours and touristy trips to thoroughly enjoy the hotel and all its amenities. Had great stores in the lobby for anything needed. Enjoyed dinner and music at the bar and grill in the courtyard. Great location and value!

We (two people) have stayed a total of ~ 3.5 months at the Ilikai on 4 separate occasions. 6 weeks were in the Hotel and 2 months in the owned condos. There are also timeshares (Shell Vacations) operating out of the Ilikai but we did not stay in a timeshare.Pros - 1. The Ilikia is located at the west end of Waikiki Beach and is much quieter than the areas around the major hotels east of Lewers Street (if quiet is what you want – it’s a con if it’s not.) You have the beach in front of the Hilton Hawaiian as well. The entire area is not nearly as busy as the east portion of Waikiki.2. You are close to the Ala Moana Mall and the Magic Island Lagoon (in Ala Moana Park) which is the easiest, safest and best swimming beach we have found on the entire island (although Hanauma Bay is pretty nice.) The above two reasons are why we came back four times.3. A number of reviews commented that the Wi-Fi was very slow but Oceanic Time Warner just did an upgrade of every single room in the building so it works very well now.4. The Ilikai is built with 3 wings regardless of whether it is the hotel, owned condos or timeshares; the Diamond Head, Ewa and Makai. For Diamond Head and Ewa, try to stay in units ending in even numbers so that you face the water. If you are in an odd numbered unit, you will be in a "city lights" room meaning you face Ala Moana Blvd and it is a busy street. Also, if you like to sleep with your windows open, the rooms in the "Diamond Head" wing (room numbers ending in 12 up to 26) are noisier as trucks unload their wares early in the morning. Rooms ending in 02 up to 10 are in the Ewa wing and are quieter. Diamond Head rooms are better for watching the many fireworks displays and the Ewa wing is better for sunsets. Overall, Ewa is preferred as long as it is on the water side and you’re staying for any length of time. We were recently in unit 1718 and our friends were in 1608 and 1608 was quite a bit quieter. We have not stayed in the Makai wing (which runs to the water) so both odd and even-numbered rooms have water views. But the Makai rooms ending in odd numbers face the area with the trucks so they likely would be noisier than the even numbered rooms. At least none of the Makai rooms face Ala Moana Blvd.5. The manager of the hotel invited us to a cocktail party the second time we stayed here which was very courteous of him. We were planning a third visit in the hotel however we wanted to stay a month and owned condo units are less expensive than the hotel for a month so we booked into an owned unit instead. Cons - 1. The Ilikia just celebrated its 50th anniversary and the hotel shows it. While all suites on the 23rd and 24th floors were either recently renovated or were in the process of being updated, the building overall has a long way to go. For example, the plumbing is old meaning the water is not great so you will need bottled water for your morning coffee and drinking water. The bathrooms are very dated and need a complete overhaul as does the carpeting. The six weeks we stayed in the hotel (2 couples) were in a 2 bedroom unit with a bar fridge and cook top stove so you always go out for meals. The refrigerators and stoves may have been improved when the renovations were completed on the 23rd and 24th floors but I am not sure so I would ask if you plan to stay in one. The owned condos have full refrigerators and a full oven. Also, the 2 bedroom is really a 1 bedroom plus a separate area enclosed by a couple of sliding doors for the other couple.2. The owned condos are advertised as being fully equipped but that is a stretch. You should bring your own cooking knives (a knife sharpener is provided but does not help with serrated edge knives), wine glasses, drinking glasses and salad bowls. Also bring your own tea pot if you drink same. The knives, forks, spoons, plates and bowls are minimally adequate for two. You will have to shop at Foodland or Don Quijote (they spell the name Quijote rather than Quixote) shortly upon your arrival for necessities so check-in to your unit first to see what is needed. Our friends who stayed in 1608 had a better outfitted unit from ours so the units vary. The condos are all studios (which is noted on the booking website) so they really are suited for 2 people even though it says 3 on the website.3. If you have significant problems with an owned condo, you may find that issues are not resolved in a timely manner. Our unit had a defective (i.e. loud) motor in the air conditioner which we brought to the attention of Bert, the on-site representative. Bert identified the problem as a motor as did the A/C tech but it was not fixed during the last two weeks that we brought this to Bert’s attention. (Also our fault as we should have brought this to Bert’s attention when we first got there; initially we slept without A/C and did not know the motor was defective. Once the humidity spiked up we used A/C and we immediately heard the noise. We should have turned it on upon arrival.) I spoke with Bert just before we left and he had no idea when or if it will be repaired. We think it possible that the previous renter had the same problem as the motor was noisy as soon as we turned it on so the issue must have existed for some time. If you are used to things being repaired quickly, you may be sadly disappointed but it is Hawaii and things are a bit more relaxed.4. The owned condos appeal to seniors who are in Hawaii for roughly one to three months. The pool is regularly used by many of these seniors and you will see the same people at the pool (good if you like meeting up with friends and bad if you want a place for your kids to swim.) Generally, the Ilikai appeals to older people given its quiet location so if you have a couple of young children, this is probably not the place to go.Hawaii is expensive because there is more demand for rooms than there is supply. Consequently, many Waikiki hotels charge higher prices compared to the mainland and this is true of the Ilikai. If you really like Waikiki and want to be there for a long stay, the condos are less expensive and quieter than many hotels in Waikiki but the rooms have issues. I don’t think I recommend it for families with young children for a shorter stay. While more expensive, each building in the Hilton Hawaiian has its own pool so it is much better for children than the Ilikai.

Excellent location, great service, beds are very comfortable and sleep was amazing.. We really enjoyed our stay at ilikai :) the hotel is close to the beach, close to the shops. We plan to travel again to Hawai and we will probably come back here!

Upon arrival we were greeted and helped with our luggage, check in was quick and easy.The staff at the Ilikai are pleasant and helpful.The location is perfect, each side of the hotel has the best beaches for swimming.We had a one bedroom with a kitchen with a view of the marina and ocean.We will be going back there again, had a great stay.

When we first arrived we were greeted by every hotel employee we passed. As we checked in we were given an upgraded, which I thought was amazing. Our room gave us a view of the beautiful mountains and was very spacious, clean,and cozy. Yes, the hotel may be a little old, however it is still well maintained and filled with helpful and courtesy employees. We will definitely be staying here again in the near future.

Firstly I feel that I could not say that this is a 4 star hotel. I would give it a 3- 3 1/2.Our first impressions were great as we arrived very early and were greeted by a lovely front office staff member who advised us our room was available. After a very long flight with little sleep we appreciated this very much. There were 3 ladies sharing a room for 7 days and we found the room big enough to accommodate us even with a trundle in it. The balcony was quite big but unfortunately we had only 2 chairs on it. Housekeeping was very hit and miss and every day we had no extra toilet paper provided. With 3 ladies...... Say no more!! We pulled up our beds each day and no attempt was made to make them properly unless we left them fully unmade. We had no extra toiletries in the bathroom till day 4. We booked a room with a kitchenette and we had a coffee machine but no kettle or salt and peppers provided. Just the basics.The beach is a short walk and the lagoon is just next door which was great as the pool is far too small for a hotel this size and we could never get a lounge chair.Overall we had a great time and we would return to the Ilikai fully aware that by our standards it is not a 4 star hotel.

We've stayed in the hotel before but this was definitely our last visit. Love the location, the history and views. However.... if you like to swim and expect to find a seat at the pool together (2) almost any time of day this isn't the hotel for you. We ended up sharing a chase, briefly, and only once in the entire week we were there. And don't expect to avoid the crowds by swimming the evening because the pool gate is locked! No food or beverages are allowed in the pool area and was surprised to learn that it was a chlorine. What is Hawaii without memories of some relaxing downtime at the pool. We really missed that. Very disappointing. I wish I'd seen a review like this on Trip Advisor.Some of the staff was very friendly but somewhat spotty at the front desk. The rooms are large, basic and clean but this hotel is tired and the rooms are in need of renovating.The veneer on the bottom of our bathroom door had been peeling off for some time, had been painted over and was still peeling. If you want to print out your boarding pass you'll be directed to a rolling cart in a small corner with an ancient computer beside the front desk. Although this hotel still beautiful in many ways this is not the Illikai we remember.

The beds were clean. The showers were old and had mold that couldn't be cleaned away due to age. The baseboards were pretty dusty. The surfaces were clean, staff helpful, and location a little calmer than further down Waikiki. I'd probably stay next door at Hilton village if I were to go back to waikiki again. Honestly, if much rather stay on Maui or the other side of oahu from Honolulu city.

Stayed for 10 nights on the 25th floor with lagoon/ocean view, excellent front desk staff and outstanding valet service. Quiet location at the start of Waikiki beach. Entertainment most nights in the common area along with Friday night fireworks is a plus on the beach. Relaxing atmosphere, yet close to everything. I've stayed at many hotels in Waikiki and for the price and location, the Ilikai is wonderful!

Stayed here with our two kids 10 and 7 for three days. The hotel is basic and clean..nothing fancy or over the top. We've stayed at Westins and Fairmonts so this is a step down but right from Check-in, Rod was great in getting us registered quickly. The room as clean and comfortable and there was free in room wifi which worked great and fast and free! The kitchen in our suite was fine and could have been better stocked (more plates, pans) but we managed. While its a bit of a walk to the main strip, the hotel is located close to the beach (easy walking over the bridge) and better yet you can use the Hilton Lagoon if you have small children. The hotel also loans out beach chairs and boogie boards (just as the front desk) which were clean and came in great use. Parking is a bit steep at $28/day but at the time we were there the elite parking staff were very prompt and courteous. Staff were friendly and they met our needs. Overall a nice clean basic hotel to stay in Honolulu for a short trip.

My husband was totally psyched to stay at the same hotel featured in the opening credits of Hawaii 5-0. The location was great. We liked having a little kitchenette, and sliding doors between the sitting area and bedroom, perfect for traveling with a small child. We enjoyed walking along the waterfront and beach in front of the hotel.  Valet parking was $28 per night, which seemed expensive.

We love the Ilikai :) Great location right on Waikiki next to the Hilton you are very central but a little quieter than right central on Waikiki. We rent online from a rental property company but you can also rent directly from the ilikai hotel, the difference Is the private condos have kitchenettes. pricing 119-140 for a double depending on the season...cant beat that price for Honolulu !I will keep coming back again and again, love the Ilikai hotel.Tips-check out the Mai Tai restaurant downstairs, great happy hour from 1030am-6pm daily, $3 domestic beers and snacks.

Stayed 4 nights at the hotel and had a great time. The Ala Moana Shopping Mall is a 10 minute walk away while the Duke lagoon is right in front for young kids. Used the valet which was pretty decent for Honolulu but it saved time finding your own parking space and bringing young kids around to the car.

The Good:We stayed in suite 2526 (honeymoon suite), the view is very nice with large windows. That was the most important feature for us.The Mediocre:The suite kitchenette is extremely basic, do not expect to cook anything other than toasts, bacon and eggs. Forget about even salt & pepper. I would have expected to have at least 2 wine or champagne glasses in an honeymoon suite, but you will have to use the typical bathroom style glasses. No oven, no dishwasher.There is a huge bathtub (non Jacuzzi), but no bubble bath or salts, nothing.No room service at all, you have to order online for room delivery (9$ extra)The pool is very small and packed, shadowed until 2 PM.Wifi is free, but disconnects every 15 minutes. Streaming music is not an option.The Ugly:Entirely non smoking but one small and remote section. (Most people will move this comment to the GOOD section :)Parking (28$) is valet only, it was next to impossible to find parking in this area.The restaurant at ground level is serving horrible food, the wine was slightly better than vinegar.You can't bill it to your room, that is probably a good thing, you really want to forget everything about this place. Fortunately that are so many other great restaurants around, so do not waste your time there.Conclusion:We liked the view, great location, forget about the kitchenette.

Stayed at the Illikai for a couple of weeks in early Jan and had a fantastic time. First time trip to Hawaii so had previously spent many hours looking for the right location in Waikiki that was central to all the shopping, restaurants, local sights etc and the Illikai was perfect! Huge hotel complex, lots of hive and activity and would definately go back again. Only downside is that the Gym does require an upgrade, particularly new equipment, but other than that, great facilities overall.

We had to book our first two nights through our VRBO Waikiki Rentals as their unit was not available. Everything was handled easily and we just went through front desk and all was handled nicely, as we had prepaid. We were upgraded to 1430 which was a completely renovated King Suite with ocean front/lagoon view. It was simply amazing, and much better than our actual VRBO (which they say are renovating in May). We were traveling with our 14 year old daughter and they even brought up a cot for us, though it had a pullout couch. Thanks to the Ilikai for providing an amazing place to stay for our 2 day requirement! Awesome facilities, pool is decent, the bar and grill downstairs is convenient, breakfast ends at 10:20 am so watch your clock. Reasonable and options available for lunch and dinner, had a few snacks. Music most nights. Definitely liked the location from downtown mayhem and tourist chaos, we would recommend this place to friends! Met many return guests... some for the past 25 years!! That says alot. NOT all suites are renovated, but they are working on it. Some are tenants, VRBO or condo property, not all hotel rooms. Staff were friendly and helpful. Great for sunsets at the Marina, fireworks at Lagoon and walking distance to shopping in either direction. Aloha

My wife with both of our adult children ages 23 & 25 had a fantastic stay at the Ilikai this past week! It was our first trip to Oahu. The two bedroom suite was very comfortable for all four of us to spread out and relax. Our room on the 22nd floor had the most unbelievable views from both balcony's. Plus their staff was so very hospitable & accommodating!

I booked this hotel on a website which provided me with a bit of a discount. Not a good idea. No where on the site (or on Ilikai Hotel site either) did it mention the hotel was under construction. I thought this was a requirement in USA but apparently not. The room we were given was directly above a room being renovated & the pounding, hammering & drilling was really unacceptable. I almost called the CEO & had him listen to it but called the desk instead. The supervisor was friendly but had no authority to do anything without contacting the Manager so after a couple of calls, we were moved to another room. For the inconvenience the Manager provided a basket of goodies but we were then subjected to construction across the street! The hotel is outdated and location is not great. Too far from Waikiki Beach however it is quieter. The Bar & Grill had decent food & prices but a couple of the waitresses were surly. The front desk staff were friendly. The restaurant on top of the hotel had an incredible view but overpriced.The pool was much too small for a hotel this size and never was there an empty chair unless it was raining. Overall we were disappointed.

My son & I truly enjoyed our hop over to O'ahu from Maui for the Pro Bowl weekend. The ocean views and room amenities were great, but the thing that stuck out for me was the aloha spirit of the employees. At every turn we were greeted with a 'can do' attitude and a friendly, inviting smile. My son & I were not feeling well after returning to the room and had to call down for assistance very early in the morning. The engineer was right there before I knew it offering service with a smile. He was very understanding & cooperative with my requests. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the true aloha spirit and inviting Hawaiian hospitality.

We traded our Kauai timeshare for a week in Honolulu at the Ilikai.The location, lobby, restaurants and shops were wonderful, as was our partial ocean viewfrom the balcony. Size of the room, kitchenette and bath were fine. However, it's quite evident that updates are needed. The gym (supposedly renovated) was a total disappointment - very few machines and couldn't even find free weights! The pool was old, too small, crowded, with no landscape appeal. There didn't even appear to be a spa. The room, (in spite of the very comfortable bed and many amenities) was tired and old. The curtains were faded and grey, and the furniture looked like it was from the 70's. The ancient air conditioner blew air into my face at night while I slept, and, yes, I did catch a cold. Since this is our only option for trading our time-share, we will return. But, as the saying goes: "You get what you pay for."
user_name:
Kathy L
Dana Point, California, United States

review_body: My stay at the Ilikai was was fantastic. My sister in law made the reservations as she had stayed there 25 years ago. Absolutely adorned the room. It may have been somewhat dated but very clean and comfortable. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in and being able to have a full kitchen for coffee on the lanai was wonderful. The view was spectacular from the 25th floor of the ocean on one area and downtown in another (Had a corner room). We could walk to many places and had access to the trolleys and buses. Excellent service from all the staff at the Ililai!!!!!!!!!!!!! I hope to return in 5 years to stay again maybe forever?

My first trip to Hawaii was 25 years ago and I stayed at the Ilikai and loved it. So when I decided to return last October, the Ilikai was my place of choice. I booked a room direct thru the hotel and reserved a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite for my 2 nieces, my sister-in-law and myself. We absolutely loved the room. I have to admit it was a bit dated but comfortable and very clean. The beds take all prizes for comfort, having a full kitchen was great for morning coffee and breakfast on the lanai. The view from our 25th floor lanai was a breathtaking ocean view. The hotel is walking distance to most anywhere and if you can't walk there, the trolley and bus is right at the hotel door. Was it anything like 25 years ago???? It was more built up around the hotel but my stay was better than 25 years ago. Excellent service from the staff and unlike staying at a rented condo we had to do nothing except enjoy our vacation.

As my family and I got to the hotel after having booked through Expedia we were surprised with an upgrade and offered a room on the 25th floor. The stunning views and proximity to all attractions made this hotel a great choice. The pool might not be attractive but with so many beaches to visit we really enjoyed our stay.

I returned to Honolulu and the Ilikai after a very long time away. The last time I stayed in the Ilikai about 20 years ago i thought the hotel was ok, but not great. I recently returned for a business trip and was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean, the lobby and courtyard area were stylish and pleasant, and the entry way was spectacular. My room was large, comfortable, very clean and had a spectacular view. And my thanks to Cliff the bellman, who went out of his way to assist me getting to the airport on time. I look forward to a return visit.

When my daughter gave us 2 weeks to plan her wedding and on New Years Eve (yikes) I was in a panic to figure out what/where/when. That is when Terry of the Ilikai came to my rescue. He and his staff made sure that they not only had a room to view the NYE fireworks as they had asked for, but made the room and experience one to truly remember fondly. I cannot thank them enough for the special attention they gave us and the attention to detail that made my daughter and her fiance's day incredibly lovely. I would highly recommend the Ilikai for weddings and events or just as a great place to stay. The rates are fabulous and the service and accomodations even more so.

We spend 9 nights at the Ilikai this January and loved every minute of it. Called to book the room direct through the Ilikai Hotel and got a very good rate. Booked an ocean view room with a kitchen for not too many more $ and were able to check in as soon as we got to the hotel from our early flight arrival from Australia. Fabulous views over the marina and ocean, stunning sunsets and lovely breezes and no street noise. Quiet enough to leave the balcony door open during the night. The hotel is clean, room serviced daily, beach towels available from check in and tour/activities desk in the foyer as well as a mini mart, coffee shop and the Ilikai Bar and Grill which give you 10%discount. Coin laundries on every floor and ice machines available also. 10 minutes walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre as well as Walmart and Ross Dress for Less. 15 minutes walk to the major Waikiki beach past the Hilton Village, Fort De Russy Park etc. The Ilikai is in a great position and has an affordable ocean view. Loved it.

Our stay there was easy and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and genuine from beginning to end. The location is great, it's practically in between Ala Moana and Waikiki. If your not bothered walking, or have too many shopping bags, its a cheap cab ride back. The pool is average, but with the beach further down, it doesn't matter.

We stayed at the ilikai on our second trip to Hawaii. Previously we ahd stayed at the other end of town so i wanted to check out what the other end had to offer. We went for the Ilikai in the end because it was reasonably priced and my husband loves Hawaii 50 so the fact that it features in the opening sequence clinched it! It is in a good location at the far end of the beach right next to the harbour and the lagoon at the hilton - which is open for all to use. The rooms were clean and large (we were upgraded to a suite which had a seating area and kitchen - which was great as we could have breakfast in our room rather than spending to eat out every morning) but could do with an updtae perhaps...although it was functional and practical. we did not use the pool area but there was a bar serving snacks and drinks etc and a handy coffee bar too which i would recommend for breakfast Kona coffee! We rented some beach chairs which were fantastic and great to use on the busy waikiki beach and near the lagoon.I would recommend this hotel, good value and good location.

We got a great rate for this hotel, and the view alone was worth it. If you get an ocean view, request the highest floor possible. Regardless of which direction you're facing, you'll get a breathtaking view every time you look out the window. The hotel is clean and the interior is nice, but the exterior feels a little dated, like we were living in a beach movie from the 70's.PARKING: Park behind the hotel in the marina parking lot. There are spots along the main drag there, or you can get $6 10-hour parking in the lot directly across from the Hilton's lagoon.

I have previously stayed here booking through the hotel. This visit we booked a condo through Waikiki Beach Rentals. We were able to choose the exact room when we booked. We knew what our view would be and which floor we would be on.The room was well appointed and the kitchen came in handy. Plenty of storage areas to unpack our clothes into.The hotel is well located with plenty of restaurants nearby. Short walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre.

Stayed at a condo at this property and it was an excellent experience. The apt was very well furnished, two bedrooms, each bedroom and living room had a tv. The guest bedroom (2nd bedroom) had a twin and full size bed and attached bathroom. Had an apt on the 15th floor so it had two nice balconies, one accessible from the master bedroom and living room, the other accessible from the guest bedroom and living room. The apt was very clean and well maintained. I have read other reviews of people that have rented apt, and its mostly the owners faults that they are not very well maintained. So its a hit or miss for these owner operated condos/apts.

had an apartment on the 10 th floor - i think room 1012 ?with a view over the lagoon - perfect to see the fireworks, well appointed and great location -walking distance to the main beaches with the noise of nightclubs - funny enough also stayed at the modern which was x3 the price & not as nice ! the top floor bar is a must & the bar staff so lovely & a wealth of local information - had a super night cap chatting to them & a local called isaac ...! lol the barmen knows his cocktails -some of the best in Hawaii - a compliment i don't give lightly !

I am writing this review while its fresh in my mind and am still at the hotel.In order of my priorities let me break down my experience at the Illikai. I booked with the hotel not the condo/private owners.Friendliness/knowledge of Staff: 5 stars. Check in was smooth, friendly and professional staff. We were able to get beach chairs and beach towels for free.Cleanliness: 5 stars. Immaculate bathroom, clean, crisp white bedding, no odors anywhere. Decor is not modern, but not worn. Traditional\transitional island styling.Location: On the quieter end of the beach and direct access to Waikiki beach. Quite beautiful view of the ocean with an ocean view. It was easy 22 minute drive to get to from the airport.Amenities/Spaciousness: 5stars. Loved the large lanai on the room. Perfect for viewing gorgeous Hawaii sunsets. Small fridge and microwave is nice if you want to buy a few things to save on eating out all day. There are nice shops& restaurants inside the hotel that I didn't eat or shop at, but was glad they were there for convenience sake. The valet parking is as expensive as other hotels...but we found the staff very engaging and hard working...they HUSTLE to prevent you from waiting long here.Overall, great experience here especially compared to some other pricier hotels...this is an upper mid tier hotel with great service and would stay again

We scheduled 3 rooms at this hotel just after Christmas. Our expectations weren't high- as not too many places had rooms, so we thought this hotel must be past its prime- remember its claim to fame is being the hotel upon whose balcony Jack Lord spins around on the opening credits of the original Hawaii 5-0.We couldn't have been more wrong. The hotel is lovely, well-kept, well-staffed and in a prime location at the beginning of Waikiki.We disagree with the reviewer not liking the 2 bedroom suite. We thought it was beautiful and functional - the kitchen and a full dining room table was very nice. Though we agree the decor is somewhat dated, though not bad.Totally agree that their WIFI leaves something to be desired.Dining options are limited at this hotel. Just a small restaurant/snack bar.Be warned, you can't see the Friday fireworks from many of the rooms- it's on the Diamond Head side.Hula/music on Fridays on the lanai is very nice.Overall good value.

We booked a 2 bedroom suite at the Ilikai for the week of Christmas (10 days total). We liked the fact that there were separate bedrooms and an efficiency kitchen advertised. My wife and I planned to take one room while her parents took the other. The kids would be on the pull out couch and/or the floor. We had successfully stayed in other suites/hotels in this manner before. Note: this is definitely not a 2 bedroom suite!The second "bedroom" was simply an area of the living area that had louvered sliding doors to close it off. The doors did not block out any light, let alone sound, from the living area. In fact, if the curtains in the area with the beds were left open to enjoy the view, you could see inside the room from the living area, even with the doors slid shut.The beds were doubles and there was no tv, no closet or dresser but a single one drawer nightstand. I note the main bedroom was entirely as expected. King bed, dresser, tv, ensuite bathroom.The efficiency kitchen is just that. It did have an oven, cooktop, and microwave. A toaster was available upon request. The refrigerator was of the mini variety but we squeezed in the essentials. We ended up buying a coffee maker because the one provided brewed just 1 or 2 cups at a time. Inside the hotel, there are a few shops but the great part is the mini grocery which sells everything from alcohol to cereals to soy sauce to peanut butter to eggs and bread so you can cook basic meals/breakfast if you want in your room. There are 3 ABC stores within a 5 minute walk as well (selling everything grocery and otherwise as well). The living area was adequate. Tv, but no DVD player, pullout couch, a sitting chair and a table/desk. We also had a dining table with 6 chairs. There were an additional 4 deck chairs for outdoors and two small tables. The decor is somewhat dated but serviceable. The wireless internet was just awful; it was hard to establish a connection, stay connected, or have multiple devices connected. You get what you pay for (it is free). And who comes to Waikiki to spend time in the room anyways???And that is where this hotel has a huge advantage. It is just a great location. You can walk to the mall; you can walk to a giant green space/park; right outside the hotel is a marina; then the start of Waikiki beach. There is no need to cross any busy street as the hotel is ocean side, which was good for us with our small kids. The entrance to the beach includes a separate sandy area/lagoon where you can rent paddle boards, kayaks, and waterbees/pedal boats. You can also sign up for surf lessons (recommended!) and other beach activities. You are right next to a plethora of shops and restaurants and can walk further for more of Waikiki shopping and entertainment. It all seems handicap/stroller accessible as well with paved pathways around the lagoon. There are a lot of people and there is a lot of action around here; quiet and peaceful don't come to mind but great for kids of all ages and adults who want some more liveliness. So bottom line, this is a hotel in a great location although the suite left some things to be desired. On a price per head basis, and considering the kitchenette and living area, it proved good value overall. Hope this helps!

First impression was great at efficient check-in with friendly staff,second impression on entering the room was whoa! this place has seen a few schoolies type celebrations (Aussies will understand) with stained carpet and chipped paint etc but the room was well cleaned , spacious and comfortable.Our views over the boat harbour were gorgeous and the location of the hotel itself is excellent.We got a very reasonable rate (hotel room not managed condo) found the amenities excellent and enjoyed our stay very much.

this is my second visit to Illiaki Condos... it's great. You can rent direct from owners and all units are clean, and most are updated.The staff and management at the Bar/Grill are fantastic. Richard (Manager) deserves a gold star - very personable. My only complaint - as a prior bartender/waitress of 25 years - is that his staff does not know that it is unprofessional and un healthy for his staff to bring out the drinks to tables by hand. where is their trays?? I will be returning again and will definitely recommend this location to all!Aloha!
