We stayed here a few years ago in a privately-owned kitchen unit and it was totally updated and fully stocked. This time I booked a hotel room (lagoon view) with full kitchen. I like the history at the Ilikai and the location and nearby beach works for us. There seemed to be more in the lobby area this time; a good coffee shop, a convenience store, clothing store and bar etc. The room was huge with a nice big balcony but was seriously dated and the kitchen had the bare minimum. I didn't plan on cooking but wanted a fridge, coffee pot that I could make a good pot of coffee in, and a kettle. The coffee pot was a single-cup style with coffee pods supplied daily. No kettle. I tried to change rooms because I didn't think the price was worth it for us to have the kitchen and ended up receiving a kettle and a better rate which helped cover the $28/day valet parking. The room is 655 sf but had just one bed, and you wouldn't want anyone to sleep on the old couch if you brought the family. It was clean though and the view from the large balcony was good. Good toiletries. I liked the vintage Christmas decorations in the lobby area and the torch lighter at sunset. There was some construction going on (a bit of loud banging during the day) so I hope they update all the rooms or I would probably choose a privately owned suite again. Good value for the size of the room though, you get what you pay for and the Ilikai is quite reasonable for Honolulu. Close to the Chart House restaurant, always a favorite.

We spent 10 nights at the Ilikai Hotel/Apartments in December. The location is incredible, walking distance to everything. The rooms have self-contained kitchens, and are ideal for long-term stays. We enjoyed the Hilton Hawaiian Village fireworks from our balcony on Friday night.Highly recommend this property in Honolulu/Waikiki area.

This is a hotel with a lot of history going back to the original Hawaii FiveO show. Located beside the Hilton Hawaiian Village, with a marina in front , Waikiki beach is steps away. Suites are one room- sofa, bed, and full kitchen, large balconies. Great for short or long stays!

This was a highlight of the Hawaii experience. It is a comfortable hotel, made exceedingly better by good staff, cleanliness, and in my case a great price value relationship. We were there in Honolulu for a special occasion, Patrice on the front desk went out of her way to set up my brother and wife at the hotel on the same floor, and same rate. Always helpful, smiling and gracious. Rod the same, Reggie big smiles.Furniture a little old, but it is an older hotel, and was still just a remarkable place to stay. The Top of the Sorrento was five star in both food and service.I was in hotel business for many years, I loved this experience.

We stayed at the Ilikai for 2 weeks with their snooze and cruise package. Everything we booked through the hotel (rental car, room and parking) went off without a hitch. Our flight did not leave until 10:30pm and they even allowed us a later checkout of 6pm which was great. The ladies at the bar were all very lovely and friendly. They had several TV's so you could watch your favorite games while having a drink or meal. The drinks were reasonably priced and the food was basic, but good. Everybody was very polite and accommodating. One of the things I really liked about this hotel was the location. While not right on the beach, it was on the beach side of the main road going through Waikiki, so you did not have to cross any streets to get to the lagoon and beach which were only a couple of minutes from the back of the hotel. My wife and I took several trips to the main part of Waikiki where all the high end shops are. We thought we were walking down the strip in vegas on a saturday night, it was that crowded. This was not the case around the Ilikai hotel. While there were plenty of people, shops, restaurants and bars around, there was nowhere near the foot traffic. We never felt crowded at this end of the beach. I will definitely be staying here again and would recommend it to any looking for a moderately priced nice hotel. While the the outside was a little weathered, the inside had been remodeled and the room size compared to a normal hotel was twice the size.

We stayed here in November for 5 days. I was very pleased with the suite. It is a 2 bedroom 2 bath, with living area, kitchen, The bedrooms have sliding doors that separate them from the living area, which was fine. The kitchen is older and we barely used it but for breakfast, coffee, snacks and drinks. It is older but fine, Everything was as we expected, they also supplied beach towels and the kitchen was fully stocked with utensils pots glasses and all u would need. I wouldnt really say there is an oceanview but you can see a peak of it and the marina if you crane your neck on one balcony. we prefered the city view balcony it was pretty at night with lights and at day you could see the mountains. the best thing was the location ...so local and walking distance to everything, there is a small store downstairs that had most things u might want and abc store directly across the street. we had a great thanksgiving dinner at 'snappers' also across the road for only $15 and it was delicious and tons of food. they also have a cheap egg breakfast for $4-5 on weekdays. walk to beach was a few minutes. the owner also graciously gave us a free late checkout when our flight did not leave till 11pm at night. bed was super comfy too. would stay here again for sure.

Overall, we were very happy with the Ilikai. The bar on the ground floor is reasonably priced, has good service, and basic but good food. The top floor restaurant is pricy, but has a very good happy hour, and outstanding views at sunset. Ilikai parking is expensive, but there are good nearby options, including free parking at the lagoon between 5am-10:30pm; and good rates at an outside lot across from the free lagoon parking.

We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful, from the valets to the bell hop to the front desk and the wait staff. Great location if you want to be near Waikiki beach, but not in the section of town near the designer shops where the sidewalks are much more crowded. We did not really hear any noise from other guests. Our air conditioner in our room was a little loud sometimes but other than that an excellent room with full kitchen, comfortable bed. Only a shower, no tub in the bathroom. Not a problem for us but if you had little kids it could be inconvenient for you.

We stayed here using our timeshare. This is a combo, timeshare, hotel and condo setup. The location is on the west side of Waikiki beach so you need to walk to Waikiki proper but you are on the beach regardless. There is shopping and food close by. Fast food or sit down is right there. Our studio was nice and worked very well for us. The staff at our timeshare was very pleasant and the place was clean and comfortable.

Wonderful ocean view room at a reasonable and very helpful front desk and valet staff. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!.

Ilikai was an okay place to stay. Would I stay there again - probably not. Our room which was an ocean view 2 bedroom suite was a little tired - lots of marks on walls and threadbare couch that has seen better days. I expected a little better when paying $400/night. I did get the room on a hotel special so maybe I got the worst of the rooms (even though I booked direct with the hotel). The beds were very comfortable. The kitchen and bathrooms were very clean. Daily housekeeping was good. The hotel is a good 30 min walk from the centre of Waikiki, but is very handy to the Ala Moana shops - 5 min walk. The beach out front is hard on the feet - very rocky once in the water. But I'm told further along is much better for swimming.

After years of staying at well known (and over priced) O'ahu lodging, the Ilikai was a big and good surprise! It is very telling for a hotel to have permanent residents-people who choose to live there. While many hotels have a pack 'em in ship 'em out mentality, the Ilikai maintains a "you're like family visiting". The price was a pleasant surprise, considering the accommodations are equivalent to neighboring hotels that charge 20%-30% more. Security, cleanliness, proximity to desired amenities, and the aloha spirit all made the stay more pleasant and return without question or hesitation.

Came with husband, 20 & 15 year old boys. Had 1334 condo. Great view over lagoon & ocean, especially good on fireworks night. It provided all we wanted, nice to have space with 2 beds & 2 bath. Full kitchen so you don't have to eat out all the time. Walk to Ala Moana Center & Royal Hawaiian end of Waikiki. Restaurants at hotel good. All friendly. Not luxurious, but good for the price & location. Will be back!

We stayed in one of the privately rented condos in October.The location of this hotel is great if you want a bit of peace and quiet. There is no noise at night (we slept with the balcony door open every night) and it's very quiet in the morning too. This would also be a good location if you have small children, the beach is a bit calmer at this end and the lagoon is right out the front. It is a 10-15 minute walk to Waikiki main beach (you can walk all the way along the beach or take the streets). There are a number of cafes and restaurants nearby if you don't want to walk that far.In addition to the quiet, the other benefit of being up this end of the beach is that Ala Moana shopping centre is only a 10 minute walk away.We didn't use the pool (no need, the beach is so close and gorgeous) but the pool area was on the small side and looked a little 'tired'.There are a number of stores - beautician, mini-mart, travel agent, etc in the lobby.There is a big ABC store across the road where you can stock up on supplies.If you have a rental car, we found very cheap overnight parking above the Red Lobster, just across the road from Ilikai.I can't comment on the hotel service, but because of the great location I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Even though this hotel is a mix of condo & hotel (mostly on floors 22, 23, 24), I was very happy with our accommodations and the service. The staff was outstanding in every area. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The views out to the marina and the ocean and the sunset were great. The location is convenient - walking distance to the convention center, and just a trolley ride (FREE to only $2) to Waikiki Beach. The hotel has a restaurant facing the ocean for Happy Hour or a sandwich - good for a convenient snack or dinner. Great restaurant/bar at the top of the hotel. Outstanding views there of the fireworks on Friday and Tues. that come from the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

I had a good stay there and had a great time spent at the beach that was right at our door step.The beds were very comfortable to sleep in and the toilet was very big. I enjoyed the view of the beach from the balcony but was sad to miss the fireworks on tuesdays and fridays.

I stayed in a condo and the view was excellent and the condo was very clean and had everything we needed. I never got tired of watching the lagoon and ocean from the balcony. We appreciated all the marvelous service we got from the time we booked till we left. We will recommend this condo to our friends.

This property was once a grand hotel but is now getting quite dated the Lanai colors especially public areas are well kept and nice and clean for us the location is great easy come and go walking distance to shopping centre and very close to beach. I would recommend this hotel as a medium range property

There are, of course, newer, nicer, more prestigious hotels in Honolulu. But are there better value hotels?We were very happy with the cleanliness and location of the hotel. But possibly what stood out most was the great service and help from the main desk.The pool is a little small and old. The restaurants nice but nothing special. But the location meant other swimming and eating options were aplenty.

We stayed in a privately owned condo at the Ilikai for 13 nights in November 2013. The view from the lanai (and from the room itself) is magnificent. I never tired of sitting out there watching the ocean and the marina - the sunsets are breathtaking. The lanai is large and easily fit the four of us. The kitchen was well stocked with enough plates, cups, utensils, etc, and a nice big fridge. We enjoyed using the swimming pool every day, also the nearby HHV lagoon. The Ala Moana shopping centre is only a short walk away. We would stay here again.

Great rooms with beautiful views! The rooms were very large and comfortable. The staff was helpful and so very friendly. The hotel is in close walking distance to the mall and harbor. We will definitely stay here again.

Comfortable Here on a girls trip with mom aunties and sister. My aunts were dusting the headboards. Don't get me wrong - there's no roaches or rats - just a little dust. Beds comfy. Nice balconies. Little kitchenette convenient.

Just recently stayed(end of October13) at the LlIKAI, You won't find a better spot to stay for the price, plus very clean and very nice rooms. ONE THING! Book through VRBO.com so you can get a owners suite. most are fairly newly renovated large room suites, that have full kitchens. a living room/dining combo and a king size bed or two doubles.Go for either a ocean view or lagoon view. The Iiikai hotel is set up like a Y shape building . On most Vrbo listing they show the layout of the hotel with the room numbers, and most vrbo. com listings also tell you the location of the suite you wish to rent. Go for a top floor to see the amazing view.Unless you wish to spend over $250 a night for a 1 bedroom suite. the Iilkai has the location. price. resturants close by and on site, walk to mall, bus out front, nice warm pool. This place has it all .

Second time at Ilikai. Our first time was in 1978. This time we stayed 10 nights in condo 1330. Things haven't changed too much which makes this place homely and much less expensive than those flash boxes in Waikiki proper! Being a Kiwi from NZ we couldn't believe the room rates at other hotels. Our room was comfortable with good beds which were doubles and not king. The kitchen was functional and contained all main appliances. So good to be able to eat in your room from time to time and the ABC convenience store is only a few minutes way and for more substantial offerings/varieties you can walk to Foodland at Ala Moana Shopping Centre in 10 minutes. Da Big Kahuna bar & eatery on the marina side of the lobby does good food and drinks at reasonable prices. The staff are happy and always willing to provide the best service possible. Ilikai is a $2 ride on the pink line to the other end of Waikiki although we walked the street and oceanfront boardwalk a few times. No need to rush as you can stop off at one of the hotels for a feed or refreshment along the way - very civilised. If you are a people person you will love mixing with the locals and other tourists. Taxis are numerous and well priced. Just watch out for the driver with no knowledge of the area and who uses the GPS on his phone to move around! Best to book months ahead as Ilikai gets very, very busy. Staff that we came across were attentive and the security was noticeable. The lanais are of good size and if you get the lagoon /ocean side you will see the fireworks on Friday night and you may get to watch and listen to the luaus being performed at Hilton rooftop at no charge! We think your pocket, stomach, and the rest-fullness of the Ilikai will be appreciated by most guests. We will return in the very near future.

Stayed 5 nights on the 6th floor overlooking the lagoon and pools. great view but couldn't quite see the sunsets.Staff were great. Very helpful and always smiling. Room was nice and clean. Had a small kitchen which was good. Pretty quiet location which was goodWell within walking distance of Ala Moana and the Nth end of the Stip. Food at the grill (great location) leaves a lot to be desired but that just seems to be typical American food.....basic, bland and no flavour

We booked condo 1732 through Waikiki rentals. We dealt with Dainora.She was very easy to communicate with and very helpful.We loved our condo. So much better than cramming into a small hotel room.The view from the balcony was just beautiful.We had a Lagoon and Ocean view. Great for viewing the fireworks on a Tuesday and Friday night.The condo itself had everything we needed.We had two other couples visit our room while we were there. They both said our condo was much nicer than theirs. I was a little concerned when booking that it was going to be dated as I had read this in some reviews, but one step in the door and we found ours must have been one of the updated condos.The location for us was good.It’s not right in the heart of the action, but a very pleasant 15 minute walk and you were in the thick of it all.Plenty of places to eat nearby.Car rental a few steps away. ABC stores also very close by.I would surely stay here again. I just don’t think you can beat it for the price.

The nice thing about the Illikai is the staff. They literally stand up and pay attention to you when you enter suite 212 (the registration room for the condos). They are extremely helpful and very couteous and we found this to be the case from the cleaning staff to the bellhops. We stayed two weeks (our first time at the Illakai) and would definitely stay again. I would have given it a five star rating except for the fact that our room could have used an upgrade (old tv, archaic microwave, etc.) Still there are signs eveywhere that maintenance is being done (carpets are new in the hallways and workmen are at work in various places). The pool is smallish and the ladders at the deeper end are rusted and loose - be careful if your a senior like me. All in all, we would stay again and if you go and like shrimp try the cocanut shrimp at the bar and grill. Also, if you stay here, a good place to go for breakfast is right across the street at a little spot called Snappers - 3.99 for two eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast. Also for icecream find the little spot tucked in behind the Haile Koi (military hotel) best value on ice cream and huge serving. Enjoy.

We had a great time in this family location. Close to everything we could need. Valet parking was great, they were prompt and helpful. It was nice to have body boards and snorkel gear avaliable so we wouldn't have to buy it. Was plenty of room for all our belongings. Kids loved the pool although it closed at 7:30pm.
user_name:
Amanda M
108 Mile Ranch, Canada

review_body: Had a condo on the 13th floor overlooking the marina.......gorgeous both in the morning and evening (great sunsets). The location was awesome. Five minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center - Foodland for food items. Ala Moana Park for morning walks - and some nice beach areas. We were able to walk everywhere. Nice to have a washer and dryer on the floor - we used them once during our stay.

This was the best location to stay In Waikiki!!!Our view was overlooking the lagoon-it was so beautiful! we also had the opportunity to have a birds eye view of the Hilton Fireworks on Tuesday and Friday night!!We were extremely close to the lagoon which was a great spot to soak up the sun and have a dip without having to contend with wave,s and also a great spot to do some stand up paddle boarding-it was only about a 5 minute walk to the lagoon from the Ilikai!right next to the lagoon is the beach which is rated the #2 beach in USA!!!The spot was prime as it was in between Waikiki beach and Ala Moana-Great for shopping and a good way to walk off dinner after dining on the main street in Waikiki!!!

I stayed here with my family for a full week and it could not been more amazing! The location is suberb! Walking distance to everything. I had an oceanfront room with an amazing view. The table outside with four chairs was a must, so we could enjoy our breakfast every morning. Very big room, with a nice bathroom and kitchen. Very confortable beds!!! The only reason the hotel get four stars and not five, is because the parking fee. 28$ (Day) for someone who is already paying (a lot) to stay there is unacceptable (even knowing other hotels in the same area charge the same). But I don't have any complaints about the valet itself. My car would be ready in less than 5 minutes. I have to say also the hotel has a very nice bar with really delicious food and a store (like ABC's) that you can purchase anything you want if do not want to leave the hotel. :) I will be happy to stay here again in the future!!!

It was our first time at Ilikai, but the location was convenient. It is within walking distance to the shopping center. We got a room overlooking the sailboats and Waikiki Beach, which was beautiful to wake up every morning to. The room was clean and spacious. There is a bar/cafe downstairs that leads out to the docks and pool.

There is a wide range of hotel choices in Waikiki. We've been travelling to HI for many years and discovered the Ilikai a couple years ago. The hotel offers "condotels" at a very reasonable price (averaging around $120-150 per night). The rooms can either overlook the ocean/marina or a view of the mountains. The rooms are self-contained with little kitchen areas, free wi-fi, and free nationwide calling. The location is convenient and within walking distance of the mall. If you plan to rent a car for a week or so, you can arrange to have parking privileges across the street (next to the Red Lobster). There is great value at the Ilikai and the rooms are very acceptable. We won't stay anywhere else in Waikiki.

As a family of 6 it can be hard to find something big enough for us to be comfortable, we were in a private condo that we found through www.vrbo.com at the Ilikai. It was very comfortable, had an amazing view over the lagoon. The kitchen was amazing and the beds were super comfy. 5 stars for us. We found being down the mariner end of Waikiki beach really lovely. The fireworks on every Friday night was amazing....the kids loved it. If we were to visit again, which Im sure we will we will definately go back.

We stayed in the Penthouse suite 2613 (Jack Lord's lanai in the original Hawaii 5-0 fly over scene) and it was a great space for the 7 of us. You never felt crowded, the view was amazing to wake up to every day and having the kitchen/laundry was a bonus. It is close to Ala Moana and not too far from the main strip of Waikiki. We would taxi/trolley it to the main strip for dinner and then take a leisurely stroll home after dinner. The Illikai Bar and Grill downstairs was a great place to eat, we did not have one bad meal the whole time in Hawaii anywhere we ate! It's a short stroll to the ABC shop across the road, the IHOP for breakfast and to the end of Waikiki beach. I could not fault the position of this Hotel. It was always clean and the staff were very nice. Would thoroughly recommend staying at the Illikai Hotel.

We had room 723. Lanai faced the mountains rather than the sea so a little noisy. Next time we would ask for an ocean view room. However we cannot fault the standard of the room and its full kitchen. Great for cooking breakfast and we used the stove on a few occasions too. Room was clean and well maintained. Excellent shower, very spacious. We booked through Shell Vacations and the couple of occasions we visited the office we found helpful and courteous service. Would really recommend the Ilikai - near all amenities plus there's a great swimming pool belonging to the hotel and a safe lagoon very close. All in all we had a lovely stay. Would particularly like to mention Bruce one of the valets who helped us with our luggage on to the shuttle bus on the last day. He was fantastic!

My fiance and I were gifted a week at the Ilikai through a relative's time share. We had a GREAT stay here. One of the highlights is that our room faced the ocean, with a great view. PLUS, we had a front row seat to the Hilton's fireworks show on Tuesday and Friday. This was AWESOME!! The room was clean and comfortable. We didn't really use the kitchen, although it did have a full size fridge, stove/oven combo, microwave and sink. The hotel looks a bit old on the outside, but inside everything was very modern and new. (Okay, except the elevators, they still look a bit out dated.) The bathroom had marble counter tops and a flat screen TV and such.There's a small grocery store in the lobby of the hotel, which was very convenient. Unfortunately, there's no parking lot and the valet was pretty expensive for a week's stay. (Although, I think you have this problem at every hotel in Waikiki). The location is fantastic as you're steps away from Waikiki beach and right next door to the Hilton. Downtown Waikiki is a bit of a long walk, but despite that, we walked down to the main part of town several times on our week long stay. The mall is also a short walk, so we wandered down there one afternoon. If I stay here again, I wouldn't even bother renting a car. Everything was very convenient to the Ilikai, and we barely used the car. I would come back to stay at the Ilikai again in a heartbeat!

We booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals and chose condo #2106, mostly for the view over the marina and because the hotel is so iconic (just watch the old Hawaii Five-O!). We were also hoping that the reviews about the condo were accurate and that we'd at last find a clean place in Waikiki. We've stayed several times, usually 1-2 nights while we wait for a flight to another island and have had a hard time finding a place that isn't run down with moldy bathrooms and beds that smell of sweat and worse (and that's despite paying $150+ for a room!). What a wonderful gift this place was: nicely renovated, well-cleaned, good beds with fresh-smelling linens. The fridge was large and new and ran very quietly. Didn't try the stove...salads from ABC Store and the mall food store were sufficient for us. The room was spacious and bright, which beats a tiny cube of a hotel room any day. The view over the marina was so fantastic that my husband spent a great deal of time in the comfy chairs on the lanai, watching everything that was going on. The view is particularly stupendous at night. We just couldn't stop taking photos of the same thing at different times of day, in the rain, in the sun, etc. The Ilikai is located just beside the start of the Waikiki Beach and is also very close to Ala Moana Beach, which is far less busy and has very calm, relatively warm water. We walked everywhere: down to the Kapiolani Park, over to the historic Honolulu city centre, along the beaches, etc. We also took The Bus, once from the airport, after returning our rental car (we didn't have luggage with us, knowing that there are restrictions on what you may take on the bus) and once from the 'Iolani Palace area. Both times we got off at the Ala Moana mall rather than the bus stop just outside the hotel because it was so darn cold on the bus that we needed the walk to defrost! Situated overlooking the pool and eating area as it was, there was some noise: the first night was great since we got to listen to Hawaiian music and watch hula dancing, which looked a little odd since we were looking down at the dancers' heads. The music didn't go on for too long and everything quieted down nicely for the night. The next night was harder. Some youngsters talked until 3:30 a.m. They weren't rowdy, just excited about life. It is true that we had the doors open rather than shutting ourselves away with the air conditioning, but the closed doors hadn't done too much to block out the music the night before, so I suspect we would have heard the talking at least as clearly. We didn't really allow the noise to bother us too much because we had made the choice to overlook the pool area, knowing it would probably be somewhat noisier.Small things are important: there was a laundry room on our floor: cost $2.50 per washer/dryer. The elevators were efficient, quiet and the ride was smooth, something that one likes when going up and down to the 21st floor! We never had to wait long. If you come in from the beach, you can use to the Bathers Elevator. There's no key or key card: you just input a code and turn the lock. While it's handy not having to worry about a key or card, it also means you have to remember that code. There's no check-in either, which means you a) have to remember to bring the information page you are sent (including the key code) and b) are really stuck if you forget that info page or your code! The only weird thing was the tub in the bathroom. The side was so high we almost needed to pole-vault in. If you have hip problems or are short, you'd pretty well have to rely on the ocean to keep you clean. We only stayed 2 nights which wasn't as good a deal as if we'd stayed for a week or so because the cleaning fee is pretty hefty. However, we would do it again because of the location and quality of the place and because we don't like to spend any more time in Waikiki than we have to. The energy in this touristy place is too much for us to consider any longer stays. Waikiki Beach Rentals was easy to work with and the hotel staff (not related to the rental agency)that we encountered were very pleasant.

We stayed in the Ilikai marina condo apartment number 888 which is next to the Ilikai hotel. Booked through alibi beach rentals who I would also recommend. We were emailed all the information for check in including the room access number etc which made for a hassle free check in. The location was excellent. Only a short walk to the beach and the Ala Moana shopping centre (which u will need more than 1 day for as it is HUGE) Lots of bars and restaurants around also and if you walk a little further down toward Diamond head you will find another shopping area behind the hotels and more eateries etc.Fireworks over the hilton lagoon on Friday night was lovely and we had a fantastic view from the lanai (balcony for Australian readers :-))Do not rely on the bus though for the airport. We waited half an hour only to have the bus show up and drive straight past us. We were then told by locals they wouldn't want us to bring the luggage on board which is ridiculous given we were going to the airport! We ended up getting a taxi instead, but perhaps booking the airport/hotel shuttle would be better.The apartment was clean and comfortable with all the necessary amenities including a kitchen if you wish to cater for yourselves. I would definitely stay here again.

Everything about this trip was excellent. Fell in love with hawaii and will be back!Great views, comfy bed, well looked after and quiet just a great condo!The illikai itself was amazing great pool, service and little shops. Nice easy walk to the beach via the lagoon. Awesome fireworks display!

We stayed on the 22nd floor facing the ocean. The view was breathtaking, and our room was large. The price was excellent, and the location was spot on. There was not a single negative thing to say We highly recommend this hotel.

We booked our condo here through Waikiki Beach rentals, it was great having a kitchen as we could re-heat leftovers from restaurants and save money by just having cereal for breakfast. We loved the location as it is away from the craziness of the main strips of waikiki yet only a short $2 trolley ride when we wanted to be in the thick of things. It is literally next door to the Hilton Hawaiin and about a 3 or 4 minute walk to the lagoon where we did most of our swimming! The trolley and all of the tour buses stop right out the front, and there are two ABC stores very close as well as other restaurants. Some of the rooms are part of the hotel and some are privately owned condos (like our was) The only negative thing about our room was that the sofa bed was very very old and needs replacing. I would stay here again but would ask for a room with a view of the lagoon next time.

We rented a private condo studio room at the Ilikai. It was roomy and very well appointed. most rooms have a ocean view of some sort except a small percentage facing onto the street and to the mountains but even these are nice rooms...just without the view.. Our only complaint was the air conditioning that would not drop to a comfortable temp at nights. we really struggle to sleep. Please keep in mind though that this was not the hotels fault as this was a private condo. We did spend one night in the actual hotels rooms and we had no problems with the temperature.If you are keen to have easy access to the Ala Moana shopping mall (which is excellent) this is a great place to base yourself as it is only a fraction over 10 min's walk away. You are also right on the doorstep of the Hilton Lagoon which offers very safe swimming for children and adults alike. The service at Ilikai is excellent and though we did not utilize the pool or restaurants they appeared to be good. We dined in a lot or visited restaurants around the hotel. They were all average, nothing stood out except HAPUNA Resturant which was very good with wonderful service , great food and with plenty of atmosphere. . This was our first trip to Honolulu and we now realize that there really are two parts to it. The bulk of the Hotels seem to be towards Diamond Head where their is some beautiful shops and hotels. I suspect that this is the more expensive accomodation option (discounting the hilton next to the Ilikai). However this area is very accessable by the $2 bus and even walkable if you can handle the heat from the Ilikai. Yes we would stay at the Ilikai again as it is very reasonable $ wise but we would also like to try something a bit more upmarket as well such as the Moana Surfrider which looked absolutly beautiful and had a wonderful position right on the beach.

clean, good space, great view and balcony (overlooking the lagoon) staff good and the best thing of all, fast efficient elevators.Staff good, good security always guards patrolling the lobby.loved the pool being real deep but closed too early and had too many rules! guess its all for safety and keeping public out that doesn't stay here.have to admit, took this hotel because they offered a deal with kitchen and ocean view, otherwise I would not have stayed here with the normal rates.

I cannot praise highly enough the early check-in and service from the front desk. Because of this early check-in, and special pricing, I probably accepted a room that I ordinarily would have refused (1724). The view (which I paid extra for) was fantastic and the bed comfortable. Everything else was OLD! The carpet was dirty white shag, the air conditioner did not cool the room, decor was original and shower head did not spray. I had to fix the toilet twice because the flush chain came off. Additionally, the lock did not work correctly (which the front desk happily comped us breakfast for our inconvenience without even asking).This would be a good choice for the right price, if you could be assured of getting one of the remodeled rooms.The on site grill is very reasonably priced and we enjoyed both meals we ate there.

Hotel : v comfortable. Lobby spacious; good staff. Arranged fun tours through them.Location : excellent. Short walk to Waikiki. Short bus ride to Ala Moana shopping. Transport : Easy access via bus or trolley cars. Fare on buses must be exact, presently $2.50. Fares on trolleys with pink flags give change (other trolleys are private charter). On each block, the bus going the opposite way is almost always directly over the road. Room : My adult daughter and I shared a twin bedroom on 24th floor with glorious ocean views from the balcony, for a week. It was spacious, clean and had two separate wardrobes, and a chest of drawers which always makes unpacking easier. (Some modern hotels omit drawers and you have to ask for them. They vary in their response, some saying they will give more hangers for the wardrobes. So, am I expected to hang up the intimate small items?!!). Enjoyed our stay.

I loved the location of this hotel. Our tours picked up from this hotel or within the block. I was on the 9th floor and had a beautiful view of the ocean and marina. The lanai was a good size with a table and chairs. The room was spacious with a good size kitchen. We stayed here on our timeshare. Staff was located on the second floor and were very helpful. I loved being able to visit the other hotels along the beach. My husband and I would take long walks every day along the beach. A lot of wedding pictures were taken on the beach behind the hotels. The view was beautiful. We had lunch and drinks at several different hotels on the beach. We had a prime view of the fireworks at the Hilton. The Ilikai Bar and Grill had good drinks but below average food and service. We loved the outdoor bar at the Modern Hotel next door. I would stay at this hotel again.

Stayed in unit # 2438 for 12 days. Nice and spacious. Air conditioning worked excellently. Nice big room, big bed and a very clean unit. View over the lagoon/ocean was amazing and the view for the fireworks unbelievable!!! Nicely located near the beach with a short walk to most amenities. Hotel staff /front desk staff were super friendly and very helpful-couldnt ask for anymore, Management should be proud of the staff (special Thanks to Richelle). Counting down the months until I can return again..!!

Stayed in a privately owned unit on the 25th floor. The unit was perfect for my husband and I to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The bed was super comfy. Lots of closet space. Kitchen was more than adequate. Nice size shower and plenty of hot water. Beach chairs and towels were great. TV and WiFi worked fine. The elevator was super fast and a great place to talk to other visitors. Location is fine. There is a little walk to the beach area so if you have small children be prepared. We enjoyed the walk. The units facing the ocean get warm from the afternoon sun. Thankfully the AC worked good. We kept the curtains shut while not in unit to help with keeping the heat out.The lanai is great with table and chairs.Things we did while staying here: island tour with Enoa, golf day at the Royal Hawaiian (beautiful and challenging course), cab to Diamond Head and hiked up for the sunrise. Hike up is not easy but doable. Wear comfy shoes, take water and comfy shoes. Ate at the Chart House (close to Ilikai and delicious steak dinner), Duke's (great buffet breakfast), Fumi's Shrimp Farm (yum) and another place where I had delicious Opah fish. The Ilikai Bar and Grill was great for drinks. Service was fine but food was mediocre.Pool was warm and fine for our use. Towels on site.The view from the unit is great of the marina and a beautiful sunset. We totally enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai and would most definitely return!

Perfect location. Close to shopping. Walking distance to the more touristy Waikiki area. The valets are wonderful. The front desk staff attentive and willing to help even with a line of people waiting. My husband and I really enjoyed the pool (pool staff is wonderful, too). The beach was clean and very enjoyable...especially at sunset. I miss Hawaii!!

I have wanted to go to Hawaii since I was a little girl and The Ilikai has always been a part of it.Glad to say it didn`t disappoint. I had a room on the 6th floor at first but asked to go higher and was placed on the 22nd without any fuss or charge. Chester on the front desk was amazing but all the staff were friendly and helpful. My room was beautiful and the bed was very comfy. I will be back and I won`t be staying anywhere else. The Ilikai Bar and Grill was very good also and the little market although expensive had good staff. It`s close to the beach and the shops and is within walking distance of the main Waikiki drag if you want excitement but far enough away that the noise isn`t a problem.

We stayed in a 2br apartment (1325) for a week through a private rental with the owner. As such we had minimal interaction with the hotel staff, but what we did have was fantastic. The valets and pool attendants are EXCELLENT! It should be criminal to have as much energy as those valets do at 6am! :) Valet parking is $25 per night, we paid for the convenience and an early start, but there are secure car parks right next door for around $7 for 10 hours.The overall hotel is nice, well maintained and in the ideal location for us as we have no desire to be in the heart of Waikiki with all the hustle and bustle of shops that never seem to close. We walked from Ilikai to Waikiki Beach Walk one night, its a very pleasant 15min walk, probably not so nice in the heat of the day though.Our apartment was overlooking the road, with only a small view from the balcony of the beach and water - but do you really travel to somewhere like Waikiki to sit on your balcony?? We certainly don't! Its less than 10 minutes walk to the Ala Moana Center, car rental agencies are right across the road, public transport stops right outside, and of course the beach and the lagoon are right on your doorstep. There are a couple of ABC stores within a minute's walk for your essential supplies, or you can go to the Foodland at the Ala Moana Center for more substantial groceries (this is where its handy to have 'pack horses' in the form of two almost teens to help carry a bag of groceries each, saving on bus or taxi fares!)A very enjoyable stay!

I have been to Hawaii twice and stayed in Ilikai hotel for both trips. Reasonable price, convenient location, amazing ocean view. Service is good, staff are friendly. Parking is a little expensive, but not hard to find street parking

We have paid 6 visits to the Ilikai during the past 3 years and have enjoyed every visit, the latest being October 14 to 19. Some of the rooms can need a little maintenance but overall they are all large and the ocean view rooms are worth the little extra to be able to sit on the balcony and watch the surf and the passing boat traffic. Last visit we upgraded to a room with a kitchen, definitely worth the extra cost as there is a relatively new supermarket at the Ala Moana Centre which has a good selection of both hot and cold food to allow for breakfasts and some dinners in the hotel room. The staff has always been friendly and helpful and the close proximity to the Ala Moana means that we will be staying at the Ilikai again in the future.

Our first stay in this Hotel,room 2537 was better than we expected.Gorgy views towards Honolulu.Great position for shopping at the Ala Moana and also close to beach. Large rooms and comfortable bed. We will definitely return.

I travel to Hawaii regularly for business, and my wife and daughter join me when we visit for the holidays. The Ilikai is our go to hotel. The location is excellent. The view is great, especially if you have an ocean view. It's close enough to Waikiki so that if you want to do the tourist thing, it's within walking distance. If you want to walk to Ala Moana to shop for anything, it's within walking distance. If you want to drive anywhere, it's outside of Waikiki so it's easy to get to just about any streets you'd need to use to get to anywhere you need to go (if you stay at a hotel on the Waikiki strip, you could spend up to 15 minutes just trying to get out of the Waikiki area when you're trying to drive somewhere). If you're traveling on business, the internet connection is free and is one of the fastest I've had in any hotel. If you're traveling with children or just don't want to always rely on restaurants to eat or want to be able to store leftovers, they have rooms with kitchens. When I travel on business I occasionally have to do press appearances, which means leaving the hotel by 4:30AM, well before any place is open for breakfast, so a kitchen is a must. One thing to note: the place overall is very quiet. One of the more quiet hotels I've stayed at anywhere. This is largely because (a) the building is a bit older (built in the 60's) so the walls are thicker then some newer hotels and (b) a good portion of the units are permanent residences.
user_name:
marginalKI
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We did a private rental from a lovely lady named Dainora and Rentals Waikiki and it was great! We had a one bedroom studio on the 17th floor for a VERY reasonable rate! Beautiful view of the ocean, lagoon and marina. We really didn't know what to expect since we usually exchange with Hilton and Marriot Vacation Clubs when we go to Hawaii. But, this year we were only able to get one week at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, due to availability. We were not disappointed with the Ilikai!! We spent the first week at the Hilton thru the Vacation Club and then moved over to the Ilikai. It all worked out perfectly. Dainora knew the situation and that we were checking out of the Hilton and I had asked if there was somewhere we could store luggage till the usual 3:00 check in time and she was able to arrange for us to check in early! It was wonderful! The place was clean and stocked with linens and necessities. When we arrived, the hotel staff and bellmen were very helpful in telling us where to go, etc. And, they even helped with our luggage on arrival even tho we weren't actually hotel guests. We thought the whole hotel was very nice ... clean, not noisy, crowded, etc. Very nicely decorated and open. We ate at the bar and restaurant a couple of times ... once for a sit down and twice got things to go and brought it upstairs. The food isn't bad and the prices are reasonable. The elevators are plenty and quick. We didn't use the pool since we prefer the ocean and do a lot of day trips, but it looked nice. You can see the Hilton Luau and Fireworks if you like that sort of thing from the balcony. Being a private rental within the hotel, you have to call the owner with any issues since you're not actually a 'registered guest'. We had a couple of minor glitches when we arrived, but they were taken care of immediately. We like that end of Waikiki ... always have. Somehow it seems 'in the action but also a tad away from it all'!! There's a walkway to the Hilton and you can use the lagoon and beach or as we did many times walk all the way down to our favorite places like the Shorebird, etc. All in all it was a great week. Dainora couldn't have been more helpful, or anyone else at the hotel for that matter. We received our security deposit back within a week as well. I would recommend this highly to anyone. And .... we wouldn't hesitate to return again.

We booked a newly remodeled condo in the Ilikai to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. It was much more than we anticipated. The hotel concierge and bellman were so helpful. There are several elevators so we never waited long. The public rooms in the Ilikai are open and breezy with lots of comfy sofas, tables and chairs. The bar and grill is a very reasonably priced option for a meal or snack. Every night the torch lighter blows the conch shell and lights each torch around the patio area. There is live entertainment some evenings.The Ilikai is on the north end of Waikiki next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but it is much quieter and less congested that the rest of Waikiki. We LOVED it!

Great location at the quiet end of waikki. Beautiful views of the blue pacific and teh best spot in the house for the hilton hotel fireworks every friday as they are right next door. friendly staff and great amenities

My partner, daughter and I stayed here for 6 nights early in October in a 1 bedroom facing the Lagoon on the 21st floor booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals. Amazingly the location is very quiet of a night and the view is fantastic with the opportunity to watch the fireworks each Tuesday and Friday night. Lifts are excellent and fast. Pool is great and nearby Lagoon is excellent for novice standup paddle boarders. However I do agree with other posts in that our room was due for a revamp as everything was beginning to look and feel a little tired and well worn and the bed and pillows really needed replacing. Kitchen utensils were rather light on as well, not really keeping with the 'aloha' spirit of things. On another note I did feel as though we were out of things a bit too much however the upside as I mentioned previously was the quietness and also short walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and Beach Park.

I booked 2 rooms. One for my wife and I, the other for my in-laws. Everyone loved the location. The rooms are probably due for a refresh within the next 5 years but they are very nice. The pool area and beach/lagoon access are perfect. The patio bar restaurant is very good and reasonably priced. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice, fun time and a good deal.

We booked a high floor mountain view hotel room for two nights before our cruise on 28 Sept, and booked a marina view condo through Waikiki Beach Rentals for six nights after the cruise. Hotel: We chose the high floor mountain view room primarily because we were only there for two nights and thought the lights at night would be pretty. We were right, the evening view was very pretty and we were treated to a stunning sunrise in the morning. However, we would choose an oceanview room in future because the traffic noise from the lanai was very unpleasant. Closing the door completely deadened the noise so sleeping wasn’t a problem, but having breakfast and drinks on the lanai wasn’t relaxing. Opt for the $10 per night high floor upgrade, the views are well worth the extra cost. Our room on the 25th floor was very spacious and comfortable, although a little tired looking. The rooms will be fabulous after the current upgrade is finished. We would happily stay here again for location, atmosphere and value for money – it’s next to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, a nice area of town and a good place to wander around for an evening stroll, and it is an easy and pleasant walk to either Ala Moana, the beach, the Ala Moana Reserve lagoon or the heart of Waikiki.Condo: We’d stayed in the same condo (2006) the previous year and absolutely loved the unit and the view over the marina. A minor grizzle is that glassware consisted of numerous chunky glass and plastic tumblers, one cracked flute and no wine glasses, there wasn’t a single teaspoon in the unit, and the towels varied greatly in quality, some were very good but others were extremely thin - more attention should be paid to these things. Having said that, the unit is very spacious, clean and comfortable, the furnishings are attractive, the location is great and the views from the unit are stunning, so we wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again. We were kindly given a free early check in after disembarking the ship (which can be arranged the day before if the unit is unoccupied prior to your check in). This was a great bonus for us, and we found Scott to be very efficient and pleasant to deal with throughout.Tip – if you need groceries, you can get a 5% discount at Foodland (at Ala Moana) if you give them your phone number (we gave the hotel’s phone number), and if you shop at Macys, ask for their tourist discount card, which gives you a 10% discount on purchases.The Hilton puts on a stunning firework display on Tuesday and Friday evenings, around 7.45pm – well worth popping down to the Hilton Lagoon for a ringside view.The bar & grill downstairs is very reasonably priced, the food is good and it’s a great location with a lovely outlook.All in all we had a lovely stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to others.

The room size made a huge difference. We didn't feel cramped at all. 2 beds, one full size sofa, 1 single lounge chair, a coffee table, desk, bureau, full-size kitchen...great! I usually stay at another local favorite a couple of blocks away but will switch to the Ilikai; price is comparable for a lot more. Another perk was the friendly and accommodating staff. I saw a washer and dryer in the ice room which would be a bonus for a longer trip. All in all, a very pleasant stay!

A few words about our wonderful stay at the Ilikai Hotel and Suites in Waikiki Beach, Oahu. I live on the east coast (Atlantic Ocean side) of Canada so travelling to Hawaii is a long day of flying. I have visited Oahu once before but this time my husband and I decided to take a cruise from Ensenada, Mexico across the Pacific where we could visit several Hawaiian islands before disembarking in Honolulu. The cruise was great but part of our plan was to stay at the Ilikai Hotel and Suites in Waikiki. I was really looking forward to another visit at the Ilikai. It is one of my favourite hotels. My daughter and her family found the Ilikai some years back and passed on the good news to me. I stayed there in 2010 for 10 days and this recent trip, with my husband, was a four night stay once we left the cruise ship in the port of Honolulu. I was very happy to be going back to the Ilikai because I knew from my previous vacation that it would be top notch and not the least bit stressful. The hotel has a homey atmosphere with friendly staff and a comfortable feeling that allows you to relax the minute you walk into the lobby. There are a number of shops in the hotel where you can spend time browsing, buying some beautiful Hawaiian fashions or obtaining articles you might have forgotten at home. The Ilikai has a wonderful outdoor/indoor cafe/restaurant which offers a good variety of menu items and drinks. Friday night there is always a wonderful Hawaiian band and hula dancers to entertain you while you dine or enjoy a drink under the starry sky.On Tuesday and Friday nights along the beach there is a great display of fireworks which adds to the entertainment found in the area.Our room, located on the 25th floor, was spacious and sunny with a magnificent view of the Ala Moana Beach Park and the local yacht club which is only a short walk. This beach and park area caters to people who have physical challenges and has a number of wheelchair walkways. This is a wonderful place to enjoy the sand and surf in a lovely family park atmosphere. The concierge at the hotel was more than helpful setting up our car rental. She will arrange any type of tour or adventure you want to enjoy. The office wall is filled with information on things to do while visiting Honolulu and the island of Oahu. We used the concierge to reserve our rented car which has an office located right across the street from the hotel in a small shopping centre. There are lots of small restaurants nearby with a variety of foods from around the world. Most of these restaurants and cafes have a daily happy hour each evening from 3 p.m. to 7 p.m and then there is the fast food chains if you happen to be in a hurry and want to grab a bite on the go. Not far from the hotel (about a 15 minute walk) is the Ala Moana Mall which has 290 stores and is open seven days a week. This beautiful mall offers something for everyone. Right outside the hotel door is the city bus stop and for $2.50 you can ride anywhere you want. There are also a number of hop on/hop off trolley stops in front of the hotel. If you want to walk to the central area of Waikiki Beach down near the International Market it would take about 45 minutes. It is a lovely walk that passes beautiful parks and lots of wonderful shops, restaurants and other hotels. If you have your own car the Ilikai's valet service will look after you. The Ilikai Hotel offers beautiful spacious rooms with large comfortable beds. The feature I enjoyed the most was the large patio sliding doors and windows as well as the lovely balconies. We had a wall of glass which gave us a spectacular view of the yacht club, the cruise ships coming and going and sunsets that were out of this world. We also had a small bar refrigerator, a microwave and a coffee maker. We usually had morning coffee and then went downstairs for breakfast. Having the beautiful park just a short walk away makes you feel you are not really in a big city but in a more rural setting. The park and beach are excellent for those who enjoy a morning or late afternoon swim and it is also great for walkers and those wishing to jog. The Ilikai Hotel also offers a number of suites equipped with a full kitchen, living room/dining area and two bedrooms so it is a hotel with a lot of options and worth checking out. We had a wonderful time and are already considering going back. I have passed on all my Ilikai information to my friends who want to visit Honolulu and who want to have a great place to stay. Staying at the Ilikai is a win, win situation.

We just returned this morning from an 11 night stay at an Ilikai Condo. We rented condo 526 from VRBO.com, at $300US per night excl taxes. 526 is a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom corner unit in the tower closest to the Hilton. The condo was spacious and well appointed - the kitchen contains a big oven and cook top, a big microwave and a ginormous ice making fridge. The ensuite bathroom has two sinks, one toilet and a shower over bath, while the other bathroom one sink, toilet and big shower. There is a lot of storage in the condo - perfect for keeping all that shopping out of the way! The condo also features a huge dining table and a super comfy couch and lanai furniture. There are tvs in the master bedroom and one in the lounge too which can be seen from the second room if you twist it round a bit.Our only mild annoyances are the air con, which makes quite a clunk when it switches itself off and on, and the two single beds were super squeaky ... You'd try not to move in the night so you wouldn't wake your roommate up! The Ilikai is in an awesome location (8 mins walk to Ala Moana and 12 mins into Waikiki proper, and 5 mins to the beach in front of the Hilton, 3 mins to the lagoon which was cold and full of small fish!) and the pool was just right - not crowded with random strangers right up close! Having now stayed at the Aqua Bamboo, the Pacific Monarch, the Hilton Hawaiian Village, and the Ilikai I would go back to the Ilikai at the drop of a hat, and would recommend it over the other hotels because of its atmosphere and comparable value for space. I would also recommend using VBRO to rent through. No hassles.

We stayed family of 5 in one of the private rental condos through Waikiki Beach Rentals - Room 1502 from Mid September to early October. Simply fantastic stay. Room was great view was great and to us this is the top spot in Waikiki. You can get from the Ilikai to anywhere with minimal fuss and bother and being located where it is you are out of the hussle and bussle of central Waikiki. I highly recommend WBR and the Ilikai. We will stay there again and book through WBR again without hesitation.

This Hotel is huge but inside condo 1639 you don't get that feeling. We had a very, very nice stay of 9 nights there and found everything we needed. The location is great, the view from the lanai is (upon occation = double rainbow) breathtaking. We had a wonderful time and will definitely consider comming here again.

We did not want to stay on 'the beach' and chose the Ilika as it seemed to be a bit out of the way and it was a perfect location as it the first pick up/drop off stop for the tour buses (Big Island, Pearl Harbour). We discovered we had been upgraded from a mountain view to a harbour view room (24th floor) with stunning views. Sunset and sunrise was magical. With a fridge and microwave we could get our own breakfast and the walk into the main shopping area was less than 30 minutes. As a base it was perfect with a small pool and more than enough deckchairs and daybeds and with easy access to the beaches you can get the Waikiki experience without the high hotel prices.

We just returned from Oahu and I have to say I can't wait to go back. We stayed at the Ilikai suites and everyone there was SO nice and helpful. We will gladly stay there again. Waikiki Beach was wonderful. I had way too many lava flow drinks and coconut shrimp but it was worth it. We went to the Honolulu zoo which was very nice. The animals seemed very happy and healthy. My brother David drove us around the whole island and we were surprised how big it was. The water was so incredibly warm. The air temp was a dewy 78 degrees and the water that day was 78 degrees also. HEAVEN on earth. Cannot wait to go back.

We stayed here one night and the room was a good size with a king bed and a sofa and desk as well as a kitchenette. All that was fine but it was really in need of a redo. It is the first hotel as you get into Waikiki so if you are staying a long time you might want to stay further along the strip. The staff was very nice, however and the bed was very comfortable. It was ok for a one night stay or if you have kids and want to cook.

We have stayed at the Ilikai 3 times and have found it to be excellent, but will admit we always rent a individually owned condo. We go through Aloha Condos and they are fantastic. The view and location for the cost is the best. We have never been disappointed, It sets next to the Hilton Hawaii village and can easily walk to the mall and to Waikiki Beach and shops. NO car needed. We don't have to check in or check out. Perfect spot to view the fireworks on T and F nights.

We recently travelled to Honolulu from Australia for our first visit. We reviewed a number of locations and booked at a condo elsewhere, at the last moment this booking was cancelled and we booked at the Illikai in a 2 bedroom unit which was lucky for us as this is a great location. You didn't need a car as everything is in walking distance or you can catch a trolley bus, or even cabs were quite reasonable. We had great views from the apartment, it was well fitted out. the bar downstairs was very well priced, local beers $3, cocktails $7 and snack/meals were very well priced. Easy walk to the beach, into town or to the Hilton Village next door. Across the road there are car rental agencies, everything you needed was there. All in all it was perfect for the 3 of us. The staff were very helpful and there is even a shop downstairs selling basic groceries etc. highly recommended

Arrived at this hotel on the 3/10/13 for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon. Check in was smooth with a friendly guy called rod behind the counter. When we got to our room we discovered a nice water feature in our bathroom mainly caused by a fellow resident upstairs not turning off a tap. We contacted reception and got a new room within 5 minutes. Our new room consisted of a very comfortable bed, sofa and a little kitchen and was seaview. We had food in the restaurant downstairs and I thought the quality was good even though it would be your typical resort bar menu. As in previous reviews this hotel was considered dated and we would have to agree. The hotels claim to fame was that it was used in the opening credits of the original Hawaii five O. I think the only thing that has changed since then was the towels. However the staff are very friendly. For those who'd like a pizza, leave the hotel and enter the Hilton which is adjacent. There's a fantastic pizza restaurant as part of their complex, think its called pizza time,open till midnight. Did a great tour to pearl harbour, organised through viator. Tour guide was called nappy and made the tour very enjoyable. Nice shop in the complex to get newspapers, coffee etc. lovely lagoon within a minutes walk where you can get a paddle boat and relax for a while. When we arrived first we used the baggage lift from curb side to the foyer. This lift would really put you off as its fairly dirty and smelly.however it leads up to a very clean and spacious foyer. As I said earlier the hotel is dated but I think I would stay here again. If you like luxury I wouldn't stay here but if its a hotel with friendly staff and good location you're after, maybe consider the ilikai.

We recently stayed for a week and will not be going back to the Illkai. Admittledly, we had a government rate room which included a broken down sofa/futon, steel stools, vertical blinds that didn't work properly, an empty bookcase, broken or missing knobs, mismatched furniture and a view of Ala Moana Blvd. The best part of our room was the bed, too bad it was brighter at 6AM then at 4PM in our room for you to sleep late.

We stayed at the Ilikai for a week and a half while on business in Hawaii. As other reviewers stated, it is a bit dated, but I think they are working on that. We had a nice, very spacious, clean room with a king sized bed. Housekeeping was excellent. The location is great if you've had enough of Waikiki--still on the beach but not as crowded. For us, it is way better for getting to work. The bar & grill had good food & staff was nice. We also really liked the pool. We had a great view of the fireworks at the Hilton too! Having the lanai is so wonderful when you are looking out at the water!Day one did not go well, as they had an electrical fire & we had to evacuate. (from floor 25!). All was well, although they need a plan to evacuate older folks as it was very hard for them. The store closed because of this and we needed (wanted, I suppose) water. So we went to several vending machines that didn't work, finally receiving coke not water. We asked the front desk for water and a refund, but they said they couldn't do that. Front desk issues when I had to extend my husband's stay because of work. We are corporate members and she wouldn't really talk to me. My husband had to take care of it after a long day. I think she passed it on to the gentleman who finally helped us, and he had it all handled no problem. Overall, it was a four star stay.

We stayed at the Ilikai hotel on 2 separate occasions in Sept. On both occasions we were on Floor 24 so the lift journey can be a bit slow!!The rooms were spacious and comfortable with everything we needed including a microwave. They are rather noisy esp on the balcony, because of the air conditioning units there and the never ending rumble of the city. Apart from this we had no complaints and enjoyed our stay and the helpful staff. We would recommend it and sure wold stay again.

We booked an apartment through VRBO rentals, and very impressed with the response from them as well as the owner.We had an apartment on the 10th Floor, with the most amazing views out to the Hawiaiian Hilton lagoon and Waikiki beach. It was nice to watch the world go by from our balcony.The Condo had everything we required for a 2 week stay, including a fully equipped kitchen. The hotel itself is a little tired, but the lobby has been recently refurbished, which includes an ABC store, coffee shop, and a few clothes shops. There is a restaurant in the courtyard called the Ilikai Bar and Grill and we had many a nice lunch and dinner there. Found the staff very friendly, and the service fast..The pool was nice, with plenty of sun lounges, however a few more sun umbrellas would be nice.The location of the Ilikai was great, a 10 minute walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre, and about the same to downtown Waikiiki and beach. If you dont feel like walking the Trolley bus stops right outside the Ilikai.Every Tuesday and Friday the Hawaiian Hilton put on a free Fireworks display at the Lagoon round about 8pm. We had the most amazing views from our balcony.Will be back !

Wanted to try the other end of Waikiki Beach this time. IIikai Hotel was a good choice. Nothing extraordinary except the room was very nice and large. Full kitchen, sitting area and king bed. Good size bathroom. Very big lanai overlooking the harbor. Staff was pleasant. If you can get a good price - under $200/night, would be worth a try.Downside - the room was not cleaned that well; dining options more limited.

We rented the unit through a rental agency, I had requested several times that I needed a room with a separate bedroom, to my surprise this did not happen. All in all the room was clean and well stocked with towels beach towels and beach equipment. The kitchen had the bear minimum. The views were beautiful, sunset was enjoyed every evening off our lanai. Check in was so easy and great not having to worry about keys. Bed was comfortable. ac worked well.Staff were friendly and helpful, the pool guy was so nice, great job. The bar and grill was a great place for drinks and food, staff were helpful. Great location near abc stores easy walk into Waikiki and shopping areas, transport was out the front so very easy. Great stay yes I would come back but would make extra extra sure of the room. Loved it.....

Just returned from our 1st rip to the Hawaii where we stayed at The Ilikai (Technically Waikiki Marina Resort at the Ilikai - as we exchanged our timeshare) room 416 for 2 weeksAll-in-all it was very satisfying experience. The check-in ad check-out services were seamlessly easy and the folks at the Waikiki Marina Resort office were totally helpful (esp. Reggie an Nicole)Any of our questions were answered promptly, some of the great suggestions were offered (incl. places to see and eat)The room was clean, large enough and comfortable with enough dishes and kitchen utensils to work for us (it was jut my wife and I). The balcony (lanai) was not huge but spacious enough to sit comfortably and have a breakfast or lunch (we pretty much dined out every day)The view was "partial ocean" - would've been more if the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door dint built their latest addition tower couple of years ago (I guess stuff like that just cannot be helped); also could see part of the Marina (from which, as it turned out, The SS Minnow departed for that fateful "3-hour tour") and the Duke K. Lagoon. On Tuesdays & Friday cold see the fireworks next door, however not fully (much better off just walk to the lagoon). And the roof of the 2nd floor was a bit too close but, again, things could be worse :)The room is cleaned 2 times a week - a full cleanup on Mondays and a partial (change towels refresh-type) on Thursdays. Was always done efficiently.The common hallway area does look a bit warn out on that floor and could use a spruce up. First week we could smell "something fishy" as we were approaching our door (perhaps someone dropped their lunch or something in the hallway); by the 2nd one the smell was gone but the area around our door needed to be vacuumed rather badly (NO it as not us littering...LOL). A bit of a nuisance but nothing to put damper on the overall experience We did park our car using the valet parking. That is a HUGE expense (at $28.00\day + the tip every time the car is brought back) but to some extend I dint have to worry about anyone breaking into a rental car (I heard stories GALORE from both tourists and locals incl. warnings from the rental car agent and the staff at the hotel) if I parked it somewhere else and the guys were very efficient taking the car and bringing it out (never had to wait more than 5 mins for I).On a retrospect - probably would not rent a car for the whole duration of the stay next time but that is a different topic all together.The restaurants on premises are excellent - ate at both Sarentos and Ilikai Bar & Grill as well as the café for breakfast; that said - tons and tons of eating options literally within walking distance!The shops seem adequate enough but we hardly paid them any mind - checked couple of things but didn't buy anything; but they are there if need be. That said - ABC STORES is next door (kind of a oversized 7-11 if you will) with plenty of all kinds stuff at very reasonable pricesNice terrace out back with cute little garden full of various flowers (lots of modeling and wedding photo shoot sessions here and at the beach) The pool is small but seem to be just the right size as it was never crowded. Immaculately clean with pool attendant on site and plenty of towels. For those who want to do laps - morning hours are "reserved" otherwise just relax and enjoy (the concrete does get HOT come mid-afternoon though)The location is very good - took us less than 10 mins to walk out back to the nearest beach area; about the same to walk to Ala Moana Mall; you can walk to any part of Waikiki downtown (and even Historic Honolulu if so chose) and driving to and fro was very easy.The only slight disappointment was not to find any original Hawaii Five-O memorabilia (although we were told that it was "around"). The only thing connected to the series is a "Chin Ho" tree in the back courtyard\terrace but then - it is more of a tribute to the original ownerI would not hesitate to come back to Ilikai I the future!!!!

We stayed in the unit with great view of lagoon and ocean. The view was the best part of this place. We enjoyed having breakfast and dinner on the lanai. We had a visitor we named "Bob" on each meal. He is a small bird with one stub foot. Now into the details.The sofa bed and the king sized bed in our unit was very uncomfortable and we had backaches at the end of our stay. There was not enough plates or pans to cook. It really does not cost too much to add those items!We had a car, so parking was a bit of hassle. There are free parking during a day until 10:30pm around marina. We move the car at night into Parking lot A for over night parking, $6/10hr week nights, then move again to free parking. We may stay at this location again, but not in the same unit.

I had only just arrived today and had a list of thins I wanted to do while I am in Honolulu. Michael not only helped me book everything I wanted, he gave me some excellent advice, found the best deals for me. I came in $250 under what I had put aside to get everything done. All of this with a smile and a sense of humour. I have been very impressed since checking in with the location, the staff and the amenities but MIchael is by far and away one of their best assets. Thanks Michael.

We got an apartment here on the 5th floor via Hawaii Vacation Properties (not thru the hotel directly). Check in was seamless as we just went to the room and entered a 4 digit # into the keypad. Great not having to deal with a key/ card for whole vacation.We didn't have a car so didn't use the parking - we used pre booked taxi from Airport (A8 Taxi - $35). Return to airport using shuttle $22 (VIP). Recommend both, great service.Apartment is good sized with full kitchen. Bathroom good sized with fantastic tiled shower. Room overlooks the lagoon so fireworks show was perfect from the lanai (very good sized as well). take a look at the web page for all the details and pictures: http://hawaiivacationpropertiesllc.com/vrp/rentals/i-5jm1.htmService was fantastic as the few issues we had were dealt to quickly. Room has wifi as well (end of our stay there was an outage for a bit and after that the service was spotty but still a nice feature). Flatscreen TV, good size, with lots of channels and dvd player.Main benefit of this place is it is close to everything - car rentals just across the street, Ala Moana is 10 minute walk, beach is 5 minute walk, key bus stops right out front, 15 minute walk to downtown Waikiki, next to Hilton, close to ABC store (what isn't), cafes, etc.We've stayed at Aqua Palms just across the road in the past and while this room was a bit more, it was bigger and the kitchen is a bonus. downsides: the room is just above some fans, ducting units out back (not sure what for) so it was a touch loud with the door to the deck open. Also, the AC unit is a bit loud until we finally got used to it. Ilikai hallways don't seem to have AC either so can get a touch warm when carting luggage.In all we'll probably stay here again (or maybe look for a unit a bit higher up). I'd say anyone going to Waikiki should at least enquire about this one and add it to their search.

My wife and I rented a Condo off the VRBO website and it was perfect. Doug the owner was excellent to deal with always answering our emails promptly with any questions I had before I arrived. The Condo was clean and a very good size for the two of us. Our unit was on the 9th floor facing the ocean and Hilton Lagoon. The location was perfect close to the best beach not too crowded. When going to the beach the best part for entering the water which was all sand was closer to the Hilton's boat dock or pier. If you decide to sit closer to the the break water there are a few rocks and coral which is a little hard on the feet if you don't have water shoes. The king size bed was very comfortable, the view from the balcony was awesome and was the best spot for morning coffee and evening wine.The Condo was equipped with a kitchen with all cooking utensils although we only had our breakfast here as we were always away during the day enjoying the fantastic beach or exploring the island. The building has free WIFI which was a great way to communicate to family and friends back home. There are several places to eat lunch on or near the beach but my favorite was a 5 minute walk down the beach to the Steak Shack see my review.The Illikai Bar and Grill has some good food and drinks and very reasonable prices too compared to other places in Waikiki. The friendly service of the bartenders and waitresses was excellent. We ate here 3 or 4 times and enjoyed the outdoor atmosphere with live traditional Hawaiian music and dancers on Friday night too. There is also a fine dining option in the building located on the top floor Sarentos. We did not eat here but the menu looked good. We ate twice at the mall as they have a massive selection of restaurants in there food court. The prices are very reasonable here for a meal . We took The Bus $2.50 pp return to Diamond Head for a hike and the view was amazing, be sure to wear comfortable shoes and bring water. There is coffee shop in the lobby which serves great coffee and snacks as well which was very good. The store in the lobby is quite expensive in my opinion, try walking across the street to the ABC store for better prices and if you have more time go to the Foodland store in the mall about a 10 minute walk away to the left of the front entrance for the best prices on food. There was snorkeling gear, beach chairs/mats, floaties and beach toys in the closet and a beach bag which was a bonus as we had forgot to pack one. The building itself looks a bit dated or older from the outside but it is freshly painted and immaculately clean and I believe the lobby area was recently renovated. The pool was nice at the end of the day on the beach to get the sand and salt off. We seen the fireworks on Friday night from the balcony and as advertised the view was spectacular. The fireworks are two times a week now Tuesday and Friday's. We rented a car one day from the airport and parked at the marina for $1/ hour which is cheaper than the valet parking at the hotel. The Illikai was about a 15/20 minute stroll down into the heart of Waikiki and was nice in the evening with all the torches lit. You can walk either the street or the beach route. I thought the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful when I asked them any questions. Overall the place was perfect for us and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Waikiki. Would I return? Absolutely !

Well, it is not easy to choose right hotel in Honolulu, especially if you are dozen of thousands miles away... Still, during the booking process as well as during my stay I understood that could not wish better! Extremely helpful personnel, the ocean view was indeed ocean view, clean, quite, ocean almost next to door - what else to wish? Shops, including general store, are there inside too.
