You get beach towels and beach seats as complimentary services. Do not even think, go there!

Going to Hawaii has always been a dream and we had the chance to go twice, so we can say it is a winner! Staying at The Ilikai feels like home! Close to shopping, restaurants, on the beach, bus station, you do not need to rent a car! It is really not that expensive and if you want to explore the island a little bit more, I suggest renting a car for 2 or 3 days so it will not cost you too much. If you are going during Christmas time, the rental will not come cheaper. Prices will go down after January 1st. But strolling along gives you time to do a little activity beside laying down on the beach and do not forget to bring a frisbee so you can have fun! The island is absolutely incredible and a wonderful place if you love taking pictures!

The Ilikai is located at the west end of Waikiki. We rented a condo from a rental agency. We liked the easy walk to AlaMoana, the short distance to the beach out the back, disliked the inconvenient and expensive parking. Pool was good but not great. I know there are better units than the one we rented so just shop around. The layout and space was just what we needed (2 bd 2bath) but the furniture paint etc could have been better.

I liked not being in the busy part of Waikiki. It's located close enough to shopping, dining, and fun without being in the most congested part of the city. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. Great room with multi-views!! Had a really great stay! We would absolutely stay here again!

My mother and I stayed at the Ilikai and enjoyed our stay. The location was convenient to Waikiki beach and the staff, especially the concierge staff were helpful and efficient. We were upgraded to a junior sweet with a kitchentte which was a nice surprise. Our room on the 22nd floor had an excellent view of the luau show at the Hilton next door, as well as the fireworks orginating from the lagoon below. The junior suite had a king bed and a couch, whch I assume pulled out into a sofa bed. There was a very large selection of television channels on the tv in the room. None of the other hotels I've been to have had as extensive selection.

I stayed for 2 days at the Ilikai with some freinds. I went there after my 3 days at the Sheraton Princess. They had a one bedroom suite/apartment, with a full kitchen, and a pullout sofabed....where I slept. Not the most comfortable but better than nothing. These suites are wonderful! Clean. Very roomy, and HUGE lanai with 2 chairs, a table and chaise! Although the room faced the busy street, you could never hear the traffic when the patio doors were closed. The staff at the bar/grill were wonderful and food wasn't at all expensive and very, very good! We did most of our eating and drinking here! The location, though a bit of a walk to the downtown area, was good and close to other shopping and eating & drinking establishments. I would definately stay here again.

This property has it all; great location, stunning views, large comfortable rooms, and most of all exceptional hospitality.Been here a couple times and it just gets better everytime. It's a home away from home.

We had a lovely studio room on 15th floor and booked through Waikiki Beach Rentals. Room was well equipped, clean and perfect for what we needed - kitchen for grabbing quick breakfast etc. By far the biggest downside was noise- our room was at the back over the multiple lane road and other buildings ventilation/air con units. I wore ear plugs but still very noisy & using air con at night was a total no no because of noise. If I stayed here again I would DEFINITELY go for a room overlooking beach/lagoon & would recommend other people do this unless you are one of those lucky people who can sleep anywhere/anytime. Pool area was nice, lovely deep pool - did get pretty busy at times. Bar/grill was good for drink/lunch.This was by far the most reasonably priced and as we were in Hawaii for two weeks we needed to make the budget stretch a bit further. The location is good on beach/harbour, about a 15-20 minute walk to town - really nice walk at sunset along the beach, trolley bus also stops outside - 2USD trip one way to town. Also super close to Ala Moana shopping centre.

My husband and I stayed at the Ilikai Hotel January of 2013 and were a little worried reading the reviews but let me tell you, everything about this hotel was great in our eyes! Everyone was friendly and our room was big and clean and we had a o/v room on the 25th floor and we couldn't have been happier with our choice of hotels!! We both have discussed that when the day comes that we go back to Hawaii, that will be were we stay!!
user_name:
Liz S
Yukon, Oklahoma, United States

review_body: Arrived wonderful room great views over the Marina and beach looking towards the airport. Clean and inviting the room was a little bit smaller than thought but this was no problem.Close to the beach and the end of Waikiki beach next to the Hilton Hotel. A 20min walk into the main downtown shopping area along the beach. Close to the Moana shopping centre, easy Trolley ride to the downtown area cost $2 and takes about 10 min. The booking agency in the Lobby was of great Value and used it to book daytrips.Hired a Mustang car from the company in the lobby but still have not got my deposit back and lost the information so my advice is maybe use a different company who deliver to the Hotel.The bars in the Hotel was great friendly but as this was peak period for US holidays get in early if you want a seat, food was good.

We loved staying here as we had a room with a beach/lagoon view. The room was clean and comfortable and fhe staff were friendly and helpful. We got a room with a kitchen so we could prepare our own breakfasts and lunches which helped save a few dollars. Unfortunately some of those savings were eaten up when we were advised, on check in, that the rate we were given was now $20 more per night than quoted. Someone else in the elevator was changing hotels because his rate was increased by $100 - not sure over how many days. All hotels state this in their terms but this was the only hotel in 6 weeks of travelling that actually did it. If not for this then they would have received a 5 from us. Would definitely recommend the hotel but maybe clarify that the rate won't go up on arrival.

We loved our apartment. We had been travelling ofr 4 weeks so staying in one place for 10 days was a luxury. We liked to be able to cook our own breakfast adn sit on the balconey and read and relax. The apartments are in a great location for either a nice walk or there is plenty of transport if you are not a walker. There is a lovely pool but the lagoon and beach or only a 5 minute (if that) walk. I also liked that there was a laundry room (probably more important to a women than a man!!). We made use of the bar, cafe and coffee shop. The bar prices are very reasonable and the food was of a high standard (just as good as nearby Hilton Hawiian but maybe not presented as well).

My wife, twenty-three year old son and a friend of his spent 5 days on Maui in our Westin timeshare and then flew back to Oahu for 3 days before returning home. Not wanting to spend a fortune on two rooms, my wife found the Ilikai website and read about their two bedroom, two bathroom suites. The price was more than reasonable, so much so that we booked an ocean view suite. Imagine our delight when we arrived and not only found a great suite but a fantastic wrap around city, harbor and ocean view. I venture to say we will by pass Maui and the timeshare next time and go directly to the Ikikai! Wonderful experience!

We chose Apartment 1424 (through Aloha Condos) instead of Hilton across the road. Cost around the same as a basic Hilton room, but we got early check in (our flight from Sydney arrived very early in morning) included, and had benefit of kitchenette and view. The condo's a little larger than a large hotel room. We enjoyed the downstairs grill restaurant, well priced and good food, and mini supermarket plus cafe. The condo was well kitted out, with everything you needed including boogie boards and beach toys for kids, but the lounge/bed for our kids was just adequate - if our kids had been a little older (they're 11 and 7 years old) it may have been pushing it in terms of comfort and size. Under that age it's fine. The convenience of going straight up to our condo on arrival, and using the key pad to get in (no check in queue), was a big plus for us. Communication prior to arrival was excellent. THe location was great, with the beach and lagoon close by, not that we spent much time there (lagoon/beach hygiene??!!), and you easily can hire a car for the day from any of the outlets across the road, saving you money (you pay a bomb in Hawaii to park your car over night - it's cheaper to hire a car in the morning and return it in the evening). Everything's in easy walking distance. If you're there on a Friday night, be sure and go to the lagoon to see the weekly fireworks put on by the Hilton as you can't see them from the Ilikai. You will however get to see the nightly Hilton Luau from this condo's balcony!

We/I have been to Honolulu at least 2 dozen times, starting in 1970. The Illikai Hotel is a great find. We were looking for inexpensive and close to the Kahanamouku Lagoon. This hotel fit the bill. We stayed in the "Shell Resort" side of the hotel. The hotel is split with one wing private residences/time share the other a true Hotel with front desk. We had to go to the 2nd floor to "check in" and everything was waiting as promised. We had 2 rooms for 8 family members, including 3 babies. The check in was seamless and the welcome packet was a nice touch. The room was bright, clean and spacious. The maid service refreshed our towels daily. The kitchenette was Spartan with minimal cookware, however, we made it work. The room faced Ala Moana Blvd, therefore sitting on the lanai to read or check email was ridiculous due to the traffic noise. With the sliding door shut, the noise was al but gone. The hotel halls were NOT air conditioned, so it felt like a sauna walking from the elevator to the room. Being built in 1964, Illikai was the first high rise on Waikiki and is dated. To their credit, the building has been well maintained and is in the process of a floor by floor renovation. Brandon at the help desk was amazing, thank you. There are two pools, one for each side of the hotel. They will throw you out of the "Hotel Side" if you mistakenly wander into "their" pool. ( which I did with my grandson. It was quite embarrassing). The hotel is ideally located at the end of Waikiki, walking distance to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, which has great restaurants and shops a plenty. "The Bus", Honolulu's rapid transit is great and will take you to just about anywhere in Honolulu you want to go. Bandon, at the help desk, will plot your rout and tell you where to catch the bus. He was right on when we did the Diamond Head State Park tour ( see review).Hints: Fire works are at the Kahanamouku Lagoon ( By Hilton Vacation Village) just steps from the Illikai each Friday and Wednesday evening at 7:45 and 8:00PM respectively. Quite a nice free event, I must say.Buy eggs and breakfast items at the ABC Superette directly across the street. Bring a Zip Lock baggie of your favorite coffee and #4 filters. There is a coffee maker in the room and making your own breakfast will save you time and a truck load of cash so you can spend more on attractions.Almost every event/attraction is available within walking distance: snorkeling trip, paddle boarding, surfing, surfing lessons, sunset dinner cruises, ( recommend doing one) etc. Again see Brandon at the help desk in the lobby. Rent a car. YOU DO NOT NEED ONE. Get a shuttle from the airport or pay $37.00 for the taxi ride. ( we choose a taxi as it is more personal and less hassle). If you want to drive the island ( which takes one day) rent a car from the place on Kalakaua Ave & Ala Moana Blvd, which is walking distance from the hotel.Polynesian Cultural Center. We have gone there and found it to be a waste of a full day. It is an extension of Brigham Young University and by the end of the day, you will never, EVER want to say "Aloha" again. Having said that, if you have an extra day to blow, then consider it. we prefer to grab a few towels from ABC store and hang out at the North Shore. We are already planning another stay at Illikai, but will definitely ask for an ocean view and pay a few more scoots to be able to drink coffee on the lanai in the morning, in peace.

We used a timeshare 1 bedroom apartment in this hotel for five weeks and had a wonderful holiday.No problem finding seats around the pool area.Hotel had a good atmosphere and the bar and grill was good value for money.Hotel location was excellent midway between ALA MOANA and the INTERNATIONAL MARKET PLACE and yards from the beach

We stayed in one of the condos and loved it. Amazing views of the harbour and ocean. Very easy walking distance to the beach, shops and large shopping centre. You could sit on the balcony and watch the sunset and also had great views of the Hilton lagoon. We also got up every morning and saw how great the surf was and could go surfing within minutes of getting up. We would definitely stay there again.

We used a Shell timeshare studio condo in this facility in early August. The entire hotel was a bit dated and fading. The pools were on the small side, and the "kid's" pool was only open until 7pm each night. Crazy!!!! The pub grub style food served at the "grownup's" pool and at the burger bar adjacent to the lobby were decent, as was the bar service at the "grownup" pool. The Shell condo did not provide beach towels. We were asked to use the white bath towels from the unit whenever we went to the beach. Needless to say they got amazingly dirty. Most hated, though, was the $28 per day mandatory valet charge (plus an extra $2-$4 per day in valet tips). Slow, pointless and overpriced. We were on the street side. Traffic was VERY noisy. The beds were comfortable and the shower stall decent sized, hence a two bubble rating instead of one. As for Oahu, the traffic was wretched, but the rest of the island was great as soon as we got away from Honolulu/Waikiki.

Words or pictures do not do this justice. Amazing view with in walking distance to a lot of wonderful restaurants & shopping. You have the luxury of the busy beach without all the noise at your resort. We had an amazing sunset view and the Hilton lagoon. There is a sidewalk from the hotel all the way down the beach.

Might be cheaper but they are in the middle of moving from a hotel to time share ....it was like being in an old people's resort.No room service ( and no mention of this when we booked), very average meals when we dined in their restaurant and the fun police wouldn't even let families in the pool before 8.30am. The business centre has closed down and there are lots of empty stores. The only saving grace was that we could slip into ' the modern' next door for a meal.Great view....what a pity

Spent two nights here and was not disappointedClose to the marina and the quiet end of Waikiki BeachHotel has been refurbished with large rooms.Book a room overlooking beach..you will not regret itStaff excellent and helpful and well pricedWill def stay here again

Had an awesome week in Oahu. I would recommend the Ilikai Hotel. Not over crowded and the service was excellent from the timeshare staff. We traded our week to stay there and was very pleased with the room and location. Can't wait to return !

Great two bed apartment for 6 of us clean and well presented (room 1927) well equipped could get a good view of the Hilton Luau for free and also see if you can stay a Friday for the firework display - we stayed in the room but you would get a better view by going down to the beach- we used the lagoon and hired an SUP which was great fun - would book this or similar again.

Recently got back from Oahu. A friend and I stayed at the Ilikai. From what I understand, this is a time share and owned property. We rented a 1 bedroom that was really a studio. The furniture and supplies were from the Hawaii 5-0 era, the first Hawaii 5-0 but everything was very clean. We had a room facing the marina which was beautiful. There are 3 sides and I wouldn't want to be on the one that faces downtown but that's just my preference. The lanai was big enough to have have dinner and the sunsets were beautiful. The lobby is very nice but really isn't for renters of owned units. Make sure you know what kind of unit you're getting. The pool area was fine, on the smallish side but clean and plenty of chairs. Lots of kids but they all seemed to be well behaved. The building has a little grocery which was fabulous. All the makings for vodka tonics. I think you get what you pay for at this place.

We spent eight nights at the Ilikai on the 20th floor..... our unit had a wonderful view of the Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon in front of the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door so we were able to easily watch the Friday night fireworks from the balcony.The condo was clean and secured with a door lock that used a combination. This property is very convenient to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Hale Koa resorts..... A little bit away from central Waikiki, the Ilikai is still a convenient place to stay if you are not adverse to walking a few blocks.Valet parking is available for $28 a day. (in July, 2013)We plan to stay here again.

I spent a luxurious weekend at the Ilikai Hotel. I was very pleased with the service and accommodations. I had a room overlooking the ocean. Every morning I would sit on the lanai, have a cup of coffee, and enjoy the sunrise. There's no better place than beautiful Hawaii. The smell of the ocean, the cool breezes and the pleasant people make for a great vacation.

Stayed here with a friend and couldn't fault it, about half price of a central Waikiki hotel, but an easy walk into town, bus stops and shuttles pick up from outside door.Pool good and views over Hilton meant we could enjoy luau every night for free and twice weekly fireworks!

I frequently take business trips to Oahu from a neighbor island. I decided to give the Ilikai a shot! However, I was rather disappointed.The room is outdated, particularly the bathroom that looks like it belongs in the 1970's. The bedding was also on the cheap side. The room had no additional pillows or blankets. Lastly, the curtain was broken (no longer attached to sliding rod) and, therefore, would not close all the way.I was also disappointed with housekeeping. I returned to my room to find all the towels replaced but nothing was vacuumed or tidied up (i.e. pillows on couch, blow dryer on sink,etc.)I do not plan to stay here again. Spend the extra $50 and stay next door at the Modern.

stayed in room 2224, very spacious & clean. No complaints at all and would thoroughly recommend Ilikai. Great location and easy walk to all parts we wanted to see. Better than our first few nights we stayed right in the middle of Waikiki and it's not our style at all.Free wifi was a bonus and fast speed was great. Staff were welcoming and very helpful at all times.

My family and I recently stayed in a two bedroom suite at the Ilikai and we had the most enjoyable time! The staff was wonderful; cleaning staff, valet parking staff, beach side restaurant staff and the front desk staff! The two bedroom suite was great for a family of four with a teenager and a young adult. We had plenty of space. Also, having a kitchen helped! We went to the local grocery store and was able to pick up some food to prepare meals within our hotel room. The location is great too! It is where Waikiki Beach begins, but the I have to say the beach is great at this end of Waikiki! The Ilikai will provide beach chairs and beach towels, so you don't have to worry about packing them. If renting a car most restaurants within the Waikiki Beach will provided paid parking or a reduce parking fee at their restaurant location. This works out to be cheaper than taking public transportation for a family of four. I would definitely stay again on our next trip to Hawaii at the Ilikai Hotel & Suites!MAHALO!
user_name:
Diane L
Fairfax, Virginia, United States

review_body: We stayed at the IIlikai apartments and had a great stay.. We were in room 427 and it was well priced and comfortable room . the view over the Marina is beautiful. all the mod cons with free WI FI and local phone calls ideal for making those tour bookings. would definitely recommend to a couple that don't have to be in the heart of Waikiki.. it is a 20 minute walk but you have bus/taxi at front door. the wife loved the close proximity to Ala Moana shopping centre .A great place to stay and will be returning.

My family of 5 just stayed at the Ilikai in a two bedroom suite. It was very clean and perfect for a family of 5. The location was great as we could walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre and took cab rides to the beachwalk restaurants and shops. They have a nice coffee store in the basement albeit expensive and the view is beautiful. To get to the beach it was about a 5 minute walk which at times seemed a little long in the 30 degree heat so we would just stay by the pool. There are no activities at this hotel and it is one of the quieter hotels. The concierge was not very helpful in recommending or making dinner reservations but did book a trip to Pear Harbour. It was a very nice hotel for the price which was much cheaper than the hotels closer to the beach walk.

This property has seen better days. Nice location and friendly staff - HOWEVER, this place is in need of a remodel. Rooms was both shabby and OVERPRICED!Worn furnishings, stained wallpaper - photos on website were likely taken 10 years ago.

My family stayed for 7days in 2 different units on 24th floor. It was wonderful stay to our famaily.We had great vacation illikai with excellent view ang good location and the staff was very kind. I I wolud like to express many thanks to Mz. Richelle who helped us with many things.We love the illikai.

The location of the Ilikai was great. It was on a bus route. It was an easy 5 minute walks to Ala Moana Shopping Centre for our groceries (Foodland prices were to be expected in a tourist area). We managed to take the bus back to the hotel with two 5 yo twins in tow and 2 big bags of groceries. The beach access was so easy. The lagoon was just outside the hotel - a short walk over an overpass. And we just headed to the pool area to hose off all the sand before we walked back into the hotel. And 'bathers' had a separate elevator. From the Ilikai, we could walk to the heart of Waikiki. It was quite a walk, but the bus stop was right outside the building, so getting there was easy. Hang on to your bus transfers! One night, we walked all the way along the beach from the Hula Grill (Outrigger Waikiki) back to the Ilikai.The idea of renting a condo was the best thing for our family. We wanted to have breakfasts and lunches in our unit to save some money. And my kids always preferred their usual stuff for breakfasts. But this unit was not what we had expected. It was dirty!! A few days prior to our arrival, Waikiki Beach Rental had emailed us to check on what time we would be accessing the unit (there was no keys, just a 4- digit code to enter). Our flight arrived in Honolulu in the late evening. So we told them we should be in the unit by 11:00 pm. We understood that the normal check out time was 11:00 am. So this unit should be vacant and be available for professional cleaning all day (I stressed Professional cleaning). Since we arrived so late at night with very tired young kids, I didn't really go looking around to check out the unit. Just wanted to get the kids off the bed. I will come back to the 'bed' later. When I did have a chance to look around in the morning, this was what I found...The kitchen had the basic that we had expected. But some of the dishes, cutleries, pots and pans were dirty. And the dishwasher was broken. A note was left on the counter to inform us not to use it and that the owner was informed of the situation. A couple of days later, some one (didn't really know who that was) came by to check out the dishwasher and said would return later to replace it and that we did not need to be there when they return to do so. Well, we were not happy with the idea that some strangers would be in the unit while we were not there and we did not want to waste our vacation time to sit and wait for them. Anyways, no one had ever came back to replace it. I had gotten used to hand washing everything. I also made sure no open food packages around the counter as I had already killed two cockcroaches. I knew it was to be expected in old buildings but YUCK. Thank goodness my kids never saw them! Both times was in the dark bathroom. Not something I wanted to see. Yes, I know we were in a tropical place and that it was normal but the unit had cracks in some corners of the bathroom and the area under the sink was not pleasant. The bathroom could definitely use some updates. There were not enough bath towels to go around. But that was why there was laundry facility down the hall. Bring your own soap. I brought samples from home. The photos on the website were pretty accurate. We knew it was out dated. When they are ready to update in the future, a bath tub with a hand held shower head would be nice. The kids would prefer a tub instead of just a shower. The floors were still dirty from the previous guests. The area under the sofa and the dining table were so dusty and covered with food particles. On the memo left on the kitchen counter, it said if we wanted a cleaning done during our stay, the cost would be $ 50. What!!! I just got the vacuum out and just cleaned up myself. The sofa bed was not acceptable. Good thing my twins are too little to care. The mattress was very bumpy. It would not laid flat. No adults would accept that. I swear that sofa bed was never replaced from day one. There was one good point through all of this. The ocean view was great. We could see the luau on the roof top at the Hilton. It was on a few times. Can't remember which days of the week. We saw the fireworks from the Hilton instead. The other building in front of us blocks the view (and they could look into our unit). We had a few meals on the balcony. Just had to make sure the kids were not so close to the railings. A bit scary. We didn't dealing with the hotel staff as this was a private condo rental. So I couldn't comment on them. Only that if you were to leave your bags with the bell staff after you have checked out, the cost was $1 per bag. We only rented a car for one day and did the drive to the North Shore. But didn't realize that on Sundays, some places are not open. We had wanted to check out a few restaurants that were not within the Waikiki area, but they were closed. Too bad. But a must stop for shave ice at Matsumoto was so yummy. Tried the Green tea special. So good! As for the parking, the rental car (Enterprise) agency had hinted that the marina parking may not be safe therefore, parking at the parking lot (gated) at the Red Lobster would be better. If you want to prepaid, $7 would buy you 10 hours. And after that, I think it was $4 per half hour. So that option did not work for us. We ended up paying $20. All in all, the vacation was good, just wish the stay in the actual room was nicer.

Bit surprised that this room we got was nothing like the photos on website. Maybe we just happened to get a room in very dated floor? I regret not booking a four star hotel deal just $25 more, after parking fee $28( Valet Only)

My family accompanied me to a conference in Honolulu. Many of my colleages stayed next door at the village. However, I wanted larger accomodations for my family so we could eat some in the condo and have more space. I could not have been more pleased with the Ilikai. Our 2 bedroom condo was very spacious. We chose the "mountain view" instead of the more expensive ocean view, but the view was still beautiful and we could still see the ocean outside the bedroom balcony. The check-in staff were very friendly. The onsite restaurant was not crowded, was reasonably priced for Wakiki, and the food was good. The hotel is convenient to the Hilton conference rooms and to the convention center. We would definitely stay here again. Recommend a high floor for the view, but be prepared for frequent stops in the elevator.

We arrived around 10am and were told that our room was ready. However when we got there is was full of dirty towels and unmade beds! We reminded reception of this on our way out. 4 hours later when we returned, still no clean room. Reminded them again, went out for an hour. Came back and still dirty. By now we were tired, jet lagged (we flew from the uk) and fed up. They finally sorted out our room at 8pm and gave us a free night at our request. The room itself was tired looking due to the 80s fittings (we later learnt the Ilikai is the oldest high rise in Waikiki) and the balcony is not for the faint hearted. For those who suffer panic attacks and vertigo, highly unrecommended. Having said this, the location was great for shuttle pick ups and there is waikiki beach just outside. The suite was an adequate size with 3 double beds in 2 bedrooms. Kitchen was well stocked and suited our needs.

We have stayed at the Ilikai many times and it is still the best value for money as far as hotels go in Waikiki. We have done the Sheraton, Pacific Beach, a couple of the Astins etc. but the Ilikai has by far the biggest rooms you will find and the location is superb. Invest the extra few dollars (and it really isnt that much more) for an Ocean View room - the scenery is superb. The pool is a decent size and the lagoon directly at the bottom (shared with the Hilton Hawaiin Village) is superb. There is soft grass to lay on as well as sand. Location wise - its walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and trolleys everywhere if you dont want to walk the Waikiki strip down to the Diamond Head end. The rooms are HUGE, clean and very comfortable. Big bathrooms (we had 2 in our room!) - quiet air conditioner and HUGE lanai. Our favourite hotel whilst in Waikiki :-)

Great property! Was here for a business trip for a few days. I honestly don't pay much attention to hotels when on the road, but this one definitely was extraordinary and commanded a deeper look. Wonderful location, super friendly staff, had a few meals here and they were great, and overall was a bargain compared to others in the area. You really can't go wrong with Aqua properties, and the Ilikai is one of the best.

We just got back from Hawaii and we rented condo 928 for 8 days. The condo was great had all the essentials plus more. Location is about five minute walk from nearest beach. The balcony is spacious and the view is beautiful. The restaurants within the hotel are phenomenal. The only complaint is the market downstairs inside the lobby is way pricey. But overall I loved this place and would def stay again. Tip to first timers, ask the concierge about the free trolley they offer don't waste your time with buses and cabs because it gets pricey. Enjoy

This was a great motel in a great location. It had a great continental breakfast. Large, comfortable quiet rooms. Closer to the beach than what I thought it would be. A 2 minute walk. Loved this motel. Would for sure stay here again.

Booking the Ilikai as a our pre-cruise and post-cruise hotel turned out to be an excellent idea. The staff was very helpful and attentive during our stay and it's location is exceptional for the price. With 5 of us (2 adults, 3 kids), we stayed in a 2-bedroom suite that met all of our needs. Great views of the Waikiki area, kitchen, laundry services, and easy beach/lagoon access made it the perfect place for us to stay and play. Additionally, there was no reason for a car because of the great location. However, the real gem was the helpful staff. We booked the Ilikai for a day room from 8a to 8p the Saturday our cruise was over due to our flight leaving at 10:15p. It was very convenient and restful during the day, but turned out to be a God sent after our flight was cancelled and we were stranded in Honolulu Airport at 1:30a. After getting rebooked for the following day at noon, we didn't know what to do but possibly hole up in the airport until the next day. There were no rooms left in Honolulu due to a huge convention, but on a hope, I called the Ilikai. I explained the situation and hoped our day room was still just sitting there unoccupied. The staff on duty told us to come back immediately and we could certainly have our room back at no charge. The baggage handlers were there to greet us immediately at nearly 2am and our keys were waiting for us at the front desk. Within 5 minutes of arriving at the hotel, we were settled in our room for the night. With customer service like this, I can't recommend the Ilikai enough if you are planning on vacationing in Waikiki.

As a local staying at this hotel before we moved off thr island. Staff and hotel were filled with aloha!!!! We would stay there again in a heart beat :) we've stayed in many hotels in the area and this by far was the best! Mahalo. Til we see you again <3

Good location but the hotel needs a major renovating.. Furniture looks like it from the early 90s, bathroom is old, very outdated. Room is kept clean but looks dirty because of the old carpet, tiles and bathroom fixtures. Service was decent but they charge you a mandatory $28 valet, no self parking option.Internet was very slow. I woudnt stay here again.

Our stay at the Ilikai was great! My husband and I went for our honeymoon (: from the moment we walked in it was great the hotel lobby is very nice. The reception staff Richelle and Ron was so helpful, accommodating, nice and cheerful. Our room over looked the Marina and Ocean. Make sure to request the ocean view room, it's totally worth! Beach was walking distance, it was a 10 minute from the Waikiki hustle and bustle. I liked that our hotel and surroundings were relaxing. We had 2 ABC stores around us, a McDs, and short 10min walk from the Ala Moana outdoor shopping center. We very much enjoyed our stay and recommend it.

We booked the Ilikai for our family of 5. It is away from the more prominent Waikiki hotels on the strip but the rates reflect that. We were on the 21st floor and had stunning views out over the lagoon and to the sea in our ocean view room. The apartment, while not huge, was good although it was getting a bit tired and could do with renovating in the next little while. We were missing a couple of basics in the room on arrival but things were remedied quickly after a phone call.It is 10 to 15 minutes walk to the main beach but there is a good beach area just around the corner in front of the Fort DeRussy Beach Park with good swimming albeit without the buzz of Waikiki beach itself. It is 5 minutes walk to the Ala Moana Centre. We would look at it again if returning, but do feel like some modernising is in order.

We don't often do the whole apartment thing but friends were staying here so we wanted to join them. We booked through a rental company and paid an incredible price compared to what you would normally pay on Waikiki Beach. After a 9 hour flight with no sleep and a sick child we were thankful to be allowed an early check in. We found the room to be in great condition and spacious. We had a stunning view of the ocean and lagoon as well. We loved the beach area outside the hotel near the lagoon, it is a lot less crowded than down the other end of Waikiki. The lagoon provided another option for the kids which was a bonus. Overall we thought the hotel was great. Will stay here again next time.

We stated on the 25 floor and had awesome views of the lagoon, diamond head and fireworks. Every morning was like a postcard. Housekeeping was a bit slack on a couple of occasions but none the less very happy with my stay. I will return one day!

I rented a room through a private condo owner, however you can also rent through the hotel. I loved having a kitchen to save a few bucks. The location isn't bad, but you have to trek quite a ways in either direction to get to most attractions. Overall, I have enjoyed myself here.

We stayed in room 1537 and had great views the apartment was nice and modern could of had a dishwasher . our air condition malfunctioned but kellie who was the agent looking after the booking sorted it out ASAP . The ilikai bar and grill service wasn't good and some of the staff. Looked dirty. And scruffy Wouldn't advise to eat there .close to ala moana shopping centre and bus stop right out front of hotel. Also a nice walk to waikiki to walk off all the food you seem to eat while you are in Hawaii

we stayed at the Illikai in 2011 and 2012 the Illikai is the right hotel at the right location at the right price, the ocean view rooms are more than worth the few extra dollars The rooms are large and clean,the décor and furnishings may need some work,but taking into account the volume of visitors this can be over looked and does not detract from the overall experience.a well stocked bar and grill and in house entertainment

We stayed at the Ilikai 2130 in July 2013. We booked through Ocean Front Rentals and were very happy with our stay. The pictures were exactly as the images on the site. It was clean and fairly spacious. The view overlooked the lagoon and we were lucky enough to enjoy the fireworks. The only thing that could be improved is change the bed size. They are doubles and quite short in length. A taller person would struggle. The beds were comfortable though. The area is quiet and just a few minutes walk to Waikiki madness. We will be back.

Stayed here in July 2013. Great location! Nice beach and Diamond Head views. Prime location for the Friday night fireworks, watched them from our lanai. Overall good value hotel for the price. Ilikai Bar and Grill was good for food and drinks. Family friendly hotel.

We stayed at Ilikai 13 years ago and were impressed by the views and tried to overlook the room conditions. But what a difference a decade makes! We had reservations at the Hyatt and after a bad experience there, tried to quickly recover our remaining 5 nights in Waikiki but with Transpac going on, rooms were scarce. Luckily, we found a wonderful government rate ocean view room available and jumped at it. Prior to checking in and knowing what Hyatt had just done to us, our expectations were "checked." Imagine our surprise to be on the 23rd floor overlooking Ala Moana Beach and the Marina.....city views to the right and water views as far as you could see. Plus, the room was updated and bright and at least 600 square feet. It included a microwave, refrigerator and even a wine opener. The lobby was beautiful, unlike the Hyatt's which is located in a shopping mall with no real lobby and not much of a pool. While the Ilikai's pool isn't very big either you are adjacent to the Hale Koa and with your military i.d. they will let you into any of their pools. Ilikai is in a quieter location although still right next door to the Hilton where you can see the Friday night firework display. We would not hesitate to return here. Everything in our room was 100% updated and I can see why they are rated so highly on tripadvisor.

We stayed here for a ten day vacation with three other families with teenagers. We had two surfers with us so the location of the hotel was great for this as the surf break is straight out from the hotel. However the pool area is very outdated and small which was a little disappointing. Also the nice part of the beach where that is not rocky is right around in front of the Hilton Haiwaiian so a bit of a walk for us too. We stayed in the hotel as the condos were fully booked would never do this again - book in early to get a condo especially if you have children or teenagers. A much cheaper option as we spend more $ than necessary on food. There is a fridge and microwave in the hotel rooms only. We had an ocean view on the 24th floor with great views but the hotel was at full capacity so lifts were quite busy. We used the swimmers lift which made life easier. The other thing that would help in the hotel would be somewhere decent for breakfast. There is a bar and grill but this only does lunches and dinners. However we found 'CJ's Deli inside the Hilton Hawaiian Village which was good and quite reasonably priced good omelettes or eggs benedict etc with 'real eggs' also real coffee place close by. The staff at the IIikai were extremely helpful with everything and nothing was a problem easy to book excursions etc from the hotel were well run and organised. Americans really know how to give service and are extremely courteous! I guess 'tipping' might have something to do with this. We would stay here again but definitely rent a condo next time.

Had a great ocean view. Location for us was perfect. Clean rooms and great staff. Only thing was that the one bedroom is not really to me a one bedroom. Room is separated by a folding accordion type pull out panel devider. Was fine but if your looking for a one bedroom privacy it's not gonna happen. Not sure if this is the case for all one bedrooms. Love the hotels history as well.

Great view of the marina and gorgeous sunsets. Could see the surfers from the lanai and watch the waves crash into the break-walls. Minutes to the beach and lagoon, walking distance to Ala Moana shopping centre. Wifi internet was intermittent with iPad, but we were using the open Waikiki Beach Rental wifi and not the secure one in the room, as the correct password was not provided. Bed was extremely comfortable and the room had all the amenities we needed. We would definitely stay there again.

We stayed in Ilikai 1438 for two weeks. It is always nice to stay in a condo that is privately owned. You get all the little extras. 1438 was beautifully furnished. We enjoyed the lagoon and sea views from the lanai. Also good for the Friday night fireworks and the evening luau on the rooftop of the Hilton complex next door.

Great location, stunning views, spacious rooms. It's nice to be a little away from the crowds yet close enough to everything. Extremely nice staff and amenities. We had a two bedroom/two bath suite which was perfect for travelling with three teenagers.

Enjoyed a 23rd floor VERY spacious room with 2 double beds overlooking the marina with spectacular views over to the Ala Moana beach and beyond! expansive bathroom with 2 showers - room includes fridge, microwave, and large balcony, which wasn't overlooked. 5 min walk to Ala Moana shopping centre - check out the great eateries on the top floor (good options are California pizza kitchen, Bubba Gump - don't bother with the food court - whose offerings are awful/average except for Hagen Dazs and Jamba Juice!). 5 minutes walk out back to the duke lagoon and waikiki beach - no good surfing waves unless you swim out a long way but the lagoon is great for hiring a floating ring, paddle board or pedalo. staff are mostly friendly, helpful and efficient (Chester on the front desk was super!). 10-15 minute brisk walk to waikiki main shops on Kalakakau avenue - across the park/Fort - or you could walk along the beach. Good places to eat include, hard rock, cheesecake factory, california pizza kitchen - dont bother with dukes in the outrigger or top of waikiki. You can get a trolley/bus/taxi out front if you prefer! breakfast in the bar/grill was disappointingly bland with small portions but the coffee shop had a limited but good selection of drinks and the shop also provided a few snacks/sweets/ice creams as well as hawaii 5 0 souvenirs! gym was a bit poor (no water and the selection of machines was small).daily newspapers/ laundry at the end of the hall (2.50 per 30 min wash and 45 min dry). theres steps out front so if you have luggage then use the elevator (hidden around the right hand side if you are looking at the front entrance). 2 ABC stores open till midnight out front (one to the right and one to the left /across the street) if you need any drinks/snacks/souvenirs. MCDonalds out front left and across the street and Starbucks out front right in the Hilton Hawaiian 530am to 7pm. good sights are iolani palace (about 30 minute stroll from ala moana) and the zoo (30 minute stroll through waikiki) or you can get bus/trolley/taxi - aquarium and sea life park both disappointing. would definitely stay at ilikai again!

Stayed at the Ilikai for 8 nights before our cruise in January. The condo was clean and had everything we required for our stay. Whilst the hotel is not right in the middle of Waikiki, it is only a short walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre or the buses and trolleys pull up right out the front for those not wanting to walk into Waikiki. Excellent range of dining options within easy walk, but we chose to eat at the bar and grill on the ground floor a couple of nights, food and service were great.

We love the Ilikai. We rent one of the condos when we come for vacation. Great location with lots of restaurants in the area and the Ala Moana Mall is just over a block away. Bus and Trolley stop just out front. We always stay on the south side of the building. Get great marina, lagoon, and ocean views. Get to watch the luau at the hilton next door right from your lanai. Great having a kitchen to whip up some food when you like instead of running out to eat all the time. Great little store on the main level for food, liquor, etc. Nice pool and walkway down to the lagoon if stretching on the sand is your thing.

Even though this is an older building it has been kept up to good standards. It's not as fancy as some of the big chain hotels, but you can't beat the location and advantages of staying in a condo. The pool doesn't have a tropical feel or slides like the Hilton, but it wasn't over-run with people & noisy kids either! We always found numerous lounger chairs open too. The building offers valet parking which is wonderful if you plan on being out and about during your stay. Even though it's not cheat to park there we never waited more than 2 minutes for our car to arrive! They have a few shops in the lobby, with the mini grocery store being super helpful for the forgotten items. The location ON the beach and right next to the Hilton Lagoon, where you can rent beach equipment suited us perfectly! I highly recommend this location for Honolulu vacationers!

Nice apartment/suite although the furnishings appeared dated. This however could hacve been the the Hawaiian fashion taste. Very good position close to everthing you need. Ala Moana shopping centre is 400 metres away and Waikiki is about 1km in the other direction. Buses pass by regularly out the front to take you wherever for only $2.50 per person.

I would not stay in this hotel again. I have been to Hawaii several times and this was the most disappointing hotel I have been in. It started when we checked in. They did not have the type of room I had reserved so they gave us a roll away and jammed it between the bed and the wall. It made the room crowded and the beds hard to get in and out of. We were greeted by a very large - well over an inch - cockroach in the kitchen, yuck! And the room was old and out dated. The cabinets in the kitchen and bathroom were old painted wood which were sticky and dirty from years of use. The carpet was worn and dirty as well. The air conditioning unit was so load my husband asked me if it was a jack hammer when we were talking on the phone. So much for the room. The hotel is on the marina - not on the beach. It is a bit of a walk, not a bad walk, but don't think that you will be "on the beach". The hotel staff is nice but not professional, I called down for the car, as I was running short on time, but when I got there they hadn't even begun to go get it. The porter and front desk did not talk to one another so baggage instructions were messed up. The valet guys held my door for me, but never helped with luggage. I am happy to tip when someone helps me and makes my day a little easier because I appreciate the effort. But I don't like it when they do the bare minimum and then expect a tip - I paid a lot for parking, $28/night.My final complaint about this property is that it does not have a hospitality suite for travelers with a late flight. I have been to Hawaii several times and this is the first time that this service was not provided.We were there with a group - everyone else in the group had bright new rooms that had been upgraded.....be extra sure you get one of those!

I really enjoyed my stay at the Ilikai (even though I was working). By chance, my dad was in Hawaii at the same time visiting a relative. I put him and his wife up at the Ilikai for three days as a Father’s Dad present. I got to see him each night after work which was great. He liked his stay at the Ilikai much better than the Hilton Hawaiian Village. He liked the calmer atmosphere, the room was bigger and the ocean view was spectacular. And of course the service was great. Mahalo!

Hotel and room was very clean and maintained. However, the rooms are outdated. Other side of the coin is that the room was much larger than the modern standard room and contained a small kitchen. Hotel is a short walk to Waikiki Beach.

We are loving our stay at the Ilikai- it is a beautiful hotel in a great location- steps to the lagoon and beach, and walking distance to restuarants and grocery stores including Wal-Mart, which is critical when travelling with a family. We used our kitchen to cook for 18 of us, also barbecued at a nearby park a couple of times. We enjoyed the open air restaurant downstairs for breakfast, dinner, and just stopping in for a drink! The laundry rooms are very convenient. The staff here is very helpful and accomodating, and the room was always well cared for! This is a beautiful hotel and would definitely recommend.

We rented a Condo through VRBO.com (#103015). The price was fair. The unit was fantastic! Very comfortable bed. Nice TV. Kitchen with pans, flatware, dish-ware, microwave, 4 burner stove, dishwasher etc. The place is clean and includes everything you need for a week or two at Waikiki. The condo has secure, fast internet with a nice HP printer with scan feature.The Ilikai is in a great location and this 20th floor unit has a great view of the ocean and marina.The owner was great to work with from day one when we made our reservation. I high recommend rental of this unit. I know we will be back!

Stayed here last May and loved it! Clean room - easy beach access - amazing review all a round great hotel! The hotel is located in a great place - though it's downtown you still get the quiet feel when you're at the beach or lagoon. Easy access to the street and beach.

The room and hotel location were perfect for our mother/daughter get-together. Nearby was the beautiful Ala Moana beach, park and shopping on the Ewa side with interesting/attractive beach and grounds on the Diamond Head side - all nearby but nicely separated from nearby "touristy" Waikiki but yet was very tourist friendly. Room was very quiet and parking was convenient - all supported by a helpful/efficient/friendly Staff. Will not hesitate to recommend the Ilikai to anyone!

I was awed by the picturesque view of the Ala Wai Harbor and the Ala Moana Beach! So beautiful!The spaciousness and interior furnishings of the room allowed for my granddaughters to feel very happy and comfortable.Chester, at the front desk, really came through in giving us a fantastic room, fit for royalty.The friendliness and helpfulness of the hotel staff were noticeable and greatly appreciated.The hotel's location is perfect because it is close to restaurants, stores, and the beach.As locals, we don't stay in Waikiki very often, but we loved staying at the Ilikai and will return again! We will definitely recommend that our friends and family stay there!

We spent our evenings eating and having cocktails at the bar and grill. Big comfy rooms. Great staff. Great laundry facilities and all you want in the room. There was a charm about this place. I would come back here any time.

My teenage son & I stayed here in condo 1242 via Marina Hawaii Vacations. Have been renting with MHV since 2007 - good service & very reasonable pricing. The view from this condo is awesome - you feel like you could almost touch the ocean - & perfect view of Friday nite fireworks at the Hilton. Recently renovated condo with very comfy king bed - slept well. Also a queen size sleeper sofa. Privacy via a wall between main bed & living/kitchen area. Kitchen has everything, including bar seating. Love the coffee shop & convenient mart downstairs. Will stay here next summer too!

The Ilikai is a good family hotel, with spacious rooms, (my young girls could even do their gymnastic moves!) they don't make them like this anymore. Check-in was no hassles, hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The Ilakai has a great location, close to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and away from the histle and bustle of central Waikiki . I stayed at the Ilikai over 40 years ago when my family lived in Honolulu .....though nearly 50 years old it is well matained and still has a 'retro feel'. I 'm sure I saw Jack Lord (Hawaii 50) travelling the elevator to the Penthouse ; ) . The only dissapointing thing was that the pool clsed at 7.30pm.

The Illikai was fantastic! We loved the location! It was easily accessible and within comfortable walking distance to the heart of Waikiki and close to the Alo Moana shopping mall. Our suite on the 24th floor offered a breathtaking view of the ocean and harbor with balconies to sit out and enjoy the beautiful sunsets. Our room was clean, spacious and well maintained. We felt very comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly, professional and helpful. They went out of their way to accommodate our needs. We particularly appreciated the friendly and efficient valet and front desk staff. We enjoyed the casual dining at their restaurant near their pool. We thought their prices were very reasonable. The convenience store located downstairs came in handy when returning from our island excursions. We had a great time in Waikiki thanks to the Illikai. We can't wait to come back!

I was on the 25th floor, with a great balcony and magnificent views. The room was exceptionally spacious, the bedding beautifully comfortable, and the service was superb. Will definitely have to stay there again, preferably longer than one night. Highly recommended.

I rented a condo at this location. It is great value for the price you pay. I was on the ocean side and thought it was great. My room looked on to the Hilton front entrance with it's pretty landscaping and waterfalls. They softly play Hawaiian music all day to and it's nice to sit on the deck and hear the music and the waterfalls. The rooms are all different to just be thorough in checking the details when you book a room or rent a vacation rental. My room was on the 5th floor and it was a good size for a couple. It had a kitchen and a king size bed which was great.Some rooms have a large fridge and a stove with an oven. Others have a smaller fridge with just a cooktop. Some rooms have carper and some tile. Also some rooms sleep 6 and some 2, so just double check everything to meet your needs.The pool area isn't very appealing but there are tons of other options along the beach in walking distance. The restaurant at the Hotel isn't bad and not too pricey. The lobby area is visually appealing and clean.

The hotel stay itself was nice but things seem to be outdated a bit at the Ilikai. It is hard when you are staying near some of the other hotels that have really nice inviting pool areas or nice shops in the main level but honestly the Ilikai had everything we needed. The valet group was so quick and very nice when we came and went. It was expensive but it was welcomed having to not park our car after long days of sightseeing and watching the soccer tournament. Ilikai felt very safe too.

The Ilikai Hotel was such an outstanding stay for our family of five. We stayed in a beautiful 2 bedroom suite with a wonderful view. Access to the cove and beaches were great; and you had "excutive seats" to view the weekly Friday fireworks right there. The amenities were great to include the shops nearby. Easy access to Waikiki. Management and staff were sooo accomodating and friendly; and made us feel as though we were all a true Ohana! Thank you all for a wonderful stay!!

We decided on the Ilikai Hotel for our 15 day vacation after reading all the great reviews about the property, it also had a fantastic location with a 2 minute walk down to the beach and lagoon, and marina right out the back. Bus stop right outside, and its own Bar and grille down stairs. We booked thru http://rentalsinwaikiki.com/company.php with Dainora, and she put us in a fantastic condo #1225, WOW .. what a perfect location, the view from the balcony facing the beach was awesome. The value for money was second to none with full kitchen, nice bathroom, huge bed, Tv, dining suite, clean and tidy. We saved $800 NZD booking thru her compared to other websites ! Anyway, the Hotel was great. The staff were friendly and helpfull, the food at the grille was excellent. We used the booking desk down stairs and Cathryn was fantastic and helped us plan and book 3 excursions. Concierge services were friendly and they had luggage storage all day until we flew out that night which we really appreciated. Couldnt have got a better value for money stay ... A definate option for accomodation in waikiki

From the moment we opened the door to Condo 1938 we were thrilled. The condo was fresh and clean,with a lot of thoughtful touches to make one feel right home. Plenty of storage and a really comfy bed. (Lovedt he linen too!) Plenty of bath towels, beach towels and beach gear. So many more utensils and appliances than you would get in a hotel room.The view was amazing, we spent many happy hours relaxing on the balcony with a beer and a cocktail or two. If I was feeling lazy I could watch my husband surfing from the lanai, and the grandkids playing in the lagoon! The night lights of the city and the Luau next door on some evenings were great to enjoy at night. We enjoyed a few meals at the Ilikai Bar and Grill downstairs, and walked a few times into Waikiki for beach,shopping and restaurants. We also caught the $2 trolley to Waikiki which stops right out the front of the Ilikai. The foyer and amentities of the Ilikai are beautiful, and checkin was so easy....just jump in the lift and use the keypad to enter the condo! We checked out a lot of accomodation options for our first trip to Hawaii, so glad we chose this condo as it is really good value for money, as well as a great place to stay. Thanks to our hosts for giving us this wonderful opportunity!!

Ilikai 822 was another perfect unit from Aloha Condos. I was on Oahu for work and the Ilikai is always my first choice while there. If you require the Four Seasons, you better pay and stay there. With that said the Ilikai is a great property it has the resort feel without the crowds. The Condo was clean and updated. Had everything I needed for both business and pleasure. Booking was easy and efficient. Parking no problem. The View outstanding.You won't be disappionted with Ilikai 822.

Great place to stay - very clean and comfortable. Easy walking distance to everything. Staff very helpful. We stayed in the privately owned condos through hawaii vacation properties who were extremely helpful.

Nice condo and recommended if you want an inexpensive place to stay for a week.Firstly, I HIGHLY recommend buying a book called ‘Oahu Revealed’. Search for it on Amazon – it gives you lots of tips and information about Oahu.The trip was pleasant but the first few hours were a little stressful. This unit uses the Schlag electronic lock and the combination on the check-in document was incorrect, or the battery in the lock was ‘dying’. Thanks goodness for the house cleaner, Ala, who walked by the room just as we tried to enter the unit. She was nice enough to assist us in opening the door. Once we opened the door, we were stunned to see the room was a mess. The unit was not clean. Again, Ala contacted the house cleaning department and they sorted everything out within 2 hours. We left our bags in the unit and took a drive down Waikiki. When we returned, the room was almost perfect. Plus, the view from the balcony was awesome, exactly as the pictures described it on the website. The building itself was decent but a little dated. The elevators were clunky but it worked. The room was upgraded but the balcony sliding doors definitely needed some work. It was not easy to slide the doors back and forth, and it was squeaky. We rented a SUV (Chevy Traverse) and paid $28/night for valet parking with ‘in and out’ privileges. Valet parking was definitely pricy but absolutely worth it if you plan on renting a car. The valet drivers were really nice and friendly too. Don’t even think about trying to find parking on the streets or metered parking. You will probably stress yourself out and ruin your entire trip. The other option is to park in the first building west of the ilikai – that is the left side when you exit the main ilikai entrance on Ala Moana Blvd. By the way, we rented our car from JN rental for $777/wk. The cost included taxes, fees, and basic insurance coverage. JN rental will pick you up and drop you off at the airport too. With 8 people in our party, it was like herding cows. Therefore, we felt it was cheaper to rent an 8 person SUV versus a 7 person van. Driving around Waikiki is not as difficult and others had described. It’s really no different to driving in a big US city. The biggest tip is to ensure you have Google maps going whenever you are in the vehicle, AND be sure you have an attentive co-pilot - super important.Meals - this is one area we lacked in our plan. There are lots of restaurants but we struggled every night to find a decent place. All I can say is stay away from Makittii buffet and don’t get sucked in when you see their coupon. Their ‘seafood’ buffet is abysmal, horrible and terrible. The food is lukewarm, horrible sushi – just nasty stuff. If you want to relax with a drink in your hand and sit in a comfortable place, go to the Shore Bird at the Outrigger Reef. It is super relaxing and the Mai Tais are $3.50 during happy hour. Btw, happy hour starts at noon!Tours - we did the Dole tour – interesting and pleasant. Awesome pineapple ice cream and great gift shop.Pearl Harbor was great and touching. If you do plan to visit this location, get your tickets online at least 4 to 5 months BEFORE your tip. Otherwise, your options are to be at the Pearl Harbor visitor center BEFORE 7am and pay $7.50/person for the USS Arizona tour. It is a self-guided audio tour. The last option is to buy a Pearl Harbor tour packages at your hotel or one of the ExpediaTours desk. Be sure to ask for the guided USS Missouri. ** One important tip about self guided tours – get to your destination early.All in all we had an awesome trip.

I booked the Ilikai after staying at another hotel earlier in the week. The Ilikai was a wonderful surprise. Right on the beach, competative rates and helpful staff. I drove up and the Valet took my car, the bellman took my bags and I went to the front desk to check in. The bellman arrived with my bags just as I was unlocking the door. My room was one of the larger ones with a kitchen. The staff was friendly and helpful. I stayed 7 nights and every night was great. The only downside was that the Bar and Grill did not allow you to charge to the room. Overall a wonderful place to stay.
user_name:
Drew F
Owasso, Oklahoma, United States

review_body: Great for - Anyone who wants to stay close to the Waikiki beach and Hanauma Bay, watch the fireworks on Fridays, go for water sports and is visiting Oahu for at least over a week. Booking - Simple and helpful customer service. Food - Good restaurants around. Well-equipped kitchen which we used mostly for breakfast. Parking - The only complaint I had was the daily Parking fee of $28, which was insanely expensive. There was no concession that you were a guest in the condo.

Great stay overall. Staff is very friendly and always accommodating. We stayed in room 2439 for a two day getaway, very clean, extremely spacious, great view, quiet, and huge lanai with table and chairs. Only issue was the "business center" in lobby is actual a computer kiosk with one computer and printer. Ilikai could really benefit from an actual computer center for their customers. Aside from that I was very happy with my stay. Definitely will be coming back.

I stayed at the Ilikai Hotel and suites condo 1530 for seven nights with my husband and two children (aged 2 1/2 and 7 months). We loved our stay! We arrived on the 5th of June at 12pm and the room was ready and waiting for us to move in. The view was absolutely amazing, we overlooked the lagoon and the ocean, and also had a view of the city. The room was very clean and comfortable. We hired a cot and toddler bed through paradise baby, which were delivered shorty after we arrived. It was very cosy with the four of us, however there is plenty of storage space for clothes and toys so we did not feel at all cramped during our stay. The condo comes equipped with beach chairs, snorkels, blow up beach toys, beach towels and lots of other items that made the stay that much more relaxing. The door to the balcony had a very secure and child proof lock that was very reassuring. We were a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping centre, which had a very reasonably priced grocery store, as we found the ABC store too expensive. We had some very nice meals and the ilikai bar and grill which is just down below the hotel. The lagoon is a 5 minute walk away, we found it perfect to swim here with two small children. Our room was in a perfect position to view the friday night fireworks. There is a small playground just 10 minutes walk down the boardwalk that my 2 year old enjoyed playing on. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to Waikiki with the kids in a stroller. The owners of the condo were very friendly during the lead up to our stay, they replied to our emails promptly and provided us with helpful advice to make our stay more enjoyable. I would also recommend going to the discovery centre if you have children and want to give them a day out of the sun. It is fantastic for kids. It is a short taxi ride from the ilikai. If I am lucky enough to go back to Hawaii, I would choose to stay in this condo again.

We rented unit #1444 - a 2 BR/2Bath condo and were completely satisfied! This building has both hotel rooms and privately owned condos for rent and we opted for this condo found through Waikiki Beach Rentals. The unit appeared just as presented in the photos and was even more spacious than shown. It was very clean, bright, open and ready for our week's stay. The view is AMAZING and the location was exceptional. It is at the quieter north end of Waikiki beach, which was just fine for us - we walked or could take the trolley to the center of Waikiki for shopping when we wanted. You can get to the beach in just a couple of minutes walk from your room and the beach in front of the hotel/lagoon was much less crowded than other places. The Friday night fireworks are literally right out the balcony. I rated the sleep quality average because the beds are not the most comfortable, but there was certainly amply space to sleep our family of 5 and there was lots of closet space. We would rent here again in a heartbeat!

It was our first time bringing our 3 kids age 4,8 and 10 to Hawaii. Our first impression at the Ilikai was that the front desk staff Marie and Riccia were very helpful. They really went out of their way to help us settle in. Our ocean front room on the top 25th floor had absolutely gorgeous views of the beach and marina. It was spacious, airy and clean. The beds were very comfy. The child friendly lagoon beach is just a few mins walk from the hotel. The kids loved this beach just right beside Hilton Hawaiian because there was no large waves and the water was fairly shallow at most places with tiny fishes swimming around. Just opposite the hotel are lots of food eateries, very convenient. The hotel pool is heated and is crowded on weekends. There was an unpleasant encounter with one of the regular pool users from the apartments that share the pool. We got into the pool at 8.30am( by our watch time), not knowing that the pool clock showed 8.25am. There were only 2 ladies using the pool at the time. This lady in her 60's went up to my 8 year old who was in the water and told her off saying hotel guests were only allowed to use the pool after 8.30am! Luckily the pool management staff David was very nice and smoothed things over. Other than that, we had a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to families with young children.

We stayed at the Ilikai last week just before beginning our cruise. I booked it for the price and the reviews here. The hotel is on the edge of Waikiki but not far from the attractions. The beach is inconvenient. THe price was right for the city. The first room they gave us was very musty. After complaining I was given another room which was passable. There was a bit of mustiness about it but opening the terrace doors aired out the room. The staff was very nice and accomodative

Stayed here with family and it was a really good stay. Check in was a breeze. They have complimentary discount coupons to nearby establishments (forgot to use so can't comment too much on it) and free wifi everywhere. The room was very spacious and clean. It's not new but it's maintained. There's a microwave in the kitchen, which is a big plus. It's not beachfront but it's just right beside Hilton Hawaiian which is a beachfront hotel. The beach near it is also not that busy if you want some quiet time. They also provide beach chairs and towels. There's a bus stop right outside the hotel so it's pretty easy to get around Waikiki or Oahu for that matter. Ala Moana Center is just a 10 min walk away as well. Overall, would recommend this hotel for anyone.

First visit to Hawaii did not disappoint. Hotel famous for appearing in opening shot of Hawaii 5-O series. Lovely room balcony view of lagoon on beach, which provided excellent view of Friday night firework display on lagoon beach which was marvellous. Could not fault hotel at all , could perhaps do with a little coffee shop /cafe but bar served excellent meals and really good prices. There was a laundry room on each floor with washing machine and tumble drier both at $2.50 each . Entertainment on terrace a few nights a week. Few other restaurants in walking distance particularly liked the OUTBACK a couple of doors away. Hawaiian Village hotel next door had Luah's most night on the roof of their car park which we could also see from our balcony so we enjoyed a free show. Transport is easy the pink trolly line costs $2 and you get off where you like or just do the circuit. There are also 2 other lines which go to the outskirts of Waikiki .Buses - fare is $2.50 how ever far you ride and hotel gave us a list of bus nos and their destinations. Pearl HArbour is a must and don't worry if you have kids as there are some guns and submarine sections that they are allowed to climb on. Really moving experience.Wifi at hotel was excellent and free. Main part of Waikiki beach is obviously busier with loads of shops etc which are open really late. Weather was superb around 30o with a nice breeze. Unfortunately the hotel had several empty shops which although we did not want to shop did not look so good . The little supermarket on site was reasonably priced and lots of people took food to their rooms as many like ours had a kitchenette with fridge cooker microwave etc.Really pleased with out choice of hotel in Waikikit

We spent one night at the Ilikai. Knowing it was in the opening credits of the "old" Hawaii 5-0 television show, I was not sure how "current" it would be but decided to go with the majority of TA posts whoch praised it. Our nicely updated room was immaculate, and the beds were very comfy. We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff, and check-in and check-out were smooth and easy. We would certainly stay there again! Recommended!

I stayed at condo 1904 and liked it very much. I had a very early flight in and was on a plane for 3 days, so it was great that I was able to get an early check in and could rest. The condo was in good condition and the views are awsome.The kitchen etc was all in perfect order. I stayed in the condos before and love the idea of walking to the beach, see the Hilton fireworks and be close to the action without being right in the middle of it. The food at the Ilikai Grill was nice and they to take away as well. I had a problem with the TV (I am technically challenged:-) and someone came immediately to help me sort things out.Thanks for a lovely stay.

My husband and I stayed at the Ilikai Hotel Condo 828 from May 30, 2013 to June 5, 2013. The condo was truly home away from home. We were so comfortable there. Everything was nice, check in and check out was hassle free, the condo itself was neat & clean and in a great location. We could not have asked for anything more. I look forward to coming back and staying here in the future.

What a fabulous location. We had a wonderful stay at the Ilikai during the last week of May and the first week of June. Our unit was clean, nicely decorated and well kept. We had a wonderful view of the beach and lagoon. The hotel is steps from the beach. There are loads of restaurants within walking distance. We loved the location and were very happy with our unit.Our only complaint would be the pool. The pool is older, but well kept and quite quiet. There are two or three condo owners who put their towels on the chairs under the only permanent canopy each morning hours before they arrive and then when they finally arrive the two or three older women run to the attendant every time someone jumps gently into the pool, leans on the divider rope or brings a floaty into the pool, yet two of the three women have floaties. They are relentless and talk loudly about "the Guests". They made sitting by the pool uncomfortable and unenjoyable. I watched dozens of people leave each day because they were basically run out of the pool because of these condo owners. I have never seen such militant pool rules. These women should realize that their unwelcoming and rude behavior is discouraging people from returning to this hotel. We spoke to dozens of guests who were very upset about this. We felt horrible for the pool attendants who had to enforce such silly rules. I agree that people should not be being rowdy and jumping lots, but leaning on a rope?

It was with some trepidation that we booked one of the Ilikai’s private condominiums for a week in Hawaii, never having rented a holiday apartment before.What if we paid up front and hated it or there was a problem?But we felt right at home from the moment we punched in our access code and “checked in” to our condo on the 19th floor, rented from www.waikikibeachrentals.comThe condos look exactly like they do on the website – a granite kitchen with full oven and fridge, a granite bathroom, a sofa in front of a flat screen television and two double beds.Oh and let’s not forget the view – nothing like opening the curtains to see the white sands of Waikiki Beach and blue skies. This condo also has views of the Friday night fireworks.The double beds sit in wooden bases that stick out quite close to the storage unit so you have to be careful not to smash your legs on the corners.Our nine-year-old son slept on the sofa (extra sheets and a rug were supplied) but you probably wouldn’t want a child much older than 9 or 10 trying to sleep on it for a week.There’s not much room to swing a cat or store bags but the stack cane baskets in the dividing storage unit between the lounge/sleep areas provided just enough space for all four family members to store essential clothes.The writing desk had a good assortment of pop up power plugs – far better than many business hotels.The kitchen was well equipped with coffee maker, kettle, toaster, even a rice cooker. We mostly used it for cooking breakfast and reheating leftovers.When we arrived the bench was set with placemat, crockery etc for two. There were plenty of plates and cutlery but the glasses were a bit light on, topped up by assorted plastic tumblers.There are coin operated laundries on each floor and most helpfully a laundry basket was in the wardrobe. A clothes airing rack for the lanai/balcony would have been handy.The bathroom vanity extends over the toilet so keep the lid down to avoid accidentally knocking items in :-) Our bathroom only had a shower but our friends' near identical condo had a shower over a bath.Towels were supplied for four but there were only two beach towels. Our friends who also booked to stay at the same time noticed this also. Luckily pool towels were supplied by the pool; you receive passes when you arrive and names are left with the attendants.We didn’t use the pool much – not when the Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon is a quick walk from the hotel. This is a great place to spent the day swimming or hiring a paddle boat or stand-up paddle board. There are ABC convenience stores located nearby but the Ilikai’s own general store on the ground floor also had all the essentials from fruit and ice creams to beach mats and bottled water at reasonable prices.The massive Ala Moana shopping mall is about a 10-15 minute walk away and has an amazing food court with every cuisine under the sun.Free wi-fi and free local and US calls were included with our rental. Our understanding was all condos were non-smoking yet each morning we discovered ash on our lanai which was a bit of a nuisance to clean up.The condos are a great, economical option for families and those who don’t want the pressure of having to leave a hotel by a set time each day so they can make the beds. We’re saving for a return visit.

We just got back froma 10 day stay at The Ilikai Hotel, stayed in one of their condo units on the 6th floor and it was fantastic! I discovered that their location was perfect for our family (2 adults and 2 kids) as its located on the best part of the Waikiki strip = away from all that chaos. We loved going to the beach everyday it was a dream vacation and if we ever get away to Waikiki again, we're staying at Ilikai. Super clean hotel, nice amenities, nice pool and so close to the beach!

My family (mom, sister, and nephew) and I stayed at the Ilikai Hotel for the first time from May 13th-May 20th, 2013. We reserved the Ocean View Two Bedroom Suite (#2410) on the 24th floor. When we walked in, all our jaws dropped as we saw the enormous and excellent views from the suite... views overlooking the marina, beach, partial lagoon, the city, and Ala Moana Beach and Park!We have been to Hawaii over a dozen times, and we all feel this was the best hotel we've ever stayed at. And the location is very very peaceful and quiet with access to the lagoon and beach, and Ala Moana Shopping center in just a few minutes walking distance.
