Perfect if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle noise of Waikiki.First, check-in at the front desk was really fast. The man who helped us was very friendly and he even showed my 2 year old nephew the "hang loose" hand sign and he has been doing and saying it ever since! Lol.The elevators are fast and you reach the uppers floors in no time. Even as an older hotel, it is very updated with and we were very impressed. The rooms were very quiet and the suite was large enough for the four of us. It had a half kitchen with a nook, microwave, four stove burners, half fridge, dishes, cups, a sink, and small dining room table with chairs. The suite has two bathrooms, and two separate rooms, one with two beds (very comfortable), and another with a king size bed where mom slept (she said was it extremely comfortable, the best ever!) and had access to one of the 2 balconies. Yes, it has two large balconies! We were at first nervous since we were so high up and having my 2 year old nephew we knew we would have to keep all the doors to the balconies closed that week and just rely on the air conditioning, which worked out just fine as it was so humid and hot that week. I did notice that the front balcony had a metal pin lock that was out of reach for young children, but unfortunately, it was damaged and would not lock. There was one early evening my mother, nephew, and I were in the living room part of the suite, and his mother sat out on the balcony. She closed the heavy sliding glass door behind her, but was still aware and was watching him on the inside. But, unbeknownst to my mother and I... a few seconds later, my nephew was gone in a flash, I ran over to the balcony and he was sitting on his mother's lap outside. My sister saw that he had managed to open the heavy sliding glass door within a few seconds by all by himself. Really scary! And even more scary is the fact that small children can fit through the bars of both balconies.So I hope Iliaki hotel management reads this and fixes the pin locks on the balcony door and to all balconies on the rest of the floors for child safety.The housekeeping was so friendly and they cleaned the room each day around noon, sometimes 1:30 pm at the latest. My mother and sister wanted me to mention to hotel that they did have problem with the dust in the room. They kept sneezing on certain days while in the room and noticed the furniture was dusty, especially the couch, curtains, and chairs, and quite possibly the air conditioning vents may have been dusty inside as well.But, all in all, we really enjoyed this suite and hotel and the breathtaking views! And we all agreed that we will stay here again and have already recommended it to other family members and friends as well!

LocationThough the location of this hotel is not very central nor beachfront, I still consider the location good because the bus stop is right in front of the hotel. The beach is also easily accessed and a good 10 to 15 minutes walk from the hotel. ServiceThe front desk and other service staff were all very polite and gracious. We just had a bad experience with our activity services coordinator who had a great misunderstanding with the Blue Hawaii helicopter company in terms of where to pick us up. This resulted to us moving our helicopter tour from 12nn to 3pm. It was rainy and cloudy on the 3pm tour. Facilities and AmenitiesThe facilities and amenities like microwave oven, brewer, ref etc. were a great help to us especially when we did not feel like going down for breakfast. RoomWe got a very big room and it was really spacious with a dressing area before the bathroom. It was cool to have such a big room in Hawaii.

We truely love the view from the room, spectacular! You can see the ocean from laying on a comfortable bed. Kitchen has everything you need to cook, I cooked breakfast and had breakfasts on a lanai and enjoy the view. We stayed there for 9 nights and enjoyed every day. If you walk on the beach, you do not mind walking to International market place and Royal shopping center. Also walking distance to Ala Moana shopping center.

Had a slight issue with checking in as the condo's aren't run by the hotel reception. They had given us the wrong code to use to unlock the door. Once we called, they sent someone with correct code and all was good. Spacious room, balcony overlooking the water, kitchen facilities and plenty of wardrobe space. Location was perfect, walking distance to Ala Moana shopping centre (10 mins) and the main restaurants on Waikiki beach (10-15 mins). About 30mins from airport - $35 cab ridewwhich was good. We are headed back here in 4 weeks to stay for July 4th!!

We stayed @ the Ilikai in May for 12 days. The Ilikai is such a beautiful hotel! We were very happy with our stay. There are restaurants all around within walking distance of the hotel. The city bus and trolley stops are right in front of the hotel. That was very convenient. The concierge was not helpful at all. It seemed like all the information he gave us was incorrect. It became very obvious that when we wanted info about tours or info about the island that we needed to find someone else to ask. :-)No matter what time of day or night there was always people cleaning...that was a fabulous feeling. It is a very clean hotel!!If we ever get back to Honolulu we will be staying at this hotel.

My family owned several of the condo units for many many years, so we would always pick the Ilikai first whenever we stayed in Honolulu. My husband has stayed here on business trips. My most recent stay was most pleasant, and I was delighted by the entire experience. The staff was wonderful and totally accommodated any of the small requests I made...like to use the computer to print my boarding pass before heading to the airport.

Rental agency waikikioceanfrontrentals.com (now waikikibeachrentals.com) has an extensive rental website for privately owned condos @ Ilikai Hotel & Suites (hotel owns top several floors, private studio/condo units all floors going down). Building is Y shaped, studio with full kitchen, 1 bath # 1539 is on left side/West sunsets (looking at Y from bottom which would be from the ocean/Ala Wai Harbor). Right side/East sunrise of Y is next to Hilton Hawaiian Village great view from your lanai of HHVlg Friday night fireworks @ 7:45 pm after their Rockin' Hawaiian Rainbow Revue (dance portion of luau with fire dancers at end 7-7:45 pm can buy tickets or stand around Super Pool to watch). Top of Y arms facing North are mountain views. Majority of rental agency's privately owned studios with kitchens 1 bath are remodeled decorated in the same dark brown/rust/taupe color scheme with light blue accents and dark toffee woodwork tv/desk unit, night stands and platform bed which at first blush looks designerish. But, colors are more for a "man cave" which is exactly how it felt dungeonus as the wall of glass sliders have a sun screen film so there is no natural light coming in studio. Even if you turn on the night stand lamps, wall art lights and kitchen few ceiling can lights you are still in a dungeon feeling room, ugh! Let's make sure to mention the wood platform bed (with only very soft mattress) sticks out too FAR and will gouge your shin bones and ankles if you forget one moment both corners are deadly!!! The entire plastic headboard that sticks out 5" from wall with the wood square platform is an extremely poor choice, takes up too much space, a regular bed with box springs and mattress would be more comfortable and practical. We both have at least one leg with chin skin gouged purple navy blue and one ankle with same!Let's talk about the extremely poor bathroom lighting and thick built up grunge on plastic like glass? mirrors (which over sink should be replaced). When we turned on bathroom light we wondered if the lights were on, I immediately teared up wondering how in the world a woman was supposed to get made up?!? Husband put his face right up to grungy so called mirror remarking he could not even see to shave! By the way, there is NO running vent fan to take steam out of closet feeling like bathroom, therefore do not expect back to back showers then woman be able to do hair and makeup (if you can see)!!! Suggest counter fan is necessary to put on kitchen corner counter top to blow a/c air from ceiling unit above tv into bathroom, it gets like a sauna even after waiting some time after showers and wagging door to achieve trying to pull some a/c air in!!! We immediately left our pile of luggage in room, down elevator, valet, back into car and drove to Kmart to BUY brighter light bulb for ONLY ceiling can light in bathroom (one ceiling can light in shower with plastic cover for steam) and degreaser mirror cleaner with paper towels, toilet paper and kleenex box (Geez, thanks for the half roll paper towels, one roll t-paper and quarter box of kleenex, most of all no cleaning products)$! Seriously, 40 minutes of aerobic scrubbing on both bathroom swear plastic/glass mirrors trying to remove the build up to be able to see ourselves to function, brighter light bulb installed (left existing dim bulb in kitchen drawer) bathroom was more useable, ugh!!! NOTE: Updated floor tiling from entrance, kitchen into bathroom is pretty but SHINY, just a bit of water spots on tile and you will go flying ie placed small rectangle towel floor mat in front of toilet to step out of shower, took one step onto floor tile and slipped like a banana peel falling backwards smacking arm on corner of shower stall tile (broke skin bruised) and hitting other arm on toilet on way down!!! We were extremely careful on tile rest of stay, husband slipped in kitchen after doing dishes, there is NO sink rug. We have rented condos and houses all over Hawaiian islands and never experienced such a boobie trapped unit.Suggestions: Replace bathroom sink mirror for sure with actual glass! Replace can opener in kitchen it doesn't work. You could treat your renters to a better quality of an actual set of pots and pans (not odd pieces of college student quality), a decent set of matching silverware (again odds and ends). Might as well buy set of 4 glasses and 4 wine glasses while you are treating your guests after all there is NO dishwasher! We can tell you how to get to Kmart... Also, how about leaving some extra paper products and cleaning items in case first thing guests don't want to do is run to store! An extra set of sheets left on top shelf of closet for mid week change would be most welcome!!! Oh yes, we have NEVER seen such SMALL pillows in our lives, our children may have used toddler sized pillows at one time!!! Get a new mattress if you insist on using that deadly platform our backs were killing us. We wanted to move the couch toward tv to move basket shelves to give us more walking space between platform, it's a good idea! You usually rent to couples, so why only one luggage rack, wouldn't two luggage racks make sense, at least?!?After telling the reality of functionality of unit, it is remodeled, rest of unit was clean ie no dust, sticky ? left behind any where, rug clean, tile shiny clean, lanai table and decking clean. Unit #1539 is one unit removed from end of leg on Y shaped building, therefore closest to ocean and more private lanai from rest of building. Being toward end allows unobstructed views from other buildings for gorgeous sunsets and views of harbor and beaches West. The rental studios at Ilikai are actually the best price for generally being remodeled with lovely views $!We enjoyed the location of Ilikai building which is at beginning of downtown allowing easy walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center, lots of restaurants, easy walking access to beaches (East & West). We loved the smiling friendly valet staff and the easy wide covered drive up entrance! There is small grocery store on main level, restaurant/bar and few shops. Liked the beautiful tables/chairs/umbrellas garden courtyard with view to Ala Wai Harbor to ocean and can sit there for Friday fireworks if you have West facing condo.

Stayed here for a week and bookde through WaikikiOceanfrontRentls.com. Site excellent and booking very easy and painless. Good communication from manager of site and always kept up to date with what happening, all instructions and regular emails. This is great when booking from overseas. When it comes to these units you need to book early as the best are booked first. This wasn't our first choice but it was ok in the end. We stayed in a 2 BR, 2Bath unit and the second bedroom had a full proper dividing wall.The Good: Location, very easy to get to, Waikiki Trolley and all tour coaches pull up outside The Ilikai. Easy walking distance to Waikiki central, the beach, Hilton Village for shopping, ABC stores and other amenity store on site, able to walk to Ala Moana but may want to bus or taxi back with bags of shopping etc.Beds extremely comfortable and had very good restful nights sleep there. Minimal noise heard from traffic and outside. Bed linen average.Excellent supply of towels and beach towels. TV's large and in the three main rooms, reception good and cable tv.View from balcony fabulous of the ocean, Hilton lagoon and fireworks that were on both Friday and Saturday night. Able to see the performance on the Hilton rooftop nightly as well.Very well cleaned priot to our arrivalLanai furniture excellent able to eat out there and rest and look at the view from diferent areas on the balcony.Everything there need for self containment and making meals, be prepared for everything to revolve around drinking coffee and not tea.Had one maintenance issue and Bert arrived promptly to sort us out.We arrived early from Australia and we had pleasantly been allowed in the room early, rooms have codes not keys so very good not having to think about keys at the beach or losing them. Codes changed between guests of course.Easy walking to beach and restaurants nearby. Very good hairdryer provided in room.Free wi-fi, nil issues with this at all, connected immediately with no drop out or problems. Phone in room with local free calls.Laundry facilities on each floor.The average: The decor was very dated in our eyes with the wall paintwork scuffed.The photos were true to what you get but much dated in real life. Minor but a bit disappointing.The bad:The airconditioning was nothing like what we are used to as in window units and seemed unable to cope with the temperature. Relied heavily on the 3 ceiling fans as well, This is part of the building being old and each unit needing its own air con and no ducted being available. The bathrooms were very dated in our experience and even though very clean still were the biggest let down. Overall we enjoyed our stay in the unit as the view, location and beds made up for any disappointment.

Loved the location in the city and the bar is great, I recommend the breakfast it's yummy an affordable and very quick for a sit down. Room was normal. My main let down was the pool area, it is very outdated and small, especially for the size of the hotel and there was no jacuzzi. There is a convenience store on the lobby level that was great, it has some alcoholic items. Overall, we "hung out" at The Modern next door for the pool and Lobby Bar, younger scene and very updated.

Hi,This unit was excellent for the two of us. We really loved the view ofthe marina and Ala Moana beach, the location which was away from themain Waikiki noise, and the well-maintained furnishings. TheBus to mostof the main attractions runs right past the door; you can get to theHilton lagoon and nearby beach in a couple of minutes out the back ofthe building; and you can use the facilities of the attached IlikaiHotel (Concierge, Tour Desk etc.) We also dined at the Ilikai Grill(twice...excellent food, really friendly staff), and the rooftopSarento's restaurant: great view and again, great food and staff. All inall, we are very happy and will recommend this unit and building toanybody travelling to Honolulu.

Hubby and I spent three nights precruise at the llikai Hotel. We were upgraded to a upper floor and the views were fantastic. Big balcony, bathroom had a soaking tub and a separate shower area. Really enjoyed the coffee maker with Kona coffee, frig, and a small microwave. The grounds are beautiful. Easy walking to pubs and small grocery type stores. You can walk to the beach if you enjoy walking. We would stay here again.

I have stayed here for a week with my friends. Because of the location, it is very quiet. The location is excellent as it is between Ala Moana Beach/Shopping centre and Waikiki beach, which are both walking distance. ABC store is just step away too.I will definitely go back to this hotel next time around!

With the image of Steve McGarrett standing on the top floor looking out over the ocean, and great memories of many stays at the Ilikai from my childhood, it was wonderful being able to bring my wife and 10 year old son here after so many years absence. It has changed a bit, but the good things are still the same. The stairs up to the lobby with the water features invite you in from the beginning, leading to the spacious open lobby looking out through gardens to the boat harbour. Throughout ground level are found the shops, cafe, bar/restaurant and post office with the walkway at the far end leading to the lagoon and Waikiki itself. A cool and comfortable breeze sweeps through all of this, and with the roomy lounge chairs throughout, it is a pleasant place just to sit and read. Our room on the 22nd floor had magnificent views of the lagoon, ocean and beach (as well as the rooftop Luau at the adjoining Hilton each night!). The full glass doors opened right up onto the balcony, which was not too windy and a great spot for having a drink a bite to eat. We chose a room with a kitchenette, which was handy for breakfast and lunch if we weren't out and about. Decor and furnishings were comfortable and contemporary, and the bed very comfortable. The staff were all very considerate, pleasant and helpful. My son has very fond memories of Rob, on concierge and reception, who taught him the "Hang Loose Owen". Access to the in house pool and the beach was an easy stroll; the bar\reataurant had great meals and very reasonably priced drinks. The restaurant at the top of the hotel (worth the visit just for the ride in the external glass elevator) had magificent views of the city, beach, harbour and mountains with a menu and wine list to match. Service was excellent and the jazz was pretty cool too. The location of the Ilikai at the end of Waikiki is a plus. It's quiet at night but you are never far from the main action, or the great shopping at Ala Moana, a five minute walk away. Pleny of well priced bars, restaurants and shops can be found immediately surrounding the hotel. Tour buses and The Bus stop just outside the hotel. You can walk to the main part of Waikiki in ten to fifteen minutes if preferred. It's an easy hotel to navigate, and our 10 year old became quite comfortable in moving around on his own, changing beach towels at the lobby and posting letters in the post office. The Ilikai is one of the first "big" hotels form the 60's but retains a lovely contemporary and family friendly feel. Definately on the list to return to.

We recently booked a condo at the Ilikai Hotel & suites through a Waikiki rentals(not the hotel itself). The hotel itself is located in a perfect spot with great ocean views and for the most part is well maintained. The condos, which are independently owned, reside within the hotel complex but are not managed by the hotel so the hotel services are not available. We rented from Dainora from Waikiki rentals based on pictures she sent us. When we got our instructions for how to access the unit we noticed the unit number was different from the one we signed in the contract. We didn't bring it up as we thought maybe the posting number and unit number were different, but when we arrived we were a bit disappointed as it looked nothing like the pictures but decided to stay and make the best of it. The bathroom was gross, worn and dated, the sliding doors didn't work very well and had no lock on them, thank goodness my husband had a padlock in his duffel bag. There was plenty of closet space and the bed seemed reasonably comfortable. We were traveling for three weeks so we decided to just unpack and relax and not stress out about it and intended to deal with it later. After we completely unpacked our 3 weeks of clothes we get a knock at our door from a coupe who said they were registered for this condo, when we both compared the emails we got from Dainora, they were the exact same email for the exact same unit. They contacted her by cell phone only to find out she was in CA! When we finally reached her she said there was a mistake and sent the other couple to a different unit. An hour later the couple came back and told us there was someone else in the new unit Dainora sent them to and that she was sending them to a third unit and that we should call her. When we called her we learned that the unit we were in 718, was supposed to be the other couple's condo and that she was putting them in our condo unit we were promised unit 1732 but we would have to move in two days!!! Needless to say we were just furious about having to pack up everything again to move in two days. We were there for a conference so it was going to be additionally inconvenient as we had a conference schedule to adhere to. Dainora offered to help us move and to work around our schedule but was unwilling to compensate us in any other way for the inconvenience, not even a dinner or gift car or anything. Her response was "mistakes happen". When we got to 1732 it was in fact the unit she had sent me pictures of and was a much nicer unit, but still not as nice as we thought, it sufficed. So the bottom line if you are going to rent a condo at Ilikai be careful who you rent from and make sure the pictures are current. Our trip otherwise was fun and we did enjoy the location which was very convenient to the Convention Center where our conference was being held.

We stayed at this hotel for one week in May / June 2012. The kitchen area was well equipped with a stove, fridge, microwave and all the utensils one would need. There was a small living area with a sofa and coffee table and the bed was comfortable. The staff were friendly and ready to be off assistance whenever needed. The room was very clean, and the housekeeping staff was sweet, but when we entered the room we were hit with the scent of some kind of deodorizer that irritated me after a bit.Generally, I would agree with other reviewers That the rooms are a bit dated, and while I can appreciate the wish to keep the historic integrity intact, I few more upgrades would not hurt. We also had a bit of an unpleasant surprise in learning upon arrival that unless you wanted to park in some public area, there was a $20.00 nightly valet service. Having said that, I would have no problem in staying here again.

We stayed at the Ilikai for a week after thanksgiving. The first night we had issues with water flooding in our bath tub but the hotel rectified the situation swiftly. They moved us to another room with an even better ocean view. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Fell in love with the kona coffee shop in the lobby. I would recommend for anyone wanting to be close enough to the hustle and bustle but far enough away from the rush.

We rented through waikikioceanfrontrentals.com (now waikikibeachrentals.com) and stayed in unit 1629. We picked the Ilikai because we did not want to be in the heart of things in Waikiki, but liked to be able to walk places there when we wanted. We thought the location was perfect for this. Renting through waikikibeachrentals was super easy and we had no problems at all during our stay. The condo itself was exactly as pictured and very clean, which is a priority with us. The bed was comfy, another priority. The bathroom was roomy and the shower worked well. We never cooked in but the kitchen had sufficient dishes, pans, etc if you wanted to. The condo was very quiet and we never heard noise from above or next door. We were mostly sight-seeing but did go to the pool one day just to relax. The lounge chairs had comfortable cushions and the beach towels provided were thick. We walked through the lobby of other hotels in Waikiki and much preferred the smaller, quiet lobby at the Ilikai. Good price for a condo in Waikiki as well. We would definitely recommend the Ilikai and specifically the condo we stayed in. We usually rent through vrbo but this rental agency had more units available. Their website made it very easy to make a reservation and I would recommend them as well. The only reason that I did not give an excellent rating is that it is not a luxury hotel. If you don't want to pay luxury prices, this is the place!

My wife and I stayed for 14 days in May 2013 - in condo 1232 rented via Waikiki Beach Rentals.I was a bit a apprehensive after reading several negative reviews - but for us, our stay was fantastic. The room itself was clean, newish, quiet, with everything we needed. The only interaction we had with the hotel staff was the pool attendant - which was fine - the pool ok - we never had any problem getting a bed, although it did get busy late afternoon.Sure the hotel is oldish, but it suits the environment, and it was fantastic value, and appeared to be more peaceful than the Hilton next door.Our only real complaint was with the internet - it was slow and unreliable - but putting this into context - it was included in the rate - there was no extra resort charge - so we could live with it.We would return !

If you are looking to for somewhere slightly removed from the hussle and bussle of the main Waikiki resorts, then this is the place. A great location means that a wide range of shops are only 10 minutes in either direction, as well as the nearby lagoon and beach for swimming and relaxation. Staff are efficient and helpful, and the hotel is both inviting and relaxed. Sitting on the balcony, watching the scenery and people go by on Ala Moana Boulevard, is a relaxing way to start or end the day.My only criticism is that some of room fixtures and fittings are starting to look a bit tired, particularly in the bathroom and cupboards.

We stayed in a newly renovated condo unit.it was clean and modern, and had a great view of the ocean and the lagoon. It is in a good location. Short walk to the beach, the mall, and Ala Moana park. We enjoyed the bar food and drinks. Reasonably priced for the area. On Friday night there are fireworks over the lagoon. Nice to sit on our own balcony with a drink and watch.

We enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai immensely ...We stayed 5 nights in a full ocean view room on 24th floor, and enjoyed everything about the hotel and that end of town... It is a short 10 min walk to Ala Moana shopping centre, and is in close walking distance to plenty of good restaurants, beach, lagoon, marina and shops, with only a short walk to Waikiki central ... It is less busy than the central and diamond head end, and much preferred as we found there was no need to make reservation at restaurants, and less crowded on the beach. Our room was very clean and good size with great view and amenities, we could not ask for anything more. We are still in Waikiki staying at another hotel at the Diamond Head end for a few days, but we miss Ilikai and that end of Waikiki.. Definitely our preference.

Our family of 2 adults and 2 teen girls from Australia stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment booked through Scott at waikikibeachrentals. We had apt 1414 and it had amazing views and was fabulous. The booking procedure and having the keycode on arrival ( no checking in) worked really well and having a kitchenette was very handy. There was a little grocery store in the lobby that wasnt too bad pricewise and allowed us to stock the fridge for our 5 day stay. The balcany had little beach chairs that you could take down on the sand and a couple of books to read were also in the apt. The only downside was the bed base was too big for the mattress and we ran into the wooden base a couple of times with our shins and ankles so watch out for that.The hotel is in a good spot and we loved the lagoon down by the beach. The bistro and bar in the lobby is also awesome. Great food at good prices and excellent live music.We were very happy with our stay and would defintely stay there again and book through waikikibeachrentals.

LOVED staying at the Ilikai! Nicely located, within walking distance of the WORLD's largest mall - Ala Moana (and you have to go there to the 4th floor Mai Tai Bar), along with lot's of other places to shop & eat. We had a room with a kitchenette which helped greatly with expenses, visited the local Walmart and loaded up on our snacks & beverages. Make sure you visit thebus.org to get the local bus schedule, the pick up & drop off are right outside of the hotel! The pool/lagoon/beach are all within walking distance. Visit Snappers across the street, awesome grilled mahi mahi!

This was our first trip to Hawaii and what a long trip it is from the U.K.  As a first timer this hotel fitted our requirements. Great views if you get and pay for a lagoon view. Its situation on the edge of Waikiki is just out of the main area but plenty of restaurants and bars easily walkable. Our room was on the 22nd floor, great view of the Hilton fireworks on Friday night. A very sapcious room with dated fittings but perfectly adequate for our needs. Ultimately if we venture this way again we would probably end up paying more for a more modern property and position but it certainly proved value for money, AuroraUK

We have just returned from Hawaii. The minute we walked in to this apartment we all just went Wow. The view was spectacular. The ocean, the lagoon and the Marina, just georgeous. We had 4 people mum, dad and 2 teenagers, so we had plenty of room. The location was fantastic, I felt it was much better than staying right at Waikiki beach where it was more crowded and just shops all around you. Here you have the public bus and the trolleys right at your dooprstep. We caught the bus to Pearl Harbour, at $2.50 each it was cheaper than the $40 per person tour we were going to take.The owner was great, she sent a long email before our arrival with suggestions of things to do and we followed most of them and had a really great time. Our only complaint would be that the blinds we old and do not close properly, this made it very hot in the afternoons when the sun was coming straight in to the apartment and at night trying to sleep, lots of light from the street and the Hilton next door coming in. Apart from that I have no complaints and would not only stay there again, but highly recommend it not only to my friends but to anyone reading this review.

I usually get a little nervous when I travel and see great photos showing oceans views, lavish lobbies and super massive rooms for a very reasonable price. But this place delivered on every single promise! Amazing location, great views, well kept and very clean. They even had a surplus of body washes, shampoos and such in the closet for us. A good tip is to park at the marina rather than the parking lot; it is better lit for those who are nervous travelers and is less likely to get broken into if that is a worry. It is also a bit cheaper if I recall correctly.I did make an appointment with the massage therapy place in the lobby to find a very strange vibe in it; when I made the appointment I had asked for 11am the next day, when I was getting ready to go down at 10:45 I saw the girl who has taken my booking standing in the elevator banks crying, while talking on the phone, complaining about clients. I decided to high-tail out of there as I wouldn't want to be serviced in a place that makes their staff cry.

This 60's retro hotel and condo property has spectacular views from any of its 3 wings, any floor. Immaculately maintained, it's very popular with the bargain traveler, yet has first class amenities. Every room has a balcony/lanai granting breathtaking views of sunrises and sunsets. I was lucky to land a condominium sublet for a month-long lease. Friends have raved about their stay in the hotel rooms (interspersed with the condos, throughout the hotel) and praised its affordable rates.The very efficient Honolulu Bus stops directly in front of the hotel, making for easy, affordable access to the metropolitan area and the entire island of Oahu. Best of all, its in easy walking distance of all the beaches, parks and Waikiki attractions
user_location: New Orleans, LA, Los Angeles, CA
user_name:
CRobertNow
New Orleans, LA, Los Angeles, CA

review_body: The hotel was good and the location was great. Got ripped off by the car rental company in the hotel lobby (Advantage car rental). I was overbilled on my credit card when I got home by $75 including a "cleaning charge" that was never discussed.

The hotel its self is very clean and nice rooms. However it is definantly one of the older ones and you can see it from the outside. The inside is nice and they are remodeling to bring it up to date. The hotel needs a spa at the pool though.

We have stayed in Waikiki many times,usually near Kapiolani Park area-it is busy and noisy there ,along with many homeless asking for help-staying at the Ilikai was a quiet haven for us-we booked our condo through alohacondos.com-unit 1938-it overlooked the Hilton Hawaiian lagoon and one of their pools and is perfect for watching the Friday night fireworks.You also have a ocean view-the condo is well equipt-having a kitchen is a bonus-Foodland grocery is nearby at the Ala Moana Mall-about a 10 minute walk away-also the trolleys and city buses stop right in front of the Ilikai. The sofa sleeper is not very comfortable but other than that this was a very cozy condo. We liked the Ilikai Bar and Grille in the beautiful courtyard that overlooks the marina-which has the most gorgeous sunsets-From now on we will stay at the Ilikai!! The Ala Moana Park also about a 10 minute walk away is beautiful! Thanks to Alohacondos for an amazing vacation! On the lanai was a storage box filled with beach chairs,sand toys, beach umbrellas,ect which we used-another nice bonus! We had one minor issue during our stay and aloha condos took care of it immediately.

We just returned from our second stay at the Ilikai Hotel. Both times our experience there was excellent. All the rooms are on the upper floors. (The lower floors are condos). Both times we were on the 25th floor, which is above all the noise, has great views and 2 lanais. The rooms were spotless, the staff is friendly, everything works, and there is nothing negative to say. When I filled out the survey that the hotel does, the only suggestions I made were: more utensils in the kitchen (at checkout they told me that if I had called the front desk they would have sent more up) and the Concierge could have been more helpful. Other than that, everything was perfect. For me, one of the most important things is peace and quiet. We never heard another house guest the whole time we were there, and as mentioned, being up so high, if you keep the sliding doors to the lanais closed, noise from the street is very low. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite for the 4 of us. The mattresses were very comfortable. The main room is much bigger than the other hotels that we looked at. The sofa was a pull-open bed, so we could have slept 2 more people. We were very satisfied and would definitely stay there again. There are places that are cheaper, but this is worth the extra.

This was our first time staying at this hotel, we based it off pictures and reviews on here. Overall it was a great experience. We checked in May 8th and left May 14th. We had a ocean view and they put us on the 25th floor, which gave us a beautiful view. The staff was super friendly and we did use the concierge downstairs to book a few excursions and we had them set us up with a rental car for a day. Them booking our car saved us around $50 for the car with Alamo, which is literally across the street. The cafe downstairs was pretty good for breakfast, I loved the Loco Moco!! Yummy!! We also ate one night at Sarentos at the top of the hotel, we both had the filet which was delicious and the view is beautiful from up there.The only 2 bad things was the shower had mold in it and the bed was hard as a rock, we had to take back ache pills nightly due to how hard it was. We stayed in a regular room, not a full condo and the room was a very nice size. The hotel is not right on the beach, it is a good walk so make sure you have all your stuff. The Hilton next door does rent umbrellas and lounge chairs for a fee but well worth it. If using cabs ask rates before you get in, they all have different rates. You can bargain with them, to go from the hotel to the mall should run $7 but the cab driver will say $10, but once you say you paid $7 they will lower the price.

My husband and I visited Hawaii for our 5th anniversary/ honeymoon in April 2013. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We arrived around 10pm and were quickly greeted by the valet staff. They were always friendly and helpful. The reception check-in took under two minutes and we were off and away to our room. The carpets of the hotel are a bit worn out. They show their age, but nothing too much that distracts from the "comfortable" feel of the hotel. The lobby was open and spacious. It had a modern feel to with a throw-back to the 50's when the hotels were in their glory days. The lobby was clean pleasing to the eye. There were plenty of areas to sit in the expansive lobby and enjoy the breeze from the open lobby. It had a paradise feel to lobby which was quite welcoming. The room was clean, the chairs worn. Our chair looked like a cat had used the arm rests for a scratching post. The room was VERY large. We were on 22 floor. The view of the harbor and partial city was beautiful. The side we were on - which overlooked the Modern hotel's pool and the Ilikai's large patio was perfect for sunsets. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows lacked in quality - although they offered 7 on our bed. The bathroom had recently been remodeled and was fine. It was a tight fit with the door and a person using the toilet. The shower was very large and clean. The room also contained a desk, a dresser and two night stands and its only AC unit which was housed on the balcony. We enjoyed the large open balcony doors and preferred to keep them open than use the AC. Their lounge outside was reasonable priced and on the lower end of price ranges compared to other hotel's restaurants. They had some delicious drinks, but the hotel's bar/grill closed had their last call around pm. One of the downsides to Waikiki was that almost everything closed around this time. The hotel's pool was extremely small in comparison to the other hotels. Granted, this is more of an "original" hotel, the pool area could stand to be updated. It was clean however. The two down sides to the hotel were the walk to the beach. The walk was about 5-6 minutes to the actual beach, although it was closer to the man-made lagoon of the Hilton's. Carrying their chairs, towels and other beach supplies made it a long journey. We were pleased they offered towels and beach chairs. The other con was the smoking section at the hotel. The smoking section is placed right at the walkway to the beach access. You had to walk through puffs of disgusting smoke to enjoy the rest of the W.B. or to return to your hotel. It was really poor placement for this. It was also on the pool's wall side. If you did spend time at the pool, the cigarette smoke wafted into the pool area frequently. Poor planing for placement. The Ilikai is located at the very end of W.B.. For the amenities it lacked, it made up in price for a affordable vacation.

Recently we sailed from Sydney to Hawaii and spent 3 days pre second cruise and 3 days post second cruise at the Ilikai Hotel and Suites. We had an oceanview room. The room was great very large with both shower and bath in separate bathroom. Views of the marina and beach to complement the room. The staff were fantastic and they could not do enough for us. We were able to leave a considerable amount of our luggage with the hotel while we sailed on the Pride of America for a week. The luggage porter is a really nice guy and nothing was too much trouble. Laundry on each floor allowed us to do our washing and come home from holiday with suitcases of clean clothes what a change was that. All in all I would recommend this hotel for its proximity to everything. We walked to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, grabbed a shuttle to the international market place and could stroll to our choice of good restaurants. The king size bed in our room was fabulous to sleep on and overall the vibe is relaxing. If you get to Honolulu you should check this one out.

We have stayed in many nice rental properties, but condo unit #1511(VRBO #436164) and its owner, are the best we've experienced. The Ilikai has hotel rooms, time share units, and condos. Clint equipped the condo with nice furnishings and appliances...and more. My husband said several times, "He's really detail-oriented." Clint thinks of things his guests may need and provides them. He also responded quickly to questions and went above and beyond by telling us we could check in early! The location of Ilikai Hotel is great for easy transportation, beach location, and shopping. To get around, we used the Waikiki shuttle, which has three different routes, and stops at the Ilikai. The beach is a five-minute walk onto a very nice section of Waikiki. (In fact, we walked through the Sheraton Waikiki where I stayed years ago, and there is no beach there now.) We carried beach chairs and boogie boards that Clint provided, along with our towels and drinks -- all in one trip. One day we rented a paddle board ($35/hr.) and it was fun! For grocery shopping, we went to Foodland at Ala Moana and paid about $5-6 (including tip) for a taxi back to Ilikai. For other trips to Ala Moana to shop, we crossed the street and caught the Waikiki Shuttle there. See Cat at the concierge desk for help getting shuttle tickets.To visit Pearl Harbor, Cat secured a rental car from Alamo, which is across the street from the Ilikai. It was cheaper than airport rates I perused on Kayak.com. The Alamo people were great and we signed papers and were driving away, all within 15 minutes!We celebrated our 25th anniversary during our stay by having dinner at Orchids in Halekulani Hotel, which Cat suggested. It was a very nice restaurant overlooking the beach and ocean, the food was great, and the service was outstanding.One of my favorite parts about staying in the condo was having breakfast on the roomy lanai that overlooked mountains and Honolulu. The patio furniture was nice and comfortable.We washed some clothes in the laundry room next door to the condo -- and we never heard any noise from the washers or dryers. Clint provides an iron and there is an ironing board in the laundry room.I swam in the pool one day, which was well-kept, but preferred being in the clear ocean where we saw large sea turtles one day!Overall, Clint gets my vote as the most accommodating host we' ve ever had for a rental property, and we certainly enjoyed his nice tastes that are true to the photos on VRBO!

I usually don't hit a hotel hard, but I was quite annoyed when I arrived at the Ilikai last week. I had a reservation for 5 nights. There were a few negative comments, but since it was so highly rated, I went with the TA scores. The Ilikai is about to undergo (major?) renovations, and boy does it need them. The rooms are worn and barren. Lots of space which will suit families, but then the bathrooms are really cramped---you can only exit one end of the tub/shower otherwise you will have a rinse in the toilet. I was disappointed when I had a housekeeping issue with my first room (the bathroom had the previous guests' undergarments available for try-on) and they said there were no rooms in better condition b/c a renovation was impending, I think they should warn you of this information when you reserve on their website as it indicates what to expect. So, be warned, if you stay between now and June, you'll get the old Ilikai...if you stay during the renovations---good luck...and if you stay after---well, the price will probably be like Trump. Even for the current prices (~$200/night), I thought the condition was inappropriate. As an aside, I was frustrated when the manager who assisted me with the room change could not provide a check-out later than 2 PM (no courtesy rooms for late day showers) without charging me for 50% the current rate---no accommodation for their earlier mistake other room substitution (which, by the way, had a shower floor which could have used some Tilex....).On the plus side, the location is good.

We stayed at Ilikai Hotel Condo 1540 for our 5 year anniversary at the end of April. The unit was wonderful and very clean. The view from the lanai was fantastic! The condo was equipped with everything we could need. We loved having the beach chairs, beach mats, coolers, snorkel gear, beach towels and even ice packs available for our use. We cooked breakfast every morning and ate on the lanai. You couldn't ask for a better place to have breakfast and a morning mimosa! The kitchen is very small, but extremely well equipped. It had everything that we needed to make breakfast and dinner. The room was plenty big for the two of us and we loved being able to open the big over-sized patio doors and feel like we were outside. The bed was very comfortable and there was plenty of closet space for our things. I would have given the room a 5 star rating if we had been pleased with the air conditioner. We really only used the air conditioning at night, but it didn't cool the room off very well. We were instructed to not set the temperature below 72 degrees, so we didn't, however I don't think the room ever really got very cool. Maybe it just needs to be serviced. Also, there isn't any water pressure in the bathroom sink (hot water), the shower is fine, but the sink isn't. Other than these small issues, the room was wonderful, the location was really nice. The walkway from the hotel takes you right to the beach. You could easily walk to all the restaurants, shopping and beach walk. I think the parking at the hotel (valet) is quite expensive. After the first couple of days we checked into the parking behind the hotel by the marina and that was much more reasonable. I thought that the key pad entry was very nice, no need to worry about a key. I would definitely recommend this unit to friends and family. It was a great place to stay. Thank you Hans and Daljeet for letting us use your home, we had a great time! Michael & Lynn

We got an ocean view room which was an excellent choice. We spent most of our time on the balcony. The room was large and quiet, and everything worked. We had an enjoyable meal at the bar and grill, and enjoyed the friendly staff. The fireworks from the Hilton next door were a fun bonus. Loved the convenience store right in the hotel, and the small fridge and microwave were a pleasure to have.

I went to hawaii for three weeks to get married and my honeymoon. After travelling to three islands this was a great end to the trip. Great location. We paid for an ocean view room which over looked the lagoon at the Hilton and the ocean. Very unique. We were walking distance to everything. The staff were friendly and helpful. We both decided to have a 1 hour massage before we checked out and it was a amazing I would highly recommend there spa. Will be staying at this hotel in the future when we return. Valet parking was 28dollars and you could leave your vehicle up until 11pm the day of check out.

Convenient location, decent rooms for the price, excellent service, the bar & grill was a good value with some excellent meals (some not so good), nice pool. We stayed in the private condos, which get you a better price than the hotel itself, so my review is based on that.

We booked this hotel for a 1 night stay before our cruise. We were coming in at 4 pm so I just wanted a clean quiet place to stay. What I got was a huge room huge bathroom , great view of theMArina at a reasonable rate. We checked in, went to the 0utback for dinner, which is across the street. McDonald's and ABC stores were all very close by. We could not see the Friday night fireworks at the next door Hawaiian village, we should have gone down. It were exhausted due toJet lag. We woke up at 5;30 am to see the pride of America in the harbor. At 6 am we sat on our balcony ate our surprisingly good McDonald's breakfast , got our car from the valet $28 and went to Pearl Harbor . Since it is towards t he end of Waikiki it was an ez out. It did take an 1 1/2 hoursTo get from the airport to the hotel because of some closing of roads due to a bomb scare. I could Have walked faster. My husband preferred this hotel over the one that we stayed at after the cruise. It was in the middle of Waikiki and the area was very busy. It was also more money.

We stayed in March 2013 and booked a sea view room with 2 double beds. It's a good hotel but there's nothing trendy or hip about it. What we enjoyed was the location (on the quieter side of Waikiki), view (24th floor),the good size of the rooms (probably because it's an older hotel) and the price.The downside is the pool area which is adequate but nothing to write home about and is looking a little tired. It was mainly occupied by elderly permanent residents of the building and the kids weren't even allowed to jump into the pool - they aren't wild kids but do like to have a little bit of fun. There were never enough pool loungers for everyone - probably because it's a very large hotel and not much room has been allocated to the pool area.I walked down Waikiki beach and wasn't terribly impressed with it but that might be because it was high tide and everyone seemed to be crammed onto a small section of the exposed sand. If you are in Honolulu to shop then it's well located near the shopping complex which you can walk or take the trolley to. The trolley stop is outside the building (not to be confused with the bus stop) and it was a long time before we could actually get on one because they were mainly full. Most of the ones passing the hotel were privately run for Japanese tourists so we couldn't board them.We tried out the restaurant on the top floor - the food was excellent and the view fantastic so try to get there for sunset dinner or sunset drinks and request a table with a view.Stay here if you want space and a good location, but if you are looking for something a bit more swanky then try the Modern hotel next door ,although when I popped my head in there to have a look I noticed that all the double pool loungers were booked for VIP guests only - aren't all their guests VIPs?

Husband and I spent 11 days at the Ilikai apartments after arriving in Honolulu on a cruise ship. We were very pleasantly surprised with our accommodation. The apartment was on the 12th floor. Had amazing views over the marina and out to sea. The furnishings were adequate, with the bed being very comfortable. Kitchen had everything we required and the bathroom had everything we needed plus very good storage space. The Ilikai is an older building but is in a great position. A short walk to the beach and a shorter walk to a lagoon which is excellent for swimming. Good restaurants nearby and walking distance to Ala Moana shopping mall. We have had a number of vacations in Waikiki and this was by far the best accommodation we have had and we much preferred this end of the beach. There is a great board walk along the sea to the centre of Waikiki. We booked through Ali'i Beach Rentals and couldn't have been more pleased with them. They went above and beyond to ensure we had a great vacation. We will certainly stay there again when we return to Waikiki.

when I was a little kid, I learned about the Ilikai from seeing it in the opening of Hawaii Five-O. I said then that "one day, I will go stay there." And that day finally came this year! I could not be happier with my stay. They have spruced up this old gem. the entrance and lobby are beautiful. there is a patio area overlooking the marina, with multiple tables/umbrellas, that is most inviting. the Rooms are nothing fancy, but they are very clean, very comfortable, with everything needed. The lanais are large and perfect for afternoon relaxation and enjoying an incredible view. The location is terrific, close to both the bustle of Waikiki and also the shopping of Ala Moana Mall. It overlooks the marina, a lagoon, and the Beach. The best thing about this hotel is the people. Everyone was incredibly attentive, helpful, and responsive. the only suggestion for improvement that I have is that the pool area could be enlarged and updated (though what they have is totally fine - it just pales in comparison to the next door Hilton Hawaiian Village pool.)Overall though, I could not have had a better stay. I will certainly be back. and I would tell people considering this hotel to: "Be there. Aloha." - (Jack Lord - Hawaii Five-O)

My husband and I stayed there for 3 days after having a great experience in Maui at a condo. We stayed in a condo at the Ilikai. The furnishings were old and uncomfortable. There was very limited access to the beach. If you went to the pool, there were no chairs available unless you got there by 8:00am. The pool is too small for the size of the hotel!!! The air conditioning is a window unit instead of central air. The kitchen was not stocked with pans and utensils so you could not fix much in there. Even the TV was so small. I WOULD NOT RECCOMMEND THIS HOTEL AT ALL!!!!! The only thing I enjoyed was the balcony.

We stayed here for 4 nights in a room with a kitchen facing the marina. The room was clean and had excellent housekeeping service everyday. Accommodations were basic and we had everything we needed, nothing fancy. The kitchen was clean and adequately stocked. The location was good as well with lots of shops, restaurant, etc. all on the same block. Hotel does not sit directly on the beach, but its maybe a 2 minute walk to the lagoon and the beach in front of the Hilton. My only real con was the noise from surrounding hotels and bars. If they had a band or music playing you can hear it from your balcony if not in the room on some occasions (but this was mostly during the day or evening). Maybe not the best place for a tranquil stay but overall a great hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

The Ilikai is not a bad hotel, I just wished they had paid a little more attention to detail. My biggest complaint was the fact that they used single pane glass in the rooms. Even though we were near the top of the hotel, you could still hear street noise. Waikiki is very busy. There's lots of traffic and delivery trucks are active in the morning. The beeping coming from those trucks could be heard easily. If you are a sound sleeper, this may not affect you. But if you're not, you'll find yourself waking up earlier than you want. The carpeting in the room was in need of updating and the pool is small for a hotel that size. If you're not bothered by any of these, you will probably be fine at the hotel. It's nice overall, with an adequate restaurant and bar, but I would look around the area for other options before returning.

We booked their 2 bedroom, seaview suite, which comes with 2 bedrooms, a living room, 2 bathrooms and a mini kitchenette.The air-conditioner was weak and took a long time to cool down the suite. The bathrooms looked aged and bare, and the water pressure was weak. Another thing which I dislike was that the master bedroom's air-conditioner was directly facing the bed, and it was quite uncomfortable to have the cold wind blowing against your face and body the whole night long.Another thing...this hotel compound doesnt provide any mineral water. There's a supermarket downstairs at the lobby level, and we had to pay and stock up our own mineral water.

My wife and I both highly recommend staying at the Ilikai Hotel at the gateway to Waikiki. We found the very large and spaciously arranged rooms with a big balcony very relaxing and comfortable and for a relative bargain price!Consider their available large rooms with a full kitchen too, which really comes in handy. This is especially so for longer stays where being able to cook on a full oven with stove top, as well as a Microwave in addition to being able to stock a full-sized fridge, makes the whole trip more easy going and saves a bundle on not having to eat out at each meal.The staff was uniformly courteous, efficient and professional. Terry Dowsett, the Ilikai Hotel Manager, runs a solid and friendly ship there and it is perfectly located at the beginning of Wakiki for easy access to all that Waikiki, Magic Island and Ala Moana Beach Park has to offer. Not to mention, its only a stone's throw away from the huge Ala Moana Shopping center as well! And all without being too cramped as some hotels right in the middle of Waikiki's Kalakaua avenue can feel.The Ilikai Hotel offers the best bang for your buck that I know of in the area, and as a former 38 year resident of Oahu, I'm well familiar with the lay of the land in Waikiki.S. Dickson

As a resident of O'ahu, I have stayed at many hotels in Waikiki. What impressed me most about my recent stay at the 'Ilikai was how everything went so smoothly: from room rervations to check-in. From the moment we stopped for on the hotel grounds, we were greeted and acknowledged by the staff and personnel. The rooms were immaculate and the view--breathtaking! We will definitely be staying here again. (Bonus points: this hotel is located on the cusp of Waikiki; therefore, you don't have to fight the crazy traffic, yet, one can begin their trekk into Waikiki from here without any problems)

We stayed at the Ilikai Hotel, some of the furniture was a bit old and frayed around the edges, but other than that the room was very clean and tidy, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located within a short distance from the beach and the Hilton lagoon. The Ala Moana s/c is a quick walk away and Waikiki is also located not to far away. You can catch the pink trolley to get around to different sites in Waikiki. We will miss the nightly conch ceremony at sunset each night near the bar and grill. Would recommend this hotel and hope to come back again some day

We arrived at about 10.30pm, and were told that we'd been upgraded to a kingsized room with kitchen. The 'suite' was very nice and spacious - but hadn't been properly cleaned. There was a towel hanging out on the balcony and one on the bathroom floor. The bins in the rooms had not been emptied.There were coffee facilities but no kettle for tea, and no tea bags (and a cup of tea was what I was hanging out for after the flight from LA). The electronic cards for the door were still on the bench from the previous guests. This sloppiness really put us off, and when I mentioned it at the front desk next day was simply told that 'housekeeping' would be informed. Though the kettle and tea bags were soon delivered.We were given a little card to exchange with the concierge for a pack including maps and whatnot, but the 'concierge' turned out to be a woman on the travel desk, who was so busy seeing people booking trips around Hawaii, that even though we tried about 3 times to get our maps (and waited within her view for about 20 minutes on the first day), she was constantly busy, and the people on the front desk said that they couldn't provide these maps! We assumed that the idea of her distribution of these packs was all about trying to upsell various tours around Honolulu etc.So, yes, the room was fine, the location good, we enjoyed the view, but these little annoyances took the shine off things somewhat.

We stayed at condo 1904 for a week and enjoyed it very much. It had all the amenties you would expect but also had a lot of extras like snorkeling equipment, beach mats. The view is great. The hotel is at the end of Wakiki Beach, a 15 minute walk from the main beach, but it allows you to enjoy the beach without the crowds. We had friends staying in downtown Wakiki and they said the traffic noise was unbearable. You can also enjoy the lagoon next door and the fireworks on friday nights. The bus and trolleys provide cheap transportation. The pool is not big but enjoyable.

The ilikai hotel is homely and has great service. My room was spacious and the service was great. It is conveniently located to all the meeting places i needed to be at as well as close to major attractions.

After several years of interval, I came back to this hotel. A beautiful view overlooking yacht harbor from the pool remains unchanged. The hotel is situated in a walking distance to both Ala Moana or Waikiki Embassy street. Hilton Hawaiian village is very near. Overall the hotel is value for money. Shuttle bus service is available from HNL. (Charge)

We have a great trip, we had unit 1609, very clean and a great situation for the hotel. We were often the first hotel to be picked up and dropped off! the lagoon next door is free and fantastic for families and everyone, you get free fireworks each Friday.Catch the Waikiki Trolleys to get down to Waikiki touristy area or just walk along the beach. We are 7 mins walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre - fantastic bargins!Good restaurants around the area and the restaurant downstairs was also handy with good food!loved the place and we will go back again
user_name:
Denise H
Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

review_body: Nice hotel, people were friendly. Some of the interior was dated. The beach was super close. Major con: getting to the touristy areas on Kalakaua Blvd was a fairly long walk, I wish I booked closer to that area to get to the nice shops and restaurants and other tourist attractions. Also no daily maid service, they only come on certain days of the week. On the plus side we had a kitchen and great view, and a very spacious room.

We had a great experience at the Ilika. We rented two rooms in total - one with a kitchen. The rooms were clean and very spacious. Rooms were a little dated but nonetheless we were comfortable. We saw that the rooms down the hall were being renovate - can't wait to see what those look like. We watched the Hawaiian Hilton fireworks right from our room which was spectacular as we were at the same height as the fireworks. Beds were comfortable and linens clean.Great location as well - close to the lagoon, Ala Moana Mall. We hopped on the trolley to go to Waikiki - kids loved that. Didn't have a chance to try Morimotos restaurant around the corner but hopefully next time.Everyone at the hotel were exceptional from the housekeepers to the front desk and bellmen and valet. We have three young kids and everyone was friendly, helpful and welcoming,It is also great that beach towels were provided daily as well.Great place to stay!

We were up on the 24th floor. Great view of the ocean and lagoon. Very friendly hotel staff all around, large room, room service came daily, restaurant with good prices located in hotel, various little stores in hotel and steps away. You can step outside to take one of the many shuttles or the bus, but if you are willing to walk for 15-20 mins you will be in the heart of things. Close to everything you need. If you need a car the hotel will take care of that also. Will stay here again!!!!!

Ilikai Hotel & Suites are a lovely place to stay.We stayed in room 2233--22nd floor.Location is Very Good very handy to Aloa Mall--a very large shopping complex.Rooms are Large and well appointed, quite comfortable.Swimming pool is very small for this complex however the Lagoon and Beach are only a 100 meters away,great swimming.Good Restrants nearby and the complex has a Very Nice Bar Outdoor Eatery.Hotel Service Staff were Excellent, well done guys.Overall we were Very Happy with our stay and Will Be Back

I loved the hotel, amenities were excellent, location was perfect right near beach, restaurants, shopping. BUT, IT IS A SUPPOSED TO BE A NON-SMOKING HOTEL. I have an allergy to cigarette smoke and chose this hotel mainly because it was advertised as non-smoking. My family has been here for 3 days and have smelled cigarette smoke from a lanai close to our room. We can't enjoy our lanai or leave our sliding doors open. Security won't do anything about it.

Great condo, you can see the Laguna and beach, gorgouse View! 2 min walk to beach! Clean, air conditioned! Fully stocked with everything. Quite area compared to where outdoor mall is, which we apprecaited! Restaurants walking distance from hotel! Great place to say ever better price! We will be back!

We stayed here for 2 months in private condo, which was fine. Our main problem was the pool area which is small with a surrounding wall and no view. The elderly residents must have a system for reserving all the chairs and a lot of the time not using them. I asked one "regular" lady if she was vacating her bed when she gathered her belongings. She said no,left one towel there and didn't return all afternoon.

The Ilikai hotel is a great place to stay when on Oahu. Right in Waikiki not to far down so the traffic is not so bad. Easy into and easy out a big plus. The room is 500 sq ft, airy and clean, has a full kitchen if you want to cook. It also has a balcony which is great. We booked a package with a car, the price was really reasonable actually pretty cheap in comparison to other properties. It is a real great value. They even gave us free parking which others charge up to $40/ day. No need stay at Hyatt or the Hiltons stay here enjoy and relax, after all your in Hawaii.

Just returned after another visit, we call the Ilikai our home away from home. Everything is great from the hotel with great views and feel of the real hawaii to staff who are friendly and helpful in all departments. It is so nice to be just on the edge of Waikiki away from the noise but near. It is a short walk to Ala Moana shopping center, and beach park, friday nights are special with a hawian group and dancers, then the firework show to follow. The church service on the ground floor at 9am on sunday makes for an end to a wonderful week. Thanks once again.

The lilkai Hotel is clean and the people are friendly. Condo was great, clean and had everthing we needed to make our stay feel like home. location is close and walking distance to most conveniences, stores, malls, restaurant, and coffee shops.Our time there was great!

We stayed at the Ilikai for 3 nights as part of our Hawaiian adventure for our 10th anniversary. They were wonderful!!! The location was perfect for us, within Waikiki but a little outside of the hustle and bustle. They gave us an amazing room on the 22nd floor with a fantastic view of the harbor and we watched the Friday night fireworks from our balcony. There was wonderful live music in the downstairs patio in the evening. The staff was very helpful (ask the concierge for a list of local happy hour specials) and we were so appreciative for the special treatment. The pool was simple, but clean with both shady and sunny loungers. The adjacent beach was lovely powdery sand that was cleaned regularly. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!!!

We recently stayed in room 2344 in an oceanfront 2brm apartment. We were able to check in at 9.30am which was great after a long flight and 2 young kids in tow. We were given beach towels to use during our stay which was great. The apartment had an amazing view of the lagoon and ocean. It was very clean and housekeeping were very efficient and made beds daily and washed our dishes. It had cooktop, microwave and utensils etc. The free wi-fi was a bonus. There were washers and dryers on each floor and a change machine in the lobby. The decor isn't modern but it was nicely decorated and had all the facilities we needed. It's quite a walk into the main area of waikiki but this also means it is quieter which I liked. There is a bus stop out the front of the hotel and the buses come frequently. Valet parking is $28 a day so be prepared for that. Another bonus was viewing the friday night fireworks from our balcony. Amazing. Red lobster, the outback, mcdonalds and ihop are all close enough to walk to. It's a short walk to the lagoon and beach as well. I loved our stay and would definately stay here again.

We have found that the Ilikai is a great location that puts you just on the edge of Waikiki and yet close enough to enjoy everything that goes on there. The hotel is always clean and well maintained. And the rooms we have stayed at our all up to date and comfortable.

My husband is staying here while in town on business and I had the opportunity to join him for a week. Once the desk staff found out he would be with them a while, they gave him a room with a kitchenette, which has been most helpful for both the budget and his convenience. Both of us have been very pleased with the service and accomodations! Every employee that we encountered was friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and comfortable - I would definitely stay here again. The valet staff was always attentive and we never had to wait long for our car. Overall, an excellent experience at the Ilikai!

Had a relaxing two day stop from my long busy 2 week stay in the Philippines and rejuvenated me for my forthcoming back to work schedule in Pheonix.Excellent quite location away from the big crowds.Very convenient way to walk and enjoy the beach.Very helpful and friendly staff.Would highly recommend it to fulure travelers.In fact, will be back with my family this coming June,2013,

This was our first stay, but not our last. The Ilikai offers everything that is Hawaii. Great staff. We were stoked. We liked being able to step on the beach. Neighbourhood shopping was great. We will be back.

I absolutely loved this hotel! I went here with my family (mom, dad, and younger brother). The pool was great, the restaurants in the hotel were great (we visited all of them), the room was great! Everything was within walking distance and we are the type of family that loves walking and exploring when we travel. The shopping was close by, the stores were close by, just everything was very convenient. Now back to the hotel. It very clean and not a large population of guests. In fact, it was very quite and peaceful. The beach is also just around a short walk and that was also very quite and very clean. The hotel room was cleaned everyday and new amenities such as tea and coffee were given everyday. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We didn't encounter any issues during our stay so it was great. We stayed for 8 days and 7 nights and our whole trip including airfare was extremely well priced for all 4 of us. That was the cherry top really. I would whole heartedly recommend this place. If I ever go back I would definitely book a stay with them again.

This is by far the most relaxing and attractive (for weary, 'need a vacation' types) option I have ever found in the Waikiki area. Love the Mountain View and Ocean View studio suites that include a full kitchenette and killer views.

We stayed in one of the condos at the Ilikai for 8 nights in March. For the price ($1400) & location, at the end of Waikiki beach, it's hard to beat. We had an ocean view, however a few blocks away, but still an ocean view at that. Even with 5 of us in the room, there was plenty of room. It was very clean & kept up well. The AC didn't work when we got there, but after a call to the Manager, they replaced it with a new one the same day. We ate at the bar & grill in the hotel & the food was excellent! The biggest downside is it's not right in the middle of all the action, but still only a mile or so away from the shopping & restaurants. If you want to stay at a place where you can simply walk outside & are on the beach, this isn't the place. However, if you want to save a few hundred to a thousand dollars, this is the place. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.

We rented a private condo on our second return to Waikiki via Waikiki Condo Rentals in the Ilikai Hotel & Suites. The private condo was # 520, was a nice clean studio upgraded but was still missing some things - futon in front of TV was terrible had to sit on bed to watch TV, the lanai was missing chairs so we couldn't sit out to eat but other than that it was a pleasant stay there except for having to deal with Scott the manager - whom I found VERY rude when I phoned for help and the fact that the check in/out times are just too rigid. It had a lovely view of the lagoon and the room was very quiet and clean. Due to our late flight times on our departure day, we were forced to rent a room in the hotel as we had to vacate the private condo @ 11AM. The staff in the hotel were VERY helpful and pleasant, especially Brandy at the valet parking desk. The hotel to us was perfectly located beside the Hilton Hawaiian, it was quiet and a nice walk to the busy shops through Fort DeRussy which my husband used for his daily jogs. Though not right on the beach it was a pleasant 5 min walk. We rented a Harley on our second day there and the valet staff were so helpful in securing parking for us. Highly recommend the coffee from the coffee shop in the lobby - local beans-was delicious & staff were very friendly. Also recommend eating at least once in the bar. We found the prices fair, the food very tasty and the service was exceptional. We would definitely return to this hotel

Upscale setting at an affordable price. Super large rooms plus spacious balconies and a kid-friendly staff make this a welcome stop for vacationing families. The Ilikai is located at the west end of Waikiki, so away from the crowds, but a pleasant walk on the beach if you want to get to the excitement. Kid-friendly lagoon is a perfect ocean experience without the waves or deep water. Hotel pool is delightfully warm and adults only in the morning until 8:30 or so. They supply beach towels and chairs, so makes packing simple. We took only carry-on! Will definitely come here again! Also recommend Hikers cafe and Cheeseburgers -- both an easy walk.

We stayed at Ilikai Hotel for 3 nights in one of the more affordable rooms with no ocean or marina view (303) but we were only in the room to sleep after our daily activities, so the view to the street wasn't an issue. The room was huge, with a kitchenette complete with blender, kettle, toaster, crockery, cutlery etc. The bed was large and comfortable and there was also a couch and armchair in the lounge area. There was no daily cleaning service, only the change of towels and removal of trash - which is fine by us as it was only for 3 nights. Plenty of towels, spare toiletries etc were available. Very conveniently located if you're there for shopping at Ala Moana shopping centre (10 mins walk) and about 20 minutes walk to Waikiki beach. A couple of ABC stores in the area, an iHOP, a couple of cafes, McDonalds and bars. There is a marina and a lagoon just in front of the hotel as well.

We stayed at the Ilikai last year and are looking to do the same this year. We booked the Ilikai because it is close to all that Waikiki has to offer. Close to the Ala Moana shopping centre, 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach. The rooms are spacious and have great views. It is nice sitting on the Lanai sipping a wine or beer of an afternoon. Great sports bar across the road. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Admittedly the rooms were a little old but for the price this was factored into our itinerary. We have always had a problem with the size of the pool it is a little too small for the amount of people that utilise it during the day. Overall though it is a great stay, that is why we keep coming back

My husband was assigned to work 2 days in Waikiki and we took two additional days for ourselves. The hotel staff was very kind and attentive. This hotel is old and does need some attention in the bathrooms and kitchen. Phone in our room was not working and needed repair. Room did not look clean due to age and bed was not comfortable. Pool area was not inviting and small. Easy access to the shopping mall and many other stores. Hotel unfortunately did not meet our expectation.

Stayed on 15th floor lagoon facing apartment and I felt like I had stepped into an advertisement for paradise. It was just heaven. The view was breathtaking, not just the fist time but every time I stepped on the oversized balcony. This was my location of choice and delight both early morning & early evening. It was amazing to see and feel the sun come up from that vantage point. Early evening gave a spectacular view of the Hilton Hawaiian Village luau & the torch bearers running around the village lighting the torches. General location at the Hawaiian Hilton Village is amazing. Stones throw from Waikiki Beach & shops in one direction & Ala Moana Mall on the other. The apartment had one room divided by a sliding door into a separate bedroom with a full size double on one side and a full size single on the other. Perfect for a family of three.

Stayed in Waikiki before & after my trip to Maui, Hilton ( Prince Kuhio) first, then condo 1416 at the Ilikai on my return. The condo is lovely, comfortable & homely, with stunning views of the ocean & a good view of the nightly luau at the next door Hilton Hawaiian Village. I don't cook on holiday but if you do there is a well equipped kitchenette. The Ilikai itself is at the Aloha Mona end of Waikiki about 10 minutes walk from the shopping centre. There are restaurants/ bars in the area & a 15 minute walk to Waikiki centre. The hotel grill is ok for a snack, didn't try the restaurant, preferring to eat at different places along the beach walk. The pool gets busy so get there early for a sunbed, it is about average size for most of the hotels in Waikiki. Yes the pool at the Hawiian village next door is much bigger but unless I had young children I would not want to stay there. Very much a family hotel !

The hotel is awesome--very convenient. Book a full kitchen for an extended stay. We stayed 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed. Do not depend on the concierge desk for simple questions (ie trolly information, etc.) Everything else about the hotel is really convenient and a must-stay

We stayed in room 2222 which is an oceanview with kitchen. The room was quiet, clean, and spacious including the lanai with a decent view of the ocean partially obstructed by the Hilton Grand Wai tower. While the hotel is not actually on the beach, it is a short walk to it which also has a shallow lagoon perfect for the kids. They offer each guest a beach towel and foldable beach chair for free which was a nice feature. We ate at Sarentos, which has great food and fabulous views. Breakast was equally good at the Ilikai Bar/Grill and the Mt. Ka'ala coffee shop. The hotel is currently has a number of vacant shops which gives it a bit of an empty feeling. It is conveniently located next to the huge Hilton Hawaiian Village which offers a variety of food and shopping options to make up for the emptiness. Also nearby is the Chart House with great seafood and Sangha with delicious Thai food and dancers who perform traditional Thai entertainment.Overall, I was pleased with the condition and value of Ilikai for our first visit.
