We had one night's stay here in between connecting flights to other islands. We were welcomed very nicely at the front dest on our late arrival and had a spectacular view of the harbor with the lagoon in the morning. Large balcony, comfy bed, ample kitchen space and we appreciated the little decor touches all around the room. Wish we could have stayed longar!

We enjoyed our own happy hour at sunset every night on our 100 sq ft lanai with amazing views. This unit has a new kitchen with large island and bathroom too... also comfy beds that have privacy with sliding shoji screens. There is a gym, pool, market place and the best organic coffee at the lobby level.

we stayed here for 3 nights at easter and enjoyed our stay. (3 grown up and one child). Good sized room and small clean kitchen. OK terasse overlooking the lagoon at Hilton and their nightly lau show. very convenient location - almost at Waikiki.can recomend

We stayed in one of the privately owned condos in the building. It has a great view over the Hilton lagoon - perfect for watching the spectacular Friday night fireworks. Decor was a bit tired but the bed was a super king and comfortable. The ilikai itself could do with a vacuum in the corridors. The downstairs bar was very average but the top of the I restaurant was fantastic. Nice handy location to ala moana mall, Waikiki and the bus routes.

We had a wonderful time staying in Ilikai Condo 1938. We arrived and were surprised by how many water toys there were available on the deck. The condo was big enough for us and our two girls. The view from the balcony was amazing. We saw surfers every morning and a luau dinner on the rooftop of the adjacent building every night.There was an ABC store right across from the Ilikai to get groceries along with a decent store in the hotel. There were also some inexpensive places to eat nearby that we found. There was also a laundry mat with two washers and two dryers on our floor. The cost per load to wash was $2.50 and to dry was $2.50. This was a bit steep I thought but it was nice to have this option. The parking cost, which I believe is the same everywhere in Hawaii, was $28 per day for valet parking at the Ilikai. I think we could have parked at the marina behind the Ilikai for less but since we had a rental car we wanted the security of the valet parking under the hotel. The only thing I would change about this condo would be the fact that the pull out couch was very squeaky so we took the mattress off and that helped some but it was very old also and had a lot of lumps and bumps for the girls. We would definitely recommend this condo and it's manager Kat to anyone. Kat helped us right away with any email questions I had for her and we absolutely loved the location. It was beautiful and nice and quiet every night.

Lived here for over a year for work. Loved how convenient the location was to bus, ABC store, McDonalds (across the street). Always felt safe here with security in plain sight which is important for a woman traveling alone. Having a kitchen, large lanai, awesome pool, workout gym (free for guests too) and beautiful view make this the perfect place for families & seniors alike

Hotel is perfectly placed if you don't want to be in the main tourist section of town. You are far enough away to have a relaxing time, but still close enough to walk to the main strip. Close to the Ala Moana Shopping plaza (5 min walk) and close enough to the beach (10 min walk). If you find that's too far to walk then you can use the lagoon located directly next door at the Hilton.Every Friday night the Hilton has a fireworks show that you can see from the hotel depending on your room, otherwise you can go down to the bar/pool area and watch from there.The room was extremely clean and had everything that we needed. Beach towels were provided and plenty of towels for showering. The lobby of the hotel has several stores, including a grocery store where you can buy anything you need including alcohol. There is a bar/grill and a restaurant on top of the building that has amazing views. Our apartment had a view of the pool and harbour. Very relaxing. There is a bus stop right outside the front door and there was always at least one taxi waiting in the drive. The pool also has a bar and staff will take you to deck chairs, provide towels and take drink and food orders from your deck chair. I don't know how anyone could give this place a bad review....what more could you want.

Spent two nights on the way home from San Francisco and was very pleased with this hotel. The staff were all extremely pleasant and the onsite facilities were good. We received an upgraded room with kitchen and it was spacious and clean. The position of the hotel was perfect for Ala Moana Shopping centre and beach park the two places we were looking at using on our short stay.

I really wanted to stay in this location but since we will be on this island for such a short period of time, we're only here for a few days - then maui for a week, and there is a cleaning fee. So if you add the fee per night PLUS the cleaning fee - mind as well stay in a hotel, right? Well after inquiring about the fee.... got response "just stay in hotel if you don't want to pay the fee" Which is direct and true, but WOW... that 's all the response I got. How about you include the price of the cleaning in the price per night you "Advertise"..... the worst part is that i was so excited about staying here, i was going to pay the fee $115 for two nights...but after that response... you're right... i'll stay at a hotel - which i will gladly pay more for now.

We are a mature couple and recently stayed here. We loved the view from our room, its size and the way it was equipped. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and we really enjoyed our stay. The only criticism we had was that the furnishings of the room and the hotel in general need to be upgraded. The whole hotel has a 'tired' feeling to it. In particular we noticed that the lifts smelled very musty, the carpets in them and throughout the hotel need replacing. We looked at 'The Modern' hotel next door which was noticeably more luxurious. However we feel that the Ilikai is good value for the price we paid.We had dinner in the Sarento restaurant on the top floor of the Ilikai, which was an amazing experience - great food , view and service.

We stayed here before moving on and had a wonderful view of the ocean. The staff were quite friendly and the place was a lot of fun and the location was wonderful. The restaurant downstairs was pretty good and not too expensive. We had a nice time here. It was near the Hilton so we could see the Luau's every night along with fireworks and could go shopping all around. We will go back and enjoyed our time there. Each room is a bit different so hard to really judge anyone elses. We stayed in a place from Wakiki Oceanfront Rentals and it was seemless.

My wife and I stayed at the Ilikai Marina from Feb. 8th to Mar. 1st 2013. We booked through MARINA HAWAII VACATIONS , who’s office is located in the Ilikai Towers Hotel . (Not to be confused with the Ilikai Marina.) The agency called the units Condos. Firstly on arrival to the Ilikai towers unaware there was a differences we were shocked when we went to the front desk and found we were not booked there. After all, the place looked like the literature that we had received. By deduction the receptionist concluded that we should be at the Ilikai Marina just around the corner. We paid well over 1K/Week for what?The list of deficiencies in the order as to our arrival into the unit assigned to us is as follows.A strong musty odor greeted us as we opened the door first night. We opened the window and the balcony door for most of a week while there to get rid of the odor .Random dirty spots on the carpet as if a small pet had also lived there.Hard spots on the carpet that looked like fixed cigarette burns.The carpet seam was separated in one spot about 1” in another about 1/4”.It appeared that the cabinets in the kitchen had been changed do to the fact that there is a sizable gap between the cabinets and linoleum in both the kitchen and bathroom. And one door nob is missing on the lower right corner cabinet in the kitchen by the stove. The kitchen tap was loose and moved about when you used it.Bathroom shower and tub enclosure supposedly has clear glass shower doors that were totally unsanitary with scrape-able soap, skin and calcium on them. They were so coated that at first glance one may think they were frosted. The above counter sink in the bath room was little better. Some walls had streaks terminating in a light brown tear drop stains. In my world neglected unsanitary conditions.The toilet was another major concern. While having a bowel movement I was shocked that my testicles were getting wet. The water in the bowl was far too high. It was an extremely disappointing and unsatisfactory experience. Despite many complaints and checking in when these complaints would be acted upon little or nothing was done to correct the most serious sanitary situations. And as far as we know the conditions have remained the same although we left the apartment cleaner than when we found it.The advert we received posted a pool but there isn’t one at the Ilikai Marina. Would you like to stay in a place like this and deal with an Agent like that?Your answerTMcD

From the outside, this hotel look old and worn. I don't think the look has been updated since it was in Hawaii Five-0, but as soon as you walk into the lobby you are blown away. The lobby opens up into a beautiful atrium that connects to a walkway that will take you to the beach and a fair sized man made lagoon. Every Friday, fireworks are set off on the beach so if you are lucky enough to have an ocean view room, you will have a perfect view from your balcony.The rooms are very nice. The newer remodelled rooms have plenty of space and the kitchenettes are prefect for families. I stayed in both a renovated room and an older room but it was still very nice. I also love the fact that the Ilikai offers free wireless Internet.This hotel is walking distance from the Ala Moana shopping centre and no less than 3 beaches. It,s just down the street from an IHOP, McDonalds, Red Lobster and many other restaurants. We rented a car the first time we came but quickly realized we didn't need one.

I booked this hotel thinking that it was going to be nice since it got such good reviews. We were scheduled to stay for one week and left after the first night. I'm all for getting a good deal on a hotel, but if you're looking for a real vacation place, this isn't it. First off, it was right out of the 70's....very dated and felt like my grandparents' condo building. This place actually is half condos half hotel, so that's probably a reasonable assumption. The rooms were definitely old and not comfortable at all. They didn't even have cable in the room! I also thought this place was going to be ocean front...it's not. There is a marina right in front of it and it's kind of near the lagoon for the Hilton, but you have to walk super far to get to the actual beach or even the lagoon. If you're going to Hawaii for a special trip, consider staying at a nicer hotel than this...we moved next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and there was no comparison whatsoever. Sure, the Hilton was $50 more per night, but if you're coming to Hawaii for a memorable stay, you're better off splurging since most people probably won't be back to the island again.

We stayed on the 10th floor, the view was stunning. Location gave us all we needed, and less of the Waikiki hustle and bustle. Important to remember: Parking is Valet only, so add it to your budget. We found the service well worth it. Cheaper parking is available off site, but you will have to walk a ways. Friday night fireworks were a treat from our balcony, and the concierge was oh so helpful.We also made good use of our fully stocked kitchen. No hot tub, and a less than yummy breakfast at the marina bar-have me giving 4 stars.Every other aspect of this hotel, was fantastic!

We rented this condo for 2 weeks and were very pleased with the location, the actual condo and the price of the condo. The condo is spacious (approximately 600 square feet) which beats a regular hotel room and is fully outfitted with a full kitchen and spacious lanai overlooking the marina and ocean. The kitchen has all that you need and more: pots, pans, dishes, cutlery, blender, coffee maker, rice cooker, etc.... The room stays cool as it doesn't get direct morning or afternoon sunlight so we never had to turn on the A/C once. The views from the lanai are gorgeous. There are 2 washer and dryers per floor for those staying longer needing to do laundry. We would return again! This condo is great for a couple or a family with 2 young kids; any more people would be a tight fit. The bedroom is separated from the living space by a wall partition. I love that the entire condo has tile floors so if you happen to track any sand in, it is easy to sweep up.There is no daily maid service here. There is a mid stay cleaning and end of stay cleaning that you pay for ($125 each). It was easy to spend 10 minutes per day to sweep the floor, tidy the kitchen and make the bed saving yourself money by not staying at an expensive hotel. The location is fabulous: the condo is on the western edge of Waikiki near Ala Moana shopping centre and Fort DeRussy beach. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Everytime my husband and I come to Hawaii, we stay at the Ilikai. Previously owned by the Marriott Hotel, the Ilikai has been remodeled and now owned by Aqua Hotels.The ocean view rooms has the most awesome view and you can enjoy it from the most spacious lanai. The rooms are huge. Approx 650 sq ft. Double closets so lots of room. The hotel itself has so many amenities and shops. Restaurants are great. The top of the eye has a spectacular view of Waikiki. Food was reasonably priced. I had the filet mignon with a pineapple mango topping. My husband had the lamb chops, in an Italian base sauce. Overall the best hotel if you are looking at size of room, hotel shops, great restaurant and bar and walking distance to so much shopping... One negative is no room service but I didn't mind because we were so close to everything and didn't need it.

We stayed at the Llikai Hotel Condo #1110 for 9 nights there were 6 of us 4 adults and 2 kids ,the room was a great size for all of us ,there were 2 twin beds for the kids my daughter and husband had the pull out sofa which really need to be replaced and room needs updating we found this end of town was to far away from Wakiki as all the shopping and restaurants are down there and the beach in Wakiki was beautiful here the beach wasn't that great

We just returned from 2 weeks in Honolulu. We booked room 1820 at the ilikai through WaikikiOceanfrontrentals.com. The room was very nice and clean. We were two adults and 1 child and the room was a pretty good fit.The location was excellent. 10 minute walk from Ala Moana Shopping center and steps from Waikiki beach, The Duke Kahanemoku lagoon next door was great for my son who went to play in it every day (there are small fish which he found fun to chase around the edge). Waikiki beach is pretty much next door and you can walk the entire length in about an hour round trip. There are tons of amenities nearby; restaurants, shopping, car rentals, fishing, surfing and sailing are all within easy walking distance.One thing that was not clear in any of the reviews was parking. We had a rental car for 6 days. parking was pretty easy to find. There are a few stalls behind the buiding and many more in the marina. It is one dollar an hour to park there and the only limit is you can only get a slip for a maximum of 24 hours.. This was not an issue since I was out for most of the day with the car anyway so the most I paid was for overnight parking of around 11 dollars. If you know you are going to be a short time you can park in the free parking at the lagoon for 6 hours. One last note about the parking is that Hawaii 50 was filming at the lagoon (They film the Shrimp truck scenes in the parking lot behind the lagoon) twice while I was there and it reduced the parking quite a bit but I still had no issues.I would say my only minor complaint was the bed frames. I think the platforms were designed for Queen beds but only have double mattresses on them. My wife and I bashed our shins on these more than once.

This Hotel is in a great location and has its own lagoon. Rooms are spacious and has everything you need within walking distance. Truly enjoyed our stay. The view is awesome and you can walk down the beach and back to the hotel as it sits at the south end of the beach

We were a party of 6 across 3 of the apartments, so we had cooking facilities, air con, great size balcony king size bed. A very well equipped apartment, large flat screen with DVD player, full size fridge, iPod clock radio, coffee machine etc.Well maintained, only down side was maybe could do with an upgrade on the outdoor furniture.

First thing we noticed was the lifts here are so fast, room was ok but maybe a little dated, good view of the ocean, would come back againIt pretty much has everything that you need close by, use the pink trolley buses to get to the malls or Hard rock cafe, its only $2 each wayLove Hawaii and we want to come back again

The Ilikai is a good hotel. We stayed for 5 nights in a two bedroom unit. The unit has plenty of space for a family which was great. We normally stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village which is right next door. The price for two bedrooms was less than one room with double beds at the Hilton. For this alone I would recommend the Ilikai. The location is great, the Hilton complex on one side, the Modern Hotel on the other. Both offer amenities that the Ilikai doesn't have....best of both worlds. The beach is a five minute easy walk. So why three stars? The Ilikai is 50 years old. It shows in some ways. Our rooms were fine, only complaint was the a/c units that are mounted on the wall blow right on the beds. All in all I easily recommend the Ilikai, just know that it is an older property. Sarento's Restaurant was excellent and I recommend a visit. I also recommend Morimotos at the Modern next door.

Great, convenient location. Nice easy walk to beautiful Waikiki beaches. Open beautiful lobby welcomes you from the moment you arrive. Convenient to several nearby eating places and shopping. Friendly, helpful staff.

After flying in from Heathrow via San Francisco we were a little frazzled from 16 hours in the air and 2 hours getting through US passport control at San Francisco. We arrived at the hotel at about 11.30 pm local time and were welcomed. Our room was huge with matching, comfortable bed and good facilities. The Hotel Bar and Grill is open through the day serving reasonable breakfasts, lunch and evening meals. There is a range of shops on the ground floor and grocery store was very useful. The coffee shop served excellent coffee and sandwiches to die for. Sarento's on the roof, 30 floors up, provides a much classier dinner experience for a larger cost, but given the view, service and food quality it is excellent value.There are many restaurants close to the hotel. We tried a few and "The Outrigger Steakhouse" was brilliant.

We stayed here two nights in March before our cruise. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel given the reasonable price. We were upgraded, along with our friends to an oceanview room so we could enjoy the Friday night fireworks...which were great! The location was wonderful....the lobby and terrace area were delightful. The hotel is very close to the beach and the lagoon. We ate several meals in the hotel grill because the quality of the food and prices, plus the convenience were a pleasant surprise! We were staying 3 nights in Honolulu after our cruise and seriously considered cancelling our reservation at another hotel to stay here, we liked it so much.

Stayed here last 2 weeks in Feb. Had an oceanview room on 25th floor looking out over the marina, lagoon and ocean. Decent sized balcony where we enjoyed breakfast every morning watching the surfers. Room was large with a comfortable very large king bed, large flat screen TV, fridge, microwave and coffee machine (coffee provided). Two large wardrobes and a decent sized chest of drawers for storage. Iron and ironing board and a safe were also provided. Actual bathroom was quite small with shower over a very short bath,it was a bit shabby but functional. There was an outer area where I normally would have expected the sink to be but wasn't, just a large mirror and counter top. As most people have said the room was a bit tired looking and could do with a refurb. No real complaints about the room, the cleaner came in every day with clean towels etc. We left a tip for her at the end of the first week and near the end of our stay and its the first time that I have been thanked for doing this. Free WiFi worked well in the room. We thought the hotel was in a good position with regards to the beach and the Ala Moana shopping centre but it was a bit of a trek to the main Waikiki area. We did use the trolley service though which stopped just outside the hotel. We booked a couple of trips through the concierge who was very helpful. The only real negative was the pool which was very small considering the size of the hotel and it was difficult to find beds. The best positions were taken early in the day, usually by regulars, and we did see a lot of "booking" chairs with towels etc. Also we over heard someone saying that they didn't stay in the hotel but came to the pool every day. Overall we would stay here again.

We stayed in condo 828 at the Ilikai hotel over Christmas and enjoyed every minute. The accommodation was very comfortable for our family of three adults and one child. The kitchen is modern and easy to use. The bathroom was more than sufficient.The view was spectacular en we were able to watch Friday night fireworks from our lanai. The laundry facilities on the same floor were more than adequate. The hotel is within walking distance from the large Ala Moana Shopping centre.I’ll go back I a heart beat.

Best location ,close to everything . Really clean and well maintained. Enjoyed food,drinks and sevice at patio bar. Firework on Friday evenings was a plus. View and sunsets amazing. Hope to get back soon.

Check in was smooth and prompt. Had to Valet park our car, as only option available, at $28.00 per day which while efficiently managed rather pricey and made loading and unloading car a little awkard.Room on 23rd floor overlooked other high rise buildings and road, not much else. It was definitely dated and in need of revamp but was clean and roomy. Bathroom also dated and a shower over small half bath. Free wifi worked well.Have previously only stayed in condo's at opposite end of Waikiki and was looking forward to a different experience this end. View from other side to marina and ocean was very nice. Walk to central Waikiki was definitely further than I had anticipated after a busy day and meal and I would most likely not stay this end again by choice.Housekeeping left a little to be desired with bed remade and towels changed but not much else,used glassed were left untouched, not washed or moved. Laundry was in constant use so not accessable with only one machine available. Small fridge and microwave which we did not use. Air conditioner blows on top of bed and needed to be turned down at night.Overall I felt value for money was better staying in Condo at opposite end of beach like Banyan or Sunset and while satisfied with property would probably not stay here again.Checkout was smooth and prompt.

Beautiful location- right on the beach and marina. Handy to lots of excellent restaurants, bars and shops. Walking distance to anything you could need. I had a beautiful spacious suite to myself, with a large balcony overlooking the marina and ocean. I was treated to amazing sunsets and magical sunrises every day. The staff were also so friendly and helpful. The housekeeping was excellent. I will definitely be returning!

Stayed here with my family of four. Our 2 bedroom suite was perfect for us. The second bedroom had two double beds which made my older children very happy. Lobby is quite a bit nicer than than the rooms, which were a bit dated, but super clean and comfortable. This is a great value for a suite and beats the heck out of the two room solution for a family of four. The location is ideal on the end of Waikiki beach proper--out of the crowd but still easy walk to the beach and the classic Waikiki stuff. Also right by Ali Moana park which is uncrowded and has a really nice protected lagoon and great views of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach.

We had 10 wonderful days in the Ilikai at the end of February. We stayed in a 2 bedroom (1 king and 2 double) 2 bathroom suite. Clean comfortable, roomy (so roomy that we prepared for a wedding there and had 8 extra people in the room that morning and there was room for us all comfortably), plenty of closet space. Lovely little kitchenette with all you need in it. We were lucky and had mountain view and some ocean view as we had a corner unit. The lights at night towards the city/mountain were very relaxing. You also get to see the nighly display at the Hilton next door from this unit. The Ilikai is very well situated. Just outside the busy Waikiki but so easy to walk there or catch the Trolley Bus that pulls up right outside. Just a short walk to the tourist popular Ala Moana shopping centre from the Ilikai. All the tour places know the Ilikai and most pick up from there first, so you get to pick your seats. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Definately staying there again if we go back, you won't be disappointed if you do too.

We have been spending our vacations for the last 32 years in this fabulous hotel.The staff is just wonderful. Very friendly, they are willing to do anything and eveything for you as long as you are satisfied and happy. The general manager, Mr. Dowsett is just a wonderful manager. Very friendly and knowledgable and just the manager, any hotel should be jealous of.

My husband and I are planning our 3rd stay at the Ilikai, it is wonderful place to stay,no complaints. The staff meets every need, very friendly. The rooms are spacious and clean, view outstanding, we face the Harbour. The hotel is at the end of the busy Waikiki, but easily in walking distance to everything. We have been going to Hawaii for years and have stayed at other hotels, one in particular we had big problems with smokers, so we moved to the Ilikai, no regrets, we plan on staying here over and over again, we are planning a trip next year with our family and will definitely stay at the Ilikai, hopefully in a corner suite. Absolutely no complaints.Would definitely recommend the Ilikai, you won't be disappointed.

This is the first time we have rented a Condo unit while in Waikiki and pleased with our stay here.Our room is large, comfortable kingsize bed, sitting area, good sized kitchen, large closets with full height sliding mirror doors, wood laminate in living area with large square marble tiles in kitchen and bath. Good sized bathroom with large shower. Large Balcony. Our suite faces South so lots of sun on the balcony. View of Ocean and good view of fireworks. Quiet at night. Guests we meet in the halls, elevators and lobby are friendly. Great Bar and restaurant on top floor with amazing view of the ocean and city. Will book here again.

Wow, we were very pleased! We had a 2-bedroom suite with two bathrooms, living area, and a kitchenette on the 22nd floor. The corner unit with two balconies made for some spectacular views! Our room was clean and we had lots of space to spread out. The valets and bellman were very attentive and friendly. Valet parking is $28/day and well worth it. You don't want to have to find parking in Waikiki every night on your own (and it'll cost that much or more, anyway). The hotel has a market for snacks & basic needs, as well as a couple restaurants. You can also walk to several coffee shops and the restaurants at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Friday night fireworks at the Hilton are just a few steps away as well. Great location!

The Ilikai was a pleasant experience. The location was great, close to the beach, overlooking the marina, close to great dining and shopping. We stayed in the hotel style room which was clean and well appointed. It was spacious and let"s face it, how much time do you spend in your room in Hawaii? Location is everything and the Ilikai has it. Good value!

I had five nights at this great hotel at the end of Feb. The hotel is located around half an hour from the airport and I caught one of the shuttle buses (Speedi Shuttle) from outside the terminal. A round trip will cost about $30 USD and doesn’t need to be booked in advance. As the hotel is located close to the airport as far as the “Waikiki strip” is concerned, I was the first to be dropped off. I checked in at 0930 and was initially told the room wouldn’t be ready until 1500, which I was expecting. Just before the registration process finished they found a room and off I went (2440) on the 24th floor (25 in total, plus the Penthouse). The room was huge with a large king sized bed. The bathroom was also big with a bath large enough even I could submerge myself in at 6’3”. The bathroom can be split in two with a sliding door separating the vanity & bath from the toilet & shower. The shower cubicle was long but a little narrow so you found yourself rubbing against the shower curtain. I didn’t find this a problem and besides, the bath also had a showerhead on a flexible hose so that was the preferred option. The room had both a safe and bar fridge which was empty; a great idea so you can fill it with whatever you want and not worry about taking something supplied by the hotel. The room had a large balcony with a table and two chairs with an “ocean view”. The hotel has three wings, like a Mercedes Benz symbol effectively. I was on the south eastern wing (Diamond Head side) so looked across to the hotel opposite but to the right and below were the pool, lagoon and ocean beyond. To be honest as good as it was, I have learnt that you don’t generally spend a lot of time in the hotel so if you want an ocean view the beach is 2 mins walk from the foyer! Those on the south western side would have perhaps had a better view across the marina and the sunset beyond.Reception have both beach towels and deck chairs which can be gained by swapping them with a card given to you at check in. There is free wifi in each room but I used the computer next to reception. It was pretty fast and free. There is a bar as well as a number of shops in the lobby area including a general store and sight seeing booking desk. I found both the lagoon and ocean great to swim in but didn’t try the pool.Outside the hotel can be found numerous shops and restaurants. Two minutes from the hotel at the large intersection can be found one of the numerous ABC shops which sells everything from cold drinks to t shirts to band aids. Also opposite the hotel are numerous rental car companies including Enterprise, National and Alamo (which I used). Ten to fifteen minutes walk away back towards the airport can be found the Ala Moana shopping centre which has most things you are looking for. A Walmart is another five minutes beyond it. Alternatively, the main strip is ten minutes walk along the beach or the road behind the hotel.I only encountered one problem during my stay; the air con in the room worked great but I woke up to it rattling away in the middle of the night. A couple of strategically placed wads of paper solved the problem and I reported it early the next morning before heading out on a day trip. I returned later that evening to find the air con had been replaced by a completely brand new unit. Talk about service!It was pointed out to me by someone staying at another hotel that the Ilikai features in the opening credits to the original Hawaii Five-O TV show. I found it on youtube; the main character is zoomed in on in the hotel and even my room could be seen!The hotel isn’t the most glitzy or newest on the beachfront but it oozes character in all the right ways and I wouldn’t hesitate in recommending it; the staff are fantastic and I can’t wait to return!Just a couple of other thoughts; if you hire a car head around the island in an anti clockwise direction as it is much easier to find a car park on the beach side and you are right on the ocean for most of the way. Diamond Head has a small car park so you may need to park outside the crater and enter through the tunnel Allow 30 – 45 mins to climb to the top depending on your level of fitness. Traffic in Honolulu during peak hour is horrible so avoid driving during these times.I went to the Chiefs Luau which was great. Reviews I’d read noted the food wasn’t particularly nice. I thought it was ok; if you are looking for burgers and fries you are in the wrong place! I had a Royal Package which means you get table service and front row. It isn’t in big area so no need to be up front. Although it is only 25 mins from Waikiki, you spend an hour driving around before leaving downtown after picking everyone else up. The other options would be the same though if not worst due to their locations. A local bus to Pearl Harbour will cost $2.50 and take around 1.5 hrs each way. I thought I’d be clever and get on the Pearl Harbour Express. It cost $30 return and took a change of bus and an hour to get there so don’t bother! We were left stranded on return so a couple of us split a cab which cost $40 USD. Get there early if you want to get to the Arizona Memorial; you my have to wait for your turn to get out there by boat.

We arrived for a 3-day stay at the Ilikai after an overnight flight from Fiji and although it was only 8 am our room was ready and the pleasant front desk staff quickly checked us in. The room was unusually spacious with 2 clothes closets, a large bathroom with separate tub and shower and 2 sinks, updated furniture with a bright and beautiful colour scheme, microwave and small fridge, and a wonderful balcony overlooking the marina and oceanfront. We were on the 25th floor with a panoramic view. Comfortable bed. Great TV. Bathroom could use updating but was perfectly acceptable. Swimming pool is small but the beach isn't far away and the hotel provides beach towels and chairs.Ilikai's location is beside Hilton Hawaiian Village and provides access to the Hilton's features (restaurants, shops, gardens etc) without the hubbub of that over-crowded property. Ilikai concierge will give you a discount booklet that we used at several local restaurants. Location is within easy walking distance of the Ala Moana shopping centre and is at the more upscale end of Waikiki.We would definitely book here again. Reasonable price for an excellent ocean-view room.

Great hotel with wonderful service. Clean, well appointed rooms with excellent bistro. The ocean/pool view was outstanding and the walk to the beach only a few minutes. Easy to catch public transport from outside the hotel and only a short distance to the main strip in Waikiki.

We stayed at the Ilikai for 4 nights before we headed to Ko'Olina to stay at Disney's new resort the Aulani. This hotel is a bit smaller than other hotel/resorts along Ala Moana and Waikiki and it can seem a little out dated depending on what you consider out dated. It seemed to be a bit of an older hotel but to be honest, we had a great time. We had a suite at the Ilikai and it was more than we could have asked for. The room was huge it had a kitchen and an amazing view! The hotel is located at the end of what I like to consider "hotel zone" but on the bright side is closer to Ala Moana shopping center. The trolley which I think its $3 or $2 stops right in front of the hotel. The service was great and the valet was very helpful in terms of directions and recommendations. Also, on Fridays aka "Aloha Fridays" they have fireworks and the fireworks go off in the cove at the Ilikai so if you don't have a view from your room just head on downstairs and there it is. I don't think I've ever been that close to fireworks but it was such a memorable experience! All in all this hotel is great and is a bit cheaper than the other hotels but then again I think its because it seems to be a bit older and it is further from the "center" of it all like but isn't that far of a walk plus its nice with the Hawaiian breeze.

I've stayed at the Ilikai several times throughout the past four years. I was born and raised in Honolulu (now living on neighbor island), so know the island very well. Although I have stayed at other outstanding hotels on Oahu, I prefer the Ilikai because of the following 1) special rates for locals; 2) parking is included in local rates most times and if not, parking is reasonably priced; 3) you can walk to two beaches; 4) Sarentos Top of the Ilikai Italian Restaurant provides one the the finest views of the ocean/sunset in Honolulu and the food/service is impeccable; 5) The Modern Hotel (sister property) adjoining the Ilikai boasts Morimoto's (exquisite service and Iron Chef meals at reasonable prices); 6) you are also in walking distance to other fun eateries across the street which locals frequent i.e. The Chart House; 7) Ala Moana Shopping Center is a 15 minute walk or 5 minute drive or you can take a free trolly service from the hotel to Ala Moana and other shopping establishments; 8) the hotel is at the "beginning" of Waikiki so there are many ways to approach it to avoid traffic in the rush hour; 9) rooms are very spacious and clean; 10) staff is always very polite; 12) rooms with full kitchens are available; 13) Rooms are very quiet if you get an ocean view or partial ocean view. The bottom line - the quality + price of the rooms, central location, ease to recreational spots/night life, ease of getting in and out of the hotel (valets are quick) make the Ilikai my favorite hotel on Oahu. I love the Ilikai because I can pull into the garage at night and not feel compelled to get in my car again to find fabulous food and entertainment just a short walk away. Beds are comfy, great pillows. The only downside is the air conditioner is usually aimed at the side of the bed blasting at the head - so you can try to request for another room configuration. Lastly, if you are not happy with your room management will find another accommodation. On two previous visits I was placed next to construction (renovating hotel) which was quiet over the weekend, however changed on Monday. FYI this is where the original Hawaii Five-0 filmed their opening sequence.

...but that's about it. I love the proximity to the harbor and being away from the craziness of Waikiki. I liked how we were so close to Ala Moana Mall, easy to walk to. We were able to go back to the mall if we forgot to buy certain things. Foodland is at the mall, great place to get groceries. Why the 3 stars? 1) parking 2) pool 3) laundryParking was valet only, $28/day with in/out service. Valet staff were awesome by the way, but who wants to spend $30+/day on parking (if you include tips)?! Parking at the next door Ilikai Marina was $20/day self park (i think it is in/out) or park in the street in the back about $1/hr.The pool was super small and was crowded! No open chairs available when I went. The crowd was geriatric, not a very hip scene. The laundry room was down the hall and required quarters. As a parent, being able to do laundry without planning and prep is a luxury and a must.Although this dated hotel has it perks, next time I'll stay at a hotel/condo with free in/out parking, a nicer pool, and an in-unit washer/dryer.

Great location but not really great hotel. Housekeeping was really poor. We had to ask for them to come back in and vacuum up sand in the bathroom. Mirrors and taps not cleaned well either. We had a problem with cigar smoke coming in from the room next door smoking on the balcony. They did move us into a better room which we appreciated. The pool was small and really enclosed felt claustrophobic.

My boyfriend took me to the Ilikai for my birthday week and it was wonderful! Our plane was delayed and the hotel was very flexible with changing our arrival and departure dates and didn't charge us for the night we missed. The concierge was very helpful throughout our stay. And the valet was always prompt and friendly, when we called down for our car it was always there waiting when we came outside. We had a nearly top floor room facing the ocean and the view was absolutely spectacular. We slept with the sliding glass doors wide open and the sound, breeze, and smell of the ocean was so peaceful. Our room was spacious and comfortable with ample closet space and room to hang out. We like that it came with a mini fridge and that in-room Kona coffee is the perfect way to start the day. The location was great too, we could walk to several restaurants and conveniences, including Morimoto's right out back. The grounds were beautiful and the hotel itself was beautiful as well. Our only complaint, but not really a complaint, is that they did not have room service.We would definitely stay here again.

Our stay here lasted three nights . The room was extremely large and comfortable. Almost accommodation around with more expensive price, this hotel was suitable for our budget. The location was lovely and located near with the beach and famous attractions nearby. Staffs would helped for surfing and local trips. A nice place to stay!

Unit 1906 of the Ilikai. A studio with a bed and a fold out sofa bed. Full kitchen. Spacious. Beautifully decorated. Very clean. Right on Waikiki. For us, the best part was the balcony which had a view of the marina and the beach. We watched the surfers while enjoying most meals. I would return to this unit.

We have stayed at the Ilikai 4 times over the past 8 years. Over the years some improvements have been made which makes it an even better choice. Several new and very useful shops have been added to the lobby floor. The hotel was build in 1964 which means that the rooms are spacious as are the lanais. The personnel are all very friendly and helpful. They have a tiki torch lighting ceremony every evening and the view of the sunset from the property is spectacular. It's a short walk to the beach and beach towels as well as chairs are provided. Several city bus routes stop close by and car rentals are available just across the street.

This was our fifth year in a row staying at the Ilikai. This was our fourth year in the hotel. The other year was in one of the condos. While the price for the condo stay was a bit less, we prefer the hotel for the service. All of our stays were in rooms in the Diamond Head wing. Our view was looking out over the lagoon (between the Ilikai and the Hilton Hawaiian Village complex) to the ocean was magnificent. The rooms in the hotel are quite large by any standard but especially by Hawaii standards on Waikiki. The price is very competitive and lower than any other hotel right on the beach in Waikiki by far in our opinion. The lanai (porch) was large too. Two chairs and a table are provided but 6 people could easily sit out there. We spent many hours on the lanai. The king-sized bed was very comfortable but the pillows were not the best. The furniture shows some wear but given the price and size of the room, this was very acceptable. A large desk was provided with room for both my wife and I to set up our laptops. There is high speed wired and wireless internet access. Our room had a microwave and small refrigerator. The refrigerator was plenty big enough for everything we wanted to keep in it. Room are now also equipped with large flat screen televisions. The staff there are outstanding. Extremely friendly and helpful. There are two restaurants in the hotel. Sarento's at the Top of the I, atop the hotel, is Italian and while not casual restaurant priced the food is quite good. The spaghetti with filet mignon meatballs is our favorite. The view is spectacular. On the ground floor is the Ilikai Bar & Grill. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner and prices are very reasonable. They serve a kalua pig BBQ sandwich which is quite good. The also serve a kalua pig loco moco breakfast that is also very good. Loco moco is a local favorite (rice topped with the kalua pig or hamburger, an egg and gravy). A change in ownership between last year and this year led to a definite increase in service. As I mentioned, we like the hotel over the condo because of service. Daily cleaning of the room, fresh towels, and the making of the bed are great. Condos charge significant cleaning fees and only come once a week. Coin-operated aundry facilities are provided on the floor. From the hotel you can easily walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center to the west and along the entire Waikiki beach to the east. There are a number of outstanding restaurants within walking distance. Our favorite is the Chart House (no relation to the chain) across the street from the hotel. Access to public transportation is a few steps from the hotel entrance. Tours to all popular tourist attractions are available and most will pick you up at your hotel. The past three years we have stayed three weeks. We are already planning out trip for 2014.

Stayed in the Hotel February 11-20th in a 2 bedroom suite, found the staff to be very pleasant and knowledgeable, dining in the Italian restaurant was pricey but the food and service was very good. The downstairs outside bar was not that great and there is better choices that are just a short walk away. Overall for a family hotel it was satisfactory, i would suggest that the room we were in be upgraded with new carpets, paint and furniture. Everything was really worn but not abused. I would likely not return to this hotel as we believe that there are newer hotels for about the same price closer to the core of Waikiki.

Wonderful stay, from the reservations (Thank you Sandra H.), to the maintenance crew. My last few nights on the 25th floor were windy and I kept hearing a noise. I called the front desk, 20 minutes later maintenance person was in my room investigating the sound. He found a gap in an access panel to the balcony, caulked, and was gone, no more sound. What service. Will definitely stay here again, and oh the views, the locations. There are lots of places to stay in Waikiki, but there are not lots of Ilikais

We stayed on the 22nd floor at the Ilikai Hotel in Honolulu. It was a large room, large bathroom, with extremely comfortable bed. The service from the front desk was great. We had a balcony which overlooked the ocean and lagoon and we watched the fantastic fireworks on Friday night from the Hilton Hotel. Would definately stay there again . Walked along the beach to wherever we wanted to go, Did not eat in the restaurant because there were so many choices around the hotel.

We have just returned from a wonderful two week vacation at the IIikai Hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel for it's quite location and clean, large rooms. The staff were wonderful, and although the hotel was completely full the weeks we were there, it did not feel that it was. We had a room on the 24th floor facing the harbour and ocean view. It was spectacular to wake up each morning glaring out at this view. Since food is rather expensive in Hawaii, I would highly recommend a room with a kitchenette. We managed without one, but it would have been much easier with one. As mentioned, the location was perfect if you are not a night life person. With the Hilton next door, there was lots of opportunities to walk around the resort and eat at the many restaurants in the facility. The fireworks were spectacular too. It is about a twenty minute walk to the centre of Waikiki. The beaches at he IIikai end are less crowded as well.

The Ilikai is located right next to the Hilton Hawaiian Village on Waikiki Beach so it is convenient to everything there. The hotel is part condos and part hotel. The staff is helpful and efficient. The rooms are large and comfortable. Ours could have used a bit of a makeover. The arms of the comfy lounge chair were threadbare but otherwise it was a great room. We could sit out on the balcony (a small table and 2 chairs) on the 22nd floor and have a snack and watch the boats go by. Two great things about the room that we loved were the mini-fridge and the amount of outlets. In this electronic age with phones, computers, tablets there were plenty of places to charge our devices at the same time. The wi-fi signal was strong and easy to access, another plus. Although not exactly on the beach (it is by a marina), it is a quick walk to Waikiki beach and the hotel supplies beach chairs and towels. The hotel is within walking distance of shops, high end and fast food restaurants. There are buses and trolleys (some free, some have a fare) in front of the hotel that will take you anywhere on the island if you don't have a car. I was not too thrilled with the $28/day valet parking fee but I believe it is par for the course. We'd definitely stay there again when in Honolulu.

I do believe this is the 4th time Ive stayed here in the last four years, so I'm either going back out of habit........or its just that good and for me, its basically JUST THAT GOOD!I know this will sound repetitive, but its just got a lot of things going for it that I truly love....location: its at the very beginning of the strip and a very short walk to Ala Moana park and mall....for some this is a plus (like me)...for others, you might want to be more "in the heart of things" a few blocks further up the beach...rooms: not brand new and fancy (yet....thats a'comin'!)....but great size, comfort, and amenities for the price.....also great views.service: this is what places the Ilikai at the top for me...it starts with the management, and everyone else there buys into the concept of true "aloha" right down to the valets. I cant say enough great things about the service here.All in all, I spent 4 nights there during peak season, and always felt like I was part of their family.If you have any questions or need advice on floors or rooms, just reach out.Mahalo!

Our 2 bedroom suite had fantastic views over the ocean and marina. The location is close to the Ala Moana shopping centre and within walking distance of all that Waikiki has to offer. We were there for a family wedding and the suite was a perfect setting for the wedding party to get prepared in with a hairdresser and makeup artist attending the party in our suite and all of the family returning after the wedding. The reception was held at the roof top Sarento restaurant on Friday night with the fireworks providing a perfect back drop to a perfect day. Friendly staff, comfortable beds and spacious suite.

We were here for a convention and this hotel not only priced well,but located centrally.The concierge was the best,helping find a rental car and offering advice on places to see.It is a very clean property,and has a great staff running the hotel.we were within walking distance of the Ala Moana shopping center (great selection of stores)and the Hawaiian convention center.Also near the lagoon,and a great walking path near the beach.Just a nice place to stay,for all ages.We were also surprised to find that the masseuse (wonderful)was also a physical therapist,offering great advice in addition to a wonder massage.

Stayed for 7 nights in unit 1530.The unit was very well equipped and had lots of staples and there was plenty of space for our belongings.( It would have been nice to have had a dishwasher.) The location was outstanding and the view from the lanai was superb. We loved seeing the Luau every night at the Hilton and we had front row seats for the Friday fireworks.We loved the Ilikai and enjoyed the hotel grounds. We did have a rental car for our stay and would never do that again because of the parking fees. The best deal is to park at the Marina lot if you come with a car.The only negative was that the Ilikai pool was always crowded. Over 7 days we could never get a chair at the pool. We felt fortunate that our unit was equipped with beach chairs, etc so we headed to the beach each day instead. Looking forward to a return visit.

We liked the Ilekai and would come back there. It is conveniently located and the staff are very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are a little dated and could use an upgrade...especially the kitchen area (if you get one), but it was nice to have; especially for breakfasts. If you're in town for a convention, it has good access on foot and very easy even to walk all the way to Diamond Head (which we did several times. The restaurant at the top (Sorrento) was also very, very good although a bit pricey, but the view is nice and the service, again very pleasant and helpful. The food was also excellent and you get a discount if you're a hotel guest. Its a very short and almost traffic-free walk to the beach and lagoon just behind the hotel. We came away thinking it was a very worthwhile and good experience.

The staff at the Ilikai were very friendly and accommodating! Even the guests at the hotel were so friendly!! meeting and talking to people in the elevator was fun!! The rooms were clean and spacious!! Lots of places walking distance to eat and even shop!! Wish we got to stay there longer.

We think this is the best location in Honolulu. It's away from the craziness of Waikiki, but only a short walk away if you want to get into the tourist scene. And it's walking distance or a short bus ride to all the interesting things that Honolulu has to offer. The Ala Moana Center is only about a 10 minute walk and our favorite store, Don Quijote, is only another 5 minutes.The hotel has a nice swimming pool and exercise room. The hotel also has a very nice coffee shop with good sandwiches for lunch. The Ilikai Grill has good, reasonable priced food and drinks and live music every night in a great outdoor (mostly covered) setting. And of course there is Sorentos at the top of the Ilikai with fantastic views, good food and drink at fair prices. There is also a convenience store with a variety of items, mostly reasonably priced.The lobby and courtyard are really comfortable and the staff makes you feel really welcome.The beach outside the Hilton and Fort Derussy is only a couple of minutes away and is probably the best beach in Waikiki. Even closer is the lagoon, which is great for kids. For serious swimming and a beautiful uncrowded beach, you can't beat Ala Moana Beach, a short walk in the other direction. There are probably 100 places to eat within walking distance of the Ilikai. The city bus system works well and we don't feel there is a need for a car, if you stay at the Ilikai.We've stayed at probably a half dozen places in Waikiki and the Ilikai is by far the best. The rooms we've stayed in (the ocean side) are quiet enough to leave to lanai doors open all night (we seldom use the A/C)

We stayed for 8 nights in unit 1115 of Ilikai in December 2012 and booked through WaikikiOceanfrontRentals.com. We liked the room. Everything was like in the pictures from the website, so there were no surprises. We are a family of 4 (kids 14 and 20). The king bed was comfortable with nice linens. The sofa was comfortable and firm also. I slept 2 nights on it, and didn’t feel the frame or lumps.Room has a lot of closet space, and the bathroom is small, but in good condition. The kitchen had everything we needed. I think the pans were replaced since last review of this room in 2011(they all are in very good condition), but kitchen faucet is still dripping. Kitchen also had a toaster, tea pot, electrical oven, blender, a lot of plates, glasses, cups, and silverware. I brought tea, coffee, and oatmeal from home. Plastic ice packs helped keep our snacks and water cool at the beach. We brought a small lunch box (the same as kids take to school). I wish I brought a travel size bottle of vegetable oil and about the same amount of detergent. The smallest you can buy is still very big for one week. There is laundry room on every floor. $2.50 for washing or drying, we used it a couple of times.We did grocery shopping at FoodLand by the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. It is an easy 10 minute walk there, and we took a cab back. I think it was $7. You can give your phone number during check out in FoodLand to get a discount on your groceries. The hotel location is great. It’s only a 5 minute walk to the beach. We liked to go past the Hilton to the Fort DeRussy Beach(more space and less people). We stayed on the beach by the restaurant with blue umbrellas. This is Hale Koa military hotel. They have good food: burgers, chicken, salads. Everything is about $5 and no tax. We did snorkeling right on the beach, a little to the right of the military hotel when you’re looking at the ocean. There aren’t too many fish, but we saw some and also a turtle.We ate breakfast every morning on our balcony. This room has a very nice city view, and you can see mountains between the buildings, and also several rainbows.One day, we felt like we had too many left overs. So our friends, who stayed in Room 1607, and us brought food, plates and silverware downstairs (there is space with tables and an ocean view outside), and ate our dinner outside.Otherwise, we ate dinner at many different restaurants:Bubba Gump (good shrimp, catch of the day, other food was oily, not very good).Yard House – great food, great service.Ocean House – very expensive. It said in the review, this place has big portions, good portions to share. Also their menu says the same, but portions are regular size and it’s not enough to share. Service is very slow, and the food is not good.Right next door to Ocean House is Shore Bird Restaurant (ocean view). You have to grill your food yourself, but everything comes pre-packaged with spices, and the chef helps you. Food was really great, and grilling was really fun. All 6 of us liked our choices. They have a salad buffet included with many different options.Kaiwa - very good Japanese food. Good sushi and sashimi, good salads and fish dishes. Great service..We rented a car for one day and went kayaking on the Kahana River. There are 3 car rental places in the Discover building just across the street from the hotel, but neither of them had a car that could fit 6 people. We ended up renting a car in a small place on the same street as Ilikai going toward Hilton. Renting a car for one day was very expensive. This also may be because it was during the holiday season.You really don’t need a car in Waikiki, but if you take a bus, remember busses are very slow. They stop every 10 seconds. It takes forever to get anywhere. It took us 1.5 hour to get from Pearl Harbor. We used taxis a lot. It was about $45 to Pearl Harbor, $45 to Hanauma Bay, and $15 to Diamond Head.I will definitely recommend the Ilikai condos. We had a great stay and great vacation. This place is very good for families with kids, and everybody who wants to save money on food. It is also in great proximity to the beach, stores and night live

Did some extensive research when booking our room. We really wanted a kitchen to save some money. We stayed 5 days in condo 2124 at the Ilikai. And it was great. For the price of the room and the location-- we couldn't have asked for anything better. It was a suite with two beds, a couch and kitchen. We had a great view of the Hilton Lagoon and got to see the luau down across the street from our lanai. Ample room for my family of four! Needs a little love cause the paint inside the room is not so well. But nothing that would keep us from staying here again. I did have a problem with the bed frame-- it was made for a king but both frames had a full size bed in it which lead to everyone walking into the corners of the frame. Great room though. It's a nice walk to both walk plots and restaurants galore. Stay here if your looking for a reasonable price and great views!

Hotel itself is nice, would say great but needs a touch up here and there. The room was large with a nice balcony but looks a little worn. Our room has a wonderful view of the Marina, ocean and local park. Pool etc are fine as well but unfortunately the main open areas directly abut the fabulous pool area of the Modern Hotel next door and if not careful one could think that they are the ones for the Ilikai (and then be a little disappointed when you get to the actual pool area for this hotel). No major issues with the building itself but guess I was expecting a little more based on the reviews that I read. All of that being said, I would advise anyone who comes here to do their own homework when it comes to trips, meals etc as the concierges seem to have little knowledge of what the best quality trips, meals etc are. Almost, everything that was recommended was either not what it was billed to be or just plain wrong (tried to book a helicopter tour and was told we could do it on a certain day but was suspicious so called myself and there was nothing for that day). Interestingly, they could get us some tickets for the tour if we listened to a TimeShare presentation at the hotel. Oh by the way, the Ilikai is only 1/3 hotel. The other parts of it are 1/3 timeshare and 1/3 private condos. I did not feel it was appropriate for the concierge to try to steer us toward the inhouse timeshare presentation. When we said no thank you she offered us $100 cash. Issues like this can sour one's opinion of an otherwise fine hotel.

You do get what you pay for, and this, for Waikiki is fairly reasonably priced. We are a family of 5, so we had 2 bedrooms (one is behind sliding doors, with no wardrobe or storage at all), and a pull out bed in the lounge. It is handy having a kitchen especially when travelling with families. It sounds like the hotel is 'gradually' going through and upgrading the rooms - this is definitely needed, we were on the 24th floor, with nice big balcony and great views, ours was a mountain view, but really a view of other high rises and a bit of the marina, but a good view.....but our room was pretty outdated, so if you are in a higher floor you have the great views, but more likely your room is not been re-done. I would check on this firstly when booking, as if you are staying for longer than 3 nights, you will be better off having a nicer room. If you are travelling with a lot of luggage, it was hard to figure where to put it, as there was no room to even put a suitcase in the second bedroom . This may become a bit tiresome if you were there for a week or so. As far as the location is concerned, it was good if you wanted to be walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, otherwise it's a bit 'half way' to everything. Its about 20 minutes walk in the other direction to Ala Moana to the main shopping and Beachwalk area of Waikiki, though the trolley buses to go past the hotel.Also, as people have mentioned, you have to know the hotel is not on the beach, in front of it is the Marina. This is a good average hotel, but dont come here if you were wanting a luxury Honolulu experience.

It,s a nice place to spend a vacation, the rooms are comfortable, the price great but I must say I have never seen a front desk so annoyed at me asking a question. I didn't bother them except to ask where to return the beach towels and where to get change for the laundry room. They just looked at me rather annoyed and pointed to a bin for the towels and a change machine for the laundry room. not a word spoken. I realize now that they have year round tenants in condos that they sell, so I guess they get tired of the tenants asking the same question over and over again. NEWS for the front desk not all of us that are asking for something are tenants we are TOURIST on vacation. If they don't know the difference they will soon with that attitude. When I complained that my room wasn't made up the day before the responded by sending up fresh towels.

I`ve had the pleasure of staying at the Ilikai three times. It is old world luxurious. The open air lobby is comfortable and pleasant. The rooms are clean and spacious, with lots of storage space. The lanais are roomy. The hotel is conveniently located near to the Mall, and the beach is a short walk away. The staff are friendly and attentive. It`s a great place to stay.

Stayed here got only 1 night but wished we stayed longerSuites are very spacious with an equally large balcony. Fully equipped kitchen is great when travelling with kids. Service is fantastic and staff attentive to your needs. Walking distance to Ala Moana and only a short trolley ride to Waikiki. Look no further, this is a great hotel at a great rate.

Our fourth stay at the Ilikai. Close to shopping. Close to Waikiki. But, in a quiet area with great ocean views. Comfortable rooms with useable lanai's. No need to rent a car with bus service right outside the hotel. Seniors can ride for a buck with a Medicare card. Plans to upgrade pool area are approved and awaiting to be implemented.

The good: 1. location - walking distance to both the main part of Waikiki and Ala Mona shopping centre was extremely convenient. Spectacular views from the room and balcony. We were on one of the higher floors. Although the view is interupted by one of the Hilton Village buildings, the view is still spectacular, provided the room is on the beach side! 2. Staff - very friendly and helpful, linen is fresh. 3. Rooms in general are very large, a legacy of the period from which it was built. 4. Lastly, the bar / grill downstairs is terrific and reasonably priced (compared to the Hilton next door), plus the coffee shop next door serves great coffee early in the morning, with very cheerful owner / manager.The bad: 1. The pool. If retro is your thing, you wont be disappointed because this pool area is straight out of circa 1960s. It feels like it has not been upgraded since. There is a hideous looking giant AC or exhaust fan behind the pool which is just ugly. No amount of palm trees is going to cover that. 2. Wi-Fi - sometimes its there, other times it isnt. Our room connection was unreliable at best and my wife needed to sit in the corridor several times to get a good connection, much to the amusement of other guests. 3. Room - bathroom expecially needs updating. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai, but were let down by the aging building. I hope the management spend some money on it and update the items above.

Comfortable, reasonably spacious rooms with usable balconies. Friendly service and a good range of facilities in the hotel. Ocean views all seem a bit restricted, but OK from the balconies. Most parts of the hotel have been recently refurbished. There are stairs up to the lobby from street level, but escalators and a lift are provided for people with bags.Located 3 minutes from Kahanamoku beach and the Marina, but about a 20 minute level walk to the centre of Waikiki and the main beach. However, you can get a local bus from outside the hotel for $2.50 each way. Note: Unless you buy a multi-day pass, the buses are cash only and don't give change.

We are staying in a vrbo room 828. For fun was reading the reviews but feel now must write a note. In all fairness, we have never dealt with anyone working at the hotel. No need to. Able to carry own luggage etc but I can see the stairs could be a problem for some. Our room is so modern and clean, I don't want to use it. Bed is king and comfortable and our air conditioner quiet but can make sitting on couch a bit cool. Bathroom shower fine and room quite large for two. No the hotel is not right on the beach but a nice path via the pool area gets you to lagoon and then to beach and a nice quiet beach to boot. Some areas need water shoes. Our owner gave us all the toys including chairs and beach mats and towels. You would have to bring all your food if plan to eat in. No condiments or anything. We never ate in hotel and loved that we had the beach walk path to get to any excitement we wished to partake in. The hotel itself is for an older quieter crowd it seems.

Stayed in a condo 2020 at Ilikai and can recommend this option if planning to visit Waikiki.Condo itself was one of the recently remodeled and it was very nicely decorated. Really looks like in the pictures, which is not always the case. It was maybe a bit smaller than what we thought but nevertheless big enough for 2 adults and one baby. The bed was maybe a bit too soft for our liking but we still slept quite well. Our friends were staying in one few floors down and it was almost exactly like ours. Everything works well and the condo is well equipped. View from lanai is really amazing! Lagoon, ocean, diamond head... Booked through waikiki oceanfront rentals and they really handled everything superbly. We requested a crib for our baby and this was delivered before we arrived (quite pricey though as you could almost buy a new one with that money!($50)).The location is also very good. At the more quiet end of Waikiki but still walking distance from the hustle and bustle. Only few steps to the lagoon and the beach. The pool is a bit small and didn't really use it as we preferred the beach. The big Ala Moana shopping center is about 10 mins walk away and lot's of restaurants also close by. Top floor of Ilikai you also have a very nice (but pricey) restaurant and recommend to go there at least for drinks and for the view. Car rental agencies, ABC, few restaurants, etc are just across the street. Free trolleys and local busses also stop right in front of the building. Next door hotel, which you can access right from the courtyard, also has a nice pool, a pool bar and very cool restaurant.All in all would definitely recommend this place (condo, not sure about the hotel) to anyone looking for a good value place to stay in Waikiki. And hopefully we will return one day!

This hotel is an embarresment! We stayed here for two days when we first arrived as we wanted to do shopping before going to maui. We were on the 25 floor. It was ok. Basic but clean. Great views and close to shopping. We booked it sgain on our way back before glying home. We were on fhe 10 floor!!! Bugs crawling in the bath room, extremely old and dated would be a compliment. On a positive note the linen was clean and fresh.

Stayed for a week at the Ilikai on the 25th floor facing the Marina. The hotel facilities are ok, but they need to improve the way to handle the luggage from the street to the main floor, you have to carry your luggage up two set of stairs, no help from hotel staff.The room was big but needs upgrading specially the bath room and the AC.The location is fine but not on the beach, short walk to the beach, restaurants etc.

Let me start with the upsides. (As with any hotel, beware the website!! Somewhat misleading.)Location - not bad, not great. At the very far end of Waikiki, fairly close the Alo Moana Beach and the shopping mall. Easy to get around from here via taxis or busses. Very large rooms. Cheap, especially for Waikiki. The concierge desk staff are knowledgable and friendly. There's a nice dispenser of iced lemon water at the front desk. Woohoo.Oh my, but the down sides! Despite the website pictures, this hotel is NOT ON THE BEACH!!! It overlooks a parking lot for the marina.When I arrived (a 53 year old woman, alone with heavy baggage) there was no bell service. The entry to the hotel is at the bottom of quite a large staircase and the elevator was "temporarily" out of service. Broken more like it, under seemingly extensive repairs. There is an escalator, but I was told upon arriving that I could not take my luggage on it. When I asked how I was supposed to get my luggage up the staris I was told to carry it. Seriously. I told the man I have a torn rotator cuff, which I do, he stared at me blankly. Nice welcome. Finally, a security guard took pity on me and carried my bag to the top of the stairs, but not as far as the front desk. Jeez louis.The restaurants! Dreadful!! Sarento`s at the top of the buidling is absolutely horrible. Supposedly ``Fine Dining`. The room is not bad looking, if somewhat pedestrian and boring, but the food is bad beyond belief, particularlly given the pricing. Dinner for 2 will run you $250 with apps and wine and the food is not worth $25. I will say that they wine list is pretty good though.We were seated in one of the smaller rooms, which did have a spectacular view, next to a table of 6 people who were screaming into their cell phones the entire evening. The place was empty so there was no reason for us to have been seated there. The wait staff was useless, knew nothing about the menu or food preperation. Just to be clear, we ate subsequently at Alan Wong`s, Morimoto and Side Street Inn and gladly paid lots of money for exquisite food and spectacular service.The Bar and Grill was fine for breakfast - eggs for $7.95, get what you pay for. Lunch and pu-pus are gross, cheap bar food served in paper take-out containers.The POOL is one of the nastiest I have ever seen in my life. Small, grotty and full of ancient condo owners who resent the hotel guests`presence. I am pretty sure it is the original pool, circa Hawaii 50 1972. Full of rude people, chairs right on top of each other, teeny tiny, no view, behind a concrete wall. NOTE - use the pool next door at the Modern! It`s gorgeous and sleek, with a view, and the bartender will let you use it for a $10 bribe! Also, go there for drinks and pu-pus. The outdoor bar is beautiful at night!The hotel has no accomodation for people checking out hours before their departing flight. I had to check out of my room at noon, my flight did not leave until 9pm. Of course, they will store your bags, but there are no guest ammenities (shower, change rooms) other than the disgusting pool area. Never experienced that before! When I checked my bag at noon the bell guy was going òff duty`and rudely demanded a tip for checking my bags. He wasn`t even going to be there when I left, did nothing but put it on a trolley which was right next to me. This from a hotel that couldn`t get my luggage up the front stairs!!! Then I of course was expected to tip again when I collected my bags in the evening.The `mountainview`rooms are a view of the highrises completely surrounding the Ilikai - I was on the 23rd floor and could make out about 3 inches of mountain. Whatever. It was cheap.The bed was the most uncomfortable bed I have slept in for a very long time. I asked for and received feather pillows to replace the horrible rock-hard foam things that were on the bed when I arrived. That improved my sleep somewhat.Anyway, as the review title implies, You get What You Pay For.The Modern (which bizarrely is also an Aqua resort), right next door, is absolutely gorgeous - sleek, up-to-date, friendly and about the same price. In fact, I spoke to 2 couples who paid lessat the Modern with an Ocean Front room than I did for a Mountainview at the Ilikai .BTW - the Aqua across the street, the Palms, is even nastier than the Ilikai.

We stayed in the condo at the hotel in room 1227. It is cheaper to book this condo which is part of the hotel through an agency rather than book a room at the hotel.it has a kitchen, good bathroom, large double bed and a sofa bed which worked well for us 3 ladies. You just have a code to het into your room. You enjoy all the facilities of the hotel as well. The view is of the marina and beyond. A large room and large balcony. We would stay here again if in Hawaii. Just a short walk to the big Moana mall, and stores to pick up supplies just across the road. It is a short walk down to the lagoon and beach. This end of Waikiki you are away from the crowds.

The Illikai location is great, however, the owners are not very welcoming at the pool. They are very elderly and have been sitting at the same table by the pool for decades so heaven forbid if a tourist inadvertently takes their table. This happened to my husband and me. We had gone down early, took a table and then went to grab a coffee. We came back to fins a surly old man at our table with all his gear, walker and bad mood at our table. Rather than fight with him, we left. Also, don't rent from Oceanfrontvacation.com, Scott does not really care about what happens with your room following renting. We had some issues with our room, dirty, dirty, dirty! I emailed him as the room did not stand up to the on line advert. He was not helpful. Room 2130 needs the owners to get in there and clean up the place. I most likely would not stay here again. Hawaii is beautiful.

I really wanted to give this hotel a great review. If you're a fan of the old Hawaii 5-0, you've seen this hotel. It's the one Steve McGarrett is standing on as the picture zooms onto him as he's looking off the penthouse suite's 26th floor deck. The new 5-0 does the same scene in it's opening credits.I do want to preface my review with the fact I only stayed here one night. That was the plan from the start. I did not leave due to the hotel.Ilikai does have some very good points. The staff I encountered was great. Helpful to a fault. My wife and I arrived late and the chef was willing to make us food even though the kitchen had been closed for nearly 1/2 hour. The bar and front desk staff were very nice. All of the staff rated far better than some hotels I've stayed at in Hawaii and elsewhere.My wife and I stayed in the Ilikai in January of 2013, The room I was in 2412, was very large. The view was much nicer than most, with a triple sliding door that opened to a very large lanai. I had a view of Diamond Head, the lagoon by the Hilton and the ocean. The bathroom was also very large, with both a tub and a shower. There was also a little kitchenette area. All this was very nice.The location of the hotel is good. It's a short walk to get to the beach (by the Hilton). Not much more than three city blocks. You can opt for the lagoon, which would be nice if you have small children. No waves and not crowded. Shopping and restaurants are close by.The cost was very affordable, just over $200 including all taxes and fees. Free wifi was a plus.Not for the not-so-good. The air conditioner is on the side of the room as the bed. I directed the flow of air away from the bed as best I could, but my wife and I both woke up with sore throats from the cool, dry air. If you like cold air on you during the night, this might be a plus.The was also a "mystery noise" that came from somewhere in our room by the door. I never figured this noise out, but it was enough to wake me several times during the night.The nasty part was the shower. It had not been cleaned well and somebody had wiped their nose and then wiped the shower wall. I had to clean this with toilet paper, as the hotel gave us only one towel, hand towel and wash cloth each. I didn't tell my wife or she would never had showered. My towel had some stains on it, which always grosses me out. Again, the wife got the "clean" towel. Finally, there was a green substance on the lower rim of the sink. Unless you bent down close to the level of the sink you wouldn't see it, but I did. Again, my wife didn't hear about this either.All of these bad things could be an anomaly, as I stated, I only stayed here one night.
