I have no doubt the staff would have corrected these shortcomings, but I didn't bother them as I wasn't coming back.The hotel is dated - it was built in the 60s. It looks it's age. I could have overlooked all of this and given the hotel a 4 or even a 5 because of the staff's helpfulness and friendliness, and the great value of the hotel. But I can't overlook the lack of cleanliness. It was really nasty and I expect more from any hotel.

My family and I stayed there for 10 days during Christmas 2012. The location is good because it's near the beach and a convenient store - ABC. the partial ocean view was great. However, during our stay, a number of people and us got stuck in an elevator a few times. Two elevators were not working properly. The water was constantly dripping from the shower head. The air conditioner was very noisy. The sliding door to the balcony was so tight and heavy. I hurt my hands and wrist every time I had to open and close the door. The sofa bed was probably older than the aging hotel. The mattress was sagging, hard and very squeaky.

This hotel has an excellent location and great ocean access. We had an ocean view room and it was wonderful (worth the extra few bucks). The staff is great and very helpful. The grill downstairs has good food and is as a great food option. This hotel is within walking distance to everything.

I stayed at the Illikai in mid-January for 3 nights. I had a great view of the ocean and harbor from the 25th floor. For the price, it was overall a great deal and I would certainly recommend it to anyone going to Waikiki.
user_name:
Ben G
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: Great location for public transportation, walking and services. Near parks, shopping and restaurants. Staff, valet parking and housekeeping were helpful and courteous. Housekeeper, Clarita, was exceptionally accommodating and honest.

These comments are regarding the Bar & Grill. Ever since it changed to Da Big Kahuna staff in early 2012, the quality of service, attitude, food, and atmosphere has decreased 100%. The girls working there dress (AND ACT) more like strippers than waitresses. The majority of them have absolutely NO service industry skills; i.e., walking past customers 3-4 times before acknowledging them, joking at the bar with their boyfriends that visit instead of checking on their customers, and forgetting parts of the order. These girls will tell you that they prefer working at Da Big Kahuna bar because that's where the tips are. They say NONE of them want to work at the Ilikai bar & grill and their work performance makes this painfully obvious. At any given time, 3-6 of the 10 bar stools are occupied by waitresses/waiters taking breaks, getting extremely drunk after work, or watching TV before work. They should not be taking up the barstools on their breaks. I witnessed a family walk out when a half-naked waitress with her foot on the bar, who said she had finished her shift, was drunk and eating sloppily at the bar, who then leaned her head back and let out a huge belch. Not only didn't the manager or barmaid tell her to leave, they laughed along with her and kept feeding her shots. I've seen several waitresses finish their shift and get sloppy drunk at the bar, using loud profanity and rude mannerisms. Although they are off-duty, they continuously walk behind the bar to pour themselves shots and other drinks. A couple of weeks ago, one of the bartenders was drinking with the Ilikai security lead, and he had several personal mini bottles of alcohol lined up on the bar that they proceeded to drink with mixers from behind the bar. I've seen the Ilikai security lead and other Ilikai security staff drinking with the bar & grill staff on more than one occasion. I am a Security Manager, so I understand how unprofessional this is and how much liability it creates for the Ilikai hotel. As a final note, the local musicians they bring in to play should be stopped. Their wires are all over the place, they are in the way, and their amps are either too loud or sound blown. Families want to hear themselves talk when they eat there and people at the bar (when they can wrestle a stool away from the staff) want to watch the televisions. I understand they are trying to create a Hawaiian ambience, but people on vacation already know they're in Hawaii and I believe would rather eat without having their eardrums tortured. The bar & grill had much better service, better food, and was more family oriented under the previous owners.

Stayed at the Ilikai this month and enjoyed the experience. After living in Hawaii for a number of years and now returning as a tourist the Ilikai is a very familiar landmark . It has been there since the early 60's. Room renovations ongoing at the property. We got rooms which had recently been renovated and were quite comfortable. We were on upper floor and had delightful views of the Ala Wai yacht harbor, Ala Moana Park and the mighty blue Pacific. It is located at the entrance to Waikiki and not in the heart of things. However it is within walking distance of Ala Moana shopping center ( which they tout as the worlds largest outdoor mall), as well as many great restaurants (the food court at Ala Moana has something for everyone - check it out). The huge Hilton Hawaiian Village complex is right next door with a bunch of food and beverage outlets ranging from fast food to luau's, fireworks every Friday night, Hawaiian music, shopping bazaar, sunset sails, water toys, and the list goes on. On the other side of the Ilikai is The Modern Hotel with Morimoto's, Red Lobster, Outback and across the street is McDonalds. Within two blocks there are Italian, Thai, Indian, Japanese, Chinese and just about any ethnicity you would like. Parking is expensive ($25/day) but there is a convenient trolley that goes throughout Wakiki about every 40 min. for a nominal fare. All in all a good deal with clean, comfortable rooms and public spaces . check it out - or rather -- Check in!

the Ilikai Hotel was the perfect stay for the week before the Christmas holiday. The location is super, alittle out of the way of the mass of Waikiki hotels. There's a beautiful walkway along the beach that leads in front of the other hotels. The deck of the Ilikai overlooks a marina and is just plain gorgeous and so restful. As it is so easy to get around the island it was a bonus to have a bus stop right in front of the hotel. My stay was just plain perfect.

everyone is so friendly and they go out of their way to make you feel: SpecialWe stayed on a high floor for 3 weeks last November and found the location of the Ilikai was great for walking the beach and shopping --then this year we spent several days just before Christmas and we had the same excellent service and friendships as we celebrated our 50th anniversaryPlanning to return again C&D Texas

We stayed at the Ilikai while attending a conference at the Hawaiian Hilton Village, which worked out perfectly. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. We arrived a few hours early and they were able to put us in a great ocean view room high on the 23rd floor. The housekeeping staff (same woman each day) was wonderful and friendly -- not only did she do a great job cleaning, but did some extra small things that we really appreciated. The rooms were large and very bright, and the balconies are huge. The price of the hotel room was about $220 incl. per night, and included free high speed wifi, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, beach towels and beach chairs. Although the hotel is not located directly on the beach (the marina is right in front), there is easy access to the beach and lagoon in front of the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The only downside was noise. First, a group of young adult/adolescent basketball players were in rooms around us and above us and one night were partying loudly on their balcony from 1:00 until 2:30 when I finally called security. The young people were so loud that there was no way that security could not hear them if they were checking the halls and patrolling outside. Second, the hotel seems to be doing some work on the grounds all day long, which meant if you were in your room, you could hear jack hammers and other such loud construction noise.Otherwise, we really enjoyed staying at this hotel, preferred the location (close to Ala Moana shopping center, as well as Ala Moana park), and felt that it provided a good value for the money. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.As an aside, having stayed at both the Ilikai and the Hyatt on this trip, and visiting a friend in their room at the Hilton Hawaiian Village (Diamond Head Tower), it seems that the high-end hotels here are not as swank as you might find on the mainland or in other major cities in the world. All the bathrooms were small and outdated, although some a little better than others. It would be important to set your expectations when you come to Hawaii, if you're used to more modern and updated hotels!

The Ilikai seems to be a bit older hotel, but it is still nice and pretty clean. We had booked 2 nights originally but my wife came down with food poisoning from a restaurant and couldn't fly the next day. Thanks to the help of the staff we were able to book another room for cheaper than my travel agent could. The staff was very friendly and efficient, specifically Chester at the front desk. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a room with full kitchen. Not sure why but we took it anyways. The rooms are very spacious. The second room (w/o a kitchen) we were put in was actually more open and had a bigger bathroom, which I think we would of preferred to have originally but oh well. The only thing I would of wanted differently is to have central AC. The AC units are mounted high on the walls and have a remote (which is pretty cool) but don't seem as efficient. Overall a great stay, minus the food poisoning.

We(Wife and I) spent a total of three nights, two nights in a row interrupted by a one day stay up north, then back down to Ilikai for one night. Both check ins went smoothly and they even worked hard to get us in our rooms with early check-in at no extra charge. The hotel staff, from front desk to baggage room to cleaning staff were all seemingly happy, professional and helpful. Our rooms had exceptional views of the beach and ocean, the balconies were huge, lots of room. Our rooms were very clean and well kept. The location of the hotel itself was perfect for our needs, dinning and shopping is all near by. This was our first trip ever to Honolulu and we strongly suggest staying at the Ilikai Hotel. In our opinion, this was one of our best "bang for our buck".

This is our 3rd visit to the Ilikai and I can't speak highly enough of the staff, the location and the rooms. This end of Waikiki is far more pleasant and relaxing. I like the closeness to Ala Moana Mall, walking in the evening by the Marina is quite lovely. Transport right at the door, trolleys and The Bus. 6 elevators plus the bathing means you never wait too long. The foyer and grounds are well maintained and security is always on hand. Well priced, clean and good position. I look forward to my next visit.

This is a privately owned condo, the room itself was very spacious and great ocean views but it can do with and major update. I think the oven was back in the 70s but still works. Overall we enjoyed the location with the lagoon for swimming and beach there too. We were situated between Main Waikiki Beach and Ala Moana Shopping Centre (15min walk for both).

Lovely view from level 25 overlooking beach. Very affordable. Great to amble along beach walk to Waikiki through beach and park. Relaxing and very friendly hotel. Easy walk also to Ala Moana shopping centre. Valet staff arrange shttle to DFS and to meet transfer to Waikele Discount stores. Pool a little cramed but OK and foyer impressive.

I've always wanted to stay at the Ilikai. Right on the trolley line, next to a great spot on Waikiki beach, and just 2 blocks from Ala Moana Shopping Center, it's an ideal place to enjoy a few days of O'ahu before heading home. My mountain view room wasn't ready when I checked in, so they upgraded me to a kitchenette suite on the 22nd floor with a great city view. Kitchen was fully stocked with clean dishes, pans and silverware, and the bed was very comfy. Air conditioning was tricky to figure out, and kind of noisy. The hotel has multiple stores inside for all your needs. There's a McDonalds right across the street if you don't want to spend bank on a restaurant meal. Wi-fi worked pretty well as far as free wi-fi goes. There is only valet parking at this hotel, and it's $25 a day, very spendy. Still, I had a great stay here, very comfortable, and would return again.

After reviewing lots of places, I decided to stay here again for my second visit to Honolulu, just because I like the location. Its away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Waikiki which might not suit everyone but suited me. I rented privately this time and was happy with the experience. The room was clean and well looked after and overlooked the marina with an ocean view as well. The hotel was quiet, despite being I suspect full because of the Marathon during the time I was staying. It is an easy 10 minute walk to the Ala Moana Centre which was perfect for me as I went there on a number of days and the bus stop right outside the door was convenient for the days I went to visit Diamond Head and the Iolani Palace (across the road for the one). There is a convenience shop in the foyer, perfect for simple meals and snacks, It's about 15 minutes walk to the main area downtown. The beach is right out the back entrance and around the corner.

Hotel in excellent location near shopping, most tours and buses were found out front. Staff was excellent and rooms were clean. Smaller hotel next to Hawiian Village. Excellent cafe outside facing beach and yauht basin. Hawaii 50 show was filmed there during visit.Excellent booking of tours, had front row center seat at Polynesian Show( get Ambassador package).

Centrally located to everything and yet very quiet; you don't need a car; the pictures you see is exactly what you'll experience; very clean rooms; a room safe included; a lovely lanai with the ocean at your fingertips; booking our tours with the hotel concierge was very convenient; the friendly bar/grill at the hotel for casual eating was great and having a lovely restaurant on the top floor for a more romantic experience was a bonus. The staff make you feel at home. There are no surprises here just a fantastic place to stay. We'll be back!!!!

This was our first trip to Oahu. We arrived Dec 1 and stayed until Dec 12. As this was my 50th birthday, i had a whole Hawaii Five-0 theme going for the trip. :-) So it was quite exciting to find out this was the hotel where the opening sequence of Jack Lord from the orginal Hawaii Five-0 series was filmed. We had planned to stay at the hotel for 2 days and then rent a camper van to drive to the North Shore and camp for 5 days before returning to Waikiki for the final 3 days of our trip. Unfortunately, the camper van rental did not turn out but we were able to extend our stay at The Ilikai. The staff was great at accomodating us and we really enjoyed the hotel. It was clean and had a fantastic retro feel to it. The rooms were spacious. We stayed on different sides of the hotel after having to extend our stay. Both sides had views that were equally as beautiful. We enjoyed coffee on the lanai, used the fitness facitliy, walked to the mall, beaches and the military museum. Great value and history.

We stayed at the Ilikai for 11 nights from the end of November 2012. I was expecting quite a good hotel and I wasn't disappointed! Large rooms with everything we needed and a gorgeous lanai with ocean views made our morning coffee all the more wonderful. Check in was a breeze, we booked a tour with the concierge which was easy and cheaper than on line and we ate at both restaurants. The Grill was pretty good - decent food and service. However Sarentos was AMAZING and SO reasonably priced!! We couldn't believe how gorgeous the restaurant was even though we knew it was a Top 50. We went there for our wedding night dinner and they really looked after us.The convenience store downstairs was excellent and there is an ABC Store, McDonalds, Subway and Red Lobster all within a 2 minute walk.The walkway along the beach is gorgeous and a wonderful way to get to the main drag of Waikiki. Ala Moana Shopping Centre is a convenient 10 minute walk in the other direction. We hired a car and parked behind the hotel for about $10 for the night.Great hotel, wonderful restaurants, excellent location, large clean rooms - what's not to love?!We WILL be back!

Valet staff were very friendly and helpful, they even helped us find a coffee shop nearby for a super late night snack! We needed to print some stuff out to return a shipment, and the lobby staff helped us out with that too. Really appreciated the free wifi at virtually anywhere in the hotel.Very nice views and very spacious room! Can only imagine what better views there might be in the other wing. Though surrounded by other tall hotels where we were, we got a nice opening (view) of the beach, and the nearby pools; you can even watch nearby performances (music/dance) from your balcony. Great air conditioning, very clean.

the valet staff and bellboy were very helpful and friendly. the $25/day parking is way too expensive. overall, i liked the hotel and its services such as beach chairs, towels, fast internet, and spacious pretty lobby. the only complaint i have is the lady at the front counter was NOT nice at all. if you want someone to represent your hotel and treat your customers right, either you train them well or hire the right people. she was the only reason i did not like my stay here. other than that, i liked the view in my super spacious room (ocean view)!

There is a difference between the hotel itself (an Aqua property) and those units that are rented by a condo clearing house, so be clear that this a review of the hotel. We stayed in a room on the 23rd floor with a view of the Hilton complex and Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon. The room was spacious and easily acccomodated a roll-away for our son (which was a sturdy unit that felt more like a real bed than the more commonly used type that looks and feels like a rat trap set to spring). We booked here when we discovered the Hilton was pretty much booked and whose rates had become astronomical (we are locals who just wanted to stay a few days in town). We were pleasantly surprised at every turn (and after having a single, mobbed with people, stroll through the Hilton at 10pm, relieved by our choice). Great room with beautiful views of the ocean. The staff we dealt with, from the front desk to the valet, were all very pleasant people. Our roll-away was delivered within minutes of our arrival. While our unit did not have a mini-kitchen, it did have a fridge and microwave (what more do you really need?). A coffee maker with no charge for coffee, free wifi, and a local newspaper every morning (even on Sunday! Thank you Ilikai!!) rounded things out and NO resort charge. With five elevators, access to our high-floor room was convenient in a way that often isn't. We had a great experience without so much as a single gripe. It was the weekend before Christmas and one of the reasons we had wanted to stay in town was to check out all the Christmas decorations at other hotels. We were very surprised to find that the Ilikai had the best decorations of the many we visited (sadly, the Moana and Hilton seemed to have scaled back considerably). The Ilikai has a small garden area in the lobby that was full of lights and decorations that made it a warm and festive area to stroll through. The Ilikai is within quick walking distance of Ala Moana Shopping Center and has access via a ramp to the lagoon area and Hilton beach. The only thing that disappointed was the lack of a hot tub in the pool area (but this is sort of personal quirk of mine; most Waikiki hotels lack them, for whatever reason). We will stay here again in the future.

Ilikai’s location at the North end of Waikiki Beach makes up for any of its shortcomings. We really enjoyed walking down boardwalk and peeking into the other hotels lining the beach. It’s a pricey area in general, but there are some less expensive restaurants within easy walking distance.  As many other reviewers have noted, the rooms are spacious with mini-kitchens. We only used the coffee maker and refrigerator, but appreciated that we could heat something up if we wanted to. The convenience store on the ground level of the Ilikai was a pleasant surprise. It has a decent selection of food/beverages and sundries. While high, the prices weren’t as outrageous as we expected, particularly on alcohol. We rented a convertible from Alamo (just across the street) and had a really great time driving around the island for two days. The hotel concierge got us a better rate for the rental than we could find online. The roads are easy to navigate and the island very manageable in size. It takes less than an hour to reach the opposite side of the island where there are long stretches of lovely beach. Don’t miss the great offerings of the roadside fruit stands and food trucks. For $12 you get a big plate of garlic shrimp or hulu chicken with rice and salad. Outstanding eats at a fraction the cost of most things in Honolulu. The Ilikai’s pool area is nothing to get excited about, but it’s nice for taking a quick dip after a day exploring the island. I suppose it’s because of the congested high-priced land on Waikiki that none of the hotels have the massive resort-style pool areas that you find on other islands. Again, the Ilikai’s pool is perfectly adequate for a quick, refreshing dip—just don’t expect to be happy lounging beside it for hours on end (that would get depressing). We particularly appreciated having access to the pool and changing rooms after we checked out on the last day. We had an evening departure out of HNL so were glad to have a place to freshen up before our 8 hour flight. I would definitely stay at the Ilikai the next time I go to Honolulu—excellent location, nice views from the rooms (especially higher floors), decent restaurants, and a really friendly, helpful staff.

Condo was true to picture. It was very clean and met our expectations. There even had items for the beach like mats and sand pail. there was a city view, spectacular lights at night and rainbows in the morning.FYI, there was no dishwasher, which did not bother us. There was no clearning service, but extra towles and bedsheets were provided.

We stayed at the Ilikai for four nights in December in a mountain view hotel room on the 24th floor. Whilst not a good as a ocean view room, this was cheaper, and actually a great view at night. The room was very large and comfortable. Wifi access was free - and the reception/speed was one of the best we had during our month long trip.The only minus would be the bathroom, which was a little dated and in need of a revamp.The hotel is in a good location - a short walk to Ala Moana shopping centre a few steps from the beach, and a few minutes from the main section of Waikiki. The pool area is tucked away so we did confuse the Mondern's for ours on the first night. Both were lovely!The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here againOur highlights from our stay in Hawaii would have to be Pearl Harbour and the USS Arizona Memorial (a must do in Honolulu) and driving around the island - a visit to the North Shore is a must.

Stayed at the hotel from Dec 3 to Dec 7, 2012. The hotel was great, staff very friendly and close to all amenities. Was able to watch a filming of the Hawaii 5-0 TV series in the hotel lobey. Will definitely make the Ilikai a stay on the next trip.

Ilikai Condos were central, clean and on a quiet street. Our condo was spacious and all needs taken care of like beach chairs, a medium sized esky, everything in the kitchen.It is an older style condo but at least it was clean. Convenient to hotel facilities..restaurant, bars, coffee shop,small deli, valet parking for $25/day saved us parking fee and walking to and fro, parking transport out the front.

We had a great stay at the Ilikai. Awesome ocean views, great location with access to transit, easy walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center, nice walk to central Waikiki. Lots of great shops, restaurants, and bars within steps of the front door. Fast elevators, 3 minutes to the lovely beach. Very reasonable and convenient bellhop luggage service for storing those pesky bags on your last day, they'll arrange for your shuttle to the airport as well. The outdoor bar and grill was just the place to unwind and grab a tasty bite at the end of your action packed day in Oahu. Very nice pool and deck, just a shame they close at 7pm. This grand hotel will celebrate it's 50th birthday next year but she's kept her style with modern finishes and fixtures. Can't wait to get back. Aloha!

We stayed at the Ilikai on the 14th September 2012. The room was exactly as described. Older style but renovated and fresh inside. The kitchen was ample for our needs and the fridge was certainly large enough. Cooling was adequite but the room we were in, Room 2012, was next to some ventilator shaft which was quite noisy. We stayed there for 10 nights and got "used" to the noise by the time we left. It isn't a relection of what the other rooms are like at all. The bathroom was clean and we were amazed to find a toilet plunger in the corner. We wondered why, until... the toilet flooded over and over. It was quite disgusting to say the least. I have never seen a plunger in a room before and management said that we must've put something in that we shouldn't have. I can assure you that we didn't (other than the obvious) and I do believe it must be a common problem so to have a plunger in the first place. Luckily it only happened once. Would I stay there again? Probably not in the same room (the noise issue). Probably not at the Ilikai as I would like to try other resorts a little closer to the centre of Honolulu. For the price and the accomodation, I recommend it and hope you don't have plumbing issues.The Motel is truly grand and has a 5 star feel about it. The staff are lovely and helpful. It is close to many restaurants and has public transport right in front.

We had just returned from a 7 day NCL cruise of the islands and decided to spend a restful night before flying back to PA the next day. Since there was 4 adults sharing this suite, I was fearful that it would be cramped with all of us and our luggage. I was surprised by the spaciousness and the large balcony to enjoy the views of the marina and the ocean. I would definitely stay longer next time. The restaurant and the bar were beautiful. We accidentally used the pool next door instead of the Ilikai's (which looked very nice) but after tipping the pool attendant for replacing the soft terry cloth lounge chair covers we decided to stay and enjoy the salt water pool and bar. It was an honest mistake that we made the best of.

This is a great hotel for all ages. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and spacious,with a coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator and safe in room. Stayed on the 23rd floor, good views of Diamond Head and downtown, also beach if looked sideways. It is a little worn in places and the bathrooms though very clean could be refurbished. The ground floor restaurant was good value for the money. This hotel is at the very beginning of Waikiki and away from the hustle and bustle, which was great. We had a great time there.

The Ilikai ia on the marina where "Gilligan" left for that fateful 3 hour tour.. The condo suites are fully self contained with a full kitchen, granite countertops, and large balcony, rooms are nicely furnished. The staff is friendly and accommodating, beautiful pool area, close to beach and just a short walk to the heart of Waikiki Beach, shopping, dining, and entertainment.

The Ilikai Hotel has been operating in Hawaii as far as I remember. Remember the opening scene of the original Hawaii Five O. This place is great, look at the size of the rooms, they are simple,basic but is enough to feel comfortable and relaxed. The staff are really friendly, and you feel secure staying in this Hotel. The Ilikai Hotel has done some remodelling which has made the hotel even better. My family really enjoys staying in this Hotel.

We booked our hotel rooms from a major US travel website. We stayed on the 20th floor with a full kitchen, microwave, refridge and a sofa bed. All the furnishing has modern flavor, granite counter top in kitchen and bathroom. The room is clean. Room service will pick up garbage and replace towel daily but they only did our bed for one day. Not sure if this is a standard with this hotel. We liked the full kitchen so we can save money on eat out. The room is a little bit crammed with 4 people especially there is no separate sleeping area. Living and sleeping is in one common area. There is no dinning table so you have to use the coffee table. The hotel staff was very friendly and they also offer beach towels which you can get from the office. Some tips:- the hotel is next to Hilton Village. You can walk over there to watch Friday night firework and also go in to take the beach walk and use lagoon. Hilton also has boat rental which is convenient.- the hotel charges cancellation fee as soon as you book. (at least at the website we booked) We noticed that the price kept dropping. By the time we are ready to go, it is almost dropped more than 150 dollars for a 4 night stay. We didn't pay attention to the cancellation penalty when we first booked. Even with the penalty, we still got some money back after the re-book. Be aware.- Across street, you have McDonald and Subway. Trolly and free shuttle to Hilo shopping center can pick up in front of the hotel. Ala Mona Shopping center is not far away.- We didn't park at the hotel. We used the parking near Modern for the first day, which is 20 dollars. Then used the free parking behind the hotel during the daytime ( Maximum 6 hours). At night, we either use the hourly parking next to the free parking, which costs 6 dollars for 10 hours on weekdays or at the parking near Modern using their 7 dollars for 10 hours rate at night. It works out for us. Save quite a bit money.

Our room at the Ilikai was clean, spacious, and comfortable. There is also a refrigerator and microwave, which were added bonuses so we could save some money on eating out. We had a view of Diamondhead and the city, very pretty at night. The beach is less than a 5 minute walk and about 15 mins from the International Market and Waikiki Beach Walk. If you don't want to walk, the trolley stops right in front of the hotel-$2/person/one way. The restauant in the hotel is reasonably priced with good food. There is also a little store in the hotel,decent prices, but save some money and go to one of the numerous ABC stores within walking distance. The Hilton is right next door, with restaurants and shops (prices are definitely jacked up, but the pizza place was reasonable)-you must try the local ice cream at Lappert's. The hotel also provides beach towels, so save room in your suitcase. Free wi-fi. Overall, a very nice hotel.

Recently had the opportunity to return to Hawaii for a very special occasion and again stayed at the Ilikai Hotel.The remodelling had added more charm and warmth to this elder statesman of Hawaiian Hotels. Yes built in over 40 years ago but its in a great location water,shopping,transport and now a great range of in building stores.I have stayed there several times as I believe if you find a great place backed by always great service from friendly staff from Concierge, house keeping, front desk and all in between lead by their general manager Mr Terry Dowsett, why go anywhere else? They make it feel like home away from home.Beds are super comfortable.Will be back again next trip.

we enjoyed staying in this warm and well maintained hotel. the facility's in the room are simple and basic but they are enough to feel comfortable and relaxed. the shower is too basic and need renewing. the kitchen is nice and practice. the balcony is big with a nice view of the marina. overall we really liked the hotel.

“...`O ka hali`a aloha i hiki mai ke hone a`e nei i ku`u manawa = Sweet memories come back to me bringing fresh remembrances of the past...” The Ilikai hotel was as we expected – great. It has been a special place for me since 1983, when I was a Honolulu resident. I used to come for the special weekend radio broadcast breakfasts at the Top of Ilikai with Larry Price and Michael Perry. Then, twenty six years ago I met my husband at the Ilikai and since then we have visited Ilikai many times. This has been our comeback after fifteen years (I flew 24 hours from Europe for a week stay, my husband joined me from Australia) on the occasion of our 25th Wedding Anniversary. For that reason I have booked far in advance a room in our favourite Ilikai Tower with the Marina View and was quite disappointed to get a Diamond Head View instead. The next day we were able to move to the room with the desired view, where we stayed the following eight nights. Apart from this unnecessary hiccup everything was wonderful. We will be back again, the feeling of Ilikai has still that same old magic, - like us, it hasn’t lost its Aloha spirit at all.

Room was nicely decorated, upscale furnishings, spacious and quite clean. Having a separate shower from the bathtub was a nice plus. Wifi was free! We had a King room with an ocean view. Bed was pretty comfortable although a bit bouncy (when one person would turn over the other was "bounced" around a bit. Also there was a bit of music noise from outside but, earplugs more than did the job to cover up the sound. Maintenance was very prompt when my parents (in another room) miskeyed their safe & locked their belongings in it accidentally. The bellmen were outstanding. Overall we would highly recommend and definitely return here again!

The Ilikai isn’t your typical hotel. Portions of it are traditional hotel and portions are privately owned condos. We were visiting with family and each person reserved something different. Normally I would give the Ilikai 3 stars but will give it 4 today because it has so many options.We had a traditional hotel room, reserved through the Ilikai. It was a basic 2 doubles room with an ocean view. The room itself was quite large and there was plenty of room to move around. We did not get a room with a kitchen. The view was remarkable and it was great to sit on the balcony in the morning and drink coffee or watch the sunset in the evening. A man goes out onto the patio at sunset and blows a conch shell to signal the end of the day and we easily heard it in our room. The room could have used a little refreshing as far as décor went; it was bit dated and starting to show a bit of wear. The rooms were clean and bedding was fine, nothing spectacular. The staff was very friendly. While the hotel did offer free Wi-Fi, the ability to log on and do anything more than basic surfing/email checking was hit or miss. I tried to Facetime with some family on Thanksgiving Day and email a couple of photos (several times) and was unable to do either. The location is fine, the lagoon and beach is fine although we preferred to walk down the beach a bit for a less rocky area. Additionally, we chose to use the valet parking. Initially we were not excited about the $25/day cost and family members raved about the $10 spot they got at the Red Lobster down the street but after a day or two of walking to and fro and/or hunting for free parking it was universally decided that the convenience factor was well worth the cost. We did not go to the pool, it was small and basic we opted for the ocean instead. While there is access from the patio to the pool at the Modern next door, I was told Ilikai patrons were not permitted to use it.The Ilikai has a nice coffee shop and café downstairs. The food was reasonably priced and tasty. Additionally there was a drug store downstairs that we frequented on more than one occasion and I remarked that the prices were not as outrageous as I expected. There are a number of fast food options directly across the street as well as a wide variety of restaurants located next door at the Hilton.Two family members rented a room with a kitchen through Marina Hawaii Vacations. These are privately owned condo rooms and can vary widely. One was “economy” and the décor, appliances and furniture were all circa 1965. Marina Hawaii will admit that these rooms are not renovated. Another family member rented a partially renovated room that was a bit of a step up but still dated. Marina Hawaii has an office on the 2nd floor and manages many of the privately owned condos. These rooms consisted of a small kitchen, one or two double beds and a couch. They are the same size as the non-kitchen rooms, just more crammed into one area. We did have approximately 15 people in one room for dinner and it was crowded but we were able to move around fine.Another family member rented a room with a kitchen through VRBO. His room was fully renovated and was pretty nice. It included granite counter-tops and new stainless steel appliances as well as Wi-Fi that was more reliable. Again, because these are privately owned condos the condition and upkeep can vary widely. That room (along with the 2 above) were city views that overlooked Ala Moana Blvd. The rooms were quiet despite being on a busy street. We have yet another family member who owns a fully renovated condo and obviously is quite nice. That is a mountain/ocean view room. The view is of the Hilton next door, Diamond Head and the ocean. You can see the fireworks from the Hilton on Friday nights.Overall the Ilikai offers a lot of flexible options and a good but not great location. If you are looking for value, especially if you are staying for an extended period, this is an excellent choice. If you are looking for more of a “resort” type feel or luxury hotel this is probably not a good fit for you (unless you luck out on a VRBO room).

We spent four days at the Ilikai in Nov 2012. (definitely not long enough).We arrived early for check in, our room wasn't ready so the put us in one similar that was ready so as not to make us wait. (said they would just swap us over with another couple and the other couple would get our room when they arrived). Good service, didn't find that everywhere! The room was on 24th floor, absolutely fantastic - large with a nice sized balcony, a bar fridge, microwave and coffee maker and good size tv. The bed was very comfortable (and huge! King size.) We ate breakfast on the lanai (balcony) every morning and in the evenings sat watching the city lights after strolling back from dinner, mostly along the beach, sometimes through town and past the gardens - no bugs in sight! We didn't have a beach view but not complaining because the view of the city and the mountains was spectacular (especially at night).The bathroom was a very good size and there was a bath! which was much appreciated after our walk up Diamond Head. A shame that I had to clean it before I could use it as it still had scum around the inside from someone else's previous use, and the grout in the shower was alittle bit grotty. While we're on complaints, there was a really comfy armchair in the room,it would have been nice to have two of them since there were two of us. ( a toaster would have been nice too)  But I count those as only a few small complaints as overall we were happy. The location is great for going anywhere - the beach, lagoon, Diamond Head, A la Moana.Speaking of which - I'm not that much into the shopping b but it is a huge impressive shopping centre. I would have to say that Foodland was my favourite here, such a variety of salads, meats and fruitsalads, yogurts and drinks( bread we got from a great little bakery a couple of shops up). You can pick up something to warm up in the microwave to have in room if you want to stay in, or better still grab a pick-nick lunch to have on the beach or in a park, inexpensive and really good.We found all the meals we had were actually very good and good value. We managed to get into Dukes, also had dinner at Tropics, have fish Tacos at Maui Tacos, had lobster tail at the shrimp place in the international market food court, all excellent!Loved Cholo's in Waliewa too. Took the bus around the Island and stopped great food, great atmosphere. Trip well worth doing, had a great day and met nice people. It was recommended to us to get a 4 day bus pass and I agree. Just so much to do and enjoy. Great Coffee at Island Coffee, try one of their Acai Cups ,(breakfast , lunch or just a snack) you're in for a treat.Love all the entertainment, music everywhere you go.Love free WIFII at the Ilikai.Love the bus drivers.(The ones that are not just for the Japanese only!)Love the warm moonlit walks on the beach.Staff at the Ilikai helpful and friendly, location is perfect, wouldn't think of going anywhere else.

At the Ala Moana mall end of Waikiki so I could walk to the mall or head in the direction of the busier section of the beach. Friday evening fireworks behind the Hilton Hawaiian village were a great bonus.Liked the layout of our suite but it could have been better equipped. Yes, it was too noisy and too bright to sleep in but that's Waikiki!

Forty-seven years ago, I met my husband here on his R&R from Viet Nam. We had a week in Honolulu and stayed here. It was wonderful. Came back here yesterday to relive old memories. Unfortunately, it was hard to remember after so many years. (Ha!). Anyway, the hotel is very nice and not too big. The pool leaves something to be desired. The rooms were big and clean but could use a little updating, but still nice. We are with another couple and we are staying just two nights here and then off to Maui (which we have never been too). We would definitely come back to the Ilikai though.

We spent a week at the Ilikai in December 2011 - and have nothing but positive things to say about it! We booked an "Ocean View with Full Kitchen" room - upon arrival, we were placed in a room with marina views (meaning the only thing to be seen from the balcony were the masts of the boats in the marina, which wasn't our idea of an "ocean view"), but after requesting a room on a higher floor, we changed rooms the next day.The room was absolutely fantastic - larger than we expected with a nice sized balcony, a good kitchenette and nice living room area. The bed was very comfortable (and huge!) and we slept extremely well. We ate breakfast on the lanai (balcony) every morning and dinner there in the evenings - no bugs in sight!We divided most of our days between the A la Moana shopping center and the Hilton lagoon - first, 3 hours of shopping (the A la Moana is GREAT! Such a beautiful place with all the shops you can think of) and then relaxation by the lagoon. We went to the beach on the first day but then decided to go to the lagoon after that because the beach is not all that great - coarse sand and not too great views. The lagoon on the other hand was nice and relaxing, there were mostly families enjoying the area around the lagoon but it was actually a surprisingly calm place to sun bathe. The sand is coarse, but that doesn't really matter when you're lying on a beach towel anyway.The location is great for going anywhere - the beach, lagoon, Diamond Head, A la Moana...I would definitely recommend the Ilikai and would go back in a second!

We booked a room with a partial ocean view, looking out over the lagoon, we were high enough up (Rm 2528) that we had a view of Diamond Head as well.We've stayed there 4 times over the last 6 years and still love the hotel. New LCD TV's seemed to be the only upgrade and the upholstery on the chair was looking a bit tired as it has before.The staff were great and the rooms are always large (600 sq ft incl Lanai). So yes we will continue to go back to the Ilikai, as it's at the entrance to Waikiki, it's far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, so you have the choice of the Waikiki beach in one direction or the Ala Moana beach in the other direction (way quieter)We travelled in November but reserved in August, so the price was $152, the prices had gone up to ~$240 by the time we arrived for the same period.What can I say we liked it and will return.As an aside we flew from Bellingham on Alaska Airlines direct, price was great and service was great

We had a room with an ocean view (Marina). It has a nice size balcony with a table for two. Perfect for relaxing and viewing the sunset. The valet is $25/day, which isn't too bad since you have in and out privilege and the convenience. You would only save a few dollars if you park else where so it was not worth it for us. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the main Waikiki area at a moderate pace.I'm a light sleeper so the negative is the noise that we heard from our room:1) Our room was right next to the elevator, so we heard the elevator most of the night. The front desk was willing to move us to another room, but we opted not to since the other room doesn't have a nice view. 2) There was a loud ticking one of the nights. Don't know what it was, but it was very loud. Was too tired to do further investigation.3) We like to sleep with the balcony door open for the fresh air. The nuisance with that is our neighbors like to hang out in their balcony and talk very loudly. Again, we could have moved, but that would not guarantee a quiet neighbor.Overall, the hotel is fine for the price.
user_name:
CL_011610
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is very welcoming and definately shares the Aloha Spirit.From the greeting in the front driveway as we handed over our rental car right through to the room service staff everyone was wonderful.We had an ocean view room and it was massive.The large sliding doors opend onto a good sized balcony. the microwave int eh room was an added bonus.Alos liked the separate dressing room and 2 large wardrobe areas.

This is a two bedroom condo with a city view/part ocean view. We were not disappointed. Great condo, with fab views. Decent size lounge, bedrooms & bathrooms. Only problem we had was the beds. Very soft mattress in both rooms. My Sister & her Hubby had the main bedroom, and we had the other. This had a queen and a single bed. If someone moved the other person was bounced around. But it is a small price to pay for a great condo. A bit noisy with with the traffic. But it didn't bother us. Great kitchen. Short on glasses though. Had breakfast on lounge lanai as this had the morning sun. We like the location as not in the hub of Waikiki. Nice to be at quiet end. Hilton lagoon next door is so lovely. Friday night fireworks are very good. Will return for sure. Booked via Waikiki Ocean Front Rentals. (recommend)

This is an iconic landmark. The public areas have been updated nicely and celebrate the hotel's history. The rooms are spacious and have been nicely updated. An "ocean view" room may translate to a direct view of the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but a sliver of ocean is visible if you look to the right. Even so, it is a great value for the location. Some of the furnishings may be a bit worn (e.g. our sofa was a bit threadbare) but the beds and pillows are great. Very friendly and helpful staff.

The view was fantastic, and the price was right. We enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai. The privately owned condo we rented through homeaway.com was a real bargain. We were a party of three adults, and never ran out of things to do. Our condo on the 10th floor, had a view of the ocean, harbor, and Kahanamoku Hilton Lagoon. A birds eye view of the Friday night Waikiki fireworks, and a luau that took place nearly each night at the Hilton were also in view. Located at the beginning of Waikiki beach, we were close to the action, without being in the middle of it.Important info for your budget, the Ilikai has Valet Parking Only. You will want to keep that in mind for your vacation budget. We enjoyed the service.There is other paid parking, a block or so off the property, if you don't mind the walk.

We stayed at the Ilikai Hotel for 10 days prior to our cruise. Our room on the 22nd Floor had a lovely view over the beach and the Hilton Lagoon. The room and lanai were huge. Housekeeping did an excellent job each day. We really appreciated the powder room off the bathroom and the desk.There were several ABC stores within a minutes walk and the hotel was right on the trolley stop. We booked several tours through the tour desk and found them very helpful. We caught the trolley to Waikiki most nights and walked back along the beach. The coffee shop downstairs was excellent value. We took the glass elevator up to Sorento's for sunset cocktails and the view was outstanding.

I chose the Ilikai because I am a (Jack Lord) Hawaii Five-0 fan. I also found that the rates and what the Ilikai offered were better than most other hotels so it was a win-win.My husband and I and our two boys (ages 3 and 1) stayed at the Ilikai from November 1 to 10, 2012. We had a room on the 23rd floor with a view of the ocean and the yacht harbor. I really enjoyed the location as it was not in the middle of everything so it was quieter, yet we were right next door to Waikiki Beach and Ala Moana shopping center. The Honolulu Harbor was very close and we were close to downtown too. Not to mention that the Ilikai is one of the stops for the trolleys that go by so often. Oh and Wailana Coffee House is across the street from Hilton Hawaiian Village and it is open 24 hours, serving breakfast all day. The staff were very friendly and the location was very convenient.The hotel entrance consists of a staircase and to the right of that is an escalator. There is a small elevator further to the right that is for luggage and strollers.When we checked in the lady at the front desk was a little flighty. She said we had booked a "veteran's" rate. It was late and I booked the room months ago. All I could remember was that I used whatever code the system online would allow. She told me that to use this rate we would have to write a letter to a veteran. I didn't quite understand, but writing a letter to a veteran was not difficult so I did it and presented it the day before we checked out. Also when my husband checked out, the total hotel charges were LESS than the amount from the online reservation.With two little kids, we got a room with two double beds. I am used to sleeping on a 6-year-old Serta mattress with a lumpy pillowtop. So these beds and pillows at the Ilikai were HARD and thin. My husband commented on it too. Even though they were hard, they gave you three per bed and we were able to prop them here and there to sleep and, we slept exceptionally well. The hotel provided a rollaway crib for our baby, free of charge. The crib was all metal and looked more like a cage than a crib, but it was free and saved us from renting or bringing our Pack and Play.The view was spectacular. We could see the ocean, the yacht club in front of it as well as the Honolulu Harbor to the far right. I could actually see cruise ships in port. If you looked down you had a good view of the pool and hotel grounds. On the first Friday, we took advice from another Trip Advisor review and got pizza from Round Table at the Hilton and took in the Hilton fireworks. I would say we were able to see them, but not all of it. On our last Friday we walked down the ramp and stood along the Hilton Lagoon to watch them which was much better. Also the pizza from Round Table is average, at best. I almost think we could have done better getting pizza at the Ilikai Bar & Grille and saved the walking.The room was equipped with a mini fridge (which got a lot of use as storage for juice for the little ones), a coffee maker, and microwave oven. There is a small safe in the closet as well as an ironing board and hair dryer. There were also a few hangers and dry cleaning supplies. The closet in the bathroom area had a luggage stand and a few hangers. We only had a tub/shower stall, not separate as in some reviews. It was big enough for our two boys to bathe in. The shower head was Water Pik and it provided very good water pressure. The outside showed some signs of wear - possibly mildew or just cracking. It didn't bother me too much to investigate.Bathroom amenities were body soap and hand soap; coconut lime shampoo and conditioner, and coconut mango lotion, all exclusively for Aqua Hotels.Being so high up and with the two little kids, I would have liked to had some netting for the lanai. They probably would have provided it, but we didn't ask. We just held onto the 1-year-old when we were out there. The 3-year-old knew better than to climb or try to fit through the bars. I had read the hotel was grandfathered and that the bars are too far apart - this is certainly true. I know my 26" tall, 25 lb 15-month-old could have gone through them, had he been allowed to try.The lanai has a small table and two chairs. The air conditioner makes a lot of noise when running on the lanai. Sadly the sun is so hot you can't really sit out there during the day, unless you like it that hot. It would have been wonderful to have a locking screen door to feel the trade winds when it was so hot as there was always a wonderful breeze. For those of you with little ones, check out my picture regarding the lock on the lanai. I brought baby locks with me because I was unsure of what the door was like. It is a strong metal hook, kind of like an upside down "U," but it is at least 5' high. It was well above my 3-year-old's head. However, when my husband went to get take out and I was doing laundry down the hall, I did not feel safe enough to leave them alone in the room while I went to get the laundry. Thoughts of my 3-year-old taking the desk chair to the lock or my 1-year-old knocking down the lamp and starting a fire were in my head. So I brought them with me. Note: Parents please be safe. Don't leave your kids alone for a second. Kids are capable of anything and anything can happen.Our housekeeper, God bless her soul, was great. As far as trashing hotel rooms, our two boys have NOTHING on rock stars. :-) I was glad I had my baby wipes with me because they went a long way to cleaning up stains on the bed linens, which were all WHITE. We did our best not to track in so much sand and to keep the room as clean as we could, but she did a wonderful job of replenishing our supplies and cleaning the room for us. And on Saturday she brought free magazines (Honolulu, Whole Living, Wine Spectator). I also noticed that many times she didn't put plastic bags in the trash cans. The cans are typical and small and with kids and the baby's dirty diapers we ended up using grocery bags as liners. I know in California they are working on phasing out plastic store grocery bags and I wonder about Hawaii and whether wastepaper bags are the same way. Maybe she just forgot. It wasn't that big of a deal.One other great thing is that there is a coin-operated laundry room on every floor, just to the right of the mirror by the elevator. Both the washer and the dryer cost $2.50. There are laundry supplies you can buy for $1.25 so you don't have to go to the sundry store for them. There is also a soda machine that dispenses bottles of soda for $1.50 as well as the ice machine.Speaking of sand, there is a bather's elevator around the corner from the Ilikai Tower elevator (the main elevator to the hotel rooms). There is also the glass elevator to Sarento's restaurant.There is a sundries store on the lobby floor. The prices are high, but not much more than you will find at the drug store or grocery store. They really do have a large variety of items. I only wish the store clerks had been friendlier. No one really smiled or engaged in conversation. As far as friendliness goes, our housekeeper, the bell hop (when we passed him in the elevator), and the dining room manager at Sarento's (Jason Watkins) were the most friendly people we encountered. Pretty much all the other guests we ran into were friendly as well. I wish the front desk had been friendlier and, my husband felt the concierge was lacking.Every night before sunset there is a man dressed in red and yellow and he blows the conch shell and then the torches are lit. The grounds are very beautiful.The Ilikai Bar & Grille serves good food that is average price. We ate dinner there on a weeknight and it was pretty empty. When they had the hula show on Friday night, it was packed.The pool is on the small size and fills up fast. The hotel will supply you with beach towels, but you need to sign a waiver first. Then you are given cards that you exchange for the towels. If you do not turn in the towels, they will charge you $20 for each towel.The guys and gals at the valet are very friendly and are quick to retrieve your car. They charge $25 a day for valet parking. We tried parking at the yacht harbor as other reviewers recommended, but it was not as easy for the time we needed and it amounted to about the same charge as the hotel valet.As many others have said, Hilton Hawaiian Village is next door. They have a lagoon that is a short hop from the Ilikai (just down the ramp). This is a great place for families with little kids. We went there often, though the sand was very hard on my husband's feet so he preferred walking a little further to Waikiki beach which is just on the other side of the lagoon.Though this is not a review for Sarento's, it is part of the hotel. We dined here on our last night. The food is expensive, but not much more than other places around. The view is amazing and the food is wonderful. They allow children and even have a keiki menu - $12 for entree, beverage, and dessert. My only regret is that we wasted meals at nearby Outback and Red Lobster when we could have paid a little more and ate at Sarento's for three nights instead of one. I highly recommend you dine there at least once. When you check in you receive a shell lei for each person along with a coupon booklet that includes 10% off food only at Sarento's. The booklet was a nice touch, but we forgot we had it so we didn't use it.Other aspects of the hotel are the concierge desk. I did not see him, but my husband did. Apparently he is only there until around 2 in the afternoon. My husband thought he was too pushy with the whole Shell Vacations time share thing and he did not feel he offered much information about what to see. However, there is a huge selection of brochures. Be sure and pick up a free copy of Oahu Gold and/or This Week Oahu which has coupons and tour information.The hotel has a boutique clothing store on the lobby floor along with Shell Vacations and a small gym. I did not use any of these, but I walked by them. The gym was empty, but it had plenty of treadmills and elliptical machines.All in all we had a wonderful time at the Ilikai. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. If money was not an object would I stay choose this hotel? I would pick the Halekulani and pay $7k for a three bedroom suite and private butler! But if I wanted a clean, spacious room in a great location, I would always choose the Ilikai.The hotel layout was easy enough that even my 3-year-old would talk about needing to turn this way and that. It's no secret that the Ilikai is an old hotel, but it has a lot going for it. I hope the new owner can bring it back to its former glory. It would not take much to bring it around. The lobby and grounds are beautiful and Sarento's is a great restaurant with an amazing view. Having room service would be a wonderful addition because there are many times you find yourself wanting something quick without having to walk to get it. You can also order online, but there are too many options and it is frustrating when you are hungry.

I stayed in private condo Had the use of all hotel facilities and restaurants. The restaurant on the top floor was first class, reasonably priced and had a view of Hawaiian luau show! Location of this hotel is a10 minute walk in one direction to Ala Moana shopping centre (great bargains) and a ten minute walk in the other direction to major attractions in the heart of Waikiki beach. Amazing. The Ilikai is ideal if you have young children. Just two minutes to the lagoon for hire boats or stand up paddle boarding. Just a few steps further to a quieter section of Waikiki beach.Shuttle buses to everywhere stop right outside the hotel. The concierge can also book any tour of the island for you.

Had a great room with a balcony facing the beach. Got to watch a free luau due to the fact that it was on the roof across from my room. Also had prime viewing for the fireworks from the balcony. The location was fantastic. A few minutes walk to Ala Moana. There's a bus stop right out front as well. Across the street was an ABC store, Subway, McDonald's, Buffalo Wild Wings, etc. I highly suggest Marukame Udon for dinner one night, it's a 10-15 minute walk. The staff was friendly, but forget about talking to the person who helps organize activities. There was always a billion people in line and only one woman. I just grabbed a map from the front desk and went on my way.

What can I say........well wow is a start!My wife and I stayed here in August and it was amazing beautiful hotel fantastic staff especially Kara who worked in the bar she was so lovely and polite,The hotel was not 5 star but it was very clean and tidy and the staff are fantastic and very friendly our maid was brilliant she changed the beds every day and was very nice and had time to talk to us. The first night we went next door to the Hilton and used the bar and grill, this was the first and last time we did. Apart from the cocktails the food and service were not great for a 5star joint, oh and then there's the price $18 for 2 pints of lager I nearly died!The next night we stayed in our hotel and used the ilikai bar and grill very comfy, nice food, great service and boy was it cheaper! The shop in the hotel is very good selling gifts, food and drink so you can stock up in your room we did this and it saved a lot of money on breakfasts and dinners, we ate out most nights using the vouchers we were given when we checked in however we still found the ilikai bar and grill better.The hotel is in a great position and you have the choice of pool, lagoon or Waikiki beach.On an evening the sunsets are amazing from the balcony but for the best sunsets you need to ask for a room on the side the sunsets although to be honest if you have a high room you should have a nice view.There is a gym which was never over crowded and had everything you needed for a quick workout.On an evening you can walk down Waikiki beach to the duke's statue then walk down the Main Street and look in all the fantastic shops and restaurants, we loved the Hard Rock Cafe, best one i have ever been in by a country mile and then some!!!All in all if your looking for a nice clean comfortable friendly hotel I would highly recommend the Ilikai.Ps strongly advise on car hire to see the rest of this fantastic island and its far cheaper to book it through the hotels concierge service who are very very knowledgable
user_name:
Glenn M
Crook, null, United Kingdom

review_body: We had a large room on the 22nd floor (paid 9$/night extra for this) with a balcony and a great view (though partially obstructed by the Hilton) view of Waikiki beach. The hotel itself is on the north/west edge of Waikiki with easy access to the Ala Moana Shopping Mall. The rate we paid was much less than what other well reviewed hotels in the area seemed to be charging and we booked directly with the hotel. We also paid 25$/day +tips for valet parking to save time and hassle with less expensive options.Ironically, the Waikiki area was of little interest to us, so we would usually leave the area in the morning. This ended up working well because we were usually going against the flow of traffic. This is a large hotel with lots of people, so everything feels a bit rushed and hectic, but I think that's normal for the area.

Let me start off by stating, this was the first time we had rented a condo, so we were a little apprehensive about the differences of being a hotel guest. We are people who plan ahead, and so we didnt really require information from anyone in the hotel/didnt use concierge desk for anything. The hotel itself was nice. Anyone we did talk to, just walking around, was able to direct us toward the nearest xyz etc. The lobby level has shops, a convenience type store with some groceries, souvenirs, straw mats, towels, toiletries, postcards etc, the Ilikai Bar and Grill, their outdoor pool is down a walkway, beach access etc. We didnt use the pool because the beach was so close we couldnt resist sitting on the beach and being able to swim in the ocean, with Diamond Head in the background! The hotel also has Sarentos restaurant at the top of the hotel which is one of Waikiki's top restaurant and is known for their view. There is an ABC (or 12) across the street for groceries as well, so we stocked up on our weeks needs when we got there).We did get food to go one night from the Ilikai Bar and Grill and also dined there (its outdoors, and half of it is also covered) and thought our food was great both times. Our actual room was great. Took us a second to figure out how to open the door, but once we were in, we were happy. The condo is updated; the kitchenette is tiny but the same size as ours in NY. Granite countertops, new appliances, all utensils provided for what you would need to prepare all meals inside. The majority of our days we had breakfast in our room, made lunch to take with us and ate dinner out somewhere else. Thats what we like to do on our trips and it was nice to be able to do that with more than a tiny hotel table, with a tiny fridge, limiting your options. The couch in the living area was nice, with a coffee table to lounge and watch tv in the morning or late at night. The bathroom was updated and had a rack of towels, including beach towels. The bed was so comfortable, we passed out everynight. From the lanai you have a beach view, pool view, and Hilton Hawaiian villages luau view. You can hear it a little at night, but it wasnt bothersome at all. A few nights we went out for a little while and watched different pieces. The view of the fireworks on Friday night, were great. All the information that you need is emailed to you within hours of booking, and there is also information provided to you when you get in the room with details for wifi, pool, restaurant recommendations etc. It was a really pleasant experience to rent the condo and I would definitely recommend it through waikiki oceanfront rentals. Mahalo.

We have stayed at Ilikai several times booking through various means. This time we used AlohaCondos.com to book #1639. This was the nicest room we have rented. It is updated with granite counters, stainless steel full-sized applicances, tile floors and bathroom and is just as the photos show it. Aloha Condos and the owner made the process very easy and quick, no hassles. Everything we needed was available in the unit from dishes and cookware to beach chairs and towels. Be aware that if you book directly with the owners, you will not have access to some services at the Ilikai, but this owner provided pool passes and phone numbers for contacting services such as maintenance if the need were to arise. The view is over the marina which is our favorite - great sunsets, but you do need to go down to see the Friday night fireworks as you can't see them from this room (go lagoon view if you want to see them). What you can see from this room is the Modern Honolulu next door. The view of their pools is nice, but we also noticed several people who didn't think they needed to close their drapes while in their underwear. One blonde lady did all her packing in a black bra and thong on Sunday night. It was hard not to notice.The Ilikai is close to shopping, restaurants and the city bus so we don't rent a car when on Oahu. We usually shuttle to and from the airport and use the bus for everything else. This trip we found a great luggage storage service for our extra suitcases while we spent a couple days "island-hopping." Cliff at BeachBum.com was recommended by the Best Western and we will VERY HAPPY with his service. He picked up our luggage at one hotel, stored it for two days and delivered it to the Ilikai all for less than it would have cost to take it with us!!! What a time and hassle saver he was!!This is the condo that we will try to get for our next trip to Honolulu. I actually thought maybe I shouldn't give it such a good review because it will always be booked.

We stayed in room 2129 which was privately rented by waikiki oceanfront rentals. I spent some time before booking looking at reviews and chose this particular unit for its high floor and view. The room was a large studio with a full kitchen which was plenty adequate for the 4 nights we were there, We made breakfast and had happy hours on the balcony but dined out each night. The view was wonderful but the panels across the balcony made it difficult to sit and look out. We squeezed the chairs up by the AC unit and could just about see around then when sitting down. This was a bit of a disappointment to me as the whole choice had hinged around the view and it was a bit misleading on the website. Standing up, the view was magnificent, out towards the airport, overlooking the marina and we saw awesome sunsets every night. The general condition of the room was okay, flat screen TV, reasonable bathroom but there wasn't much storage space and the flimsy wicker draw unit almost unusable. The pool was small but quite nice and the Hilton Lagoon and the sea close enough for a swim in more natural surroundings. It was a bit of a hike to the centre, which we didn't mind, although it was starting to get a bit tedious by the fourth day. This end of Waikiki is much quieter, depends on which you prefer, it is an easy walk to the Ala Moana Mall. Overall, it was good value for the money we paid and I would probably stay there again if we return to Waikiki.

My wife & I stayed here for only one night prior to boarding the Pride of America cruise. I chose this hotel because it was the first to reply to my email which I sent to 4 other hotels in the area. I had requested that our luggage be stored during the day of our arrival from Sydney (at 8.00 am) and their reply confirmed that our room would be ready at that time. Amazing. More amazing - it was!! and on the top floor, lagoon view!! Great location for a day of shopping at Ala Moana and Roger Dunn Golf shop (10 minute walk); easy walk to the beach. Concierge suggested Chinatown for dinner (try Indigo restaurant for great local fare). We didn't use the hotel's restaurants, so I can't comment. One problem, the water condensing from the air con dripped on the carpet all night - the staff were notified in the morning. If we were to stay longer, I would have made sure it was fixed. The hotel room was showing its age; the bedroom more than average size but the bathroom was tiny and the air con was noisy. Next time we would like to stay longer, despite the hotel being out of the main part of town

Stayed for 18 days great location. Close to everything but still away from the main Waikiki area. We rented a condo through VRBO. You are next door to the Hilton where the best beach is and only a 5 min walk

we honeymooned at this hotel and were very impressed. We only stayed in the hotel itself for the first 2 nights before moving to a condo within the hotel; but it was a lovely experience. The views are spectacular especailly if you can get a marina view (you can watch the sunsets) or a lagoon view (the friday fireworks!)

The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was large, clean with a great mountain/city view. The outdoor bar/grill had great food and drinks, friendly staff and multiple tvs to watch games. The location is right on Waikiki beach and in walking distance of Waikiki venues.

We rented unit 1938 from alohacondos.com, which Kat made easy and enjoyable. A great unit overlooking the lagoon, we comfortably slept three. Loved having a sliding wall between the bedroom and living room plus a full kitchen and free wi-fi. The owners also stocked the place with beach gear for us to use, which was great! (Unfortunately the flippers wore out on us, but we walked over to Walmart and replaced them, picking up bargain-priced t-shirts and chocolate-covered macadamea nuts for famly back home at the same time.) Others traveling with us booked through the hotel paying about the same for a city-view room (really big) that had a mini frig and microwave (and daily room service). Location is great for walking to the southern end of Waikiki, the Hawaiin Village and Ala Moana Shopping Center, but away from the nightlife and hubbub. We loved swimming and snorkeling right next to the hotel! It's a little older and no longer glamorous, but a great place to stay.

My husband and I stayed at the Ilikai in condo #1522 this fall. The condo was a private rental but was amazing if you have the chance to stay there! The room was spacious, newly renovated, and had everything you'd need for your stay. But our favorite part was the awesome view from our balcony! We'd sit out each night and enjoy the view of the Hilton lagoon and Friday night fireworks, the beach, and on certain nights, we could watch the luau as well. As far as the hotel went, the location worked for us, we were close to the beach, had everything we needed around us, and the Hilton's shops and services next door gave us some great evening shopping and dining options. As well, there was a small grocery store on site that had a great selection of food, liquor and pharmacy items that were very reasonably priced and open until 11:00 at night. Very convenient!The concierge and front desk staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful, and we could book car rentals and excursions right at the desk. As well, the hotel had the Ilikai Bar with outdoor seating which had very reasonably priced food and drinks, as well as live music in the evenings. We chose to spend a few nights here rather than wandering down the beach and paying $10 for a beer. All in all, a great hotel, and we would definitely recommend it to anyone planning to stay in this area!

There was 10 girls on a week long holiday. We all rented condos with 2 girls per condo. Each Condo had 2 bedrooms. I was a gate crasher on this trip so we had 3 in our condo. Each bedroom had an ensuite with a kitchen and living area as shared. My sister and I shared 1 room that had a king bed and the other girl had a double and a single.The rooms were clean and had everything that we needed. We had a view of the bay and over to the luau at the Hyatt.The pool was great. We sorted our own breakfast and ate out for the other meals. It was a pleasant walk to the Ala Moana but definitely a bus trip back!It was my first time to Hawaii and it lived up to my expectations. Yes I know that Honolulu is not typical but it was what we wanted for a holiday. We went to the Waikale Outlets, Pearl Harbour and snorkelling at Hanauma Bay. Some of us also did a helicopter flight that was fantastic!! We walked into the main street on day and it was a bit far! I had very sore feet after that.Yes I would stay there again but I would look at staying closer to the main beach area to try something else.Very happy with our week there.

Hotel was booked as part of AQUA hotels. This is more expensive, eventually we found out there cheaper alternatives (through owners) which we did not risk doing as it was our first time in Hawaii.Taxi fare from airport to the hotel is around USD35-40 one way (tip included). This is not a bad price thanks to its location, which is at the edge of Waikiki. So, it is relatively quiet and far from the Waikiki area. However, it's only about 20-30 mins walk to the Waikiki area, and if you're lazy, can pay USD2 per person for a hop-on hop-off pink line Waikiki Trolley. The Ilikai is also near the Ala Moana Shopping Centre, about 10-15 mins walk.My initial impression of the hotel reception was not good (this lady works on the Friday night shift). She seemed a bit fake and somewhat unhelpful. However, the next few days, there were far better hotel reception clerks. Valet guys were good.Our room was very old. The dishwasher was not working (luckily we don't use it anyway). The decor seems very 1970s, which suits some people. I got used to it eventually because the ocean views and sunset made up for it. Shower is a bit old and may need stronger water pressure. Maybe other rooms are better.There was a free WIFI which is a big bonus. There's a bar/restaurant downstairs which had huge and affordable meals. The coffee shop is also very good! There's a shop to buy other goodies (mart) which is reasonably priced. Washing machine and dryer available for 10 x 25c per machine on each floor.However, at one time during our stay, some alarm went off at 1am which was annoying.Overall, I highly recommend this for the location (quiet and relaxing), the free WIFI, availability of laundry on each floor and affordable food/coffee downstairs. Would pay to research cheaper options to this hotel & suite, and get the ocean view!

I was pleasantly surprised with the lovely entrance to this hotel/condo. The rental price was good. The fact that we had an ocean front view, made it possible to have breakfast outside while watching the activities below. Every night we could decide if we wanted to watch the luau at the hotel next door. We walked along the boardwalk, stopping for coffee, a drink or just taking photos of the sunsets. We were there for one week in suitre 1120. We rented a car for 3 days at the end of our stay and enjoyed using the valet parking....the attendants were very friendly and helpful. This is an older building with new upgrades...great for having your own privacy with buses stopping at the front door, an ABC store a short walk across the street, trolley buses stop outside of the hotel and you can walk around and pass through shops of all descriptions. The mall is a 10-15 minute walk across the canal if you have energy. Go to Dukes for the buffet breakfast that starts at 730 am. You can make your breakfast, lunch or dinner in the condo and save a huge about of money. The stay here was everything we had read and even more.

Have stayed there several times. The best hotel experience I've had in Hawaii, and so we will be returning next year. Best location in terms of beach and Ala Moana Shopping Center and Ward Center. Superb staff in skill and attitude. Excellent rooms. One of Waikiki's landmark hotels (many very pretty features), yet it has a quiet, peaceful atmosphere. Very reasonably priced. The new in-hotel store is guest-centered in its prices and products; nicely done. We love the place and its Aloha spirit.

We booked the hotel online based on location and great rate compared to other hotels in the area. We were very pleasantly surprised with our room and convenience of location. Everything is within walking distance but wish it was a little closer to the beach - 5 minute through parking lot and around lagoon but still great.
