Also note that they have CAA rates buried on website but well worth looking for.

I actually rented this as a vacation rental.. very reasonably priced and in a good spot if you dont want to be right in the middle of waikiki.. walk about 15 mins to main strip... always busy and close to ala moana

Love the place given a chance to visit again we will definitely stay in Ilikai... :) We were upgraded and stayed in the ocean view room. Service is excellent, staff are courteous and willing to help.The concierge are very helpful and so are the helpdesk.

My husband an I stayed for our 29th wedding anniversary. We are residents of the Island andTry to stay at different hotels throughout the year to give back to our local economy. This hotelWas one of the best we have stayed at, especially for the spacious size which made it very comfortable to move around in. Many other hotel rooms are so much smaller. We truly enjoyed the view and large balcony as well. Even the bathroom was comfortable and had a bath as well as a shower making it ideal if you are travelling with young children. Room was clean and ready upon check in, staff was also quite friendly. Thanks for helping make our Anniversaryan even more special one!

This is quite a grand hotel for its age.....it was convenient to everything and we found it a lot smaller than the pictures becos of the mirrors everywhere, but hey it was ideal for what we wanted, immaculately presented although tired and outdated but very clean. We had a unit over the entrance to the hotel so it was quite noisey but once you shut the sliding doors it blocks out that noise very well.I would certainly recommend it to others and Scott was very accommodating as our flights were changed by the airlines and we had a late checkout which we paid $50 for and it meant we didn't have to rush out and look for a place to go to for the rest of the day.Only one negative which I found rather annoying. The day before we were due to leave there was a note on the Kitchen bar asking us to ensure that the dishes were done and the unit left in a reasonably clean state. Why do we pay a cleaning fee of over $100 for then????? This is something on all our travels that we have never been required to do or a further fee would be charged. Unbelievable!!!!

We stayed here when we got married 5 eyars ago. We came back this year because it was just so lovely - huge rooms, great tv and brilliant location. We really can't recommend this hotel enough. If we can ever save upi enough again and face the trip out - we will be back in a heart beat!But the service was a little bit impersonal - they weren't that bothered that we had make the trek all the way from Scotland (24 &1/2 hours to get there!!) and that we were back as it was our 5 year anniversary and this was where we had stayed when we got married - not even a "welcome back" when we checked in. This was the only downside - I suppose big hotels these days just don't give that personal touch any more!But lack of personal touches aside - stay here if you are heading to honolulu!!

Our room was a private condo that we rented and it had a great view and was clean. The illikai is a very nice property which is very close to everything. The restaurant at the top has a great happy hour and view of the city. I would highly recommend it.

Staff here is happy to see you - helpful and appreciative. Great value and location, at the start of Waikiki for beach walk to Hilton and hotels beyond. Walk to Ala Moana too. Remodeled rooms that are spacious and balcony is too with room table and chairs to enjoy the clouds roll by and the surfers. Waikiki is a busy busy place and the Ilikai is just at the start of it so you can choose how much busyness you take in.

We only stayed at the Ilikai Hotel & Suites for one night but we wished we would have booked there for a longer stay. We were on vacation with my brother who is stationed in Honolulu. I thought the prices were reasonable considering some of the prices for the other hotels in Waikiki. I was impressed that the hotel was so updated and the furniture was comfortable. We rented two 2-bedroom suites to accommodate 8. In my research I was not able to find these types of room configurations any place else in Waikiki. My husband and I shared one suite with my father, who is handicapped and he had the bathroom with the shower, which was perfect for him. He only had to step over the rim of the shower, however, he complained of the lighting in the bathroom to shave, but he also has macular degeneration. We stayed in the room with the King bed and private bath and there was a lot of storage, as well as an entrance from the room onto the side balcony. There was also a front balcony and the double doors opened wide. The view from the 22nd floor was outstanding in our suite which faced the marina and had a view of the sunset. I recommend this wing of the hotel. My brother's room was in the opposite wing had a view of the lagoon and the fireworks display, which is good for families with children. The suites offer two televisions, two full baths, a living area and dining area, two balconies and a full kitchen and breakfast bar. Since we only stayed one night, I can only state that the refrigerator worked well and the coffee was good. You have to buy your own dishwashing detergent, however. They offered a washer and a dryer where the ice machine and soda machine are located. They also offer a swimmer's elevator, for persons wet just coming off the beach or pool. We did use the washer and dryer and they worked well.The elevators were quick and we experienced no waiting, however, we visited Hawaii in October which is off season. We ate at the restaurant facing the marina and the food was adequate and the service was good. They have a market and you can buy snacks, personal items, souvenirs and alcohol, but there are two ABC stores very close to the hotel which offer better prices, and they sell everything from food to souvenirs! I recommend the ABC store to the left as you go out the front of the hotel, as they offer more.There is a McDonalds and Subway right across the street and I think I recall seeing Buffalo Wild Wings nearby too. The valet parking was expensive, but we got a military discount which made it affordable. They offer beach towels and beach chairs for your convenience, but it is a long walk to the beach or the lagoon. Our only complaint about the pool was you couldn't see the ocean from the pool area. The pool towel service was good and the loungers were comfortable and the water was perfect even in October. They have a chair that assists the handicapped into the pool. Overall I think this hotel is very handicapped assessable. There is an elevator at street level that can take a wheelchair or baby stroller to the hotel lobby level and they also have an escalator. We had no problems with the hotel watching our luggage as we shopped after we checked out. They even offer a post office to mail packages or post cards and sell what you need there at the store.I was told that the Ilikai is the hotel that they filmed the opening scene to the original Hawaii 5-0. It's too bad the hotel doesn't sell Hawaii 5-0 souvenirs there.

Very beautiful place, for my taste little to crowded. You will not find a connection with nature there but if you like to party ...It could be good place as base point for adventure trips around the island.Rooms are clean and comfortable (refrigerator, microwave), for additional money you can get a room with spectacular view.In the lobby area you will find a grocery shop and coffee shop.

We were very optimistic about our booking, but ended up in a VERY outdated room. It had a full kitchen, which was okay, but the dishwasher had a sign on it that it was not working and the dishes, cups, and utensils were not clean. I think the thing that disappointed me the most, was on our last day, I saw through open doors near our room, newly updated and cleaner rooms. Not sure, but I think our room was privately owned as there was a name on the door. Oh, and the toilet belonged more in a pre-school as it was so tiny and close to the floor. (LIttle things mean a lot.)

Stayed with my wife in Oct 12. Good clean rooms and reception areas. Rooms have a bath and separate shower. Weekly fireworks by the lagoon every Friday eve and usually a guitar/singer in the hotel bar most lights. Waikiki beach is a 10 minute walk but a smaller beach is just across from the hotel. The lagoon, based in the adjacent Hilton hotel is ideal for children and offers boats etc for hire. Concierge services are available on site to book all trips, but try to book direct, you will save a fortune, island travel is straight forward via the local bus service and only $2.50 a trip anywhere! And you can use the same ticket within a 2 hour period on any bus, just hop on and off. The best tours are Pearl Harbour and a visit to the Polynesian Centre.

I stayed with my wife on our round the world trip seven nights in this hotel. We had an ocean view room on the 23rd floor. The view was magnificent. The room had a spacey balcony which was very nice to sit in and watch the ocean and the small boat harbor just in front as well as the surfers.The room was quite large with a decent bed but the bathroom was a little bit worn out. If you accept that the hotel is quite ideal for a vacation. Each floor has a coin operated laundry room which we found quite practical.

The Ilikai is one part hotel, one part time-share, one part owners and/or owner rentals. Unit 2030 is an owner rental which was handled/managed through Scott of Waikiki Oceanfront Rentals. Our experience is what it was and does not necessarily reflect on the entire building. The first thing that hits you when you walk in the door is the mildew smell, it was slightly better once the AC started to run. The AC turns off when you open the balcony door and is very sensitive, even with the door locked it would sometimes turn off, leaving the room warm and moldy smelling. This unit was not as advertised by Waikiki Oceanfront Rentals. The bedding super upgrade of memory foam mattress topper and pillows with 600 thread count sheets did not exist. The pillows were below average quality, no memory foam at all, bedding average. The advertised best view in the building is of the side of the Hilton, you can not see the ocean from the room unless you go outside and stand at the rail of the balcony and look to the right. You can not see the view sitting in the balcony chairs, there is a solid panel that blocks it while you are sitting. You can see the balconies of apparent owners, they had clothes lines and a lot of junk on them. The interior is nicely decorated, it is much smaller then what it looks like on the web-site. You get 7 hangers and a small basket cubby sort of dresser, did not find it useful. While taking a shower the water from the floor above started to drip on me, the ceiling drywall was severely sagging and was being held up by paint and it had stretched out to the point where the paint had small rips in it so water from the bath above was dripping on me while I was showering. I informed them of this obviously noticeable issue. So when we returned that afternoon the bathroom had a large, rotted out hole in in the ceiling where the drywall was removed and nothing was put back to cover the hole, not a piece of cardboard, nothing. We were instructed to go to another unit to shower. When I voiced my displeasure I received nasty, condescending emails from Waikiki Oceanfront. Not an offer to cover the hole or an apology. The Hotel itself seemed nice, the pool seemed okay, you have a short walk to the lagoon or beach in front of the Hilton, beach is rocky on the bottom. There is a nice restaurant on the top floor with good views, good food, good happy hour. The valet service was very good. Because it is a private condo you do not get any hotel services, such as cleaning, or the ability to move to another room when the one you are staying in has a problem. I would never stay here again.

This hotel had awesome staff and an awesome view. When we checked in, the staff was quite friendly and polite. Our room was ready which surprised me. I asked for a higher floor, and was surprised to get a room on the 25th floor. We were close to the top of the hotel. The view was great. I could see Waikiki Beach and Diamond head. The room was large in size and so was the balcony. It had a great lounge chair and a table with chairs. The bed was great, and I had so much room. The wifi connection was faster then any other hotel. My stay here was great, and I would recommend this to anyone. There was a bit of a walk to Waikiki Beach but it was only about a 10 minute walk. Great location and perfect.

This hotel is not great but it's not bad. It is in need of a face lift.The rooms are tired but clean and roomy. Most hotels are reducing the size of their rooms and the room size here is a welcome.It is reasonably priced and in a good location to all close attractions.We stayed for 12 days and found the staff willing to help to every need. Nothing was an issue.It sits right next to the Hilton and you find yourself spending time eating and shopping there than at ilika.i

Stayed in a two bedroom condo with my family. Rooms were fairly small, but living room and kitchen were adequate sized and funcitonal. We were on a lower floor opposite the street side, Ala Moana Blvd, and no noise was apparent. I thought the room was reasonably priced on the east end of Waikiki before it gets expensive and congested...for me, the location was ideal. They had a hulu show on Friday evenings, followed by fireworks, which was overshadowed by the show by the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door, and the next day was the Ahola Parade down Ala Moana Blvd passing the hotel. Valets were great, very friendly and a good source information. Front office and bell staff, while adequate did not seem to have that extra aloha spirit. Would like to return to this hotel.

My Wife & I just returned from our 10-day stay on the 25th floor of the Ilikai. Our Lani overlooking the Marina, looking NW over the beach, downtown, all the way to the Airport. Beautiful Views of Surfers, Boats, Rainbows, Sunsets, Cruise Ships & cargo ships, Airplanes, all coming and going, without all of the noise and people in the "main street" of Waikiki. Thank You to all of the Staff at the Ilikai! To get to Mainstreet Waikiki, walk 15 minutes or catch TheBus right out front for $2.50 each way. We found Waikiki really crowded and noisy the days & evenings we went there. The Ilikai is on the quiet end of Waikiki. Just a short 5-minute walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center & restaurants. The Ilikai Bar & Grill served good food and drinks with excellent views of the Sunsets behind the sailboat masts. We will stay there again and recommend it to Friends. We went on a referral from Relatives.

What a wonderful stay we had this past weekend at the Ilikai Hotel. From the moment we pulled our car into port cochere you could feel the Aloha. Our check-in was quick & easy and the front desk staff was pleasant & friendly. Our room was on the 22nd floor and our lanais overlooked Ala Moana Blvd. on one side and Waikiki Beach/Diamond Head on the other. The room was spacious and very comfortable with a full kitchen. We checked in on Friday and was able to catch the Friday night fireworks (a must!) and the enjoyed the Hawaiian entertainment from the Ilikai Bar & Grill (great service, drinks, & yummy food!). After the fireworks, Hawaiian entertainment/hula show, drinks and pupus, we took the glass elevator up to Sarento’s - WOW the view is amazing!!! We choose the Ilikai to watch the Aloha Festivals Floral Parade and what a GREAT choice! From the comforts of our room we had a birds-eye view of the parade. We were extremely pleased with our choice of hotel but what made our stay an “AWESOME” stay was the hotel staff – they were very welcoming – they made us feel like family. We look forward to our next stay here.

We booked thru the Aqua website a couple of days before arriving on Oahu.We stayed 5nights.Price was good and the free internet in our room and the location was the drawcard. I asked for a high floor and we scored the top floor, with a room facing the ocean, overlooking the HHV and the lagoon.Bathroon was old and in need of a renovation, but otherwise our experience was good.Our room had a microwave. laundry was also on the 25th floor -washers $2.50 and dryer $2.50.We were in waikiki to shop (after having spent a relaxing week on maui) and the ala moana centre was an easy 10 minute walk. We also walked into the main area of Waikiki and this only took 10-15mins.All in all a good experience, and we will stay at the Ilikai again when we next visit Hawaii.

The iconic Ilikai is the sort of hotel suited to a relaxing stay in Waikiki! Located near the marina it is just away from the main Waikiki strip meaning it's not amongst the crowds and noise! Great view and the opportunity was given for a higher floor upgrade which was amazing! Rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious. Free wifi available! Reception staff were most helpful. Hotel facilities were great - Bar and Grill had reasonably priced breakfast and lunch menus, excellent massage at spa, ATM and post office on site, beach and pool towels and beach chairs available free of charge and the service for transportation was efficient and friendly. Also short walk to Al Moanas shopping centre. Definitely will return for a stay again at the Ilikai!

A fantastic Condo to rent through vbro.com - a one bedroom/studio type apartment - full kitchen with plenty of extras (beach chairs, umbrella's etc.) awesome lanai that overlooks the Hilton Lagoon and out to the ocean - perfect view of the friday night fireworks and nightly the Hilton Polynesian Dance show directly across on top of the car park.The Ilikai has a lovely eating area downstairs - a very clean, well maintained hotel. Was just hubby & I - this room had a fold out double sofa for perhaps two children but perfect just for 2 adults. We had a ball, loved the whole Hawaiian experience - cant wait to head back.

It is Nice place for the price. It is a good location and the rooms are clean. Free wireless internet is of suffcient speed. They don't offer free computer or business services. It will cost you $5:50 to print your boarding pass. However, this is a very nice motel and we will stay there again when we visit Honolulu
user_name:
Michael Y
Cumming, Georgia, United States

review_body: We recently spent a week at the Ilikai Hotel on Waikiki Beach, the island of Oahu, Hawaii. The Ilikai is a grand old dame which has recently been beautifully renovated. About 1/3 of the hotel suites are privately owned, 1/3 hotel, and 1/3 time shares. We 'traded a week' of our own time share to stay at the Shell Vacation Club which is housed there. We were so very pleasantly surprised! We had a 'studio' which was one large room with a king bed, living area with television, kitchen area with pots, pans, dishes, etc., and bathroom with shower (no tub). It had granite counters, lovely decor, an entire wall of windows (we faced the mountains and cityscape) with sliding doors to a deck. We were on the 20th floor, so, even though we would have preferred an ocean view, the view we had was wonderful! My only complaint would be there was no dishwasher nor washer/dryer. There was a laundry room on each floor, but each machine took $2.50 to operate. Nevertheless, I would stay there again in a heartbeat! The location is fabulous! Just across the Ali Wai Canal from Honolulu, it is easy walking distance west to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, and city or beach walk east to all the charms of Waikiki. The remodel included new, high speed elevators. Each unit has its own air conditioner. The check in/out day was Saturday. The housekeeper does a complete cleaning, including changing the bed, on Monday. She picks up trash and replaces dirty towels on Thursday. Fantastic stay!

I have spent almost a month in a kitchen suite on the 12 th floor..The views can't get better, we have friends that come every friday to our room to watch the fireworks.The Lagoon and the pools are more than anyone can want..With in walking distance to zoo, mall...great restaurants...need i say more?..Oh..and the bar and grill not only have great service and food, when the sunsets its spectacular!!! Gift shops in building are a little pushy and pricey...5 star restaurant on top of Ilikai hotel...great food....Aloha!!!
user_name:
Drema P
Quaker Hill, Connecticut, United States

review_body: The Ilikai hotel was a fabulous hotel. We actually stayed with the with Shell Vacation time share suits in the hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and the location was great. We were on Waikiki beach with about a 15-20 minute walk to the Duke Kahanamoku Statue and a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana mall/center which has great shopping and eating stops. The pool is not so big and no Jacuzzi :( but regardless its still a great place to stay. My only complaint would have to be the comfort of the beds. Im sure they are just a bit old and worn out, my sister had a problem from the beginning but I did not really notice it until the last 2 nights.

We recently stayed (Sept 2012) in a kitchen suite on the 22nd floor. The views were sensational and the location was brilliant. A short 10 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping centre or 10-15 minutes along the beach to the middle of town makes it perfect. Next to The Hilton with it's lagoon and Friday fireworks is also a bonus.

My husband and I stayed at the ilikai in condo, 606 (privately owned) The balcony had a terrific view of mariner. The place was very clean and well equipped. and in one of the best locations in Wiakiki.The only drawback was the afternoon sun on the balcony but then again, you can view spectacular sunsets and in the morning, it was an ideal place to have breakfast. nice and shady.The hotel pool could have done with a few more plants. The pool was clean and you were given spotless pool towels and due to the efficient pool attendant, towels were never left on unoccupied chairs so that there was always spare seats for guests. Highly recommended, and so near the beach.....

We stayed in 15th floor marine ocean view studio room for 4 nights. The room is ok for the price we paid (about $200 per night including cleaning fee and tax).The location is ok, but we would prefer closer to Waikiki center.The swimming pool is too small, and looks like a swimming pool in an apartment in the U.S.We will not come back to Ilikai condo again.

We rented an ocean front room through the hotel direct on the 25th floor, room number 2544 for 5 people. View was amazing and the room was modern and was well appointed. We used fold out bed for third person and was plenty of room for all of us. Rooms were serviced daily which was great. Concierge was extremely helpful and made recommendations that not only saved us money but proved to be as good as she said they would be (5 stars for her). Location is close enough to walk to everything including Ala Moana shopping centre. We got to watch the Hilton fireworks from our balcony. Only negatives would be that the balconies are too small but this can't be changed and is merely because of its design era. Beach and pool towels are supplied and all the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Would happily stay there again.

We are a retired New Zealand couple and we stayed in vacation rental unit 806 privately owned by Pat Carstens( see her wbsite). This is a brilliant hotel superbly located on the waterfront with views across the marina. This apartment was about 600sq.ft incl. a large lanai, and was VERY comfortable, spacious and well equiped. One of the great things in life we were able to do was sit on the lanai late afternoon with a bottle of wine and cracker biscuits and watch the sunset....superb! It had a big fully equiped kitchen, and was significantly cheaper than hotel apartments in the Ilikai.We researched available accommodation and consider this was very good value for Honolulu (which is not cheap) and we had a very happy week here. It's only about 15mins walk fro Ala Moana where you can buy everything ( get groceries from Walmart).Thoroughly recommended.

We stayed on the south side of the building and we could see East and West, saw the magnificent sunset colours and got up to the sunrise. We could even see the Hilton's fireworks show from our room on our first night. The service is excellent. The hotel even provides you with beach towels and chairs at no extra charge. The beach is minutes away by foot. The hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki, at a walkable distance of shopping and restaurant strips. Great value at $180 per night in Honolulu.

Stayed for 1 week at an apt suit with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. We were two couples traveling together. Had a wonderful time. Apt was well equipped and ean and tidy. Beds and pillows very comfortable. We would recommend this unit 1525 as it provides everything you need. Found the wifi practically useless very slow or no Existing to Log on after 7 am and to 9pm. Got very annoyed trying to communicate on iPad and iPhone if on wifi. Otherwise would recommend

This was my 10th trip to Hawaii - have stayed different hotels each time, including some top end ones - like the Sheraton. The Ilikai was my favourite so far. Yes its an oldie (Elvis even stayed here in his day!) but its clean, very comfortable and doenst look its age. The renovations have been kept up nicely over the years. We stayed 7 nights on the 23rd floor. Our view was magnificent - the lagoon and the ocean and diamond head. The balcony (lanai) is HUGE compared to other hotels. The pool was great, clean, palm trees and umbrellas for shelter and lots of sunbeds, didnt have to fight for one at all. The restuarnt on top of the penthouse "Sarento - Top of the I" has a 360 degree breath taking view and is very reasonably priced for fine dining. There is also a cafe downstairs with yummy meals and a bar. The location of the Ilikai is perfect - its out of the bustling Waikiki main strip and beach - but close enough to walk there for shopping and eating. Ala Moana Shopping Centre is literally a 5 minute walk. The hotel is right on the marina and its very picturesque. The beach is beautiful, but a little rocky - but the lagoon is right below with its white sand and clear blue water, beautiful to swim in.The rooms are the largest I have stayed in, in the Waikiki area. Large bathroom (ours had 2 showers) - airconditioned nicely (no noise) - flat screen tv, microwave, fridge and safe. For the rate we paid we were more than satisfied and would definately stay here again. And free wifi in the rooms and right through the hotel!

I am reviewing the condo portion of the building. Stayed on the 4th floor using a VRBO rental. Price was WAY below the hotel rate even after cleaning fee. Property is excellent - has great views of the harbor/ocean on one side and the rainbow lagoon/hilton property on the other.Being on the 4th floor I could look out on the pub/common area where music and dance shows took place right below my balcony.Location has a pub, beautiful and clean common areas indoors and out, 9 elevators - 6 common, 2 bather, and one to the restaurant at the top, pool area and hot tub.The location is at the north end of Waikiki and a little bit of a walk to the tourist area but nice and quiet. There are ABC stores on both corners as well as some chain food places. No grocery nearby. A 10-20 min walk got you to Waikiki central. I even walked from here to the top of Diamond Head (9+ miles RT) in about 4 hrs. Great stroll!Ocean access is either front the rear of the building down the ramp and into the park/lagoon or thru the Hilton property next door....very close and convenient Parking is valet at the front or you can drive around to the marina in back and park for $1 per hour prepaid. They offer weird specials depending on time of the day you park like $6 for 10hours during the day or one morning I got a $12 for 24hrs option although I was leaving for the day.You can't go wrong here!

We loved our four night stay in our one bedroom condo/hotel room 1724 at the Ilikai. We had a beautiful view of the ocean and a bonus view of the Hawaiin hilton luau. We watched the entertainment from above for three nights. The last night we watched them set up and set off friday night fireworks. The bed was comfy and we really enjoyed the huge lanai. The suite had a full kitchen in which we utilized the fridge for our breakfasts and late night munchies. We had a family reunion cocktail party of 11 people in our little Hawaiin home. The other members booked regular hotel rooms that they enjoyed as well. This is the best value that I could find with an oceanview room on Waikiki. The hotel presented a hula show featuring a Hawaiin band and a very talented duo of dancers. This show was one of the highlights of our trip. The pool was a nice size- and enjoyed by the entire party. The only negatives were the inability to get drinks by the pool- this should be a must in the future, and the out of date fitness facility. I would recommend a transfer from the airport by Roberts or another private bus service(around 12 per person) because this is pretty much the first stop from the airport. On your return transfer though- one should take a taxi to the airport or your cruise because you may be the first stop of many before a return trip. The staff was kind and very helpful. They provide beach chairs and towels!

This hotel was recommended to us by a friend and it was great. We had room 2401 - Mountain view room and it was massive. It had a big bathroom, flat screen TV, a safe, big sliding doors onto balcony and massive beds. It was such good value for money too. $160USD a night - Aug 2012. It takes 10mins to walk to the 'main drag' and if your a bit lazy - catch the bus for $2.50IHOP is across the street and it's about 5 mins from Ala Moana shopping centre. It's also next to the Hilton and the beautiful lagoon. We would definately stay here again.

Great location if staying in Honolulu. Beautiful room and view of the lagoon and ocean. Staff was great. Only complaint would be the rates for parking at $25 night and mandatory valet if you wanted the safety of the garage. Valet may work for some, but did not work well for me. I'd rather park the car myself. I don't like to feel hurried to get everything out of the car as soon as we pull up. And if I forgot something, I had to ask valet to bring the car back. I prefer a little more independence. Otherwise I'd have to say Ilikai was near perfect.

I usually stay in Waikiki at the other end of the strip. I booked the Ilikai for a good deal and out of curiosity. I am glad I did. The room is huge. I usually bring along a yoga mat for a little exercise in the room and there was plenty of space. Also had a great view of Diamond Head and the ocean from the lanai. Free Wi-Fi is also avaialble and the speed was great. I rented a car and valet parking is required and costs $25 per day. However, the valets really hustled and were very efficient. The location of the hotel is also excellent. Close to Ala Moana shopping, loads of restaurants around and very conveniently located to public transportation and walking distance to pretty much everything. The rooms are in very good condition. I had no complaints King size bed, LCD TV, refrigerator and microwave. The room was kept spotless. I ate at the bar and grill on the lobby floor. Not impressed with the food but the drinks were reasonably priced.

My Husband and I stayed at the Iliaki for 5 nights 26 August-31August.We were on the 24th floor facing the marina.The views were amazing from our room and even better from the balcony.Our room was large and spacious and we had a wonderful king bed.The staff are warm and welcoming and nothing is to much trouble.The pool area is well organised and very quiet,there were always loungers available as well as tables and chairs with umbrellas and the staff at the pool are great.We are already planning on returning this time with all our family.Thank You for a relaxing stay

We chose this particular hotel because it is at the beginning of Waikiki Beach. That means you are close enough to walk to anything Waikiki has to offer, but far enough away to not feel "crowded" by fellow tourists. The hotel is showing its age but the grounds are beautiful and the rooms are twice the size of an average hotel room. I did not use the pool and if you are a pool person, you might be disappointed by it. The Hilton Hawaiian Hotel next door had a pool with rivers and slides etc. I also wanted to stay at this hotel because it is the original "Hawaii Five-O" hotel.

Yes, the hotel could use some upgrading, but the rooms we had were spacious, as was the fridge, the view from the lanai (upper floor) was fabulous and the food was good. There is a paved walkway along the beach/marina that connects from the Modern next door (nice bar there) all the way to the Hilton, hale koa and Sheraton. We woke up to find Hawaii 5-0 being filmed on it one morning! We stayed in the middle of Waikiki after staying here and found it to be too hectic. Noise and traffic at all hours. The ilikai end is much more peaceful. It's easy to drive in and out of the hotel. The valet service is super fast. We really enjoyed our stay here. The one negative - there was a temporary issue with the main elevators (necessitating use of the side elevators) and they chose to tell everyone about it over the P.A. - at 6a.m.! Twice! A sign on each floor probably would have sufficed. The issue was resolved quickly and we never heard the P.A. again, thankfully.

My best friend and I stayed at the Ilikai from the 16th to the 25th August 2012. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by the amazingly friendly Joli we felt at home. We had arrived very early and they had a full house but were directed to bathrooms, luggage stored and we went to walk off the jetlag. On our return Joli had a room ready for us 2514 was fabulous, the most breathtaking review. Our room decor was a little dated, however, extremely clean and not at all tatty. The room was also in pristine condition which we found was to happen everyday after maid service.The cocktails in the bar downstairs were outstanding, we had one lovely fish meal there as well. We loved that the Ilikai was just on the fringe of Waikiki, we did not want to feel like we were in a busy place. It was also perfect to walk to Ala Moana, literally a 7 minute walk. The only fault with the hotel and its not a big deal what so ever, is that the pool is in need of an updating. But the lagoon and the beach are just there and the pool is perfect for a quick cool off. Thank you Ilikai, we will be back for sure.

Inspite of all the negative reviews about how old this hotel is...my husband and I enjoyed our 4 night stay. Our room was clean and we could see the ocean from our bed. There were no carpet stains, old plumbing or anything. WE did not want to leave the room...each morning to venture out...however, we looked forward to returning at the end of each day. The hotel is in the perfect location with easy access to transportation to and from surrounding areas. There are plenty restaurants within two blocks of the hotel. The marina is very pretty...within walking distance and so is the ocean. The Ilikai is close to other hotels with more restaurants and shopping! Awesome location!

Lobby area is nice but the Ilikai is starting to show it's age inside the rooms. Needs some modest room renovations. Also not enough attention to cleaning the bathroom areas. Toilet seat , shower stall and mirror behind door were not cleaned well. Complained to front desk. Very apologetic but nothing was done to correct the problem.However, you can't beat the location for restaurants,shops and beautiful beaches. On 17th floor and view was great.! Next time though we'd consider staying at another hotel in the area with better quality rooms.

We have just stayed at the Ilikai for 8 nights having privately rented a studio unit on the marina side of the building. The building on the outside may have been here quite sometime but the interior of our studio unit was outstanding.The unit was fantastic. Very modern, ultra clean and fabulous views. We had easy access with no keys necessary due to the locking system. The shop at the Ilikai was convennient and the ABC stores on two sides were great with cheap prices and good stock lines. The unit had everything we needed, lots of towels, full size fridge, flat screen tvfree wifi and best of all a huge comfy bed! The location is also terrific with access to buses out the front of the building. Restaurants nearby that were inexpensive and tasty were the Outback and Red Lobster. MacDonalds for those interested was across the street and alongside MacDonalds was the best coffee on the strip Kimobean. Ask for latte not cappaccino. The chinese buffet across the street was not to our liking and we would not go again. Scott at Waikiki Ocean Front Rentals was very helpful prior to our arrival with any questions we had and if you are thinking of coming to Hawaii check out site, very easy to use and all transactions etc went without any hitches. I would definitely recommend using WOFR and I certainly would recomment the Ilikai. Ann, Australia

I was so grateful that we stayed here. The Ilikai was perfectly located downtown with an amazing view and beach access. We ate at the restaurant bar often as the food was delicious and inexpensive and all the staff were friendly and welcoming. The pulled pork sandwich was the best I have ever had! We used the valet parking, and likewise the staff was very helpful and prompt. The hotel atmosphere was relaxed, but more so than other big hotels we saw in the area. The rooms were comfortable and clean. I would definitely stay here again!

This hotel is terrific!!!! We rented 3 2 bedroom units at the beginning of August for a family vacation. Units 2544 2543 and 2410. 44 and 43 are the 2 closest to the lagoon and the ocean. 10 is on the sunset side at the other end. The units were clean and well maintained. The balconies were recently painted. Lots of space to relax and of course the convenience of your own kitchen. Housekeeping was wonderful and even did our dirty breakfast dishes 1 morning when we left in a hurry. The valets are so fast and friendly. You have to be careful of how you judge a review of a specific unit as the lower floors are timeshare, the middle floors are condo and the upper floors are hotel (part of the aqua chain) Our experience was fantastic and we are already planning a return in a few years. Thank you Ilikai!!!!

We rented condo 1637, from 2 owners from California. We arrived and the bellman accompanied us with our bags. The email I had from the owner indicated condo number 1638, so after several failed attempts with the lockbox, I think the bellman began to wonder what was up. I tipped the poor guy and asked him to leave the bags, and I promptly called one of the owners. Turns out he'd made a mistake on his email. After apologies from the owner, we went across the hall to condo 1637, and got in right away with the code they had provided. The last time I stayed a the Ilikai was in the 80's. I lived on Oahu, so I knew the property pretty well. The view from our lanai was gorgeous. It overlooks the marina and beyond. I have stayed in Waikiki many times since and this was probably the best view I've ever had. We arrived on Friday, so I had promised my son we would watch the fireworks over the lagoon from our lanai. Unfortunately, since we were now on the other side of the buidling, we couldn't see the fireworks. There are floorplans of the buildings on the Iliakai site, so you know, prior to getting there, which condo is facing what and now that we were actually in 1637, we didn't face the lagoon. We ended up walking down to the lagoon and watching from there. This particular unit was recently remodeled. The kitchen was very nice with just about anything you would need for a week. Who cooks when staying in Waikiki anyway? There is a full size fridge, which is nice but no icemaker or dishwasher. I got busy making ice right away. I began to unpack as my husband checked the place out. The T.V. remote didn't work, but that isn't a big deal for me. There are no instructions for a first time condo user. We didn't know if we were to call down to the desk or directly to the owners, if we needed something. Our son was sleeping on the fold out couch, but they provided no linens for that. There were no beach towels provided. The fitness room is for hotel guests only, so don't plan on using it. I was disappointed about that, as I work out almost every day. One whole wall of the condo is sliding doors. This provides for a lovely view, however, several of the vertical blinds were missing. 10 to be exact and when you have the Modern Hotel across the way, looking right into your condo, privacy can be an issue. My husband found a chest with some damged blinds that had been taken down and he repaired what he could. We ended up purchasing sheets to cover the sliders, so at least we had some privacy at night. Not really the thing you want to deal with on vacation. I showed my family the grounds, but I honestly don't recall such a disappointing pool and pool area. It is down right depressing. I recall spending many days at that pool back in the 80's, and I don't remember it looking like that. We never used the pool after that. The lagoon is a nice place for families to hang out and learn to stand up paddle board etc. Although once you get it down, rent over by the Outrigger Waikiki as it is much cheaper.The time difference can be a challenge, so I emailed the owners with our issues and they were very apologetic, insisting they would make it up to us and reimburse us for the sheets etc, but we haven't heard from them since. As a rental property owner myself, I realize it is difficult to manage a property in a whole other state, but it isn't fair to the renters, having to deal with missing window coverings, etc... Please also keep in mind that if you run out of towels, you are to wash them at your expense. We ran out of toilet tissue, and were never provided paper towels in the kitchen, and it is the guest's responsiblity to replace those as well. Just some little things that we were not aware of prior to our trip. We have never stayed in a condo on Oahu and would probably opt to stay in a hotel in the future. One other thing, the unit above us was undergoing some renovations, so we heard lots of drilling etc above us, but it was during the day.

My wife and I stayed at the ilikai from August 13-27th. The hotel is beautiful, very well appointed and very modern. There are small stores with gifts groceries and two bars. The ilikai bar is great in the evenings, wonderful servers (Hannie is a sweetheart) and the condos are spacious kitchen is well equipped. We stayed in 512 which hack a fridge, microwave, stove, toaster, very nice walk in shower. Li suppose the only complaint is that the pool at the ilikai is small and looks like an apartment complex pool. The lagoon nearby is great to lie on the sand and tan. Hawaii Five-0 was shooting right on the beach beside this hotel which was amazing. Lots of small bars and restaurants near by with tons of happy hours (wild Wings and Snappers right across the street), Chart House (old school Waikiki style) is Aron d the corner. Lots of ABC stores if you want to buy groceries near by. Staff/valet Parker's are extremely friendly. A wonderful experience. Will definetly come back.

We stayed in a condo (Room 1718) and it was complete perfection!We had an uninterrupted ocean and lagoon view, as well as a view of the city. The condos are huge and so are the lanais. The room was well equipped, clean and comfortable.The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the strip one way and Ala Moana Centre the other.The beach just down from the hotel in front of the Hilton is beautiful & there's a little bar where you can order cocktails to sip on the beach.Perhaps the only downside is the $25 per night valet parking. But other than that no complaints here.We will back next time!

We selected this hotel because we needed a kitchen. The fact that it's right on the beach was just great. We could walk to the beach every day, including the great lagoon next door which had a lot of beach activities. The hotel itself has a great convenience store that's open from 5 AM to 11 PM so we could buy everything we need right in the hotel. We were able to cook breakfast and dinner (for our kid) everyday and it was a great experience. Valet staff is extremely friendly. The hotel is definitely a little older than the fancy Hilton next door. Closet doors could be tight, etc, but it doesn't matter that much. You can always stay at this hotel and then shop and walk around the Hilton :)

Absolutely no complaints about anything. Rooms are spacious and clean, very comfortable. Balcony with ocean view was fantastic. Can walk everywhere. Staff extremely knowledgeable and gracious. Shopping and food on site. Fireworks on Friday night. We will definitely stay here again.

Amazing time at the Ilikia!!! If your wondering where to stay...look no further! Very friendly and family orientated!! Staff go above and beyond to assist you and make your stay comfortable!!! Beautiful views, close to shopping, restaurants, bus stops EVERYTHING!!! Military Community Welcomed!!!

If don't want to rent a car, this is the place for you. We stayed here for a week and walked everywhere! The beach behind the hotel is steps away and you can easily walk up and down the shore line. The staff here is really enthusiastic and eager to help. We had a wonderful time and would definitely stay here again!

My recent stay in August 2012 was my first time renting a condo. I normally select full service hotels. In this case, we booked the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach before finding the Ilikai #1938. We moved in the middle of our 1 week vacation. I really enjoyed the Ilikai much more. The condo is perfect for 2 people. I LOVE the lock box option for entry. I wish that I could implement this easy method in my home - no more search for misplaced keys. The bed was super comfortable. The kitchen was well stocked and used for breakfast and lunch. The pool was clean and lots of fun. The Hilton lagoon and beach were right next door to the building. I was happy to find plenty of beach toys on the lanai - 2 boogie boards, lots of beach chairs, a beach umbrella, rafts, inner tubes, snorkels and one set of adult fins. I only wish that we could have stayed longer in this condo.

We booked our condo directly with the Hotel and asked for a two bedroom oceanfront condo on a high floor. As we travel from Australia and arrive early in the morning we always pay for accommodation the night before arrival to ensure that we can go straight to our room on arrival and have a sleep and rest. It was therefore disappointing to arrive and find that whilst the condo was an ocean front condo on a high floor, construction work was being undertaken on both condos next to the one we were allocated. You can understand my annoyance that we would be on holiday in a construction site (the corridor outside our room had plastic covering to stop the debris etc messing up the carpet) and that management made no mention of this at the time of making the reservation nor at check-in. I promptly went back to the reception and complained about this. They explained that as the condos are privately owned they have no control over the construction work - whilst I accept this, I do believe that they should advise their guests that construction work is occurring especially when you are paying in excess of $USD500 (incl taxes) per night. I explained that I would not be able to stay in the condo and wanted to be moved to an alternative one.Donna, at reception was very understanding and advised that she would see what could be done. In order for us to rest after our flight they put us in a studio to rest (which we did) and in the early afternoon were advised that we had a new condo - 2544. All better, all resolved - much appreciated.Condo 2544 was great. Normally on our visits to Waikiki we stay in one bedroom ocean front suites with the major hotel chains, but thought we would try a condo. Compared to these, the condo offered great value for money. We were not disappointed with our choice, the view was marvelous and the condo had everything we needed. Both the lounge and beds were comfortable. The condo was looking a bit tired, but this did not worry us at all. The fireworks from our lanai were terrific, and listening the hula show from the Hilton next door was fun.The location of the Ilikai is terrific, at the quieter end of the strip - we have now decided this is our preferred location. It is within walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping centre and all the hustle and bustle of downtown Waikiki without the ongoing noise.In respect to restaurants, would recommend Roy's - always reliable and consistent and La Mer at the Halekulani for that special occasion.We would stay at the Ilikai again and would ask for condo 2544. thanks for a great stay.

gorgeous views! great location! could just walk to beach and look out room! so relaxing! all inclusive, full size fridge, microwave in every room. if u forget something, there's a nice convenience store on first floor. elevators to everything! great price! great deal!
user_name:
Cathy B
Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

review_body: We booked our stay at the ilikai online, and being our first time to hawaii we didnt know what to expect when we got there,firstly our room was upgraded from mountain view to the most beautiful ocean view i couldve imagined from the 22nd floor, on our first night there (friday night) we were informed of a fireworks display over the lagoon at 7:45 and couldnt believe how good it was..it is a MUST SEE!!! the staff were all so helpful and friendly they really did make us feel right at home, we had a few meals/drinks at the ilikai bar & grill which we also recomend and the pool was very handy to help with the heat and was always clean and well managed.the bottom line is, the ilikai is a must if you're in honolulu! you wont be disappointed

We loved this building so much we are buying a condo there. We did come to check out the building, location, views & what is currently on the market. We really love Ilikai now. Before we stayed here we thought we wanted the Lagoon side but decided we like the Marina/Sunset side better. Previously we had always stayed next door at the Hilton resort but loved staying at this less crowded "hotel". No room service but the concierge was so friendly & helpful (especially with the discounted rental cars) and our condo had a full kitchen (didn't touch the stove but utilized the fridge, microwave & dishes) so we didn't miss room service at all. There is a Foodland close by (15 minute walk, though we timed a rental car with food shopping) & there is a little shop near the lobby. Loved Happy Hour at Sargentos (take the glass elevator to the top of Ilikai) between the views, food, drinks & locals it was a great evening. Easy access to Hilton resort/beach, Ala Moana & the rest of Waikiki. Parking is expensive at Ilikai but the Marina is right there & much less. We did two daily car rentals a few days apart to avoid paying for parking but still enjoy the rest of the island.

hotel is within easy ( and scenic ) walking distance from clear beautiful beach and harbor. Well lit at night. Close to many restaurants. Walking distance.TheBus and the trolley have pick up locations right in front of hotel. Walk to your left out of hotel not to your right or you will have to walk all the way down and walk back up again on other side of street like we did (twice).Gorgeous grounds with free entertainment on Friday night to go along with the free fireworks that the neighboring hotel shoots off. (our favorite part)Breakfast is good but pricey.Very friendly and informative!

We returned from our first trip to the islands a week ago. I wish we were back there again! Our room at the Ilikai was wonderful. Our 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo (privately rented unit 1143 through homeaway.com) had awesome views with a clean, comfortable, and spacious room. There were 4 of us traveling (myself, my husband, my daughter, and my mother-in-law) from Tennessee and we had plenty of room in this condo. The owner was very helpful and accommodating, and the location could not have been better. The pool was just the right temperature and it was just a short walk to the Hilton lagoon to relax in the sand and do some stand up paddle boarding.My only complaint was doing laundry. With 4 of us there for 9 days, we had no choice but to do laundry. We had to use the coin operated laundry, which only took quarters, and was $2.50 per use, meaning to do one load of laundry was $5. When going downstairs to get change, the change machine was broken for the entire 9 days we were there. I had to go to the front desk to get change, and they were less than thrilled with having to make change for me. However, this one minor inconvenience did not ruin our trip.When we are able to return to the islands, we will definitely be staying here again!

we stayed here 5 years ago the place is great, really helpfull staff at all times. the room was amazing ,fantastic view thinking of a return trip wouldn't stay anywhere else if we deciede to go back to honolulu

Hi, I have been to the Ilikai on the July 13 through the 27. I came from Quebec City Canada. I have choosen this hotel for the reviews here and for the complete kitchen offered in the room because my daughter has a very severe allergy. My entire stay was totally perfect. The view was incredible, the staff helpfull and friendly, the room was very clean and the pool was great. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, everything is on a walking distance and I have emphysema, didn't have any trouble. This stay was the trip of my life and the Ilikai was so much more than I expected. Thank you Ilikai for everything, hoping to have another opportunity to visit you once again. Caroline Quebec City

Our overall experience was awesome. Our hotel room had a view of the lagoon & the ocean.I was there with my kids and a good friend of mine and her daughter. Our rooms were huge.The hotel staff were awesome. And the hotel was walking distance to a lot of restaurants & coffee shops. It's Valet only parking, which was an added bonus just for the convenience of it. I didn't have to walk to my car, the valet were really quick at getting your car around.I would definitely stay at Ilikai again.

Was there with my family this past may. Our first visit to hawaii and we rented a condo in the hotel. The hotel has rooms and suites but also condos with a kitchen.The hotel is slightly older but fairly well kept. Situated at one end of the beach so it is very quiet. It is right beside the hilton. You can walk on the beach to the more popular part within 5 to 10 mins depending on how fast you walk. Don't bother going to the time share presentation that they offer. The conceige told us about that when we were booking a car rental there. Told us that it takes about 3 hrs and they are not aggressive at all. For attending, they will give us $150. She told us to tell them right off the bat that we weren't interested when we got there and we could just get our money after a short presentation. It didn't end that way, we were there for more than 3 hrs and there were of course pressure from not just one but 3 different sales people. Getting that $150 was not that easy and we did get annoyed at them because we had made plans and they delayed us.There're washers and dryers on each floor and walls weren't too thin so it was pretty quiet.Overall stay was pleasant.

We stayed here for a week with 3 adults and 2 children, room 1937 with views to the ocean over the marina. In hindsight, the other option available with views over the Hilton Lagoon would have been better, but that apartment also looked into other apartments in the complex due to its location.Staff were great, even though we had a couple of issues with the concierge bookings these were quickly attended to and fixed. The facilities of the hotel are good, and being a major hotel in Waikiki all the major transport options were outside the hotel.Its old and dated, but we knew that so no complaints there; if we had wanted modern and chic we would have stayed at Trump. Very pleased with location being out of the main part of Waikiki, and only 5 mins walk to the Ala Moana centre too so it was a very central location for us.Room was very well kept and clean and modern, although I understand that rooms vary. We booked ours through Waikiki Oceanfront Rentals and were very pleased with the service and communication, the benefit of this method is that you can see photos of the actual room you will be getting so no nasty surprises!

We went here on our honeymoon with our timeshare. The room was clean, but as with any studio room, no real privacy. It was my husband and I so privacy wasn't too much of an issue but to have the bedroom (or even just the bed) separate from everything else would have been GREAT for the mornings. With that being said, the customer service was unbelievable! The valet service was a added bonus. They were fast and always polite. The maid service was efficient and always went above and beyond. The view was breathtaking!!! We were able to see the lagoon and the ocean from our balcony. With a full kitchen, we were able to have home cooked meals. Other than needing a face lift on the outside, I think the place was great! Customer service made up for any shortcomings.

A hiccup on check in was quickly amended and the room was as expected from the website. The hotel is removed from the centre of Waikiki so fairly quiet but the bar & grill wasn't in full working order during our visit so we chose to dine elsewhere. Breakfast of coffee & a pastry from the Kahuna Coffee House on site was lovely & the ladies make great coffee. All our tour buses collected us from the front of the hotel so no problems with that and getting around - particularly to Ala Moana Shopping Centre - on The Bus was fairly easy. Pool area is very small but adequate and you have the Hilton Lagoon right next door or the beach is a 2 minute walk.

The best part of the hotel is the valet service. They have wonderful customer service and I am impressed that they go out of their way to make you happy. I had left a bag in my trunk of my car and Cory went out of his way to return to my vehicle to retrieve my bag. If I will remember anything from my trip, it is the professional customer service of the valet service. Thank you Cory!
user_name:
Marie A
Lynnwood, Washington, United States

review_body: I rented 2 condos from July 1-7 on the 21st floor...clean,lovely view, fireworks at the Hilton from our lanai! I have to say the valet service was excellent. They were often busy but worked very hard to bring our van up promptly and would ask if we needed map/directions for the day. Ashlin Akau went out of her way to help me with a problem and I appreciate her willingness very much! I would definitely stay here again.

We have used our timehare at the IIikai several times. We have always had a nice unit with an ocean view except for this time and we got a noisy city view. The unit was clean. The valiet parking staff is te best. Some of the units have old air condition units which are noisy and rusty. The common areas are kept clean and the elevators all work well. Great location as it is easy to get in and out of the hotel with a car. The beach is close, the pool is clean and the bus stop is out in front of the hotel.

We had a wonderful time staying at the Ilikai Condo, unit 938. This is a small but compact studio with a great, very well-equipped kitchen with modern appliances (great oven, microwave & dishwasher!) and a big fridge. The twin beds were very comfortable, though not the sofa bed. The view from the lanai (balcony) is fantastic and so lively – you can see everything from the Hilton pools, lagoon, beach, ocean, surfers, nightly shows opposite, and spectacular firework display on Wednesday and Friday nights. We love having our meals at the lanai watching everything going on before us. Although a privately owned unit, we enjoy all the facilities of the hotel and more. There is free internet connection which is so essential these days. We love that there are even light beach chairs provided which we can easily carry to the beach - that was thoughtful. So are the beach towels provided.The location of the hotel is simply the best, at the quieter end of the beach, but within walking distance to almost everything – Ala Moana Shopping Centre and adjacent Beach, Waikiki beach and all the parklands around, Ward centre, and the many restaurants. The hotel pool is pretty basic when compared to the adjacent Hilton pools but the pathway from the hotel to the beach is great and we preferred the beach/lagoon anyway. Laundry facilities is provided on each floor of the hotel (coin operated-$2.50/wash). The BLACK toilet in 938 was the first thing we noticed in the WC – probably to match all the black granite and to hide all the yuck – it just feels all wrong. Kitchen tap and shower head are dripping and needs tightening. We did tighten the rickety sofa bed with a pair of kitchen scissors. Alas! on the last day my son found out why the sofa bed was so uncomfortable (can feel innersprung) – it was put upside down in the first place – now why would housekeeping do that?All in all we had an enjoyable stay and would definitely go back again. Thank you Waikiki Ocean Front Rentals and the owners of unit 938.

We had a beautiful room on floor 24 with an ocean view - perfect for viewing Friday night fireworks from lagoon and for sitting on the lanai watching the world sail by!Staff were all very friendly and helpful, mai tai's top notch and food good value and tasty. The location was excellent - first stop for many of the main shuttles to Waikiki, easy 10 min walk to Ala Moana, plenty of good eating options locally notably Red Lobster and Irish pub nearby. We'll be back!

This hotel+ suite is in a good position. Near shops, beaches and transport. We had room 2243 had a great ocean view and was very spacious. The staff were very helpful. The only problem was the noise from the next door apartment- renovations. The manager however offered to change our room our give us a discount. We had the most amazing view of the Wed night fire works. I gather that different rooms are different quality and different views, but we were very happy with ours. Would recommend this to all.

We stayed here in the timeshare area... so not sure if its different then the actual hotel. We had a great room, very spacious and a view of the beach. The kitchen in the room was awesome and the bathroom was huge. We enjoyed our stayed. The only thing we found odd and this could have been b/c we stayed in the timeshare area... was that we only had housekeeping on 1 day. We stayed for 3 nights. And when the housekeeping came they cleaned the bathrooms but did not make the beds or anything. A little disappointing. The Valet service was awesome. There is a Valet named Gary ... who was awesome. He would ask us everytime we left the hotel what our plans were and then give us advise. He recommended a great restaurant for us ... however when we got their our daughter was so tired that we came back. The valet service is $25 a day but well worth it for the service. Overall this is a great place to stay.

#1938 was clean, cozy, and comfy. Communication regarding checking in, etc. after booking was quick and easy to understand. The sliding screen was a novel way to split the room. The view was SPECTACULAR! Look forward to referring and returning.
user_name:
Mel P
Des Moines, Washington, United States

review_body: First of all, I am not a super picky traveler, and have never checked out early of a hotel, but I did here. I booked Ilikai based on the reviews and the "reasonable" price for a July stay. I left because, despite my cool view of the city on the 25 out of 26 floors, the bathroom was so old, dark and moldy, I just didn't want to take a shower in in. After a day at the beach, that is all you want to do. It had shower curtains that I didn't even dare open and the fixtures look like they had been from the 60s with the mold to boot. The room itself was big, and the bed looked great, until I got under the sheets. The sheets were made of some material that felt like a cousin to the material you use on shower curtains. Not quite vinyl, but not cotton either. They were not soft and I didn't want to touch them. I would like to give one prop to the lovely Hawaiian clerk who checked me in at reception. She was very nice, let me check in early, but gave me the wrong internet access card. By the time I realized it wasn't my phone that was in error, I was ready to leave anyway. The "cheaper" hotel restaurant menu had about 5 items on it "due to new ownership we are just starting to build our menu" and the other Italian restaurant was too expensive.The location was good and bad . I learned, being new to Oahu ,I am NOT a Waikiki lover. It is too crowded & busy. The scene at the end Ilikai is at are less busy, but the sand is like cement and the hotel is not ON the beach. You have to walk down a street sidewalk, past the harbor, past the SMOKERS' area (no other way) through the kiddie area around the Hiton Hawaiian Village, and then you are on the beach. The pool at Ilikai looked small and uninviting. The baggage service/bell hop was smug and didn't move until you handed him money.If you are a family, this is a huge hotel and has a convenience store right in the lobby, so that is the one good thing to grab last minute whatever you need...That said, NO IDEA what everyone else loves. I will never return. There are too many other hotels to pick from.

This was our second stay at the Ilikai, with many years between our 2 visits. Check-in at Reception was efficient and helpful. The hotel room was not large, but was totally adequate for our needs. The balcony overlooked the Hilton Lagoon and the Hilton's nightly Hawaiian show. It looked impressive, so we went along and enjoyed it immensely. The nightly fireworks over the lagoon were spectacular. The information desk was staffed by different people - on one occasion, extremely helpful and knowledgeable, on another, not nearly as knowledgeable.The restaurant / grill was adequate, with casual service (rather than attentive), although the servers still expected full tips for below average attention. Food there was good.There is a BRILLIANT Indian restaurant in thesmall interior mall area in the complex just over the road from the main entrance. GREAT food.Location is great, with a 10 - 15 minute walk down to the huge Ala Moana shopping centre. Just across from Starbucks is a store (japanese themed, but covering pastries, electronics, ... everything) that has a 2nd hand book section. I bought current best sellers for $2 to $5, and older titles of best selling authors for $1 or less.We wouldn't recommend taking the long trip out to the discount shopping centre (past Pearl Harbour) unless you haven't been to one before (especially on mainland USA). However, the trip to Pearl Harbour is a must.

Had stayed once before at the Ilikai many years ago, and it has been upgraded since then. But it is still a bit dated, and if you are looking to be right on Waikiki it may not be the best. As it turned out, we liked being a bit away from the action (next to but far enough away from the Hilton Hawaiian Village), it was quieter and more relaxed, and very easy to get to Waikiki from. Our room was a bit old fashioned buttery comfortable with a nice kitchen set up in each room (allowed for breakfast in the room, which we like). Nice people running the hotel. And the price was right, more than half less than the bigger named properties along Waikiki. Showing its age, but still very comfortable. Theycould use a better pool. But overall, a very good deal fro the money.
user_name:
WBreskin
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Excellent position, next to beach and marina, no roads to cross, but a bit out of the noisy scene which suited us. A 10 minute walk into the noisy restaurant and shopping of Waikiki and an easy 10 minute walk into Ala Moana mall in the other direction. Loved the location, right on beach/lagoon/marina and close enough to walk into the action at night time but far enough away to get a good nights sleep.If you're a light sleeper worth paying for sea view because if you face city, it's straight onto noisy road.The rooms and pool are a bit dated but that's reflected in the price so we were satisfied.Valet parking $25 plus tips in and out, or park at plentiful marina parking behind hotel at $1 an hour.

We were in Room 330 and stayed for 9 nights before going onto the Big Island and it was fantastic. Only a couple of floors up with partial ocean view it was great. Sat on the balcony every morning and ate breakfast while watching the boats and surfers go by which we prepared in lovely full sized kitchen with full sized fridge for groceries and drinks. Had sharp knives and breadboard for cutting up those lovely pineapples and watermelons, etc. Rooms were spotless and very large. We had a king bed and pull-out sofa for the kids, our friends had two doubles, both rooms were lovely. Towels available at the pool and beach towels available from Concierge who couldn't do enough to help. The pool was lovely, the bar and grill was lovely and a great place to be on 4th July for fireworks on Magic Island. The location was fantastic overlooking the boat harbour and Hilton Hawaiian Village lagoon (which anyone can swim in) and next to that the beach. We walked everywhere or caught "The Bus" for $2.50 and if you return within a couple of hours you get a free bus ride back. Very very close to several restaurants even though we were not in the heart of Waikiki. Short walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre where there is a Foodland store to purchase groceries (Cashier will ask you for an 8 digit number and you get Foodland discount each time you go - it saved us about $20 each shopping trip). Walmart is just behind the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Overall makings for a fantastic holiday. Couldn't fault the place.

Apartment 1710 was in the Ilikai Hotel but not a part of the hotel itself (ie you didn't check in at their reception). We rented the apartment through Ali'i Beach Rentals. Because of this I can't really comment on service aspects of the hotel itself as we didn't require any. We had two families of 3 staying there. One family with a 5yr old girl the other with a 16 yr old girl. The 6 of us were together for the first 5 nights, 2 then left leaving 4 of us (3 adults and the 5yr old) for the remaining 6 nights.Location: It was great for what we wanted to do (spend time with each other and my wife wanted to shop!) but requires an approx 1 mile walk to get to central Waikiki which generally wasn't a problem but I did have to carry our 5 year old a few times. The very large Ala Moana Shopping Centre was a 10min walk and it had numerous family friendly dining options as well as a vast array of shops (from low to high end).Amenities: The apartment was well stocked with both bath and beach towels, more than ample for the 6 of us. There was plenty of crockery and cutlery provided. We never cooked and really just ate breakfast in the apartment. The starter portions of soaps, shampoo etc provided were handy and allowed us time to get to a grocery store.Layout: The apartment is one contains one central living area which includes a dining area, lounge/TV area and kitchen. At either end of this area are the bedrooms. One bedroom had a queen bed, the other had two singles. Each bedroom had its own bathroom. Problems/Issues:1. Being two bedrooms it meant that the "children" had to share the inflatable bed in the living area. Generally it wasn't a problem but it did mean the only place the adults could converse when the 5yr old had gone to bed was the balcony. After 2 nights of this we made a bed in one of the rooms using cushions from the lounges for the younger child. 2. The living area was airconditioned via two large wall mounted units, however the bedrooms were not airconditioned. What we chose to do at night was to leave the balcony doors open and allow the night breeze through. This also meant that street noise was more than audible which generally wasn't a problem with the exception of Fri and Sat nights when it was noticably louder. Not doing this meant the room would get stuffy very quickly.3. The carpet was a very light brown/beige colour and in the living areas it was in need of a very good clean (this is the main reason for the average cleanliness rating otherwise it was very good). Hardflooring here may be a better option.Other Information/tips: 1. The view from one of the balconies was spectacular and provided a great setting to watch the 4th of July fireworks. There are weekly fireworks at the adjacent Hilton Lagoon but you can't see them from the balconies.2. The 17th floor had a coin operated laundry which we used a few times. Make sure you save your quarters for this! :-)3. Get a savings card for the Foodland store at the Ala Moana Shopping Centre (all that was needed was a US Phone number, the apartment has a phone and you canm use its number however we used a Cell phone number).All in all both families agreed that we would stay here again (Honolulu is a location that is roughly half way between Perth, Western Australia and Philidelphia and is great holiday location) and that being able to all stay in the one location represented great value.

Stayed at the Ilikai 29/6-12/7 in room 2440. Hotel room exactly as on hotel website. Good size. King size bed was ok, mattress hard and uncomfortable by end of our stay. Bathroom has bath and separate shower which was very convenient for us. Fridge in room was bonus for storing our beer and cold drink. Large lanai. We paid extra for ocean view, and it was a fantastic view too, looking out over the lagoon. We also watched nightly the hula show, the conch man, and the grand firework show on Friday evening, and also on Wednesday evening over the lagoon. Room was kept very clean, coffee and shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soaps replenished daily. 10 minute walk from Ala Moana shopping centre and park, and Magic Island. About 20 minute stroll from main Waikiki beach either along the beach or through Kalakaua Avenue past all the shops :-D. Red Lobster and Aussie Outback restaurants 5 minutes away, or go to Ala Moana shopping centre for more expensive restaurants. Go to Hard Rock Cafe on Kalakaua Avenue. The pool is small for the hotel though, and got quite busy late afternoon. We had a great time here and would recommend this hotel.

The Ilikai is a bit old but the rooms are huge, very clean and spacious. It is the cheapest hotel on the beachfront with a balcony. The restaurant on the roof top is excellent, make sure you get there in time to watch the sunset. All the tour and trolley buses stop right outside. Its a short walk to Ala Moana shopping centre. The Ilikai is away from the strip so its not noisy, but its only a $2 trolley ride to get downtown. Would definitely stay there again.

We've spent 2+ weeks in the Ilikai ... on the edge of Waikiki Beach ... perfect location, great views, very reasonable prices in the Ilikai Bar for food/drinks, the greatest view in Hawaii from Sarento's on top of the hotel ... BEST HOTEL VALUE ON OAHU!

Ilikai may be aging, but she's still the best for me. Its clean, well maintained, large, convenient to locations such as the Ala Moana Shopping center where you can just cross the street and take a bus there-- only around 2 stops. The Hilton lagoon next door is good to enjoy, Waikiki is close by where you could also just take a bus there if you don't want to walk. In short, you can be close by to things while avoiding the tourist crowd and pretend you're a local. I came back to stay with my two teenage daughters and our room was spacious, had a great view from the lanai, the kitchen was well equipped and it just felt so good! I'm very into how a lodging "feels", and this place always has a very good vibe to it. Every Friday night, there would be a dazzling firecracker show on display near the Hilton lagoon area and where best to view it but from the Ilikai!

This was our 3rd stay at the Ilikai, mainly because it offers a full kitchen (which we use with our 2 young kids) and the location (easy walk to Ala Moana). We have always stayed in the 2 bedroom apartments, but have had friends/family stay in the hotel rooms too, and these are always huge and clean. It's showing it's age, and could do with a refurb, but it's clean, and the staff are always polite.This is the perfect hotel when you have young kids (ours are now 5 & 3), and can choose between swimming at the pool (pretty average pool area), the lagoon or the beach.We take the kids scooters with us, so it's easy for them to scooter to Ala Moana, or even into Waikiki.
Excellent Hotel. Great location.Very relaxing vacation spot. Great restauarnt and view at Sarento's on the 30th floor.

We have come to like this place after a bit of a rough start and mediocre first impression. I found out via email that not all rooms have a full kitchen; some have only microwave and mini fridge. So we paid $40/night to upgrade to full kitchen (with 2 kids that was the primary reason for this choice). When we got to our room, we found a king bed and sofa bed. I had specifically asked for two doubles/ queens. Chester at the front desk said that all full-kitchen rooms have only one bed. This was not mentioned in my emails with their staff. So, after my complaining, Chester upgraded us to a newly remodeled room ("just released"). A big improvement! We also really disliked the concierge service that was relentlessly trying to get us to sign up for their time share orientation. Honestly, we just wanted to ask about where to eat dinner without being sold anything. Please eliminate the salespeople sitting at the concierge desk. The grounds are in a bit of disrepair (need to renovate the exterior) so plan to enjoy the exquisite grounds next door at the Hilton. However, we talked to another family and discovered that it's $100 less/night to stay at Ilikai than Hilton plus we have kitchen and fairly good service (not available at the Hilton).

We stayed for 3 nights going to Alaska and 1 night on our return to Sydney. The rooms are large, clean and showing ware but well maintained. Independent air conditioners helped with our changes in climate. Location is fairly good with a variety of restaurants, shops and the Ala Moana Shopping Centre within a short walk. Access to the beach is in one direction only however it is close to a family safe, man made lagoon. Resent restyling of the Lobby area meant that many of the hotel shops and restaurant are yet to be fully occupied and operational. We arrived very early in the morning and expected to have to store our luggage but were given access to our room immediately…Great service Ilikai! As with most Hawaiian businesses the friendly and very helpful staff did not disappoint.
