We enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai. It was my husband, two daughters ages 13 and 7, and myself. We stayed on the 24th (2424) floor with two double beds.Pros: Lovely lobby, beautiful views, good location, close to Waikiki and many restaurants, Hilton's lagoon next door, friendliness/helpfulness of staff, Ala Moana center nearby.Cons: Small swimming pool, dated rooms (need new carpet and new covering for chair...The chair was thread bare in places), air condition was over the beds and blew right on you laying in bed, but you had to leave it on, or the bathroom got warm. We would also like to make a recommendation to put two queen size beds in the room instead of two double beds. We stayed here three nights, and we had a good stay.

Stayed 6 nights in the Ilikai on the the 23rd floor and would go again. Room was spacious and very comfortable. View from the balcony was terrific, and an added bonus was an up-close view of the fireworks on the lagoon on Friday night. Just a short stroll around the lagoon to a very uncrowded part of Waikiki and plenty of shops and restaurants. The bar/grill at the hotel was fine for a snack and breakfast, but some wider choices in the Hawaiian Village complex just down the beach. My only complaint was that the concierge gave us bad information about a visit to the Pearl Harbor memorial. We were never told we needed advanced tickets, and the concierge booked us a shuttle without explaining this. The hotel apologized for our wasted trip with some champagne and candy, which was a pleasant surprise. We also got a reduction in parking fee when we requested it at registration. Hotel provides free towels and beach chairs, which is a welcome perk. Pool is a little small and no hot tub. Business center is available, but they charge for internet access and printing our boarding passed, which I felt was not warranted.

I really liked our stay. The room had a nice kitchen with utensils, plates, bowls, pots and pans. The bed was very comfortable. The elevator was fast (we were on the 9th floor) and washer/dryer on every floor. We ordered Papa Johns Pizza to our room one night at a reasonable price. The daily service gives towels and coffee replacements only. They had extra toiletries in the closet so we never had to ask for any. We enjoyed the fireworks from our lanai on Friday night- very close up on the beach! They set them off every Friday at 7:45pm. It's an easy walk to the beach, the lagoon next door, ABC store and Enterprise rent-a-car is across the street. We got an economy car on a budget and only stopped for gas once and we drove a lot. This hotel is pretty, affordable, and clean.

My recent experience at the Ilikai is one worth writing about. This is truly a great hotel and I especially want to thank the valet staff. Every morning we were greeted by a lovely local girl named Kendra who always had a smile on her face and a smile in her voice. Her friendliness was extremely refreshing. She was helpful with giving us directions and advising us on local attractions. The valet staff retrieved our rental car within minutes. Having valet parking at this hotel was truly a blessing as locating our vehicle or finding a parking space was never a problem for us every day.

On the original Hawaii Five-0 TV series any time there was a VIP in town they always stayed at the Ilikai. I've wanted to stay at the Ilikai ever since I was stationed at Hickam AFB in the early 70's. Finally got to. Great hotel and great staff. My original reservation was with a mountain view but when I checked in I was told that I had been given a free upgrade to an ocean view with a kitchenette. I had a rental car (as usual) and the Ilikai has valet parking. This may cost more but it's worth it. The other hotels that I've stayed at not only rent parking to guests, but also to non-guests. I've had to check six floors of parking garage to find a space. No such problem at the Ilikai and I never had to wait longer than 2-3 minutes for the valet to bring my car around. I never ate at the hotel, but Red Lobster, Outback and other restaurants are within walking distance. If you have to have fast food there's a McDonald's across the street. There is shopping available at the hotel with several boutique shops, including a shopette. There are other shopping places nearby. The Ilikai was everything I thought it would be and then some. On Friday nights there is a small local Hawaiian show and a fireworks display that is put on by the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door. (The hotel name is pronounced EE-li-k~eye.)

I just got back from a week's stay in Honolulu, right on Waikiki Beach at the Ilikai Hotel. It's a great hotel, great staff, and the location cannot be beat. We stayed on the 23rd floor, ocean view room and had an amazing westerly view of the Ala Wai Boat Harbor and the ocean beyond. This hotel is just the right mix of old and new. It's not too posh, or stuffy, but still very nice. The staff is helpful, friendly and tries very hard to meet your needs. It's very convenient to have the bus and trolley stops right outside the front of the hotel. The ground level restaurant leaves a bit to be desired (although the coffee shop was fine) and the Italian restaurant at the top of the hotel is very good, but a bit pricey. Good for a special occasion. It's handy to be so close to the Hilton Hawaiian Village (right next door) as they have more eating options. Try the Tropics Bar & Grill - good food, waterfront view and live music. Overall I would recommend the Ilikai.

This Hotel is very central to the beaches , Ala Moana shopping centre I am 73 years old and had no trouble walking to Ala Moana or the centre of Waikiki.The fireworks on Friday night and also the Polynesian dance show at the Hilton are some added extras but.............. make sure you get a room or apartment above floor ten and on the ocean side facing the Hilton and LagoonThis is also the quiet side and the ocean is very serene............ at least it was during May .The staff are wonderful and the shopping for food or restaurants plus buses to the door make this my choice of accommodation in Waikiki.

Just returned from a trip to Maui and Oahu. We chose the Ilikai to be out of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but near enough to enjoy it. Room was very large with two double beds and lots of room to spare. Wide lanai(balcony) gave us an amazing view of the marina and ocean. Pool was nice and deep, but roped off shallow end for younger and novice swimmers. Nearby pool house for showers was a plus - a bit dated but nice to be able to shower before heading back to the room on the 23rd floor. (A woman who owns one of the condos at Ilikai said that they would soon be updating the pool house within the year.) Fireworks were visible from rooms ending in 16-26. We were on the ground a block away and enjoyed the show. Beautiful lobby and entrance, shuttles stop right out front for convenience in getting to Waikiki and beyond. Did not need a car and used taxi to get to and from airport. Another plus was being able to check in early. Our room was available so we were in before noon. Hotel will also keep bags if room is not available.
We thought the staff was most courteous and helpful, and appreciated the concierge service.The Ilikai has an excellent location. Our condo was well equipped and the view supurb.

We arrived on the red eye and got tot the hotel at 6am. They found a room that was clean and let us check in early which was amazing! We had breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. And their pancakes were amazing, skip the french toast. The daily cleaning service was fast ans thorough. The only downside is it is a very small pool. I would definately stay there again!

We stayed three nights at the end of May at condo 1718, which we booked via waikikioceanfrontrentals.com. Overall, we were quite happy with our choice. The Ilikai is a bit removed from all the hustle and bustle of the center of Waikiki. It is about a half hour walk to most of the shops and restaurants. Although there are closer options as well. The lobby and public areas were nice. As a condo visitor, you have to be abit more assertive to get some information from the valet, concierge etc. But everyone was pleasant. Note--they do have a luggage elevator/conveyor belt so you don't need to schlep your luggage up and down the steps or escalator. Just ask for assistance! Condo users are charged a dollar or two a bag for the hotel to hold the luggage if you need to check out before your flight. It is a relatively short walk to the beach, but it is a walk...and you might get jealous of the Hilton next door and all their lovely amenities! Anyway, this particular condo had a nice view of the lagoon and ocean (though not a direct sunset view, for those who care). You could also see and hear the Hilton's nightly luau, though it isn't terribly disturbing. The condo had a pretty comfortably king bed, with flat, uncomfortable pillows. The bathroom was very nice, and the kitchen and living room were well decorated, with enough places to put all your stuff. However, oddly, there didn't seem to be any living room lights except in the bookcase area...so no way to read a book on the couch. Lighting is a pet peeve of mine. The wireless internet was good, and also worked on the lanai. The chairs on the lanai were comfortable. .I don't recall ever hearing any other guests, so I guess the soundproofing is okay! Their are laundry facilities on the floor, near the elevators. The kitchen glasses were spotty and I didn't care to use them. They provide 2 beach towels, but could either have provided more, or had a plusher set. The basic soap, etc they leave you with were fine for us, but I would have liked to have more tissues and a roll of paper towels, and some more items in the kitchen pantry. Waikikoceanfrontrentals were great to work with. I love the fact that the door had a combination lock, so you didn't have to worry about carrying keys.We rented a car two separate days from Alamo right across the street....it was easier than renting two days and then having to pay for parking overnight! The beach in front of the hilton is just okay. You need sand shoes. The sand is coarse and if you go swimming, there are stones and rocks on the bottom. The lagoon was weirdly colder than the ocean.

I recently won a one night hotel stay at any Aqua Hotels on Oahu! After holding off till practically the last month of the duration of the coupon, We decided to try out one of the Aqua properties. Our first choice was the Best Western Coconut, but sadly, Aqua no longer carried them as of June 1, 2012. Our next choice was actually a toss up between the Ilikai and the Aqua Bamboo. Because the Bamboo is on the main busy strip of Kuhio, we decided to go with the Ilikai Hotel, had requested a high floor. Since we live on Oahu anyway, we wanted to just take advantage of trying to check in early. We were told guest parking was valet only and was told a rate of $25.00. When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted pretty quickly with the personable Jeremy. He advised us that we would have in and out privileges and that the valet could be charged to the room. He later directed us to where we needed to go to check in. He was very friendly and didn't make us feel rushed, even though there were a few people waiting for their cars. We were quickly received at the front desk by a smiling and friendly Rizelle. She quickly found our reservation and explained to us about the beach towel and beach chair services. I thought that was pretty cool that a hotel would offer those services, and at no cost at all. Provided you returned them promptly. To my surprise, I did get a high floor, and boy was it high. We got the 25th floor, one floor short of the penthouse. But we were happy!The hotel lobby was very clean and airy. I knew they renovated and was pretty happy with what we've seen so far. Entering the room, we were amazed at how large the room was! It was clean and was very presentable. Mind you, Ilikai is not a luxury, so we weren't expecting that. But for what they offer and the price, we were extremely happy. The free room coupon was for a standard run of the house. What we got was a high floor, mountain view room. The view, although not oceanview, was still pretty good. If we had checked in the day before, we would have been able to view the Kamehameha parade down below on Ala Moana Blvd. We went downstairs to check out the pool. After checking with the concierge, she directed us to the pool area. The Ilikai shares the lobby deck with The Modern pool so we were somewhat confused. Ilikai's pool was pretty disappointing. Compared to the Modern next door it's rather small and enclosed. There were quite a few kids that day so there was no room for swimming. We decided to just go to the beach at the Hilton Lagoon for the rest of the day. All in all, we were pleasantly surprised. We would definitely stay here again.

My family stayed for 10 days in 2 different units on 2 different floors and it was wonderful. My parents stayed in a studio condo and my daughters family and I stayed in a 2 bedroom condo. Both units were very clean, comfortable, and modern. The two bedroom condo was unit 1334 and it was beautiful. Two bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen, living room, double lanai, 3 flat screen TV's, and plenty of storage space. One bathroom had a shower while the other had a tub/shower (and a badet:) The studio unit 1412 was also beautiful but definitely smaller and more fit for a couple. It had a kitchen, 2 queen beds, pull out couch and shower. Both of our condos had a ocean/marina view and we watched the fireworks from the lanais. The security at the Ilikai was top rate. We had 3 small children under age 10 and felt safe and secure. The Ilikai is definitely more laid back than some of the other hotels but not in a bad way. It is situated so that you aren't in the middle of the Waikiki chaos but you can walk or drive quickly there if you want to experience it. I really can't say enough great things about Ilikai. I would recommend it to everyone AND plan to only stay there for future Hawaii vacations. Everything was perfect and I cannot thank all of the staff enough. Mahalo and Aloha!

The management and staff at the Ilikai Hotel & Suites were outstanding again. The room was on the 22nd floor with a great ocean sunset view. We were able to see the lighting of the lanterns. The sunsets were great. The housekeeping staff made things nice each day when we got back from the beach or excursions. This is a great place to stay.

We statyed in unit # 938. If you are looking for a modern updated hotel this is not for you. The decor is in dire need of an update. The outside grounds are pleasant but was just lacking that wow factor. When we walked off the elevator to our room we were overcome by a smell of a nursing home, for a lack of a better term. The carpet in the hallway was old and we felt like were in a bad apartment building. Walking into our room we were greeted by a huge refrigerator to our right. Weird place for a fridge. The unit is small(which we knew) with Ikea type furniture. The sofa bed is a futon not a bed. The coffee table is old and outdated. The double beds are also very uncomfortable as I am pretty sure they were bought at Ikea as well. The kitchen is nice with newer appliances, but no toaster as stated on their website. The bathroom vanity is very small with no room to place any of your toiletries. The shower is ok but looked like they needed to clean better in the corners. Was turning black just a few days into our stay. The balcony had plastic tables and chairs, but a great view of the ocean. I think that might have been the most redeeming quality. The website says that their is ocean views by the pool, WRONG! There is no ocean views as it is blocked by trees and foliage. Maybe the trees are put there so the cigarette smokers can have some privacy. This was so gross. All the smokers congregate by the outside pool wall and smoke. So make sure you sit at the opposite end of the pool. The pool is extremely small and warm. We are in Hawaii where the water should be a little cold. Just not refreshing. If you want a drink you can walk all the way around the outside of the building to get to the bar. There is a bar attendant but had to go and get her. We did not eat at the Bar and Grill as we were afraid after seeing the pool. This hotel was just not up to par. We were looking to save a few bucks by staying in a condo but will pay the extra money next time for room service and clean sheets every day.

We stayed in condo 1904 for a week at the end of May 2012. We've visited the Ilikai a dozen times over the past 28 years and noticed it was looking run down on our last visit, about 5 years ago. It has since been rejuvenated, and seems fresh again. We love the location--walking distance to Ala Moana Beach Park and the Ala Moana Mall--and the retro vibe. We started staying there when we were in our twenties and we appreciated being on the quiet end of Waikiki at that time; we were happy to see the place is still that way. It is not the Hilton Village but that isn't what we were looking for. Our condo had good wi-fi and that was another important factor for us. We love the Ilikai and will be back again.

We had room 1735, king-sized bed, ocean view with full kitchen. The location was good, near buses (many buses stop right outside, lots more accessible from the Ala Moana shopping center). Being on the ocean side meant our room was fairly quiet, though we did hear noise from room upstairs at times. Basic cable only, no movies or on-demand programs. The lobby is gorgeous, but the room itself was a bit decrepit -- there was a big hole in bathroom wall (see picture), a hole in the screen that you can pull partway across between bed and TV area, the shag carpet smelled moldy. There was no bathtub, shower floor was seriously stained and grubby-looking. The king-sized bed was comfortable, all the linens were clean. Kitchen has stove and oven and dishwasher as well as fridge and microwave; but, they provide you with some very old and bent silverware, and we ended up not using the dishwasher because there was no dishwasher soap provided. Really great view from the lanai. Other negatives: the sofa by the TV was uncomfortable, scratchy and cheap, curved so that two people sitting on it can't find a comfortable way to put their legs. The AC unit is placed so that it blows directly into your face when you're sitting on the sofa. Strangely super-cheap, bad quality TP and tissues. Don't be fooled by the "in-room dining" button on the phone, there is no room service.The worst thing about the Ilikai was the service, which was downright surly (example: I forgot our beach towel cards in the room when we checked out, and they insisted I go back upstairs and get them; when I went to pick up "welcome packet" -- just some coupons for burger restaurants -- the concierge was on the phone with someone and basically just tossed the coupons at me). Overall, no frills -- okay because of location and view, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Our family occupied four of the condos and one room in the hotel side and everyone was satisfied and happy with the facilities. We attended a wedding in the Modern hotel next door and was very convenient. I love the way all of us have access to shops, restaurants, pools, beach and parks for the three neighboring hotels. The Hilton Hawaiian village is on the other side of Ilikai Hotel. Public transportation and taxis for large groups are easily accessible. We are grateful for an enjoyable and problem free stay!

Not sure why, but everytime I go to Hawaii I feel like I have been transported back in time about 20 years. The hotel is nice, location is great withing walking distance to the main shopping areas, International Market, restaurants, etc. For shopping and dinner, go check out the Ala Moana Mall (5 minute walk) - one of the most beautiful malls I have ever seen. Staff was great - very friendly and helpful. Room was big and comfortable with a great view as I was on the 22nd floor. The only minor setback, and it's not even a complaint by any means, is that everything is slightly dated. The hotel itself, rooms, etc. seemed as if we were again in late 80's. Gym is also slightly dated, but it is adequate and everything works. Overall the hotel is clean, nice, very good location, and I do recommend it, having stayed at many other places in Hawaii.

We stayed at the Ilikai as a less-expensive alternative to the Hilton, where our friends were getting married. Would definitely stay again! We walked in with our luggage and were greeted by an extremely friendly staff at the front desk. We arrived at noon, but could not check in until 3pm. However, the hotel was happy to store our luggage for us in a locked room and, upon return, the staff brought our bags up to our room for us and filled up our ice chest voluntarily. The staff always had a smile on their face and treated us like royalty (despite the fact that we're both grad students in our mid-twenties). We had asked for a high floor with a Hilton lagoon and ocean view, and were given a great room on the 24th floor with a terrific view of both. The room was huge, at least as big as our friends' rooms at the Hilton (and for half the price). The bed was comfortable, the TV was a large flat screen mounted on the wall, and the bathroom was large with a separate bath and shower. The terrace was much larger than I imagined- it would have easily fit 10 people comfortably, maybe 15.Upon asking the valet service how to get a taxi to take us to Pearl Harbor, I was informed by the valet representative that his dad ran a limo service that costs the same as a taxi, and he would just call them to pick us up. Sure enough, a white limousine arrived at the hotel and took us to Pearl Harbor for the same price as a taxi to the airport (about $40.00 with tip). The crew also sent another limo to pick us up from Pearl Harbor after our visit. Never had to wait.The hallways were clean and vacuumed every day. The elevators were fully functional and quick. The bar and grill downstairs had decent food and drink prices, but the service was just... meh. Not anything to write home about, but not bad at all.We never visited the pool because we're just across the way from the beach, a very easy walk around the Hilton lagoon. The area was safe and well monitored. The location is extremely convenient. The Royal Hawaiian Shopping center is a 10-15 minutes walk, and everything worth doing on the beach was within 20 minutes. We only rented for a couple of days to drive the back way to North Shore (highly recommended!)On our last day, our flight did not depart until 11pm. The Ilikai was happy to accomodate us with a late check out of 2pm, and then allow us to store our bags for the rest of the day for free in the above-referenced room. Upon dropping our bags off, the staff voluntarily set up a shuttle to pick us up later that evening and take us to the airport for only $20, cutting the cost of a taxi in half.I am entirely satisfied with my experience at the Ilikai, and will definitely stay again!

Returned recently from 12 days on beautiful Oahu and was fortunate enough to stay at the Ilika for most of that time. This was our 6th time to Oahu and without a doubt, the Ilikai is now our favorite place to stay. The room was immaculate, updated and huge! I especially enjoyed the bed as they bedding and mattresses too where updated and so comfortable. There where just enough amenities on the grounds to meet your needs without being overwhelming. The courtyard was so pretty and again just the right size. Sitting out there each morning looking out over the marina and the beautiful Pacific, with a fabulous cup of coffee from the coffee shop was the perfect way to start the day. As a photographer, I so enjoyed photographing the beautiful flowers in the courtyard and the birds that played and bathed in the waterfall. Go Ilikai!!!!!, we can't wait to return again!!

I don't think the website photos do justice to the hotel. I wasn't expecting much but when we walked into the foyer i thought "WOW" this place looks like a how a holiday resort should look like. Sure the outside looks outdated, but who looks on the outside. The view from our room was amazing, the lagoon was great for the kids, bus stop out the front and across the road, hired a car for the day from the building across the road. A convenience store inside the hotel as well as 2 ABC shops, McDonalds, Subway across the road and the friendly staff from Front Desk up to the ladies cleaning our room all made for an enjoyable and would return to stay.

My famiy stayed in a 2 bedroomed condo here and were very pleased. The room is a great size and the kitchen was nice in the mornings for coffee. It is a very mellow hotel - perfect for relaxing and enjoying hawaii. Our room overlooked the lagoon and marina - amazing sunsets - we had two lanai's and could see the fireworks at the Hilton and their luau! Perfect for relaxing after a day of activity. On the ground floor of the hotel there is a store, coffee shop and a grill/bar (which had live music many nights) and some gift stores - everything you could need!The pool is smaller than some of the larger and newer hotels so keep that in mind if you have younger kids who might wants slides etc. However, it was perfect for us and we never had a problem getting chairs etc. There is also poolside service.The hotel is only about a 10-15 minute walk to the center of waikiki - not a problem at all and the walk home after another huge meal was nice! There are many dining options within two minutes of the hotel though. We really liked the location as it was close to the mall also and the parks for jogging - the walk to the beach took about 4 minutes but we did not have small kids.We did not have much contact with hotel staff but those we met were nice and efficient.Overall I would recomment this hotel for space and location.

I have been coming to this hotel for many years--and It seems to get better and better each time we stay. Recently, I booked a room for my family as well as my brother and his family--Lets just say our experience was perfect. I cant tell you enough about the friendliness of the staff. Each staff member greets ALL guests--if your a tourist or a local person (we've had negative experiences staying at hotels nearby where they wont even greet guests no matter what type of guest). Ilikai has a beautiful view--its not as crowded as others nearby. I can't wait to go back for another stay!!

My wife and I found the overall appearance and layout of the Ilikai Hotel to be excellent. All of the hotel staff that we had contact with were very friendly, especially the bell staff who handled our somewhat extensive luggage, both when we checked in, and checked out with great efficiently. The hotel outdoor cafe was very pleasant, an we anticipate visiting the newly planned restaurant on a future visit.

Stayed here jan 2012. Location is perfect just far enough from downtown Waikiki so you don't get all the crowds but close enough you can walk. There's a pub right at the marina that served a great breakfast for $6, avoid the chain breakfast places too $$. We stayed on the 24th floor of the marina side, spectacular sunset views. Left the lanai doors open 24/7 never got hot or cool just perfect. Hotel is very clean well looked after. Some people may say rooms are a bit dated but cleanliness is more important for me. Pool was warm and beautiful. Great lounge chairs, sometimes needed to get there early to make sure you got one. Within walking distance to nearby park or the mall. The price was very good considering our view and location. I will be staying here again on my next trip to Honolulu/Waikiki

I am originally from Honolulu and come back often to visit friends and family. This hotel is the best, as it is close to Ala Moana Shopping Center, and access is easy via Ala Moana Boulevard. The views, both city and beach, are fantastic. The staff is wonderful; they recognize us when we check in and provide great service. On a scale of one to ten, this hotel is a twenty in my book!!

My daughter and I went to Hawaii for a wedding and decided to book a place with a kitchen to cut costs. We couldn't have chosen a better place! We loved our suite - loved the view of the lagoon and ocean and everything else. We found it nice to not be in downtown Waikiki even though we walked there many times during our trip (approx 25 minutes). The wedding had it's reception dinner upstairs at Sorrentos and it was lovely! Since it was a Friday we were able to watch the spectacular fireworks from the Hilton Hawaiian Village - it was pretty awesome!!We definitely plan to go back!!
We loved our stay at the Ilikai. The view was incredible from the Honeymoon Suite on the 25th floor. We highly recommend it!

We are a family that appreciates a little quiet. This hotel was a great location for that. It is right off the marina and a couple of miles from Waikiki beach, which is easily accessible by walking or taking the bus. We took the bus for all of our excursions and found it very easy to navigate. We especially liked the hotel's location because it was right next door to the Hilton's lagoon for our toddler. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful.

We stayed at the Ilikai Hotel the day before and the day after our inter-island cruise in Hawaii. It's located right between the harbor and the edge of Waikiki Beach and next door to the Hilton Village and lagoon. We arrived on a Friday and were able to sit by the lagoon and watch fireworks. The location was easy to get transportation to from the airport or tour buses. Multiple restaurants and shops are within walking distance. There is a mall that is not far as well. This is the hotel featured in the opening scenes of the old Hawaii Five-O TV series. The outside decor is dated to that time period, but the inside is timeless and very nice. There are shops surrounding the lobby area and a nice restaurant at the top with a great view while you dine or have a drink. There are plenty of places to sit and relax with beautiful flowerbeds and plants everywhere. The room was very nice and spacious. We had one room on the 22nd floor and one on the 25th floor. They each had a small balcony with a table and chairs where we could enjoy the view. The service at the front desk was top notch. This hotel is a great value. We really enjoyed our stay.

We chose this hotel on the recommendation of a family member and the reviews of others on Trip Advisor - their descriptions were right on target. The rooms were comfortable, clean and spacious. The bathroom had a separate shower and bathtub and significant closet space. The maid service was excellent and front desk staff were courteous and helpful. We asked for a room near the top and a view of the marina and mountains. The only real ding on this hotel is the fact that there is no casual dining restaurant or coffee shop on property. There is a nice but expensive restaurant at the top of the hotel and a bar on the first floor neither of which we tried. However, The Ilikai is right next door to the much more expensive Hilton Hawaiian Village. We took an easy walk next door for several meals or walked a short distance across the street to a McDonald's for breakfast and a small coffee shop. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Don't waste time looking anywhere else unless ther is no room at the Ilikai.

The Ilikai is a comfortable, spacious hotel that retains a bit of the slightly kitschy retro fabulousness it must have had back in the Hawaii Five-0 days. Our room was spotlessly clean, and surprisingly large (actually, the largest hotel room I've ever experienced). Our view was spectacular -- truly -- and our room rate was less than half what my friends staying next door at The Modern paid.The pool is average, and the restaurant/bar won't win any awards, but you're right next door to The Modern, whose pool and restaurant are quite nice. Also, my bed was a bit too firm for my taste.Area-wise, the good news is that you're off the beaten Waikiki path, but the bad news is that you're off the beaten Waikiki path. (And that path has been beaten to a bloody pulp.) The property is, mercifully, far enough away from Waikiki proper that you won't have to deal with the Vegas-by-the-beach set, but eating options are more limited than at hotels further east. (Given the choice, though, I'll take the latter any day.)I would absolutely stay here again if I was in Waikiki.

We're locals who wanted a mini staycation getaway, and so happy to have chosen the Ilikai to do so. From the time we drove up, the valet attendants were very courteous and quick in getting someone to help us with our bags. The front desk person was friendly and efficient, and check-in was a breeze. And knowing we were in a bit of a rush to get out and start enjoying ourselves, the bellman brought our bags to the room right away. The room was very modern, clean, and spacious. And the location of the hotel is within walking distance of many shops, restuarants, and the beach. The Ilikai is an awesome place to stay! I highly recommened it to both locals and visitors to our island...

We choose a room with double beds, and we get a very spacious room.The internet was fast.The only thing we could not found was the external elevator which works from 5pm. to 10 pm...It is very close to everything but not on the crowded side of Honolulu.

We recently stayed one night at the Ilikai Hotel in a hotel room - not a condo. The hotel was easy to find and everyone right from the parking guys out front were so friendly and helpful. Check-in was a breeze. We had several questions for the concierge about places we wanted to visit and he was great - gave us tons of good information.We were extremely pleased with the location of our room. It was one floor before the penthouse, I think it was the 24th floor. The Hilton hotel next door has fireworks every Friday night. Our stay was on a Friday and I really hoped to see the fireworks. When I checked in the they told us they'd given us an ocean view room overlooking the Hilton so that we could watch the fireworks. It was really nice that they did that without being asked. When we got up to the room we were very pleased with the size of the room. It was really large. The balcony was fabulous, it was huge! It was so nice sitting on the balcony with a bottle of wine watching the fireworks on such a beautiful night. We also had a view of Diamond Head, so the location couldn't be beat.The room itself wasn't in the best of shape. The carpet had some stains on it. I have no complaints about the beds - they were spotless and comfortable. The bathroom was the biggest problem area. It was a big bathroom. It had a bathtub/shower combo and sink with large counter when you first walk into it, then a closed off area with a toilet and another shower. The bathtub/shower combo looked like it had been replaced fairly recently and was in good shape. However, the toilet and the stand-alone shower were really old. The tiles on the bottom of it were kind of gross... I wouldn't have stood on it for anything. In the middle of the night when the toilet was used, it wouldn't stop running. My husband had to get up at 2:00 a.m. and take the lid off the tank and fix it. It happened every time we used it. The bottom line is the rooms are a little tired. I certainly wouldn't have wanted to stay in the room for any more than a night or two. However, the location, the service and the views were so good at the Ilikai, it made for a pleasant stay for one night.

We rented unit 2008 privately and were thrilled with our stay. Beautiful room, really nicely modernized. Fantastic View and pretty quiet. About 10 minute walk from Ala Moana Shopping Centre and about a 15 minute walk to the main section of Waikiki. Highly recommend and we'll be back.

Great place to stay in Honolulu on the beach and close to everything. Clean rooms with a fantastic view at a low price. Can't beat that. Will definitely come back. My kids and parents loved it. We had a presidential suite and the two grandparents got the 2 bedroom apartment. We paid half the price of the next door Hilton. I think it's a waist of money to stay anywhere else. Most of the rooms have been recently renovated so they are really nice and clean.

For "first-time in a long time" visitors to Honolulu it was an absolute delight to rent the Ilikai suite from Doug. The suite was clean, very well appointed (it even included some 'leftovers' from previous guests for the beach use) and the location was perfect for the Friday night firework display that took place right ouside our balcony! The city bus ($15 for four years seniors pass) stopped right outside the front door of the hotel and the pool and the sea front was on the other side about 30 paces away. We couldn't have been happier for three weeks; we saw the sights and walked a lot but when we got tired, we took the bus home. Yes we'll do it again.

We watched the fireworks from our room in the 24th floor, it was incredible. Very comfortable room and bed, bathroom it's small and water pressure not that great but overall very good. Perfect location and staff very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again
The room was perfect. Having a kitchen saved alot on food expense. The staff was friendly and helpful in attraction advice. Our room was clean and a perfect view.

Good sized rooms, good views, especially if facing ocean and great staff. The tour desk in the lobby told us exactly how to do some of the bigger sites without needing to purchase a tour as well as recommending others. Position is good, a little out of Waikiki (10min walk) and a similar distance to Ala Moana shopping centre. Had a good trip, good weather helped.

A very nice place in a very expensive city. It was priced great. Concierge was so helpful. Car rental place in hotel lobby. Wasnt impressed with Ilikai bar and grill. Hotel itself is wonderful. Rooms are spacious. Bathroom shower could have been a bit cleaner but sufficed for the great price!! Would definitley stay here again.

Another visit to the Ilikai, it is a great hotel with the greatest staff who are very helpfull and can't do enough for you. From the singing group on Friday nights to the lighting the torches and conch shell blowing each evening it makes you feel you are in hawaii. lovely sunday service on the ground floor at 9 am make for a special time. lovely sunset view will always stay when we go to oahu.
We never go wrong when we choose to stay at an Aqua Hotel! We highly recommend the Illikai!!

First stay, we can only recommend it.Great location if one wants to stay a little away from busy WAIKIKI centre.Only one bus stop from the "Ala Moana", walkable.Reasonable priced and very friendly frontdesk and housekeeping staff. Nice view from the 22nd floor ocean side.When in Honolulu we'll definitely stay at the ILIKAI again. Travelled as a couple.

We stayed here during a stopover on our flight from New York to Australia. Not our first time to Hawaii but our first time at this hotel. The hotel has both good and bad points but overall it is a great place to stay.First the good: Room size - had an ocean view room on 23rd floor - view of the beach can't be beaten and the balcony is generous - great place to have breakfast or just relax with a drink to watch the ocean. The room itself had a marvellous armchair for watching TV - overall just a very comfortable environment for winding down. A fridge, microwave and coffee maker are also there if you don't want to go out. The bathroom had a bath, separate shower and toilet which these days you don't find in more modern rooms. The furnishings were in good conditions and housekeeping was spot on. Downstairs the lobby area has a cafe selling takeaway items and a shop with provisions for the room.Location: A 10 minute walk will have you back in the main restaurant zone. At night this is definitely a positive as the main street is very noisy especially on the weekend. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Ala Moana shopping centre which also has many dining options and great shopping.Now the negatives: There are few options for eating within the hotel - you need to go father afield. The entrance may also be a problem for some - there is an elevator but it is tucked away so you need to ask where it is if the stairs are difficult. As for the escalator at the front - it is either under maintenance or turned off most of the time. (I have been here on 4 different occasions in the last 6 months and this has been the case)Overall, I would recommend this hotel - it is rather like staying in someone's home - familiar and comfortable.

We arrived at Honolulu airport at 21.30 after a long flight from LHR, UK. We had slept on the plane from LAX, so at least we had our wits about us. The hotel were expecting us & also knew we had requested a high room facing the sea.What a stunning view of the Ala Wai Yacht Harbour, awaited us the next morning. The only downside was that the outdoor 'snack bar'at the hotel had stopped serving breakfasts in February and we had not been informed. Compensation was a coffee shop on site, also a supermarket, but as we only had a tiny microwave and coffee perculator, without any cooking utensils, the microwave was of no use. We decided to explore and found a small pub on the harbor corner, which served very acceptable breakfast specials with 3 eggs! Our room was cleaned daily and there was laundry room close to the lifts on our floor (22) The corridor carpets looked new, the hawaiian trees were soothing.The starting point for the Red Line Waikiki Trolley, was outside the hotel.I would certainly recommend this hotel.

My Husband and I have stayed in Hawaii 10 times, and all but the first time, (when we knew nothing much), we have stayed at the Ilikai Hotel. From the room cleaning staff, to the Valet Parking team, the front desk, (thank you Joli), and the General Manager, Terry Dowsett, we have received nothing but friendliness, and respect, and helpfulness. My Husband and I decided on the spur of the moment to renew our vows while we were there this time. Knowing nothing of what we had to do, we decided to ask Terry for his help. He went out of his way (and he is a very busy man), to find us a Minister, and to try and get permission for us to marry at sunset at the Lagoon. He wasn't able to do that for us after trying for a few days, but we found another perfect spot 4 minutes drive away, called Magic Island. From a certain spot, where we renewed our vows, you could see the Hotel in the background, the Lagoon, and all of Waikiki down to Diamond Head. It really was magical. Terry also organised our traditional Hawaiian wedding Leis for us. The rooms are huge, beds huge, (we actually had to get rid of a few pillows so we could meet in the middle) lol !!!! The entertainment on a Friday night downstairs is lovely, the traditional way the torches are lit every night and the conch shell blowing, all adds to the overall atmosphere at this hotel. The gardens and flowers are always well tended to, with the mini waterfalls flowing, and the tree with the lights wrapped around and through it. We made use of this beautiful space in the courtyard to take nighttime shots after we had dinner at Sorento's at the very top of the hotel on our special day. The addition of the coffee shop downstairs was a wonderful idea. They could actually make a proper iced coffee, yay !! We feel as if we are coming home every time we come back to Hawaii, and especially the Ilikai Hotel.

Clean and comfortable with a friendly staff. We had a high floor with an ocean view that also shared a glimpse of Diamond Head. The room was spacious which made it comfortable for three people.Bathrooms were well worn and a bit outdated but kept clean. Vaccume was not used as well as I would have at home and not at all during the week in the hallways which is a drawback when others track in sand. The hotel has a special elevator for those who are sandy and wet, unfortunately most of the clintele didn't use it which created a mess. The location is a quick walk to most dining and shopping in the area which was good becasue the hotel itself lacked dining options.

My two daughters and myself stayed here for 4 days after a 2 month European tour on the way home. It was the perfect choice for a relaxing stay. The room was really nice with a superb view. The hotel could do with more dining options as these are very limited.

We rented a 2 Bedroom, 2 Bath, Kitchen Suite. It was perfect for the 5 of us. We had 1 King Bed, 2 Queens, and a Sleeper Sofa. The King Bed and the pillows were the best we have had at any hotel. Most hotels make the bed and pillows way too soft and results in neckache/backache. These were just right. The grocery store in the lobby saved us lots of time, and the coffee house downstairs provided our daily bagels & cream cheese breakfasts.

Pros: HUGE room, free wifi in bedroom, close to Ala moana shopping centre, Service was good as well. I do expect good service when staying at any hotel, there was nothing that was over the top in regards to service. Cons: The bathroom looks really old, outdated and dingy. I really dislike having dingy bathroom whilst traveling.

We booked this hotel manly from recommendations here - it seemed like a nice hotel, good value, in a good location but not too busy - it did not disappoint hereWe stayed for 5 nights booked in an ocean view room - we were in 2230 and it was a great spot, perfect views over the lagoon and out to see so we had a prime spot to see the fireworks, in addition we could see past the Hilton buildings to Diamond HeadThe room was standard - king size bed - very comfy, desk and a couple of chairs, the bathroom was small but there was a dressing room which had a mirror too so it made up in the space issue.Convenience store down in lobby was very handy for buying snacks and drinks (including alcohol), and there was an ice machine as well as a laundry on our floorWe used the pool most days and never had any issues, its not as big as some of the other hotels but we were happy with itWe never had any problems waiting that long for a lift like other people commentedOn our last morning we were advised our flight had been delayed for a day and reception were happy to extend our stay in the same room which was a reliefTour desk was touch and go - on the weekend the girl on the desk seemed more interested in chatting to her friends but the one during the week was really helpfulLocation wise - trolley stop right out the front to go into Waikiki (or back from Ala Moana) which was handy, or its about a 20 minte walk into the main area of Waikiki. We walked to Ala Moana Shopping Centre one morning, it took about 10 minutes, we also walked to Ala Moana Beach Park another morning which took about 15 mins. While the hotel had very limited eating options, we found there was plenty nearby especially at the Hilton. We did eat at Sarentos one night which was very enjoyableAs the hotel does not do breakfast we tried the Ihop first morning and it was terrible (see separate review), we ended up eating breakfast at McDonalds most other mornings, it was quick and reliableCouple of Disapointments1 - We had arrived our flight landed at 8.40am when booking however there was no allowance to get early access to room (hotel was not that busy), 3pm was the time we could get in room, and there was no availability of shower to freshen up so I had to try and get changed with bags and cases in a small toilet cubicle.2 - Website still says they do breakfast (I only knew from here that they had stopped). We were not told on check in and there was just a small sign at the restaurant. We were going to have dinner there on the first night but the way the hostess spoke to us when we asked if we had to book was if they weren't expecting many people anyway which turned us off. We had thought about eating there on another night or for lunch, but the next morning when we went down to get a coffee there was a sign saying closed for renovations for 2 weeks, Again would have been nice if reception could have told us or there was a message put on the messaging system.3 - Coffee machine in hotel pretty awful and there was no kettle to make tea, thankfully there was a coffee shop downstairs which did espresso coffee, Plus the only glasses in the room were in the bathroom and there was a microwave but no plates or eating utensils which seemed a bit oddOverall if you are looking for a nice hotel, in a quieter but still central location which is of good value would highly recommend

We needed a place to stay for one night before our cruise left Honolulu. After lots of research online, we settled on the Ilikai and were very pleased. The location was great, the staff was incredibly helpful, the balcony overlooking the Hilton lagoon and ocean was wonderful (24th floor), the room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the price was good. We also had the good fortune of enjoying the fireworks on Friday evening that were right next door at the HIiton. Would absolutely return!

Once you find a hotel with great location and always great service I go back.I have been to hawaii many times over the years with my wife who is mobility challenged. have Mr Terry Dowsett GM and his team very helpful and accomodiating to our needs to ensure our stay is enjoyable.For us the location is great for easy access to beach , shops ( my wife loves) and eateries.Thats why we have become regular return guests. Plus we have found other guests we have met are return guests.I am sure you will find this hotel a great location with very friendly staff.Plus they now have a great selection of shops and a new mini mart which was great.

I took my 16 year old daughter and 2 of her girlfriends for a week to Waikiki for the very first time during Spring Break. The Ilikai was ideal for us - if you're looking for a hotel with 2500+ luxury rooms, acres of kids' pools, tons of nightlife and hundreds of shops, this may not be the place for you. However if you plan to walk to the beaches, shopping and restaurants and are looking for a spacious and relatively quiet spot then consider the Ilikai. Yes, I've stayed in more luxurious hotels but this place was perfect for our needs - 2 bedrooms and more importantly 2 bathrooms were a must with 4 women! The kitchen and living room also came in handy and were especially nice given that we were here a week. We had an ocean view room on the 25th floor - the view was magical day and night. Staff were pleasant and seemed genuinely happy to help with any questions or concerns.

We stayed March 12 to 17th and had a TERRIFIC 2 bedroom ocean front corner room with 2 balconies on the 25th floor with a TERRIFIC view of the ocean, marina, and Hilton lagoon! Room was exactly like the photo's on the website. The front desk, and all the staff were also TERRIFIC! We had free beach chairs, beach towels for the entire stay. The pool has comfy beach chairs and we had no problem getting one. Wifi wasn't working when we arrived-but once we called the front desk and then we contacted internet company-they reset it and it worked flawless-took under 5 minutes to fix. Quiet location, short and scenic walking distance to Waikiki and take the beach walk-which is TERRIFIC! it's TERRIFIC to have a small fridge, cook top, microwave and coffee maker but there is TERRIFIC restaurants on site and near by too. We really enjoyed the outdoor grill/bar, roof top restaurant that are on site and also "Fat Greek" which is near by. We were offered coupons from the activities desk for many restaurants around the hotel. We really enjoyed sitting on our balcony and watching the TERRIFIC fireworks on Friday night over the lagoon. Couldn't of had a better seat! Store on site, and the trolly bus stops right out front. Take the pink flag trolley for $2.00 a person-another TERRIFIC deal and tip we received from the staff. We can't wait to return to theTERRIFIC Ilikai!!!!

I have stayed here several times over the past few years in various areas of this historic hotel. The harbor provided opening scene shots from "Gilligans Island", the opening scene from the original "Hawai'i 5-0" was shot with Jack Lord posing high atop of this hotel. The staff are always amzing, several pools to choose from, several dining options too. Just a short walk from the Ala Moana center and many Waikiki favorites. I look forward to visiting this place a gain soon. I ran into Christian Slater on one visit, he was staying in the room next door, so you never know who you might run into! This really is where Waikiki begins.

22nd floor ocean view room. Stayed tor 7 nights in March,2012. I had stayed at the Ilikai in 1977, when it was newer, but really loved the hotel more this time. I found the staff to be friendly and wonderfully courteous. They promptly dealt with any of our requests. Like others have said, the hotel is a bit dated, but our room was wonderful. First rate ocean views of the yacht club and harbor area. The room had a lot of space, including 2 full closets. Shower only, no tub. Smallish bathroom, but had foyer/closet/makeup area outside of bathroomRoom included a mini fridge and microwave and coffee maker. Valet Parking was $25 per day, but we know that going in. Five minute walk to the Duke's beach. On site coffee shop and "ABC" style market were very convenient.I would stay at this hotel anytime. I found it to be an excellent value for accommodations on Waikiki.

Aloha:We visited Oahu and Waikiki Beach for two weeks in March , 2012.While visiting, we stayed at the Ilikai Hotel & Suites– Unit #2131. http://www.waikikioceanfrontrentals.com/viewProperty.jsp This condo was nice and conveniently located. It was tastefully decorated, well appointed, clean and came with an amazing view. It was nice to have a kitchen with a full size fridge. The hotel has a lovely salt water pool, although no flotation devices were allowed or toys, which made it difficult for children that could not swim or wanted to play. Special exceptions were made upon request if a flotation device was required.We will definitely be making a return trip and we will definitely be staying at the Ilikai again, however I am not certain I would book with Waikiki Oceanfront Rentals again. Although booking the condo was easy, this is definitely a self-help rental agent. Any questions we had, we were told to look on the website as the website would have all we needed to know. If I could have found it on the website easily I wouldn't have asked the question in the first place. Half way through our trip the shower drain stopped working in our condo and we were left with no shower. Although we were offered another room to shower in and later on offered another room (on the other side of the complex and without the view we had paid for) to move into, there was no mention of a refund or partial refund for our inconvenience. This is still a matter that needs to be addressed with the owner and I will keep you posted on if a full or partial refund was provided. The location of the condo was perfect. We were at the start of Waikiki Beach and at the end of Ala Moana Beach. With the Marina located right in front. Within the complex itself there are 3 restaurants: The Chart House Steak House – Very expensive and the food was just okay. Red Lobster Steak House – Reasonably priced, great food and great service (takes a very long time to get seating as it is so busy). Outback Steak House – Good food, great service and quick seating.Across the street from the complex is an ABC store and kitty corner from the complex is a McDonalds. A block and a half up is the Ala Moana Shopping Centre that has more restaurants, great shopping and a grocery store. And just behind the Ala Moana Shopping Centre and across the street is a Wal-Mart. Although Waikiki can be very expensive, we found several alternatives that required little to no out of pocket expense.The Hilton Hawaiian Village Lagoon is open to the pubic. Great place to take the children swimming. It is a man made lagoon that is approximately 6ft deep at the center of the lagoon. No need to worry about big waves. The Hilton has beach equipment available for rent as well. There are also many shops available within the Hilton Hawaiian Village along with koi ponds and other animal displays, such as parrots, penguins, flamingo’s and turtles. This is all open to the public to see and enjoy. Magic Island at the Ala Moana Beach was a great place to take the children as well. It has a protected swimming area and the views were amazing.The Honolulu Zoo was fairly in-expensive. The kids enjoyed seeing all the animals. However I found the Zoo not what it used to be 20 years ago and was disappointed. The aquarium was also nice and in-expensive to visit.The US Army Museum of Hawaii, this museum is free to visit and relies on donations. The museum has exhibits and educational programs emphasizing the role Hawaii played in military actions from WWI through the Vietnam Conflict. Very educational and an interesting tour.We did do some planned tours with Oahu Spot Tours. Our tour guide, (although I prefer to call him friend) Ron was amazing. We did an Island Tour that was awesome. As this was a private tour, there was no sharing bus space or having to wait for people or be hurried at any one particular sight. He was informative, and shared his knowledge of the island, its people and their philosophy. I left the tour with a better understanding and a greater appreciation for the island, its people, history and its culture. We also did a City Tour with Ron. We visited the Flea Market at the Stadium, Pearl Harbor, we visited historical sights that included the first Church on Oahu made of coral and the Iolani Palace. Our final destination on the tour was the Puu Ualaokua Park View Point. Stunning views of Oahu and Waikiki can be found here. There is a lovely place for a picnic or a rest. Definitely a highlight of the trip.Ron also shuttled us out to our Whale Watching/Snorkel excursion with Wild Side Hawaii - http://sailhawaii.com/index.html. Captain Downing was friendly and experienced and genuinely interested in the animals and their surroundings. He did not act in an aggressive manner trying to pursue the animals. Ashley our shipmate and Paul our photographer were amazing. There is not enough good things I could say about this tour and would go again with them. Thank you for the lovely experience.We found that 2 weeks was not enough to see and do everything that we wanted to do on the island. It was just enough to tease us into wanting more!Mahalo

This was my second stay at the Ilikai and it was another very pleasant experience. Although the weather was very rainy, the hotel was great. Our room was on the 24th floor, beach side looking towards Diamond Head, Hilton Lagoon and ocean. The staff was very friendly and eager to please. It was a pleasure to meet the manager, Terry Dowsett. He went above and beyond any expectations to be sure we were satisfied with our accommodations. The hotel continues to get updates and was undergoing a new paint job on the exterior. I really like the large rooms and divided bathrooms (two showers)! The microwave, small fridge and coffe maker is a real bonus. The outdoor Grill/Bar served really good food and especially the Mahi sandwich and salads were great. Very nice place to sit and watch the sunset. The large terrace provides the setting for the Friday night Hula show and fireworks. Even with the rain, they moved inside to the huge lobby for the hula show with chairs and sofas to seat everyone. A very nice evening at no cost! There are lots of good restaurants all around in walking distance. While I do enjoy going to the "heart of Waikiki" to stroll around, it is always refreshing to return to the peace and beauty of the Ilikai. Transportation to the busy Waikiki area is convenient, by trolley or bus. Even to walk there was not bad and we found it to be a pleasant experience by beach or street. I look forward to my next stay there at the one of a kind, Ilikai!

We stayed in a private condo at this hotel. Loved the location, staff were helpful and there were plenty of facilities on site. Wifi connection in the room was very poor, but no problems in the lobby or terrace. We were on the 11th floor overlooking the marina - could get very noisy with sirens at night even though the windows were closed. Only one disappointment - the pool.

This was a nice hotel. It rained alot while in Hawaii so to be able to go downstairs and get coffee, work out, and shop for groceries/snacks was great. It is also in a very fine location. You will be in walking distance to the mall and fine restaurants. The hotel also has a very nice restaurant at the top.The room was spacious (2bdrm suite) and had a nice view of the Ocean. The only negative thing was there was a leak in our room and our floor got pretty wet. When the hotel staff was notified they sent up a blower to our room.I would stay here again.

having stayed at a condo with an oceanview compared to this one with city view the oceanview is recommended.However the suites are similar and if you are on a budget and don't mind a little noise..its not bad with the doors closed...the city view would be OK..same great location on the edge of waikiki close to the mall

Aloha,My husband & I spent 14 days at the Ilika Hotel 2-23-12. Our first time in beautiful Hawaii!Our experience in Waikiki was wonderful. We were very happy with our Condo. The view of the lagoon & ocean was spectacular. Enjoyed watching the Luau from the Hilton while sitting on our lanai. Everything was in nice walking distance (to beach & downtown shopping). Enjoyed the fireworks on Friday's. The hotel staff were very knowledgeable and friendly in helping us plan our tour outings. The bus stops were just in front of the Hotel which was so convenient. The hotel was very clean, quiet and safe. Enjoyed the little bar & entertainment on Fridays. Would recommend this hotel to family and friends. We will definitely return to the Ilikai on our next trip back to Oahu! Mahalo

We spent 7 days at this hotel on 2-2-12 what we found was that this was a very quiet hotel close enough to the beach but far enough away not to here all the partying going on, The room was clean and very confortable the staff was very friendly, however the the partial ocean views are a little bit overrated the little bit you can see is not worth the xtra money and normally you are not in the room that long anyway.There are plenty of places to eat within walking distance from the hotel and you can catch the #20 and the 42 bus right in front of the hotel to take you to all the tourist sites.

This really is an excellent value and splendid hotel. We were on the 22nd floor and had a peaceful experience. There was a bit of a hitch as arrived and discovered the lanai was undergoing painting and was closed off. Once aware of this problem, they quickly remedied it by moving us to a different room and apologized profusely. Rather than offering this as a complaint, I include this here as a testament to the dedication of the hotel staff to make our stay top notch. The front desk staff were always friendly and very helpful with suggestions. They helped book shuttles, find restaurants, etc. They even remembered us after awhile--not easy, considering there are hundreds of people staying here. Another plus was the close proximity to the Hilton lagoon and beach. This is especially fantastic if you have young swimmers. The lagoon is an easy walk from the hotel and perfect for wading with kids. We had a few days of rain and the temperature dropped to lower 70s. Very happy with the warm pool at the hotel. This turned out to be the main attraction for us and was an afterthought when we booked. Overall, very happy with our experience.

My bride of 30 years and I spent 7 days in unit #1540 celebrating our anniversary. This unit lived up to our expectations and we are very satisfied in our decision to stay here. The unit was very clean and had plenty of space for the two of us. We took advantage of the full kitchen to prepare our own breakfasts on most mornings. Although there are also plenty of restaurant's within easy walking distance if you'd rather eat out.  The location was good for us because it is at the North end of Waikiki Beach which is a quieter location then the "Central" beach area. Watching the Hilton Hawaiian Friday Night Fireworks from our lanai was a treat and you are only a short walk away from everything else that Waikiki has to offer.  The only improvement we could suggest is that the owner really needs to update the television set. I know you don't go on a vacation to Hawaii to watch TV. But, for those times in the evening when your relaxing before bed or in the morning when you would like to see what the local weather and/or news is, the TV is an important part of your stay. This is an old unit with a remote that only works occasionally. (even with new batteries) With the price of flat screen HD units now-a-days, an upgrade would be a great addition to a really nice condo for a very minimal cost. The Ilikai is a very nice hotel. Clean, quiet and very comfortable. They have several shops and a bar area that also serves some tasty lunch and dinner meals. There are 5 main elevators plus a "bathers" elevator serving the building. You are never waiting more then 30 seconds (usually MUCH less) for a ride to or from your floor. We were VERY happy with our choice to stay in unit 1540 and we will recommend it to anyone and everyone who asks for our input. Mahalo for the memories!! Dan 'n Terrie. Wisconsin

This is a very nice hotel with a very warm welcome from the valet parking staff and those on reception. Our room was on the 22nd floor and was very clean and airy. There are some negatives to the hotel, however. Firstly the lack of breakfast facilities (we were informed on the first morning - not on our arrival - that the restaurant/bar had discontinued breakfast services only the week before. Secondly, the parking fee of $25 per day which is more than double what we paid on Hawaii and Maui. Thirdly, on our return to the hotel after a day exploring Oahu, we found that our room had not been made up so we had to ask reception for housekeeping to pass by. On the second day, the room was not made up until late in the afternoon. On a positive point, the hotel is ideally situated for the beach, shopping and night life.

I recently re located from the main land and stayed at the hotel for three weeks.Location was ideal. Property had all of the necessary amenities. Clean, safe, great value. Staff was friendly, accommodating , efficient. Bell staff, front desk, housekeeping, restaurant grill and front drive all gracious and courteous! Made the transition to Hawaii seamless!

We booked with Shell vacations,got a good deal but they only offer rooms on lower floors (4 and 5).We got room #532 with partial ocean view.Room on fifth floor have reasonable view are away from the street noise and quiet except fireworks on Friday .We enjoyed hotels restaurants and being close to Waikiki beach and Ala Moana shopping center.We would stay there again.

Although the rooms are old, they are very clean. I was inside 3 different rooms and although they are old and worn a bit, they are very clean, the king beds were more than comfortable, and a great location with a staff that were so friendly and helpful. the furniture was not very old and the air conditioners had remote controls that made it easy to adjust from the comfort of your bed. I will come back again. I booked a special rate that gave half off parking, so I had the best deal in town since everyone charges for parking. The front desk staff were incredible and very helpful. Friday nights, the Hilton village next door puts on a fireworks display you can watch and you can walk next door to the shops and restaurants. Also liked the Hawaii Five-O history, this is the hotel McGarrett stands on top of during the opening credits (both the old show and the new series) and only a short walk to the beach on a walkway straight to the Hilton lagoon. I was really quite impressed just don't expect new and forgive the signs of aging, this place was clean, friendly, and comfortable.

We stayed here for a week after Christmas in unit number 426. We were very happy with everything here. Our condo was in good condition, spacious, and had everything promised on the web site where we found it (www.waikikioceanfrontrentals.com). I am sure that experiences can vary greatly as the condos are all owned and decorated by different people. This particular condo is a corner suite so we had 2 balconies, one with a view of the marina and the other had city views. We were also very happy that this area isn't right in the middle of the busy section of Waikiki, but it's close enough to walk to and enjoy all the shops and restaurants on the way. Another big plus for staying here is it's really close to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, less than 10 mins walk in fact. The only negative I can think of is that internet coverage was not ideal in this suite. It is provided by the hotel, however we were told our problems stemmed from how far away our rooms were from the server. We eventually discovered that if we moved the computer to the kitchen bench, we were able to get a signal from there, and could use it. Fun fact - the Illikai is where the original Hawaii 50 was shot with Steve McGarrett at the top. Can't really comment on the service of this place as we really had nothing to do with any of the staff, you check in to the room with a key code you're given once you've paid for your holiday. It really all went very smoothly, we would definitely come back here again.

MArch 1 - March 7My review may sound negatiative, but overall we enjoyed ourselves. To start with we were assigned a room on 24th fl Great view of the marina. Note, there is no beach front at this resort. the rooms are very dated, bed is as hard of a sheet of plywood i've ever slept on. few amentinites at this hotel. Parking is $25 a day min, and comes with only valet. There are lots of great restaurants nearby, car rental right across the street, and easy access to Waikiki beach. I understand from other reviews, that some may be renovated. That would be a plus. To note, there are also a lot of condo owners on site.

Very enjoyable stay - great location - super view. Originally wondered how things would be because of age of hotel but price was great and reservation staff was very helpful so we took a chance. So glad we did!

This is a 50 Years Old Hotel , but , still "" HOT "" . It has a Perfect Location , most of the Rooms had been Renovated , so make sure yours had been , ask for Pictures , beside a Tradicional HOTEL , you can RENT Rooms from Private Owners , much better deal !!! . Most IMPORTANT Thing = LOCATION !!! , it is Beach and Marina Front and Next Door from the Famous HILTON VILLAGE RESORT and the Natural Beach Pool : Amazing ! . You can enjoy most of the HiltonVillage Resort withou Paying Hilton´s Price !!! , Even the Tradicional "" Friday Night Fire Works Show "" on the Beach . it is a walking distance to Waikiki Beach . Very Central Location .

We were very happy with our condo stay at the Ilikai in February 2012. Our famiy of four ( two teenagers) were very comfortable in our bachelor st condo. Our room had been updated, but there are some dated areas in building. There are plans for more updates to come. We stayed in an ocean view room that overlooked the Hilton Lagoon. You could sit on the lanai and watch the sunset and the Friday night fireworks next door at the Hilton. The Ilikai is at the end of Waikiki beach, so is not near the crazy busy Beachwalk but is a short walk down the beach if that is where you want to spend your time. We did not use the pool, we preferred the beach, but the pool appeared to be very popular. The only things I would change about the stay, would be a dishwasher in the room and washing machines that worked better.I would definitely stay there again.

I would like to take a few minutes to elaborate on the joyous stay I experienced at the Llikai Hotel from 10-12 Feb 12. I arrived at the hotel with reservations; however I was welcomed as though I was already a guest. Initially, I was given a room with a mountain view, but I was really hopeful for an ocean view room. I called the front desk to request a change and was politely told I needed to speak to a manager. I was given the phone number to the manager on duty which was Mr. Terry. I called Mr. Terry and he was very attentive to my concern and told me he’d get back with me as soon as possible with an answer. Within a few minutes, I heard a knock at my door and it was Mr. Terry. He told me an ocean view room was available and asked if I would like to see it? I said yes, and immediately he showed me the room. Upon first glance I was very pleased with the ocean view room, however Mr. Terry extended his hospitality by showing me how to operate the air/heating, he volunteered some very helpful tourist information and asked if I thought I’d be comfortable?I’m a frequent traveler and have stayed at various four and five star hotels, but I’ve never received red carpet treatment as delivered by Mr. Terry. I’d like to personally thank him and the Llikai Hotel Staff for a wonderful stay. The room was very nice and clean. It is in a very good location for restaurant and shopping. I enjoyed every moment. The temperature in the room was great not too cool and not too warm. The air condition was located in the sitting area. Nice comfortable appeared to be a new mattress and good parking.

My boyfriend and I were extremely pleased on our recent stay here. For the price, this place is incredible. Our view of the ocean, city, and mountains combined was breathtaking and we spent a majority of our time in the room out on the balcony.The pool area and the room decor is not anything out of this world, but it is clean, beautiful and the staff is incredible. Definitely worth the value, and still gives you the vacation getaway feel at a lower price.Location was great, a little away from the hustle and bustle but still walking distance to restaurants (and just steps from the beaches)All in all we were very pleasantly surprised by this little gem!

The hotel is in a good location. It has no breakfast which would have been nice to know upon check in.The lagoon is close and great for kids. The whole place needs a renovation, everything is old. The staff though are super friendly.I thought it was a bit expensive for what it was.Restaurant at the top of te hotel is very nice.

The location is awesome and you wake up to a breath taking view of the ocean and lagoon. I stayed in a condo with a kitchen and that really helps to save money. There are so many convenient stores around the hotel. You can even rent a car at one of the desks in the lobby and they bring it right up front. The staff in the hallways and elevators say hello and can I help you with anything, which floor, just really nice people with nice attitudes. The restaurant has yummy food too! Can't say enough!The other cool thing about the location is that you aren't in the heart of all of the action. You are towards the end so it's not too busy and it's fun to walk up the beach. I live in NY so I am always around a ton a people and liked being a bit off the main strip - yet still close enough to walk to restaurants, shopping, etc.

Location was good. Tub was scraped and scratched. Virtually no finish left on it. The towels and bedding were poor quality. The floor was probably not washed for months and all wall and base boards in desparate need of paint and thorough cleaning. The street side was noisy as police and other sireins all night long. Food including groceries are expensive so do yourself a favour and stay in a beach front hotel.It will be the same price.

We have being going to the Ilikai for the past three years. We have looked at other places but none of them offered the complete package we were looking for. The Ilikai is in a great location; within walking distance of everything needed for a great vacation. We loved sitting on the lanai over looking the ocean while sipping a glass of wine before dinner.The hotel is very well kept, the staff are extremely friendly. There are numerous little touches that just make you feel at home. Needless to say we will be back again.

Although we rented a suite at the Ilikai privately, I would reccommend this hotel simply becuase of its location. Being right on the west end of Waikiki beach makes it a fantastic location, location, location! The hotel is coming up on 50 years old but has been very well kept and modernised yet still holds her 60's charm. The staff at the hotel were very helpful whenever we needed any information or assistance. Sorrentinos at the top of the hotel is a very good dining experience with wonderful wait staff.

Our famly of five had a 2 bedroom suite in the hotel-owned part of the Ililkai, on the 24th floor. We were really pleased with our 6 nights there - the suite was spacious, had amazing views of the Hilton Lagoon and out to the ocean. We splashed out on the oceanview room and it didn't disappoint. Two huge lanais with comfortable chairs and tables on each - and the sunset was gorgeous. The second bedroom is only separated from the dining by sliding louvre doors which didn't completely close and we had to keep quiet with our light sleeping children. One of the showers was on the weak side but apart from that the bathroom amenities were up to par. We were provided with a metal crib for our baby but unfortunately no bedding - we called and they gave us a pillow and king sized blanket so I would recommend taking your own - other hotels have always supplied sheets and blankets in the past. The only thing the kitchen was missing was an electric kettle, we had to boil water in a pan to make a cup of tea each morning. As for the hotel - they were helpful (apart from the 8.20am call on our first morning after an 8 hour flight - just to tell us we had a welcome pack waiting to be delivered, gee thanks for that) and when we had a problem with a leaking a/c making the carpet soaking wet, we had housekeeping arrive and remedy the problem within 15 minutes. The shop downstairs had most grocery items (except for swim diapers) and while we didn't dine in for any meals, the restaurant seemed to have a good range on the menu. My only complaint was regarding the pool - the attendant was a complete killjoy and stopped my husband from lifting our 4 year old into the air and making a little splash. No toys allowed either! Heaven forbid we actually had FUN!! The pool area is about to be upgraded but its fairly cosmetic - a few plans, new tiles, a pergola, etc. Really they need to have a separate kids pool so the grumpy people can stick to their own area and not send evil glances our way. As for the location, the Ilikai was ideal for local shops, the Hilton restaurants, the lagoon and breakfast/lunch outlets. Our favourite was the Wailana Coffee Lounge across from the Hilton which was sooo cheap, quick and the food was excellent. I would recommend that the owners of the Ilikai do something about the exterior of the building - rusty, green, peeling. Really tired-looking. We would definitely return to the Ilikai, it was good value for money.
