We stayed in an owner owned unit for 3 weeks. It was our second say in the same unit in 14 months. Great location, close to beaches, great oceans views from the beach side of the hotel. Close to public transportation, you don't need a rental car if staying here. Close to shopping, just far enough away from busy area to not be in the rush. The unit we were in has been updated and very comfortable. Bascially our transaction was with a rental company and we had no direct dealings with the hotel itself, other than use of the outdoor pool. Recommend the unit we were in for a couple.

This hotel/ condo is in a great location. Just a short walk tonthe wonderful Waikiki Beach.new stayed on the 3rd floor but had a great view of the ocean and the Hilton Hawaii Village lagoon. Loved the full kitchen and the lanai. We will stay here again.

Okay, so I read the reviews and talked to reservation rep who told me the hotel was recently renovated, has large 2bd/2ba room with kitchenette, ocean and lagoon views. Sounds great right? Wrong!First of all when my family and I pulled up, my teens said,"Mom is this a motel?", "What made you book this place?" I told them, "well look, the sign in front says newly renovated rooms, so maybe they didn't get to the outside yet. The reviews were all positive, and the reservation lady told me we will really be happy and enjoy this hotel." Well, first of all, they pre-charged our credit card for the first night, normal, but when we arrived they placed a $300 hold on our card for room security. I'm thinking this must be some kind of renovated room and it just has to be great. Well, on the way to room noticed all the old doors, walked in room to find.....old white fridge like one I grew up with. Old dirty, filthy white microwave, old cabinets, new counter top; old carpet; wall paper peeling off wall over one of the beds in first room; bathrooms have new counter tops with old tubs; bed old; very old sliding doors that lead to very old balcony with ocean and lagoon views. New t.v. with poor picture quality in living room and 2nd bedroom. I stayed up all night researching online for another hotel. Checked out the next morning, and front desk person asked my husband was everyone out the room, he said, yes, and then he was told they will complete the check-out and take $300 hold off card once they check the room and make sure everything is ok, so please have a seat and we will call you back to counter when clear. WOW! What the heck! Were there hidden diamonds and gold in the room that I missed? Was that old lamp an antique worth thousands? Incredible, anyway, we drove right over to The Kahala Hotel & Resort (review to follow) a true diamond and pot of gold on the island for the remainder of our 5 day stay. Pay & stay at your own risk! Don't waste your time and money. The valet parking attendant told us the original Hawaii Five O, was filmed at the Ilikai. That explains it all, it's still in it's original Hawaii Five O condition.

We stayed at the Ilikai for 8 nights. When I say we, it's my husband, and my 1 year-old daughter. I was a little nervous after booking this hotel and reading some of the reviews. I almost changed my mind and look for another place to stay, cause I wanted my family holidays to be a great experience. I'm so happy I didn't make any change. I was pleasantly surprised with the Ilikai. We were on the 22nd floor with a stunning view of the marina and the ocean.. The sunsets were just priceless. The room was large, a fairly well equiped kitchen, and some comfy furniture (coaches have seen better days though). Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Good value for your money.When we got to the room, my daughter's crib was already in place. That was nice cause after a long trip she was ready for a nap. Location is just great! I would definitely be a repeated customer.. Mahalo Ilikai! We had a fantastic holiday!

Repeat visitors to the Ilikai and we will surely return....I'll keep this short as this is a followup to an old review from last year...4 of us stayed there this past week for 4 nights and had great rooms on the 23rd floor....same rooms as last visit with wonderful sunset views overlooking the ocean and marina.WE love the location due to its proximity to great places to eat...shopping....and of course the staff that follows the direction of Terry Dowsett to perfection.Its an older property that lacks the flash of the new mega hotels on the strip, but more-than-makes-up-for-it when comparing value and location.We are Ilikai customers for life!Mahalo!

My wife and i stayed in room 2116 on the condo rental side of the building Jan 2011.Nice room renovated modern looking clean, a little small but excellent location and what a view will be back for sure

Daughter teenager & I stayed at the Ilikai ON WAIKIKI BEACH for 3 weeks in July 2011. IT was 'Brilliant' value & the rooms were spacious and location perfect for visiting the Ala Moana Centre. During our stay which was peak season we had to change rooms on 3 occasions as this was the only way to get a room at this Hotel which was completely booked out at this time of the year. Even although we booked in advance we were still in a position whereby we had to change rooms, so if you want to stay here book WELL in advance.The Hotel is obviously one of the originals and hence it is of an older vintage which in fact makes it much more enjoyable. The rooms are LARGE!! seriously. The beds too. The decor is very comfortable, compliments the era. The Lobby is lovely and the restaurant downstairs on the Lobby floor is exceptionally good & exceptionally good value!!.The staff here are amazing. Trust the Americans to do it so well>>>SERVICE that is, something that Australians would do very well to learn more about as generally we have a lot to learn from our allies over there on this topic. The front desk staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful; we needed to change rooms on a number of occasions and they were flawless in their preparations. The maid service is also excellent. Please TIP them as they rely on this to boost wages; plus they are generally very good at what they do. Different teams work on different floors though so be aware of who the maid is for your room during your stay. They replentish the coffee- perculator- Hawaiian brands - not our taste- and clean the room perfectly.The location is truly excellent away from the bustle & hustle of central Waikiki and walk to Ala Moana Beach & Shopping Centre plus surrounded by brilliant restaurants and Hilton Hawaiian Village.I was recovering from major surgery _Total Hip replacement , yet managed to walk daily to Ala Moana and down the beach to Waikiki with teenage daughter so if I can do it so can most. The quiet location is very important and if you take a room with a view- we did for a few days- the atmosphere is exceptional.The City view Mountain view rooms are also nice, especially value wise. Truly this Hotel has to be recommended not only for the excellent value (especially compared to Australia @ just over $120 per night~ PLUS the truly BRILLIANT professional staff, the spacious airy & light well maintained rooms, and the very lovely lobby and restaurants. You can book bargain prices via the various online booking agents. We found a very good one & got a great deal. We will DEFINITELY stay again. Absolutely. And Hawaii= For atmosphere & shopping in a contemporary setting with a great taste of USA & Japan especially food. American Professionalism- CANT BEAT IT!!

As most people comment about the hotel/building etc, I'm going to try to focus my review on the Condo 1318. The thing to remember is that the building is divided into 3rd's. One third is the hotel, one third is owned condo's, and the last third are condo rentals. I can't comment on the hotel or lived in rooms other than the quick look you get when walking down the hall when they are being cleaned, but they did look more dated than 1318.Condo 1318 that I arranged through Waikiki Oceanfront Rentals (Scott) was completely updated in 2007. Once you walk in through the door you wouldn't know the building was old. The floors had all been redone, new kitchen, new appliances, walk in showers in both bath rooms, the master had a 10 jet hot tub, 2 flat screen tv's, 2 dvd players, 2 separate air conditioners with remotes. The kitchen had everything you could ask for in terms of pots, pans, forks, spoons, glasses, toaster, crock pots, full oven, you name it. It was there with the one exception being steak knives. It's billed as a 2 bed 2 bath unit. Yes the 2nd bedroom is really part of main area with those extendable sliding walls but to be honest we had no problem with it. The eating area and lounging area are large enough in size to not feel cramped at all. The couch in the lounge area was also a pull out bed so you could put another 2 people there if needed. Our family of 4 didn't feel cramped at all with the space.The great thing with this condo is the size of porch/deck. It ran the complete length of the unit and had an entrance from both the master bedroom and the main area. The deck has another full table and 4 chairs, plus a set of lounge chairs, plus lots of space left over. It's really that big.The condo exceeded my expectations in every regard. It even had free LD to the mainland, and free wi-fi.The only thing I could fault it for was the bed in the master was lumpy. But that is it. I would highly recommend the unit to anyone.Regarding the hotel. Yes the outside is dated. Big deal, you don't spend hours looking at the outside of the building anyway. The inside has been renovated, the lobby, the grounds, the elevators have been updated.The bar/grill on the lobby floor offers good food at reasonable prices (not horrible waikiki prices). The general store is generally cheaper than the ABC Store just outside. There is a "bathers elevator" so you don't get on the elevator all wet. The people at the reception and cons. desk are super eager to help regardless of you staying at the condo or hotel. There is even a car rental right there.Yes there is a pool. It's small, and used mainly by the groups that live in the building. It's an older age group than my family so we didn't use it once. We are more beach and big water folk anyway. That said the people there looked like they were enjoying themselves. Yes they didn't like little kids being loud. But I knew that going in, so didn't even consider going there.Yes its easy access to the beach. Yes you can get a starbucks at the hilton next door. If you go through the reviews on this place, you will see most people really enjoyed the location. If you think its far to walk to the other side of Waikiki, just know we walked to the church at the other end of waikiki and it took 35 minutes door to door at a pace an eight year old can maintain. It was a 15 min walk to Ala Monana Mall. It was easy to get to.It's a great place and I would highly recommend the unit. If you have questions, feel free to ask me.

A very pleasant 5 day stay here, although next time I will request an oceanfront room (ours was VERY noisy on Mt. View side). The hotel is older, original Hawaii Five-0 older, so it will come as no surprise that there are a few "worn" items in the room. Beds are comfortable, big shower but small bathroom, dressing area with mirror, flat panel T.V. In Rm. 2215, dresser, closets, newer carpeting, desk, lanai w/chairs, plenty of outlets for re-charging and all other in room amenities. There is an average sized pool, that gets "taken over" quickly in the mornings, but the ocean is readily available only a mere few feet away; also a fitness room that is just ok. The hotel does have a two restaurants and a mini mart, inside the lobby area, they will also provide beach towels for guests, very open airy atmosphere. It's right next to Hilton Village, which is nice to shop around in or there is a mall across the street in case you forgot something. The closest Starbucks is in the Hilton main entrance, watch out it can be pricey! Waikiki is a very busy area nowadays, not laid back like some of the neighboring islands, but if you like fast paced, party location Waikiki is a good bet. We went without kids, but I did see a lot of them around, and there are plenty of places for them to have fun! All in all it was a good trip and after 20 years a LOT has changed, but it was good to visit again.

We stayed at the Ilikai for 3 nights in January. While it is not as modern as some of the neighboring hotels, the location and attentiveness of the staff more than makes up for this. The hotel is located at the edge of Waikiki, which means its relatively quiet, although there is a short walk to the beach. The pool is nice, but not huge, and the poolside restaurant serves great (and affordable) casual food. The other guests during our stay were primarily 60+, so the atmosphere was quiet and seemed a bit more upscale than the other hotels we walked by where there were many families with small children. We'd definitely stay again.
user_location: New York City, New York, USA
user_name:
Ny_where_else
New York City, New York, USA

review_body: Spent 12 nights here on a business trip in Aug. 2006. Spacious rooms, amazing view of ocean and marina from my 27th floor balcony. Short walk to the beach. It's at the far end of Waikiki (going away from Diamond Head), so it seems much less crowded and touristy. Clearly an older building, but maintained very nicely and has an open/modern feel. The pool is nothing special, but the adjacent tiki bar was the perfect place to wind down after a long work day. In-room internet speed was adequate, even though I was on a very high floor and feared it might be slower. My usual after-work routine was to grab a Mai Tai and watch the sunset torch lighting ceremony (complete with conch shell blowers, hulu dancers, etc). If you have a rental car, be sure to check out some of the less crowded and more scenic beaches on the North Shore. I especially liked swimming and snorkeling at Waimea Bay (and diving off the big rock), staying for the sunset, and then grabbing a less-expensive dinner at a local seafood restaurant on the way back to the Ilikai. For vacationers, I think you need at least 8 days in Hawaii to get the full "experience" but you might consider adding a 2nd island or. I was able to see just about everything on Oahu in my 4-5 "free" days off of work. Favorite activities were beach-hopping across the north and eastern shores, went to Pearl Harbor, visited Waimea Valley Audobon (highly recommended), extreme boogie-boarding at Makapuu Point, and learning how to surf (sort of) at Waikiki. It work hadn't kept me tied to Oahu, I would've been eager to move on to a different island after a week.

Yes, it was where Jack Lord is shown with a helicopter coming up behind him in the scene. It's showing it's age a bit but it is very much OK. The view is still good toward the ocean but all you see landward is other highrise buildings. For breakfast, there is a McDonald's just up the street and an ABC store (like 7-11) is there too. Several chain restaurants are nearby as well. Lots of good family beach area here. WiFi is free but personal business center is expensive. If you try to park your car there, it's $25 a day extra. I did not have any meals at the hotel.The big Ala Moana shopping center is about 3/4 of a mile west of the hotel. (Ala Moana Center is located at 1450 Ala Moana Boulevard. Free parking on four levels.) The hotel met my requirements except for the personal business center and parking fee.

Had a lovely stay at the Ilikai in Honolulu. Very spacious rooms, lovely view of the marina and right by a large mall and a long beach into Wakiki. Service was excellent and the conceirge was helpful in booking several venues, including a Polynesian majic show. Lobby is open air and goes out into a garden like area and over to the outdoor restaurant and bar. Room has a mini fridge, microwave and coffer maker. Would recommend it.

My wife and I, and my parents stayed a couple nights at the Ilikai the week before Christmas and I cannot say enough positive things about the hotel's staff and the wonderful suite we were given. It was my parents anniversary and the front desk staff had this noted, passing along best wishes at check in. We had a two bedroom suite overlooking the ocean that was fantastic. Also had a great dinner in the rooftop diningroom.I highly recommend the hotel.

We had to travel to Oahu, for the Hawaii Surf Association State Championships which take place at Ala Moana Bowls surf break. We chose the Ilikai as it was affordable and it was located right in front of the surf break. My daughter and I were traveling with another mom and daughter who were also competing in the surf event. The check in and out process was easy, the price was right and the staff did not seem to have any issue with the girls coming and going through the lobby with wet and with thier surfboards. In fact many other kids competing in the event were also stay there, which made it fun for the girls. The room was suprisingly large, with two queen beds, a big bathroom with seperate bath and shower and a view of the surfbreak where the girls would be competing. The other mother and I enjoy the fact that there was a great pool bar located right next store at the Waikiki Edition (now the Modern). The drinks were really special...can you say Lilikoi Mojito, yum. The hotel is located about 15 minute walk from downtown Waikiki and about 15 minutes from the airport. We will stay there again, this year.

Overall I was pleased with this hotel. I booked it using credit card review points so it cost nothing. It is located at the harbor end of Waikiki which provides a quieter experience. Had breakfast the first day down in the open-air restaurant - food was average. The entryway and lobby are very nice and well-kept. The only negative was the dated hotel room. It served it's purpose and had a nice view from the lanai but not sure I would stay here again unless there was a great deal. Once nice aspect was they provided beach towels at no additional cost.

Our stay at the Ilikai Hotel & suites was awesome. The ocean view from the room was fantastic. Watching the sunsets from the balcony was great. The WiFi internet access was super fast. The staff was excellent. Rod, Chester and Patrice knew us by name. The new Kuai Market was excellent with reasonable prices. We didn't have far to go to get little things or even some groceries for the room.

We stayed 7 nights here in December. We were in a Vacation Rentals By Owner suite, on the 17th floor, suite 1727. We had a fabulous view of the ocean, mountains, airport, yacht club, sunset, etc. Despite the age of the hotel, we were very, very happy with all aspects of the property. We had read about slow elevators, but we never experienced that at all. People were very friendly & helpful. The location was ideal. We easily walked to Waikiki beach, the premium shopping areas, museums, etc. The variety and quality of restaurants within 5 or ten minutes of the hotel was excellent; several american, Japanese, Italian, etc. The property was totally clean and well maintained. We will try to arrange to stay here on our next trip to Hawaai!

We rented this condo for a month, starting mid January 2012. We thought it was Beach front because we didn't associate the pictures with the written descriptions, so in fact the property is Ocean Front with a 10 minute walk to the Beach. The condo itself is very clean, has most items you would want and is a 20 minute walk to food shops such as Foodland and/or Walmart, both of which are not cheap, but more reasonable than the ABC stores. The best place for fresh fruit and vegetables is Foodland as opposed to Walmart who have a smaller selection. The Hilton Village is next door where there are more shops. Every Friday night the Hilton puts on a huge fireworks display that can be seen from the balcony but is better seen down at the Hilton Lagoon. Every Tuesday thru Saturday the Hilton has a luau on the roof which can be heard and seen from the Balcony.The Ilikai is within walking distances of several very good restaurants and boasts two good ones itself. If you want to "walk" uptown to the International Market, all the designer stores etc, is a good 25-30 minute walk so pack good walking shoes. The Ala Moana Mall is a good 15 minute walk each way and is enormous and has every store you can imagine. Foodland grocery store is in there and if you give them your home phone number they take 10% off of your bill. The local bus service is very reliable and goes just about everywhere. Seniors ride for $1 and if you ask for a transfer you can ride within a 2 hour envelope for that same $1.00. Non seniors pay $2.50. I don't know what children pay.I booked two tours on line and realized good savings for doing it that way and for also booking 10 days in advance, so think about going that route. The condo has free calls to Canada and the USA and free WIFI The warm pacific ocean is wonderful and we found the best beach half way between De Roussy Park which is about 15 minutes from the condo.This condo does not half beach chairs and if you want to get them, they are 1/2 price at Walmart compared to the ABC stores, it's whether you want to carry them back all that way if you don't have a car.If you aren't used to city life and the hussle and bussle associated with a big city like Waikiki then don't come here. As one person described it, Waikiki is like New York City on the beach. If you like city life and all the advantages of it, like shopping, tons of restaurants, night life etc. then this is the place for you.

We were on the 18th floor looking west. First off: the view. You'd be very hard pressed to find a better view from a hotel room on the planet--serious. The ocean, the marina, the sunsets, the (daily) rainbows--all absolutely spectacular. We enjoyed watching the ships going in and out of Honolulu and Pearl Harbor. Can't say enough about the view.The hotel: our (condo) room was clean and very comfortable. The kitchen was adequate, the bathroom--same. Our king bed was extremely comfortable, the sleeper sofa in the living area comfortable only when we pulled the mattress off the frame and put it on the floor (but I think all sleeper sofa's are like that). The exterior wall of our room was all glass and most of it opens, which is very, very nice. The lanai was among the best I've ever experienced in a hotel anywhere in the world (read: huge with comfortable furniture). Don't recall ever having to wait on an elevator. We never made it to Sarento's (the top floor restaurant) but we did the Ilikai Bar and Grill (lobby level--outdoors) a few times and the food and service were good. The pizza and burgers don't disappoint and the BBQ Boneless Korean Kalbi was outstanding. The Tiki Torch lighting ritual is fun to watch and the live music was very good. Friday night fireworks are worth the watch. The Ilikai common spaces were clean and nice, and the folks at the hotel front desk were very friendly and helpful. One note I would make: the east side of the hotel is a bit close to the Hilton with some noise, plus the view, while still good is lacking in sunset and rainbows. The Ilikai is convenient to most everything in Waikiki. We walked or took the bus everywhere, including to Diamond Head and Pearl Harbor. The bus stops right in front of the hotel and is cheap and the routes are easy to figure out. If you're thinking about a car, it's good to now Honolulu streets are very crowded and parking fees are astronomical ~$30 overnight. There are car rental agencies right across the street. Waikiki Beach itself is just around the Hilton Lagoon (not even a five minute walk) and there is a nice path to follow--when you're on the beach, don't forget a shave ice! There are lots of places along the beach to wet your whistle, as well.A side note: if you have decent physical stamina, climb Diamond Head--it's worth every step. Also, pay your respects at Pearl Harbor.We thoroughly enjoyed Oahu/Honolulu/Waikiki and plan a return trip. We thoroughly enjoyed the Ilikai and will definitely stay here again.

The Ilikai is located on the west end of Waikiki. It's in a relatively quieter location than many other hotels in central Waikiki: less than a 5-minute walk to the beach but about a 15-minute walk to the central Waikiki shopping area. There are plenty of restaurants within a short walk from the Ilikai, as is the Ala Moana beach park with green space and walking/biking trails. The Ilikai rooms are realtively inexpensive for the location and quality. My wife and I were given an ocean-view room on the 25th (second-to-top) floor even though we paid for an "inland" view room... we quickly found out that our room abutted the elevator shaft, so we got limited elevator noise (as it turns out, we didn't hear anything at night when the A/C was on). Our room was spotless, all appliances (TV, A/C) worked nicely, and the wifi was fast. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I'd recommend an ocean-view room partly because there is probably street noise on the inland side.

I love that the Ilikai Hotel is right on the lively beach under coconut trees and there are shops nearby to visit. I quite liked the Alana Moana Shopping Centre, and it's little village.The hotel itself had great things about it as such as having a lovely swimming pool, but it did not have a view of the beach which was a bit disappointing. The Hilton Hotel nearby had a pool close to the beach for people to swim at. Nothing wrong with the building, but some of the shops were disasterous, and had only very few restaurants to choose from. Make 5 restaurants, and I'll be happy. The apartment had fantastic views. The extra bed was VERY uncomfortable. Please make sure you accommodate good quality beds for your customers. You had only one bathroom and one ensuite, which is not enough. I don't like how you deal with the hotel financially, but don't usually get involved in that - however, i warn you to make it discounted to attract more customers. This is a great place for young people to stay at, and feel at home.

We stayed in the Ilikai for our first time on our recent trip over NY's Eve. These particular condos were rented through alohacondos.com. Because I booked a bit late, I ended up having to rent 2 condos for our 10 day stay (5 days in each location.)We were very pleased, first of all, with our overall experience at the Ilikai, and secondly with our particular condos. The decor in 1530 was what some would call dated (each privately owned condo has different decor and features) but as it turned out, it was actually much more comfortable than our second, more updated condo at 1512. There were 4 of us sharing the space, but plenty of storage and space to accomodate all of us. We were on the side facing the lagoon, and the view was fine. We did enjoy watching the luau at the Hilton while we ate our dinner on the lanai! Hey, pick up some to-go Hawaiian food at Ono Hawaiian Food, a mai-tai at the bar in the lobby, and you've got yourself the least expensive luau on the island!Both condos were well equipped with everything you would need in the kitchen, as well as beach chairs and accessories. 1530 had even more beach equipment, and would be an even better choice with families with kids. 1512 was much more updated, with many designer features, but not as much furniture, and a bit less comfy. We still enjoyed it, however.We appreciated that the lagoon and beach were a quick walking distance, without even having to cross the street. We actually prefer spending time at DeRussy beach, and that is very close as well; so is Ala Moana Beach Park.The staff of the hotel was always helpful, the lobby area very nice, the pool was small but served our needs. We really liked that it was at the "end" of the Waikiki strip; it meant that we didn't have to drive in and out through all the traffic on Kalakaua. And, we were able to rent our car for a few days right across the street, and take advantage of inexpensive parking at the Marina lot behind the hotel as well as at the nearby Hale Koa parking garage.We were very pleased with our choice of the Ilikai, and plan to stay there again. It may not be for everyone- if you need the newest and fanciest of hotels, this isn't it. Also, I would say to avoid rooms that face Ala Moana Blvd./ the mountains, as they would be much noisier. However, it's a great bargain for such an excellent location, and for such well furnished rooms.

We booked our trip via the private condos company through marina hawaii vacations. We got a non- renovated condo on the 21st floor, lagoon view. The price through this company was cheaper than through the actual hotel. We were able to use all the facilities except for the gym. We did not get daily housekeeping though. The view was great and we were able to see the fireworks on Fridays and also got to have a look at the Laua at the Hilton from a distance. The room was large and likely needed some renos, but we paid the lower rate for a non renovated room. The family really enjoyed the trip. As other people have stated in previous reports, this hotel complex is on one end of the Waikiki beach strip. It is more quieter and less busy. That could be a good thing or bad thing depending on your preference. We liked it more quieter. It was very close to the Ala Moana Mall. The Hilton lagoon was nice place, the beach was a bit rocky, but closer to the dock had a smoother beach. It was nice to have a kitchnette to have breakfast and the occasional meal. Food is quite expensive in Honolulu. Close restaurants include McDonalds, Red Lobster, Outbacks. The Ala Moana Mall had an excellent food court and many restaurants. We rented a car for a couple of days to travel around the island. Found some cheaper parking behind the hotel near the Lagoon area/marina area. Six dollars for 10 hours and Twelve dollars for 24 hours, called LOT A. There is some free parking during the days only, no overnight parking around that area also. Helpful to have a GPS for the car though. We did some of the driving tours listing on the Honolulu tripadvisor forum. We used Hawaii 23 and Mark for the transportation to and from airport. Efficent and great service. 23 dollars each way. Great weather, nice beaches, good shopping and great food. Will be back...

We stayed for one week in the Ilikai on the 23rd level facing the Hilton Resort, Lagoon and ocean. The location of the Ilikai is its greatest asset being away from the busy central part of Waikiki, close to good beaches, the Hilton lagoon and a 10 minute walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. If staying on the Hilton resort side of the Ilikai you will get to watch the nightly luau which is quite novel. The first impression of the Ilikai when arriving is that it is old and in need of a makeover, however the inside has been renovated and is in good condition. The rooms are comfortable and far more spacious that what I had expected. The room I was in had large balconies to enjoy the views, excellent air conditioning, good kitchen facilities and comfortable beds. Free internet is also a key feature. Overall I was very impressed by the room.I did get frustrated with the elevators which seemed slow and ill equipped to handle the number of people staying in the hotel, although I was there in the busier new year period. The pool is small, old and seems to be populated by the retirees who permanently live in the complex. However with the Hilton lagoon and beach a short walk away there really isn't much of a need to use the pool.Given the price of staying in the Ilikai coupled with its excellent location I would definitely stay here again.

Rented from individual throughvrbo.com studio condo with comfy king bed, clean, flat screen tv, nicely decorated. Great view of the Hilton Lagoon and ocean. Quieter side of Waikiki. Close to Ala Moaba Shopping Center. Found free street parking along the canal. We would rent 1716 again. Good for a couple. Elevators fast. Sorrento's Restaurant on top floor is very good but expensive with a rich view! Loved the bus system but advise one to rent a car for a few days to explore Oahu with magnificent sights.

We only stayed at the Ilikai for one night, but found it to be a bit old and slightly run down. Our room was very spacious and had a nice view. The hotel it self was very quiet, and seems to almost be abandoned. It has a mini mart down stairs and coffee shop which also sells muffins, cakes, coffee, smoothies etc. The area of the Ilikai was very good, near the shops and right on the gorgeous beach front. Sadly, it is overshadowed by the "Hilton" next door, which is a stunning building and property. Overall it was nice for a night, however if we came back to Honolulu, we would consider staying somewhere else.

My wife and I celebrated our 5th anniversary here and enjoyed every minute of it. I even paid the little extra to get a high floor and was surprised to find that we were all the way up on the 24th floor (there are only 26, inlcuding the Penthouse). We were in room 2408 which over looked the entire harbor and the ocean as well. Service was great and very friendly. Vallet was also very friendly and helpful. There were only four issues during our stay and two of them were solved:1. The family above us was noisy late at night - called the front desk and it was quiet within 2 minutes.2. The remote for the AC and the in room safe were not working - Maintenance came up within 5 minutes and fixed both of them.3. Upon checking out the guy at vallet literally threw my wife's suitcase into my car, this was my personal car and the interior is suede; I did not complain, he simply just did not receive a tip. (There was not damage done so I saw no reason to make a big deal out of it)4. The biggest issue was the level of dust in the room. Though not noticeable at first, we quickly realized that there were several places were it seemed as if the maids lighlty brushed over and then forgot about. Overall our stay at the Ilikai was a great get away. The room was comfortable, everything we need is either in the hotel or within walking distance. The renovations made over the past few years have given the Ilikai a much newer and up to date ambience. I will be staying here again, very shortly, for another "staycation".

This hotel is in this process of being updated, it is not as run down as some people have stated, the enterance and loby are very nice as are the elevators. The room that we stayed in could use some updating but this was not a problem. All said, my wife and I were in Honolulu to relax at the beach, shop and tour all corners of O'hau, this hotel was great for the amount of time that we actually spent there. I would like to say that the pool is very busy and not ideal for kids, this can be resolved as the beach is close and has a lagoon for the kids to swim in. All kinds of shopping is located within walking distance although the heart of waikiki beach might be too far for some. Overall I don't think the price, location of the Ilikai Hotel can be beat if you want to stay in Waikiki.

We have just come back from Christmas and New Year at the Ilikai. This is our second stay at this hotel and the first thing we noticed was how many apartments are now private. Normally this wouldn't worry me but there was a definate "clicky community" by the pool. Most of the owners seem to be Americans in their 70's plus and they think they have the right to any sunbed etc which made things difficult as there were only 50 beds for a hotel that had 400 rooms. The staff at the small pool were also on first name terms with the apartment owners and went out of their way to make sure they got what they wanted. The room we stayed in was extremely spacious, it contained a fridge, a micorwave and a coffee maker plus a large flat screen tv and free internet service. The walk in shower was large but dated, the furniture was also dated although the bed was huge and very comfortable. The balcony was massive and we overlooked the bar area where you could also see the Old Guy lighting the torches everynight and sounding his conch (big shell) as the sunset. All in all watching the sunset off the balcony was one of the highlights every day.The reception staff were friendly and helpful as were the room staff and maintenance guys. Unfortunately the bar staff were mostly youngsters who were just there to pick up their wages and tips, without actually giving any decent sort of service. Entertainment was put on two nights a week during our stay which wasn't worth staying at the hotel to watch. Even New Years Eve when we finished watching the fireworks at midnight the bar was closed. One must is to eat at least once in Sarentos Italian restaurant on top of the hotel, only accessible by the outside glass lift. The view, service and food was excellent.The location of this hotel suited us down to the ground, it is next to the Hilton Hawaiian village and lagoon and a two minute walk to the beach. This is all located at the quieter end of Waikiki but only a 10 minute walk away from the main drag. Going the other way, you overlook a lovely marina, and are 10 minutes walk away from the Ala Moana beach park (used by the locals) and also 10 minutes away from the Ala Moana shopping centre.All in all we had a great holdiay with no hitches, our room was clean and spacious and the majoirty of the staff were good. Would we stay here again, probably, but it would definately be dependant on price.

We stayed here for a week at Christmas, the room had all the needed amenities that we sought. A full kitchen for meals, sitting area and a lanai for the ocean views. This hotel was big in 1965 and the pilot of Hawaii Five O was filmed on the roof but it is starting to lose some lustre. Our friends had a room on the 22nd floor we got the 4th, the view sucks from that low.One plus of being a up the beach from the more popular Waikiki hotels is less traffic and people which makes it easier to get around.Cons - not a good beach to swim at very rocky and coarse sand.What out for the conceriage trying to get to attend a SHELL Time Share presentation on site!

Just back from 8 nights at the Ilikai over Christmas/New Year 2012. Very happy with the Ilikai.We had a party of 7 and were originally expecting to enjoy two x 2 bedroom suites but unfortunately our travel agent messed up the bookings and we found out a couple of weeks before departure that we only had two hotel rooms. As you can imagine there is not much available in Waikiki at Xmas. None the less I contacted the hotel directly and a matter of days before we flew out a 2 bedroom suite opened up. The Ilikai reservation staff were very helpful and the check-in staff were terrific in sorting through the complicated booking arrangements.The room was fantastic with views directly out to the ocean on the 22nd floor. The hotel has been around for a while (featured in the original Hawaii 5-0 series I believe) and is at one end of the Waikiki strip but don't let that deter you. It is well maintained and clean, our rooms had great views. It's not exactly on the beach but it is barely 100 metres from the Hilton Lagoon and Waikiki beach, a short walk to Ala Moana mall one way and all the key activities in Waikiki the other. We had a perfect view of the fireworks from one balcony and could watch the Hilton's Luau from the other.Would definitely stay at the Ilikai again.
This hotel use to be ok. Now it is rundown and dirty. Only good thing is the location. Beware of bed bugs.

I took the family on the dreaded Christmas vacation to Hawaii and decided to go back to Waikiki for a week. I have driven past the ilikai for 25 years and always wanted to stay. Yep its 48 years old but what a wonderful experience. You get Waikiki without all the chaos and noise, we loved the hotel, nice staff, great large rooms, brilliant views and away from the maddening crowds. Cant wait to go back.

Perfect location. In Waikiki, but not in the center of all the noise and bustle. Very close to the Ala Moana Center for great shopping. Also very close to Ala Moana Beach Park, much nicer and less crowded than the beach in Waikiki. The lobby and grounds are well-kept. The elevators work quickly. Laundry facilities and trash disposal are readily available on every floor. It is next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village which has tons of shops and restaurants available in addition to the lovely little lagoon.

this is the most underrated hotel property in waikiki. new owner has obviously put a great deal of effort into making a comfortable spot at the western end of waikiki. hotel has all amenities you could need. the common areas are well done. beach bar has tasty lunch items. the hotel does not sit directly on the beach but you sure can see it and it is a two minute walk across a pedestrian bridge to the hilton lagoon and the western tip of waikiki. another ten minute walk along the beach gets you right to the middle of the action in waikiki. easy parking. out unit was rented through craigs list and was fantastic; corner 2 BR overlooking the ocean. sunsets to die for. hilton hawaiin village is next door and is a mad house if you likie that king of thing. we used their beach, renting chairs, umbrellas and towels and using their water sports for a fee. to us it was the best of both worlds.

Those of us who travel and like to maintain their workout routine know that its difficult to do that in the usual dinky little gyms found in hotels. The Ilikai is the only hotel in Waikiki that has a CrossFit gym. The workouts were great, and also scalable- could be as tough or as light as you wanted.They even have beach workouts since the hotel is right on sand.The trainers were friendly and helpful and were a good motivation.The prices are also Lower than other CrossFit gyms i've searched on the island.Looking forward to going back!

Just a one night stay here, but arrived early (10am) and we were able to get in our room immediately. This was a bonus given the short visit. Room was clean, spacious with great balcony. We were able to watch the fireworks from our room. Our 9 year old son loved this hotel, but probably was the flat screen tv that sold him. Friendly, helpful staff. Evening hula and music entertainment was low key and just the right touch. Nice Christmas decorations too!Location easy access to walk to sights or hop trolley. I walked over to the big mall to get some stocking stuffers...you can definitely find anything here!

This hotel may look old from the outside but it is lovely on the inside. The Ilikai is a very clean and tidy hotel from the entry to the rooms. We were in room 2442 which overlooked the Hilton lagoon and out to the ocean. The room was very spacious, big bathroom, 2 showers, seperate toilet, microwave and empty fridge. The lanai was also large. There is enough room for two queen side beds which would be better than two double beds. There is a laundry on every floor at a reasonable cost. The restaurants are reasonably priced with nice food. The Ilikai is central with a 10-15 minute walk into central Honolulu and a 5-10 minute walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. If on the lagoon side you can see the Hilton's fireworks every Friday night. The staff are more than accommodating with any requests and were immediate in response. The best rooms for a view are obviously the Hilton side or over the marina. Very reasonably priced for Christmas/New Year period. The four stars is because I agree the pool area and gym are small, if this is the vacation you want, but you can spend time at the Hilton Lagoon or on the beach. We would definately return to the Ilikai as it meet all our needs.

My family and I stayed at the Ilikai condo #1710 in December 2011. We found the unit to be nice, but some improvements would make the experience even better.The property is located on a main street, at the West end of Waikiki Beach, next to Hilton Hawaiian Village. It is a very short walk to the beach/harbor from the property. Nearby restaurants, which you can walk to in less than 5 minutes, include; McDonalds, Subway, IHOP, Outback, Buffalo Wild Wings, Red Lobster, and more ABC Stores than you can count. If you have never been in an ABC store, it’s kind of like packing a Walmart into a 7-11 store.The property will remind you of the 70's and Hawaii Five-0, but is very well maintained. The grounds are very lush and tropical. They have a commercial business center only, which is only open until 5:00pm. If you need to use a computer/printer, the cost is $15 per hour. There is a nice large fully stocked market on the property. There is a Bar & Grill that serves good food at a reasonable cost, and has a view of the harbor and ocean. There is also a fine Italian restaurant on the roof top. The pool is in need of a make over. It’s on the smaller side, not heated, and has no view because of a tall brick wall surrounding it. There is no jacuzzi/spa. There is also a 24 hour laundry room, I believe on each floor. A wash and dry is $5 per load, and soap is $1.25 per load. There is also a medium size gym with the basic machines/weights. The only onsite parking is valet, which I believe is $12 - 15 per day with in/out privileges. All interaction with the hotel staff were excellent. They were all very friendly, professional, and helpful.The Ilikai is a mix of hotel and privately owned condos. We stayed in condo #1710, which is a corner unit with fantastic ocean views and views of the harbor out of the main patio. The side patio has great city views. The sunsets are absolutely wonderful. The condo had 2 rooms/2 bathrooms. One room had a queen bed, the other room had two twin beds which could be moved together to make a king bed (the twin beds were uncomfortable). There are televisions in the living room, with basic cable and a VHS and DVD player, and one in the queen bedroom. The second room did not have a television. The unit was nicely decorated and clean.Some of the negatives about the unit. You need pool passes to use the pool, but you have to go down to the management office to pick up the passes. The office is closed after 5:00pm, and on the weekends. There was an internet router in the condo, but no instructions or password given, so we could not use the internet with our wireless devices during our stay. The “stocked kitchen” was inadequate for the needs of a family. They were short on glasses, and the cookware was missing needed items. The one cooking pan was an old teflon pan, that was all scratched on the cooking surface, not the healthiest thing to cook in. Some of the utensils and cookware were not properly cleaned.If you are staying at the Ilikai on a Friday evening, make sure to take a short walk to the beach side of the next door Hilton Hawaiian Village for the fireworks show at around 7:30pm. The kids loved it. There are many restaurants, shops, and services located at the Hilton, including a US Post Office.Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai and Condo #1710. I would recommend this location/unit to my family and friends based on the price at the time they are staying. I would stay again if traveling with the family and needed 2 rooms.

We enjoyed the Ilikai. Great location next to Hilton Hawaiian Village, close to the beach, public transportation. About a 10-15 min walk to Ala Moana mall with tons of eateries, shops, and also a Foodland grocery store. Many restaurants nearby also. Had an marina/ocean view for a great value. Do your homework on the different rentals. We had a very nice updated condo but they are all different in decor and updates. The pool was a basic square pool but sufficient for cooling off. Thought it was a great value for location and view. Clean, would book there again if we ever get back gto Waikiki.

If you're planning to surf at Waikiki, think twice about booking this hotel. Although we were well enough satisfied with the accommodation, the walk into the central Waikiki beach area (where the best waves were) and to restaurants grew very tedious -- it's a good 25-30 minute walk. The beach near the hotel doesn't offer very good swimming and the pool, as other reviewers have pointed out, is small and not particularly nice. On the other hand, the hotel offers easy access to the Ala Moana shopping centre, it is quiet at night, and it's close to the Hilton lagoon if you have young children. The accommodation at the hotel is good and spacious (if you want a studio or apartment) but housekeeping was quite slow making up the rooms. We had to ring down to request service on a number of days.

My husband & I stayed here in January 2011 for our honeymoon. Choosing a hotel in Waikiki was quite a challenge given the vast array of options, but in the end we were swayed by the fact that this hotel was at the more "quiet" end of the city, no loud nightclubs and party goers to contend with. We loved our stay here. Our room was very large and had a balcony that looked out over the marina as well as a kitchen, big TV and lounge. The pool here is quite small, but more than functional. The hotel is located next door to the Hilton Hotel so we often walked over there (a 5 minute stroll) and swam in the Hilton Lagoon (which is a public swimming spot) or the beach right next to it. The beach is a bit rocky getting into the water, but I think all of Waikiki is like that. The water was lovely.Our room had a kitchen so we ate breakfast in our room each day (there's a supermarket not too far away or ABC stores everywhere) but ate dinner in their restaurant one night (Sarento's) which has a fantastic view over the city and the food & service were outstanding. There are a plethora of places to eat nearby and the Ala Moana shopping centre is about a 15 minute walk or 5 minute bus ride up the road.Would we stay here again? In a heartbeat. No complaints at all.

If you are thinking of staying at the Ilikai hotel and your plans include spending time at the pool, I would highly recommend NOT staying at the Ilikai. The pool at the hotel can maybe accommodate 50 people, yet the hotel has 25 floors of rooms. Also, if you enjoy working out, their workout facility is one level below pathetic.

The Ilikai was in a great location. Close to the beach, the restaurants, the stores, public transportation. We never wanted for anything! The hotel restaurant had good food, everything was clean. Especially liked the Christmas decorations! Staff was very accomodating. Would definitely stay again.

This is an extremely clean, well-equipped condo with many amenities (full kitchen, linens, beach items, etc.) and beautifully remodeled. We were in town for UH's graduation ceremony and stayed here five nights. Given that this is only a one-bedroom unit, it was spacious enough to host dinner for eight people comfortably. The unit is modern, quiet, has a wonderful view of the ocean and Ala Wai Marina, and the lanai has two very comfortable rocking chairs! Valet parking is $25/day (kind of spendy) but given that nearby self-parking is $20/day, the extra $5 is well spent on valet - car was delivered quickly each and every time. Online reservation process was effortless, and owner response was great when contacted. Would highly recommend this condo and will definitely book it again on our next trip to Honolulu.

Didn't know what we were in for but Vacations to go took care of us the Ilikai is a great big beautiful hotel. The people at the front desk were very helpful and the housekeeping staff was great. Walk out the bck of the hotel and there it is the beach the marina. Then there's Scubbersacross the street best place to have breakfast and the owner even chips in good food for a fair price. the place I'm retiring to is going to be around there the people are great the weather is the best.

The hotel and staff were nice. The bed and pillows could have been better but the room was spacious and clean. This hotel is not really walking distance from the nicer area of Waikiki...it's about 1 mile from the shops and restaurants. If you want to go anywhere you'll have to pay to park (plus the hotel charges $25 per day for valet). The beach in front of the hotel is NOT as nice as it looks. The lagoon is good for kids to play safely but what looks like nice sand is really hard and crusty...you won't be building any sand castles. The actual beach past the lagoon is rocky and murky. Overall we hated Waikiki. It is busy, expensive, and it takes forever to get anywhere. Unless you enjoy a downtown lifestyle do yourself a favor and go to Maui or one of the other Islands. We will not be back to O'ahu.

On Thursday, Dec 22, 2011, a woman was assaulted by two men in the elevator of the Ilikai Hotel. I know because I am staying at the hotel and spoke to the family of the woman assaulted and saw the police report.The hotel management chose not to inform the residents, but rather tried to "hush it up." It is still that case I can walk into the building at 1:00 am with no security guard seeing me; in fact, with no one at all seeing my face. The hotel staff say they have security cameras, and it is true that their cameras captured the incident that took place on December 22, but this didn't prevent anything, and their security cameras won't prevent any crime from happening again.The hotel facilities are reasonable, but the entire hotel gets a FAIL in my opinion for trying to save face by hiding a crime and doing nothing to prevent it in the future, to protect their guests.

This property is at the beginning of Waikiki from the airport, which mean we were dropped off first on our transfer from the airport. At first sight we were a little worried because the property looks dated, but our room was large, our view of the harbour lovely, the beds were extremely comfortable and the kids rooms contained 2 double beds (which was a hit with the teenagers). We had a 2 bedroom ocean view room so paid a bit more but it was still good value for a family staying in Honolulu. It is hard to find a 2 bedroom property for a reasonable price so we were more than happy with this hotel. It was just a 10 minute walk to a major shopping centre, small shops, bus stops and restaurants nearby and a short walk to Waikiki so we would recommend.

I had booked a studio unit for the holidays expecting Ilikai to be chaotic due to the size of the building.From the facade I expected to find an old resort.As my family walked in after an 18 hour flight from France we were so delighted to find a spacious,well decorated lobby and the Mormon areas so clean. I notice there are a lot of security in the premises which made us feel much safer.being the time of the holidays the lobby was in high spirit for Christmas . We had taken a unit facing the Hilton lagoon which was quite nice. Our unit was nicely remodeled and clean so well before our arrival. We had rented through Waikiki ocean front rentals and everything went smoothly. I highly recommend this resort especially for ravel lets with children.we will definitely com back!

We really enjoyed staying at the Ilikai in early December. We rented condo 1414 which is a one bedroom with a balcony overlooking the pool/ocean. The room was very clean, the shower was great, the beds were comfy and the air conditioning worked like a charm. The location was perfect, next to the Hilton and at the quieter end of Waikiki...we were in walking distance from the main area of town and close to bars/restaurants. I have no complaints regarding our stay and look forward to coming back in the future! Tip: the restaurant in the hotel is fantastic!

Sure, it didn't hurt we are Hawaii Five-0 fans from way back. This hotel is nice, well maintained, and the terraces (lanais) are enormous. We got dinner from Aloha Sushi across the street and had dinner overlooking the famous harbor where Gilligan went out on a three hour tour. The rooms are a little dated but very clean, incredibly large, and did I mention the lanais?

The front desk didn't have the correct reservation, so we ended up having a rollaway bed in the room. The hotel restaurant has limited selection. The hotel is very close to the beach. The conch horn blower was wonderful. Overall, this hotel is ok but could use a good makeover.

After researching numerous hotels for my first trip to the Hawaii Islands. The Ilikai Hotel and Suites was my pick...All I can say is I am so glad this was my choice. We stayed for 5 nights. Check in was easy. The staff was excellent. Everyone was nice. and the Ilikai is beautiful! We had a wonderful view on the 22nd floor and the room was very large and immaculate! It was walking distance to so many things and just a block or so to the Ala Moana Shopping Center...the largest open air mall in the world...I can't say enough about our stay at the Ilikai Hotel and Suites, and i will say if I am blessed enough to take another trip to Honolulu, I will definitely stay at the ILIKAI HOTEL AND SUITES!!!

We stayed there from November 24 - 26 and then went on a cruise ship. We went with another couple and our rooms were not together. Our room was on the 23rd floor - aweome! The other couple was on the 3rd floor. We went down and asked if there was anything closer to us. They ended up giving us the 2-bedroom suite on the 25th floor. AWESOME!!! The 2 patios had absolutely gorgeous views!!! Wish we could have stayed longer. The hotel was very accomodating and very nice to work with. We would definately stay here again!!

We stayed here for 8 nights - hired a condo "1908" thru Waikiki Oceanfront Rentals - all good with beautiful sunsets every night. The hotel is located on the Marina at the opposite end to Diamond Head which is not as busy, noisy and congested as some of the other properties along the strip. There are plenty of amenities within walking distance i.e. ABC Stores, McDonalds, Alamo Hire Cars, HipHop, restaurants, Ala Moana Shopping Centre, Hilton Hawaiian Village, the beach etc. SHOPPINGIf you love shopping you should DEFINITELY book a coach transfer to Waikele Premium Outlets in Waipahu - 50 outlet stores ranging from Guess, Coach, Brooks Brothers, Tommy Hilfiger, Michael Kors, Calvin Klein, Ralph Lauren, Armani Exchange, Adidas, Levis to name a few - ensure you attend the Outlets first before going to Ala Moana Shopping Centre as you will pick up real bargains.GETTING AROUNDThere are numerous Trolley Buses that stop outside the frontdoor and do a big circuit of the area and you can hop on/off where you please - just tell the driver $2 each way. There is also a free Trolley that only goes to certain spots - just ask the driver before getting on. But if you prefer to walk everywhere ... that's fine too as we did this often either along the beach or zigzagging between streets and the park. We used Speedi Shuttles for our transfers to/from the Airport both on Waikiki and Maui - they were reliable, courteous and very helpful. HOTEL AMENITIESThere are plenty of lifts within the building, an escalator at the front door as well as stairs, concierge will look after your luggage for a small fee $4 if you arrive earlier than your check-in time. The lanai's are a decent size to sit on and view the marina, beach and fabulous sunsets. There's a coffee shop in the hotel foyer plus a convenience store which is open until late. There are laundry facilities on every floor with both washing machines and dryers (both of which use quarters i.e. 25 cents - wash and dry cost $2.50 each). You can either use the vending machine within the laundry to purchase washing detergent or the convenience store downtairs stocks it too. If you need change, there's a machine located near the reception desk that changes notes into quarters.Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this property and having an apartment with a decent size lanai (balcony), huge fridge and cooking facilities was a real plus.

PLEASE be sure to bring railing netting as the lanai's are not up to code due to being grandfather'd in but children under the age of 6 CAN FIT THRU THE RAILS!! My in-laws live here and we put up the netting everytime we visit.The pool is nice and they have relaxed on the rules so you can actually get wet now :) They still don't allow any toys at the pool and even if children can swim they are not allowed in the deep end until older...kind of annoying. There is a brand new market place in the lobby which is GREAT and a new bar/restaurant, coffee shop and jewelry shop. The new Modern hotel next door offers a great place to lounge. The lagoon is fantastic!Enjoy your stay!!

In November, stayed in Unit 1629 Illikai, arrived from long overnight 10 hour flight from OZ was able to get early access, nice was impressed, first time in condo was to see the brilliant view over marina and ocean, good size room in all, bath and full kitchen with all amenities, lounge seat for 2 plus, was comfy, plus flat screen TV. Was good that the sun didn't come in to far in afternoon so could sit there (unlike some of the other water facing Condo's, with glass of wine in hand in champagne glass! overlooking the marina and ocean it was simply beautiful, more so as sun went down and lights came on. Considering size of building we never had to wait for lifts very long, Location was great, found it was so close to restaurants, bars, take ways, ABC store, plus buses and easy to get a cab, short walk to the massive Ala Moana Shopping centre too.Firstly if you stay here read instructions properly (we didn't) any problems call the cleaner!, and phone prefix in brackets are not used locally.couple of of problems encountered... No compendium in room, where to go what to see, local bus routes etc.No instructions for TV or its chanels.Coffee perk was dirty, only 2 small champagne glasses and one wine glass to drink (wine) from provided, a whole two dinner plates to choose from, so its wash up as you go, lots of cutlery though!, found out on our return should have called cleaning contractor if we had read instructions properly, silly us. Carpet was also dirty (didn't look like it) made our bare feet black, purchased some slip-ons at Wallmart (could've called that cleaner!). Pin was stuck in carpet, stood up by bed and on it, made under toe bleed slightly was bit sore for few days, but got better by end of week (could've called the cleaner for ointment & band aid! - we guess). Advised maintenance was to be done while we were still occupying condo!, what!, why then not in between rentals?, it was not urgent, all that happened was two guys came replaced the old salmon coloured covers on the 2 low uncomfortable patio (lanai) chairs, with off white ones of same vintage and condition! (no cleaner required!). Toilet had plunger sitting beside it!, why…was that a message?, toilet blocked up twice had to get plumber in, they left a mess, we cleaned up floor (yep could have called cleaner yet again but last one was 9pm anyway). King bed had seen its best days, lump in middle, fell into sides & very soft, pillows far to soft too, really awful (the cleaner!). Paid cleaning fee but still had leave Condo as we found it! on departure. Just remember if you stay here any problems any shape or form CALL THE CLEANER!Sent email to booking agent after our return he said, you guessed it "read instructions and call…!"

Business and pleasure occasionally take us to Oahu from our home on the big island, and it is such a pleasure to know that a true experience of island hospitality is waiting at the Ilikai, our hotel of choice. All staff (valet, front desk, room service) are pleasant and accommodating. The edge-of-Waikiki location is perfect for meeting clients on or off property. Rooms are spacious and comfortable ... enjoy coffee on the lanai each morning overlooking the Pacific.

I spent two nights here. The location is great. It's right at the edge of Waikiki. You can walk to Ala Moana Beach, Ala Moana Shopping Center, The Convention Center, and the heart of Waikiki all in about ten minutes. Being on the edge of Waikiki makes it a lot quieter than the middle of Waikiki. There is also less foot traffic as well as auto traffic.The hotel a lot of amenities. There is a small pool, a convenience store, bar and grill, a rooftop restaurant, and many gift shops. Near the hotel there are a variety of restaurants within walking distance.The rooms were clean and spacious. The ocean side of the hotel has beautiful views of the marina and ocean. The hotel offered both wired and wireless internet service. They had a big flat panel tv, small fridge, microwave, and cold A/C. My stay was comfortable and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a conveniently located hotel in a quieter area of Waikiki.

Halloween weekend, met a friend for a long weekend at the Ilikai. The hotel is very clean, staff was all very friendly. Room was great. It overlooked the harbor and we had several amazing rainbows. This is a very convenient location. Easy walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center, and a fun trolley ride through Waikiki. Tons of restaurants and activities close by.Living on an outer island, I will definitely book at the Ilikai again when I visit Oahu next.

We loved the location of the Ilikai Hotel & Suites! The view from our balcony spanned from beautiful Waikiki Beach to the lagoon to the high rise hotels. And a few nights, there was a luau atop the building next door. The hotel facilities are extremely nice and we always felt secure both in our condo and when going to and from it. We walked to restaurants, shops, the International Market, and up Waikiki Beach too--lots of spots for a sunset drink! Ala Moana Beach Park and Ala Moana Center are close by also. Getting in and out with our car was simple thanks to the valet parking set up---always friendly and fast service.

The unit we rented at the Ilikai was updated and comfortable. The Ilikai is on a quieter end of Waikiki, which we greatly enjoyed. It affords a quick walk to the beach and numerous beach-side restaurants. The lobby is open and attractive and has a few stores offering basic necessities, food stuffs, clothes, and souvenirs. The pool is salt-water ( I believe) and well-kept. It does get crowded on occasion and I wish it wasn't closed at 7:30 pm every day. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We never dined at the on-site restaurant.We booked our condo unit through hawaiivacationpropertiesllc.com. Their rep., Kathaleen, was super good about communications and directions before and during our trip. I had a terrible experience with Scott, an agent at an alternate rental agency for the Ilikai. I've rented vacation properties all over the world and never dealt with anyone so unhelpful.All in all the Ilikai is well situated. Shopping, dining, beach, sight-seeing, transportation are all within walking distance. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai.

Lovely recently redecorated place. The linens (towels, bedspread) were old and tattered and not as luxurious as the feel of the place overall, but the kitchenette, furniture and finishing was quite nice. The location was very convenient. The stay was far less expensive than comparable hotel rooms and far more convenient with the kitchenette and less hectic environment.
It was very clean and it made me feel like home. I would defiantly stay here again. Plus the staff was so friendly and willing to help out

We won a contest that gave us free nights at an Aqua hotel in Waikiki and we chose the Ilikai. Not sure that I can really think of anything to complain about (I can still be objective even though it was mostly free)! We were quickly helped upon arrival by a courteous and friendly staff member at the front desk. Our room was spacious, as well as our private balcony. We had a room with a king bed, living area, and full kitchen (all in one big room). Full refrigerator, stove, etc. This was very convenient and we were able to save money by making use of restaurant leftovers. There was a decent sized safe inside the closet, a nice large flat screen tv hung on the wall, and a remote control for the a/c. Our room faced the marina and ocean and we watched the sunset from our balcony each day. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to Ala Moana shopping center and most of Waikiki shopping and restaurants. It is also far enough down at the end of the beach (opposite end from Diamond Head) to not be in the middle of noise and traffic. This was a great balance for us. It could be a bit of a walk to the other end of the beach, but given the beautiful weather and nice surroundings, we enjoyed the stroll numerous times. You can always catch the easily navigable bus system right out in front of the hotel if you are unable to make the walk. We did not rent a car, did most of our sight seeing on foot, and many activities will pick you up right out in front of the hotel (ex: our luau, and ghost tour). Getting to the beach was an easy and picturesque walk around the adjacent lagoon. There is a bar and grill on the bottom floor and a nicer restaurant on the top floor. Many easily walkable restaurants in the neighboring Hilton Hawaiian Village as well as nearby fast food and chains out the front of the hotel across the street.We were given two beach towel cards which we did not use (we brought our own), but I am sure this would be helpful to have if you did not bring any. There was a shop downstairs that had food, snacks, fountain drinks, basic drugstore items, clothes, souvenirs, magazines, etc. This was very handy. We did not make use of the gym, pool, or other clothing shop. On Friday night, there was live music and hula dancers out back and fireworks. I believe these are regular activities. Every single person we encountered at the Ilikai was professional, kind, friendly and helpful, even as we were there as the APEC events were unfolding. Leaving came with some difficulties as city officials had shut down Ala Moana in front of the hotel due to traveling dignitaries for APEC. Front desk staff got on the phone to call SpeediShuttle for us to be sure we knew how to find them (I did not feel this was their responsibility and we appreciated them helping in every way they could). We had to meet SpeediShuttle across the street due to the closure and even the bellman was very concerned about helping us and offered to find a way to help us get our luggage across the street. At this point, we had checked out and were no longer customers at the hotel, yet they continued to help us every way possible. We really have nothing bad to say about our stay at the Ilikai. We paid for an extra night, the room rate was reasonable, our room and common areas were kept clean, the hotel staff maintained their friendly disposition even during the high stress of APEC. We would absolutely stay here again and have many fond memories of the Ilikai. In response to a few negative comments by other reviewers, I would definitely say there is another side to the coin..... We love the smoking laws there and being able to enjoy our balcony without smelling someone else's smoke. Another reviewer complained that their boys were not allowed to be rambunctious in the pool area... well, as travelers who were visiting without kids, we appreciate that they do not allow rowdy, disruptive (not to mention unsafe) activity to take place. Thank you, Ilikai! We hope to be back soon!

We stayed there because of their awesome anniversary special...something like $140 a night for two nights, the third night only $10. Could not beat it. Our room faced the backside, overlooking the city and the mountains. Really a lovely view especially in the morning with the clouds coming just over the tips of the mountains, and the lights coming on in the various buildings. I wouldn't pay for ocean view since we would have rarely been there to enjoy it. The whole place seems a tad dated, as others have noted, but in some ways that is part of the charm. Our room was HUGE, with a very comfy bed and nice linens, simple but serviceable furniture. Also a huge bathroom with a tub and a separate shower. The tile was old, had a lot of grount stains and probably would benefit from a bathroom fan to keep the mold down. My understanding is that this is also a condominium, so there were always lots of people coming and going and the elevators were slow and always crowded. Pretty lobby area with lots of space to roam. I think they are putting in a small market so you can get coffee and light food to go...would be a welcome addition.We ate one evening at the outdoor cafe. Nice view of the marina. Food was good although the chicken salad I ordered was missing the chicken! Great pina colada. We had no problem with valet services. Yes, it's expensive but that is the price of staying in Waikiki. We never had to wait more than a few minutes for the car. Front desk service was friendly although there were times when I would stand there three to four minutes and no one ever came out. Also a glitch at checkout regarding the special we had booked. Thankfully I had my original booking sheet that confirmed the price so they did honor it. The absolute best thing about the Ilikai is the value, which is why I rated it very good. If you want service and luxury, look elsewhere, and expect to spend a lot for it. This place is clean, comfy, with a bit of nostalgic edge, all at a very fair price.

We stayed the last 2 nights of our Hawaiian holiday at the Ilikai before returning home. I chose this hotel because of (1) the consistent ratings on Trip Advisor - and has recently received an even higher rating - and (2) the connection with the original Hawaii Five-O series (I am a Jack Lord/Steve McGarrett fan). We paid $135/ night for an ocean view room at AAA rates - amazing. The room was spacious, simple, with a "beachy" decor; the bed was very comfortable; the lanai was small but the view was quite good from the 22nd floor (Hilton Hawaiian Village hotel, but also the lagoon, ocean and Ilikai pool); we even enjoyed the Hilton fireworks from the lanai. The room was very clean and this was the best housekeeping we had during our holiday. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful, as was the staff in the restaurant. The hotel lobby and restaurant area were light, airy, and welcoming. The beach is next door, and you walk alongside a parking lot, entering at the end of the Hilton lagoon area. This end of Waikiki is relatively quiet, compared to Kuhio beach / Kalakaua Ave section. Given the price, location, facilities, and staff, we would definitely consider staying here again - maybe trying a suite with a kitchen next time.

Booked room through Panda Online.com. Requested ocean view room on higher floor and away from elevator. Had a quiet room on the 25th floor with separate shower and bath. Hotel is located very close to beach and lagoon and within ten minutes walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center and Waikiki Beach Walk. Room was spacious with beautiful sunset view. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. Service was excellent. Room was cleaned daily. Also fresh towels were relaced and coffee and sugar replenished on a daily basis. Saw great firework display one Friday evening from the Hilton Hawaiin Village next door.For value and money, will consider staying here again next time.Thumbs up for The ILikai Hotel and for Panda Online.com.

Would probably be rated 4-5 stars if not for the horrible parking/valet services.Room was great. Very spacious. Enjoyed having a fridge in the room as well as a shower/bath and separate shower. Large patio.Unfortunate that such a bad experience with parking is bringing their rating down so low. At checkout, I was informed that I had 2 charges for valet parking (and additional $25). I told them that I only had 1 car. The lady at the lobby smirked at me and told me that "You signed that you understood our parking rules" and proceeded to tell me that someone else had told the valet to charge their car under my name. Now, I was staying there for our Marine Corps Ball and alot of people knew I was staying there- so people can just park and tell them my name and I am responsible for them??? The lady told me that the extra car was still there and told me to sit down and wait for the valet supervisor. I waited 20 minutes with nobody showing up, and I had to leave (I have a life) so I walked out to the valet to get my car and was just gonna take the $25.00 as a loss. The valet stand helped a man before me and she then couldn't find his keys! She didn't even acknowledge that I was waiting, but I stood there waiting for another 15 minutes while she attempted to find this gentlemen's keys. At least she could have noticed I was there and asked me politely to wait.Overall- room was great...service....HORRIBLE. So much for the cheaper rate I got when I got stuck with a $25.00 parking charge that they can't explain.

We went to Honolulu for my hubby's birthday. I chose Ilikai as I did not want to be in waikiki because of all the noise and crowds, but close enough so I can walk there if I wanted to. This hotel is located between Ala Moana Centre and Waikiki. It was quiet and I had good sleeps as I am a light sleeper. Also many buses stop in front of the hotel, and I walked to Ala Moana bus exchange for buses to everywhere - 5 minutes walk. Great convient location. We stayed in an Ocean View suite with loungeroom and kitchen. We did not eat out much as the food was very greasy etc...so went shopping to Chinatown, and cooked lobsters, crabs, and abalone and vegetables and salads ourselves.The room had beautiful ocean views and we watched sunset on the balcony every evening whilst eating dinner. The room was a bit old but clean, but definitely not luxurious or anything like that. But the bed was comfy, noise insulation was good, it was spacious and very clean. Great location for what we wanted to do. All the tours and taxis and buses all know where this hotel is. I loved the quietness but still close to the action of Waikiki beach.

I have travelled to Oahu several times over the years and have stayed in many of the hotels, but I keep coming back to the Ilikai. I have such a feeling of peace when I check in and know that for the time that I am there, I am going to be taken care of. The staff is so helful, nice, and accommodating, everyone from the check-in staff to housekeeping makes your stay the best it can be. I have no complaints and yes...the hotel is a bit "dated" as some of the other reviews have pointed out, but it seems that this is something that they are trying to improve on.

We stayed at the Ilikai in a self catered apartment in October 2011. We enjoyed our stay, the facilities were good and we had no problems. The complex does look a bit dated now we thought, but its been kept very clean and it was quiet which we needed with a baby accompanying us. The pool was small, but perfect for our needs, being heated and easy to get to from the apartment. Location is right by the start of the beach, with a lovely path walking along the front beach from right outside the back of the property. Valet parking $25 per 24 hours, bus stop right by the entrance and supermarkets an easy walk away. We had a good stay.

We stayed here during our honeymoon. Great room with sunset ocean view on the 23rd floor. Found a good deal by browsing through tripadvisor, a lot cheaper than regular / expedia. Its right next to the hilton hawaii village. We liked it here a lot.

We stayed four nights in a private condo (unit 1143 through Homeway.com) and were delighted with our stay. This was our first time renting through the site but it was all very easy and the owner was a pleasure to deal with.
