It's more like additional beds in a large living room with privacy panels. It might not be an issue for other people but when you're sharing with other adults, you would want more privacy. Location is great since it's at the start of Waikiki Beach. It's also right in front of the lagoon where they launch the fireworks every Friday night.

We booked a two bedroom, two bath suite with an ocean view, but when we arrived we were upgraded to an oceanfront room on the 23rd floor. Within minutes of our arrival there was a fireworks display at the lagoon outside our window. The kids were thrilled. It was like a special show just for us. Rooms were spacious and clean, and the beds were comfortable. We went to the beach in front of the Grand Hyatt, which was lovely. We walked 10 minutes to the heart of Waikiki Beach, and less than 10 minutes to the Ala Moana. All in all a good value in Waikiki for a family of five.

This was our second trip to the Ilikai Hotel and we enjoyed it again. We really like being close to beaches, but also close to Ala Moana Shopping Centre etc. We actually got the date wrong by one day when we arrived late at night and the staff arranged a room for us, then phoned to stay we could check out late the next day and then go straight to our new room. Wonderful service. We had a 2 bedroom suite as we had a toddler with us so was great to have the extra room we could close off (shutter doors, so 2nd room not quite as private). House keeping did a great job as well and everyone very friendly. The pool has had new furniture since we were there last and that looks much better. Pool never packed and there was always sun loungers available. Never as busy as some other hectic hotels we used to walk past on the beach. We only had breakfast once this time downstairs and service/ food nice. The restaurant downstairs has burgers etc, just the standard snacks available but we enjoyed it. Loads of other places to eat nearby. We also used the supermarket at Ala Moana and had salads / roast meats in our room etc, so that is handy with kids. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

We loved the Ilikai. The Ilikai may be a little older, but she is still a jem in Waikiki. Our condo was specular. The Bar and Grill downstairs always has good food and great service. The coffee shop, little grocery store, and all the others were wonderful. The staff were always helpful and courteous. The fresh market offered twice a week in the courtyard area of the Ilikai is a must do. Fresh fruits, breads, loaves, salads, etc at great prices. The best thing about the Ilikai is the location. Close to the beach with its own walkway. Close to the marina. My wife loves to shop so the close proximity to the Ala Moana Shopping Center was very advantageous. There is also many great eating establishments within walking distance. The trolleys and public transit bus stop just outside. My wife and I have many fond memories of our visit Honolulu, and the Ilikai is in a lot of them. When we come back we will definitely be booking here again.

I stayed with 4 adults and 1 teenager in a 2 bedroom ocean view Hilton side room.It was a nice sized room. The kitchenette was nice and well equipped.The bathrooms could use a "refresh" and a really good deep cleaning.The hotel staff were friendly but not really helpful. Housekeeping was just OK, I have stayed in cheep down and out hotels they had better housekeeping.The Valet contractor was great. Always fast and friendly.I also highly recommend the coffee shop in lobby by near the Ilikai Grill. This coffee shop is locally owned and makes great drip and specialty drinks.

Stayed at the Ilikai for a meeting at the convention center--nice 15 min.walk.At the far end of the beach but easy walking distance to beach,shopping,restaurants--close to the action but very quiet at nights.Room (hotel--not condo) was large,well appointed,very comfortable king bed,and very quiet.Price was much better then anything else comparable. Air conditioning not working properly when I arrived--technician there in 5 mins.,and when it was obvious that it was going to take a while to fix moved me immediatelt.Staff friendly and very helpful
Stayed in this hotel for 9 daysIf you like to have great view and balconyPlus do not break the bank it is perfect space for you
user_name:
StasNYCI
New York City, New York

review_body: The Ilikai Hotel is a mixed building - hotel rooms, private condos and timeshare units all meshed into the one building. I stayed in a private condo but my review will only share my thoughts on the hotel as a whole since each condo/unit has it's own quirks.The building itself is located at the marina side of Waikiki, right next door to the massive Hilton complex. I particularly like this side of Waikiki because you avoid the craziness of the middle/end section of the beach which gets super crowded. The beach in front of the Hilton is nice and pretty calm with plenty of room on the beach without feeling like you're so close to the next body. Also being close to the Hilton means you can enjoy the nearby restaurants and my favorite, Lappert's ice cream! It's also 10 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping center and 15 minute from International Marketplace. The building is super old - it looks like it hasn't been renovated since the original Hawaii Five-O filming days. There's not much to the hotel, the pool is small and what's that, no kiosk to print my boarding pass? That's lame. If you go to concierge be prepared to have done your homework as they will sell you not the best tours but the ones that probably give them the most incentive $$. They also try to get you to a timeshare sales pitch and offer the tours for free. No thanks.Here's my tip about parking if you are staying at the Ilikai. Don't do valet, period. I saw lines every morning with people waiting for their car. Yes it's a ridiculous $22/day with in/out privileges but the waiting plus the tips each time to get your car makes this not worth it. To make it more disgusting, they charged $30/day for the July 4th weekend. Not cool. If you want affordable parking, have a car for more than 3 days, and don't mind a 5-10 walk, park at the Hale Koa parking garage at Fort Derussy (right across the street from the Hilton entrance). Non-hotel guests can self-park there for $16/day with in/out privileges by getting a 3-day minimum parking pass. Get the parking pass at the office in the parking garage. The other option is to park in the Ilikai Marina parking garage, behind the Red Lobster restaurant. It was $10 for 10 hour parking with $4 for each additional 1/2 hour. If you're an early riser, this might be a good option.My condo was great and I would consider staying again in a private condo. But if you are looking for a hotel room, I would book somewhere else. I've stayed at the Hilton next door and the rooms were good, the bed was comfy plus you get the benefits of the awesome resort amenities.

I found this a little confusing when I was booking our trip to Honolulu. The Ilikai Hotel is a hotel, but there are private condominiums within the building -- know what you're booking when you book. They are not all the same.My review refers to unit #1318, which I booked through waikikioceanfrontrentals.com. This unit had been recently renovated by the owners and included a master suite with king-sized bed, whirlpool tub, separate shower and bathroom stall and double sinks, plus a second "bedroom" (a section of the living room which could be separated by a moveable divider) with two twin beds, a new contemporary kitchen, spacious living room, and large lanai overlooking the ocean. It was attractively furnished, in superb condition, spotlessly clean, and perfect for our family of four. And aside from a minor glitch with regard to our final payment, we enjoyed a smooth and easy transaction with Waikiki Oceanfront Rentals. I was provided a key code which allowed me to check in without hassle upon our arrival in Hawaii.By staying in a private condo I had access to all the amenities related to the resort, including the laundry area (one on each floor) and pool, but none of the hotel services. This was a perfect arrangement for us.The Ilikai Resort itself is old -- it was featured in the opening to the original Hawaii Five-O TV show -- but has clearly been renovated over the years and I found it more than acceptably updated. I enjoyed the location: situated on the very end of Waikiki Beach, within easy walking distance of the beach, restaurants in Waikiki, and even a major shopping mall in Honolulu. While some might prefer to be right in the center of the action, I couldn't have been more pleased with the location.The only downside is parking. There is none, except for valet service. They will tell you that there is parking at the marina, but that, while reasonably priced, is a nightmare, requiring you to move the car every certain number of hours. The valet service cost $22/day with unlimited in/out privileges, but I think the whole valet thing is a pain, especially if you're returning to your hotel multiple times in a day. Tips and wait time add up quickly.

This condo is beautiful. It is really nicely decorated and luxurious. The kitchen is equipped with the best quality appliances and utensils. The queen bed is very comfortable and there is lot of space to storage luggage and clothes. The bathroom with plenty of thick towels has a spacious shower. We were happy to have at our disposal beach chairs, beach umbrellas and nice beach towels. We were with our 2 kids and they were additional chairs either to eat inside or on the lanai all together. We took nearly all our meals outside on the lanai and appreciated the spectacular view. We appreciated too to have access to free WiFi and free calls. The condo is also very well located, a few steps from the beach and not directly in the crowd of Wakiki. This condo is perfect and we highly recommend this unit to anyone. Thank you indeed to have shared with us your little paradise! Sophie and Bertrand

We stayed in room 2426 from July 1 -7. I sort of knew what to expect in regards to the outside of the hotel from previous reviews and also from Ala Moana skyline shots. As previously stated the outside of the hotel is rather dated. Also, the hallway on the inside leading to the rooms is rather dated as well. Still, the entrance and lobby let me know quickly that I was truly in paradise. As a family of 5 we booked a two bedroom suite. When we walked into the room we were definitely in awe of the beauty of the view. The two lanai's were huge and served as the perfect view each morning and evening we were there. In fact, we had a terrific view of the luau taking place at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The two bedroom was really not a two bedroom suite. There was a huge living room and a sliding door between the living room and the area where the two double beds were situated. The kitchen had only a mini-fridge. I was a bit disappointed and surprised there because my mom had a single mountain view room and she had a full sized refrigerator. Still, there were two sizable bathrooms which we certainly appreciated.The room was clean for the most part. I did find hair from a previous visitor in the bath tub which was a bit of a turn off. The furnishings were a bit worn and utilized but entirely comfortable and not dreadful. The beds were extremely comfortable and there were both soft and firm pillows on the bed. So, you could easily take your pick according to preference. The sheets were clean, crisp and perfectly relaxing after a day of touring and sun bathing. The light blocking shades had holes in them. So, light could not be entirely blocked. There were two flat screened TV's with cable which was completely convenient and handy for my little ones to sit and unwind.One thing I was worried about was being able to stock up on supplies and what food places were immediately nearby. There is an ABC store of course across the street but there is also a Food Pantry on Hobron if you walk down just a little bit. It is seriously a full fledged grocery store. Anything from red meat to milk and fresh produce can easily be purchased there and is cheaper than the ABC store. Also there is a McDonald's and Buffalo Wild Wings directly across the street as well as a fish and Indian restaurant. At the end of the block is an IHOP and a local breakfast spot, Wailana Coffee House which I heard is really good. There is also a Red Lobster and an Outback Steakhouse at the corner of Ala Moana and Hobron (which is the intersection if you head to the left coming out of the hotel).We did not like the beach closest to the hotel or the lagoon. Waikiki Beach was a bit to pebbly and rocky for us. The most beautiful beach of our entire trip was Lanikai Beach which you would need to drive to. If you do drive out there you simply must stop by Island Snow in Kailua.Overall, I would definitely stay at the Ilikai over and over again. Everyone was extremely nice and my reservations were exact and according to my specifications. Check-in was also a breeze. The value and space offered at the Ilikai simply can't be beat.

I recently stayed at the Illikai for four nights. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised by the room. It is a very large room with nice ammenities and very clean. The bed was really nice and the view (although the company where i booked stated ocean view) was decent. my view was blocked by my own hotel if that makes any sense. The Hotel design was so that the rooms towards the middle of the hotel have a partial ocean view. I was on the 24th floor which honestly was a little too high, although i did have a nice view of the Luau that the Hilton puts on daily. (the Hitlon Hawaiin Village is next door). The location was pretty good. I think that it is pretty much the first hotel on the strip. So, it kind of depends on what you want. If you want to be right smack in the middle of Waikiki then you might want to go further down the strip. If you want to be 5-10 minutes away and still be able to walk or take a cab to most places then this will suit you fine. Watch out for the parking prices. All the Hotels charge a 20 a day parking cost. There are nice stores inside the hotel to include a mailing service which was very resonable. Of course once you get outside there are literally hundreds of places to shop and thosands of people shopping there. Overall I was pleased with my stay, the customer service and the quality of the room. I would recommend this place to anyone that wants a modestly priced room in Waikiki.

We travelled in June with another family and we each had a 2 bedroom suite at the Ilaki Hotel. Both rooms were fabulous. At first I was a little disappointed at its location because I felt it was a little far from the hub of Waikiki, but as time went on it turned out to be better for us as it was not so crowdwed. It is about a 20 minute walk along the beach to the centre of Waikik beach. The hotel itself was fantastic. It was very clean, and spacious. The beds were so comfortable! The rooms have been refurbished and our views were spectacular. We were there for 10 days and it was great to have so much space. The kids had their own room, plus a family room with table, chairs and a great couch. The kitchen was well equipped although we did not cook, other than breakfast. We had 2 flat screen LCD televisions in the suite which meant the kids could watch what they wanted and free internet which was also great. The pool area was a little daggy, but we never had to fight for a chair or lounge as people from other hotels told us they had to be down at the pool by 7am to get a chair. It was never crowded and the facilities are great. The pool area was always immaculately clean and tidy. The Hilton Lagoon was a 2 minute walk away and that was greatalso. The staff were fantastic. Nothing was ever too much trouble. It was also a 5 minute walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre and the Ward Centre, which was great for a shopaholic like me! Lots of restaurants nearby was also handy. A great place to stay!

For the $$$, I don't think this is beatable there. Very large suites, comfortable and remodeled. Its only about 5-10 mins to the hot spots in Waikiki and you can bus over if budget conscious. Beach is about a block away, pool not too crowded (but not to large an area), the Hilton lagoon is very close. If you get a low enough room on the west side, you can watch the Hilton Lua at night. We were on the 25th floor, and it was too strange to look down for more than 10-15 minutes though!If you are ok with the location, this place is great and I would defintely go back.

Great hotel, public areas spotlessly shiny and clean. Staff friendly and helpful, arrived early before check in time and was given everything required for shower and change using gym shower. Great little book given for local discounts. Situated away from Waikiki beach area but quieter and all transport (shuttles, bus and tourist tram and taxis) stop at hotel.Plenty of places to eat in the evening and wonderful view of the Hilton lagoon and beach and marina. Stayed in the hotel room and this was huge with large flat screen TV and bathroom with bath and separate shower. Had 2 large beds with clean crisp fresh bedding and large lanai.Really enjoyed our stay here and thoroughly recommend it. Thanks to Chester for looking after us.

My mother and I picked the Ilikai Hotel for our special mother daughter trip to Waikiki for Mother's Day. The hotel is very beautiful and the staff is spectacular. We stayed for 7 nights and everyone was so pleasant and helpful. The rooms are very large and the bathroom is also very ample. We absolutely love the location and service we received while we stayed with the Ilikai, we hope to repeat this trip as a complete family next year for my daughter's high school graduation present. Even though we had only a mountain view room, it was a welcoming site!

First trip to Hawaii.. found the Ilikai to be quite nice. Great value, staff was very helpful and friendly, room was huge and very clean. Kitchen was nice sized to. The king bed was very comfortable with quality bedding. Bathroom was large and nicely remodeled as the hotel was built in the 60's but doesn't look rundown or dated to me. It is in a great location to us since we don't like the hustle and bustle of the busiest section of town. It was only a block away from that area however. Walk out the back to bar/restaurant and great view of the Yacht Club/harbor and lagoon. Short walk to Waikiki beach. Nice and quiet at night for sleeping. We stayed on the street side of the hotel with a great view of the city/mountains..21st floor. Nice roomy balcony overlooking the street/view. Wired internet was fast and free. Overall great visit...didn't used the gym so can't speak to that.

My husband and I spent ten nights here at the end of May. Having been to Waikiki before, we were familiar with the location of the Ilikai. The Ilikai sits away from the central hub of Waikiki. To the front is the main road, to the rear the beach/ marina. Buses and trolley buses stop outside the hotel. A walk to central Waikiki strip is a flat, easy 15 minute walk either along the road or along the beach. Little tipsy at Dukes ? Take the trolley bus home for $2. The Ala Moana mall can be found 10 min walk in the other direction. That $2 trolley ride home to the front door comes in handy with all those shopping bags. Restaurants n shops are all seconds away. More eating and shopping can be done at the Hilton Hawaiian Village next door.Our room. Ocean view on the 22nd floor. Overlooking the pool n the hilton lagoon area giving a perfect view of the Friday night fireworks and the nightly luau at the Hilton. Huge bedroom with great size lanai met my approval. Fridge , safe and two wardrobes. Dressing area. Bathroom n bedroom lovely n clean. Downside? After the big bedroom , the bathroom is a let down. Yes it's clean n nice enough but it's Tiny ! Toilet was between the sink counter top and the shower. Shower had a curtain and was a big shower but no light in the actual shower made it dreadfully dark and u have to basically push past the toilet to get in n out of it. To be fair, having spoken to another person staying there, they didn't feel their bathroom was small so maybe we were unlucky. I would suggest replacing the curtain with a glass shower door to let it more light n possibly make it feel larger. For the price, this is excellent value.If u like to be in the thick of things , maybe this isn't for you but if u enjoy a stroll this should be on your short list. The tired exterior of this hotel belies the well kept, airy and highly polished interior of this old lady.

My family of four (including two teenage boys) recently stayed in condo 1512 for ten days. From the time I booked the condo to the time I checked out all I can say is "Wow what a great experience". The condo is clean comfortable and you can not I repeat can not beat the value. We have payed up to 300+ to stay in hotel rooms that were not near as nice. I will probably never stay in a hotel room again. Ms. Santos has outfitted her condo with everything you might need from condiments in her kitchen to boogie boards for the kids in the lanai. Her gorgeous kitchen impressed me most it is spotless and has anything you might need to heat up a can of soup to cooking up a full breakfast. The view from the lanai is gorgeous -I enjoyed my cup of coffee in the morning and looked out the gorgeous view the whole ten days! The location of the condo is great it is near any shopping or excursion you might undertake. We use the BUS during our stay and it picked us up right in front of the Ilikai. I can not say enough great things about our stay all I can do is sent out a big Texas THANK YOU to Ms. Santos for sharing her property with us and giving us a home away from home.--God Bless and Hasta Pronto- C. Ruiz-Soria

When going on vacation to Honolulu June 2011, I requested and paid for a two bedroom suite with a full kitchen for a group of 5. I explained to the reservations agent that I would be traveling with 3 teenagers and a person using a wheelchair, we wanted to cut costs by cooking in the room. Once in the room I found that their idea of a full kitchen should be called a partial kitchen or efficiency kitchen. This full kitchen consisted of a stove top, a microwave oven, and a dorm sized refrigerator. As far as kitchen utensils are concerned, this full kitchen had three glasses, four plates and bowls with silverware(except butter knives), two pots, one flying pan.... no food preparation dishes. This full kitchen had no oven other than the very small microwave. Since the hotel offered grocery service(a nice amenity), we ordered some groceries to have in the room when we arrived. Most of that had to be trashed since the full kitchen had a refrigerator similar to the one I used in my college dormitory. When I talked to the manager about the fact this room was not what I asked for nor paid for, he did offer me 2 one bedroom rooms with full kitchens. I did not take the rooms since I could not separate the teenagers and the handicapped persons from me and we had been in our existing room for almost three days. They did bring up another dorm sized refrigerator to be placed in the middle of the kitchen and more kitchen utensils to sustain the 5 persons I have in the room. I was very disappointed with the bait and switch type service that I received considering I specifically explained what I needed as well as how many persons would be sharing this room. So when requesting this hotel, it is possible that you will not receive what you asked. However, I have to give credit to the on site hotel employees. They were very helpful, kind and friendly. I have to give kudos to Glenda in housekeeping, Sara at the outside bar/grill and Laure at the concierge/tour desk. Spa facilities consisted of two rooms, practically non- existent though highly publicized on the online website. The gym was very small with no air conditioning . Bring your own pool towels. The towels you get at the pool with the 15$ pool towel cards(if you don't return the cards) look like they have been used for ten years or more. A person needs 2 of these towels to cover the pool lounge chairs. You best bet is to go next door the Hilton and see how they view a room with a full kitchen.

What a great way to stay in the wonderful world of Hawaii! The building shows it's not a brand new building. So the first thing on my mind as I walk up to the entrance is hmm did my wife and I stay at a tourist trap....we walk in, go to the check in and I'm pleasantly surprised with not the usual friendly Aloha but a real deal no joke Aloha. Then the bell hop takes us to our room and the pleasant surprises continue! The room is immaculate, it's a full on studio condo room! Man it was an amazing stay! The hotel lived up to our expectations of being right on the ocean (OK so you had to walk about half a block around the lagoon but still rockin!)

The staff was super nice....from the valet to the front desk staff. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable! When I envisioned my first trip to Hawaii, I always wanted an oceanfront view. Most hotel rooms were very pricy for an oceanfront view, but not at Ilikai. We definitely got our moneys worth. The check in and check out were smooth. The front desk went out of their way to get us a scale to weigh our luggage. The best thing about this hotel is the friendliness of the entire staff. The swimming pool is small, but who needs it when the ocean is practically outside your room. My husband and I are not experienced travelers, but I don't think you can get lost in Waikiki. We only got a rental car for one day to drive around the island (a must)! The other days we either walked (to Honolulu Zoo, Ala Moana Center, and all Waikiki Beach Walk); we also used the bus transportation or shuttle services. Be sure to check out Pearl Harbor and Germaines Luau. If you drive around the island, I recommend eating at a restaurant on the North Shore: Grass Skirt Grill. I hope this review helps you, just as previous reviews helped us last year! Aloha!!!

Staying right on the beach is not as critical as most think when visiting Honolulu when a hotel like the Ilikai is an option. This one provides an easy walk or an even easier bus ride to nearby beaches, for much less than oceanfront. Do opt for the ocean view rooms, a partial look but a beautiful one of the harbour and a nice surf spot. Friday nights there is a ringside seat to a great fireworks display too. The rooms have ample space, the bathroom was shower only but look new. The restaurant on top is a must, great service, great food, great view if you can snag a window table. Street noise is present so forget leaving the balcony door open. Pull out sleeper couches are rough on the back. Barebones swimming pool but clean.

Excellent hotel with a great staff! Big rooms with a nice view. Bathrooms are decent size and have separate bath and shower Hotel is not in the heart of Waikiki, but easily within walking distance or a very short cab/trolley ride away. This hotel is right next to the Hilton Hawaiian Village. There are plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, bars, etc nearby. The Ala Moana Mall is only a short distance from the hotel and there is a trolley that takes you to and from the Mall or other hotels for the price of $2.00. I did not order room service, but did use the Ilikai Bar & Grill. The food and drinks there were very good - pulled pork sandwich and coconut shrimp were my favorites. I did not eat at Sarento's on top of the "I", but it is a higher-end option onsite. Honestly, there are so many good places to eat in Waikiki at many different price ranges, you should try them (Cheesecake Factory is my favorite - try the shrimp scampi (add kalamata olives) or bang bang chicken and shrimp. Finish off with the chocolate coconut cream cheesecake). Back to the hotel, I had a fantastic stay and highly recommend the Ilikai with it's cozy location near the marina/beach, but just far enough away from the crowded Waikiki norm. I did not have a rental car for this trip and got around just fine. I am however, very familiar with Waikiki/Oahu. The hotel offers free wifi in the lobby, but you will need a password from the front desk staff. There is an ether connection in the rooms as well. The hotel also has a spa/salon, apparel/sundry store, 24 hour gym, dry cleaning, safe in the room, etc. The hotel provides a towel for daily beach/pool use. The front desk will provide a card for this when you check in.

I stayed 2 nights for business in early June and was impressed. Great value and close to everything downtown. The hotel is adjacent to the beach and was a great value comapred to similar hotels downtown. I'd totally come back on my own dime!

We stayed in a two bedroom mountain view apartment for a week at the end of March. We have been to Hawaii seven times and this has been the best accommodation. The apartment was on the 24th floor and part of the Aqua hotel group it was nicely furnished and was very comfortable. The bedding was also very comfortable. The main bedroom had a KIng bed and ensuite the second bedroom had two single beds which had a sliding louvre door this wasnt a problem to us but others have commented on this room is not private. It was nice and quiet which is very important to us as last trip we stayed one week at the Aqua Wave - night clubs and garbage trucks to 5am and then went to maui and returned to stay at the Embassy suites again really noisy the Yardhouse below and thin walls. The Ilikai is perfect location for walking to Ala Moana Centre one way and then Waikiki the other way - 20min walk. We didnt go to the pool as the Hilton Lagoon was perfect and you can hire paddleboards etc good fun. The coffee house was great for a cappucino and american pastry. This will be the only place we will stay and already I am looking forward to trip eight.

This hotels location and amenities combined with the discount rate I found on the online travel sites makes this an easy choice. Classic but updated decor along with a staff that always tries to please. We come here every year and are never disappointed. Ocean views from most rooms and an easy walk to the beach right from the lobby.Will always stay here!

This hotel is actually also privately owned apartments as well as a hotel. We stayed in a privately owned apartment booked through a separate company. So l cannot comment on what the hotel side of things were. That being said, we did use all the facilities so l can give a review on those, just not the hotel rooms themsleves.The reception area is big, and well maintained. The conceirge desk is well manned with knowledgable people who were a great help. The reception is accessed via stairs or if you have a pram, via a lift round the side of the entrance, a little annoying but nothing to worry about too much.The bar area is good, they serve bar food eg: pizza, tapas etc and a good selection of cocktails. The pool area is however separate from the bar area so if one wanted a drink/food and it was outside the hours of 1-5pm, you had to leave the pool area, and walk a distance to the bar. The waitstaff is on 1-5 and he is attentative, albeit quick with the hand for tips. There was one lady at the pool towel desk who was a little stern. Another guest had a 2 year old and they gave her a cracker to eat. This lady went over to them and told them they couldnt eat anything by the hotel pool that was not brought at the bar??!!? She was 2!!! dont know how a 2 year old would go with some shrimp from the tapas menu at 9am in the morning!! They told her how ridiculous it was and she left them, and me with my two kids, alone from then on thank god. Also, we have a 1 yr old who is crawling and as the pool is older style with concrete surrounds, we could not let her crawl on the floor as the concrete got very very hot, it is also rough and would have damaged her knees. The pool itself doesnt have a particularly nice outlook. You either look into a hedge or if you face into the resort, a really ugly air con tower. Not much shade either. There was one nook to the right as you went in but that was a coveted place and hard to get. That being said, we noticed that many surroinding resorts either didnt have a pool or theirs was on a roof and less atractive than this one. We were warned by a travel agent that as many resorts are aging , their pools are not spectacular as we'd come to expect here in Oz, but as long as you are warned, you will find it enjoyable regardless.On Friday night, the hotel puts on a mini-luau under the big tree behind reception. The start before the Hilton fireworks, then pause for the fireworks, then resume. Great free entertainment, unless you eat at the buffet, which we didnt. It looked very limited in choices, not sure of the price. The hotel is located in such a great area, next to the Hilton so its great to wander over there. On the other side is The Edition Hotel. Wowzer, this place is amazing. You can eat at the restaurants and drink at the bar, but not use their amazing pool unfortunately. Same with the Hilton Village. We were also persuaded to attend a sales presentation at the hotel. For our efforts my husband got a free scuba sesson valued at $125. The give you a one off 'gift' of your choice, then heavily discounted prices on other activities you book through them. If you are planning on doing a few activities, its worth sitting through the 1.5 hour one on one presentation to get your activities cheaper. Our car hire should have been $75 a day but as we attended the sales presentation we got it for $45. Hope this helps. Overall, l would recommend this place.

The Ilikai Condos are a great place to stay for those who are looking for a relaxing vacation on the edge of Waikiki. The Ilikai is a bit of a walk from most of the action on Waikiki, which might be a drawback for some, but it is nice to choose when you are in the center of the madness, and not be in it at all times. The condos have full kitchens, which is a plus for those with children that aren't into eating at restaurants three times a day. The pool is relatively small, but adequate. Right next door is the sprawling Hilton property, so you can walk over to many restaurants, beautiful grounds and enjoy the friday night fireworks at Hilton. If you stay on the side facing Hilton Lagoon you can watch the fireworks from your lanai!We have stayed here many times and will be back again.

Stayed at the Ilikai Hotel & Suites in July and had a beach-front room. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this hotel, be sure to book an ocean front room. It was amazing to watch the fireworks from the balcony and the parking lot behind the hotel was very reasonable.

We had 2 privately owned units in Ilikai Hotel (through vrbo and also Waikiki Oceanfront Rentals) and the units we both had were renovated. The hotel is a bit dated on the outside but once you get inside it is fine. The lobby area is nice and the bar outside is quite satisfactory. Pool looked very boring but with the beach so close we didn't even bother with it. Our units were great and the views of the ocean (over the marina) were fantastic. We loved being a bit out of the noise etc. in the centre of Waikiki and we walked everywhere. We loved Ilikai (and we are quite fussy) and it was really good value. Not sure if the units you get through booking direct with the hotel would be as good but you can always look at vrbo!

Stayed at the Ilikai for my hubby's birthday. Booked on-line for a one room Condo with kitchen. Had a great view up close of the Lagoon and Beach. Harbour view would have allowed great sunset views, but we didn't spend much time in our room, so it didn't matter. Because we booked with a rental agency, we did not have room service for cleaning every day (they clean after you leave). We aren't slobs, so this wasn't a problem. Plenty of clean towels are provided. Laundry facilities are on every floor if needed. No place in Waikiki is going to be quiet, so if you want quiet, best to go to another part of the island. We did not find it a problem. Once you close the glass doors, it's quiet. The rooms are quiet, we never heard any noise, tv, talking, or other toilets flushing. No smoking allowed in the building. Parking is at the Marina behind the hotel. It's $5.00 for 10 hours. We only needed a car for 2 days, and relied on public transportation the rest of the time. Ten minute walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, 10-15 minutes to Waikiki. Nice walk on the beach to all the hotel area. A really great Greek restaurant close by that was a favorite. Free shopping trolley stops out front, bus lines close by. China town was a fast bus ride. In short, a good location. We have stayed at the Hilton Village in the past.Family members booked a room close to us but had emergency surgery 14 days before we traveled. The booking agency was able to open up that date, and it was rented out, but family was told they would not get a refund because they were doing "spring cleaning". We met the people who rented that room. They were not cleaning it. I'm sure they get by with this all the time because how can people check on them? While we did not have any problems, I have lost respect for this ocean front rental company because of their lack of integrity. I would stay at the Ilikai again, but I would not go through that rental company.

Reasons we love this condo:- older hotel is in a great location and is very well-maintained and quiet.- close to the beach- check-in is easy with electronic keypad- condo is immaculate and well-stocked- stunning views of the marina from the wall to wall, floor to ceiling windows- very quiet- comfortable bed- exactly as in photos except sofa and bedspread have been nicely updated- air-conditioning is very quiet within the unit- fireworks on beach every Friday night- local transit and trolley right outside the hotel. Phone Honolulu transit for directions and  times. It is an inexpensive, easy, comfortable, clean way to travel around the city.- valet was very helpful booking shuttle to airportWe'd like to thank the owners for providing such a lovely and comfortable place to stay in Waikiki!

After reading fellow travelers reviews I 'm sitting here wondering.... did I stay at the same hotel? The rooms are large but very outdated. I did have a beautiful view but it's a journey to the beach through a parking lot and around the harbor. Upon arrival I was given a room on the 25th floor. My phone rang right in the middle of me unpacking my things to be told they needed to change my room because of a water leak and possible mold issues. I was given a free dinner for my troubles. The staff wasn't very friendly or knowledgeable. When I went to the bar to get a pina colada to take back to my room I had to wait until the waitress and other staff member finished their conversation about their outings the night before. I had to interupt to ask for my drink because apparently this was not going to be a short conversation. I was standing right next to them waiting patiently but they didn't seem to care. Then when I signed my room number on the reciept I was told by the waitress in a very rude voice that I need to tell the waitresses that it will be a room charge before ordering. When I reminded her that I did in fact tell her she turned away. I asked the gentleman at the stand next to the elevater were something was in the hotel his response was I have no idea. This is definately a time share type of stay so if you don't mind lack of customer service , no room service and rude staff you will at least have a nice view.

If U like to escape from Waikiki crowd,suggest U 2 stay here, convenient 2 access 2 Bowls, Ala Moana shopping ctr,2 min. walk 2 ABC conveni.reasonable valet parking service, off-course atmosphere, cleanliness, calm.room are comfort, early bird breakie are valuable > US$ 9, elegant lobby,regular staff are always helpful,used 2 have concierge services, no longer now..... but always helpful as possible arrangement.......... lovely & reliable place.

My friend and I - we had separate side-by-side rooms - just returned from a 10 day trip to Honolulu. From greeting at the lobby entrance to leaving in the cab, A with tears in our eyes, we loved our stay at the Ilikai. The price was right; the room and unobstructed view over the Ali Wai Canal , Ala Moana Beach Park and the ocean; the service; the setting - all wonderful. We were so impressed. The rooms were very large, well kept, with frig, microwave, coffee maker, separate walk-in shower and toilet room with door, and tub and sink also separate with door. King size bed was comfy, huge windows and lanai, what more can I say? We were SO impressed. All staff did a great job of Aloha and my friend commented to me how friendly everyone was - this was her first time to Hawaii. Not a sound was to be heard once inside the room - no TV, no flushing toilets, no chichat from the room next door, etc. A bit of noise from the street but we soon grew accustomed to it. Access to all the places we wanted to go was great and enjoyed the Hilton Hawaiian Resort next door too. The Friday night Hawaiian entertainment put on by the hotel was great and we really enjoyed it. The small restaurant and bar could expand the menu a bit perhaps, but we liked the well-poured drinks and burgers. Staff here were exceptionally efficient and helpful to us.The coffee shop with freshly made sandwiches, Kona coffee, muffins, juice and other goodies was very good and the folks in there very friendly and helpful. Both restaurants were happy to provide you with take-out and we had food on our lanai one evening and watched the sunset - spectacular. We also both heard and watched the Honolulu Marathon over in Ala Moana Park and all the comings and goings - could hear the music too! Our biggest disappointment - which had nothing to do with the folks in the hotel - was the restaurant Sarantos at the Top of the I -- very pricey - questionable food - indifferent service. We went on a Tuesday evening - on entering room seemed empty and tables unappealing (too early perhaps?) - we ordered two pasta dishes - one with scampi and one with mushrooms. They arrived in bowls with little eye-appeal, the scampi were very salty, as was the whole plate and the flavor was masked by the over-use of oil. The pasta did not taste freshly made to us. In short, we were not happy with our dinner, the cost, the service, or the fact the restaurant billed itself as 4 star. It reflects badly, in our view, on the hotel and is not even run by the hotel but I don't know if the guests are aware of this. To be fair - perhaps we hit them on an off night, but we were so looking forward to eating there often and sampling their whole menu - alas it was not to be. Got a kick out of the folks at the bell desk and the routine of clapping for the cabs. Great place to stay - wish we had longer. Keep it up folks - the secret will soon be out to all.

If staying for more than 3 days book a suite or apartment with cooking facilities. We loved the Lagoon area for swimming and sun and there are many fine dining options within walking distance from the Hotel. The in house "Sarento's" restaurent is a fine dining and sunset drinks option. Service and friendliness from the GM down to the house staff is a feature

We rented a 2 bdrm/2 bath privately owned condo through WaikikiOceanFrontRentals in the Ilikai Hotel & Condo building "Hawaii 5 O Bldg" original program filmed out of this building, thus the nickname. This Y shaped building is in front of the Ala Wai Harbor and right next door to Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort. There is a large U shaped driveway to pull up to unload your belonging and groceries, where you are greeted by friendly and very helpful Valet Staff. The building has a beautiful but small walk up entrance with rock waterfall on either side of center staircase up to large beautiful dolphin sculpture. There is an escalator or elevator for use as well. Upon walking into large open air lobby it is clean, relaxed feeling, some shops and restaurants and if you walk straight through to view of gardens and harbor there are tables and umbrellas. There is a cement walkway that leads Ilikai residents over to the Hilton Lagoon and beginning of Waikiki beach strip. The pool is quite, pleasant enough, clean and more private than large resort area pools! Being that we rented through a private owner condo we did not have access to the fitness center.The Ilikai Hotel building can be rented through the hotel, Shell Vacations or private owners and their rental agents. The hotel owns the top levels of the building, with the leg of Y as oceanfront rooms one side has lagoon to ocean views next to HHVlg and the other side has harbor and sunset views. The top of Y arms have same views with right side on HHVlg side and left side Harbor and Sunset, while the top of the arms are mountain and city views.We went up to the very top of Ilikai building to Sarento's Italian Restaurant on Thursday evenings they have live excellent Jazz group, beware they charge a $10 per person "music fee" while seated at table for dinner $! The service is VERY slow and a bit unorganized, but if you can bare the wait while listening to awesome music all our food selections were excellent!!! Not one of us was unhappy with our dinners! The four of us split two salads which was plenty, they serve warms breads in basket and the cocktails were strong. There is a bar if you just want cocktails and appetizers while listening to music, along with awesome views in every direction from windows around entire restaurant!Our rental experience was very painless, efficient and the pictures on the website were exactly what we happily received when entering condo unit. Very clean, well decorated, large, well stocked kitchen, great view of HHVlg Lagoon to ocean especially for Friday night Hilton fireworks and excellent value for rental fee paid $! Could not have asked for anything more, extremely happy with condo and rental service!!! We will definitely rent again from WaikikiOceanFrontRentals and stay at the Ilikai $!

This hotel was great I rented a suite rm 1530 right across the street from the Hilton Village. Right there in downtown Waikiki lots to do and see restaurants within walking distance. Mall within 2 miles wonderful location right by the marina and near the beach. Waking up to waves and 80 degree weather i definetely can get used to it. loved it loved it.

We stayed at the Ilikai Hotel prior to our cruise and everything was perfect. We were granted a seniors discount and we given a room on the 24 floor overlooking the ocean and the fireworks at the Hilton Hotel next door. All our requests were met. We were also allowed a 1 o'clock check out which allowed us the do the Pearl Harbor Tour prior to check out. The room was renovated and everthing looked great. We were disappointed that we could not get a reservation at the roof top "Sorrentos" as they were booked up. So if you are staying at this hotel on a Friday night and want to see the Fireworks while eating, book a reservation in advance of your arrival. We ended up eating at the bar grill patio and everything was good. I would stay here again if I went back to Honolulu.

It was lovely to come in to the clean and tastefullly decorated unit. It was quiet and peaceful at all times. The large windows opened out to a gorgeous view and the curtains over them kept out the early morning light when we wanted to sleep in. The kids of course loved the great new flat screen tv. It was very spacious even with the couch pulled out into a bed. We used the fully stocked kitchen for making scrumptious breakfasts and snacks. We did walk to the many restaurants for lunch and dinner. It was great to walk either by the beach or by Ala Moana Blvd to get to any of the eateries we felt like. The mall was really close too with a great food court and grocery store - food land. The coffee place at Illakai was great and so was the Kona Bean right across the road. The bar downstairs was perfectly situated with a view of the ocean. The stores downstairs were useful when we needed something in a hurry. Of course the many ABC stores were ubiquitous. We always saw people cleaning the walkways. We relaxed by the pool some times which had clean towels and shower. We could order drinks and food from the bar to have by the poolside. Friday evening if you were tired to walk to a restaurant, you could enjoy the hula, music and fireworks (on the lagoon) downstairs.  Our favorite time was sipping wine as we watched the sunset from the lanai. The view from the bed and lanai was breathtaking. Most mornings we ate our papaya and pineapple on the lanai watching the early surfers take the waves.  Most mornings we had time to go for a jog along the park which we could see from the lanai.

Although this hotel is older, it is still very nice. The rooms are spacious and we had a deck with a lovely ocean view. The area is almost completely ruined by crass commercialism; having said that, we found some great places to eat. And, there is nice beach walking.And, on Friday evenings the hotel has local dancers with a lovely meal and later fireworks. The bar/ restaurant at the Ilikai had some very nice food at reasonable prices. Service was very good, as well.

Of all the available hotels in Honolulu, I feel we were lucky finding the Ilikai Hotel. 2 friends and I were running in a half marathon event and this hotel was close to the start finish. There are many nice restaurants within walking distance of the hotel as well as a shopping center but the hotel has a signature restaurant on the top floor as well as a lovely restaurant on the first floor. The front staff was super friendly and we received a bonus when we were upgraded to an ocean front. We chose a 2 bedroom suite so each of us ladies had our own bed and bathroom. The hotel recently renovated their rooms and they are truly lovely and the kitchenette has granite counter tops. The grounds are beautiful and we were able to watch the Friday night fireworks display from the courtyard. On Friday nights, guests are treated to a hula show. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and would stay their again next time I go to Honolulu.

Family of 4, (Mum, Dad, 16y/o and Nanna) stayed in 2 bedroom oceanview apartment on 24th floor for 10 nights. Even though this hotel is older in style it really is spotlessly maintained in all the common areas. The staff are wonderful and our daily housekeeper was so lovely. The Bedrooms were very roomy , plenty of room for empty suitcases. Only 1 closet in the hallway and no drawers in 2nd bedroom. 2 bathrooms was great, and a bth/shower in en-suite handy for small children. Kitchen had plenty of crockery/cutlery and pots/pans. No dishwasher or oven.The ample size kitchen had a Microwave , coffeemaker,toaster and cooktop and small fridge. Linen changed daily and toilettries and coffee topped up, no tea supplied. Very comfy lounge and chairs, 6 seater dining table and desk with free broaddband. Two lanais with outdoor furniture. In room safe does not fit an average size laptop however. Aircon in lounge area and main bedroom. There is also a washer/dryer on every floor and free daily newspaper. A real plus is the short walk (10 mins max) to Ala Moana centre and 15-20 mins back into Wakiki. We ate in the restaurant downstairs and found it to be good value. We also took advantage of the many ABC stores nearby.The sunsets were mindblowing and the skyline at night was spectacular.We all found it very comfy and homely.The pool is a great temperature and has a decent shallow end for toddlers and an equally decent deep end, around 8ft. Have to agree with previous posts re the "Pool Nazi", she certainly maintained the peace in the pool area ! No diving,jumping or bombing (naturally) it was like swimming scared!Overall this is a hidden gem, great location if you dont mind a walk, beach is bigger, HHV is next door, marina out front, Ala Moana shopping close by, trolley and TheBus stops out front too.Im sure to have forgotten something but hope this gives a fair indication of what a really good old place this is ! I would return in the blink of an eye.

Our stay at the Ilikai was heavenly. The staff and concierge were incredibly attentive and the hotel itself is clean and beautiful. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends. The room was plush and spacious with a separate tub and shower in a very spacious bathroom. The only thing I would suggest is for them to offer large beach towels for trips to the beach. They only gave us white bath towels for the beach which weren't large enough and seemed awkward to be the only ones on the beach with bright white bath towels. We stood out. Other than that, hotel is luxurious and the people were incredibly friendly and made us feel very welcomed. We also used the fitness center which is small but packed with all the necessities. We got a good morning workout before the heat of the day set in. The hotel is walking distance to nightlife on the beach and shopping in Waikiki. The hotel concierge has discounted deals on dining - ask them for a discount booklet. There's cheaper parking available at the boat dock. It's a short walk back to the hotel but well worth the savings.
